reviews.review: A beautiful reflective experience. St. Patrick's Cathedral is so beautiful and quite ethereal with the many turrets and spires on the outside but the inside is something on a completely new level. It is a thought provoking yet peaceful building with the most stunning interior, amazing stain glass windows and a very warm welcome. I have visited this Cathedral 3 times, the first being while a close family member was dying and I felt such peace and although I am not of the Catholic faith I felt the need to light a candle for him and spent some time feeling the warmth wrap me in a cloak. This is such a special and beautiful place to visit.
Worth a visit. When in New York well worth a visit to this Cathedral no charge to enter very busy with holiday makers but well worth seeing the inside magic place
Excellent architecture. Didn't go inside, however this beautiful building, nestled between the NY skyscrapers stands out to all visitors and residents alike. Beautifully kept and worth seeing.
Beautiful cathedral. This is one of the most beautiful church that we have visited in USA. Recently renovated, it is a must see place in NY
Stopped in on Friday night to see this beautiful cathedral. So glad we got to look inside again. Had seen it before, but it doesn't get old seeing again. Absolutely beautiful.
St. Patrick's Cathedral. Absolutely beautiful! To have a Cathedral like this right in the middle of a modern and busy city is wonderful. A little piece of peace!
The architecture.. Come for the architecture, and stay for the sense of peace and stunning warmth. Although there are many visitors, its grandeur makes up for it.

Tranquility in the middle of NYC. Having traveled the world and visited many beautiful churches, St. Patrick's stands as one of the best anywhere, especially considering its location; near Rockefeller Center and shopping. As a respite from the hectic or materialistic pace, or for a spiritual moment, stop in and put the world on hold, even if for just a few minutes. You'll feel refreshed for the experience.
Beautiful inside. After always seeing churches and cathedrals all over Europe, it was really nice to see a comparable cathedral right here in the USA. Wonderful architecture!
Memorable. What an honor to be able to participate in one of the masses when I happened to pass by this beautiful and impressive cathedral. Will come back again when I visit NY.

Must see!!!. We passed this Church on the way to Central Park and called in to look at the stained glass windows.
Stunningly beautiful. They encourage you to take photos and you can spend as much time as you want in there.
Highly recommended and glad we went in.
Beautiful!. So unique to see gothic architechture in the US! Very beautiful and historically signifigant. Really amazing to see it tucked among the skyscrapers!

Beautiful church. Stumbled across this while walking around had not been in my plan for this visit but so glad I went. The cathedral is beautiful the stain glass windows are stunning well worth a visit

True Wealth and Momentary Retreat on 5th Avenue. In the midst of some of the most expensive real estate and materialistic appeal in the country, St Patrick's Cathedral stands out and reaches out. Its classic, gothic, architectural beauty contrasts with surrounding structures that are understandably designed to maximize retail sales per square foot. Spacious in its entry, its interior, its heavenly heights and stained glass lighting within, you find yourself breathing differently from the moment you step on the property. Leave the chaos and consumerism of 5th Ave shopping behind for a momentary retreat. You'll be refreshed greatly by even a brief, prayerful pause here. We were.
A Peaceful Space in New York. walk in off the street sit down and simply meditate to the walls, ceilings, glass windows, and chandeliers
Wonderful. It makes a pleasant break from the 'hustle and bustle' of city life. The architecture is a Must See, whether you are religious or simply an enthusiastic admirer of classic buildings.

Gorgeous. Very beautiful church, Mary Chapel, statues and prayer spaces. The Jubilee Doors of Mercy are here until November, 2016. Renovations are worth seeing. It gets crowded but you are still able to see and get close to what you want to see. A must see/tour. We live not far but go into St Pat's whenever we are in the area for the beauty, peacefulness and prayer areas

Beautiful piece of architecture.. St. Patrick's is probably the most beautiful building I've ever been in. They let you roam around most of the church snapping photos if you like. The only thing I found weird was the fact that they let you walk around the church on Sundays, while church is in service. I felt bad for the people sitting in the service.
more a tourist spot then church. very beautifull, everyday i think 6pm mass the fight fighters, cops ect go to mass there, confession is everday and they dont mind photos
Magnificent. St. Patrick's is a beautiful church with magnificent architecture. I liked the many side altars and chose a special one to light a candle for my mother.

Stop here for a moment. This cathedral is one of the beauties of New York. Take a moment to view the stained glass windows and the soaring spires. There is a majesty to this place that all can appreciate.
Beautiful Cathedral. this is a stunning and beautiful Cathedral. The architecture as well as the art. Definitely something most people would find interesting.

Beautiful Cathedral a must see. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a beautiful cathedral, something that you would see in Europe.
This is a fairly new Cathedral because we are a young country in comparison to other countries of the world especially in Europe. There are activities going on daily

New renovation was well worth it. The renovation project was long but the results are well worth it. If you have visited St. Patrick's Cathedral in the last decade when you come back you will see a brighter and whiter cathedral.
Oasis. This church is beautiful and an oasis of calm in the middle of madness. It is a lovely building with gorgeous windows and you can imagine Jackie O and JFK walking down the aisle

beautiful Catholic Cathedral. Gorgeous Catholic Cathedral with a lovely alter to Our Lady of Guadalupe,as well as a Relic of St Patrick. FYI, not a place of quiet reflection,there are alot of tourists here
Beautiful. A trip to NYC wouldn't be complete without visiting this iconic cathedral. If you can go around Christmas its just beautiful.
Lovely cathedral. Set on 5th avenue the cathedral looks glorious in the sunlight. When we visited it was during a service so didn't see much of the interior. Acoustics seemed good.

Beautiful architecture. Welcomed by a greeter at the door. Can take photos. Beautiful stained glass windows, ceiling - all of it is stunning. Visitors can participate in services, or just walk around observing.
peaceful. A place to pray and meditate, beautiful and peaceful, just sit down and rest in your mind, the benefits are great.

Amazing Cathedral. A must see for anyone visiting NY. The organ was playing and it was lovely as we lit a candle and walked around this magnificent church. There is a statue of Mother Theresa to the right of the alter that is one of the many works of art to see. Amazing!
Beautiful and Peaceful. This was the first time I have seen the cathedral without scaffling. It is very clean looking and from the outside and lovely on the inside.

Beautiful place of worship. We were on a tour and had a few minutes to go in the beautiful cathedral. It is just so beautiful and to be in the house of God where so may times we have seen on tv was a wonderful experience.

St. Patrick's: impressive and depressing. My wife and I walked in and through St. Patrick's Cathedral on a recent NY visit. We were at once awed and oppressed by the opulence of the structure. The architecture is reminiscent of times past when the edifice was a reminder of the transcendence of God and a teaching vehicle for those who were unable to read the Bible. The stained glass windows tell stories, but in 21st century American culture they send a mixed message. At once they call attention to religious lessons and history. On the other hand they are examples of an opulence which belies the church's commitment to investing in the lives of the poor, the victims, the oppressed and all of those who need the church's resources which are now represented in a massive, ornate structure which speaks more to power than to poverty. I admit that this is a biased judgment, but it is at least worth thoughtful contemplation as visitors view the magnificence of St. Patrick's Cathedral.
A tranquil place. A beautiful peaceful much love cathedral you can tell. Worth a visit. The light is good in the cathedral. Lovely stain glassed Windows. Was popular with locals and visitors.
Girls Trip 2016. this church is so beautiful, nice to walk around and see all the architecture. Staff was very nice and helpful and answered questions.

Spiritual Experience. Come by for a spiritual experience. Spectacular setting and music. Excellent homilists. Significant community outreach. The church's concert series is on line and the concerts are very accessible. Multiple masses daily. Or just come by for prayer. Always a joy to visit.

can't say how i felt. will they every complete their construction. everyother time i visit this place (almost every year), the same incomplete work..who are they trying to fool...i wasn't impressed by this
Very nice. No entry fee to get in.....walked around and viewed this beautiful cathedral at our leisure! Lit a candle (cost was $2)
Spectacular architecture. Walked by on Saturday evening. Would have loved to have taken in a mass. Structure is quite a sight to see. Architecture is wonderful. Size is overwhelming.

Revamping cathedral . First visit after the redecoration, very grand and impressive, always full of people. They search bags of visitors if you want to get inside. Worth to wait for it if this is your first visit.

Must See!!!!. St Patrick's is as beautiful on the inside as it is on the outside. If you are in Manhattan, you must stop. Easy to get to and a sight to see! Light a candle, wander and relax. Take it all in!!! You won't be sorry!

Fantastic architecture. A wonderful building on the exterior and even more survival on the inside. I didn't get the chance to experience Mass when I visited but you are permitted to go and look around during Mass. At night this building looks exceptional and I got some great photos.

Beautiful and spiritual. I love this place and go here every time I am in Manhattan. Our Lady Chapel, behind the altar, is especially lovely. During this visit, at 7:30 on a Friday morning, the church had many people on the way to work, and stopping in for Mass on the way. The history and beauty here are unparalleled. I can't wait for my next visit.

Absolutely Beautiful!. We happened to be there during a Sunday service, so we got to hear the organ which was stunning. The Stations Of The Cross (for all of you Catholics) appeared to be individually carved in stone and were beautiful, as were the numerous side altars. Even the pulpit was beautiful and elaborate. Had time permitted, we would have stayed for the entire mass because the priest seemed very interesting. The parishioners didn't seem to mind us visitors. Definitely worth a visit.

Fabulous. Go inside and walk all around, it's allowed. (Security just checks your handbag). It's free and it's across the street from Rockefeller Center, so it's easy to find. The architecture is amazing. We took lots of photos.

The most incredible Church I have ever seen.. Spent approximately an hour inside this architectural wonder dedicated to the Lord. They have guided walking tours but I did my own thing and lost got lost. This place is huge, literally a square block in NYC! Don't miss out on one of the best place to experience God in the world!
St.Patrick's Cathedral. A quiet haven in the bustle of the city and well worth a visit. Free entry and very ornate. Would loved to have heard the organ playing.

Just renovated - gorgeous. This cathedral is a must see for Catholics. On the one hand I dislike that tourists are allowed in the church during services, but I was one of those tourists walking around during Baptisms. The recent renovations are evident; this is a beautiful place to seek a spiritual pick me up in this high energy city.
St. Patrick's Cathedral. The Cathedral is beautiful. Masses are served almost every hour on Sunday mornings. It was easy to find a time to attend services.
beautiful building - a must see when in New York. from the stained glass windows to the architecture of the cathedral, this building took my breath away - stunning - beautiful , breathtaking

Amazing Structure. This year was the first time I saw St. Patrick's completed after the re-construction. It was absolutely amazing. There is nothing else like it in the US for sure. The glass art, pews, ceiling, and doors are amazing. It is definitely a sharp contrast to other structures in the city. I would definitely want to attend a Sunday Mass here one day. The beauty of the building can only be understood if you see it for yourself.
A place for reflection. Much renovation has been done to the cathedral. It is a lovely church with a wonderful sense of peace.

A work of art. Besides being the most widely known church in the United States, it rates among the most beautiful architectural masterpieces in NYC. Always accessible to visitors, and well worth a quick visit. You'll be walking by it anyway if you're walking on Fifth Avenue, which you should.

Beautiful. As a European traveler it was lovely to see some historic architecture among the skyscrapers and modern buildings. A stunning place of worship on the most beautiful avenue in the city (5th). Well worth a visit.
Breathtaking!. Breathtaking cathedral worth a visit! Don't miss it! Located on 5th ave, easy to find. Beautiful contrast to the skyscrapers!

Probably the most Beautiful Cathedral we have ever visited. When we entered the Cathedral from a side door, we were immediately amazed by the size and beauty of the interior.Many people taking time to reflect, and although it was very busy it was not noisy.So many beautiful small Altars for offerings, lighting of candles etc, The many stained glass windows were so bright and magnificent and a massive organ which I presume would make some noise when played.On leaving the Cathedral by the main door take time to turn and admire the facade and brass door. another beautiful sight.You must see this Cathedral when visiting NYC.
Wonderful. A must to go see. it is just beautiful. Free to get in and still has church services. Doesnt take long just awhile to see
Nice quiet visit. After being in crowds all day it was very calming to just sit and meditate. Very calming and comforting. Beautiful architecture.
Beautiful Cathedral. This cathedral is built in the style of many of the great cathedrals of Europe. The windows are spectacular as are the many statues and altars.
My wife and grandson enjoyed. My wife and grandson enjoyed they went on Sunday and enjoyed very much. I sadly did not attend. This is icon of icons.

Very peaceful. our hotel over looked this cathedral so we had fantastic views of the outside. Inside was quite busy but still peaceful very ornate church, lovely to find in middle of big busy city . A haven!
Beautiful Church. This is a really beautiful church, I've gone to it every time I'm in New York as it so nice and peaceful. Really lovely architecture which you don't see with new buildings.
Just Beautiful!. This is a must see place. The church is lovely to see day or night. Light a candle, say a prayer and sit and take it all in.

a magnificent space. A beautiful space, usually too many tourists for quiet reflection.
They did a magnificent job with the recent cleaning/restoration
Sunny and Bright. Although I have mixed views about cathedrals, this one is beautiful. The lighting, natural and artificial, is good - a bright, even sunny, interior.

Cathedral fit for New York. I love that in the middle of the big city, one of the most impressive and intimidating skylines in the world, stands this cathedral which can be compared to any of the most famous religious structures in the world.
The cathedral is well maintained and definitely worth a visit / worship.

Majestic and reverent . A church that is beautiful and a refuge. The surroundings outside and inside are breathtaking. It's unbelievable rich in architecture and religious meaning. You see people praying, and some resting.There is security to go through to enter and thoughtful the church you see attendants. It's well worth a visit and free!!!! You do have opportunities to make donations or light candles for $2.00. They have a small gift shop and definitely worth taking a peek. I suggest going early morning 8am, that's when I went and it wasn't crowded at all!

Peace in the City. Everytime I go to NYC I go into St Patrick's Cathedral to take photos. It amazed me this time how crowded it was. There were numerous people there with their selfie sticks taking photos. Even with all the people in there I could still find a nice quiet spot to relax.Highly recommend going into St Patrick's when you're in NYC as it's a spectacular building.
Gorgeously hidden jem.. Gorgeously hidden jem was a delightful little spot a mid skyscrapers and subway terminals. Stop and rest.
Breathtaking. A must to see, the church is so beautiful, it is breathtaking. It is not a place to take young children.

A cool quiet spiritual space. Glad that I took the trouble to visit, it is a cathedral young enough to have been built when my great grandfather was a child. The faint blue light left by the illuminations of a hundred score new moons in the tall american gothic spaces gives it a thoughtful, attractive feel.

Truly takes your breath away. St. Patrick's Cathedral is truly one of the most magnificent places I've ever been. The minute I walked through the door I was absolutely amazed at the splendor and beauty. A beautiful place - so peaceful and grand. Truly gorgeous and not to be missed. It's been on my "things to see" list the last three times I've been to NYC, now I'll make sure I visit every time I come back.

Peace in the bustle of the city. This Cathedral is beautiful. The architecture is incredible and the lighting subdues. There are altars by the staues and a smaller chapel (St. Mary's) that is behinfd the altar. It is a lovely place to sit and reflect.

A NYC Treasure. I grew up with St. Pat's. As a child my mom would take me here for concerts, Mass and to enjoy the beautiful architecture. As I grew older I continued going here. I guess you could say it's part of my DNA by now. Overtime I visit I discover something new to admire. Last year I had a friend from Australia visiting. It was around Christmas and the interior was decorated for the Holiday. Just lovely! She loved it. I stopped by there recently and was pleased to see so many tourists enjoying this beautiful landmark. This is truly a treasure of the City.
Fantastic central location a must when in nNew York. Great landmark to find your way around New York,Well work a visit lovely stonework, great location and a warm welcome

Beautiful but.... Beautiful Cathedral but we walked blocks planning to hear a Sunday afternoon organ recital, only to find they didn't start until later in October. Disappointed. But the cathedral is beautiful. If you've seen the cathedral's of Europe and are short on time, I'd skip it.
Mass with the Bishop. Been there 3 years ago and St.Patrick was under refurbishment and major scaffolding so it was a pleasure to be able to revisit and stay for Mass .
Great. This is the best Cathedral to visit in New York City. Of courses it's free. Plenty of places to light a candle. Impressive Ceilling .

Another cathedral. It is beautiful, massive, ornate, etc. but in the end just another cathedral. If you are Catholic, it is probably worth attending a service. I attended the 7 AM mass...in and out in about 20 minutes.
Beautiful. Now fully restored and open, this cathedral is a must for both those of the catholic faith and those who aren't. The art and history contained within the building is simply breathtaking.
Arcitechure is stunning. Such a lovely Cathedral to see. Beautiful inside and very calming and peaceful from being in such a busy City.
Marvelous. You can't go to New York city without visiting this wonderful Cathedral. Historic, beautiful and a holy place,
Serene old cathedral. Looks much better from the inside than the outside. Right on the street, a few steps up from the pavement only. Looks like it was built a lot longer ago than it was.
Beautiful!. An architectural wonder with incredible detail. Well worth the visit. There is a mass every hour, so that you can easily attend a mass if you wish.
Beautiful!. Very handicap friendly, everyone very helpful, very clean and just so beautiful. We stayed for a Mass and the organist even accompanied this one singer. Beautiful, just beautiful.
New York's most beautiful church . A visit to this church is a must. The size and architect of this church is beautiful. There is so much to see.

Misa en Domingo/ Sunday mass. Asistir a misa en domingo puede darte una gran idea de como se vive la religión católica en NY.
To attend to Sunday's mass (catholic service) can give you a great experience of how is being catholic in NY.

Beautiful. If you don't appreciate architecture or church history in general, this is probably not a place you'd need to stop. However, if you are, the recent renovations and cleaning of St. Pats have it looking pristine. We went during a Sunday mass, and it was a very nice service.

A beautiful Cathedral. Recently refurbished and cleaned this beautiful building stands out amongst the surrounding hustle an bustle of NYC. Step inside to view the glorious stained glass windows, which dazzled in the sunshine. Light a candle for a lost loved one and take a moment to yourself.
Impressive Cathedral. This Cathedral is well worth a visit when in NYC and stands amongst the hustle and bussel of the city. It has some beautiful stained windows and artwork inside.

Stunning church. We walked in the rain to st Patrick's cathedral and despite soggy shoes were so grateful we made the effort, it's beautiful and offers a peaceful respite from the chaos of Times Square,
Very beautiful. This place is really beautiful and relaxing in the middle of NYC craziness. great for all members of the family.
A peaceful place. In the buzzing New york, it is a peaceful place. A beautiful cathedral, just wish it wasn't so touristy.

Gorgeous inside and out!. This is a beautiful cathedral both inside and out! The outside architecture is very detailed and the freshly restored limestone shines brightly! The inside is even more amazing and the stained glass windows are amazing!

Well worth a visit.. The outside of the building is very impressive and certainly stands out from it's surroundings. The inside whist still impressive is somewhat plain compared to it's European counterparts.

A beautiful church surrounded by skyscrapers in the heart of New York City. In the heart of New York City, just across the street from the Rockefeller center and surrounded by skyscrapers is located the St. Patrick's Cathedral.The church has Gothic style with very beautiful vitrouxs and its majestic seen from the entrance. However, in Europe it would not be so special if compared with other Cathedrals in the continent.There are not that many information available about the church, even at the information desk they have close to the entrance. On the other hand, is a bit chocking, the intensive way the 2 gift shops in existence in the church are divulged. There are small folders explaining in details how to get to the shops while we could not find similar with the history of the church. One huge framed picture of a saint actually was an announce saying: do you know that we have 2 gift shops at St. Patrick? (see one of my photos).Anyway, the place is worth a visit and you can always search for additional information by yourself. Be prepared for the huge number of tourists visiting the place.
Calm at cathedral. Iconic cathedral in centre of NYC. Architecture is magnificent both inside and out. Bags are searched on entry and an entry donation is needed.
NEW YORK MOST FAMOUS CHURCH. magnificent neo-gothic church on fifth avenue across the street from rockefeller center......impressive interior and architecture......ask god to forgive your sins

Beautiful. Even if you are not a person of Catholic religion, St. Patrick's Cathedral is a beautiful church to visit. I appreciate that there is security. Packages are checked upon entering. A nice gentleman explained some of the history of the Cathedral to us. We toured it in the early afternoon and then came back for Mass later in the afternoon. I thought the tourists would be distracting during Mass, but they were very respectful. People attending Mass were seated in the middle sets of pews. What a wonderful, peaceful feeling participating in Mass with people from all over the world and of many denominations.

in the uk would not be special but in the USA is unusual .. A pleasant but fairly ordinary church. Large church with a nice window. There are services and it is clearly very popular with local people.
ST. PATRICK'S CATHEDRAL. Beautiful cathedral located on Fifth Avenue. Go inside and enjoy the silence and the beautiful interior.
Stunning!. Architecture is gorgeous! We missed the tour and just walked around on our own. We stayed for the daily Mass. The stained glass windows and incredibly beautiful
Real architecture. Amongst all the skyscrapers sits a wonderful cathedral. The new statue of Mother Teresa has magnificent detail and worth going inside for, alone.

New York's major Cathedral. I've been to St Patrick's Cathedral several times. Last weekend we went to a wedding there. What a magnificent structure. It rivals the great cathedrals of the world. It is massive, as well. The wedding was in the center of the church. Although there were hundreds of tourists throughout the structure, it is so large, we barely noticed them.If you visit New York, stop in to see St Patrcks Cathedral.
Beautiful . Beautiful place to visit! Gorgeous building and if your walking past pop in to really see it you won't be disappointed.

It's a church. I've been to some churches before in Spain. This was pretty nice, considering it's NYC. There was a wedding going on at the time so we didn't get free roam but It's nice if you are a religious person or a fan of churches.

Cathedral. A Must when we were there!! Attend mass that morning and very emotional due to the overwhelming size of the cathedral. They don't have any restrooms, so plan well, or you will need to go across the street for the restrooms. A location this magnificent needs to have service for elderly, disable persons that need to use the restrooms.

Solemn. It is a beautiful church, the scene of so many state occasions and funerals - worth a visit. People are respectful and quiet so as an oasis from all the noise in the street, it is a good place to sit and think.
Amazing. Beautiful cathedral, well worth a visit. Went to the 10.15 service on the Sunday morning, and not disappointed. Lovely service and lots to see inside the cathedral.

Rivals Europe's best . Although not as large as some of the cathedrals in Europe it is still imposing and beautiful, inside and out. Across the street from the Rockefeller Centre it's a cool contrast in commerce and theology. It's worth a walk around the back for a different perspective.

Beautiful cathedral!. Attended Mass last Sunday at 1:00pm. There are seven Masses provided on Sunday's so you have many choices as to which time works best for your busy schedule. This cathedral is beautiful! Adults as well as children are welcome at all the Masses. This is a family friendly church. Be sure to visit while in New York City. It is in a safe and very convenient location.

Great historic church and worth they hike from Rockafellef Plaza.. This historic church will take your breath away. Gothic Style building. Peaceful to take a load off your feet while strolling 5th Avenue. Nice to sit and reflect and take in the view of gothic style.

Emotional Experience. Witnessed part of the 9-11 memorial service at St. Patrick's. The Cardinal presided, the pews were full with many first responders present. It was a beautiful ceremony in an awesome setting. The restoration work is complete and the Cathedral looks fantastic. Worth the visit no matter what your religion. Enjoy the architecture and the solemnity.

Must Visit. The recently finished facelift has left everything spectacularly bright and vibrant. I have been many times over the years. This was the first time I noticed many extra small details, like different colors in the marble architecture. As always the stained glass is a marvel to see the intricate scenes and detailed mosaics. The statues are simply amazing pieces of art. There is a new bronze statue of St. Mother Theresa. Right next to Mother Theresa up front on left there's a walkway. Don't miss going behind the alter. You'll see a small chapel most people don't see and additional statues. Be respectful, as its a church but they welcome everyone with open heart. Do not miss stopping in.
Just magnificent. Money well spent on the major renovations. The prestige White of the outside makes St Patrics a real land mark
Beauty of the past in the middle of bustling city.. After all the hustle and bustle of busy New York this is a wonderful place for quiet reflection. Absolutely beautiful.

It drew you in, glowing in the skyline. so unexpected, we saw this amazing white glowing cathedral off of 5th. the inside was just as incredible. it was like a kaleidoscope with such amazing colors from the stained glass. Wish we had done a tour to learn about the history
Anniversary . Because I have a relative buried under the altar we were permitted to visit his crypt. We also attended mass on Sunday. The place is spectacular!

A must see destination.. The beauty of the Cathedral is amazing. After you have had a day of fun filled but hectic experiences in the City, stop at St. Patrick's to relax and calm yourself. Spiritual - you can feel the Love.

A must see for NYC trip. Our family loved visiting the Cathedral. it was our first time taking our children 5, 7 and 11 year old. They were mesmerized with the architecture and the windows. Beautiful church!
Beautiful. Amazing cathedral with lots of rich craftsmanship. A quick place to visit if you only have a short time in the City.

A beautiful place to stop. After walking in 5 Avenue for a while, seeing all these modern architectures, you will feel a such relax when you see St. Patrick's Cathedral. The history and the architecture will stop your busy mind in this busy city.
Amazing architecture. Beautiful Cathedral. Well worth the time to walk around inside and observe the architecture and design.

If you like Cathedrals you'll love St. Pat's. The title says it all: St. Patrick's Cathedral is an iconic place in New York - the site weddings and funerals of the rich and famous, and famously on the route of the NY Easter Parade. It is a large impressive structure, in the traditional (neo) Gothic style.

Beautiful Cathedral, Distracting for Mass, Disrespectful? . I have attended St. Patrick's on a number of occasions when in NYC. It's a beautiful Cathedral, however attending mass is difficult. It feels disrespectful that while mass is going on, during the consecration, people are walking up and down the aisles, and behind the alter looking at the priest like he is David Copperfield. It is hard to understand why the Cathedral cannot restrict those who walk around the cathedral during the mass. If you are attending mass, i would sit far front and center and close your eyes.

Beautiful!. The church is a masterpiece. The amount of detail and work that has gone into the stones to create this place of worship is beautiful. It has become a huge attraction for tourists, hard to actually say a prayer. But it was nice to light a candle.

An historic landmark right on 5th Avenue. This being a Jubilee Year meant we were able to enter the Cathedral through the special doors, but we also made a point of seeing the sculpture on and above the beautiful bronze doors at the 5th Avenue entrance. Inside there is a lot more artwork - and the serenity typical of a place of worship.
Awe inspiring. A definite must see. We were lucky enough to attend mass and the cathedral is magnificent to see. Even if you are not a catholic, the architecture alone is so beautiful

It's Finally Back To It's Original. For those whom have been to NYC over the last couple of years you have unfortunately not seen the full beauty of this Cathedral since it was being refurbished with scaffolding everywhere both inside and out. It's finally finished!We were at the 10:15 Mass this past Sunday which is the choir mass (highly recommend if you have a choice as the music is excellent). We were pleasantly surprised to see the celebrant was the Cardinal Timothy Dolan, he was excellent with a spirited homily and nicely paced service.If you need to find a place to see and collect your life, this is it, you feel the splendor and magnificence all around you. It can't help but make you feel better. Go, enjoy it's wonder.
Gothic Gem. You don't have to be Catholic to appreciate this wonderful example of gothic architecture. The cathedral inspires and is open to all respectful tourists to take a peek.

Iconic Landmark. Boy, I hate this selfie crap. You walk into a house of worship like St. Patrick's and you expect to feel the reverence for the purpose of the building. No, you see a bunch of idiots who are more interested in putting their selfies on social media so they can show those that follow them where they visited when they were in Manhatten. Those folks lost me a long time ago. Nonetheless, the inside of the Cathedral is awe inspiring and the building is one for the ages.

Beautiful side trip. Took a side trip over to St. Patrick's cathedral to get a break from the craziness of the Times Square chaos. It was breathtaking walking into this beautiful sanctuary. We lit a candle for our angel son then stopped into the little shop at the back of the church to buy some momentos and communion gifts for our daughter. Small little shop but very friendly and helpful women behind the counter. A must visit for a respite from the craziness of NYC.
Good place to visit and reflect. St. Patricks is a beautiful Cathedral and a moving experience. Mass there however is not what it use to be. It is not a lavish as it once was.
Beautiful Church. Enjoyed our self tour. Also got a memorial coin. There is renovation going on. Gift shop--we were unable to locate as it was across the street--somewhere.

Must see. I've seen the Cathedral only from the outside in December at night it was beautiful. This trip i was able to go inside, it's amazing. Be sure to talk with the staff, they can share some really neat information.

Beautiful Cathedral for Mass or a Visit. The iconic St. Patrick's Cathedral is a must visit, whether to attend Mass or a visit. Severa Mass time options with and without music. Numerous private areas to light a candle and pray. Architecture is magnificent.

A beautiful cathedral. We always visit here when we visit NYC. The Mass and the music from the organ is amazing. Check their website, you can hear the organ and the choir practicing for special services--Christmas or Easter.
Nice Cathedral. I was there for a mass during the Steuben- Parade. It's a bigger cathedral and the architecture it's amazing.

St. Patty's. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a beautiful Gothic structure that stands tall on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan. It seems like a combination of a church and museum containing great stain glass and many statues of various saints. Although it is an intense tourist attraction you can still find a quiet, peaceful, and holy space in the Mary Chapel as you walk to the front right of the main altar. That is a more intimate space with the statue of Mary and a place where people can pray with relatively no distractions. There is a gift shop in the back of the cathedral for souvenirs or religious items. A traditional Mass is held in the cathedral in the early evening on Saturdays and on Sundays.
Second time to attend Mass. Part of Rockafella Center. Previous time was at Easter. Lovely Church, surprised at how large it was.
Breathtaking architecture. This is a must visit to fulfill your soul and reflect on your life. The architecture is unbelievable.
must see. have to see this while in new york. beautiful church very clean quiet place. beautiful cathedral ceiling.
Ash Wednesday. Wow what a beautiful magnificent Church breathtaking and spellbinding a definate much see right nr Top of the Rock.

Such a site to see. The architecture is AMAZING. If you want to light a candle, make sure to bring change, as the shop will not break bigger bills unless you make a purchase. This is an absolute to-do while in NYC.
Sunday service. Not a Catholic but I really enjoyed the service and the sermon, if you sit at the back near to the end you are able to leave before the communion (if you want to)
Gothic. Stunning Cathedral . A masterpiece unique . A special place to visit Majestic a must for all . Definitely recommend.

Try and visit when services aren't on so as not to disturb worshippers.. This is a beautiful cathedral. Very like cathedrals yiu can see all over Europe, though of course not as old.

Beautiful. So beautiful a and peaceful this is well worth a visit on 5th avenue. We visited on the Sunday before Labor Day, but left prior to the Mass that was taking place.
Awesome piece of architecture. Cool too on a hot day.

Georgous. I was privileged enough to attend 9/11 memorial mass and it showed the church in all its glory

Amazing!. St Patrick Cathedral is a magnificent and beautiful church. A peaceful and serene oasis for the believer and non believer. We attended the service on Sunday morning and it was really beautiful.

It's incredibly majestic and an amazing place to just sit and soak in the atmosphere. The last time I was here, renovations were taking place; the cathedral looks even more regal than it did before. A beautiful place to pray. This is not only a beautiful Church it is a very thought provoking sanctuary. My only wish is that tourists would refrain from taking photos of the sanctuary as this is disrespectful.
Beautiful. Such a beautiful Cathedral, love to visit it well worth the walk to it, can't go to NYC without visiting this magnificent building.
the biggest church in NY. The biggest church in New York but if have been in Italy this church cant tell you anything! Just get in there only if your walk takes you there!

Beautiful Church, but very busy. Me and my family visited this church a few times during our stay in Manhattan. The tourist crowds were insane. A lot of people seem to go there for a tourist attraction instead of going for spiritual reasons. My mother was so upset that she approached a priest after mass and called the cardinal the next day about tourists walking around and taking pictures during mass.

St Patricks Cathedral. A very nice church of Saint Patrick . Well organized to pray and have a tour inside. Beautiful on the inside and outside. Worth a visit
Inspiring place. This is a gorgeous building - full of atmosphere. We caught the end of a mass and the sing, organ playing and whole feel of the place was overwhelming.
HIS house. This was an amazing place of worship, comfort and prayer. The structure itself is a must-see and will provide a lot of oooh's and ahhhh's....

Calming building in the midst of chaos. Located right in front of Rockefeller Center amid traffic, skyscrapers and high-end retail shops, this cathedral is a breath of fresh air. The Gothic spires reach up high above the busy traffic of New York and bring you a little peace. Beautiful architecture. A true NYC landmark.
Beautiful and peaceful. Even though there was a lot of tourist traffic to see the renovated cathedral, we took our time and enjoyed the beauty and peace here. It is a must see when traveling to NYC.

An oasis of calm amidst the buzz of 5th Ave. We were in NY as a party of 7 and were on 5th Ave as part of our agreed "shopping day". Very hot and humid - full of noise and bustle - so when we popped into St Patrick's it was (to be honest) initially to get out of the heat. The building is lovely and the calm atmosphere allows you to sit and reflect for a little while before braving 5th Ave again. Even with some construction / renovation work going on it was peaceful and calming. None of our group is Roman Catholic but that really doesn't matter at all - think of St Patrick's as a sanctuary amidst the Manhattan madness.
Beautiful. A very warm welcome by staff at this beautiful cathedral. Beautiful on the inside and outside. Worth a visit.
Wow. An amazing building a gem of a find in this busy city a place to stop and reflect and gather your self for the next part of your visit.
Great Architecture!. In the midst of New Yorks high rise blocks stands this very impressive building on 5th Avenue. Definitely worth a visit!
Amazing. This church is an absolute must see in New York, it is huge and a most beautiful and serene place to see. The interior is just amazing

Beautiful mass!. We heard Sunday mass and the choir was angelic! The solemnity of the Cathedral is kept with some guards/attendants up front. No food and drinks inside (good thing). There is a small souvenir shop to the side where one can buy a few medallions and other religious items.

What a beautiful building. Amazing the contrast between skyscraper and the Cathedral... Only breifly went inside as there was a mass going on... but lit a candle... would like to go back

A piece of history dropped not the middle of Manhattan. The photographic opportunities are immense. St Pats is a very old building dropped into the middle of sky scraper central. Stunningly beautiful!. We weren't able to spend much time at St Patrick's Cathedral on our most recent visit to NYC, however we're so glad we stopped - even if every-so-briefly. It was simply stunning! The architecture was beautiful. Definitely ought to see at least once!

Beautiful Cathedral. We visited the cathedral very beautiful. There was security in the church checking bags on the way in strange but necessary in this day and age. Mass was being celebrated when we visited beautiful cathedral

Visit to NYC. This Cathedral is Superb especially since its been Renovated. So if you coming to Visit the City. Its a must see. The best cathedral in New York. This is the best Cathedral to visit in New York, it is big and old and refurbished with love so it is gloing again, all white and cleaned up from the inside and the outside...
Light a candle, pray and give a donation!

Pretty, But $$ Could Be Used To Help Homeless . My wife wanted to see St. Patrick's Cathedral since the cleaning & restoration have been finished, we were able to visit on 8/30/2016. They did an excellent job of cleaning all of the marble, both inside and outside & it certainly looks beautiful. We have visited often over the past 30 years & it had started to look somewhat dirty. The stained glass windows & interior statues are very pretty and also interesting to look at.  I wonder if all the money for cleaning ($177 million +) could have been better used if spent on helping the poor & homeless of the City, instead of making the Cathedral into a bright shiny showplace. I am sure that one can pray in a huge marble building with dirty marble just as well as one can pray in a bldg which has clean shiny marble. Why not use part of the building for homeless to shower & sleep out of the cold. Should be a good mission for a church. I also noticed that they have prominent signs informing visitors that there are two gift shops where one can spend a lot of money. They also charge $2.00 to light a candle & they have staff constantly changing out the old ones. They appear to have a major focus on fund raising.
Beautiful church. Last time I was in NYC the church was being renovated. They did a beautiful job. Stop by if in the Rockefeller area.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful church. There was a service when we were there and it was wonderful. The architecture is incredible.

Gorgeous gothic building with incredible stained glass. It's worth visiting on a sunny day, mid morning or mid afternoon, when the sun is illuminating at least some of the stained glass windows. BEAUTIFUL ST. PATS. Been here many times. Unbelievable beautiful church. Be VERY quiet and reverent when you go in. Just sit in a back pew and observe everything.

Light, Bright St. Patrick's Cathedral. We always visit cathedrals when we travel abroad, so we decided to visit St. Patrick's while in NYC. It is absolutely beautiful inside, evidently the result of restoration. there was a service going on and the music was beautiful.
Trip to the Big Apple. What a beautiful classic cathedral structure. Nice to see on still in all its glory, fully intact after visiting ruin of great churches and cathedrals in Russia.

Amazing Huge Beyond Comprehension Must See. I was just taken by the sheer size of this church - I could not believe that it took up an entire NYC block let alone I could not even get the church all in one photo. Gorgeous - must see.

It took about an hour and was very informative and enjoyable. The cathedral is very impressive and the staff are extremely welcoming. Well worth a visit.
Beautiful. A very nice cathedral to take a walk to and spend a bit of time. Beautiful architecture and photo opportunity.

Beautiful. This cathedral, while smaller than some of the better-know European cathedrals, is on par from an aesthetic standpoint. It's simply beautiful. Go during the day and walk inside, light a candle, say a prayer. Come back at night for a completely different view.
fantastic. opposite the Rock, there had been a wedding earlier in the day so the main doors were open - beautiful church free to go into and have a look

Beautiful church!. This is one of the prettiest churches I have ever seen, and I've visited churches all over the world! I am not of the catholic faith, but I am glad I visited this beautiful place of worship

An architectural masterwork...barely visible among a concrete Forest !. Saint Patrick Cathedral An Architectural masterwork barely visible among a concrete forest...Last July we were enjoying a Gastrotour week in NY. Of course those days included touristing several of those iconic sites and building in the great City that "never sleeps".  As architect, was mandatory a visit to one of the highest, impressive and most magnificent neo-Gothic style building in USA: The Cathedral of St. Patrick (commonly called St. Patrick's Cathedral) is a profusely neo-gothic decorated Roman Catholic Cathedral Church, designed by James Renwick, which is considered one of the most important landmarks in NY with its visible and strategic location east side of famous Fifth Ave, between 50-51 streets (Midtown Manhattan) and directly across Rockefeller Center The construction works, with its huge proportions, were completed in 1878. At that time, present-day midtown Manhattan was far north of the populous areas of New York CityLater, in 1888, its magnificent multiple spires were added. With its 329 feet (100 meters) it was the tallest structure in New York City at that time Our lasts times touristing New York I couldn't visit it, so... I was very disappointed as it was in the phase of an extensive restoration and renovations works which begun back in 2012 and lasted 3 years at a cost of aprox $200 million. Those restoration works were finished by the end of 2015, before Pope Francis visited the cathedral.The restoration included the needed cleaning of its exterior marble details-now beautifully looking- and the restoration of its fantastic stained glass windows and great painted ceilings, among other works That was then...now- as impenitent professional architect, urban planner and history lover, I could fully appreciated this Architectural work of art... ...today "humble" sited-barely visible- among a "concrete and steel forest" ! An artwork that- hopefully- will remain to be appreciated by generations to come in the future as testimony of those incredible past works of art that today....looks like impossible to create again, even with our architectural programs that, rather than facilitate, probable limit creative works and rather.......has guided us to non-creative patterns of replications and repetitions, composing arts and architecture just reorganizing old and already designed and created elements !
Stunning. We walked through bc didn't have time to do a full tour. May come back to do it though. You can download the app for it - the cost goes to the church. Magnificent.
Nice. It matches the skyscrapers and the rest of he city very well. A beautiful church. Reminds me of Duomo in Italy.

Most beautiful catherdral I've ever seen!. My fiancé and I visited New York in January, in the middle of the second biggest snow storm in it's history! Seeing the outside of this covered in snow, was just magical. I wasn't sure if we could go inside but we just happened to walk passed as people were going in so decided to pay a visit after I'd be admiring the front for days! It was absolutely stunning inside - truly magical. We actually got engaged that afternoon.. and all I could think about was getting married in a church as beautiful as this one!

a gorgeous cathedral in the center of Manhattan. The Cathedral of St. Patrick, commonly called St. Patrick's Cathedral is an active Roman Catholic church in the heart of one of the busiest parts of NYC. Extensively restored 2012-15, it is the seat of the archbishop of the NY archdiocese. It is also a wonderful example of Neo-Gothic architecture as well as a nice, cool place to get out of the summer heat. The stained glass windows are beautiful and there is a rose window as well. There are two pipe organs and it's a great place to come to hear music. The cathedral is certainly worth seeing on any visit to NYC but be sure to avoid visiting during mass unless you are Catholic.

Beautiful. This place was just amazing. I was impressed that even though they allowed the public to walk in everyone seemed very respectful of their surrounds. The architecture was one of the most magnificent that we had seen on the entire trip.
Quiet place. The place let enter a beautiful light. It is quiet and spiritual. If offers a nice architecture. Worth a stop.
Unexpected beauty . So wasn't expecting to see a cathedral I the middle of all of the skyscrapers, but there she was! Absolutely lovely on the inside too, with some stunning stained glass windows.

45th Wedding Anniversary Mass. Went to St Pats 10:15 mass today in honor of our 45th wedding anniversary. The mass was exactly the same day and time that we got married 45 years ago. A real bonus. What a great church and the organ is amazing. The next time you visit NYC, make sure you stop by this beautiful cathedral.

Beautiful Roman Catholic Cathedral. I highly recommend you visit St. Patrick's Cathedral in Manhattan, NY
It has beautiful artworks in it and please show respect when visiting there with keeping you children under control with no yelling inside please.
Incredible at noght. Very impressive gothic style cathedral. You should definitely visit at night, the Lightning gives a very spectacular view to it.
Breathtaking. Not a Catholic, but can certainly appreciate the artistry that went in to making this church. It was recently cleaned from top to bottom and it is magnificent.
Great place to visit.. Great construction. It is mesmerizing. Never seen a great place with such intricate construction and attention to details any where in the world.
Beautiful Church in the heart of Manhattan.. With no doubt, the most beautiful church I have visited in the USA! Incredible architectonic design.
Mammoth. Cathedral fronting 5th Avenue pretty close to Rockefeller Plaza. It's big and its busy. It's one of those places where, if you are passing, then pop in.
Wonderul. A must to visit if you like uplifting architecture. As this is a church, please visit when there is no mass on. It was a lovely visit that i will remember for years to come.

Beautiful without the scaffolding. Now is the time to go see the inside of St. Patrick's Cathedral. There is no unsightly scaffolding to mar the beauty of this fine house of worship. The stained glass is gorgeous everywhere you look. Don't forget to look for the pipe organ in the balcony. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to be there during a service, but it's definitely worth a trip to see, reflect and to get away from the frenzied life of the city just outside the cathedral doors.
Stunning!. This is a gem in the middle of the madness of Fifth Avenue. It is definitely worth stopping by to admire the beauty and enjoy the peace in St. Patrick's cathedral.

We love going to mass at the Cathedral. I go to mass here about twice a year. It is such an amazing cathedral, but it is even cooler to worship the Lord with such a diverse group of people. God bless the people of St. Patrick's.
Beautiful. This is the most beautiful place I have seen. This is a must to see. The stained glass is gorgeous the statues were so neat. Please go see this most serene place I have ever been to.
Gothic beauty in the concrete jungle . Wow what a building! So beautiful to see, inside and out, the architecture of this place is amazing. Wonderfully maintained too and free to visit.

Awesome, Beautiful. This Cathedral is one of my favorites, seems like a smaller version of St. Paul's in London. The detail and finish are something you should pay attention to, and the church is also a great place to capture a few moments of peace and solitude in the middle of a busy NYC tour.
A must go for all or no Faith. Very holy Place .Went in as Mass was starting .The organ playing and the singer were vey beautiful . If you are looking for St Paddy he is on the Left hand pillar
Wow!. This visit brought my wife to tears! The stained glass work is priceless! Huge! Historic! The exhibits along the sides are unimaginable! Wonderful place to take my wife!

A must see!. Such a beautiful place! The windows, the altar and chapels are beautiful. The building is so well maintained - it really is a must see whether you are a Catholic or not. We got there at 9am and it was busy then.

Amazing, beautiful & spiritually uplifting. A spiritual oasis in the middle of a bustling City. You can be alone with your thoughts, yet communing with other parishioners and travelers who stop in to rest their weary feet or hearts. The priest's homily was touching, not superficially, but thought-provoking. The renovations have brightened up St. Patrick's. As you leave the Church, notice the statue of Atlas holding the weight of the world on his shoulders, perfectly framed by the Church doors. How appropriate!Take a picture of the stained glass above the organ, and the buttresses and other decorative features of the Cathedral. One year, I used a St. Patrick's photo for my Christmas cards.
Beautiful. Nice place to stop and admire the art. A truly beautiful church that is open to the public. It has many little side alters.

Awe Inspiring!. This is a crown jewel in the middle of the city. Regardless of your beliefs, it is awe inspiring and a spiritual experience to enter it's doors. I think it's wonderful that they church doors are open for people to come inside to pray or just to admire it's beautiful Gothic architecture and stain glass windows. Their is no entry fee so everyone can enjoy however they do have areas you can leave a donation is you like. It's a must see when in the city!
Be sure to visit the gift shop. World renowned cathedral. You can't come to NYC and not visit for a few minutes. Enjoy the grandeur of this magnificent building amongst the surrounding skyscrapers.

Beautiful cathedral, indoors and outdoors . Entry is free of charge, and well worth a visit even if you're not religious (I'm an atheist myself, but still appreciate the magnificent stained glass, architecture and sculptures of cathedrals). The interiors are truly impressive, especially the stained glass windows and the ceiling. The cathedral also looks fantastic from the outside, especially when viewed from Top of the Rock.

One of the place to visit in New York city. Rockefeller center, Empire State building are nearby. A beautiful cathedral to photograph. If you are in NY during Christmas season, this one of the place must visit. Place will be beautifully decorated.
Speechless. Its architecture is beyond words, there is so much to admire. Great place for photographs, it's absolutely beautiful.

A Moving Experience . This Church is amazing to say the least. To write a review is hard. How do you write about going into a magnificent spot like this and do it justice?! You honestly can't. You feel safe and at home when you walk in, the architecture will blow your mind especially if your not use to spots like this (yes the small town girl is not use to this kind of extravagance). This is a must stop on your journey!
Beautiful and peaceful place. Very beautiful church to escape the noise of the city. The decor is amazing and has a beautiful shrine

Restoration almost finished. This cathedral has been having restoration work over the past few years.This is now almost finished and will bring St Patrick's back to the heart of 5th avenue.Lovely cathedral inside and good to visit for some silence in the middle of the crazy city that is New York.

Almost not real. Truly a stunning work of architecture, even for NYC, but from a religious standpoint, read the part of the New testament where Jesus goes tearing through the temple in Matt 21:12, Then Jesus went into the temple courtse and drove out all who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those selling doves. 13And He declared to them, “It is written: ‘My house will be called a house of prayer.’f But you are making it ‘a den of robbers.’g”One has to wonder how many poor people could have been helped by the millions needed to build this church. Of course nothing is being sold and no one is robbing anyone, but when looking at the Gospel of Thomas - The Kingdom of God is inside you and all around you Not in a mansion of wood and stone- Split a piece of wood and I am there - Lift a stone and you will find me.From purely a touristic standpoint, absolutely stunning. But I just felt that the excesses of money and fashion have somehow influenced this place and took away from it what it really is supposed to be. But by all means, it needs to be seen in all of its awe inspiring ways.

Morning Mass at St. Patrick's. I love to attend Mass at St. Patrick's Cathedral whenever in town. The church has just undergone a major renovation and the results are fantastic. There is one section still under construction to the left of the altar. After Mass, I was able to visit the small chapels that go around the back of the main altar. It is definitely worth a visit!

Beautiful and moving. Visit St Patrick's is a must every time we visit Manhattan. Last time we could not visitt because it was under renovation. Let me tell you that it was worth the waiting. Beautiful, clean and moving. It is like an oasis in the middle of the crazy Manhattan. Perfect to catch a breath and pray before going mad again.

Well worth going inside especially on a hot day. We made the time to visit St Patricks. The interior was magnificent and worth walking around. The air was cool which was a welcome break from the heat on the hot day we visited. We received a hearty welcome from the gentleman at the table near the door. I will visit again when I am back in New York.
Nice church in the city. The church is located right inside the city. Walkable distance from Times Square area. The building is very well built and worthy of a visit.

Beautifully renovated and cleaned... You can go into St. Patrick's Cathedral and sit in quiet peace in a beautiful prayerful space in the midst of a busy noisy city and find yourself at peace and rest.
Couples getaway. Wonderful to be able to attend mass and take in the beauty of our surroundings.Easy walking distance from our hotel.

Construction Complete!. Every year we have visited the Cathedral and although it is so impressive, there has always been construction of some sort obstructing the full view of the sanctuary. We went this summer and all the scaffolding was down and for the first time we were able to see the complete sanctuary. Wow. Beautiful.
beautiful church. St. Patrick's is a very beautiful cathedral. It has many different altars honoring different saints.. The stained glass windows are gorgeous

Lovel place of Worship. Went along with m wife, and wow what big place of worship, mass is held every day of the week, some of the masses are with music, we never got to had those masses, but it does get very busy there, but plenty of room for everybody, and you can light a candle for 2 dollars for every candle you wish to light.

Grand and Beautiful. When taking photos of the exterior, I prefer at dusk. It complements well with its neo-gothic style. It's soooo beautiful!!! It doesnt matter what your religion is, this a very beautiful architecture in Midtown and just across Rockafeller to be missed!
East Coast Trip. What a magnificent cathedral. The architecture is amazing. Felt the need to let it all go and cry. Security is tight.

You Really Need to See This. A beautiful place to visit and since the renovations have taken place it is even more spectacular. You can have a quick walk round or you can spend time in it and soak up the beauty of it all
Beautiful!!. After a long day dealing with the hussell and bussell of the city it was the perfect place to sit and reflect. To me it is as if you feel Gods presence. Such a beautiful cathedral!!!!

Very ornate. It is a large and very nice church.
We visited when a mass was going on, so did not have the chance to walk around. Nevertheless, it felt serene and peaceful even with the huge number of visitors.
A must see.

So glad we stopped in. The stained glass windows of this cathedral are stunning. Our visit was short, but breathtaking. Even if you only have 10 minutes, you can really enjoy the beauty of this cathedral. Just be sure to check mass schedules if you plan to visit on a Saturday or Sunday.

Beautiful inside & out. Must go visit even if it's just for a few minutes. It's a beautiful building.
I'm not catholic but I appreciate peace, art, and architecture.

One of the great cathedrals. Our hotel was right across the street on Madison Avenue which faces the back of the cathedral. Having been there many times as a child I wanted to take my wife and show her what a beautiful, elegant Cathedral was located right in the middle of Midtown.No matter how many times you go it's still an amazing sight to behold.

Grand and Gorgeous. This is one of the most beautiful cathedrals in the world! Everyone should visit here at least once. I came to a holiday service once and I cried the whole time. It was just so beautiful to be in such an amazing place with the choir singing. This church is everything.Amazing inside and out.

Huge and Breathtaking. The cathedral, which can accommodate 3,000 people, is built of brick clad in marble, quarried in Massachusetts and New York. It takes up a whole city block, between 50th and 51st streets, Madison Avenue and Fifth Avenue. At the transepts it is 174 feet (53.0 meters) wide and 332 feet (101.2 meters) long.

Sunday Mass. We visited the Cathedral for Mass. Lovely to have an Irish Priest as celebrant. It is a beautiful building, currently undergoing refurbishment. Lovely, bright and clean, even with the work going on.

A beautiful Cathedral with free entry. This is a beautiful cathedral at the top of 5th ave, it is free to get into with plenty of helpful staff around, inside although it was busy it felt calm and peaceful - do drop in if you are passing,
Wonderful. This is a beautiful cathedral in a very nice part of Manhattan. The inside of this is full of wonderful statues and stained glass a most see.
St. Patrick's Cathedral. What an incredible church, St. Patrick's Cathedral. It is a very well known NYC landmark, gorgeous to see.
Beautifully Clean. A grand cathedral. Good for meditation whatever your religion. Light a candle, drop some coins in the collection box and look at the sun streaming through the window.

Peace in the middle of NYC!. St. Patrick's Cathedral is like a little quiet island in the middle of the big concrete jungle. It is such a beautiful church. I have always loved stopping in when I am near and just sitting in peace for 30 minutes.

Beautiful inside and out. As a proud Catholic visiting churches are a gift. Going to mass at St. Patrick's is very special, to marvel at the architecture with the incredible stained glass windows are impressive. The height is amazing. I just hate that you have to have your bags checked to go to mass. It's the sign of times.

The Meca of Irish Catholisim. This Cathedral is located in Midtown Manhattan and was there way before the skyscrapers that surround it. It is the headquarters of the Catholic Church in New York. It has just completed a multi-million dollar renovation and looks as good as when it was first built. There is a burial chamber under the main alter for the past Cardinals that served there. This is a cathedral to be seen while your in New York!
Nice place for serenity in the city. St. Patrick's is NYC's take on a gothic cathedral. It's a nice place to get away from the noise and heat/cold.

Gorgeous Church. Absolutely beautiful church open for free to the public for viewing (although they were collecting further inside the church, we just stayed by the entrance and didn't pay anything). The architecture was so pretty. It was very nice.
Wonderful beacon of faith & Inspiration.... Fantastic, no lines and plenty of scenario and a fabulous setting. It is a beautiful place. A great escape from the craziness of Times Square.
Breathtaking. Such a beautiful place! There are several different areas within the church that you can learn more. Photos really don't do it justice.
Happy. My daughter graduated from St.Patrick's Cathedral and it was a unique experience,and just wonderful.

A place of solitude in the heart of the concrete jungle. Used the side entrance "Door of Mercy", will try to put video on. In the main church as you enter there are candles to burn. (I did for my grandma kept my promise RIP)...There is a choir and the sound resonates like you are sitting right in front of them. The depth to the church is breath taking the alter is lit up. We came upon the church by accident and looking at the architect we went in and had a very somber occasion.
Beautiful. I took my mother-in-law to church here. We were staying nearby and she is Catholic. It was nice to attend a service with music--the soloist was fabulous!

Beautiful peace. Visited eight years ago but now been refurbished and as good as new. Beautiful stained glass, immaculate exterior, small shop selling holy relics. Would have lived to have had time to attend mass.

Feeling the presence of god..... I used to visit this Cathedral often when I was younger. When you enter it's cavernous interior, you are taken back to a former age. Although I've visited here often in the past, I am still taken aback every time I enter... Go there. Sit in the pews in silence. Take a moment to reflect on life. Walk around and look at the decor. You'll be glad you did!

Beautify retreat. This was on the list of must see things in NYC. We stopped in after a long hot day of walking. It is amazing how quiet and restorative it was. My daughter and I were sitting quietly in reflection when mass started. It was incredible to get the opportunity to attend mass. It was a little weird that people were walking around taking pictures during mass but it did not detract from it. The church itself is gorgeous. This is definitely worth seeing!
Family. Beautiful, absolutely stunning details, statues, stained glass windows, the whole church is breathtakingly beautiful! Highly recommend a visit.
A place for anyone to seat and pray for a better world. An imposing building , witness of an era. Beautiful stained glass windows. Try to go when there is an organ concert. The sounds fill the space.

Construction is over!!. It was a delight to walk into the church and see it in all it's glory without the scaffolding etc. We clubbed this site with Rockerfeller center and spent about 30 mins walking through the lovely vestibules of the church.
Beautiful Church. Really beautiful church. It is free to go in a take a look. They had a Mass happening when we were there.

Interior scaffolding is gone. Go see this.. So, about a year ago, my brother and his wife took one of those tours of Italy and France. Do you know where most of their tour went? Cathedrals. He spent hours and hours on end, going to, going from, and inside cathedrals.My brother hasn't been inside a church since, oh, maybe a funeral? So why did he go on vacation? He could have just booked a flight to my house, and we could have gone and seen St. Patrick's. Except the scaffolding was all over it for a restoration. Now it's done and boy howdy, welcome to Jesus's house that he wants to share with you. Come on in, set a spell. This place is spectacular and it is free. But give 'em a few bucks anyway.
Elegant. A beautiful church amongst shops and skyscrapers. Lovely inside and out. We weren't in here long but enjoyed the beauty of the building.

Beautiful Church. St Patricks has been a favorite of mine. After visiting many churches in Italy, I still find it very awe inspiring. The architecture is wonderful. I find it very peaceful in there even with all the people that come in to look. The gift shop area is very tiny.
Gorgeous cathedral from the past. Saint Patricks Cathedral is a massive gothic style church. It has so much history and has recently been upgraded. Well worth having a closer look at it's beauty.
Beautiful and massive. I visited the cathedral both before and after the renovation. It is so shiny now, the walls are white and bright and beautiful. A very gorgeous and very spiritual place.

Great experience!. First, the structure itself is one of the most outstanding things I experienced in NYC. We attended the 10:15 mass with choir and it was outstanding. Our home church does not have a velvet rope to let people in to worship, so that was different, but we got in just fine. It is a little strange to have tourists taking photos of you during mass, but the overall production and experience is like nothing I've ever experienced. It was also amazing to attend with Cardinal Dolan presiding over the mass. I would recommend.
Great Cathedral. We toured the Cathedral and liked it a lot. Beautiful artifacts, stained glass windows, and an amazing organ.
beautiful building. Beautiful architecture, free to visit, a must do for everybody who loves history, even if you are not affiliated with any religion.

Dwarfed by surroundings. Almost lost amongst the skyscrapers on 5th Avenue, this neo-gothic style cathedral would be easy to miss. Look out for it between 50th and 51st streets, opposite the Rockefeller Center. A little oasis of calm, away from the hustle and bustle just outside. There is no entrance fee, but lighting a candle and donating a couple of dollars is suggested. Try to include this in your itinerary, highly recommended.

Definetely worth thre visit. If you are in NY for a visit, they are chances that you happen to be close to St Patricks. If so, then take sometime to visit. It's really beautiful and reminded me of the cathedral in Notre Dame.I didn't plan the visit, just stopped by. I didn't regret it at all.

Beautiful cathedral, a very nice experience. It's a very beautiful, ornate, and old cathedral located in Manhattan. I wouldn't say it's a destination (unless you are religious) but worth dropping by when visiting NYC.

Beautiful cathedral in the heart of a busy city. We were welcomed like old friends to this beautiful cathedral in the middle of the sweltering summer heat and crowded pavements of New York.A little treasure worth seeking out
Gorgeous!. The most beautiful church ever! Got to go in and attend part of the mass on Sunday morning. It was so amazing to see all the architecture. Gorgeous!!

It's glows. The cathedral glows since being cleaned and refurbished. I recommend attending a service with music so you can hear the restored organ, which is majestic, and get the true feel of the building.

Wonderful monument and house of God. Fabulous architecture, wonderful monuments, and well worth a visit and for the price of a small donation (not compulsory, but morally obligatory) it's a fabulous place to visit. Do not miss it!

Too many people. The Cathedral itself is amazing! I've been stunned by its beauty and splendour. People say there has recently been a restoration and it really seems like this. i gave the rating 4 just for the fact there are too many tourists, just impossible to concentrate and pray.

Lighting candles. Renovations complete the cathedral is more breath-taking than ever. So restful and tranquil, an oasis in the middle of the city. Take time to just sit in the Lady Chapel and revel in the stained glass windows.
Beautiful Cathedral. This Cathedral is simply stunning it is in a very popular part of New York even you are not Catholic or not religious it is worth a visit
Beautiful Church - Free to Enter. Beautiful Church - Free to Enter. They accept donations. Suggested donation to light each candle is $2.00 U.S.

Magnificent, humbling and glorious. We've been several times to St. Patrick's long before the restoration and during. We've been during Mass and during the week. The Cathedral always has people coming and going. No one can describe in words the beauty of the architecture, stained glass the labor and sweat of those that created this masterpiece for worship. We stop in when we can to light a candle, say a prayer and be every hopeful of world peace. Standing at the back of the pews during Mass makes one very hopeful.

Beautiful church. Last time I visited NYC the cathedral was under construction. Now I was happy to see it in its full beauty from the outside and the inside. It is a nice, cool place to visit. And while looking at its beauty you can relax a little.

An architectural splendor. We've been there on the walk-in tour. All tours are free, but they accept donations. It was difficult to know where to look and what you were looking at with all that construction. The tours tell much about the intricacies of the architecture as well as its history. St. Patrick’s Cathedral is a must-see on every trip to NYC. It has its website www.saintpatrickscathedral.org You may find much info about it there and even listen to records of masses.

St. Patrick's Sunday Mass. We decided to wander around New York early Sunday afternoon. We were at St. Patrick's Cathedral, and we wanted to go in to see the cathedral. As we stepped inside, the Sunday mass was in session. We were able to pray and be a part of the mass while we took in the beauty of the cathedral. The sermon was wonderful, by the way.

Heavenly Restoration. If you haven't been to St Patrick's Cathedral recently, now is the time to make a pilgrimage. The wonderfully restored House of God is a breathtaking sight both in and out. Go for the beauty of the edifice and the majesty of the interior and stay a while for the tranquility and peace of mind prayer can bring. Truly a must see destination in the Big Apple

Awe inspiring cathedral in which to worship God. My daughter and I visited on a Saturday morning and were just in time to attend Noon Mass. I don't know how you could sit in such an awe inspiring sanctuary and not feel the presence of God. When I visit NYC next time, I intend to return in order to view all the architectural splendor.
Breathtaking!. A must see! doesn't matter if you are Catholic or not it is just beautiful inside lots to look at and so so pretty!

Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful cathedral that sits architecturally at odds with the NYC skyscrapers. Visually stunning inside and out, many biblical themes and story telling via beautiful stained glass windows and ornate statues. Great place to chill out from the busyness of NY, it is also free and you can make a donation.
Spectacular Architechture. A beautiful shrine to worshippers! It was a grand place in a grand city. They even have a gift shop. We went during mass and it wasn't disruptive.

Poor Sound, Average Mass, Beautiful Church. Went for 5:30 Mass which was interesting as tourists continue to visit during the Mass. Sound is poor due to cavernous building and weak speaker system. The priest tried but was no match for the size and sound issue rendering the sermon somewhat lost. The Church is under construction but is still beautiful and worth the visit. I'd go to visit again but might choose a different service!

Renovations Completed!. My wife and daughters visited NYC on Saturday 8/6/16 and were pleasantly surprised to see that the massive renovation project seems to be complete! We treasure St. Patrick's Cathedral for its awe inspiring presence in the middle of such a busy location(5th Avenue at 51st Street)!!
A beautiful building. Was very crowded the day we visited but still awed by the shear scale of the building, plan to spend some time there if the crowd was large and it takes time to visit.
Beautiful and peaceful. Great Cathedral to visit.The upgrade for electricity, electronics, sound system and lighting system is very impressive

Stunning!!!. As we were walking down the road, towards St Patrick's, you could see the church among all the high rise buildings and it was stunning!! We stood outside taking pics, but didn't have time to go inside, so we came back the next day.  This is a must see when in the NYC area! It's location amongst the house rise buildings is unique, and awe inspiring.

Gorgeous, Gorgeous Cathethdral. WOW! You can look at photo's of this Cathedral but not a single one can do justice to the reality of how magnificent this architectural site is. It is unbelievable! A MUST SEE IN NYC.

Stunning cathedral. Visited a few weeks ago with my wife and teenage children. I had been told that it was a building worth visiting. We were on our way to Top of the Rock when we walked past the cathedral. So glad we went in. It is huge and the architecture is out of this world. My grandfather recently passed away so we decided to light a candle in his memory. It was very busy inside but everyone was respectful. A wedding was taking place in one of the areas behind the altar. Will definitely visit again.
Beautiful mass. We attended a weekday mass and toured the cathedral after. Amazing and beautiful with statues, prayer areas, and stained glass.

Gorgeous Church. We arrived during a Sunday service and quietly went in through the front entrance to light candles, the mass look brilliant and I wish now that I had taken a seat even for a short while. The building itself is breathtaking and it was so nice for me to see it without the scaffolding that it had last time i visited.
