Amazing piece of architecture. For lovers of architecture, it's definitely a must see. Located in the heart of the city, shouldn't be a problem to find it. Very well preserved and, subjectively, I loved it.
Beautiful. A must see if you are a fan of architecture and/or visiting churches. I have visited them all over the world and it is definitely in my top ten list.

Tranquility in the Midst of the CIty. Such a peaceful place in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city. Sit and pray awhile and enjoy the peaceful talk with God while you admire the beauty in the architecture of the building. Recently restored it will surely impress.

Beautiful, welcoming Cathedral.. This is one of the most impressive Cathedrals I've visited and there was no entry fee, which came as a pleasant surprise to me.
With security checks being a necessity, they couldn't have been carried out in a more friendly way. One particular chap was outstanding, with his hearty handshakes as our bags were checked.
Thank you!

Beautiful and peaceful place !. They have done an amazing job cleaning the outside and inside of the building. Take time to walk around the church to see all the saints. It is a jewel of a building . Like being in Europe! They do have a gift shop across the street that have a lot of beautiful religious things to buy.Leave some money so they can continue the renovation and continue maintaining such a becauitul place.

Amazing. We did Sunday mass here and it is an amazing Catholic church. The church is beautiful and despite a huge gathering the staff kept the mass on schedule. The homily delivered a clear and meaningful message.

Took a look-see. My wife and I were walking around Manhattan and ventured upon St Patrick's Cathedral. We stepped inside to look around and saw some people praying and many waiting for a Mass to begin. Lots of kiosks to purchase prayer candles for $2 each. My wife and I worship differently than Catholics, but the visit here was interesting.

Beauty and Peace in the heart of NYC. What a stunningly beautiful place to visit! Thank you St Patrick's for throwing your doors open wide for all to enter. Regardless of your beliefs or the specific religion you may participate in this is a haven for everyone as we are all brothers and sisters. I highly recommend - oh and while you're there drop a couple bucks in the offering box and help this wonderful historic place maintain itself!!

Beautiful Building and Visited By All. Went to the 1015 Sunday Mass. Noticed that there many people from all over the world in attendance. Also, many non-Catholics there too. The art work through the cathedral was beautiful. If you are ever in Manhattan please take some time to visit this beautiful place, Catholic or any other religion.DDS
Restored to its former glory. A few years back we visited the cathedral as well, but then it was a big building site as it was being restored. Now this is over and it looks brandnew.
Beautiful!!. Finally, there was no construction happening on our visit! What a stunningly beautiful cathedral, right in the middle of Manhattan. A must see!

Beautiful & Cool. We aren't catholic, or even religious but we enjoyed stumbling upon this beautiful structure. It was 90 degrees outside so we stopped in to cool off and see what it was about. We spent about 45 minutes admiring the architecture, sculptures, and stained glass. I do find it funny that there is a gift shop in a church & a vending machine for some sort of medallion keepsake. All peoples were clearly welcome here and that was a nice thing to see for a religious organization, ironically enough.

A Quick visit. We noticed the beautiful church after being at Rockefeller Center and just had to go inside. Once inside there was security checking bags while people were in the pews praying or meditating. The stained glass is exquisite. It felt somewhat sacrilegious to take pictures. My 7 year old niece was not impressed
loved it!. Loved this place. Gothic and absolutely stunning if your into this type of stuff. Walk around and take time to read the information about saints.

Beautiful Cathedral!. We happened to get there during Wednesday Mass. It was great to hear the singing! I especially love the stations of the cross! Then all the statues have been restored.vthey are bright and beautiful.

Quiet peaceful area in this City. You can come in most anytime however mass is done several times a day and if you want to hear the pipe organ play make sure to check out the days and times it will play during the masses since it is not played at all the masses. Very pretty church. If you do go for mass sit way toward the front so you are not distracted by visitors coming throughout the day and the altar is some distance from the front pew so the further back you sit you will only a birds eye view.

Gothic and peaceful. Stunning cathedral and can provide the perfect place to rest your feet and enjoy the stunning peace and tranquility of all it has to offer, the biggest catholic church in the city. beautiful.
Must see. Take some time and visit this beautiful Cathedral. The art work is majestic and the church and impressive.

Majestic . The white spires of St. Patrick's are made more awesome by the context, standing apart from the forest of skyscrapers in the vicinity. It's an oasis of calm and peace within, the bustle of Manhattan's streets muted momentarily, allowing the visitor to turn inwards and reflect, not an easy thing to do in NYC. If you do happen to visit, don't forget to pause from the picture-taking and take it all in.

Magnificent Cathedral. This grand old cathedral is a quiet oasis among the hustle and bustle of the area. The architecture, stained glass windows, and interior furnishings are all magnificent! There is even a small gift shop tucked back in the corner. This is something that every visitor should see.

Great spot to look around and reflect. Large cathedral with lots to see, get away from busy New York and take time to sit and reflect. Good collections and great photo options. Very spacious and airy and cool.
Beautiful and peaceful. Stunning architecture and immense reverence. Always peaceful and beautiful. It's great to visit and enjoy a mass.

Iconic and the scaffolds are gone. Outside at least, and the building looks beautifully clean -- still some interesting age stains in places, but glistening in the afternoon sunlight.There are many animals hiding all around St. Patrick's -- on the statues, in the ceiling architecture and stainws glass windows, and in the decorative accents on the altar -- that searching for them is reminiscent of a "Look and Find" or an "I Spy" book. Try to find the dolphin, the pelican, the dragon, the cats and a mouse; I've found the others, but not the mouse -- and it looks more like a rat to me in the one picture I've seen.The image of a mother pelican with blood trickling from her beak as she feeds her young is based on a legend that in a time of famine, a mother pelican would draw blood from her own chest to feed her babies. The church uses it as a symbol of the sacrifice of Jesus Christ and the nourishment of the Eucharist.There are many secrets in this wonderful place -- I particularly like the two stained glass windows that no one can see from inside or outside, hidden behind the organ pipes, except through a hidden passage way. Symbolically -- man may not see, but God sees all.
They were renovating. Probably unfair to rate it because they were renovating but seriously underwhelmed, no atmosphere. Give it a miss. Its prettier outside.

Gorgeous Cathedral. As a New Yorker I have been here numerous times. It really is a beautiful cathedral. It's right near Rockefeller Center so if you are in this area, visiting St Pats is easy. Some tips:Look up mass times on their website, which also has important info about when it's open. There are bathrooms.There is security and looking in bags, but it is fast, friendly and non invasive. It's particularly nice at Christmas when the nativity is set up. Bring a donation and light a candle for a special intention. Take the time to walk around and look at the details in the art and architecture. There has been an extensive renovation going on for a few years that may be finished, and the changes in color of the stone and marble is incredible. I think you might need to walk up steps to get in, but I can imagine they would have a handicapped entrance. I have never noticed one before so check the website for help with this ahead of time.
Loved this free attraction. I'm not Catholic but was in awe of the architecture of this building. There are so many little things to stop and enjoy up and down the nave of the church.

Glory be to the American Catholic. This is a must see, must do mass, must hang out on the steps before and catch the "wild-life" experience in the heart of Manhattan. As a church of the tourist and local alike, this was a place where people seemed more relaxed, and willing to strike up conversations and comments. The Sunday mass was pretty traditional, but sitting in the front pews a bit hard to hear the lector and priest. Still, the building-complex is stellar, restoration divine, and ode to catholicism, very heart felt - especially for those raised in the tradition. Light a candle for someone you love, just 2 bucks cash.
A Lovely Cathedral. Went to see the Cathedral on a Wednesday evening. Mass was going on when we got there. There is security. Beautiful architecture. Light a candle for someone you miss.
Beautiful and quiet in the middle of New York. Magnificent cathedral in the busy heart of New York. We arrived while a service was being conducted, wonderful chance to hear the organ being played.
Bigger than it seems!. The cathedral is beautiful with its stained glass windows and much bigger inside than it seems from outside!

Light a candle. If you grew up Catholic, you have to go just to say you've been. If you aren't Catholic go anyway, God loves everybody. St. Patrick's is not just a church. It is an intimate part of the history of New York City, and the USA. Just think of the number of events that have taken place here. For over 200 years St. Patrick's has stood for all the many good things that are New York.

We were left speechless. This church is huge and very ornate. I thought to myself if God was going to show up at a church this would be the one. Words can not describe the detail and craftsmanship of this beautiful building.

Faith and History meet. St. Patrick's is one of the top sites of NYC. Everyone should know the history of this sacred space and the challenges of the men and women who built it in the face of prejudice and ignorance. Beautiful and peaceful in the midst of the busy city.
Everyon is always welcome.
Wondefull. Just like the architecture of the time you can see a well conservated building in European style. Felt like in Ireland

Simply Beautiful. A gorgeous cathedral with incredible architecture. It was a very spiritual experience. I loved seeing the devotions to different saints. Several popes have visited the cathedral as well.
A bit of reflection dear. St Patricks is a stunning cathederal. A place to sit and reflect and if you are lucky you can listen to the choir practising

If you like churches.... ..I think this is worth a visit. I personally go to NYC for business every year and visit this church as part of my routine. I go, buy some candles, light them, say my prayers to my deceased family, wish them well, and thank them for allowing me to arrive in NYC safely once again. Then I sit and take some time to be quiet. It's very busy outside with people and traffic and whatnot, but I don't feel it when I am in here.

Must Visit Icon. If you are walking around Rockefeller Center, make sure you stop in St. Patrick's Cathedral. Chances are masses will be going on so you can sit/walk around and just take in the magnificent architect.

Breathtaking place which will take you back to Europe. This place is huge. And amount of details inside is just incredible. Brought me back to Europe, even this specific church smell is there. Place giving very spiritual aura, is place not only as must see in Big Apple but also as place for thinking and pray.

beautiful church. we dropped by on Sunday morning to have a look and found that a mass was being held, we were surprised to see people still touring around the church, but I was not comfortable doing that during mass so we just had a quick peek
Prayer and refection. St Patrick's Cathedral has been going through a major renovation over the past few years. The results are amazing.
Place to pray. A beautiful church on 5th Ave that was recently renovated. Very convenient to office and midtown NYC shopping area & Rockefeller center
Simply beautiful. You don't have to be Catholic to be in awe of this church. The organ was astounding to see. There is much beauty and reverence here.

Impressive Architecture and History. What an absolutely gorgeous Church! We went to Mass on Sunday. If you want to hear, it's better to sit up front as we had difficulty hearing the priest. The architecture is amazing. Last year when we came, they were renovating, so it was wonderful to see what was completed.

impressive. This is a beautiful and impressive cathedral. It looks as though it would not be out of place in an old English country town. It is in sharp contrast to the modern skyscrapes that surround it.
Breathtaking. One of my favourite places we visited - the architecture is simply perfect and it is such a beautiful, peaceful place.
Beautiful inside. We walked by this while waiting for our NBC tour at 30 Rock. We were allowed inside and gazed at the beautiful statues and stained glass windows.

All cleaned and magnificent!. St. Patrick's Cathedral is often called "America's Parish Church" and for a good reason. It is a splendid example of neo-gothic architecture, and the recent renovation and cleaning has taken off years of auto fumes and shows here true beauty. Several popes have visited here and Cardinal Dolan still celebrates Mass here every day. The archbishops of New York are all buried beneath the high altar. It is an active church and a place for prayer, worship, and yes, sightseeing.

Breathtaking. If you are a fan of architecture and history, this beautiful cathedral is worth your time. It's free to enter and walk through, and it doesn't seem to be much to light a candle to the saint of your choice. I am not a catholic, but I truly appreciated that we were able to go in and see this beautiful building. Their is an air of reverence in the building, so I wouldn't take very young children to this. But my husband and I loved it.

Impressive Architecture in the Heart of Manhattan. I am not an overly religious person, but everyone visiting New York should visit this place. It is nearby Rockefeller Center. Its architecture is impressive. There is also a lot of peace and quiet inside. If you have time, go for a Sunday mass. They don't make buildings like this anymore.
Beautiful Renovation. Attended a mass at the church on Sunday and was impressed by the beauty of the church. After undergoing a full renovation, the church looks great.

Beautiful cathedral. We happened to be visiting during a Sunday mass but were still allowed to see most of the building. If this happens to you, please be respectful of the worshipers and be quiet (there were a few visitors who were not so polite and received glares or were even asked to lower their voices by a docent). The architecture is amazing and the cool interior was a welcome break from the heat.
Must see!. When you're around, just hop in. This is one of the most beautiful churches/cathedrals in the neighborhood.

Simply heavenly! A must visit!!. My first visit here was on Dec. 14, 2012 - the day of the Sandy Hook Elementary shooting. We wondered why the cathedral was packed at 5:00 p.m. A woman turned to me and said: "Have you seen the news?" and then she explained. There were thousands of people praying during that short visit. It was a powerful experience. Our second visit was in April 2016. I decided to take my mom with me as we stayed nearby at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel. Words cannot describe the beauty of this American Gothic Revival church that opened in 1879. Please visit and donate money for the restoration of this gorgeous cathedral.

History made. So glad we stooped here it was amazing to see. Beauty and art with religion and controversial surroundings. Amazing to be here and what an honour that we witnessed an event taking palace , hard to see what it was because we didn't take part in it, but we stood in the back. A memory I'll never forget. My son remembers it well too!
Very nice . An amazing site. I am not an overly religious guy but you have to stop and see this historic place. Places like this will never be built again.

Historic beautiful Cathedral that is a must see !!!. Amazing, majestic and just beautiful. This New York landmark is a must see when in NY. It is vast and it can be crowded but it is worth it. Sunday masses would be great to experience if you have some time.

Beautiful place to visit. They just finished restoration of this building. There is a lot of history to learn about it's history and the clergy buried there. Unfortunately, there were way too many people taking selfies and teens sitting on the backs of pews and the front banisters. I am not extremely religious but I do have enough sense to be respectful of where I am. The staff needs to speak up more and not be afraid of the tourists.
Breathtaking.. A gorgeous cathedral and a lovely mass. My only objection were the number of people on their cell phones during the church service.

Indescribable and Unbelievable . St. Patrick's Cathedral, very close to Rockerfeller Center, is amazing! The Archdiocese of New York makes this his home! So much history with visits from the Pope. Burials and ceremonies for Yankee greats, Andy Warhol, Robert Kennedy, Vince Lombardi, Ed Sullivan etc. wow! The art and music were stupefying! Such beauty everywhere, both seen and heard. The stained glass has the wow factor and the marble along with gold brings a view of wonder as well. The organs are enormous and there are so many reasons to be grateful.This place is one of the great views into Catholicism. St. Patrick's Cathedral brings forth an attitude of gratitude! So thankful to see this Cathedral and so thankful for life! Enjoy St. Patrick's Cathedral!
Beautiful. Nestled amongst the skyscrapers, this building is absolutely beautiful, you literally cannot take your eyes off it

Could be in Europe. St. Patrick's is the most amazing cathedral I have seen in the US. While "only" 140 years old...it easily competes with the many of the better know European cathedrals built centuries earlier.
Quick duck in and out. This is a very beautiful cathedral in the heart of Manhattan. My kids have never been to Europe or seen a full-scale cathedral before, so we stopped in for a very brief visit.

beauty to behold. We are not catholic, but were in the area and I wanted to see it. I had a freind who had been proposed to here after mass and I wanted to remember. It is beautiful and tour by donation. The stained glass is amazing and on a hot summer afternoon it was a nice cool place to sit and rest for a moment.
True gem!. Beautiful cathedral! Highly recommended to visit if you are closed by the Rockfeller Center. Loved the architecture.

Stunning Site with superb sights!. Just being outside of this cathedral was intoxicating. The inside was like stepping into another time! What a beautiful spot with amazing architecture, sure to take anyone's breath away.
Spectacular!!. The refurbished Cathedral is absolutely beautiful!! Walking around Cathedral and looking at sculptures and stained glass is a must do in NYC.
AMAZING. We were told St Patrick's was worth a visit and we were not disappointed. What a beautiful Cathedral. Well worth a visit.
Must see. Stunning cathedral in the heart of the city magnificent architecture and the stained glass windows are awesome stumbled on this building by chance, so glad we did
A beautiful church. A truly beautiful church & well worth visiting. We attended a mass there and it was a very moving experience.

Beautiful restoration. I have been coming here since I've been a kid and now they have just completed the renovation. This is one of the prettiest cathedrals that you could possibly see in the United States. There was quite a few people at the entrance but the line moves quickly and the staff was well-prepared. They even have a little gift shop inside that you can buy religious trinkets. Every time I come to the city I always make this stop in my travels. Try it out I'm sure you will be glad you did.
Awe inspiring beauty. I am not Cathjolic and not a church goer...but there is a presence there that is not from this world. The stone work is unreal and rivals anything in the world
Worth a visit !. This is a very large and beautiful Cathederal, so much to see. Sign of the times ....an armed police officer in attendance.

Beautiful Cathedral. We really enjoyed our time in the cathedral. It was stunning and reverent. There was a blend of tourists and some in prayer and doing personal devotions. I'm glad we went in, one of my favorite things I saw in NYC.

Breathtaking.... Though not Catholic, I jokingly told my wife that I would give up my religion and join the Catholic Church if I lived in NYC. The place is simply stunning in its grandeur. The hand done wood filigree work is stunning and the attention to detail the builder and architect put into this place are thought defying. The church seems to go on and on and is cavernous inside. The confessional booths were very cool and the homage they pay to the many saints is educational. This easily compares to any church in Euripe. My one complaint is that they have really commercialized it with machines to purchase a souveni coin. The guests to the Cathedral should also be required to not make so much noise, as this is a place of worship and not an opportunity for a photo op. I felt bad for the people who were actually there to worship.
Beautiful. This really was an unexpected joy right in the centre of Manhattan. It's beautiful and provides a bit of tranquility amid the noise and the crowds.
Absolutely beautiful!!!. If you visit NYC definitely take the time to visit this breathtaking Catherdral I'm so glad that we did.

Notre Dame Rival. We walked in through a side door from Saks next door and surpassed all the security and bag checks, which was a bit strange, but once inside you get blown away by soaring ceilings, the bright lights, beautiful glass windows and alcoves with great statues on display. Sit in the pews a little to enjoy the peace and quiet before getting back into the action of Rockefeller center, UniQlo and 5th Avenue.

Beautiful. I've walked past this church many times when visiting NYC but never took the time to go inside until this past Wed. It's worth the time to go inside. Beautiful stained glass. Architecture similar to what you might see in Europe (although smaller and newer).

Awe-inspiring architecture. The last time I was in NYC there was still scaffolding around this cathedral, so to have a moment to stop in and see all of the work they had done was great. Ornate details everywhere and just a nice relaxing place to stop in and see amid the hustle and bustle. I am not a catholic myself, but I can still appreciate the wonderful job they've done restoring/maintaining this house of worship.

Beautiful and historic. I really enjoy churches to seeing St. Patrick's Cathedral was definitely on my list. The altars, stained glass, pews, and architecture are amazing and I think it is definitely worth visiting if you are in the area.

Absolutely gorgeous but so peaceful. They are still working on a small portion of this but it is absolutely amazingly beautiful. I took so many pictures, it wasn't even funny. I am thankful they have it open to the public. Definitely worth the trip.

A classic in NY, but. You may be disappointed, it's not as big as you see it in the movies, it has a lovely decoration, but nothing special, there are many churches in the world more interesting than this one.

One of the most peaceful places in NYC!. I love St. Pats'! It is a stunning church that wraps you in serene peace. Attend a Sunday mass and then go to brunch across the street at Rockefeller Center. It is the perfect way to spend a Sunday morning.

NYC trip. Last time we were in NYC the cathedral was rapped in scoffolding as they we working on it. Went inside this time it is wonderful inside and out if here are want to see great architecture it's a must see

Beautiful building. We came across this by accident as its sandwiched between large modern buildings on either side. But inside the carvings, statues and glass windows are beautiful. It does get very busy but you can also just sit and pray or contemplate as many visitors did.

Simply beautiful. The cathedral is stunning, if you can take in a service you should.
For any film lovers this was the church from 'Miracle on 34th Street - Christmas eve'

Beautiful cathedral. We took a walk in the rain to see this beautiful cathedral. We were not disappointed. They were celebrating mass so stayed to take part. They are doing some renovating but it was still accessible.
Amazing architecture. Such a beautiful church. Another tourist site but it was on our list to see in NYC and worth it - we have great pictures.
Beautiful Church!. Saint Patrick's Cathedral is beautiful. I did find it strange to be walking around the Cathedral while mass was being said. It is well worth the visit.

It is a good stop by. We attended mass and it was very strange to have tourist walking around while mass is session. They interested visitors did not walk directly to the altar but were noticeable from our seats. The church raises most if not all their funds through donation.
Beautiful. Take 15 min and walk inside this amazing cathedral. It's free to walk in and just be amazed. It's very calming and spiritual break from hectic sightseeing.
Quiet space in a busy city. I love St. Patricks. I always try to visit when I am in NYC. It's a beautiful cathedral and well worth a visit.

Great gothic architecture. We were walking up Madison Avenue and found this gorgeous cathedral.
Not what you would really expect to find in the middle of New York but was nice to see. We were en-route to someplace else so did not have time to go in.

U.S.'s Regal Cathedral. The landmark is in the final stages of a beautiful restoration. This is, probably, the best known church in America. Let me point out a little known point of interest and a very old Roman Catholic tradition. upon entering through the massive doors on Fifth Avenue, past the vestibule, go to the right and up the side aisle towards the main altar. Pass the altar, don't worry, it's perfectly ok to do so. When you're behind the main altar, in front of the entrance to the crypts, look straight up and you'll seen, hanging from the ceiling the ecclesiastical hats (that's the fanciest word I know for them) of all the former/deceased Cardinals who headed the Archdiocese of NY. Take in all the sites of this marvelous place of worship. Enjoy!

Beautiful Church. This is a Catholic church. The only difference is that it's also a tourist attraction - that means many, many people walking around snapping pictures, videos, selfies, posing in front of sacred statues, and chatting away like they're on the streets.It's a shame that this supposedly sacred building is also a place for thoughtless people to tour.
Gorgeous!. The church is HUGE and BEAUTIFUL... If you could stay for mass, the wind organ they have is amazing.

Nice cathedral. There are not many cathedrals in America that approach the size and grandeur of those in Europe. With that fact in mind, St. Patrick's, a Gothic-style cathedral, is among the most impressive cathedrals in America. It is large and it is light, with soaring vaults, and is a good place to attend mass, as they have many weekend services there. Of course if you aren't there to attend the service, you have to wait until it's over to tour the church.

12:30 pm Mass. We walked in just in time for mass. It's a huge place don't forget to walk all around the church even behind the altar. They have 2 gift shops one in the church the other across the street. Get directions I got lost. So many people some are rude and let their children run around this is a place of prayer.

Impressive piece of Arcetticture. Take an hour to and enjoy a famous NYC landmark, easy to fined near the Rockefeller Center. beautiful expansive interior, amazing arches and stain glass windows. Large crowds at times but very spacious

Beautiful Cathedral. This is a must if in New York City, regardless of your religious affiliation. The architecture is stunning and the building is as massive as it is breathtaking. It may not possess the same level of history as some of Europe's grand cathedral yet it is still absolutely worth a visit.

Breathtaking. I have never seen a church this large. It is beautiful both inside and out. Not really a religious person, but a visit here lets you think that there is a higher power. One can light candles and pray. The architecture and stained glass is magnificent. By all means a visit here will stick in your mind

Beautiful Cathedral. Construction is underway in parts of the chapel but this does not distract from how beautiful this church is. Tours are offered, we did not participate in one due to time constraints. In on area a wedding was taking place, in another area some were participating in confession, some touring, some praying, some visiting the gift shop and all in all each was not impacted by the other activities. There is a quietness in this beautiful church.

GORGEOUS!!. Absolutely GORGEOUS! The clouds opened up and we were caught in the middle of a rain shower, but the cathedral was open and hundreds went in for refuge. We were blown away by the masterpiece inside.

Well worth going!. St Patrick's cathedral is very beautiful and well worth a visit, it's lovely to pop in in the evening and see all the candles, the restoration work is on going but actually interesting to see!

Most beautiful church in New York City. This is the spot. The Archbishop's seat in New York for the Catholic Church. Visited by almost every pope and president. Home to seemingly every high profile funeral in NYC and ground zero for every parade that traverses up Fifth Avenue. Saint Patricks was built in 1840. It is stunning. High vaulted ceilings. Beautiful pews. Plenty of places to light a candle and say a prayer. It is an active church - filled with parishioners, tourists, clergy, security guards and plenty of folks just looking for a quiet place to sit. The church steps remain one of the best places in all of NYC to eat a brown bag lunch. Finer people watching you will never find. This is the epi-center of NYC tourism, across the street from Rock Center, the Today Show, Saks, the Tree, 10 blocks south of Central Park and it is all free. Although any contribution you make goes to good use.No trip to NYC is complete without a visit to Saint Pats.

Breathtaking Makeover. I am a cradle Catholic who has been coming to St. Patrick's Cathedral for more than 50 years. I can remember my mother taking me there back in the early '50s and being awestruck by the sheer size of this beautiful cathedral. However, this is the first time I saw the makeover - and it is stunning. I know that the renovation cost was over the top - and I'm not totally sure the expense was justified - but the end result is an absolutely beautiful house of worship. From the new lighting to the polished floors - nothing was left undone. I can remember the inside being gray and dusty - and now everything is a creamy white. When I first walked in the building on July 28 I was simply amazed at the transformation. It is certainly worth a visit!

Smells like a Church should smell. Grandparents used to take me to Mass as a child and I was always so impressed at the magnitude of this church. High ceilings, stained glass, priest speaks from a podium, the numerous lines for Communion... Even if you don't attend a Mass (even if you're not Catholic), this is a tourist sight that should be checked out. Classic.

Humbling and beautiful. We were in a hurry and just spent about 15 minutes in the cathedral, but it was quiet, serene,and humbling to be in such a magnificent cathedral in the United States.The stain glass windows, architecture, size, and location made this a unique experience. Wish we could have spent a bit longer time there.
Breathtaking. Don't miss seeing this breathtaking cathedral right on 5th Avenue. Located across the street from 30 Rock it is a true sight. Make sure to go in and see the amazing architecture!
St Patricks never disappoints.... We visited on Tuesday. The scaffolding was down from our last visit - and the church was beautiful. We prayed, lit candles, and took in the atmosphere. Lovely....

Beautiful & Breathtaking. I have seen this cathedral on TV many times - but I was not prepared for how beautiful it was to see it in person. Walking into the sanctuary took my breath away. It is so large and peaceful. After a brief security check, visitors are allowed to walk down the center aisle and around the perimeter. There were many that were sitting in the pews praying or just basking in the beauty of this building. Be sure to take a peek at the awesome pipe organ at in the rear balcony.

Visiting churches with future Daughter in law. St Patrick's is a very pretty church with a lot of stone work. They have a large pipe organ but you have to call for the times it is in use. Being a Roman Catholic church, they do have a lot of Statues all over the place and little to no Icons. They do offer paid tours.

So Beautiful. We just happened to be on the street where it is located and went in. We were so glad we did, it is an amazing cathedral like many we have seen in Europe. The stained glass windows and ceiling are wonderful, well worth going to
Breath taking. Such a beautiful cathedral. People inside were so respectful of their surroundings. Quiet and peaceful. Sat for awhile just to take it in. Beautiful.

perhaps our favorite site in NYC. we really enjoyed our time at St Pat's, please remember it is a church and not a tourist destination, it provides a sense of calm in the middle of all the bustle that is New York. We felt that it energized our day and would recommend finding some time to just soak in the calm.

Famous from all the movies shot there. Disabled friendly.. We visited on a beautiful sunny day and the outside was just gleaming. There was a mass going on inside but tourists were very welcome to visit and the atmosphere was very calming. A pleasant interlude from the madness of 5th Avenue shopping. There is an entrance ramp for wheelchairs and prams in the side street to the left of the entrance. Not very well signed.
Pretty. Very pretty architecture! Definitely should take a quick stop to check it out if you like architecture.
Beautiful Cathedral. Gorgeous architecture and definitely worth a see (inside and out). It's free, and very easy to walk through. There's also, embarrassingly, a gift shop in this church.

Parker says, "America's cathedral, all cleaned up nicely.". Regardless of your religious affiliation (or lack of affiliation), this is "America's Cathedral". The inside has been entirely redone and cleaned up and it is spectacular, from the vaulted ceiling to the canopied high altar to the numerous side chapels and intricate stained glass windows. Size-wise, it's large but doesn't stack up to many of the European cathedrals, but hey, who cares. Unfortunately, it's usually mobbed with tourists milling about, taking pictures and talking away. It's like visiting Grand Central Terminal with candles and statues!!!! But don't let that keep you away from this famous New York City icon.
Mesmerizing !!!!. You must stand in awe when you are looking at this architecture !!!!! To know it was built so long ago and yet so amazing...wow..stop and see it!

Always the scaffolding!. I've been here four or five times over the past few years, and there is always SOME sort of renovation work going on. It's a beautiful, modern cathedral and blindingly "white" inside, compared to the cathedrals of Europe. However, it's gorgeous and some of the artwork is outstanding.Go in the daytime to see the stained glass, and go back at night to get the feel of just the interior space. Oddly - they now have signs on the altar candle boxes saying "TWO DOLLARS" for the little candles you can light. (not sure what they're called - not catholic).

Stunning inside and out. This building is absolutely stunning from the outside, and inside it's beautiful as well.. So peaceful inside, it's easy to forget you are on one of the busiest and most manic shopping avenues in the world.A must visit when on 5th.

Finest Gothic building in the Western Hemisphere,. Probably the most famous church in America.It was renovated and is sparkling on 5th Avenue in New York City.If you visit New York City the Cathedral is a place to go.

Beautiful building. Have seen this at various stages - previous to this visit they were doing a lot of work to the ceiling etc. Beautiful building but find all the collection/donation points slightly off putting, too many, the emphasis should be on prayer/reflection. Worth a visit.
Nice Church. Went there for Sunday mass. Nice church. Choir was average. Very pack. if you want peace and quiet to pray, go to the end past the altar. Candles are a bit expensive.

Gorgeous, peaceful... This was my second trip to St. Patrick's Cathedral. The first was in 2003 during a conference. It is such a beautiful place. I was able to spend some time in prayer and then went to the gift shop to get rosaries for my mom and aunt. They have mass every hour (just about). I loved all the little chapels and the Holy Doors. I highly recommend going to St. Patrick's Cathedral!

Loved the calm serenity this catheral offered on 5th ave, so so beautiful. Worth a visit no matter what faith you have.. You can't begin to describe how peculiar the cathedral looks in 5 th Ave, so out of place and yet perfect for anyone who would like time out of city life to ground themselves. A lovely place to stop and show children too, very peaceful and stunning architecture,

A nice place to visit. This is a very busy church but worth a look. It was nice to just sit and think for a while. A place to light a candle. A few nice photos were taken. You do get a bag search upon entry

Amazing inside and out. This is a must. Absolutely beautiful architecture. It's very calm and peaceful inside, even though the crowd is split between tourists and those actually in prayer. They are very welcoming, although bag inspections and passive solicitations remind you of the times in which we live. Whether or not one is Catholic, it's tough not to be impressed with everything about St. Patrick's. Its reverent aura is undeniable.

Another must see. Went to see St Patricks Cathedral. We arrived on a Friday around noon. So mass was in progress. They are very accommodating and allow you to walk around and to take pictures. The only thing I didn't appreciate is the security. They didn't speak clear english and made the security examination of bags and liquids very confusing. Basically you can bring in water but not colored liquids such as soda. There were no trash cans to throw out my soda, and so I had to leave and find a trash can on the street.

Very Large. Our hotel overlooked the Cathedral and we had to go have a look as they were doing lots of work landscaping the perimeter/garden with very large trees and shrubs, most impressive display.Inside was greeted by a "Church man" (sorry) and he was most proud of the building. It was very busy inside and well worth 15/20 minutes taking in the magnificent structure (i'm not religious but am impressed by all the buildings various religion have built over the years).
Beautiful Cathedral. Visited on a Sunday during 4 pm Mass (Spanish speaking). It is a breathtaking experience. You can light a candle as you enter.

St. Patrick's is Beautiful!!!. This was our 2nd visit to this New York City icon. Very nice experience. We did not stay Long because it was busy. Worth the trip just to stop in and soak in the whole experince of the Cathedral.

More like a museum than a Church. Lovely souvenir shop and stunning building and features- loved the service besides the choir of the day but was a bit weirded out with photos being taken whilst I was praying. Beautiful place though.

Beautiful and Peaceful!. This cathedral is for anyone that appreciates art, architecture, or Christianity. I was mesmerized by all the individual chapels dedicated to the saints. It was truly stunning!

A must for the faithful and a must for everyone else. I visited St Patrick's with my husband it's unbelievable how amazing this cathedral is. I went back to attend a Sunday mass and the service was inspirational, the only off putting thing was being watched by lots of tourists, but I would 100% return. Irrespective of religious beliefs, definitely go and see it even just for the architecture!
Beautiful. The architecture alone makes this beautiful cathedral worth the trip. Absolutely beautiful. Add this to your list of things not to miss.

holy. We stopped by St. Patrick's Cathedral while exploring the Rockefeller area. I wasn't expecting much-- maybe a few people in prayer, some pretty stained glass windows. Wow, were my expectations off.First off, there was some kind of mass going on when we entered. (Is that what it's called? I'm not Catholic; pardon my ignorance.) There was a decent amount of people in attendance in the pews, as well as a handful of tourists who bypassed the rope lines in the back and were standing near the congregation snapping selfies with their "narcissticks". (Sidenote: is that even allowed? SHOULD it even be allowed? Like I said, I'm not well-versed with the culture of Catholicism, and I realize it varies wildly from traditional to more modern institutions, but still. That seemed rather disrespectful to me. I get the cathedral's gorgeous-- which I'll get to later-- but Snapchatting in the middle of a service crosses the line... right? I'd never do that in a mosque. Honestly made me sad to see.)Loud, billowy organ music played, and the people in the pews sang. Great acoustics, may I comment. And great architecture. The beautiful layered arches were so exquisite and so detailed, and the stained glass windows were fractured with color and light. I could only stand in wonder for many minutes, scanning my eyes across the ceiling and past the walls. There's so much to see, and there's something so sacred about it (deterred slightly by the few tourists who've decided to leave their manners at home). Paired with that haunting organ and the voices of the congregation, I couldn't help but shed a few tears at the utter beauty. (You heard me right. I cried.)So that's the story. Go and visit St. Patrick's Cathedral. Revel in it all.

Looks good. Last time I was here was before the renovation and it looks like a completely different building. This is more of a European type church experience with the tourists snapping photos and wandering around, looking lost during mass.
Beautiful. Very nice cathedral in the middle of busy New York. I loved how you could just walk in right from the side of the road.

Awesome & Beautiful. I really enjoyed visiting this church. I'm not a Catholic, but it was worth the time and effort. We took the tour and were able to climb spiraling stairs that are in one of the outside buttresses and see the attic. While this may seem to some folks as "no big deal" ... it was an awesome experience to be able to get some views and insight on the building. It was rather hot when we toured, but we had a very good tour guide and she did a great job keeping us moving and as cool as possible. She also provided us with some very useful knowledge about the facility that many won't ever know because they don't take the tour.

A lovely renovation. The outside of St. Patrick's has been cleaned to where the very gray stone is now almost white. Inside everything has been cleaned and refreshed. The church is beautiful and impressive now that it has undergone this renovation, parts of which are still underway. The church is usually filled with both worshipers and tourists. Masses still go on.

A holy shrine for Roman Catholics in New York City!. The history of this neo-gothic Roman Catholic cathedral goes as far back as 1810 and its cornerstone was laid in 1858. In 1879 it was finally dedicated and "St. Patrick's Cathedral" keeps inspiring, since then, Catholics from all over the world. At its masses, over 3.000 persons can be easily seated. Sunday masses are unmissable, specially the 12:00PM, with lovely and competent music. "St. Patrick's Cathedral" is located on Fifth Avenue, directly across the street from Rockfeller Center, what makes possible to combine visits to these two accomplished New York landmarks. Dress properly, show respect and come in. Be silent, light a candle, say a prayer, and let peace enlighten your heart and soul. Better days will certainly come. Enjoy!
A beautiful Cathedral. This Cathedral is very special. It's an amazing place to visit no matter what religion you are. Men, hats off please.

Towering extravagant architecture.. For its magnanimous size and detailed arches, the interior of the church is wanting. The colors are monotonous and the size and height alone are the only thing that is impressive.

A Wonder. Love this place and it is always listed on my trips to NYC.I have lit hundreds of candles over the years and hope to light many more..I do not like the visitors that forget that this is a place of worship and talk loudly or are rude and pushy.

The most beautiful Cathedral in NYC. One of my favourite places in NYC. I'm devoted of St. Patricks, so here I can pray and thank. Also, I think it's a good tour even if you're not Roman Catholic, because the architecture here it's simply amazing. It's worth to know.

Gorgeous church!. The church and the stained glass was so beautiful! It was truly amazing. We only stopped in quickly and walked around for about 15 minutes in the afternoon because there was no tour or mass. If you're really interested in St. Patricks, I would suggest that you find a mass time because it's a lovely church. Also, I would suggest seeing Trinity Church.
Beautiful Church. Even if you are not Catholic, we are, this is a truly beautiful church to visit. Located in Time Square near shopping and restaurants. The stain glass is amazing.

Beautiful. Beautiful to walk through. The people there were very friendly. I am glad we didn't miss seeing this beautiful place. I loved the stained glass. People are permitted to walk through and take photos, light a candle (they have boxes for a few dollars to pay for the candles if you choose to donate). Even though this is a church, there is no "dress code" or anything like that. All are welcome.
Beautiful!. I am not Catholic, but this is an amazing place to visit regardless. It is a beautiful site that can be appreciated by all.
Great Cathedral. Visited the cathedral on a Saturday, and there was a wedding. THe cathedral itself is awesome and large.

A beautiful old church. This church is open to the public and is a really lovely old church. It was nice to wander round and appreciate its beauty. It is a busy place but it didn't feel crowded. It was very hot outside but cool inside the church. You can pay to light a candle and they do have security who check bags.
Nice monumental place. Very Nice monumental place to visit with spectacular architecture... The stained glass windows are remarkable to see. It is good that we are free to take photos....

Silence in the midst of Noise. Even though located in the crowded place, once you enter the Cathedral you would be shrouded in silence.
Especially for you who adore The Virgin Mary, the place is so peaceful.
Beautiful site. It's very convenient since the masses are every half hour. If you want privacy go to St. Guadalupe shrine there are several pews there if you want to pray privately

Beautiful Cathedral. St. Patrick's is one of the most beautiful churches in the world. We attended Saturday afternoon Mass. It is a strange experience being at Mass with tourists walking all around and taking photos, but the New Yorkers take it all in stride. There was some construction/renovation going on during our visit which just added to the craziness. Well worth the time to stop in!

An emotional visit. This place literally took my breath away, incredibly beautiful, you want to stay as long as possible. It brought me to tears knowing I was someplace my Grandma would have love to see. A definite visit!
Beautiful, peaceful, Christian existence. Where JFK was buried in 1963. Christmas time at St Patrick's is glorious-kind people , warm reception whether you are Catholic or not

St. Patrick's - Quiet and Reflective on Fifth. Just Up Fifth Avenue, Saint Patrick’s Cathedral!Spires Tower Over Fifth Touching the Sky.Take a Moment. Pull Open the Bronze Doors and Step Inside…Speak in Hushed Tones.Beautiful.On Your Way Out, Touch the Cheek of Saint Kateri Tekakwitha…the First Native American Saint.Wave to the Greek Titan Atlas holding up the Heavens across the Street. A Quiet Reflective Oasis on Fifth. Stop in.

So Accessible. I was amazed that there was an opportunity to respectfully and quietly walk around the inside perimeter of the entire Church and this was in the day during a Service. A marvel of architecture and spiritual commitment.
Beautiful architecture. This review is based on my belief since same faith as the denomination as the cathedral, simply beautiful.

Not impressed. The architecture was great. They sell prayer candles for $2. I don't think prayer should cost money. I would not return to this attraction especially if you have seen another cathedral.
Beautiful Church. This is a very beautiful church; ornate and decorative, It is in the middle of the city not far from Grand Central Terminal.

Iconic. A stunning look into one of the most iconic places of worship. Stop in to admire the architecture or be awed by the beauty of the church.
A must stop for Catholics and a great place to visit for all visitors.
Breathtaking!. Beautiful cathedral inside and out. They offer self-guided tours. Always a must-see when we visit NYC.

WONDERFUL. Since the Cathedral was 'cleaned' for the Pope's visit - it is really a Masterpiece and a MUST SEE when you are nearby - it is always Open and the inside is spectacular ! And, just think about when the Pope visited and the crowds that came to say 'Hello' to St Pats !

Beautiful. This cathedral is well worth a visit. It has been beautifully restored and a perfect place to spend some quiet time away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Nice place to sit and contemplate life!

Majestic cathedral Ala Rome. A stunningly beautiful cathedral that made us feel like we were back in Italy! A church that carries much history in the city and a peaceful reprieve from crowds, the heat, and tiring sightseeing. My daughter and I just talked and prayed in solace, after lighting candles for the victims in the Orlando terrorist attack the day before. We all need that spiritual reprieve in the face of our daily lives. Worth finding it and experiencing it's beauty!
vacation 2016. Beautiful cathedral. We attended mass on Sunday morning and then again on Tuesday for our wedding anniversary. It is a must see for everyone.
The scaffolding is down. You can see everything!. The scaffolding has been removed from the inside and most of the outside and you can see all the windows and altars.

Simply beautiful. I went to the Saint Patrick when the Pope Francis was there. I was able to get in only after he left. The cathedral is beautiful, antique arquitecture, very high ceilings. They sell commemorative coins close to the entrance in dollar machines. It's worth a visit regardless your religion.
Absoltuely Stunning. Goregours Church with spectacular architectural. The stained glass throughout the cathadral can not be captured in the lens of a camera. Stunning....

St. Patrick's Cathedral a Historical, Beautiful Part of New York City. I frequent St. Pat's 2 - 3 times each week since it's 2 blocks from my job. Its years-long facelift/refurbishing was finally completed about a year ago and inside & out it's beautiful. The sculptures and stained-glass windows are remarkable & inspiring. Any day of the week is fine to visit... just keep in mind that on Saturdays there are often weddings taking place and Sunday morning Mass is always packed (Cardinal Dolan, the current Archbishop of New York, is the celebrant). Also remember that while tourists are always welcome and are free to snap photos, St. Patrick's IS a sacred place of worship so in certain areas photo/videos are not permitted and respectful silence is expected.

Grand and welcoming to all no matter what your faith. A monument that is a part of New York's history, society, and civic fabric. The church is a landmark familiar to anyone who has ever watched a parade or a memorial of note.
Say a prayer!. Architecture is breathtaking, but remember that it is a Catholic church used for prayer and services. Be respectful and maybe just hit your knees and pray for world peace.
One of the most famous places in New York.. This place you have to visit, it's free and is in the 5 avenue across the street of the Rockefeller Center.

Stunning. Both the exterior and interior of this cathedral are very impressive, but don't make an extra trip to visit. If you are walking by or near it though, go out of your way to check it out. It will be worth your time.

Amid the city madness - such a peaceful, reverent spot.. In the midst of all the sightseeing, this was a good opportunity to stop and just enjoy the beauty and reverence of this building. I'm glad we visited.
Beautiful Cathedral in the heart of the city. This is a beautiful place just to go sit and pray or find peace. It has amazing character and I love that it is right off the beaten path!!
A Must See. Please go see. It is truly awe inspiring. The beauty and inspiration found within is amazing. It is worthy of you time and appreciation no matter what your religious affiliations.

Walid Abou Farhat. We visted in July. The Cathedral by itself is definitely worth the trip. Garden outside too. To vist you should pay a fee .We were lucky to have visted on a Sunday a bit before the Mass was Celebrated. Chorus was just fabulos. It is well located 10 minutes walking from everything Central.

Recent Spruce Up Looks Great!. So wonderful to see this landmark back to its original shine! A wonderfully cool and quiet place to catch your breath amidst the hustle, bustle and sound that is New YorkCity. Truly beautiful architecture and the windows are amazing. Nice to see that most tourists are respectful and reverent in this sacred space.

An inspirational jewel that shimmers after the renovations. Recent renovation and now all the scaffolding is down and the outside glistens white. The stain glass windows on a sunny day are uplifting and give a definite feeling of calm.
I didn't have time to stay for mass on this visit, but have in the past and recommend it highly.

St.Patrick's Cathedral the Venue for John F Kennedy's funeral & many 911 Victims also. A large Catholic Cathedral about a ten minute walk away from the Empire State Building. Quite impressive both in & out well worth a look

7am Mass. I can't think of a better way to start a visit to New York than having a stroll around the city at 6 AM and attending Mass at Saint Patrick's at 7 AM. Everything has been said in previous posts about the beauty of this cathedral and I agree with them all. In short a haven of tranquility in a city of never ending wonderful madness.
Absolutely stunning!. Beautiful church and so glad we stopped to visit. So much history and beauty. A must see if you're in the city!

NYC Landmark of faith welcoming all walks of life. The Cathedral has just undergone over a year long restoration and it is sensationally beautiful. I have been to many churches and places of worship all over the world and this stands as one of the finest in the world. You are immediately transcended into a spiritual timespace to be alone with yourself surrounded by faith, hope, beauty and a grand sense of belonging.
Beautiful. Every trip we make to New York, we attend mass at St. Patrick's Cathedral. The renovation is magnificent. It is truly a one of a kind experience.
Must See when in NYC. Found the place by accident walking around NYC with the family. Our family enjoyed the visit. Must see when in NY
Must See when in NYC. Found the place by accident walking around NYC with the family. Our family enjoyed the visit. Must see when in NY

Tranquil place in the beehive that is Manhattan. It is impossible to not be awed by the sheer size and craftsmanship of this architectural achievement. This is a beautiful, peaceful place for worship. I felt very safe, and very close to god.
One of the most important Cathedral in USA. When visiting New York City, take your time to visit this Cathedral. The architecture is very classic and the construction is amazing.
Truly inspiring. Last time I was here renovation wasn't done. Was really happy to see the cathedral in all its glory.
Beautiful. It is a beautiful cathedral, but not much in the way of educational or cultural programming. Would benefit from better planning.

I'm Jewish and this is awe inspiring. Now that the scaffolding is off, this is an amazing building. The interior is breathtaking and the detail to the facade is clean and crisp. Open to all, it's a must see for anyone who visits NYC

Toured St. Patrick's after mass. We toured the Cathedral after mass and enjoyed seeing the architecture and renovations. Visitors are able to sit in the pews and walk through the Cathedral and it a peaceful, lovely place to spend 20-30 minutes.

A gorgeous creation of man. St, Patrick's Cathedral is one of the monumental edifices in Manhattan. A beautiful design and an accomplished implementation. Located in the heart of midtown Manhattan, it is on your way, wherever you are heading. The soaring roof line, the beautiful stained glass, the outstanding sculptures and work of art are perfectly complemented by the superb acoustics and the light that brightens this place of worship.

Beautiful Renovation! Go to Mass here!. WE attended the Sunday 10:15 Mass with Cardinal Dolan. It was a mass to remember. Mayor DeBlasio was in attendance and gave a speech after the service. This was the weekend after the Dallas shootings. Very profound and unified message. The cathedral recently underwent an extensive renovation. There is still some going on in the back. The side chapels are amazing. There are chapels to various saints along with places to pray and light candles. The stained glass windows are stunning. The organ in the front is, well you just have to go and listen! Don't miss it here!

Wonderful Place to Worship!. We began our last day with 7:00 AM Mass in this lovely church. They have 7:00, 7:30 and 8:00 AM Masses each day. Several around lunch, also. Most of the restoration to the exterior and interior has been completed. It looks as I would have imagined it did when first built.
A piece of history in the midst of modernity. A beautiful gothic cathedral in the very heart of NYC. It almost feels like it doesnt totally fit the landscape yet it blends so beautifully.

A place of reverence and tranquility - take 10 mins to sit in this magnificent Cathedral. We spent time sitting and reflecting in this magnificent cathedral. And you quickly forget the hustle and bustle of a busy NY life outside. It's cool and quiet. Take the time to visit

Beautiful Church. I have always loved St. Pat's from the time I was little. It is a beautiful church and they have finally removed the scaffolding so you can see it in all its glory! I was a little taken aback on the interior that there were flat screen TV's mounted to every pillar. (???) Not exactly where I want the money I give the church to go, but whatever. Just strange!

Just beautiful!!!. This cathedral is a true example human engineering a couple hundred years ago. You walk in and just stand there in awe by the sheer size and delicate details of this building. It would have been amazing to hear the organ. Must be a magnificent sound.
Wow!. Our visit to St. Patrick's Cathedral left me impressed by its opulence. We enjoyed the 14 Stations of the Cross.

Beautiful cathedral, but not that special compared to churches in europe.. It is so clean outside it is almost like it was just built so it doesn't have as much character as churches in europe. The contrast between it and the buildings around it is quite stark.
Organ Concerts here are awesome!. Not just the stained glass windows and statuary, but attending anOrgan Concert is an awesome experience.

Stunningly beautiful!. I love cathedrals. I have been to many of the most famous cathedrals in Europe, because I enjoy the grandeur, the beauty of the architecture and art, and the spirituality. St. Patrick's is just as stunning. We strolled by the various chapels, admired the architectural features and the statues and other art, and especially enjoyed the stained glass. It is just so beautiful! The cathedral was well lit which seemed to open up the whole place and make it feel even more grand. We were also treated to some lovely organ music. I highly recommend even a quick stop here. It is right across Madison from Rockefeller Center and easy to work into your itinerary. It really is stunningly beautiful!

Memorable experience. I heard mass here one Sunday and I felt like crying. It's such a beautiful church and the choir did an amazing job during mass because it felt so holy like I really felt the presence of God. Everything was so organized and I really have no words for the beauty of the church. I HIGHLY suggest you hear mass here. You can check their website for mass details
Iconic Cathedral in the Heart of NYC. Certainly worth stopping in, this is such an historic cathedral in mid-town Manhattan. The exterior has recently been cleaned and looks magnificent.
Mass was beautiful. The Cathedral is absolutely beautiful full of the Holy Spirit. Although they are working on it, you can still go and enjoy it's beauty. You can also attend Mass there.

New Yorks equivalent of Emperors Palace in Thailand. This is the only place that came close to how I felt when I saw the Emperors Palace in Thailand.
Filled with a lot of statues of saints, cool, accessible, and FREE! !

Majestically stunning architecture!!!!. We visited this cathedral while on our way to Times Square. The cathedral is situated just opposite the Rockefeller centre. Apparently, the cathedral is a national landmark, New York icon and center of Catholicism in America. It was built in 1879 and the majestic architecture will just leave you in awe. There's no line to get in but there’s security to check bags. St. Patrick's Cathedral is open daily from 6.30am to 8.45pm. The gift shop inside is open 8.30am to 8.00pm.The cathedral is so huge and architecture alone is spectacular. All the details in every corner and crevices of the church are amazing. The alter, pipe organ, stained glass windows, statues, sanctuaries, and prayer stations are all worthy of finding peace or a memorable photo. You just feel good going in, kneeling for a prayer, or just lighting a candle.This is a must visit while in Manhattan.
Spectacular. We ran in to the cathedral as it started to rain. We were there for an our. Prayed and even had a chance to attend mass. Great architecture. Beutiful place.

Summer Visit. I cannot say enough about how I enjoy visiting St. Patricks's on every trip. I am a professional photographer and love walking in and taking in the history, the beauty and capturing images of beauty. My husband and I brought my sister-in-law for the first time and spent almost two hours in the cathedral. She is the wife of a Methodist minister and loved the history and the grandeur of the church. We will return, as always, to this building of beauty!

Beautiful cathedral!. St. Patrick's Cathedral is beautiful inside and out. My husband and I attended Sunday Mass and it was a great experience. Mass offered several times on Sundays and it was a brief walk from our hotel in Times Square. Even if you are not Catholic you should take a few minutes to visit and see the beautiful architecture and stained glass windows. Absolutely gorgeous space!
a grand building amongst new sky scrappers. a grand building amongst new sky scrappers, it was good for some photos from outside, we never visited inside
A must in NYC. It's a must visit when in NYC. It's our second time in NY and our second time visiting Saint Patrick's for mass. It's a wonderful experience in such a beautiful church.
Beautiful architecture!. The exterior was recently renovated. Gorgeous. Tours are available. Mass offered through out the day.
A landmark in New York City. Roman Catholic Cathedral located right across Rockefeller Center is a decorated Neo Gothic style cathedral

Stunning Cathedral!. The St. Patrick's Cathedral is a beautiful, beautiful, BEAUTIFUL Cathedral! The stained glass windows are intricately designed with religious depictions on them. Also, the 1,480 pipe Organ was absolutely amazing! Plus, while we were there, a wedding was in session, so it added to the grand feel. An excellent attraction worth seeing again and again!

Breathtaking Church. If you come to NYC, regardless of your religious, stop in and peak into St. Patrick's Cathedral. It is breathtaking. Everyone looks up at the massive artwork, ceiling, and all the magnificence this church is. Often there is mass going on, but you are allowed to stand in the back in awe of the place.
Peaceful NYC . St Patrick's was opposite the Rockafella Centre so called in for a break from the nonstop NYC traffic. Didn't have to pay to enter and had time to sit and enjoy the architecture.
Quiet visit.. Nice walk through the cathedral and very beautiful to view. A must stop when walking down 5th Ave.Also a nice stop to cool down during a hot July summer in NYC.

A calm escape. Beautiful architecture around the outside and the inside. If you celebrate mass it is a beautiful Sunday service also celebrated in Spanish and with or without music. Around the church are alters for different patron saints and candles to light for prayers. In the entrance there is a small store with holy items not commonly found in other places including rosary beads, crosses, and other artifacts.
Beautiful. This church is absolutely beautiful and the detail is breathtaking. In the hustle and bustle of the city, this is a nice, quiet place to retreat.

Must do- recommend mass on Sunday if you are Catholic. We went to mass on Sunday at St. Patrick's Cathedral. Was a great experience- not as jam packed as I would have expected (we got seats even 10 minutes late (!) for mass).They have TVs on every pillar so you can see the priest and altar from anywhere.And afterwards of course we had to go around the church and light some candles. A beautiful church, recently restored. Definitely worth at least a stop in even if you don't attend mass. No matter what Washington DC has to say, this is truly America's cathedral.

A piece of tranquility in NYC. Wow !! A stunning place to visit. It's incredibly quiet considering the hustle and mayhem outside. The architecture is incredible, the stained glass windows mesmerising. We just sat in one of the pews gazing up and down this magnificent Cathedral. Well worth a visit it's stunningly beautiful.

St. Patrick's. This cathedral stands right opposite the Rockefeller Center and is surrounded by the tall skyscrapers that New York is known for. But every now and then, nestled in between the modern glass and chrome buildings, one finds these quaint structures preserving a piece of the older days. The interior is lovely. The stained glass windows are beautiful and as the sun filters through them one can see little pools of colour on the floor or the pews. I only wish I could have heard the organ play but then I visited during the afternoon.
As good as European cathedrals. I personally love gothic buildings and St. Patricks has a lot of those elements so I really liked it.

Massive church is a must-see stop in NY.... From the outside you can tell this Gothic church is going to be something when you go inside...and it surely is. Pass through security and move out into the open area and you are compelled to just look up and take it all in.I happened to visit during mass and sat for a while, listening. It's so odd to have mass going on while people are touring the place, but nice that it's still an active church and not just some relic. Spent time going around, looking at some of the stained glass and statues. It will bend your mind to think of how difficult this place must have been to construct back in the day. Seems impossible.You can light a candle for someone for a $2 donation, which I did. Gift shop provides a postcard to let someone know you lit a candle for them if you want to spend the .50-odd cents and stamp to let them know.I was lucky to be able to hear the gigantic organ play - wow! It fills the space and is so incredible! For that alone I'd suggest you visit during a service if you can - it was the highlight!The reason I gave this only 4 stars is no fault of the attraction - they are currently doing work on it and there is ample noise during visiting hours. I had to try and soak everything in while listening to the saws, hammers, and at the end, a jackhammer - which was brutal in that space. Even so, it was a great visit. Would still go, just be ready for the additional noise.
Not a church person but. I really enjoyed my time looking around here , quite an old building for the USA, some of the architecture is great

Lovely Church in crowded NYC. This is a lovely Church and pretty huge. Despite the number of tourists, there are still places you can sit and pray in quiet. My only suggestion to the Parish security would be to ask women to cover their heads in reverence and ask gentlemen to remove hats.

GLORIOUS. Visited in March 2015. Very beautiful. Stained glass windows absolutely amazing. Services were held while we were visiting. They high ceiling and the beautiful organ makes it sound like heaven inside. A must see when in NY ciry

Serenity and beauty. On a girls trip to NYC we visited this beautiful church. You certainly don't need to be Catholic to appreciate the beauty and serenity of this church. I have seen many cathedrals in Europe but the stained glass in this church rivals any of them.

Beautiful Sunday mass.. We weare attending the Sunday mass on July 3rd. The service was beautiful and music spectacular. Excellent place to pray and reflect not only for Catholics but everyone. A must to see place.
Nice. This is a nice place to see but is not really a destination per se. You can stop by on day of shopping or browsing nearby.

Mass in a Beautiful Church. We attended Noon mass on Sunday in July. It was very crowded and be prepared to have your bags inspected by security. There are ushers who help you find a seat if need be. The readings were easy to hear, but the Gospel and Homily were very hard to hear (turn up the Priest's microphone!!). Communion went quickly (they split the church up into sections for several priests to administer communion) and the closing hymn on Independence Day weekend was God Bless America!
Beautiful after renovations. St Pat's is looking great after it's renovation. It's close to many sites in NYC and worth a look, maybe even a service if you have time.
Beautiful!. Beautiful cathedral that is worth a stop, even if you're not Catholic. Beauty surrounds you everywhere you turn.

great new look. I had not been back since restoration was completed it sparkles inside and out and your visit can be long or short located one block from american girl store so something for all ages IT is a treasure for art lovers religious belieVERS. STOP BYFOR A FEW QUIET MOMENTS YOU WILL BE GLAD YOU DIDvers or even a quiet cool place to contemplate

Beautiful monumental building. For a small fee you can purchase "your own" candle, light it, put at the entrance and inside the cathedral and to leave here in the special rack your own little spiritual imprint.
Impressive architecture. Finally on my second visit to new york i was able to see the beauty of St. Patrick's Cathedral. I was so impressed of St. Patrick's Cathedral Architecture .

Even more beautiful after renovation. St Patrick's Carhedral has so much history. People flock there from all over the world, it's beauty is not easily described in words. Once you walk in, you can feel you have entered a sacred place. Behind the altar you can see the entrance to the crypt where some of the former cardinals are buried. The entire cathedral had been restored beautifully. It is on my must go list every year!

I'm not catholic; it was pretty. This was a stop on our tour to NYC, unfortunately I don't think it was necessary for EVERYONE to go to. Yes it is pretty but I'm not catholic, so there wasn't much meaning for me. Lots of idols/saints and candles to pay for to light. No bathroom, its across the street.
Spectacular. This cathedral is well worth a visit it is spectacular inside and out.You can spend a couple of hours just walking around it and admiring its enormity
Moving. Our visit was very moving-has to be the most beautiful church I have ever seen. Able to light candles for loved ones.

Most Beautiful Church. St. Patrick's Cathedral is such a beautiful church. The architecture and stained glass are sights to behold. I have seen it several times from the outside, but never ventured inside. I'm glad that I did!

Cathedral the Irish built. Where ever the Irish went in their exile, they took their religion with them. St Patrick's Cathedral is in Midtown on Manhattan Island is a monument to the Catholic faith that sustained them in a foreign land. St Patrick's is a fine building, worth a look even if you are not Irish.
Breathtaking. Breathtaking Cathedral in the middle of Manhattan. Take your time to stroll around the perimeter and see the various shrines.
Beautiful Cathedral!. We walked from the Rockefeller to St. Patrick's Cathedral. The cathedral was beautiful and peaceful. The strained glass windows were wonderful.

good. Well worth a look around, beautiful structure with some lovely stained glass. Bring a guide/find a free one online so you know some history. I didn't do that and pretty sure I'd have enjoyed it more if I knew more about what I was looking at.

Stunning architecture.... Right across the street from Rockefeller Plaza sits this gorgeous church. Take a moment to go inside to see the beautiful architecture and stained glass windows of times past. Beware, like everywhere else these days your bags will be searched and if you want to light a candle it will cost you. Worth a peek though!

So beautiful, iconic, but full of tourists - if you stay for the Mass it's more authentic. A bit crazy between Masses but a beautiful building and Mass was crowded but tourists were less disruptive then. Beautiful architecture, stained glass and a holy site.

Amazingly beautiful! . 2 years ago they were making renovations when we were here, this year..almost Done!! I just love this sanctuary! Go here everytime when in New York! This is The most beautiful cathedral I have Ever been to! It's a must see!
Say a quiet prayer for peace. This spectacular cathedral was recently renovated to its original splendor A place of worship and museum all in one
Stunning. So pleased we seen St Patrick's after the refurbishment and in all its glory, stunning both inside and out. Visited twice as I did not take it all in the first time
Trip to NYC. One of the great cathedrals in the US, Do not miss the opportunity to take in the architecture of this building.

Awesome Neo-Gothic Architectural Design. Visit this iconic attraction in New York. This experience is the closest you will come to visiting some of the most famous Cathedrals in the world. It took 13 years to build (1858-1878: interrupted for about 7 years for the American Civil War). The design is especially fascinating when you consider the architect James Renwick Jr. was a renowned self-taught individual.
just beautiful. well, it is there, 5th ave, throwing at your face that beautiful architecture, the only thing you can do it is go inside and take a look.

Gorgeous. Magnificent church with beautiful architecture and stained glass windows. We were chaperoning our daughter's High School Senior trip, and the kids enjoyed walking through this historical structure. Peaceful.
Beautiful Sunday Mass. Open to people of all faiths even during mass. Very welcoming, peaceful, and visually stunning. Mayor happened to attend our mass. Don't be afraid to sit down front.

Another iconic landmark. I love this church as I was married there.. Very interesting and be sure to walk all around and see all the tiny alters and also Our Lady's Chapel all the way in the rear. The stained glass windows are amazing also.

Church. This is an amazing church which creeps up on you as you walk along Madison. It's directly opposite the Rock so easy to vist both.
This has been renovated and the White masonry is like a be on within a busy location surrounded by tall buildings.
The history and design is exquisite, it is truly an inspiring space.
Love it St. Patricks's. My family and I always visit this Cathedral to pray and light up candles! It is gorgeous looking and well maintained

THE Church in NYC. Rivals most of the European cathedrals I have visited, and that's plenty having lived in Europe for 4 years. Come see this beauty while in NYC. No charge, but make a donation if so inclined.

Love St Pat's. A visit for Sunday Mass meant we were early onto 5 and got to see it with hardly any traffic. St Pat's itself looked beautiful as the sun was shining too. The Father was from Australia and even cracked a few jokes.
Very nice cathedral. We really enjoy our visit to the cathedral in our last trip to NY, it is an impressive place where you feel very good, we like to go every time we visit manhattan
Passing interest.. Interesting, but did not spend the time to view the entire cathedral as the experience was too commercialized and too noisy inside.

Magnificent. This Roman Catholic cathedral has wonderful architecture with soaring pillars, amazing ceilings, and beautiful stained glass windows. The staff are friendly and very welcoming and gave the impression that, even though you might be the 500th person they have spoken to that day, they are pleased to share their cathedral with you. There is a security bag check on the way in so this can cause a little delay if there are large numbers of people arriving at the same time.

Stunning Cathedral. One of my most favorite churches in NYC. Their renovation project has made St. Patrick's even more beautiful than before. Although the exterior and main entrance is crowded with visitors, the actual pews are not that full.
Magnificent. Visit on a Sunday, so worth it to hear the organ. The church left me in awe it was truly magnificent.
