A must see in New York!. I can't tell you how many times I have walked by St. Patrick's and not walked in, but have visited many a church in Europe. Well I finally walked in and WOW! It is beautiful the restoration is gorgeous -- go check it out!!
Revisited St. Patrick's. We had to come back to the cathedral since the renovations had been completed...absolutely gorgeous...we have been to mass on other trips to the city. A must see!

A lovely place to stop and reflect. This magnificent cathedral in the heart of NYC is certainly a pleasant place to visit. The glass is simply beautiful. I found it an ideal place to step away from the frenetic pace of the city to sit in quiet contemplation.

Very Insteresting!. One of if not the oldest active churches in the US. Came on a tour while the church was open and some of the congregation had gather.( Note: Tourists are allowed during service.) I love their security measures, if you bring a backpack, it will be searched before you can enter for services.)

Beautiful in the Heart of the City. Family visited for mass on Sunday - Beautiful Stained Glass - take time to visit the chapels located behind the alter. Quiet areas nice place to slow down after busy day.

A beautiful respite in a busy city . The cathedral was amazingly beautiful. We stopped an enjoyed the reverence of the church. We are not Catholic but it was still a wonderful place to meditate & pray.

Breathtaking. My son and I were just strolling the streets when we came upon this cathedral - it's absolutely stunning! You are able to enter and wander through and even take photo's. You can light a prayer candle and they ask for a $2 donation for that. There is one section in the back where no photo's are allowed. Otherwise you can wander through, sit and enjoy

Beautiful Restorations. Now that all of the scaffolding has come down from the inside of the cathedral, the view inside takes your breath away! The newly added lights and the natural light streaming in from the upper stained glass windows is stunning! Renovations are not fully complete - still work going on outside and on the verges, but definitely worth a stop on your mid-town walk, or after shopping at Saks. You may have to stop at confession for all of the money you spent there anyway.
Stunning . This place is beautiful, if you are in the area stop by. You will be suprised by the architecture on the inside! Truly a sight to see!
Amazing St. Patrick's cathedral. st. Patrick's cathedral was really the awesome cathedral that I've seen. The architectural beauty was breathtaking.

Beautiful architecture. This is a GEORGEOUS building. Because of its proximity to Rockefeller Center, there is a lot of foot traffic in and out of the building. If you are into photography, it is a very beautiful place to shoot. It is darker so bring a fast lens. If you shoot on a crop camera, you may need to bring a lens that goes to 10-11 mm. A standard DLSR should be ok with an 17-18 mm. If you want to avoid some of the foot traffic, you will want to come earlier in the day.

BEAUTIFUL. This was an amazing sanctuary to visit . . . you will sense both Spiritual and human peace. From the very presence of the host staff to the security throughout the facility, one will sense that respect and reverence is the goal.

Even though 4 St. Patrick's would fit into St. Peter's in Rome, it's still dramatic!. I grew up in NJ and have been going to St. Patrick's for years. I attended the wedding of friends in the Lady Chapel. I have watched the recent renovation that has resulted in the total refurbishment of the entire church, including all the side chapels. The majesty of the architecture and the grace and beauty of the chancel, the windows - oh, too much to describe. It is worth the walk through. Have respect when Mass is being conducted. And look for the cardinals' hats hanging from the ceiling. I forget the story behind that, but they are there.
You have to go if your Catholic. Mass is all week long, and yes, its open to the public and accessible. Beautiful experience for any Catholic.

Gorgeous. This church is very welcoming and beautiful to observe its majesty. Lighting a candle and saying a prayer is a special experience here ($2-3 donation). Beautiful stained glass windows line each side of the church and you are welcome to stay/sit in the wooden pews.

Worth a visit when exploring the city. If you looking for something free to do while exploring you should definitely make a pit stop here. Such a beautiful large church in the middle of a city that is a work of art.

Awe and then some!. It is an incredible building from the outside but inside is beyond words. You can go in and take it all in as long as you hit it when there is no event taking place. We were lucky and got there right before they started clearing it out for a wedding.
LuigiSLP. a majestic cathedral that rivals many old world European cathedrals. just go inside and sit quietly and appreciate the grandeur and craftsmanship
Lovely church. Beautiful architecture, so well maintained and creating a place of worship in the middle of a busy city. It is an easy stop on your many other tour stops in the area.
Beautiful. The minute you enter it will remind you of a lot of cathedrals in Europe. Magnificent stained glass windows. We were lucky and were present for a mass.
Beautiful. Beautiful cathedral. The art work inside is also very good. You need to go through security check to go inside the cathedral.

What beautiful architecture in the middle of the City. Worth walking in to see the beautiful church. We didn't do a formal tour - but walked around and looked at the stained glass, and all of the stations of the cross. Light a candle for your petition/prayer ($3).

Lovely Worship Service. We visited on a Sunday at 10:15 AM. The service was wonderful, and the architecture only added to the feeling that I was close to God. We are Baptists; when we went up for communion, we asked for a blessing. All denominations are welcome. What a warm, inviting church....to be so big. Security checked my bag before I went in, which was fine. I loved attending.
beautiful architecture. This church has a beautiful architecture ....we lit a candle too. Since it was a Sunday we could see it crowded and every one praying.
Beautiful. This is such a beautiful church, so glad we visited. Unbelievable detail inside. Great view of the church from on top of The Rock.

Pretty. We didn't make it for the Sunday Mass since we weren't sure if we were allowed to cross the street due to the parade that day. But when we visited the church on Tuesday, it was amazing. No wonder it is often shows in many movies.
Amazing...!!. We've been to Notre Dame and other special churches and cathedrals, and St. Patrick's stands on its own - absolutely gorgeous. A MUST see when you're in NYC!

Simply stunning. We visited just as the choir ended singing, it made the hairs on the back of my neck stand up. A truly beautiful church, we spent about 2 hours here just looking at every space, each of the small alters dedicated to different saints. Well worth a visit
Amazing Cathedral. This cathedral rivals the ones we visited in Europe. Amazing stained glass. Phenomenal architecture. A must see on 5th avenue.

St.Patrick a real cathedral in New York. As a Roman Catholic who has traveled extensively and seen many great cathedrals, this one is one of the best. The atmosphere is fitting for a place of worship and yet wonderful for a student of art or architecture. I appreciate the many opportunities to attend mass. The gift shop is very good. It is equal to the great cathedrals in Europe and surpasses them as a place of worship and solemnity.

Spectacular architecture!. Love this place. On a warm and busy day hide in the shade of this Cathedral. Take a seat and relax. There is enough history and splendor to occupy your attention for a few minutes.
Beautifu!. Love to visit St. Patrick's. It's undergone a renovation since the last time I was there. Lovely, lovely church.
Beautiful!. Stunning architecture! A must see for first time visitors. One of many churches to visit while in NYC.

St Patrick's Cathedral. The architecture is inspiring, the stained glass is beautiful and the grandeur of the place is breathtaking. More than that the Cathedral operates daily as a focal point of Catholic worship in the City. Its a great place to take in a daily mass and take much needed time to pray and reflect
A moving experience. You don't have to religious to be moved by St Patricks. Zofia and I lighted candles for our respective mothers and thought about them in this peaceful atmosphere,
Beautiful Cathedral. A must visit to this very attractive cathedral very popular and very busy, Situated on the busy 5th.Ave 50th. street and close to central park.
Beautiful. We visited during the day. It was not to crowded. It is free to visit. It is beautiful inside. They also have a gift shop. They have candle offerings as well.
Beautiful cathedral. ...very pleasant and friendly staff at the entrance welcoming tourists . Close to rockefeller centre and top of the Rock observatory. ...Had my 10 mind of calm and peace there
Quick stop. It was a quick walk through and it didn't disappoint. If you are visiting Rockefeller center it is nearby and close to Sakk's Fifth Ave. It was just beautiful to look upon.

Quiet Rest. This is such a serene and quiet place of rest amidst a city that is noisy and busy. It is a place of calm and peace in a world that is rushing by. Come in to find rest for your soul, peace for your turmoil, and power for your journey. I had the amazing opportunity to attend Mass here in the summer of 2012. It is an amazing cathedral, and a must-see when you come to New York, NY.

Impressive building. Well worth a look around, beautiful structure with some lovely stained glass. Bring a guide/find a free one online so you know some history. I didn't do that and pretty sure I'd have enjoyed it more if I knew more about what I was looking at.

Lovely Cathedral and Stained Windows. Having seen some of the most beautiful cathedrals in Europe, I was pleased that St. Patrick's was also a lovely space. Obviously a NYC icon, the cathedral has been refurbished on the outside, and pleasingly adorned on the inside. We did not witness a service while we were there, but I suspect the acoustics are also quite nice. And the stained glass windows throughout are equally pretty. A definite stop for those in the city!

Beautiful church. We stopped by the cathedral for a few minutes on walk around the area. The building is beautiful both inside and out. There was not a service going on when we visited, but it felt a bit disrespectful to be walking around while others were there praying and worshipping.

Great experience. This is a highly recommended stop if you visit NYC. You need not be religious to appreciate the architecture and beauty of this place. As many have said, this place is an oasis in the middle of a city jungle. I hope they always manage to keep the doors open to the public and the absurd rising prices of some city attractions at bay.
Stunning!. We came across this church while walking on Madison Avenue. It was absolutely stunning and so distinct amid the concrete jungle of NYC.

Happened upon it while walking and lucky we did. We were walking from Trump Tower to a subway station when we happened upon the church. It is breath taking. If you have time, i recommend a visit. All the tourists were quite and respectful. Lots of security and they do a bag inspection which is totally understandable. It was a nice respite during our walk to stop and talk to God.
One of the most beautiful cathedrals. It's amazing in and out. Breathtaking.You must go inside.There are almost one million pigeons outside.

A beautiful Cathedral. We just happened to be walking in NYC and came across this stunning Cathedral. The architecture is amazing both inside and out. Somebody was practicing on the pipe organ, (which was huge,) when we went inside and that just gave the tour a brilliant atmosphere. Worth going to if you have a bit of extra time to spare.

Sanctuary in the midst of Mammon. I have sung in Cathedrals all over the world, but this is one of the most beautiful and serene that I have ever visited. In the midst of a major commercial and business areas in one of the most hectic cities in the world, there exists this building of calm and quiet reflection. So impressive we came back to see it twice
Holy Place. very Impressive church. very holy. The work that was done to make this Cathedral GREAT and beautiful.

awesome!. the most beautiful structure, is so an amazing building, the architecture is really cool.. definitely worth visiting, and is one of the few things in NYC that is actually free to get in. please be respectful is not allowed to take pictures inside but the outside is just as beautiful. :)

Breathtaking. By far the most beautiful church I've seen. The doors are opened to visitors and you can light a candle if you want. They were also people through to walk toward the alter or take a seat. The inside is just as beautiful as the exterior.This is a sight you don't want to miss when visiting NY.

Serene and Beautiful. We visited the Cathedral during a family visit to NYC and found it to be breathtaking. The atmosphere is serene and spiritual even with many people in the room. Of course it is free to enter (there are donation boxes). Words cannot describe the beauty of the stained glass and altar. The pictures do not do it justice. Highly recommend you visit and experience it for yourself!
New York City Landmark. Must see on any visit to NYC. Centrally located and easy accessible to many other attractions nearby.
Stunning. We stopped by to visit. It is difficult and confusing to get inside. Saying this, it is hard to appreciate all the beauty. Still a must see!

Truly Majestic. In the middle of the fifth avenue shopping, this majestic cathedral with stunning stained glass windows is a sight to behold. We were lucky enough to witness the cardinal's visit on 26th June.
Love religious architecture. A must go when in NY, beautiful church and very close distance to main attractions. Good for families
A place to pause and catch your thoughts. Went inside the Cathedral and stayed for a few minutes. Gives you a chance to reflect and catch your thoughts in the midst of one's busy stroll in NYC

Stunning Architecture. You don't need to be religious to appreciate the beauty of this cathedral. The stained glass windows and high-soaring arches will take your breath away. The massive pipe organ is impressive and there are services going on in different areas while you wander through.

Attended noon mass. Very fortunate to time my visit right and have the opportunity to attend the daily noon-time mass. Made the visit very special and much more meaningful. Gorgeous stained glass windows. Many ornate side altars. Lots of statutes, candles, artwork. Beautiful cathedral.

Easter Sunday. We went here for Easter sunday after we had been to the parade. Lit a candle for a small donation and although we did not stay for the service the cathedral was beautiful to see both inside and out.
breathtaking. when we turned the corner from Rock Center and saw the cathedral, I got chills. It is magical and so majestic. Inside, it is quiet and serene and the spirit of the Lord is there!
Very busyand much the same as most cathedrals. Popular place to visit. Lots of locals and tourists visiting and praying. Spectacular inside but much the same as most cathedrals.
Beautiful Church. Stunning Cathedral, loved all the Altars and all the stain glass. There was a wedding when we visited, and it made it all the more magical.
Beautiful Church. This is a classic church in the sense of the word. I have traveled all over Europe and this is one of the closest that I have seen to that. Excellent visit.

Great Timing. Arrived at St. Patrick's Cathedral just in time to witness a Wedding. Of course, the front area of the Cathedral was roped off for the Wedding attendees, but visitors were still allowed in the other areas. It is a beautiful place with stained glass windows and arched ceilings. There is a sense of reverence as one enters through the door, you feel that you are in the presence of God.
Wonderfull cathedral. architectural wonder must see. you can take as many pictures as you like of some amazing statues and alters.
Beautiful cathedral!. When visiting New York, a walk through the cathedral is a peaceful break from the city. St. Patrick's is a welcoming environment.

Mass moved to 5:30. I wanted to go to the church Jackie O. made famous, and met a knowledgable security guard there. I would have stayed if mass were at 5:00, but I was on a schedule. Rose windows, Gothic arches and pristine interiors reminded me of several French cathedrals.

Breathtaking!. A must see! Has the feel of being in a beautiful ancient cathedral in Europe, and includes the sacred Roman Catholic Stations of the Cross, Altar, baptismal fount, statues, etc. presented in the most exquisite way.

Beautiful Architecture.. It is across the street from the New York Palace. The architecture is so elegant and beautiful. Behind the altar, is a chapel dedicated to Virgin Mary, make sure you visit it.
A Must See. Amazing and beautiful architecture. A beautiful and religious site. Wonderful statues, stained glass and other religious items.

Most beautiful church I have ever seen!. We are not really regular church go-ers but the inside of this church opposite the Rockefeller Center is impressive. Thousands and thousands of Colourful glass windows all around. This is a really nice place to calm down and think of the things we normally do not have time for!

Must See. So beautiful! Love the architecture, so sad that this type of building is almost a lost art. Save yourself a bit a headache and skip the gift shop inside the Cathedral. They offer a larger gift shop just around the corner that has more selection and no crowds.

Stunning and Welcoming. We stopped in to St. Pat's on our way to Central Park. It is a gorgeous cathedral; the kids were in awe. I highly recommend walking throughout the church on the circular path. It is a breathtaking tour and only takes a few extra minutes.

Saturday Mass. The cathedral is simply beautiful. I must admit to disappointment in the fact that during mass tourists continued to wander about taking pictures, etc. Not very respectful. Also during mass a police officer with a dog made his way up and down the walkways. Utterly unfortunate.

Gothic church . Famous church for locals. Very beautiful and delicate gothic cathedral. Sanctuary moment inside. Interior is stunning high slope ceiling with blue stain-glass. With warm lighting and daylight pass through blue stain glass, make the atmosphere looks marvelous. Free admission. Close to the subway station.

Stunning Cathedral. While in NYC I attended mass at this lovely Cathedral and was simply amazed by its architecture. It was the perfect spot to reflect on the busyness of my vacation in the company of other visitors.
sight for sore eyes. always visit when in the city. looks great after the renovation. very clean and well kept. lots of history.

Stunning and Absolute Peacefulness. St. Patrick's Cathedral is one of the most beautiful cathedrals I have seen in the U.S. The stain glass windows are absolutely beautiful. I found myself totally at peace while visiting the Cathedral. I highly recommend visiting regardless of your religious beliefs. The architecture alone is well worth the visit.

A place to pray. Enter to enjoy the neo-gothic architecture, the sound of the big pipe-organ (in appropriate occasions), and the glass patchwork windows (and pergaps, whatever your religion, lit a candle for those you forgot).

Beautiful Building. Stopped in when out walking and there was a mass in progress. Beautiful interior and very well looked after. Security is pretty heavy during mass with bags beings checked e.t.c. - worth a visit just to see the interior.

Catholic Charmer. for all faiths a must see in New York City ...this church has been the center of many dignitaries and Actors and politicians last rites ...has a great history to learn about as you walk through the church enjoy its history !!!
Breathtaking !!. This is a definite must see ! So Beautiful, the architecture is Amazing !! You can light a candle and find an inner peace ....loved everything about this !

Take your breath away ....every time. Check the website for service times - and be aware that the services fill up early so if you decide that you want to stay get there early. It is a BEAUTIFUL building, proudly sitting on Madison Avenue, inviting all to come in and be inspired.
Majestic. Such a beautiful church! A must see in NYC! It is easy to find and you can take pics inside. Make sure to bring a good camera!
aaaaawwww. Humbling and beautiful at the same time. A must see i NYC. Down the street from the Andaz and lots of great picture options

Majestic!. Visited on a Sunday, only for moments because worship was in session and I was part of a fast moving tour. BUT - although entering only into the foyer, I got the tail end of a hymn and a little bit of the liturgy. Even though not Roman Catholic (but because I am a worshiper and a musician) both snippets were pure spiritual joy! The organ is still the king of instruments and this organ reminded me of this fact. St Patrick's is worth a visit another time when I could explore more, but just this preview tells me that it is a great stop to make.
Beautiful. Such a nice surprise to have found this beautiful Cathedral in the middle of the city. Peaceful and quiet. Opportunity to light a candle for all those who died in 9/11.

Old world. The architecture is simply amazing. If going to NYC you must stop in to see this Church. I don't think there is another quite
like this one. You get a sense of calm when you walk in the
doors.
Wow..breathtaking!. Just beautiful inside and out..worth a look ..you can take pictures light candles (3.00 donation) worth it!
Beautiful church. Take about 15-20 minutes and walk this church. The details are amazing. There are sections dedicated to each Saint. Stop by the gift shop for a cheap (some) souvenir.
unbelievable. This cathedral was gorgeous. The exterior is just breathtaking not to mention the interior. If you like architecture, this place is a must.

a nice place to rest. when you go through a hectic city like NYC it is always good to have a place available to sit and feel relaxed. We know it is a nice church but for yourself you can relax in this atmosphere
Peaceful escape from the city!. A very peaceful retreat from the city noise! The renovations have been completed. The church is absolutely beautiful!
Glorious!. Just went this past Sunday while visiting NYC. We stayed for a bit to hear the chanter sing. It is truly a beautiful Cathedral with glorious architecture.

Breathtaking architechture.... I have been here before and it never fails to take your breath away on the detailed work and massive interior. You want to look in every nook and cranny. Not a very quiet place or even terribly contemplative unless you have the mental discipline of a monk but a nice place to sit and ponder (and people watch).

What a beautiful cathedral. When I walked in, I was in awe of the spectacular sight – the pews, sculptures, stained window glass panes and the ceiling. Words cannot adequately describe St Patrick's. Marble, Gothic, magnificent are just a few. The staff here are generous with their time so please be patient, as everyone has questions. It is being renovated and the construction men will chat if they have a moment.
beautiful cathedral. the inside of this cathedral is breathtaking the staff is very welcoming and pictures are encouraged words cannot discribe how beautiful this cathedral is
Unbelievable. one of the most beautiful structures I have ever been to . It is bend decryption. A must see in New York City

Somber and Intimate. We walked over to St Patrick's Cathedral after our Rockefeller tour. And even if there were lots of people outside taking photos, once you step inside, there's an air of peace and ambience of

58 years between visits - still amazing. My parents brought me here on my 11th birthday. Exactly 58 years later I attended Mass here again. The same uplifting feeling.
One suggestion for visitors lining up for the gift shop in the rear of the cathedral. There's a larger shop with a bigger selection right around the corner. Only a small sign informs you about this.

A few minutes at St. Patricks Cathedral. On Saturday of last week I made a point to stop and visit the cathedral. It's as wonderful as I could remember when I came here with my mother. The only sad part of the visit is the need for security. Its a shame how terrorism has affect life in NYC.
Beautiful cathedral. A little peace in the middle of the city. Again visit early in the day before the tour buses arrive.

Intricate and beautiful cathedral. The rich detail inside this cathedral is worth pausing to admire and even reflect. The craftsmanship is wonderful. It has a great deal of Old World feel inside, with the heavy, dark wood pews, elongated statues of saints and angels, beautiful stained glass, and soaring arches. Go twice, if possible: once during the day to admire the interior, and then during the evening to admire the white exterior facade that is lit at night, and simply glows against the night sky.
Beautiful Church. Attended Mass here on our final morning in NYC; a special experience not spoilt by tourists at the time. A sanctuary in a very busy city.

Spare the time for a service. Wanted to see the Cathedral so decided to do a service at the same time. 45 minutes we were done and listened to the beautiful organ and great voice of the priest. Took pictures of the fabulous architecture and enjoyed every minute. Beware, no washrooms though.

Stunning. A beautiful Cathedral slash church with a green park where you can have a picnic and watch school children play. That sounded creepy but not like that. Great central location and so worth the visit in Dublin!
Nothing like mass at St. Patrick's Cathedral. Beautiful mass, amazing choir, wonderful Father's Day homily. The stained glass windows and altar are unbelievable.

Such a beautifully designed church!. Even though I am not Catholic I was very impressed with this church. Just walking down the aisles and seeing this church was awe-inspiring. And the church staffers are very friendly and do not mind people coming in to just walk around and take pictures (without the flash of course).I would recommend this place to visit no matter where you are staying in NYC!
Family Trip to NYC. So pretty! Open to the public. Great spot for interior pictures. Quiet and respectful place to go for a little downtime.

Truly Amazing!. This was truly a wonderful experience for me, the beauty of this church is truly amazing whether you are Catholic or not. I highly recommend visiting whether for spiritual reasons or religious ones. I will say that as someone who is not Catholic I felt a little intrusive on the people who were there to pray and worship and while I realize that the church needs revenue to stay open I think the souvenir shop and the medallion machines take away a little from the beauty of the church. It would be nice if they could arrange to have that stuff adjacent to the church instead of inside. But this is still totally worth the visit and should be at the top of your must see list.

Magnificent House of God. The hushed atmosphere in the impressive interior of this Cathedral brings a mantel of peace. A gift at this time of turmoil in the world. This is a definite place to visit when you are in NYC. "Still point in the turning World."
Beautiful Church. I am not a world traveler, but this is the most magnificent church I have seen. Stop in if you are nearby.

Amazing! Best part of NYC . This cathedral cannot be described with words. When I walked in my mouth dropped. It is breathtaking. I haven't seen such a gorgeous cathedral since I was in Europe. Definitely a must see.

Monumental, awe-inspiring and glorious architectural feat. Accompanied my mother here and we joined the steady stream of visitors who came to admire this cathedral. The middle section with the pews was roped off for people there to worship, and security staff dressed in black suits manage the foot traffic. Bags are checked at the front entrance (a usual practice and safety precaution at major institutions in NYC). The vaulted ceilings force you to walk around with your head thrown all the way back in a perpetual pose of awe, which is completely appropriate for this magnificent place. A mass was performed while we were there and my mother and I decided spontaneously to attend. Being a lapsed Christian, for me the experience deepened the spiritual feeling that the space evokes. There are several discreet areas along the interior perimeter for gazing at statues of saints, relief sculptures and candles. A particularly sacred section in the back does not allow picture-taking, however, you can still visit. As you enter the church at the front, there is a tiny gift shop for purchasing small mementos, like cards, crosses, rosaries and medallions. Holy water is also available on this side of the church--you're meant to dip your fingers in it and then make the sign of the cross.
Feels more like a tourist attraction than church. Unless you like to visit churches or have some sort of connection, tourism rules here even it seems when attempting to attend mass.

Architectural Wonder. Even for us non-Catholics, this building is a must-see in NYC. It is now fully viewable since the major renovation of the past few years. You only see these things in Europe, otherwise.
Stunning. Stunning architecture in the heart of Midtown, well worth a visit, pop in for a real treat for your eyes.

New renovation is stunning!. If you've been before (or never before), do not miss this NYC landmark. After several years of scaffolding, the cathedral was unveiled for the Papal visit to NY and it is unbelievably beautiful. I've always loved visiting in the past to pause for a moment to reflect while also enjoying the architecture and stained glass. Now? It is so clean, it glows. I've found an even greater appreciation for a location I've loved for my entire life. Ignore the crowds and slip into a pew to reflect and enjoy.
Attended on Sunday.. Beautiful church and nice service. Awesome stain glass windows. Light a candle for someone you have lost.
Very nice cathedral. We stopped in for a few moments with kids. Very beautiful cathedral. Very well preserved. The pipe organs were playing, very nice!

Amazing Monument for the World. St,Patricks has finally been released from the scaffolding Gods.For so many years the stone and structural work that was going on inside the Cathedral was masking the beauty of this worldly monument and there's no doubt this is a monument.This is a place where people of every religion in the world could visit and feel the majesty.The sidewalk and street outside the Cathedral are buzzing with all the sounds,sites and smells of NYC, but when you pass through these portals it is like another world.The sounds of muffled voices and clicking cameras is about all you hear as visitors are in awe of the beauty held here.There is a regal feeling as you take in all the history and religious icons.This is a NYC must stop without regards to your religious affiliation.You have to go!!!
Gothic beauty. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a beautiful church located just off Madison Avenue. It is an impressive structure, huge and beautiful.
A very imposing and spiritual place. It was adjacent to our Hotel and we went in on our first day in New York. We love the atmosphere of churches and this one was beautiful.

Beautiful!. I had heard about this cathedral and had to see it. What a breathtakingly beautiful building. We went during a weekday, late morning, and there was a small crowd spread throughout. We walked along the perimeter and I was amazed - detailed sculptures, beautiful stained glass windows, the huge pipe organ on an upper level and the amazing architecture of this cathedral! There was a reverent hush - so glad we visited!

Always a beautiful visit!. We were fortunate to have attended Mass this past Sunday at which Cardinal Timothy Dolan was celebrating his 40th anniversary of his ordination into the priesthood. Beautiful organ music!
A magnificent church. Free admission to one of the most beautiful churches in the United States. It's not far from Rockefeller Center so it is very convienent to walk over and just take a quick look.

Recharge here. I love coming here and walking around looking at all the chapels and statues and reflecting on life. It is magnificent as the ceiling soars above you. Then we wit and reflect on things that are bothering us and offer a prayer. It is even more impressive to attend mass here when the choir sings. A must see for all who visit New York.

Beautiful cathedral. Large and beautiful in midtown. Easy for a quick visit. Very crowded due to it's location near Rockefeller Center. Some visitors not respectful of church and those in prayer. Only go if you enjoy cathedrals and can be quiet and contemplative while inside.
A marvelous place to sit and reflect. An amazing building and a great sanctuary to get away from the hectic NY life and just reflect on life in general.

Magnificent . Huge and centrally located. There is a larger cathedral uptown near Grant's Tomb, but this is the one everyone goes to. Take your time and learn the history of this building. And make sure to see The Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine uptown at West 113th St. Take that tour.
Beautiful. I called in here while I was visiting Wall Street. It's a beautiful building and most certainly worth a look inside if you're in the vicinity.

Larger than life. You really have to walk up to this place to really appreciate the size of this cathedral, the door look like a regular size door till you stand beside it. It was under restoration when we were there be still worth the visit.

Beautiful. We saw this 3 years ago when it was covered in scaffolding as it was being cleaned. Now the stone work positively gleams. As beautiful building with a calm and spiritual atmosphere. A place to stop and take some time out in.

Beautiful church - prepare for crowds. We always stop by St. Pats to light candles for our family. It was very crowded (and lots of noise). There was even one wedding ending and another starting. The church is gorgeous and worth the visit.

Great time at St. Patrick Cathedral. We were heading towards the Park and my group decided to stop for pictures. St. Patrick's Cathedral is such a landmark, and it's a very adorned and traditional church, it makes great shots!

artistry. the beauty of so much stonework and intricate details was inspiring. My grandfather was a sculptor, much of his work being religious in nature, both stone and woodwork. The cathedral is a tribute to artistry as much as religion.

A must but someone please chase the money changers from the temple!. As a lifelong practicing Catholic a trip to NYC must include a trip to St. Patrick's. We visited on Good Friday and the service was amazing...Now the bad part...the vestibule of the church includes souvenirs next to prayer candles!! Really? People laughing and joking while Good Friday service is going on...Beautiful church but I wish it was treated more like a church than a tourist destination.

Breathtaking!. Every time we visit NY this is a must. This time we were able to go to mass which I highly recommend. Not only is the mass wonderful but it really gives you some time to soak in all the beauty and architecture that the church has to offer. I could spend all day there taking pictures.

BEAUTIFUL CATHEDRAL. What a beautiful cathedral this is. Its a stunning place the stained glass is stunning. We got up early on Sunday morning and went to the mass that was held at 8.00am. It was a lovely service in a lovely place.

America's Church is St. Patrick's Cathedral. Teach us your Will.Feed us our Daily Bread.Forgive us as we Forgive others.Heal us from evil.Amen.The answer has been there all along, but I put the pieces together. Read Revelation 3:3 and Revelation 16:15. The Second Coming of Christ is the knowledge understanding and Wisdom that Love is: Teaching, not deceiving or lying; Feeding, not depriving or stealing; Forgiving, and not condemning or hating; and, Healing and not hurting or killing.
Gorgeous. fantastic, in the heart of fifth avenue. must go in. the organ was playing when we were there. such an incredible feeling. grand and majestic. superbe Cathedral.
Beautiful. Such a beautiful piece of history! usually very busy and open to the public with lots of tourists going around but definitely worth seeing at least once

Absolutely beautiful!. One of the most magnificent places I have ever seen. The intricate details of everything from the windows to the ceiling to the organ pipes is beyond gorgeous. My teens were even in awe of its beauty!

So Many Historic Moments Have Occurred Here. How many iconic weddings and how many iconic funerals have take place here. We had just visited Rockefeller Center so there was no way we were going to miss at least going into the world famous cathedral. Of course the artwork is phenomenal. The feeling inside this place of worship incredible. And there it is, somehow wedged into this sprawling metropolis. A quiet place in the din of a never sleeping city. Worth the stop.

Just another beautiful church. Yes beautiful, but I gave this attraction only 3 stars because we have Cathedral Basilica here in St. Louis, which is equally beautiful, if not more so. I stepped inside this church only because the party I traveled with wanted to do so. In my opinion, there are more interesting things to do while in NYC.

Breathtakingly Beautiful!!!. You must see this cathedral!!! No words can describe the beauty of this holy place of worship. There is a gift shop inside that sells jewelry, crosses, xmas ornaments, etc.
Fantastic looking church. Near to the Rockefeller centre this church is very striking from the outside as looks very white. Large and impressive inside,, looks somewhat out of place in the area

Beautiful Cathedral . You can book a tour to see the Cathedral but we did this ourselves, you can walk right in, it always busy and it's as stunning and beautiful on the outside as it is on the inside. Beautiful stained glass, pulpit and various monuments. We visited during mass, and as long as you are respectful it is no problem, a piece of peace and tranquility away from the hustle of the city.

A Must See for Everyone. Truly a special feeling as you walk inside. the stained glass is gorgeous and the majestic feeling overwhelms. It is large and full of people, yet quiet. The outside, now cleaned, is awe inspiring. Must walk by and go inside on any visit to Manhattan.

Grand. The intricate design of this cathedral was simply amazing and breathtaking. Standing in the midst of a concrete jungle, it was a nice to have some traditional architecture nestled between skyscrapers. You could spend about an hour here and even sit down and enjoy the mass service.

Surreal. I'm a Catholic, so coming to this Church was more than a "tourist destination" for me. The Church was huge and very ornate — very beautiful inside and out. Went for Mass here, then visited the gift shop by the entrance of the Church, and the one on the street right next to it. It's right in front of the Rockefeller too.

Part of New York History. This cathedral is truly amazing. It takes up an entire city block. The architecture, statuary and stained glass are all so beautiful. The inside is absolutely huge. There is a gorgeous alter and old pipe organ. There are many small apse areas for various saints.The craftsmanship is fabulous.I had the good fortune to attend both of my nephews graduation ceremonies at a mass in the cathedral. What a wonderful setting for such an important event.St Patrick's should be on everyone's list of things to do in NYC. It rivals any cathedral or church any where in Europe. Don't miss it.
Beautiful Cathedral. A grand cathedral in Midtown right across from Rockefeller Center which is especially beautiful at Christmas.
A Cathedral in NY, a nice break from the skyscrapers.. Always lovely to step into this cathedral and transcend a bit from the street. It is being well preserved and is a big asset to the city.

Gorgeous architecture. If you are in the neighborhood you simply must take a moment to admire the architectural work of this cathedral. It is also incredible to see in the middle of all the modern structures. If mass is not going on, you can usually go inside for a closer look.

Stunning church. St Patrick's Cathedral is a stunning piece of architecture both on the outside and inside. On the day that we actually stepped inside the cathedral there was the graduation ceremony of a girls school taking place and it was really something to sit and watch the young ladies and their families enjoying their achievements. It made our visit extra special - to see the cathedral being used like this.

Ornate. The cathedral is absolutely astonishing. It is huge inside with a spectacular high and ornate ceiling. The interior reflects the magnificent craftsmanship employed when building the structure. Worth visiting and attending a service.

Breathtakingly Beautiful. All you can do is look around in awe and reverence. Beautiful historical and magnificent work of art. Stained glass and marble like you might see in Europe. Amazing and worth the stop to visit.
Beautiful Church. Attended mass here Sunday morning. It's an old church (by US standards), and beautifully appointed. Definitely worth visiting for a few minutes or attending mass.
The cathedral is very grand. It is very grand and done very nicely it has been renewed and every detail is grand take lots of pictures.

Beautiful Cathedeal. We visited this beautiful cathedral on a week day evening. There was a long line to get in. It was a little slow but that was because of security. The stain glass widows are amazing to see. You are allowed to take pictures.
Stunning!. What a beautiful church! Stunning architecture. So peaceful, I feel very lucky we were able to get in to see it.

A must see in NYC. Even if you're not Catholic, it is a must see for any visit to the city. Near Rockefeller Center, there is a lot to see in this area.
Remember to remove hats and allow for time to have your bag checked prior to entering.
The Cathedral is simply breathtaking.
Lovely Cathedral. A lovely Cathedral,well worth seeing.Just as good as the European ones. The stain glass window are amazing, take your time.Photo's are allowed in some places.

Attend Mass if You are here on a Sunday. We try to attend Mass in a local cathedral when out of town and the experience of Sunday Mass at St Patrick's in awesome for spiritual enrichment and amazing architecture. Sit up close and take in the whole experience of the Mass in this sacred place. Afterwards take your time to gaze at the stained glass windows and side alters. I went to Europe and have seen numerous cathedrals; its wonderful to have this wonderful cathedral in our own country. Sad note: Security does check purses before entering and police presence reminds us of living in different times now.

St. Patrick's Cathedral. A must stop...take 10 minutes out of your touring and visit this magnificent church. It's free but you can give a donation. Rest....mediate...pray....and wonder why churches are not built like this anymore.
Peaceful oasis in the city. This church gives a lovely welcome to visitors, encourages photography, has amazing architecture and lovely gift shop

Fantastic architecture . Visited this imposing Church twice during our one week stay in New York. This Roman Catholic Cathedral is certainly one of the best in the world for it's amazing architecture. Renovated at an exorbitant cost, this Church has looks to be an European construction. The beauty of the tinted glass skylights adds glamour to the structure. The solemn service was the hallmark of this High Church. Though not a Catholic myself, the place clearly has the right ingradients to provide tranquility to the visitors.The church has a small souvenir shop that is well stocked with interesting gift items. A visit to this place is a must while in New York.

OMG! Unbelievable church. Visited NYC and stopped here on our walking tour. The church had just been cleaned/renovated and it was something to see. It was like looking in a magazine but was real. They allow you to take pictures and my pictures are awesome. You can even go to mass there. We didn't want to leave. Lots of tourists there but it was very quiet. Everyone was in awe. There was so much to see.

No matter your religious beliefs a MUST SEE. This place is hauntingly beautiful. I was blown away at the intricate details in everything. One thing to remember is that this is still a working Church so please respect that. Enjoy the history and beauty of this magnificent place
Stunning. It was an incredible experience seen the cathedral after so many years of restoration. The architecture is breath-taking.

Beautiful and peaceful.. It had been under renovation last visits, so was delighted to see this cathedral in all its glory.Truly spectacular, whatever your religion or non religious you are welcome here. They do a simple bag search and then you can enter.There was a mass going on while we were there which was nice. We just sat and absorbed the peaceful cool tranquility inside, that was the opposite of the heat and crowded sidewalks outside. Beautiful architecture. Didn't take pictures due to mass taking place. You can light candles and pray peacefully. Well worth a visit.

Huge Cathedral. This Cathedral is massive inside, it looks impressive from the front but that doesn't prepare you for the scale of the inside. The architecture inside and the style in which it was built you would think it was much older than it actually is. It remind you of the much older European style Cathedrals. Definitely worth visiting.
Near other attractions. It's worth a pop in since it's in the vicinity of 30 Rock and is a beautiful old church. They do ask for donations inside to light candles or gain access to certain parts.
Stunning. . This was my first time back since the renovation and it was spectacular. Truly breathtaking. The beauty in the detail of the glass and wood and stone work is unlike any church in the us.

A great visit for all fans of church architecture. If you appreciate church architecture, this is well worth the visit. I'm not sure how much you are typically able to wander around. There was funeral going on while we were there. This limited our ability to see as much of the Nave, but also gave us a chance to see the space in liturgical use.
Amazingly Beautiful Church. I have been to lots of churches around the world and this was one of the most beautiful ones😊 the glass work is stunning. And this is a must see if in New York 😊loved it.

Worship on Sunday morning. . Attended the 10:15 service. Be there
early if you want a close seat. Beautiful to see, architecture, Windows, history, and people.
Catholic service with most music in Latin. Arch bishop sermon was from Luke with life application. Gracious people and surroundings.

A time for healing. A few month ago, my sister was finally diagnose with Carcinoid Tumors‎ on her small intestines and liver. They had been there for years and had grown to the point she had episodes where she would just pass out and not one could tell us why. In March she went to see a specialist in Louisiana and was advised they could perform the surgery she need to live a more fulfilled and productive life.She went into the church to light a candle and say a prayer , which was a blessing for her. She also took the catholic newspaper for our mom.
Beautiful. There is so much history in this great Cathedral, you do not have to be Catholic to enjoy the beauty and the solemnity of this edifice.
Under Renovation around the building. As usual a beautiful building, but marred by the hacking & drilling works around the area. Quick in and out! Cant stand the noise!
Magnificent in its structure!. Great christian building, very light and competitive towards European cathedrals. Worth to be visited.

Beautiful Catholic Church. No matter what religion you are, St. Patrick's is a beautiful church to visit. It is a massive church. The stain glass windows are beautiful. I also highly recommend that you go here for mass. The services are always beautiful.
Beautiful church. Very big church though it seems smaller as hidden between skyscrapers.Nice and coloured windows that explain different parts of the bible.

Easter Service.... Was in NYC for Easter so my daughters and I walked over for 8am mass. I've been there before but there is just something about a beautiful and holy Cathedral that makes you visit everytime you are in the area. Mass was quick and we were out of there within 45 minutes. Absolutely gorgeous inside and out. High security outside and inside before, during, and after mass so we felt very safe. Regardless of your religion its a beautiful house of worship.
Beautiful. Wonderful architecture and the inside of the cathedral is magnificent. We love to stop in to light candles, view the alter and the stations of the cross, stained glass windows, etc.

Amazingly beautiful cathedral. What a beautiful church. Rivals any of the great cathedrals of Europe. Peaceful and reverent one can not help but be in total awe wheels walking through this beautiful piece of art.

Beautiful Church. On our short NYC trip, visiting here was a must do. The beauty of this church made me speechless. The folks greeting you upon entry were incredibly friendly, especially this one gentleman. He had the biggest smile I have ever seen. Regardless of your faith, you will feel welcomed here.You can take photos but be respectful. Luckily the altar is blocked off so ignorant people don't climb up it to snap photos. The gift shop was lovely too.All in all, a very lovely,serene place to spend some time away from the busy pace of Manhattan.

A Beautiful rehab. My parents were married at St. pat's during WW2, so a visit to the cathedral is always on our must do list.The church has recently undergone a $90 million dollar rehab and the church sparkles from top to bottom, inside and out.It is spectacular and worth a visit no matter what your faith.

Better than any Broadway show. The last time I was here, this great old lady was shrouded in scaffolding, being refurbished for the Pope's visit. As as result, it is now shining like a jewel. We went to the 1015 Sunday Mass, which was a good call - it was the day before Memorial Day, and as well as the usual packed congregation, there was a large contingent of military people there, which added to the atmosphere. The readings were given by an admiral and a marine general, and Cardinal Dolan was the celebrant, with the assistance of an army of priests, deacons, altar servers and the rest. Wonderful music from the choir and magnificent organ, clouds of incense, and when the congregation sang "America the Beautiful" as the recessional hymn, there wasn't a dry eye in the house!

Peaceful, Tranquil, Spiritual. I am not Catholic but there is no way you can not appreciate the beauty and the feeling you get when enter this beautiful church. I definitely recommend visiting this historical church. Sit down in one of the pews and if nothing else reflect and be thankful.

Inspiring Cathedral. We were so happy to find out that anyone can go into the cathedral and take pictures, explore the premises and just sit and meditate.The architecture and stained glass windows are beautiful and a tribute to St. Patrick!

BEST CATHOLIC CATHEDRAL. I think of all the Cathedral's I have seen, St. Patrick's is the best. It has the look and feel of Catholicism. We attended Mass and visited each side altar. It was a memorable time.
Beautiful. Thjs is an amazing cathedral. A great experience to just be able to walk through and see all of the stations.

Not Catholic but wouldn't miss it.. As you stroll down 5th avenue, take the time to stop in St. Patrick's. We partook in Sunday mass and it was just lovely. The patrons are diverse and the history is deep. Beautiful church in the middle of it all!!

What a building!. We stumbled upon this gorgeous building on our way to Central Park. Less known than many of the famous landmarks of New York but one that stands out now we have returned from our trip.From the moment you step through the doors there is a peace and tranquility that is hard to find in New York. Even if you are not religious you cannot help but appreciate the beautiful architecture within the cathedral. Truly worth a visit.
Beautiful. We stopped for a visit and it was really crowded so we didn't get to go all the way through but did enjoy it here!

Beautiful mass on Sunday. Had the luck to be a part of a very special Sunday mass held by the archbishop of NY. The cathedral is incredibly beautiful, very big and it seems it is always packed with people. Beautiful gem on Madison ave.

Went to mass here. Loved the side memorials. It has a huge pipe organ. It was strange to have people wondering the city sides of the church looking while the mass was going on. If you love to see churches it is a must see

A must do!. Beautiful cathedral and a must see! Free of charge to enter and $2.00 to light a small candle and say a quick prayer. Donations boxes are available at all exits. Mass wasn't going on when we had the opportunity to visit, maybe next time we can plan it better.
Finally, no scaffolding.. Have been to the cathedral several times in the last few years. First time in a long time that you'll find no scaffolding. It looks great and makes for a nice visit.
Beautiful. I was able to briefly see this cathedral, but I would have loved to spend more time. It's just beautiful!

Spend some time here.. This is a building from another life. It is very near Rockefeller Center but feels like it is from life-times ago. You could feel your pulse slow as you walk off the street into this majestic structure. It has a very small gift shop (counter). We each paid $3 for a commemorative coin that we can carry with us. We felt it was worth the price.
Beautiful. A beautiful building and must see for those that like to see the old churches. The staff there is really nice. No matter your belief's you can really appreciate the architecture.
Beautiful . It is absolutely beautiful and worth visiting. It is quiet and relaxing and at the end of the day, very nice. Upon arrival, all bags are checked.

Beautiful Neo-Gothic Roman Cathedral Church in New York. The Cathedral of St. Patrick is a decorated Neo-Gothic-style Roman Catholic cathedral church in the United States and a prominent landmark of New York City. Located on the 5th Avenue, behind the Rockfeller Centre, it carries the legacy of America's Parish church. A must visit while in New York.
NICE CATHEDRAL. Nice cathedral inside and worth popping into. Sanctuary from the hustle and bustle outside. Very pleasant.

Tourist attraction or....?. Gorgeous cathedral, but so many people going in and out, and the other half are praying. Probably for patience from the distractions, and the gift shop. Definitely not a place to mingle. And they check bags too, for good reason.

Peaceful, stunning. Beautiful cathedral in the heart of the city. We had just visited Top of the Rock and St. Patrick's is just steps away from there. The architecture is stunning. Such a peaceful place and well worth a stop.

A rival to Europe's best. This is a spectacularly beautiful cathedral. My wife loves old churches and cathedrals and we've toured many of them. This cathedral is in the same style as the classic European structures, but surpasses most that are more famous. The stained glass is awesome and shrines are divine. It's quick and easy to visit and experience what may be the best religious cathedral that our country offers.

Landmark Cathedral. St. Patrick's Cathedral is located in a busy part of the city - near Saks Fifth Avenue and Rockefeller Center. You can pop in to see the beautiful interior or stay to pray or worship. Recently renovated, the scaffolding is off and it is beautiful.
Beautiful. Looks lovely after recent renovations. Beautiful cathedral with free entry (voluntary contribution can be made). Guided tour are available, although easy to walk round by yourself.
beautiful. Very nice cathedral! Downtown manhantan. Must see in new york city. Great experience and photo making

Beautiful building. Came across this by accident so glad we did - the cathedral was beautiful in amongst all the sky scraper buildings. We just looked around ourselves without a tour. The stained glass windows were wonderful as was the architecture. Even if you're not religious it is well worth a visit.
Beautiful!. We went into this beautiful cathedral as we were walking through Rockefeller to get to Central Park. This place is SO beautiful! Must stop and see the art!

Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful, an oasis of calm in a busy city. The restoration is fantastic and so much to see, we didn't do a tour just wandered round in awe then sat quietly and said a prayer. Well worth a visit whether you're a Catholic or not.
Beautiful. St. Patrick's is absolutely beautiful! The architecture and size is amazing. This is another must see while in NYC.

Beautiful and inspirational. What can one say about this beautiful cathedral? A must see especially for those of the Catholic faith when they visit NYC. Awe inspiring with breathtaking architecture. Just a moving spiritual experience.

BREATHTAKING!. St. Patrick's Cathedral is my most favorite place in the city. It never fails to impress me, overload my senses and take my breath away with its beautiful and architect. First, I will state that I am not Catholic although my paternal side of my family is. With that said, I have a reverence, appreciation and understanding somewhat of the Catholic faith. I say this because even if you are not Catholic and have no understanding of the faith, the beauty of this cathedral will not fail to impress even the nonbeliever! EVERY detail from the floor to ceiling, walls, nooks/crannies, the world famous stained glass in the front, the pews, the statues, displays, Holy Water vestibules….nothing is left without esquisite detail and finery. The atmosphere, to me, is almost ethereal. Such energy! Even though hundreds of people are passing through its door daily either touring it or attending service or lighting a candle for a loved one or praying, the senses are overloaded with humbled reverence and beauty of its massiveness and art. I love looking at all the statue displays of the saints, Jesus, Mary and the stories they tell and the numerous statues throughout. I enjoy sitting in the pews up towards the front and just being silent. Listening. Talking to God. Taking it all in. I go to SPC EVERY trip to NYC to find grounding. NYC is very fast paced and can leave one exhausted. I find things slow and my heart regulates in the cathedral with the energy and beauty inside its wall. On a recent trip to NYC the same time the Pope was in town we were on our way to the cathedral just to ground and I met Father Dolan who was outside blessing parishioners. My daughter is moving to NYC for college 7 hours from home and this was a college prep trip. Needless to say I was very stressed and upset over her moving and anxiety from a small WV to NYC. Father spoke to us and said a blessing over my daughter. What a wonderful thing to happen for her!!!! Even the working active part of the church outside of the touristy side is as humble and beautiful as the structure itself. Religious, spiritual or not, I would highly recommend stopping. Its close to all the main shopping areas…Saks, Macy's, Barneys, Nordstrom, Trump Tower, Urban Outfitters, TopShop. All within close walking distance of each other and convenient if in area. Free to go in and roam around and look. Closed to public touring during mass respectfully.
A must on every visit. I have been to NYC hundreds of times as a tourist and I try to visit the Cathedral every time to say a prayer. I just feel closer to God at St Patrick's than anywhere else.
Stunning!. Absolutely beautiful! The artwork is just amazing!! We didn't do a tour becuase of time but it would be well worth it.
An architectural oasis. A lovely break from all the skyscrapers and symmetrical buildings. A lovely peaceful and tranquil building to escape the city and to be able to think

You've GOT to stop and sit a while. Just beautiful! What an amazing Cathedral....beautifully done - so many details to look at. We sat in a pew and just looked all around. Just missed an organ concert....can only imagine the magnificence of the sound. So glad we took the time to go inside.

Tourists in the Temple. First off, let me just say that this place is beautiful beyond measure. Such ornate details at every turn. The stained glass and sculptures were incredible. It literally brought me to tears. It's breathtaking. It's inspiring. Surely it is a place worthy to be dedicated to God. I've never been in such an amazing place of worship. Except, it didn't feel like a place of worship. It felt like a museum. The other tourists (like myself) were very reverent of the space. But I did have to remind myself that this is a church and not a museum. I think it was all the people. I hate to say it, but it is hard to feel the presence of God with hundreds of people standing around taking pictures. I'm terrible, I know. I'm sure mass is different. It was still a moving experience, despite the tourists. Like I said, I was one of them too.

Renovated cathedral. The interior renovations are completed and the results are outstanding. The side altars are varied and fascinating. One can also walk behind the altar for a different perspective. I was surprised how far the main altar is from the people though.
Beautiful. Easy to get to, free to see and Beautifully restored! Mass was being held when I visited and it was a nice break from the regular touristic hustle bustle - peace & quiet

This is the biggest Cathedral I have been in. I have strolled through this cathedral twice on two different trips and it is amazing. The arches, columns, stained glass, and statues...I could take it in for hours. There is a bag-check upon entry for security. Then you can just wander and take it all in. There is so much detail in this building you don't want to miss it. There are a few staff to answer questions and they were super friendly. I love the experience of quietly walking through this massive building and you cannot help but feel lifted by the spirits. You can light prayer candles at the different Saints with a small suggested donation. Definitely visit St. Patrick's

Still beautiful. St. Patrick's is still one of the more beautiful cathedrals in the world. If you visit, enter through the side entrance and walk the full circle around the inside of the building. Be sure to look up at the ceiling. Notice the artwork on the side altars and the beautiful stained glass windows. The cathedral is well maintained and, if you are inclined, plan to attend mass there.
Not Catholic, but hey the building is beautiful!. We simply went to see the building and windows. It is far from things and I must say it is a beautiful building. Worth a walk to snap pics.

Beautiful Cathedral in the Heart of Manhattan. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a gorgeous church located on 5th Avenue across from Rockefeller Center. If you're strolling down 5th Avenue, it's worth spending some time inside.

More interesting than I thought it would be. We came upon St. Patrick's while meandering around mid-town one afternoon. The magnificent architecture looked so inviting on the outside that we decided to go in. Besides, you can't beat the the free price of admission! Very impressive!
Oasis of peace in a busy city. Visited this beautiful cathedral during my first visit to New York. Attended mass with music early one morning - wonderful experience.

The restoration work has completely altered (no pun intended) the place. I was never impressed with St Patrick's. Until I went in after the restoration work. It glistens! The glass has been cleaned and light pours in, giving it the mystical effect it was designed to have. Since this is smack in the middle of a major tourist area, don't miss it.

A beautiful cathedral between skyscrapers. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a lovely and peaceful oasis in the hustle and bustle of New York City. The building itself is gorgeous with stained glass and a very high ceiling. There is no entrance fee, but you can light a candle for a fee, if you want to. I can recommend a visit to the cathedra, if you wish to get away from the crowds or you want to just to rest your feet after a lot of walking.
Impressive. At last the scaffolding is down and you can see it in all its glory, an calming oasis in a concrete jungle. Majestic, serene, spiritual, magnificent.

A quiet oasis in the middle of Manhattan. It's so nice to steal away, even for a few moments, inside this iconic landmark. The peaceful quiet you find inside is a gift you give yourself in the middle of our usual hectic days. I had not been to visit the Cathedral since the rennovation was complete. What an outstanding job was done! It's like windows were opened and light is now streaming through to let you see just how beautiful it is here. I love to walk completely around the perimeter of the church and take a moment to look and reflect on the beautiful side altars. The Marian chapel directly behind the main altar with its stunning stained glass windows is not to be missed. When I visit this Cathedral, I remember that it is important to take time to pray and reflect on priorities in life. I'm always glad I came and vow to return again soon.
A gem in the City. Take a few minutes to visit this lovely building - a 'traditional' Gothic cathedral amidst all the skyscrapers. You'll not be disappointed!
beautiful cathedral. attended Spanish mass on Sunday at 4pm. lots of people there worshiping and visiting. nice service, they have security guiding the people around which kind of surprised me.
St. Patrick's Cathedral. We happened to be in the area of St Patrick's Cathedral so we stopped in took around. We arrived just before noon and stayed for the mass. Very inspiring.

My visit to St Patrick's Cathedral. Go inside and admire the artwork, light a candle if you want. I do and contribute a small fee to their poor box. Then take a slo walk around the building to admire the stained glass an artwork. The cathedral is right up there with other world class cathedrals of its size in cities like London, Paris, Rome, Vienna, Munich and elsewhere. Atleast spend one or two hours here.
Special place. I never though that could be feel special in a church, but this church is not common, you must visit and light a pray between the angels
Saturday mass.. Went to saturday mass . It was a lovely service .The seats were cordoned off so tourists could walk around without bothering the mas

One word: Beautiful. A visit to St Patrick's is a must do when in NYC, especially when exploring 5th Avenue. I am not religious, but the architecture, both inside and outside, the cathedral is gorgeous.

I Couldn't Stop Looking Up. Absolutely amazing place of worship. This was only my second time walking into a cathedral, and they never cease to amaze me. All your eyes want to do is look up at the beautiful windows and walls. Wonderful place, I would definitely want to attend a mass here.

Gothic revival opulence. I must have missed the part in the Bible where Jesus said "Spend money on gold and marble and large buildings for my glory" but the Catholic Church thrives on it. It is a stunning display of architecture, stained glass, marble and artworks. Of course, it does not have the centuries of history of European cathedrals, but it is brighter and lighter, and the exterior is strikingly clean.

Big church popular with everyone. We were right there so we went in. Its a huge church with lots of saints in it. It is a great place to get off the streets and just take in all the gorgeous effort that went into building it.
I testing building to visit. Walked past and just went in to visit. Beautiful building and worth a visit to appreciate this. Free to visit

Magnificent Architecture. Always love going to St. Patrick's Cathedral because it is not only iconic but beautiful architecture! In the summer it is buzzing with graduates and many tourist. It is free to look and worship.
Majestic. Here in the middle of all the business building is this wonderful church. So large and impressive. What a beautiful structure. Go inside and see what a place of peace feels like.

Touch-and-Go Attraction. Located within the heart of the city, this church is inundated with tourist. Took a look and got out of there quick. The architecture is nice but no different than those in Europe. A stop-and-go attraction.

Beautiful design. Just walking through the massive doors at St. Patrick’s Cathedral is impressive. This neo-gothic style church is beautiful outside and inside. Inside the church there are the tall arched ceiling, wooden seats, sculptures, stained glass windows and the large, open altar at the center of the church. There are smaller services at the center and very back of the church.
Spririt. Amazing cathedral, worth to see, in the middle of Manhattan unexpected to find such place, do not hesitate to enter

Not a "Must See". It was a place of worship with statues that probably cost thousands of dollars to make. Architecture was was cool otherwise theres not much else. Not going to go on rant here, so I will just leave it at that.

beautiful cathedral. This place is a definite visit! Make this place a must-see on your Manhattan walking tour. Take time to sit in a pew and marvel at the architecture, gorgeous stained glass and enjoy the aura of being in God's house.
BEAUTIFUL!. I'm not religious at all but I love the architecture of churches. This is one of the most beautiful I've seen.
Gorgeous. This is my first time inside since the renovation was completed. The results are stunning. Take the audio tour and spend some time seeing all the art and enjoying the peace of the cathedral

Beautiful cathedral. We called in when we were on fifth avenue and just walked around for a short time. As we were staying nearby I went to 10 o'clock mass on Sunday morning. It was a beautiful mass, mostly sung with a priest and a cantor. I did feel though that sightseeing shouldn't be allowed during the mass as it was distracting with people walking about and taking photos when you are trying to pray.
A very pleasant place for pray and enjoy of the eyes. Beautiful architecture, vitraux, sculptures, ornamental, and a faraway altar dedicated to Holy Mother for meditation and prayer.
Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful Cathedral and architecture. Free to enter, donations accepted. If you are in the area, definitely worth dropping in and walking around.
Very impressive. Truly impressive from an architectural standpoint, and awe inspiring from a spiritual standpoint. A must see in NYC.

Interesting Place. We stopped here via the Hop on Hop off bus.Being from England it was strange to see a Cathedral that was not worn and in great condition. Usually the cathedrals that we visit are very old. This is a modern building but that appears old.It is well worth a visit and the stained glass windows and the whole place is stunning.
A wonderful piece of architecture. Extremely impressed by the architecture. would have loved to have attended a service. Was in awe of the acoustics.
Wonderful and Thriving. Beautiful cathedral with a faithful congregation of worshippers who fill the service on a week day! This is a city that has not lost its identity.
A great cathedral. We just happened to walk by and went it as it look so impressive. Worth it, a very interesting building. Rest your feet and admire your surroundings.
Beautiful. So happy we stopped in.Friendly volunteers to greet us.Whether your catholic or not. Its a beautiful and inspiring.

Beautiful. Even if you aren't religious, it is a truly spectacular place to see. Very humbling.I was in NYC 3 gears ago when the restoration was being done, so didn't see the beauty then, so i am glad that i revisited this time.Breathtaking.....
Awe Inspiring. What a beautiful Cathedral. I was fortunate to attend Mass during my trip and it was very special. I hope on my next trip, I can attend when Cardinal Nolan is celebrating.
Go to St.Paatrick´s. This was my second visit to New York and the second time I visited this Cathedral. I always light a candle and ask God for the people I most love.
Wow. Absolutely stunning and breath taking cathedral. Definetly worth going to see even if you arent religious. Beautiful alters and stained glass windows.

A very special place. I have to say walking into the cathedral was overwhelming. Memories of a passed family member of which I used to attend mass with rushed back to me and brought me to tears!! As a Catholic it's amazing how you can find peace and comfort in a place you have never been around people you do not know. Was a very surreal experience. I would recommend for all to visit, religious, agnostic, atheist it does not matter. The architecture alone is stunning.

Wonderful organ music. Happened to stumble in after leaving the Met. Was drawn by the crowds and wonderful free organ music. This was a welcome respite on a hot afternoon. The music was sublime and the church is beautiful.

Stunning church - make sure you take the tour!. Unbelievably beautiful church and the tour made it much more special. I think they only offer the walk-in tour (no reservations) a couple of times per week so make sure you consult the website to find out when it is offered. Led by volunteers but our guide was very knowledgeable and explained everything we saw. We got to go places on the tour that the general public was not allowed. Pictures just don't do this church justice - you really need to see to experience. My only wish was not getting to hear the beautiful organ music!!
Lovely. Well worth a visit , a beautiful church both inside and out. Busy around mass times but worth a visit and/or attending mass.

absolutely beautiful!. even though it's a church, its look and history should be noted. it's centrally located between broadway and 30 rock so easy to get to it. well worth seeing and such a beautiful place.

Beautiful - Don't pass it up!. We have visited St Patrick's twice now, the first time it was under-construction (2015). We returned this visit to take in the beauty of this cathedral, it's amazing to just take in the history of the Catholic Church, we're not Catholic, so I'm certain we don't appreciate all the mini-pray stations within, but it's amazing to just be there. Besides it's got AC and plenty of seating to rest.

Beautiful Cathedral in the midst of the skyscrapers. We spotted St Patricks from the top of The Rockerfella Centre and asked the guide about it. When we left we went straight to see this magnificent place of worship. It is absolutely stunning and unbelievably serene. No matter what religion you follow, be sure to visit this stunning piece of architecture and take a seat and some time to reflect - you won't regret it!

Peace. This cathedral soothes my soul. The sound within this church is like nowhere else, and the artistry of the stained glass windows, the statues, the architecture, all come together in a way that makes one's problems seem very small, very manageable.
Wow. even if you are not religious this is a must see. this Cathedral is amazing. the stained glass is a masterpiece.the architechture outside and in is breathtaking

Quiet space within a busy city. Beautiful Cathedral right on Madison Avenue! We were able to light candles for the health of friends, and sit in the pews and admire the soaring architecture and beautiful stained glass windows.
beautiful archetecture. if you have spare time in nyc after doing all the typically tourist things its worth a visit the archetecture is good

Magnificently peaceful!. ...while our girls were skating at Rock Center one evening....my husband and I turned the corner to see this beautiful and iconic cathedral-- what a sight! Lit up and so inviting...we wondered in, felt compelled to sit and reflect. (My sweet father had died 2 nites prior...). I was helped immensely by this refuge...lit candles and felt some relief as I headed back out into the NYC hustle and bustle.
Breathtaking. Even for this non Catholic, Southern Baptist kid (okay middle aged guy), this place is simply beautiful. A must see when in midtown.

Beautiful - visit irrespective of religion. Although this is a Roman Catholic Cathedral, it is welcoming to all. It is nice to stop by and sit for 5 or 10 mins amid the rush of the city. Mass continues as tourists wander around.
Beautiful, Beautiful, Beautiful. We just stopped by for a quick look, church service was going on so we didn't stay very long. It is so beautiful!

Worth a visit. Impressive structure, well worth a visit but a far more Gothic and much warmer cathedral size church is virtually across the street -- St Thomas Episcopal Church. If you like choral music, time your visit at St. Thomas to coincide with Evensong (around 5:30 PM) when the boys choir is singing.
Impressive architecture!. Impressive architecture recently renovated to its original splendor. A religious temple worth visiting; take some time to worship.

Beautiful but no atmosphere. Probably spoiled by having seen many of the great European cathedrals, I did appreciate the architectural splendour of this cathedral, but it didn't feel like such a great achievement compared to much much older ones and the fact it was ludicrously busy with people taking selfies and chattering meant any spiritual or religious atmosphere was lost. St Patrick's just didn't make me tingle like other cathedrals do. I feel a bit mean saying that but unless it really is on your must do list, there are probably better options of spending your time.

Beautiful Renovation. End of a huge restoration, we were there due to a Mass for the awarding of Boy Scout's Ad Altare Dei Medal. Many years visiting there and have never seen it better. A commemorative book detailing what was done is available in the Cathedral Bookstore there or online.

Stunning!. You should definitely stop here even if you are not Catholic and/or religious. The architecture is gorgeous and is definitely worth a look around inside and out. The last time I was there, they had scaffolding around the outside so I was nice to see the exterior without it this time. There was a mass going on when we were there so I didn't look around as much but make sure you look up at the stained glass and the ceiling.

Beautiful Midtown Cathedral. This place has been visited and used by many dignitaries and celebrities, but is worth seeing in its own right! Stunning exterior, and beautiful inside as well. Very close to Rockefeller Center.
Beautiiful. The church is beautiful, too bad it was in restoration work when I went. For those who like to get in religious temples is a great choice.
