Corpus Christi. We came for Sunday mass on 5/29/16 which was the feast of Corpus Christi. It was a moving and beautiful mass by the bishop. He explained the significance while also honoring all the service men and women in attendance. The 10:15 mass has the choir which are amazing. The sound like angels singing from heaven. I truly enjoyed the mass and hope to return one day.
WOW. You have to go to the cathedral and see inside. Please respect this is a place of worship so don't be loud. The building is a gorgeous piece of architecture. Enjoy

Restored and beautiful!. St. Pat's was shrouded in scaffolding when we visited last year. Now all the restoration is complete, and the cathedral is sparkling inside and out. Unbelievable that such a large cathedral is located in midtown Manhattan.
Mesmorizing. The statues and stained glass are beautiful. There was a wedding about to start when we were there so part of the center area was roped off.

Beautiful . It's a large modern but traditionally styled Cathedral. Arguably its what a Cathedral "should" look like. It's light inside with great views and sightlines thanks to slender pillars. As a place of worship it is superb. As a living presence on the heart of a busy city - wow!
Renovated Cathedral. The Cathedral was renovated for Pope Francis visit to NYC. It is absolutely gorgeous. It is a must see for most, but especially those of the Catholic faith.

Absolutely beautiful. Had been wanting to visit here on my previous two trips to NYC and never made it. We finally did. Even though we are not a religious family I found it very moving. Sat and admired the surrounding beauty. Could have stayed longer, but other sights were calling my name. Very serene atmosphere.
WOW, we seen a couple getting married. One of the greatest churches I have ever been to, and that is including churches in Munich Germany and New Orleans!

Amazing!. You will be amazed and awed as you walk into St. Patrick's Cathedral. It is all cleaned up and sparkling clean. The stain glass windows are so colorful and detailed. I really enjoyed the beauty of the architecture.

Breathtaking!. You should definitely stop in if you're anywhere near the cathedral. It is absolutely magnificent to behold. If you're lucky, you may end up there during a mass, which is quite a moving experience as well.
Beautiful!!!. Even if you are not Catholic, this church is awe inspiring. The architecture and all of the stained glass is worth the visit.
Breathtaking place to visit.. Beautiful building to visit when in the city. Huge and amazing history. You can even attend noon mass if your in the area.

Looks Shiny and Clean. Recent restoration has brought out the beauty of the structure in and out. Everything is so bright and clean. A wonderful Cathedral with much detail in side altars and statues. A must see in one's lifetime!

Beautiful church. Looks great since renovations work has been completed.. As an Irish girl this is a place I love to go. Even though it's really busy the staff demand a respectful atmosphere which is exactly appropriate. Lovely to take a bit of time out here in the peace and quiet amidst the busy NYC streets.
St. Patrick's Cathedral. Newly cleaned and renovated. It is beautiful! Stop by to see this beautiful church. They have a St. Patrick's Cathedral coin you can purchase along with a gift shop.

Amazing. So much detail inside. It's beautiful to see. I went after Christmas, so all the decorations were up. There is so much to take in the details of the statues and everything from floor to ceiling.

Breathtaking Architecture!. We walked to St. Patrick's Cathedral from Rockefeller Center! So glad we did not miss this Breathtaking Cathedral! We enjoyed the beautiful architect and stain glasses window. We were in awwww the whole time we were there.

Beautiful architecture, nice your guide. I attended with my students. The guided tour was fantastic and the guide knowledgeable. This is worth the time to see ... Even if you are not religious our is a wonderfully crafted cathedral

Beauitful. This is a very beauitful church! I was lucky enough to listen to the gospel during Sunday mass! It is a must attend mass so pretty inside. The church was full of people found it wonderfully amazing😄

the catholic chuch is beautifuil. it is great church I only visit and say a prayer but I love that it has lots of history..
I was surprise to see that they have guard in the door.
never had seen this before felt like I was entering the court house

A stunning place, well worth going out of the way for. We happened on this place as we were walking down Madison and went in. It was a truly wonderful experience. Did not know that there was such a nice cathedral in the heart of NYC.
Beautiful. Went with my mother in law to Sunday service 10:15 the choir was good and the sermon was so so but over all a good experience.
stunningly beautiful architecture. Was busy inside, but no queue to get in- gorgeous architecture, stained glass windows and ornate large high ceiling.
holy experiance. it is truly a beautiful humungus cathederal that once there one feels close to god in a fancy way it feels like a castle
Impressive. Beautiful cathedral. A place of calm and quiet, The stained glass is fabulous. Right on 5th Avenue so can't miss it. Exterior of building has been cleaned and looks great. Worth a visit.
St. Patrick's Cathedral. What a beautiful cathedral. The architecture is a must see. It's nice to see people respect such a church.
Historic gem.. I go in to the church every time I am in NYC. I light a candle, say a prayer and start to cry. The church is stunning and you feel at peace inside no matter how busy it is outside.

Now This Is Awesome !. All to often, I hear the word "awesome" used describing things that really aren't.When you visit St. Pat's for a service or just to look inside, you will see what awesome is really all about.Originally built with private funds contributed by parishioners during the late 1800's,the church is filled with so many historical events since then, most recently the Pope's visit last year. And all of this made even more awesome by the completion of the amazing interior and exterior sand blasting, returning the cathedral and all it's intentions to their full beauty and glory.

Stunning!! Must Go Inside!. Absolutely gorgeous!! Be sure you go inside and walk around. This was definitely one of my favorite places to see in NYC. Don't miss it! Just down the street from Rockefeller Center so easy to do both on the same day.
Great. A very nice cathedral and amazing history right on the 5th avenue. It was very nice to see how many people visit and follow the church during the weekend

Largest Roman Catholic Cathedral in the USA. You must visit and admire the beautiful architect inside and out. The inside has many side altars dedicated to saints and holy figures. I loved the stained glasses.
OUTSTANDING CATHEDRAL. I had visited previously but this time the area behind the main altar was open so ventured there as well. This is a magnificent Cathedral and well worth a visit.

Holy Thursday service that was heavenly.. We were awed with the renewed splendor of the Cathedral's appearance both internally and externally; just what we would want for ourselves. The organ and choir were as you could imagine to hear in heaven. The participation of the congregants and the message delivered by Cardinal Dolan were all exemplary. This was on the 25th anniversary of a Salvadoran Archbishop being assassinated for speaking up against an exploitive government. All very moving in this day and age. It was the late afternoon service and barely a seat was available.

Walk in and see it. Rivals the old churches of Europe. We got to see a wedding ( the Bride walk down the loooog isle.The church is so beautiful The organ played and the vibrations go though your body.It's free and not to be missed.

Beautiful!. The cathedral is so tiny compared to the skyscrapers alongside it,but this building has more beauty in the architecture than all those huge buildings put together! Stunning inside and out .
Beautiful Renovation. This is a lovely church that has been completely renovated - it is worth going in for a few minutes to relax and take a reprieve from all the walking you will do in NYC.

Beautiful cathedral in the middle of Manhattan. St. Patrick's Cathedral is an awesome structure. It is located right in the middle of all the shopping and commotion on 5th Avenue and nearby Rockefeller Center. A nice respite spot for some quiet and reflection.

Blessed place amid the bustle of the city.. What you expect a cathedral to be. Huge, beautiful, inspiring. We happened to enter during Mass on a Monday and the organ and choir were in full voice. A welcoming place where tourists were encouraged to enter quietly in the back of the church and view the interior. Photos with no flash were allowed. Nice gift shop (why not?).
Beautiful. Prettiest Cathedral I've ever seen and I am Catholic. It was great how mass was going on and everyone inside was very quiet and respectful as they viewed the church. Easy to get to

Stunning Inside and Out. What a lovely cathedral. It's quite special to attend a service there. Look closely for the details like the different stones used and the wood carvings around the organ pipes.
Beautiful church. It reminded me of the churches in Europe except for the up keep. This church was beautiful inside and outside. Very large with beautify glass stained windows and statues.

Absolutely Beautiful Cathedral. My wife and I were on vacation and had the pleasure to attend St. Patrick's Cathedral, enter through the Door of Mercy and attend the 5:30 pm Saturday Night Mass. St. Patrick's is located on 5th Avenue between 50 and 51st Street, New York City. An absolutely beautiful Cathedral to visit and worship.

Sunday Mass with The Choir. We were ecstatic that Cardinal Dolan officiated for the Mass we attended, and it was a thought-provoking lesson he provided. We are not Catholic; we were celebrants nonetheless.Close-circuit screens provide up-close views of the organists and choir members in the upper rear lofts.It does not seam like a Manhattan Sunday if we do do not visit St. Patrick's for a mass and music.Crowds in the rear and in the small gift shops; be patient.

Beautiful Cathedral. I was on a tour that stopped here for about 15 minutes. I had been here about 3 years ago and was glad to see all the scaffolding was down and you could see all the beautiful things the cathedral has to offer. Nice stop and a beautiful history rich cathedral.
Oh! What Beauty! . Got to enter on Sunday morning, during services. Such a wondrous, beautiful sanctuary. Didn't stay to worship, just long enough to admire the structure.
Stunning. The beauty and splendor of this cathedral is something not to be missed. I sat down in here for several minutes and soaked up the ambience. Do not miss this location when in NYC.

Beautiful altar!. When I am in NY I love starting and ending my vacation here. It is very peaceful the Cathedral itself is just gorgeous. Light a candle for a deceased loved one, or for a special petition and pray for everything under the sun.

Stunningly beautiful Cathedral. Wow, wow, wow. The cathedral is just amazing. We saw it for the first time at night, all lit up. The inside is spectacular as well. We made a point to come back the next day just to see the stained glass window in the daytime and it was worth the return visit. So beautiful!!

Magical. Located between the skyscrappers, this Cathedral is absolutely amazing and marvellous.
The inside is as beautiful as the outside.
You really can't miss this visit if you come to NY : it's a must do.
You'll really be stunned!!

Restored - beautiful island of peace in the heart of 5th avenue. The beauty of St Patrick's cathedral is that it never disappoints!
On top of being preserved as a cult place ( you can't move around during the services ) it is very well maintained with beautiful glass windows and architecture!
You Have to stop there!

Always a must!. Beautifully breathtaking and peaceful. Light a candle for loved ones or make time to take in a mass. One of my favorite places to go when visiting NYC. It really brings you back to a peaceful place in the fast pace of the city.

Midtown Manhattan Majestic. Opulent. Reverent. Majestic. This architectural marvel and spiritual oasis in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, attracts tourists and worshippers worldwide. Pictures only hint at the breathtaking beauty inside. Take a break from the midtown hustle and add St. Patrick's Cathedral to your travel itinerary.
Sunday Holy Mass in 4 or 5 language. I enjoy the atmosphere and the Holy Mass in different languages: I feel at home in this place. A must see in N.Y.C

Beautiful. A gorgeous cathedral in the heart of Manhattan trendy 5th ave stores.
Just been renovated and finally all cleaned up.

Add This To Your List of Things To See. Very beautiful church that encapsulates the history and tradition of New York City churches. My wife and I stopped in and lit candles and said prayers for our marriage and our children.
Beautiful cathedral in heart of the city. Go through the jubilee door of mercy if you are Catholic for the special year. Lovely inside and mass is beautiful. Lots of side altars for saints.
Fit is Free. Unusual for a service that is free.For visitors, a free ride to enjoy the Statue of Liberty.If need be, disembark and enjoy the ISland

My wedding. This is the most beautiful place. A must see. You can tell why it took 20 years to build. I went to NYC to get married in the middle of Times Square , but changed our mind and did our ceremony on the steps as you go into the church ! How fun was that ?

Stunningly beautiful. It's hard to wrap your head around the beautiful architecture of this building. Inside and out, it is amazing beautiful. Donations are accepted. It is massive with many statues of the various saints.

Gorgeous. This is one of my favorite sites in NYC. I always loved the Gothic architecture style that you see on a lot of the cathedrals. It's ornate and regal and just beautiful. St. Patrick's also has that feeling of being connected to something ancient and stoic. The stained glass is fantastic and the church just underwent a huge restoration project from 2012-15. Whether you're religious or not it's an amazing landmark.

Soaringly beautiful, quiet time of reflection. This gorgeous church was perfectfor a 7am Mass visit. It felt nearly empty, but as the communion line passed I realized there were at least a hundred people there. The aide altars were each unique and beautiful, and the high altar magnificent. This place is a testimony to man's desire to glorify God.

Catholic or not YOU MUST GO IN and you are WELOME THERE. Please if you are not Catholic do not feel odd to drop in. YES there are many people in pews praying but it's OK they know there are in a FAMOUS TOURIST SPOT. What I found was nice is there was little leaflets with the not only a bit of history of the Cathedral but also included the rosary (short version) and 2 other top catholic prayers. PLEASE GO you will not be DISAPPOINTED
Beautiful. Absolutely gorgeous. I loved seeing the churches in Europe and this one is right up there with them.
Beautiful and overwhelmingly peaceful. The whole structure is really beautiful with incredible stain glass windows. It was a peaceful retreat from the hectic chaos outside.

Mass is amazing!. Sunday Mass when Cardinal Dolan celebrates is fantastic. He speaks to Catholics with energy and dogma, yet still remembers tourists who may be non-Catholics might be present and is welcoming and cordial. Great place for Sunday Mass. Oh, did I forget to mention the building itself is beautiful and awe-inspiring?

Right in the heart of Manhattan. Recently renovated, St. Pat's is on Fifth Avenue directly opposite Rockefeller Center at 50th Street. Windows are beautiful and ambiance is very peaceful - a nice break from the noise and bustle of the city.
St. Patricks' is a MUST SEE for any NYC visitor. We happened to be walking by on Sunday morning during our NYC visit and stopped in. I was honestly moved by the elegance and beauty of this structure.

Amazing!. We felt like we were in a grand cathedral in Europe. This recently renovated church is amazing no matter where you look, especially up and at all the stained glass windows. Well worth the time to get there!

Beautiful cathedral. Now the Renovations are finished St Patricks shines again in its full glory. Its a beautiful building and irrelevant to your beliefs its a must to visit, like visiting any Grand cathedral in any other City of the Word. St. Patricks appitimizes NY especially the Irish Community. The side chapels and Main naive are beautiful and it is a pleasure to sit and rest and reflect in this peaceful atmosphere
wonderful. We walked straight into a church service overseen by the cardinal. Simply wonderful. The building is nice but nothing on the grander scale of churches in the UK, considering its the USA.

A religious experience even if you're not Catholic. St. Patrick's in NY's Catholic cathedral. It's also an architectural wonder that makes you feel you're in a holy place, even if you don't practice Catholicism. At least that's what my non-Catholic friends say. From seeing the people who visit and just stand in awe, I have to agree with them. You can attend Mass, you can visit small chapels that surround the main church, and you can visit the gift shop. If you're looking for a little reflection time while you're in NYC, this is the place.

Amazing. what an beautiful church and mesmerizing areas of prayer for many saints. truly beautiful. Would've liked to have know when masses are. appreciated that there was an area to light memorial candles at each saint

An incredible building and place of worship!. I am so pleased that we made a special trip to see this fabulous building. As soon as you put a foot inside the Cathedral, you will feel calm- so different from the buzz and modernity of the other buildings in Maddison Avenue. The stained glass windows are a spectacle in themselves, but it is fantastic to spend a little time at each of the little chapels around the sides of the building to read about each saint commemorated. Each person visiting was there for their own reasons - some to look at the architecture, the paintings, the chapels, to pray, to listen to the music or to attend a service, but all were united in their expressions of awe at this buitiful place of worship.

Nice Church. We were there for the Saturday service that we enjoyed. People visiting the church during the service were very respectful and quiet, the cathedral is a pretty one especially now with all the restoration done to it.

The peaceful experience. A must see! A beautiful cathedral squeezed between the skyscrapers. This place gives me peace. I really love praying or just sitting in peace just escaping the crowded city for a while.
NOT EVEN CATHOLIC. As a native New Yorker I've stopped into "St.Pattys" a number of times. It is a large building and inspirational to all that enter it's doors. No matter your denomination .

Awe-inspiring. This is a magnificent Cathedral. If you can't make it to Saturday or Sunday mass, You can enter, have a seat at a pew and just take in the beauty of it all. You just might get lucky and hear the choir practicing. I like to stop in and light a prayer candle for family or friends. You can leave a small donation in the box near any of the candle displays. The Cathedral has a Tour app you can down load for free or for a fee you can call for a Guided tour. They even have a gift shop inside the Cathedral. It's free to enter & Yes, you can take pictures inside.

A Heavanly Experience. When we visited St Patricks we were fortunate to observe a service for the benefit of the Firefighters of NYC. The service was conducted by the chaplain of the Fire Department and his commentary about NYC firefighters and their dedication was very inspiring. The cathedral was within walking distance of our mid town hotel and conveniently located for a stroll down 5th Ave after the service.
Still working on cleaning it up. The cathedral is still spectacular to visit but the experience is too controlled due to the crowds. Many of the tourists seem to forget this is a place of worship.

Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful cathedral recently renovated to its full original splendor. A true place of peace. A break from the New York chaotic buzz noise and materialism. A lot of history in this beautiful church. The organ playing was incredible. A must see.

Worth going. Beautiful church. I stop in each time I am in NYC. I always feel so grateful when I am in there for all that is good. Last December, I witnessed a couple getting engaged. It was wonderful. Regardless of your religion or faith, stop in architecture. Sit down and take it in, say a small prayer to your higher being or meditate. It will do you well,
A rare treat. Not only was the cathedral beautiful, but we were lucky enough to be there when a student group was singing. The acoustics were fantastic!

Beautiful Church. This church is just breathtaking. The size is just enormous, in a city like New York that's unique. The outside is beautiful, but when you step inside, you will also be able to view the beauty inside of the church!Also visit the gift shop at the wets side of the church, just across the street!
Mezmerising beauty. This Cathedral is oozing with beauty - the beautiful stonework, blue stained glass windows, 'suspended' pipe organ and amazing flowers. It has a welcoming warmth within.
Awe inspiring. I find St Patrick's Cathedral to be a very tranquil and calming place. It's gorgeous.Please avoid going during mass out of respect for those worshipping
Cathedral. Nice quiet respite from the city hustle and bustle. enjoyed the tranquility of the place. again staff and security very polite and helpful
A must see. Should be visited by both believers and non- believers alike .The sung 9am mass on Sunday a great experience
Amazing. This was just breathtaking to see the architecture and the ornate stained glass windows. Don't miss this if you are out and about in the area.
Stunning cathedral. Spent thirty minutes just appreciating the beauty of the stained glass, statuary, organs, etc. A must see for all visitors!
beautiful cathedral. We attended a sunday mass at 10.30 in April. It was officiated by the cardinal who was really friendly and the service had an awesome choir and organist.Memorable.
Beautiful St. Patrick's Cathedral!. Just an awesome cathedral and we've seen a lot of them. Just totally beautiful and serene. We went in every time we walked by.A must see.
Not for a Sunday morning. We were allowed in during Sunday services. It was uncomfortable going in during that time (and crowded). I would have liked to have visited during a different time.

St. Patrick's Day. We try to visit St. Patrick's Cathedral whenever we're in NYC, but this time was special because it was St. Patrick's day. We enjoyed the parade and then attended Mass. The Cathedral has been renovated and looks fantastic! It is a holy place and is treated as such as visitors marvel at its immensity. A must-see for New York travelers.
amazing architecture. wow...just wow. the church is amazing and the architecture is fabulous and ive been to the best in italy and this is right up there
Beautiful. We stopped by here for a brief visit, it was absolutely beautiful. The architecture and stained glass were breath taking!

Love to attend Mass there while visiting NYC. Very beautiful
Lovely Sunday Religious Service.
One of the pretties
Cathedral in The United States,a must not matter your religious faith
Brief. . This a beautiful building. Absolutely jaw dropping. I did not go inside. You can spend a lot of time watching the play of light on the stone. It is a photographers dream.

Beautiful!. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a must-see if you're in the area. The breathtaking architecture and painted ceilings are awe inspiring. We stayed toward the back of the church since a service was going on. There were security people there to look in bags if you went past the back section. There were candles to light in prayer and most people there seemed very respectful of the place and spirit within. It doesn't take too long to see, so stop by if you're close.

Beautiful Cathedral. Just a block from the Rockefeller Center this beautiful church is worth a stop. Soaring gothic spires, stained glass window, and a large pipe organ are some of the features. Feel free to walk inside.
Beautiful. Beautiful. Actually, stunning. Mass going on when we visited. Lovely architecture and glass stained windows.
Out of nowhere this massive church!. Beautiful and free to the public! Worth a visit! There is quite a history to this place and is a testament to the history of New York

Amazing architecture. Always a joy coming here. Brought my 8th graders here to start off their class trip and they loved it. It is absolutely breathtaking inside and there is so much beautiful craftsmanship that went into building this. They don't make beautiful buildings like this any more. Also loved the gift shop and they now have a digital guest book that you can sign and also write in prayer requests. Always a great place to stop by if you are in the area!

Beautiful. The church is beautiful and marble, stained glass windows beautiful, I didn't like that you had to pay $2.00 to light a candle, it should be what you can afford since prayer should be free.

Breathtaking architecture. I'm not a religious person, but am always impressed by the artistry and work that goes into building churches. I've been in many, but this ranks up there with Westminster Abbey and Notre Dame. It is beautiful, with amazing stained glass and marble floors. Entry is free, but there is a box to leave an offering. Be prepared to have your bag searched before you enter - a sad reality in our society. This is well worth a visit for us secular folk. If you are a Catholic, you'll surely be impressed/
Tranquil. In a city like this, this place is an oasis of peace, we sat and just admired the building, the people milling around.

Lovely Church. This beautiful church is a tranquil spot in the madness of Midtown Manhattan. It is very peaceful and serene inside, reminded me of Notre Dame in Paris. Well worth looking inside if you are passing.
Looks Beautiful. First time to see the cathedral after being cleaned and restored. It is worth the visit even if you are not catholic. It is a peaceful space in midst of a shopping district.

Attractive Cathedral.... While not up there with the more beautiful cathedrals in the UK or Europe, this huge place of worship in the middle of the shopping district is nonetheless a head turner. It's sheer size is impressive although the interior is relatively sparse.
A very fine looker though, we sat at the back briefly and reflected.
I loved it...and I'm JEWISH!. It's been cleaned and restored recently. What a great way to take a break and enjoy the peace and inspiring architecture.
Beautiful. I know that living in france we have so many beautiful gothic cathedral. But this Is New York .and that makes very special . Butresses , statues stained glass windows the works.
St. Patrick's. Stopped by really quickly on a tour. Went inside to see the incredible cathedral. Mass was taking place so we didn't stay even though you are allowed to walk around during mass.

Must Visit. Architectural marvel.
A great spot to just sit back and take in the calm after the hustle and bustle of NYC!
Beautiful. St Patrick's is right downtown and easy to access. You are allowed right into the cathedral for no charge. It is beautiful and a great piece of architecture.
Amazing!. Had to see the historic, beautiful building. It is breath-taking, no matter what your religion is, it's a must see!

Worth a Visit. Excellent viewing for all, regardless of religious affiliation. The architecture is interesting for the U.S. Lovely spot in Midtown to stop and rest. Plenty of things to look at, nice explanations and looking very clean after the recent renovations. Close to many attractions and you can spend as much time as you like.
fanastic!. had a chance to see St. Patrick's, a truly amazing structure build in a time when the equipment was not like today. lots of history, beautiful Cathedral,

Architecturally Pleasing. This review is from April 2015, however, I am unable to select this option therefore the month and year listed are not accurate.As someone who's not very religious I am fascinated by the architect of this church. Booth inside and out the building was a never ending experience for me. The displays available were a sight to see, and cannot be fully experienced through photos. The Cathedral itself is open daily and many come and go like we did. It is however, unfortunate that we were not aware of the tours available to learn more. Never the less I did light a prayer candle (which costs $2, I believe). The next time we are in town, we will return and take a tour.

Impressive Pipe Organ. We were visting the St. Patrick Cathedral just a few minutes before 12am. Take one more minute an listen to the Pipe Organ at the beginning of the 12am Holy Mass. I only can say: Chicken Skin

St Patrick's Cathedral. If you are fond of magnificent decor then a visit to st Patrick's Cathedral is a must.It is free entry but the church would expect a donation should you light a candle and quite right too.On my visit there was actually a christening going on which was good to watch although somewhat public with the amount of people that were in the cathedral.

Just awesome. We lucked out on this trip and our visit to the Cathedral coincided with the presence of the choir and the church organ player who was fantastic. I don't know what choir specifically were there but that venue with those sounds and the organ in the back ground was phenomenal. I like the touch of the flat screens hanging on the pillars throughout the church so that no matter where you are in the church, you can see what is going on. Especially when you see what the organist has to do to get those fabulous sounds. This was a great trip and I'm not religious at all but would recommend anyone to visit this building. It is beautiful.

Lovely respite. Such a beautiful cathedral. Chapels are well signposted so the non Catholic can appreciate the meaning and intent behind each one. I love visiting this St. Patrick's after walking down 5th Avenue.

God's Amazing Grace+Architecure.. When we walk down 5th avenue on our first day, just right after we offloaded the plane, we passed by this very beautiful cathedral. I felt God's grandness and solemnity when I stepped in. I am a Catholic, and an Architect, so you must be wondering how appreciated this amazing Grace from God and Architecture.

Amazing. Regardless of your religious outlook this is a beautiful structure and worth the trip. I wanted to visit Trinity Church also but didn't have the time. If you are at any of the downtown spots like Macys, Empire State Building, Times Square you are easily within reach of St. Patricks.

It is breathtaking!. We watched them work on the church for a little while but that didn't stop us from visiting. It is simply magnificent. I love sitting and watching the people get filled with so much emotion. It does that to me as well. It is a clean, peaceful and lively church.

Grand Cathedral. Clearly, you must visit this great New York City landmark. A three year renovation project was completed last year in time for the Pope's visit. You'll notice that year's of grime has been removed from the exterior walls.There are many small shrines lining the walls of the main sanctuary. We were surprised to find one honoring the "Black Madonna". We visited the original in Czestochowa, Poland in September 2014. Attached is a photo of the Saint Patrick's shrine.

It is OK... I have seen better. We went to NYC for our anniversary in dec 2014 and we visited this Cathedral because it is famous and because a Christmas concert performed there. But the chuchr was having repairments inside, and it was so crowded, so it was difficult to enjoy the concert and to admire the architecture... also I did not like the musicians, we went outside and found another very small church and some boys singing outside and that was better.
Remarkable cathedral.. Annual trip to NYC always includes Sunday at St. Patrick's. 10:15 service on Mother's Day was not overly crowded. Organist and choir are very good.

Beautiful cathedral and nice Sunday Mass. We attended Mass here on Sunday and I am ashamed to admit that I was a little distracted from the Mass by the beautiful architectural features. It is quite beautiful and has a lot of visual details that I would love to have seen closer up. Wish we would have spent more time or maybe taken a tour of the cathedral instead of trying to see it while attending Mass. The Mass was very beautiful with the lovely organ music and cantor, and it was one of the quickest Masses I have ever attended (about 45 mins.). Be prepared to go through a security check upon entering the cathedral (even for Mass) and possibly to receive communion from a man who looks like Secret Service, complete with dark suit & wired ear piece LOL.

Not the most extravagant I've seen but still nice..... You don't need to be catholic to get in or attend mass. Go in, light some candles or just observe for a few moments.... It's not a must see. If you're coincidentally nearby, go on in.... if you're not, and cathedrals don't intrigue you..... you're not missing out. I'd go back to attend mass only.

Stunning Cathedral. St. Patrick's Cathedral, is one of the most stunning cathedrals in the world. We are so lucky that it is in New York. Every step was visually intriguing, I could easily sit for an hour or so if I had the time and just admire the beauty.
"Majestic". " ST. Patrick's Cathedral " is MAJESTIC", both inside and outside. Captivating in everyway. It is truly GLORIOUS. Each time we visit NYC we make sure we come here.

One of my favorite churches of all time. I always go to see this church when I go to Manhattan. It is absolutely beautiful and so well preserved.We happened to catch high mass on a Sunday and heard the choir and the beautiful pipe organ. Even if you are not a Catholic, they are both real treats to hear. Frankincense was in the air, so that mass was the full Catholic experience. They now have TV monitors for those who are in the back so they can see what is going on up on the altar.If you go for Mass, be sure to come back and see it when nothing is going on as you can leisurely stroll around enjoying the arts within this wonderful cathedral.I thought I remembered a garden to the side of the church but there was nothing there when I went - the grounds were under construction.
Magnificent Cathedral. Famous Cathedral that reminds us of grand European cathedrals. Great architecture and free also. Must see.
A National Treasure. I was totally in awe of this gorgeous cathedral. Mass was in session, but I stopped to light a candle and say a prayer.

Inspiring. If you are in New York St. Patrick's Cathedral is a must see. It is awe inspiring on so many levels. The church is usually filled with tourists/Christians attending this iconic structure of the Catholic Church. The renovation is coming along nicely. So go.

Mother's Day Mass. My family went to St. Patrick's Cathedral for Mother's Day this weekend. My wife and I thought the mass was very nice and could not believe how clean and refurbished the outside looked after the Pope had been in the city.

A Place of Warmth and Peace Among Concrete and Glass Towers. On a rainy, cold, gloomy Saturday we visited the cathedral while a wedding was going on. The lights were on, it was full of beautiful flowers and people at the wedding in nice clothes. A nice, warm contrast to what we'd just come from. A conclave among the glass and concrete towers that surround it. Even with lots of people inside, it is peaceful within. A nice change of pace in a very busy city.
Beautiful cathedral. Gorgeous architecture on the outside, and even more detail on the inside! Free to enter and they don't mind you taking pics!

Must see attraction in NYC. We visit St. Patrick's Cathedral every trip we make to New York City. No matter what religion you are, it is a wonderful experience. You just go up and down the aisles viewing statue after statue, with a history to go along with each one. An experience you won't want to miss.

Even heathens can appreciate the architecture. A beautiful building with impressive light coloured stone,not the dark stone found in many neo gothic piles. There are a few interesting shops in the neighbourhood also
Stunning. Beautiful cathedral, open to the public for free, beautiful stained glass windows, quiet, neat to see the exterior and interior
stunning. This is one amazing church. both inside and out. worth your time to go in and walk around. Would have loved to hear the pipe organ

Stunning - privileged to go to Easter Sunday Mass. Spent a lovely Easter Sunday watching the people of New York in their Easter Bonnets and then went into an Easter Service.The Cathedral is stunning, outside and in, a must see!

Breathtaking and Emotional. I don't care what religion you are; when you walk through those doors something special enters you. I get the same feeling visiting St Patrick's as I do when I visit the Vatican. The beauty of the structure and the warmth and magical feelings is something for all to experience. You don't have to be religious to experience the grandeur and peacefulness of this very special place. Every trip into the city I stop for a little comfort

Stunning Renovations. They finished the renovations at St.Patrick's Cathedral for the Pope's visit, and it looks better than ever. The outside is so white that it actually looks like a new building. The inside is a magnificent marvel.
Amazing place to see!. The is a free must do in NYC, once you enter the doors, your eyes will be amazed! Sit down and take in the workmanship from the past. Wow is all I can say. Enjoy.

Beautiful. This cathedral looks like it should be in the middle of Europe, not NYC. If you're lucky, you can see a choir perform. The acoustics and beauty of the music in this wonderful place will give you goosebumps.
Attended Mass - Worship a joy. All of the people who volunteered at the church were very friendly and helpful. They were efficient and made entering and leaving seamless
peaceful. weather religious or not its a nice peaceful place to be and close to the Rockefeller, has been in a few movie scenes too
Impressive cathedral. Wonderful and impressive cathedral, the exterior looks very nice. Cross the street and YOU can visit Rockefeller Center and nearby a big Saks Fith Avenue store.
Very cool. Love the architecture and stained glass. Very iconic! Open to the public even on Sunday. You are able to walk around and explore on your own. HUGE church!
Stained glass amazing. And finding your favourite alter to light a candle. The stations of the cross are also pretty spectacular.

Gorgeous church. St. Patrick's is likely one of the more famous churches in NYC, if not in the world. I visited years ago when a friend dragged me to Mass there (I'm most def not Catholic). But it's gorgeous inside, and worth a visit, no matter your faith.
AMAZING. What a sight to behold and its free. The architecture is stunning and dont forget to look closer to see some of the smaller parts. We loved it.....
Beautiful Church. Being a Catholic I wanted to visit St Patrick's Cathedral, what a beautiful place. The organ was playing during our visit, how moving. Wow

A Sight to Behold & Totally Free!. This is an absolutely amazing structure! Whether you look at the "big picture" or examine some of the architecture up close, it is all just incredible. Each column is 5 feet across and there are so many holding up this great cathedral, the ceiling is over 100 feet high. The pipe organ is massive.St. Patrick's is less than a block from Rockefeller Center and it is totally free to visit - kind of a rare thing in NYC.

Beautiful cathedral . It is an iconic cathedral located very close to Rockefeller Center, and a lot of terrific shopping. The building itself is outstanding. Bring a wide angle to take a photo of the outside. It is very difficult to shoot the whole cathedral without one.

Amazing. The church was having a construction inside so the beauty of the inside was covered by scalfholdings however it doesn't change the solemnity of the place. The place was solemn, we attended the Sunday mass. Beautiful mass

Beautiful landmark. In between shopping and sightseeing, you must stop in this beautiful cathedral you would have seen in the news and multiple TV shows. Its so peaceful inside and beautiful to walk around.
Churches. We just had a peek inside as there were services going on. The presbytarian church opposite is also worth going to when they are holding a xmas service

Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful cathedral. It ranks with some I have seen in Europe. Of course over the top as far as money invested in it, but that is a cathedral. If you are in NYC a quick stop inside the cathedral is worth your time.
Beautiful Cathedral. Attended mass at the Cathedral officiated by the Cardinal. Beautiful Choir. This church is just breathtaking.
OMG - no pun intended. I walked in during mass. The organ playing was lovely. The design and craftsmanship is impeccable. Open to all who care to enter. I was nice to see.
Located near the rock!. Always a beautiful site, serene and peacefully. Great architecture. Stop by and say a prayer when in New York!

Breathtaking. From the minute you walk in, you feel the higher power with you. The cathedral is truly the most beautiful building I have ever been in. We sat for quite a while just looking at the art and stained glass. I feel very fortunate that I was able to visit this amazing place.
Most beautiful church. When we visited in 2011, it was closed for remodeling. We had the opportunity to stop in this trip. WOW is all I could say. The most awesome church !

Beautiful Cathedral. A very large and beautiful cathedral in the middle of Manhattan. Everyone seemed respectful. Appreciated the fact that there was small out of the way sections for those who wished to pray.

Such a beautiful Cathedral. I never go to New York without making a visit to St. Patrick's .....I go to light candles and say a prayer for my family and friends. Close to Rockefeller Center so why not go visit it's a beautiful sight.
A beautiful church enjoyed by all.. Always a peaceful, moving experience. It brings together all of mankind under one roof no matter what race, religion or skin color you may be.
Breathtaking. The cathedral was being renovated when we were there last year, so we were looking forward to seeing the results. Beautiful!
Wow!. We walked to st Patrick's cathedral to kill some time while waiting for our time slot for top of the rock.....wow! Was not expecting to see such beauty! Incredible cathedral !
Beautiful and welcoming to all. Worth a visit if you are in the neighborhood. If you happen to be there around mass you can hear the choir warming up. They sound fantastic.
Beautiful cathedral. St. Patrick's Cathedral is right in the heart of mid town Manhattan. The architecture is striking as you walk by and it's worth popping in and say how amazing this cathedral is.
Inspiring cathedral - traditional NYC landmark. t is not a trip to NYC without stopping by St Patrick's Cathedral, beautiful cathedral inside and out -awe inspiring!

Impressive Architecture. St. Patrick's Cathedral ... an iconic symbol of Christianity in upscale 5th Avenue. The architecture is impressive. This is NYC's answer to the Notre Dame Cathedral. A must visit.
Service at 5:30 pm on weekdays is perfect for tourists who may happen to be in the vicinity of Rockefeller center.
Beautiful Roman Catholic Cathedral. A very beautiful cathedral, especially since the outside was cleaned. I attended a spanish language mass on a Sunday evening.

Busy church!. This church is another tourist stop in NY, so there are always people checking it out. It is busy with both parishioners and tourist. You might as well check it out if you're in the area.

Beyond Beautiful. This cathedral is one of the most beautiful I have ever seen. The restoration has brought the exterior back in such a way as to illuminate the street. Check schedules for guided or unguided tour access. Prepare to spend at least 1-1/2 hours to truly appreciate it.

Amazing place to visit. I really enjoyed going to St. Patrick's Cathedral. Even if you are not religious, it is a beautiful work of art to see. The details are amazing and gives you a sense of peace as soon as you walk in. You feel like there is nothing else around you except the beautiful surroundings you are in.
Inspiring architecture. St. Patrick's soars, and hopefully it lifts your spirit as well. If you are attending a service, and the music is important, you may want to avoid the 7am Sunday Mass.
St Patrick's Cathedral is Amazing. We visited during a service the music was like listening to the angels sing. The church I believe is over 200 years old and is absolutely beautiful. A must see!

One of the most beautiful churches I've ever seen in the US.. I honestly didn't know a cathedral existed like this outside of Europe. It's beautiful and breathtaking. It was definitely a highlight of my trip. LOVED this beautiful church.
Absolutely breathtaking!. Beautiful architecture! One of the most impressive sites of the city! So much history and absolutely beautiful. Free admission....you can donate if you wish to.
A must see. Beautiful Cathedral, go in, light a candle and pray a little. It is right on Fifth Avenue, around the great stores.

One of the most beautiful churches in the world. The architecture of this church is really beautiful! The size of the church is huge! I was amazed when I walked in. And I have seen my fair share of churches. But what impressed me most was the amount of people that go to mass here. Our first visit was on a Tuesday and there were more people in the afternoon then we have on a Sunday in our own church. And the masses are every hour of the day. This church makes you a proud Catholic!
Hidden in the middle of tall buildings. A beautiful gem of a church hidden among the stark contrast of glass and steel on Madison Avenue. Lovely architecture and graveyard.

Always inspiring. We get to NYC a couple of times each year and we have to spend some time in St. Patrick's. So awe-inspiring. We've been to many churches around Europe and this may be the most beautiful.

mass for my mother. it is always a pleasure when in the city to visit St. Patrick's it is truly a special place. there was a mass offered for my mother which made it extra special. Everyone should visit at least once

Beautiful. I am not that fond of churches but this one was impressive to me. It was very easy to find. It felt airy inside with not too many tourists. The staff were also friendly and welcoming (as opposed to the staff from Westminster Abbey in London).
It was very beautiful inside. Worth a visit.

Good for an American Cathedral. So, having been to England and Italy, cathedrals are something I love to visit. St. Patrick's is a beautiful place, with great architecture, but I feel like it could use a good thousand years under its belt to be truly as inspiring as its European counterparts.
AMAZING. This cathedral is marvelous. beautiful stained glass, great gift shop, a pure beauty. Love the fact that there is security at the entrance.
Beautiful church!. Toured through with the kids...excellent church. Lots of opportunities for candles and moments of reflection.
Stunningly beautiful. I felt very connected to my catolic upbringing and it was nice to take a break from the busy city streets to say a prayer and marvel at the architecture.
Choir so good. Sunday morning attended mass. Spiritual! Could see everything that was going on. Bit surprised by the body guards have to say.

Stunning. The architecture, ambience and peacefulness you get by just looking at the cathedral is very calming. Going in gives you a lot of peace. It's a work of art. The carvings and attention to detail is very intricate.

Beautiful Cathedral. Along with several other old and beautiful cathedrals in New York,this one is where many important events have taken place. Take time to be silent and absorb the beauty of this masterpiece.
Stunning and peaceful. We went to St. Patrick's in the evening. Cathedral is beautiful and peaceful. Lit a candle and spent time reflecting on the day.
Not for quite reflection. Was disappointed as was expecting more spiritual visit but was just another tourist attraction. Being told who much to pay to light a candle was rather vulgar

Truly awe inspiring place to visit. What a specticle of architecture!!!! From the moment you capture your first sites of this structure you are blown away. From the grand doors you first see as you walk up the steps to the truly beauty inside you are astounded by the feat it was to construct this structure. We always make it a point to stop in here while visiting the city to grab a few minutes of quietness and reflect... before heading back out into the real world. It truly is a must see when you visit the city..
Beautiful church. We were in time for mass. Beautiful cathedral and in the middle of New York City. Walk around and say a pray for us...
Breathtaking cathedral. Although crowded with tourists it's an amazing interior masterpiece. After walking the interior perimeter, I sat down to absorb it's aura.
Easter Mass. While vacationing in New York, we were able to attend mass at St. Patrick's. The timing was great as the Easter Parade was going on with everyone showing off their new hats.
Magnificent . What an amazing structure. It has had some renovations and looks new with amazing light. It was busy with tourists yet exuded a peace and solitude only a powerful cathedral can.
Beautiful architecture. Free to public but they do accept donations. The cathedral is absolutely beautiful. I recommend visiting.
Must see. Beautiful especially at Christmas... A must see church newly renovated and looks beautiful...Recently visited by the pope.And a beautiful private Blessed mother in the rear of the church ..

Whether for Mass or a Quite Prayer. I never go to the City without at least stopping in for prayers and when possible Mass. Few large Gothic Cathedral have a feeling of intimacy. As you visit one of the many shrines your reflections find a spiritual purpose.

A peaceful place amidst chaotic manhattan. I love how St Patrick's looks after the renovation. It certainly stands out more along 5th avenue surrounded by office buildings. I think security could be tighter but understandably it is an active church. The security personnel are very friendly & warm especially towards tourists & visitors. It's great that they have daily masses.

Beautiful architectural building. It would be enough to just walk by and study the architecture. It is an excellent example of the type of buildings that aren't built anymore. A trip inside is a treat also.

This is a wonderful place - a house of prayer and a monument to the contributions of emigrants.. Great place to visit.
If you are in New York and of no faith or one, it is well worth a visit. A real oasis in the midst of all the hustle and the bustle. Stop in for a quiet reflection.
One of my favorites. One of the best places to visit in NYC. Gorgeous architecture, beautiful construction. Definitely worth popping in for an hour.
Wow. Even if you're not religious, the architecture is incredible. No wonder it took some 20 years to build!

April 2016 visit. We saw this building from above ,from the Top of the Rock and had to visit it as it was close by.From the outside the Cathedral belies the size of the interior, its grace and beauty. It is wonderfully lite and the sound of song is perfect. The Pope has visited this Cathedral twice already and given Mass.Just a pleasure to be there.

An immaculate edifice. A vast and beautiful building, it was given a two year long clean up prior to the Pope's visit, and to say that it is immaculate is not doing it justice. I no longer believe in God or similar inventions, but when you see the scale of this, it certainly tests your assumptions! It was my first visit to New York, and in talking to many locals, they do take their religion seriously, whilst also professing that church attendances are dwindling. O lot of money has been spent here, presumably that of the faithful as well as the City, and, whatever your beliefs, go and admire the quality of the work. If only I'd been there when the organ was being played.

Wonderful Mass. We attended the 10.30am Sunday Mass after reading about the choir and invited other members of our touring friendship group to come long. A wonderful and uplifting spiritual experience. A sermon that spoke about the need to keep things simple really touched all of our group attending. We were still talking about it a week later when we all caught up again on the West Coast.

Amazin Gothjic Style Church. Well. the church was actually built in the 19th century - which is a couple of hundred years late for a "real" Gothic church. No big deal - the Europeans did the same as well. Plus during the Gothic periods the buffaloes were still roaming the prairie in America. Other that that the building is amazing. Great execution of Gothic principles and comparable with some of the finest churches in Europe. The white color didnt work for me - but that is personal taste..
Amazing!!. Never have I seen such a beautiful place. feel free to light a candle for someone for a $2 donation, and be ready to have your bag cked at security..you must stop by and see
The Lady Chapel. In the very back of St Patrick's Cathedral is a small chapel called the Lady Chapel. It is my favorite place in the Cathedral.

good. everything was good except they were repairing for long time.
after lighting a candle some how everything went well that day.
Amazing holy ground. What a blessing to visit this cathedral. It was spiritual and beautiful and refreshing and renewing.
Beautiful. A beautiful church and place of peace when you are surrounded by all the madness of NY. It is next door to the Rockerfeller Center so take a look.
Silence. Beautiful. On 5th Avenue. But once you enter it the Silence is yours. A wonderful Cathedral which you have to honor once you are in. It is worth to see it
Beautiful, Peaceful, Historic!. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a beautiful, peaceful retreat, that takes you away from the hustle and bustle of the city. I wish I lived close so I attend services there.
A tranquil respite. A beautiful sanctuary -- quiet amidst the NYC chaos. So nice to just walk in, say a prayer of gratitude, light a candle, just be.
holiday. Its a church and is very much the same as all other well cathedrals but as its newer its less grand. Worth a visit.
Must visit. Better to visit on Sunday morning during a church service. Amazing architecture and stained-glass windows.

Sunday Mass 3rd April 2016. Alteration appear to be complete in this wonderful Church. Mass was a Hymn mass and it was very inspiring .
Loved it all,
Donal O' Reilly
Leixlip
Ireland

Beautiful chruch. This building is beautiful to look at both inside and out. Keep an eye out for it is you are walking on 5th Avenue and make sure you make the effort to have a look inside if you can. There are impressive vaulted ceilings, nice decorative columns and interesting pictures on the walls. We were there at night time so we didn’t see stain glass windows, but we lit the candle
Beautiful Architecture. Beautiful Architecture Inside and Out. Remind me of Churches in European Country. Famous Cathedral in NY city.
Amazing. St. Patrick's Cathedral is beautiful and the architecture is amazing. It feels good to walk through and admire all the work.

beautiful - gift shop sells communion gifts. I went there today to buy a first communion gift for my boss. the gift shop is outside of the cathedral and across the street on 51st St side. They had a wide selection of gifts.
A must see.. In one word beautiful, even if you ar a non believer walk in and around the Cathedral it is one of a kind.

Beautiful Serenity and Spirituality. This building is an amazing work of art with such meticulous details in every aspect of the architecture that it will impress even the least cultured visitor. Once you enter the building, your soul will feel a sense of peace almost immediately. Perhaps the hustle and bustle of NYC outside contrasted with the peace and quite of the inside of the church enhances this effect, but I would suggest that there is a bit more to it than that. Don't forget to dip your hand into the holy water and make the sign of the cross (if you are Catholic, or if you like to be respectful of Catholic religion). For a small donation, you can light a candle and say a prayer and perhaps it will put your mind at ease about something. Make your way around the outskirts of the sanctuary and you will find small chapel-altars that are works of art themselves. Each one is just filled with such detail that it will take some time to take it all in if you appreciate this sort of thing.The main altar emanates a sense of holiness that translates into awe and wonder and the pipe organs are the only ones I have ever seen of that scale in my travels. Not only will all the beauty of the architecture amaze you, but walking through the cathedral offers several benefits...1. In the summer, or winter, this is a nice free place to take a rest by sitting in the pews. It is cool in the summer and warm in the winter!2. It is a nice break from the hectic world outside called NYC and you will feel more relaxed after a few minutes.3. This is a spiritual place where you will feel a calmness in your soul, regardless of your religion or lack thereof. You will feel peace.4. Of course there is the beauty and history of this place which will be evident as soon as you enter this place.This is a must see in NYC, especially if you are shopping on 5th Ave and need to rest your feet, cool down, or warm up. You will be impressed and feel rested...

beautiful church. This cathedral is so light and airy compare to catherdrals in the uk. It was very welcomming. A little bit of quiet in the middle of such a busy noisy city. It was free to enter but they do ask for a gift. bags are checked on entry.

Looks better than ever now it's been cleaned. I was there last November and it was still covered in scafolding. Work is still being carried out, but the front is complete and it looks better than ever now it's been cleaned.

Beautiful building. I could not believe the amount of people inside for the mass , standing room only left the inside of the historical building is beautiful, and photos are allowed There were so many different nationalities there well worth going to have a look

winter visit. What another great visit to NYC this winter
Headed to Rockefeller center but first stopped at Bryant-Park and SPC
Did some window shopping, had something to eat and drink
The inside was nice this year – no construction going on and (visitors) people seemed reverent
which is nice in a CHURCH 

St. Patrick's Catherdral. Gothic Architecture
open to visitors
daily mass service
5th avenue between 50th and 51st streets
Christmas Eve midnight mass

Go to Church!. Yes, I know. NYC is a city with so much to do and see. We tried our best to fit as much theater and museum hopping and shopping as we could, but the hour we spent at St. Patrick's Cathedral was one of the most memorable hours of our 6 day trip. Beautiful construction; our timing allowed us to stay for mass and the organ was amazing. This is a treasure that should not be missed.
Real Must!!!. Every NY visitor must see this amazing cathedral. The arquiteture is stunning and one can feel the peace inside.

So beautiful...don't miss La Pieta inside on the right. Beautiful church although not as old as you think, but still beautiful nonetheless. It's very peaceful inside and the La Pieta statue of Mary holding Jesus is breathtaking.

Stunningly beautiful and sacred. With the renovation completed, this Cathedral is a scared monument to the faith of millions who donated to the construction of it in early immigrant times, to those who continue to maintain it's care, to those who worship here and to those who seek peace and comfort at each of it's many altars.

The priest who renewed my parents wedding vows was one of the most genuine, sincere people we have ever met.. We came here on my parents 30th wedding anniversary to renew their wedding vows. This was pre-arranged months before our visit and we assumed it would be a quick 'in-n-out' sort of blessing. We went inside the cathedral (which as a building, is breath taking.) and waited to be seen. We were greeted by a priest and were taken to a private room, which was down some stairs at the back of the cathedral that had been set up just for us! The priest remembered all 7 of our names from the phone conversation he had with my dad months prior to our visit, and greeted us all with the most genuinely warm and sincere manner. Not many members of my family are religious, myself included, but after he blessed my parents, renewed their vows and read a few psalms and verses, we all felt very connected and lucky. It was actually a very moving, emotional experience, and it was nice to witness my parents 'get married' again. A few of us shed a tear. The blessing was done mainly for my mum as she is religious, so it meant a lot to her to have this experience. We couldn't have picked a better place, or been blessed by a better priest. We all left feeling very humbled and I often find myself looking back at that experience. All of this was no charge, but we donated towards the church as thanks of the wonderful reception and kindness towards us as a family. This is a remarkable church, but the people who work here are remarkable people.

This cathedral makes many in Europe pale in comparison. Even if you are not Catholic you will be touched by the rows of statues ringing the church. There are many opportunities to light candles and pray, even with the crowds. If you have a chance to stay for daily Mass it will include the magnificent pipe organ.

A beautiful restoration. We visited this cathedral on our last visit to New York 2 years ago. At that time,the restoration work was ongoing and it was difficult to appreciate the magnificence of the building. What a difference this time, the cathedral has been completely restored and revitalised. Definitely worth a visit!

BEAUTIFUL!. This is so special because of the architecture (if you are not Catholic). It is open just about all the time, people go there and light candles, you feel very religious inside this massive church.

Beautiful Cathedral. The St. Patrick's cathedral is one of the most stunning churches I have ever been in. Newly renovated it is a white beckon for prayer. We went in and lit a candle in the memory of my father-in-law who recently passed. I am sure he was up there smiling.

Even more beautiful since it wasrenovated. Iconic New York City landmark church. You can go multiple times and spot something you hadn't noticed before. Always beautiful; serene when it isn't packed with tourists.

A wonderful place to reflect, pray, see great art and to learn.. Many tourist have a tendency to walk and take photos on front of the beautiful large gothic building in the middle of Manhattan. You really should go in, as it is a wonderful place to reflect, pray, see great art and to learn. There are many chapels to see, each with a placard that gives you some basic information. The stain glass windows are spectacular and you are treated to a show of light if you visit in the morning or afternoon. When you are in side the Cathedral it is unusually quiet and peaceful. You can get away from the hustle and bustle of the City. So please stop in and enjoy.

Awesome Cathedral. The renovation of the Cathedral was just completed and the building is absolutely beautiful. The stone is light and shines like the day it was built. The Cathedral is as timeless, beautiful, and stately as European Cathedrals that are centuries old. The stone and wood carving are breathtaking as are the large stained glass windows. Sit, contemplate and worship in splendor.

Amazing!. St Patrick's Cathedral is incredible. If you are planning on attending mass pick a time where the organist and choir will be there. The organ here is one of the most impressive instruments I've ever heard and the choir makes the experience even better.

Stunning. We were only able to walk on the outside because of the time but this is an amazing thing to look at. You can see it from far but please make sure to walk up close to see all the detail of this building. We loved it!

Words cannot describe.... In the midst of the craziest city in the world with more hustle and bustle per square block sits this sanctuary, literally and figuratively. Walk in from the madness of the city streets and you immediately feel the presence of god in this majestic, breathtaking and awe inspiring building. And while I don't necessarily agree with the gift shop being there, it is what it is. This is the most peaceful place in New York. And to be respectful please only take part in events (communion, etc.) if you are catholic only.
a must when visiting NYC. one of the most spiritual places on earth. Does not matter what your religion is. when you sit in the pews you will feel the calm and serenity of the cathedral.
Beautiful!. Newly restored and gorgeous! If you want a service they run almost continuously. Definitely take the time to look in.

James Renwick's Crown Achievement. Began in 1859 and finally completed twenty years later (the Civil War interfered), this pearl of a Roman Catholic Cathedral church was built at a cost of $1.9 million. Later improvements included the great rose window and bronze doors on the Fifth Avenue side. It has been visited by several popes, including Saint John Paul II. Unlike most European Cathedrals, this one does not have a waiting line to visit, which is a refreshing twist. Also unlike European places of worship, this one does not charge admission fees. In front of it marches the St. Patrick's Day Parade which goes as far back as 1766! When you are done here, go see Renwick's other pearl, Grace Church in downtown (separate review)

Peaceful oasis in the heart of the City. We are not religious but I felt we had to step inside.
We were greeted warmly, which I found a surprise, but allowed to walk around. There was a feeling of peace and serenity which was lovely. No memorials to the dead, or events, which you usually see in a church. Visited by many Popes, a building of faith.
one gorgeous looking building. One to tick off the list. No photos inside, however its certainly something to see. Tip: walk around the outside too!
CATHEDRAL. wow this place is absolutely stunning inside and out. this is definitely a must see as it is so beautiful and well kept
great cathedral. The cathedral is usually very crowded ...Beautiful inside and out...Going to church make me feel peaceful and calm.
Amazing venue. Even if you are not religious, this is a good take. The grandeur of the structure is amazing. It is softly lighted but very bright, the stained glass windows are beautiful.
gorgeous especially after the renovation. If you enjoy gorgeous churches go to St Patricks. Its amazing especially in the middle of a huge city like NYC>

A great Cathedral yet dwarfed by sky scrapers!. If you are a fan of Marvel Comics you will recognize buildings like this from many a Spiderman comic. It is a beautiful building inside and out and very worth seeing.

Renovations Restored It to Original Magnificence. When I was growing up St. Patrick's Cathedral, which is one of the largest churches in the US, always appeared an off brown/grey color, probably due to a century's worth of air pollution. Due to the extensive overhaul completed over the last few years, it has been restored to its original glory both inside and out. It has a number of side altars dedicated to different saints that appeal to many ethnic groups, including one dedicated to the American Saint Elizabeth Seaton. If one walks around the back of the nave, you will find the beautiful Lady Chapel where many New Yorkers have been married. Also there are the steps leading down to the crypt in which are buried the Archbishops of New York, along with Bishop Fulton Sheen who some older travelers may remember from his TV show in the '50s, and St. Pierre Touisant, a Haitian immigrant. At Christmas time, a large crèche is positioned to the left of the main altar. The cathedral is usually very crowded, bags are checked by security staff at the entrance, and movement may be restricted during services.

To faithful Christians and interested visitors to New York history. The faithful flock here during all Roman Catholic holidays and many other occasions. I find it restful, to see faith in a setting welcoming everyone.
St. Patrick's Cathedral. The Cathedral is very beautiful and attending mass there was inspirational. I highly recommend visiting this lovely place.
St Patricks. Beautiful Cathedral with amazing stained windows and architecture. Worth a quick look inside. The outside is pretty awesome too.
beautiful. Beautiful church. Random bag searches at entrance which I thought was probably a good idea. Beautiful architecture but very very busy.

Amazing Building. The cathedral stands out pure white amongst New York's sky scrapers.
This building is amazing both inside and out.

Beautiful. The cathedral has been through restoration and is beautiful outside and throughout the inside. There are 2 gift shops with several types of souvenirs and bottles for filling with Holy Water.

Exquisite. The last time I went here, renovations were still going on. Visited here again for easter. Now, the church looks really exquisite. Attended the easter vigil and the celebration was grand, as always. The most remarkeable experience for me was hearing their full choir with the majestic pipe organ.

Beautiful just beautiful. Went on a Sunday and mass was in full swing. Very atmospheric and beautiful inside and out. Designed by James Renwick Jr who was a child prodigy having his first major commission at age 25. Impressive.
GORGEOUS BEYOND WORDS. This cathedral is the most beautiful thing I have ever seen. To experience a Mass in such an incredible location was such a great treat.

Stunning!. A spectacular neo-gothic cathedral that has been magnificently maintained. If you go on line to the Cathedral's website, you might be able to time your visit so that you can enjoy the organist rehearsing or a visiting choir singing.

Beautiful and inspiring. If you're in the area of Rockefeller Center, its right across the street and worth it to cross the street and experience this stunning building. Whether Catholic or not, the stained glass windows and amazing architecture and sculptures will stunn and mesmerize.
Lovely interior. A lovely interior, clean and well lit with some interesting stained glass windows. Bag checks at entry, but open to the public and free!
A MUST. This church will take your breath away. This is a must to visit while travelling to NYC. You can feel the history of the church the moment you walk through it's doors.
Mass at St. Patricks. Mass was beautiful as was the cathedral. All the side altars and the stained glass windows are a must see. This is not just a tourist attraction but a truly spiritual venue.
Peaceful reflection. This was a nice break from the fast pace of this wonderful city a little time for peaceful reflection in a beautiful building

Amazing relic of inspiration.. A gem in the heart of the city. Go and contemplate. You will feel refreshed, relaxed and inspired. The windows tell a story. The architecture and grandeur of the building is there for you to behold.

Amazing building!. Last time I was in New York this cathedral was covered inside and out with scaffolding so it was good to see it without that. The windows are amazing and it has a lovely atmosphere.

'THE CATHEDRAL TO VISIT'. I am not a catholic, but I could not pass the opportunity to visit the famous St.Patrick's Cathedral; it will be like going to Barcelona and not visit La Sagrada Familia or to Rome an ignore St.Peter's Basilica. The cherry over the cake for us was that at the time of our touring the Youth Choir was delighting the visitors with a 30 minutes of Sacred Music that we enjoyed from the beginning to the end.

Kitch and religion. There is a strange blend of cheesy souvenir shop, unfittingly dressed travelers and sacred space. The splendor was lost on the the obvious plea to buy candles or catholic souvenirs.
Peaceful. This cathedral is very beautiful and you feel in peace as soon as you enter it. A calm moment welcomed in the noisy city!

A little piece of heaven on earth!. I was just breathless when I walked into St. Patricks Cathedral. The architecture, stained glass windows, and art is just amazing. Even with hundreds of people there (most with selfie sticks which is nuts) we felt so serene. It was really just a peaceful place where we could sit for a few minutes and reflect while be surrounded by such amazement. I day dreamed about my daughter walking down that aisle someday - while a very slim chance, it was just a great thought to imagine. It was really nice to step of the streets of NYC into serenity before getting back to the hustle and bustle.
HUGE ENTRY DOORS TO A PEACEFUL SETTING. Relaxing, ornate and comforting to all who enter this building. Lovely stained glass windows! Peaceful setting to enjoy the LORD. IT'S FREE TOO!

Beautiful cathedral. This Cathedral is literally across from The Rockefeller Center, so, please, stop by. Cathedral is huge and it's beautiful. $170M+ renovation that they just did over 3 years makes it look nearly brand new but don't let it fool you - it was built in late 1800's and it's worth to take a look.
Absolutely Beautiful Church!. St. Patricks is beautiful inside and out. Well worth the visit. Wish we would have had time to stay for mass. Architecture was impressive!
Breathtaking!. Breathtaking....Beautiful...Grand...Glorious....a very nice mass with Beautiful music....You have to see to Appreciate!

Amazing sight, such a beautiful cathedral............. Amazing to see this amazing cathedral in the middle of upper Manhattan, reminiscent of some of the great cathedrals of Europe.
Such grandeur

Stunning. Every time I visit this church I find it easy to forget that I am not in Europe. I love the attention to detail in the façade, windows, and walls.
Nice quiet stop in a busy city.

Well worth a look around. This is a very impressive cathedral and is well worth a look around, even if you're not really into architechture or religion. Everyone can appreciate the work that's gone into this building and the grandness of the design. Well worth popping in

A Must See in New York. St. Pat's Cathedral is breath taking. I'm not Catholic but I still stop by and walk all the way around every time I visit New York. No matter what your personal beliefs are you can't help but be in awe of the beauty of this magnificent church.

Breathtaking visit to this beautiful Cathedral. St. Patrick's Cathedral was amazing. It is absolutely breathtaking. This is definitely a must see!! We even got to see Mass, which made it even more amazing!
Beautifully Restored. They did a great restoration of the cathedral and it is well worth seeing this glorious place, even if you have seen it before.
Soaring height. Renovations are almost complete and the exterior is even more beautiful now that it has been cleaned. Worth taking time to tour about the interior.
Worth a Visit. Always wander in when in NYC. A cool haven in the height of summer and warm when it is chilly out! Lovely Cathedral in a busy New York. Always light a candle for my Mum.

Quiet stop on a busy day. We were attempting to take in as many sights as we could for our short visit, and St. Patrick's gave us the opportunity to slow down for a while. Plan to stay for an hour or more, and visit the side chapels and various nooks in the cathedral.
Must See. A must when hitting New York and only a short walk from the Rockefeller centre. Great architecture in the middle of the shopping district.
The Best Cathedral I Have Visited. The Cathedral is breathtakingly beautiful. So many wonderful sites and so clean that it looked like it was built yesterday!

Great Easter Mass Experience. I attended Easter Mass on Sunday afternoon and it was a beautiful experience. I am a Christian but not Catholic, but was touched by the message and music. The cathedral is a work of architecture with amazing stained glass and detailed carving. Make sure to take a look inside, even if you don't stay for a service. Optimal location from which to walk to other places such as the MOMA, Rockefeller Center, and even Times Square.

Beautiful. I'm not Catholic but I appreciated the beauty of this church. I never pass up the opportunity to visit the large Catholic churches as they always have beautiful architecture and décor. We spent some time sitting in the pews enjoying time with God. I don't feel like one has to be a certain denomination to worship in another's sanctuary. If ever in NYC I will defiantly come back here. It's located very close to the Rockefeller Center.
Must see. A must see to appreciate the beauty!! Awesome architecture and very beautiful church!! right off 5th ave.
Amazing place. Every time I come to New York City I love to step inside here - just to light a candle or two and have a moment of reflection. I love it here.

I Visited Twice In As Many Days. My kids sang there with their high school choir. The acoustics were fascinating. We were part of a large group, and I think we may have crowded some of the regular worshipers there. One lady in front of me seemed perturbed at all these people. But she seemed to enjoy the music provided by the kids when it was all said and done. A few days later, I returned to worship there with my en-laws. It was then that I heard the massive pipe organ, which was just phenomenal. This facility is a beautiful, stunning work of art. It is worth a stop, even for just a few minutes, if you are passing by. A good chance to pause, clear your head, commune with God, rest your body and refresh your soul while in New York.

Lovely Sunday service - full cathedral. We were early for our planned service at 5th Avenue Presbyterian, so we chose to visit St. Patrick's for a moment beforehand. The Mass had just begun in the very full cathedral, and it was lovely to observe for a few moments from the back of the majestic space. To accommodate parishioners who might not be able to see the front of the cathedral clearly, there are video screens positioned throughout. A nice moment in time on a chilly Sunday in April.

Beautiful, just beautiful.. St. Patrick's Cathedral is simply beautiful. Peaceful and beautiful. The organ is quite amazing, if you're fortunate enough to be there while being played. An architectural wonder.

Exceeded Expectations. As a Catholic I (wrongly) assumed that Sunday mass would be overrun by tourists.
