In fact Sunday mass is packed (with NYC police protection), but they do a great job of assuring that actual churchgoers have the opportunity to enjoy mass. Great job in a difficult situation! Of course the church is visually stunning ...
Beautiful Architecture. Across the street from the Rockefeller Center so easy to visit. Impressive from the outside and even more impressive on the inside.
Beautiful cathedral. We went to the evening Young Adult mass. It is a spectacular venue for mass. Music and singing were beautiful.
Architecture is amazing. Very impressive building both inside and outside.I come from a construction background, so, this appeals to me. Centrally located too

Awe inspiring. We toured the Cathedral on Saturday afternoon. It was amazing to see all of the detail and the beauty, as well as to experience the spirituality of the church itself. We went back on Sunday morning for Palm Sunday mass said by Cardinal Dolan. The mass was beautiful, although we had to stand through it. A definite must visit in NYC.

Fantastic place to visit. St. Patrick's Cathedral is one of the must-see places in NYC. I think the interior of the church is very interesting to see with huge organ pipes and stained glass art. It's a perfect place for families when you are visiting NYC.

Amazing building. visited the cathedral whilst on a sightseeing trip to nyc, the outside of the cathedral is amazing, the architecture is out of this world. inside it gets even better, went in whilst a reading was taking place, sat down for the reading, very warm and inviting.

beautiful. This was a family vacation. I wasn't sure my kids would really want to go in. It was one of their favorite things we did. It was beautiful inside. We stayed a long time just walking around.
Peace and Tranquility. In among all the shopping it was lovely to be able to sit in this beautiful cathedral and light a candle just sit and reflect everyone should visit religious or not.

Beautiful!. St Patrick's cathedral is stunning and reminiscent of the great cathedrals I have visited in Europe. Definitely a must see! Also a wonderful place to light a candle for a loved one and pray or reflect at your leisure.

Captivating. It doesn't matter in which direction you look the architecture is absolutely amazing and breath taking. I couldn't stop looking up, which is very appropriate since we were in a church and heaven is up.
Family Favorite. Fantasticly beautiful church. We all loved it and were so glad we did it. My 10 and 13 year old said it was one of their favorite things to see. Side note... it's free!!

Wonderful Sunday Mass. St. Patrick's never ceases to amaze me. I wish I had attended more when I lived in Manhattan years ago, but this recent visit made up for it. You will not regret paying so much for parking if you have to drive in, but it was worth every penny. Not only will you be uplifted spiritually, but on an earthly level, you will marvel at the effortless way the Cathedral changes from being a tourist's hot spot to an immense spiritual sanctum in the blink of an eye once the Mass begins... Warning: if you're not a Catholic, you will want to be once you go to Mass at St. Patrick's... beautiful.

Very emotional !. An amazing building, very striking in the middle of the skyscrapers. A choir were singing when my friend and I visited and we just stood there in awe with tears rolling down our cheeks .

Put this on your list of things to see in New York. Oh my, what a beautiful Cathedral. It's simply is breathtaking, such a magnificent building amongst all those skyscrapers. It's a lovely place to visit, take some time to pause and take in all the beautiful art-sculptures.

beautiful cathedral built on donations. this is a remarkable place , utterly lovely inside especially when the light shines through.also and a credit to the 1000s who donated the time and money to build this magnificent place from nothing ... well worth adding this to you sightseeing
historic church in america. Like a lot of buildings its nice to go in with a little more research makes for a more interesting perspective go behind main alter interesting
Beautiful to walk through and admire.. The architecture is inspiring.On a sunny day the colors of the light from the stained glass windows make for a spectacular display..
Stunning. Definitely well worth your time to visit this beautiful cathedral. It is so amazingly beautiful and serene.
Beautiful Church. Words can not explain what a work of art this church is. It is amazing, beautiful and breath taking. We truly enjoyed taking the time to include this in our sight seeing experience.

Beautiful as always. We visited the Saturday before Easter and the flower displays were a nice addition. My 16 and 19 year olds are finally at the age where they could appreciate the art and architecture

Breathtaking. If you are in NYC take a few minutes or longer and visit St. Patricks Cathedral This was the most beautiful Church I have ever seen before. Going in I thought that it would be a quick visit however I was so impressed with the beauty of this place of worship that I took my time to enjoy every visual aspect of it.

Looks like brand new. St. Patrick's in addition to recall a good number of movies is a piece of the past in the middle fo a modern town.Sincé its last refurbishing (not yet finalized) looks great , the grey stones have dissapeared and now you can admire the full beatury of this monument

A Spiritual Place, an impressive church. Firstly I'll have to say that I beleive in God and in his son Jesus, so I confess to be a Christian, and wherever I go usually with my wife we go to a church weather a big or a small one. I really love this church since those days left in my past when I had the chance to study in NYU. Have been to a mass more than once, and in this visit there was one begining when we enter, so we just sat and stay there for the mass, then did the tour, the church was in excellent shape because of Pope Francis visit, the most impressive sight to me was the mother holding his dead son in his arms, I don't know how many Pieta's exist, I think there are four I have seen at least two, maybe three, but they always make me cry. Don't miss St. Patrick's Cathedral when in New York, that would be like missing Saint Peter in The Vatican, or Notre Dame in Paris. I could mention many more but characters wouldn't be enough.
Amazing. Christmas time is always the best time to visit.truly amazing and beautiful place.If ever in NY you must find time and visit.
Gorgeous place !. Most beautiful church ! Went there for sunday Mass , the choir was angelic , the interior was breathtaking !
Breathtaking!. I was very humbled when stepping into this cathedral - so very beautiful, historic and sacred! This is another NYC must see!

Looks lost in NYC. It very strange to see this cathedral in the middle of all the sky scrapers and high rise buildings. Its very nice outside and in. Free to go in and you can pay $2 to light a candle at one of the many alters.Photos are allowed in most areas and it is a very peaceful space.

Beautiful and stirring. Planned for months to come visit and I was not disappointed. I enjoyed mass and the self-guided audio tour. I didn't realize until after I had left that the gift shop located there is just an annex and their main gift shop is across the street.

Awesome. I am not an architecture fan, but I think this cathedral is a must see if you visit NYC. Its location allows even a "casual" visit, as long as it's in the Midtown, in front of the rockefeller center

Breathtakingly Beautiful. Stopped in while in NYC for the weekend. This place is huge and breathtakingly beautiful. Since we visited on Easter Weekend, so the place was very crowded, but they seem to control the crowds well.
Breathtakingly Beautiful. Brought tears to my eyes as I walked in! A Mass was being held, was able to receive communion. Great way to start my vacation. A truly magnificent sight!
Family. Was having some renovations @ the time, but still open to the public. Beautiful windows with stained glass, architecture is gorgeous and a big piece of history for NY...

Magnificent Cathedral in the heart of Midtown Manhattan. Situated right in the heart of Midtown Manhattan between towering skyscrapers, yet close to Central Park this building is stunning, especially after recent external cleaning. Entry is free, (bags are searched by very pleasant security staff) but small,donations are encouraged. The interior is a joy to see and the whole thing should not be passed by.
Beautiful Church. We attended 12 noon mass on Friday and it was beautiful. The cathedrals stain glass windows are so striking and huge.
So beautiful and peaceful!. Definitely worth a stop if you are in the area. We just walked around ourselves, no tour or anything. It is just breathtaking.

Magnificent Cathedral. Enjoyed putting record of visit on file and asking for blessings. Each small alter told the story of the relevant Saint and you could light candles at your favourite. Small shop could have had more staff. well worth visit

Easter week in the middle of the city. Visited during Easter week and it was a wonderful time to go. Many tourists were there during a mass going on. I was lost in the beauty of this church in the middle of such an amazingly busy city. The mass, beauty and tranquility there was transporting me to a completely different place. Felt appreciative to have been allowed in during a mass, even though we were not there worship. Directly across from 30 Rock on 5th Ave. in midtown.

A haven of tranquility in New York. From the moment you step inside St Patrick's cathedral you forget you're in the middle of one of the busiest cities in the world. You could be anywhere, Rome, Florence... A beautiful building with a magical peace about it. Worth a visit. Perfect for a rainy day and it's free too.

Beautiful inside and out. St. Patricks's Cathedral is nice for either Christians or not. Very good for sightseeing, praying or buying gifts. The ceiling is very detailed and there are "mini chapels" inside, each for many kinds of saints.
Great Cathedral in the heart of NYC. It was good to see St Pats restored to its former beauty and with all the scaffold gone is a gem in the city of New York

A Very Beautiful Cathedral. This cathedral has it all : a wonderful Gothic-style structure with decorated arches and ceilings, carved marble items, mosaics, tall stone pillars, incredible woodworking, statues of great beauty, and breathtaking stained glass. We saw some items hanging from the ceiling and weren't sure what they were so we asked. Here, they were some of the hats that the Cardinals used to wear, the type with the tassels. I've never seen them anywhere except in movies. The altar area is magnificent with golden decorations and a crypt area in the back. Worth a visit even if you aren't religious.

Beautiful Catholic Church. Even under renovation, the beauty of this church was undeniable. So easy to see why it is used by so many politicians and celebrities. The architecture is gorgeous and the staff was most friendly.

Beautiful.. What an amazing experience. Beautiful church. At first it feels awkward to walk around and check out the architecture etc., with people worshiping in the pews. However, if you're quiet and respectful, it seems to be okay.
Lovely. Beautiful surroundings, and truly enjoyed participating in noon mass with my family. Loved sharing the experience with my kids.
Stopped in on Palm Sunday. It is beautiful to see a church filled with people on Palm Sunday. Beautiful service, glad we made the trip.
Rude attendant, though. Ironically, the one place we encountered rudeness.However, because the reason to visit is to appreciate its architecture and historic significance, it's well worth the visit.

St. Patricks Cathedral 5th Avenue.. We attended the Cathedral for mass on Good Friday. It was crowded. The inside of the Cathedral is beautiful and was the backdrop for the Easter Bonnet Parade on Easter Sunday. Well worth a visit if you have the time.
Impressive . Amazing cathedral, irrespective of religious beliefs this is a master piece.The outside is magnificent but the inside it's astonishing.

Beautiful Cathedral and a traditional place to see! A must!. This place is just beautiful and you should go there to enjoy the architecture and the magnificence of the place. Eventually you should also pray there to show your gratitude for being in NY and so you can pay your bills when going back home.
Beautiful inside and out. A real place of calm in the middle of New York. It really stands out in amongst the skyscrapers and traffic. Beautiful inside.

Heaven on Earth!. This was an amazing place to visit and say a prayer while you are at it! I walked by it and decided to stop and while I was there mass was going to start , so I decided to stay for it as well. Folk's this place is amazing. I thought I was in Heaven waiting for GOD to show up on the altar. If you have a chance, stop by!
Simply Magnificent. A truly beautiful place to visit and experience an European Style Church in New York. Free to walk in and enjoy this wonderful spot in New York.
Beautiful Cathedral. I enjoy visiting churches for the peace and beauty they offer. This one is a must in NYC. Beautiful stained glass and carvings. It seems open to the public every day.
Awe Inspiring. Such a moving place to visit. It just feels like a holy place. The architecture is breath-taking and it just gave me an overwhelming feeling of peace and love.

Great stop!. This cathedral was right by my hotel. I couldn't help but drop inside because it was so close and looked amazing from the outside. The inside is pristine and full of history. The stained glass and architecture make this a great stop for those in the area.

Lovely. We visited St. Patrick's at the suggestion of a friend and are glad we went. The building is gorgeous, and standing proudly next to the glass and metal skyscrapers, it's quite striking. It's really a beautiful building to see.
Classic. Magnificent cathedral, like the classic ones of Europe, but right in the middle of Manhattan. So much history here.

Speechless. The cathedral left me speechless. The craftsmanship inside is unbelievable and the outside is very daunting when you like at the size of the building as a whole. I went inside to walk through and lit a candle for my loved ones. I would recommend everyone take a moment and enjoy the quietness of the cathedral.
Beautiful. We were lucky enough to be passing by this iconic Catherdral on a Sunday during mass so we stopped in just in time to walk the aisle for communion offering.

St Patricks Cathedral. A not miss if in NYC. If you are around the Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall it's right there. The art work and architecture are absolutely amazing. Doors are open and free to get in.
Beautiful iconic church. I've been there many times ... at times the serenity on this church was not felt because of too much crowd . the church was newly renovated .
reverent experience. The architecture is stunning. More stunning was the way people acted with respect for those worshiping as they visited.

Beautiful. No matter what religion, a visit to this beautiful constructed building is well worth it. During our visit we say many and varied nationalities and i'm sure many non catholic visititors. Super place to spend a few hours and if it is your thing reflect and pray.

Beautiful Cathedral. I have been to NYC a few times and nearly always stop off to see St Patrick's Cathedral. The last few years it has been crowded, under renovation or unable to get in, but this last time was perfect. The scaffolding had been removed and the exterior was beautiful. The inside was spectacular - as I particularly enjoy stained glass windows. The massive bronze doors open to Fifth Avenue were stunning. I have always felt it was overcrowded and touristy, with a lot of people not there for any particularly spiritual reason, but the last time I visited was different. I'm so glad I went back in one more time.
Beautiful on the outside and inside. It is a very picturesque church, in the middle of the city of Manhattan. I recommend a visit when there is mass.

open to all. sit in quiet pew for solitude. can get souvenir for visit too. special place to visit. dignified and quiet. peace in the midst of ny. got prices for candle lights, souvenir medals seem sorta commercial. but it's beautiful. go, sit in pews and soak in the majesty of this amazing place that was visited by pope.

Easter Vigil Mass. As Catholics we decided this would be the best place to attend Easter Mass during our visit. We went to the Easter Vigil Mass which did not disappoint. The Archbishop presided over a mass that was moving and one of the most spiritual events we ever participated in. It was a breathtaking experience that we will never forget in one of the most amazing churches in the United States.
Easter Sunday @ St. Pat's. Gorgeous church!! had the privilege of attending mass there on Easter Sunday. Don't miss a walk behind the main alter for some awesome surprises!!

Breath Taking. I have visited a few cathedral's and St. Patrick's is really nice. I like that they had designated area's for individuals who have come to worship rather than tour. Only downside was that it was very crowded, but that is to be expected. Renovations on the outside of the building was taking place during the visit.

Beautiful architecture in this very old church. If you have never experienced the churches in Europe St. Patrick's Cathedral will give you a great sense of what they are like. I would say it definitely is right up there at the top of the list. It has recently had a good scrubbing and it looks like the marble is brand new. Colors that were previously covered by years and years of dust are now vibrant. You will have to wait in line for confession but it is a short wait. So worth seeing even if you are not Catholic
Amazing place. Huge, beautiful, European style cathedral. Amazing architecture no matter what your religious beliefs.

Packed like sardines on Palm Sunday. Monitors throughout the side aisles of the church helped accommodate the throngs gathered for Palm Sunday. The crowd was poorly behaved during communion and pushed rudely as if they would be left out. This behavior was bordering on the ridiculous. Ushers could have done a better job explaining to the ignorant that no one would be left out and cleared a path for people trying to return from the center aisle. I was actually nervous about getting crushed after Mass and headed for the door when the recessional hymn started. Anyone lucky enough to get a seat was fine, but the standing crowd seemed to be a mix of faithful and curious tourists. Some people left with armloads of palms. It was pretty chaotic.

Beautiful!. Visited the Cathedral once with my wife and the next day with our younger daugther (14 years old). Once inside, you get a sense of peace. The architecture is stunning as well as the areas for private prayer.

Beautiful cathedral. We visited on Holy Saturday and the church was lovely. Flowers and lilies made the sanctuary even more beautiful than it is normally with the stained glass windows and architecture. The staff was warm, inviting and friendly and overall it was a great stop.

Beautiful!. This cathedral never ceases to amaze me. I've been to Notre Dame in Paris, and I think St. Patrick's is even more beautiful. It does feel a little strange to walk through a building where people are praying, but it's worth the stop to see the stained glass, marble and statues.

Serenity. Absolutely gorgeous building. So amazing to enter the cathedral and leave the chaos of the city behind you. We were able to sit on a pew and reflect about life and enjoy some peace and quiet. Stained glass is beautiful. Architecture is impressive.

Very nicely preserved and looks new. Since my last visit, prior to the arrival of the Pope, this place has been completely cleaned and restored, both inside and out. When we went the alter was still filled with Easter lilies and it was beautiful.
Breathtaking, inspiring!. You must visit St. Patrick's Cathedral! A must see for Catholics! Although we did not attend Mass, it was inspiring to visit such a beautiful place of worship!
Beautiful. Words cannot describe the beauty and feeling you have when you visit St. Patrick's Cathedral. Do not leave the City before you walk inside.

Beautiful Cathedral. I love to go inside any cathedral in any town that i happen to be in. I am not religious at all, but I find them to be very peaceful, restful places in amongst the hustle of large cities. St Patrick's in New York is just gorgeous inside, take the time to go inside, sit down and soak in the tranquility.
Important point of NYC. the St. Patrick's Cathedral is one of the most inportant point of the New York City. Ypu can pray there and you can watch the holy liturgy
Amazing attraction. We went there on Good Friday, what an amazing service. We had our 8 & 10 year olds with us. Amazing place to visit.
Beautiful. As good as any Cathedral in Europe. Be quiet and take off your hat. Sit down and take a break from the crazy, busy bustle of 5th Ave.
Great place. Every time we visit NYC we go to st. Patrick's. Thus time was Easter Sunday, and there was a festival outside, 5th avenue was closed for five blocks to celebrate
Beautiful and Serene - after a Bag Check. This is not my first trip into the Cathedral but it was the first time my purse was inspected. Sad but I understand is needed but still Sad. A must see.
Beautiful, quiet, moving.. So sad some place so incredible has to have guards checking bags upon entrance. Quite a moving place.

Restoration complete. Went in the middle in morning mass which gave me chance to marvel at the restoration that has been done. Awesome stained glass windows. Ushers most helpful in answering questions

Awe-inspiring . Been here year ago. Scaffolding was everywhere. Now it's vibrant but yet still very much vintage. The upgrades are awesome from stereo equipment to television screens. Very beautiful and peaceful

Beautiful and sacred island of peace in the center of Nee York!. St. Patrick's Cathedral has been beautifully maintained. We found it to be a wonderful place to be on our knees for a short time to center our appreciation on life.
Very good stop for everyone with a busy schedule!

Once again...Impressive. I was able to hear mass on Palm Sunday....What a great experience it was. Not only the Cathedral is a beautiful masterpiece but it gives you a peaceful sentiment when you enter those huge doors..... Honestly one of the most beautiful cathedrals I've seen....

Breathtaking Cathedral. Beautifully restored Cathedral. A true landmark of art, architecture and Catholicism. A wonderful serene feeling overtakes you as you stare in awe. Stop, light a candle, say a prayer.
Amazing place of faith.. Gorgeous facility. It was wonderful to be there on Palm Sunday. The location is amazing, on 5th Ave.

Cathedral. We walked to the cathedral hoping to enjoy its beauty and were surprised to still be allowed to walk around when their was a Good Friday service going on. They were friendly and gave us a program and we enjoyed looking around, although it felt strange to do while people were worshipping. The architecture is beautiful as well as the stained-glass windows. A must-see free stop!

Spectacular.. St. Patrick's is one of the most wonderful sights to see in The City. They have just completed an extensive renovation of the inside and outside of the cathedral stripping off years of grime, revealing the beauty of the marble and repairing damaged stain glass.Take your time wandering the inside and marveling at the artwork and artisanship of the statues, wood work and glass work. Learn the history of all the Saints that have shrines there, and if you catch the organ being played prepare to be amazed.Well worth the visit.

My Favorite stop in 5th Avenue. they renew it, yet they kept all the old work untouched, very big, there is guided tours to take you inside of it, there is ash rooms for famous persons inside as well, very refined architecture details, the mass there is really worth attending it.

Beautifully renovated . Finally the renovations are complete inside and out. I was fortunate to be there during an organ rehearsal and that added to the experience. I am Catholic so the cathedral has an extra attraction for me. On the day I was there the stained glass rose window was brilliant. A great place to give thanks.
Just awesome. Was there for Good Friday. Besides the architecture, hearing the pipe organ is a religious experience in itself. For a bit of peace this is one place to head in the middle of Manhattan.

Beautiful no matter your religion. As title state it's just plain beautiful!! The interior is insanely nice and amazing to see. If in NY you need to make this one of your visits considering its across the street from the Rockefeller center also.

Awesome. No better place to attend Catholic Mass, especially on special days such as Christmas or Easter. Even if you are not Catholic, it is a beautiful structure dedicated to God. Awesome architecture. You need to experience it, nit just look at it.

Beautiful Church. We went to the Easter Sunday Mass at 1 PM and although it was crowded we arrived 30 minutes before the mass started and we were able to sit when they opened the doors. Beautiful church.

What a beautiful Church. We had alook thru this cathedral on a recent visit to New York and it was when the pope was visiting so all of the scaffold had been removed after the major refurb. What a beautiful spot to visit. I would highly recommend a visit whether or not you are a catholic or religious for that matter.Wonderful history as well.

Stunning architecture. Turning the corner from the Rockerfella centre to see this outstanding building takes your breath away, it's so beautiful. The building stand out of place slightly because it so light coloured, against the darker backdrop of the surrounding buildings, it deserves to be in a grand park on its own. On entering we got such a warm welcome from greeters just inside the foyer. There is so much to see, and looking upwards to the magnificent vaulted ceiling is truly a religious experience regardless of faith.
Easter Mass. We attended Easter Mass at the Cathedral and were throughly impressed by the Clergy, the congregation and the Cathedral architecture. If visiting NYC, I recommend attending. Mass there.
Easter Sunday. Great renovation, great organisation, just attended mass on easter sunday, logistics of people great. congratulations to its security staff.

Absolutely gorgeous and breathtaking!. I just stopped in for a few minutes but I thought it was just amazing! The organists were practicing and I think I even choked up a bit. Gorgeous and worth going in!
Loved St Patrick's Cathedral. Loved my visit to St Patricks, one of the most beautiful places I have visited. Look forward to visit again.

A peacful oasis in the jungle. I love NY City, the brisk turmoil and liveliness of all the City has to offer. To enjoy it completely it´s absolutely it´s essential to clear your mind once in a while this is a MUST visit! The atmosphere is filled with grace and peace.
This is a Wonderfull Building.. You feel the sacredness as you enter. As a contractor I was in awe of the construction detail. Every area was somewhat unique and deserved a close look.
Impressive Cathedral. Situated on a bust Avenue, although big is dwarfed by the skyscrapers around it. The interior & the windows are impressive.
St Patrick's cathedral. A beautiful church set in fifth Avenue among all the big buildings, it is a lovely change from high neck breaking buildings

Stained glass and marble. I can't really explain my fascination with old churches and the architecture of the day but there is nothing like it. i can't wait until the renovations are finished and i can see the new and improved version.
Beautfiul church, so peaceful. I always stop in at St. Pat's when I'm in NYC. It's so beautiful since they cleaned the inside and outside up. Wonderful place to find inter peace.

Breathtaking. This is simply one of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen. During my stay in New York City, we stopped by St. Patrick's' Cathedral and were lucky enough to arrive while a service was in process. This inside of the church has a very serene feeling.

Stunning and almost out of place. We saw it as we approached the Rockerfeller centre, the top pointing out above the building that tried to mask it. It was great to see such a beautiful building in an otherwise square and concrete area. It was as if someone had picked it up from somewhere and dropped it in the middle of New York. We aren't big architectural loving types but it was hard not to like this building for what it looked like rather than what it was or did.

What a beautiful cathedral. We were happy to stumble onto this church as we were walking around the city. We had been told about the church and it didn't disappoint. Very beautiful! We were able to walk around and take photos in most of the areas. Be respectful of those inside the church.

Gorgeous and awe inspiring!. Go see this in the morning, before the crowds, and watch the early morning sun light the spires. Then step inside away from the noise and bedlam of the city. Peaceful, majestic, grounding, take the time to make the circuit and appreciate each of the small chapels. It isn't laden with statues, or encrusted in gold like many European cathedrals, but it has a majestic simplicity that will take your breath away.

NYC landmark. Although I hate having throngs of tourists take pictures even when mass is being said, it's hard not to be in awe with the cathedral.Worth a visit when you are in NYC...plus it's a few steps away from Rockefeller Center.
Peaceful. You will appreciate the beauty of this cathedral once you get inside. A lot of tourist pass by here to pray and for some, to take pictures.
Awe inspiring place. The cathedral is huge and absolutely stunning. It is definitely worth a visit if you are on 5th Ave. Stained glass is beautiful. Place of peace and beauty

A beautiful place. Spent an hour or so walking around the cathedral on a rainy day. Unbelievable architecture and a very serene place. Check it out if you have an extra hour or so. Very close to Rockefeller Center. Just remember no drink or hats inside the building. Enjoy.

Stunning cathedral right out of Europe! . Just a gorgeous venue. Possibly the best one in the city (I haven't seen them all). It was good Friday and services were in session, so didn't get to explore the entire place out of respect. Entry way, stained glass, ornate detail and amazing backdrop were all on display to enjoy. It's interesting to see the monitors they have added on all the pillars for outside seating - excellent use of technology to improve the attendees experience, but does stick out.
Impressive. Impressive as its in the middle of NY. Less so if you are use't to the grand cathedrals of old Europe.

Breathtaking!. We happened upon this beautiful cathedral by chance as we were sightseeing and so glad that we did. There was a service in progress but you can still enter and stay in the back. I would recommend standing there and soaking in all the beauty and grace of this building!
Beautiful. It's a classic and a beautiful place to visit. In just about an hour you can go around the church, checking out the details and the hugeness of the place.

Beauty at every turn . No matter what you believe; everyone can find appreciation inside the cathedral. The stained glass, the woodwork on the pews, the reverence of the visitors and the beauty of the sculptures. We were here during Holy Week and the activity was constant. Once again take your time and enjoy the beauty before you get caught up taking pictures.

Just as amazing in person. We were in New York for spring break site seeing the Cathedral was on our list. It is so amazing in person. You are invited in, there our tours available. My husband and daughter took the time to light a candle and make a small donation. The amount of detail is breathtaking. The location is right on 5th ave. The area makes you feel alive and very New York.
Beautiful Cathedral. Spectacular cathedral in the heart of NYC. Attend during one of their many services and hear the beautiful pipe organ.

The Most Beautiful Church I've Ever Seen. I was so blown away when I walked inside of this church. It was massive, spotless, and there was art everywhere. ( I think it was art- there may be a more appropriate religious term for it, though...) Stained glass windows, sculptures, even the ceiling. I really liked how there was a camera free area as well, so that people could be at peace. The affiliated gift shop across the street was much less crowded than the one inside.

Went to St. Patrick's for Palm Sunday Mass. Attended Palm Sunday Mass in New York at St. Patrick's and enjoyed a fresh take on Mass where the trial by Pontius Pilate is done with a larger group giving it a fresh feel far more theatrical than anything I had ever seen and making it very pleasant and inviting. Well done.

The "Mother" Cathedral of New York City ...Saint Paticks Church. Centrally located on 5th Avenue @ 50th Street St. Pats is always opened during the daylight hours. Visit it and see the spectacular renovations that have happened over the last 2 years, as a matter of fact there is still a small amount of work still being done. All the stained glass windows have been cleaned and restored. Visit the alters along both sides of the church and as well there are alters behind the central gran alter. Great little gift store and they also have a gift store across the street.

Truly a beautiful house of worship. Although I do not affiliate with any religion, I love churches, mosques, buddist temples etc and take every opportunity to visit. This was was truly an amazing work of love.
St Patrick's- a must see. I am not of the Christian faith but I take all my New York visitors there. I am always struck by the magnificent architecture. Knowing the history of how it was built helps.
Stunning. The architecture on the chapel is beyond fabulous and definitely worth a look. If you are walking along 5th Avenue you will happen upon St Patrick's. You must stop for a visit
Great renovation. Stunning church in the middle of Manhattan. Tremendous history of events. The renovation of the exterior is gorgeous.
Beautiful building. Stunning building which is kept beautifully. The security staff could be better prepared to deal with tourists. I found them rude with no need for it at all.
Nice.... Very very beutiful church, even inside or outside. Free for come in, security staff are very nice. You will have very nice picture
Oh Praise God. This place is a big part of NYC history. People from all over the world are in awe of this special Cathedral. I am blow away from their Choir. It's sublime!
It's a church worth seeing. Well this church is quite the architectural delight. A great place to see. In a city with many different cultures and what not it's a marvel to see this place.

Saint Patrick's Cathedral. How does a person describe Saint Patrick's Cathedral. I could have stayed on the outside for hours, taking pictures of the beautiful architecture.....so very intricate. Am so thankful to those who spent the money and took the time to build a Cathedral that will be here for many centuries to come! The SPC gift shop across the street was a delight also. We found so many wonderful treasures....!Thank you NYC!
Beautiful church. One of my favorite churches in NY - a must see! Look out for all the details and before you go out light a candle.
Gorgeous Cathedral. Right across from Rockefeller Center. It is a beautiful church with a massive pipe organ, I would have loved to hear what it sounds like.
History & Heritage. What a really beautiful place to see and enjoy for so many qualities. Historically, Structurally, Spiritually and Peacefully.

Palm Sunday at St Pat's. Although we arrived several minutes late, we didn't miss the procession and were lucky enough to get seats, despite an SRO crowd. Cardinal Dolan delivered the homily. The music was good, but not great. I'm glad I was able to attend mass at St Pat's on Palm Sunday.
Breathtaking. St Patrick"s Cathedral should be on your must see list for New York, the architecture is absolutely stunning!!

a peaceful place. a very beautiful and reverent place. I sat and meditated this time. Attended mass even though I am not Catholic. You can sit and be at peace. Light a candle (for a donation) and pray. No one bothers you. They do bag checks so don't carry big backpacks or pocketbooks.
Impressive. Beautiful and Impressive! It is a must see if you are near the area. It can be relaxing and peaceful escape when you step in off the busy streets of NYC.
Nice. I been on different cathedral and this one is very different from the other ones, we went after the pope was there and they still have his items . Nice experience

Stunning. Stopped in here to see where my husband's parents married one another 60 years ago. A Mass was just starting but we didn't sit down. The architecture on the inside and the outside is incredible.

Magnificent Cathedral. One of the top cathedrals in the world - recently upgraded and made spotless when the Pope visited. It's gorgeous stained-glass windows, altars, marble statues, and the sound of organ music make this a perfect place to worship, kneel in prayer, or simply view as a tourist.

St. Patrick's Cathedral, New York, NY. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a must-see for anyone visiting midtown/downtown New York as it is a glorious survivor of and reminder of the great Gothic Cathedrals of Europe and the many fine churches built in America during the "Guilded Age." We were there when the several-year cleaning and refurbishment was wrapping up ahead of the visit by Pope Francis. Walking around inside and looking up at the soaring marble transept, "sky-high" vaulting and gorgeous stained glass windows, one is reminded that, amidst the suffering and turmoil in the world today, humans must still harbor beauty and peace within if they are able to create such beautiful and transcendent spaces in the outside world.

Impressive historic structure.. I was genuinely impressed by the ornate detail of this cathedral. The stone and word work are truly beautiful. There are many lovely statues inside as well. The stained glass is incredible as well. This is a great place to stop and see quickly, for a break between other activities, or you could take a tour. Either way, it is worth a look. The patrons there are very welcoming.

Good Stop for a Rest. St. Patrick's Cathedral is right in front / behind Rockefeller Center. We noticed that the doors were open so we decided to explore. The cathedral is free, but they do accept "love offerings." There are plenty of pews that you can relax in. They do offer a place in the back for prayer. (No photographs are allowed in that area.) I wouldn't go out of my way to go to St. Patrick's but if you're in the area, go for it!

The restoration is incredible!. I would highly suggest walking through St. Patrick's Cathedral to witness the wonderful restoration. It is almost marble white now and the soft blue glow that fills the rooms is simply stunning. It is free and it only takes about 45 minutes to see. I wish they were giving afternoon tours when we went, but it was still lovely to see.
Awesome. Renovations are done and the work is spectacular! Gives you a bit of quiet in the middle of your noisy day.
Sparkles. Was in attendance for St Patrick's Day mass. The interior scaffolds had just come down after a major renovation and cleaning. The place gleamed and sparkled.

Beautiful Cathedral. St. Patrick's Cathedral is worth a stop. Its location surprises and sneaks up on you. A step inside is amazing. The beauty and peacefulness is amazing. It's an architectural marvel.
Christmas midnight mass. Very crowded and difficult to find a place. Well worth! Wonderful experience and lovely cathedral. Priest was good and there was a true Christmas spirit among all attendees

Beautiful visit. This cathedral is beautiful and we had a view of it from our hotel so took the time to visit. It is so beautiful inside. At the time we visited there was a choir practicing--beyond amazing. You can walk around the whole cathedral and take some pictures. We also lit a candle for someone who had passed away. Was a great place to visit.

The most beautiful Cathedral I have ever seen.. This cathedral is breathtaking and amazing. The architecture is unbelievable...could not have ever imagined something this beautiful. The staff were welcoming and helpful....

Beautiful Catholic Church. My family and I went to see the church and mass was occurring. This allowed us to sit for a little while and rest and pray. This was unexpected as it was an odd time of the weekday. After the mass ended, and people started to leave, another mass began. I don't know if this is standard or just because of Lent. But it was a nice quiet time in a rather hectic vacation.

Magnificent structure on 5th. We did not planed it, just happened that way...While walking with other tourists on 5th Ave we were in the right place at the right time... It was a Palm Sunday, and service just started, and me and my wife are both Roman Catholic...We went in and stayed. Only one downside to our experience was that (as seen in attached photos) was a restauration going on full scale to preserve this great monuments for future generations.Magnificent...Yours trulyAK

I wish we could have gone in!. We were only in NYC for 3.5 days therefore had a lot packed into our itinerary. Unfortunately we didn't get to St. Patrick's until about 11:00pm one night (also while it was under construction) therefore we couldn't see much, but what we did see blew us away. It was astonishing.
nice and very lightful. It has a special atmosphere and with the good lights and structure it is easy to find your perfect spot in this church to reflect.

Gothic Gotham. As a great cathedral it is average, but as a NY attraction it is great. The Old St Patrick's was too far downtown and too much like a normal church for the New York that kept on growing and moving uptown.It is grand and huge. There is plenty of marble and decor, and a shop right hand side of the main entrance, which I for one think should be moved to the basement.This church is extremely elitist. On all the great holidays, high mass by the cardinal is by invitation only. This selection by rank is the legacy of Cardinal O'Connor whom the present pope would have surely fired as he was the last openly bigoted bully to run the cathedral in grand style while neglecting his duties, which the scandals of recent years have more than clearly demonstrated. The general look is a mix of pompous and funereal, as if a Protestant architect had been selected but fired in the middle of construction, which was finished at some point by an Eastern European one, from either Slovakia or Southern Ukraine or the guy that designed Temple Emmanuel further up in the avenue. This is a great example of New York trying to delude itself into thinking this is a major basilica in Imperial Vienna or Rome, but it doesn't quiet work: There are a lot of tacky modern sculptures that look embarrassingly aggressive and ugly next to the earlier altars and chapels into which they have been shoved.On the upside there is a relatively new chapel to the Virgin of Guadalupe that has beautiful 18th century painting with the image of the Virgin. It is always packed with flowers and more candles than any other shrine, a clear testimony to the changing population of Catholics in NY which are now by far largely Mexican.The organ is great and if you are there by chance when it's been played by all means enjoy.Avoid being there during the Christmas holiday when it becomes a running corridor for the 5th Avenue crowds that go see the Christmas window displays at Sacks, unless you enjoy being crushed by a shoving and pushing constant flow of humanity.
Must see. From the top of the rock we were able to see this church.The stained glass is something to witness.
Beautiful building. We stopped here on our way to Rockefeller plaza. Well worth the stop. The building is so beautiful. Really enjoyed photographing this cathedral.

stunning. We went to mass on a Sunday. It was a very beautiful church. The mass was very uplifting. Just sitting in there was truly amazing. The restoration job gave the cathedral just face lift it needed to still represent the old and yet some of the new. I highly recommend visiting, even if its just to walk through it.

A Must Visit. My advice is sign up early and register for a tour. If you can't get on a tour download the app and take the self-guided tour. It can be closed to visitors at times due to events taking place so best to check first before planning a visit. Do a tiny bit of research before visiting as there is a rich history behind its construction, the organs, stained glass rose window, etc.

Impressive in or out.. This last week, because it was a Sunday, the doors were wide open. Was neat to see that way at night. I've been inside too in the past. It is incredible the money and work put in to it.

Wonderful. Be mindful when visiting any cathedral, that it is a sacred place where mass may be being held.St Patrick's cathedral has beautiful architecture and a good 'feel'. Upon entering the cathedral, it provided me with a sense of calm. I sat down and appreciated it. I was amazed that, whilst walking the streets of New York, we stumbled across this beautiful cathedral. Worth visiting, even if it is for some solace.
Beautiful Church. We went to mass at St. Patrick's on Sunday, and it was very uplifting. It is a beautiful building inside and out, and it is a must see.

Old World Meets New. St. Paddy's is a wonderful modern representation of a Gothic cathedral, especially after the "restoration/cleaning." The building sparkles as sun light dances upon the granite. Inside the cathedral the vaulted ceiling lifts your eyes to the heavens. A must see while in New York city.
Beautiful Church. A beautiful architectural structure. The stained glass windows are glorious. A must-see for those interested in old Cathedrals in the U.S.

An inspiring visit.. What a beautiful place. I have to admit I was surprised at how stunning it was. Usually a place that receives so many people is a little worn. Not here. The architecture is gorgeous and the works of art are beautiful.
Very solemn. Whenever I travel I always go to different Catholic church and by far this is one of the best church I've visited.
St. Patrick Cathedral Visit. Catholic or not this is a true worth visiting landmark, breathtaking architecture inside and outside. I was lucky to be part of mass.

Most Beautiful. St Patricks is perhaps one of the most beautiful Cathedrals I have ever seen-the stained glass windows are stunning and the atmosphere is wonderful-allow at least 1-2 hours to read all there is to read and to take it all in

Beautiful Landmark, nevertheless a church. St. Patrick's is a must see when in NYC. However do not forget this is a religious place. It is a church. Please remember to be respectful, I saw some people being escorted out and called upon when taking pictures while in mass or not taking their caps off. If there is not a mass ongoing you can take pictures. It is a breathtaking architecture. There is a little shop across the street where you can buy religious items, for those who are interested in bringing religious items for family. I suggest attending a mass if you are catholic, it was a great experience.
Worth a Visit. If you are in the neighborhood this is worth a visit to see the architecture, etc. You should be respectful of those who are engaged in prayer.

Stunning Part of NYC. The architecture and history of St. Patrick's is absolutely stunning. We appreciated that we were able to just walk in and quietly take in St. Patrick's even while services were taking place. A definite must see.

Catholic or not, please go. We went to St. Patrick's for first Friday Mass and it was incredible. I assume they were non-Catholics, but the visitors not choosing to participate were incredibly respectful. The Cathedral is beautiful and worth a look.

Wow wow wow. My husband and I are not religious, but what an experience it was to see this gorgeous building. We walked around inside in awe of the architecture and history. We would come back to hear a Mass if we knew we'd here someone playing the organ.

A source of calm and tranquility within Bedlam. This is a glorious cathedral built in the classic style of gothic arches and stained glass.
Somehow, it manages to continue to remain within its purpose whilst allowing sightseers.
Unlike other religious denominations, this is regarded as a place of worship and entry is without charge

Majestic!!!. You must see this place when in NYC just simply for the awesome majestic architecture. It was heavenly simply to take in the structure itself. Would have loved to been here for mass. Next time for sure.
Great Place to Visit. I always like to visit St. Patrick's Cathedral when I am in NY. It's such a beautiful cathedral, so calm and serene.
Beautiful!. The cathedral is incredibly breathtaking! The stained glass was beautiful! Go when there is a mass going on and you will see the Cathedral full of people.

Very impressive from outside and even more from inside. I've often been impressed by the outdoor architecture of the Cathedral but never cared to get in until my last trip to NYC when I had more time than usually. I'm glad I did go in, and it was during mass, so the cathedral was packed with crowds and gave a special feeling to the visit. The architecture is no amateur work, and dimensions are just astonishing!!

Surprise Gem For Us. We were walking on 5th Avenue and happened upon St. Patrick's Cathedral. It is a wonderful place for quiet contemplation in one of the pews. It is a beautiful facility and unique gem for members of the Catholic faith and non Catholics. If you are a believer, there is a lot of history within the walls of the main sanctuary of St. Patrick's.

Simply Beautiful. Stopped in while walking down 5th avenue and listened to a mass. After the mass we walked around the cathedral, lit a candle for our loved ones and reviewed the stations of the cross.
It was a very solemn experience
Stop in for a quiet moment . St Patrick's is a Beautiful cathedral and a perfect place to take a breather from the craziness of 5th avenue. The cathedral is Beautifully renovated.
beautiful. This Cathedral is very beautiful and a must see no matter your religion. You can walk in and view, light a candle (for a $2.00 donation) or go on into the pews to pray/worship.

Beautiful. Beautiful church . . . windows and furniture. My mom was disappointed by the commercialization of the church, but it was a nice place to sit and reflect if you can tune out the tourists throughout the church.

A favourite. I love to visit this place. Not religious at all, but I enjoy the tranquillity and sense of history in the Cathedral. Sign the register, sit and listen (or take part) in a Mass, and enjoy this haven, away from the hustle and bustle of the City.
Winderful. So much more to see. Went to a Sunday service, awesome and respectful. Very welcoming. A must see. All privately funded.

Worth visiting. Just happened to walk by and we went in. Really beautiful place - wroth seeing. There was some exhibit there when we went and it was very crowded. I'm sure there are people there all the time, but we still saw everything and lit a little candle for my Dad - love you Dad!

Gorgeous. Really stunning architecture. It's easy to criticize the over the top indulgence of the place but it's beautiful. Wander the area behind the pulpit and along the sides to see intricate carvings and stories of the saints. There was an organist playing while we were there on a Sunday afternoon which added to the grandeur. Worth 30 minutes to an hour for sure.

Magnificently renovated cathedral. St. Patrick's Cathedral has been beautifully renovated and cleaned up and it is back to its original splendor. It is a destination for New Yorkers or visitors from all over the world whether you are Catholic or not.

Church. We saw this when we first arrived and thought how stunning it was,then in the evening as we was walking to Rockefeller we came across it again and saw that people was going in so we went to have a look. Inside was stunning whilst we was in there the nuns started singing then there was a procession going on we didn't stay to see it lol but was very interesting to see.
A very special place. . So glad to have stopped to have a look. Wish we had stayed longer. Gift shop very reasonable. Simply beautiful.

Absolutely Beautiful!. This was one of the most breathtaking churches I've ever been in, and I've been to the Vatican. If you have the time, go. It is humbling to sit in silence, and reflect on the beauty around you.

Beautiful Place in the midst of the hustle!. We loved our time enjoying the Cathedral. We were strolling down 5th Avenue and stopped in to see the church and listen to a lovely choir that was performing. It was a wonderful respite.

Finally Cleaned. I have been waiting a long time for the scaffolding to be removed in order to enjoy the inside of the cathedral again. It isn't completely finished, but now visitors can grasp the beauty of this grand place of worship once again.

NYC S Holy Place. This is the perfect place to take some time to reflect and take a break from the craziness that can be New York
If you're lucky you could come upon some beautiful sacred music while you are visiting

Historic and Beautiful Architecture. The history and the amazing details of the architecture of the Saint Patrick's Cathedral is a must-see! After the renovation project completion, the cathedral is beautiful and breathtaking!

Magic. A fantastic and beautiful structure in an environment that leads to prayer with kind and attentive staff to answer questions and assist tourists.
A must-see place to visit.

A visit to God's house. This is a special place of peace and reflection .I enjoyed Our Lady's Chapel a very nice ,quiet chapel to pray ,reflect and relax from the crowd. I also visited the crypts below the altar[with special permission] where Cardinal O'Conor and Arch Bishop Fulton J Sheen are entombed . In addition to its history, architectural beauty it is a place to sit, reflect and be thankful to our Maker , no matter what religious background one subscribes to.

Absolutely Breathtaking. My husband and I went to NYC this past weekend and went in to St.Patrick's Cathedral during a Sunday mass, this has got to be one of the most beautiful churches that I have ever been in, absolutely breathtaking people were very friendly that were ushers etc. I would love to take a tour next time I am in NYC. I would have take photos, but it was during a mass.

Stunning. I was here for Easter in 2015, and it was under construction. During my most recent trip, the construction was complete. The Cathedral is absolutely incredible. I highly recommend stopping by and touring the church. If you wish to light a candle, it is a minimum $2 donation. I unfortunately did not have any cash on me.
Night time visit. Light a candle suggested donation is $ 2 and is optional. Sanctuary is absolutely gorgeous. Great for architecture buffs

All Cleaned Up. Our tour guide showed us how the facade has been sandblasted to perfection, making St. Patrick's look the way it should. Next door, he pointed to an office building built by Greek shipping tycoon Aristotle Onassis. Jackie persuaded him to use a facade of dark glass to reflect the glory of the cathedral. Who knew?
Stunning . Since the renovation was completed this cathedral is just stunning. You're in awe of the detailed work from floor to ceiling. Truly stunning.
Beautiful. Another New York gem. Impressive structure that has been renovated. It's beautiful inside and outside. A must visit for any tourist.

Beautiful Cathedral. This was our first stop during our recent visit to NYC. We attended mass and afterwards toured the church on our own. It was recently cleaned and renovated for the Pope's visit so all the marble is gleaming! There is an app you can download onto your phone to do a self guided tour of the church. Another thing to note is there is not a public toilet facility in the church. You need to go across the street. It is a beautiful cathedral and worth a visit!
Beautiful. We were there for noon mass and the pipe organ and the cantor were amazing. Amazing architecture, beautiful Windows.

Never seen a church like this!. I was amazed not only at the size but all of the things to see inside. We didn't think we'd spend as much time as we did because it was so interesting. There were some guided tours going on but we went on our own and were very impressed.

renovation great, tour bad. Having lived in NY most of my life except for the last several years, I have been to St. Pat's more times than I can remember for at least 50 years. I never remember there having been a renovation until this latest one. The renovation was fantastic! I didn't realize how "dirty" it was until I saw how white the building looks now. Go see it now- you won't regret it.My Mom ( who has been coming here over 75 years) & I took the free tour recently as we had never been on it. It was a complete waste of time other than they allowed us onto the main altar where I had never been.However the tour guide, a volunteer parishoner, was one of the worst guides I have ever had. She was totally disinterested in the tour members & seemed to resent them. Honestly, we knew more about the Cathedral than she did. It was an embarrassment to be on a tour with her.St Pat's get tour guides who want to be there & will add value to a tour!
Beautiful architecture and stained glass. This church is absolutely stunning -- the stained glass, the architecture, the apse, the marble. Awe-inspiring landmark!

Really impressive and inspirational. No matter your religion or beliefs you will find this visually stunning. A true cathedral in America. The stained glass is simply breathtaking. The custodians and people working their are warm and friendly. Located in the heart of midtown Manhattan. Truly a must see in New York.

Beautiful!. A peaceful and reflecting walk through this cathedral is recommended for all faiths. To wander past the many statues of saints, alters, stain glass windows is nothing less than amazing. Remember to look up to appreciate all this building has to offer.

A beautiful building inside and out. This is a beautiful building inside. Worthy of a visit no matter your denomination. You are allowed to take photographs but you should be respectful of others using the Cathedral.
Inspiring. Beautiful cathedral. Amazing architecture. I was happy that they allow pictures taken to remember the visit.
Brilliant historic church. Must see, must visit, check out grave yard dating back to 1720's and the liberty bell all the way from whitechapel foundry

Breathtaking place. What a beautiful place ! Wether you are religious or not it's a wonderful place to visit. The architecture is outstanding with its beautiful columns and stained glass windows.Once inside though I felt so sorry for the homeless people who were sleeping on the pews - only to get back outside and see overpriced shops selling their overpriced goods at extortionate prices ! The cathedral is literally sparkling from outside with its beautiful stone glowing in the sunlight, this place is well worth a visit.

Good visit!. Whether you are Roman Catholic or not the Cathedral is worth a visit. Note the beautiful columns and stained glass windows. Be mindful if there is mass going on and turn cel phones off and be respectful; note that this is a place of worship. You can schedule a visit for taking pictures when the service is over, if you are not of the faith. If you wish to attend mass here, get the schedule of masses in advance and go early. The Cathedral fills up fast.

Beautiful. This was somewhere I had always wanted to visit and finally managed to get around to it on this trip to New York. St Patrick's is beautiful and peaceful (even though there are lots of tourists wandering around). Everybody was respectful that this is a church and that some people were there to worship
Beautiful. If you come to New York this is a very special and Beautiful church to visit. It's located just off Broadway near Times Square.
Beautiful Structure. This is such a beautiful cathedral. While traveling in NYC, it is a must see. Spend some time in this peaceful place.

Gothic Architecture at its Best. We were lucky to go on a sunny day when we could see the impressive stained glass windows . It is swamped by tall skyscraper's until you are outside on 5th Avenue . A lovely calm building that was pristinely clean.

you must. Have visited this Cathedral several times while visiting NY. I am never disappointed when I step into this magnificent structure. You sense the peace, faith and comfort of all that have gathered before you and embraced all of God's blessings
Definitely a must see. So, there we were, just walking in to admire the great architecture of the church and we ended up staying for Mass. Loved the experience. Loved the beautiful house of prayers.
Prayerful Atmosphere despite the tourists.. St Patrick's Cathedral had a prayerful atmosphere despite all the tourists. Great stain glass windows.

Wonderful Experience!. I've been to NYC a few times and I had missed St. Patrick's each time. Well I'm so happy that we finally did go and stayed for the 5:30 mass. The only thing that I didn't think was appropriate that there were people milling about while mass was going on.
NYC Getaway. I love visiting this beautiful cathedral! We have enjoyed organ concerts a few times before and this time attending Sunday service. It was very inspiring...

Easter Mass. A must for Catholics and Christians alike. Well worth the visit. The church and her history is amazing. Out of all the Catholic churches in the city I think St. Pat's is the most wonderful.
Nice Cathedral. We always stop here on every visit to New York. It's really nice and big. Everyone's welcome. Gift shop inside.
Visit to St. Patricks. Wandering through 5th Av. we decided to go inside the Cathedral and we gratefull to take a minutes to pray, light a candle and enjoy the tranquility.

Spiritual retreat in the heart of Manhattan. A lovely building opposite the Rockefeller Building, spacious and functional. It was nice to attend Mass and receive communion. As with all major religious institutions it serves as a warm dry spot for the poor and homeless who in fairness didn't disrupt the peace. As with every other attraction in New York, security is in place at the door. They are quick and less official than at other locations.

Beautiful Place, Free worth the trip. Mixed this in on a day we went to see other attractions and it was so pretty. You can walk around and take pictures and light a candle very peaceful place in the middle of a busy city

Crick in the neck from viewing so many beautiful things!. The cleaning of the interior and the addition of larger screens for people to see Mass behind a column has made the cathedral very nice. During the day, one can walk into the apse and look in both directions. A few things have been moved around. The site is magnificent, but there is a psychological warmth to it. Glad I saw it before the cleaning and now afterwards. The windows and the sculptures are still awe-filling, no matter one's views on religion.

Absolutely Beautiful!. Whether or not you are catholic or religious at all there is a beauty found here in the middle of the bustling city that you should not miss. Since the renovation this cathedral is breath taking and definitely warrants a stop while visiting the city.
Stunning. What a stunning cathedral! So beautiful and peaceful inside and out. Very well worth a visit. A popular place for tourists to see.

Scaffolding is Gone. Hard to describe this beautiful, holy place. It really needs to be seen since it's so hard to describe. I love the craftsmanship of the masons and woodworkers. Men, please remember to take your hats off.

Very pretty cathedral. A stunning cathedral built in the european style, decorated with various memorials to saints and religious leaders alongside containing some stunning stain glass windows. Worth a quick look around if you are in the area.

Prayerful,peaceful and architecture to simply bowl you over.. You could not fail to be impressed with this amazing cathedral.This is a haven of peace in the middle of a very busy New York City.From the moment one enters the cathedral one could not fail to be impressed by the most beautiful architecture.I enjoyed the opportunity walk around and admire as well as kneel down and pray.I went back for two further visits for mass.A very peaceful and prayerful experience.

Beautiful Restoration. Two years ago, when I was at the cathedral, scaffolding filled the nave while the cathedral underwent a 135 million dollar restoration. This past February, when in New York City, I made sure I stopped by St. Patrick's to check out the result of the restoration. Wow! The white stone walls, columns and vaulted ceiling gleamed! Now, add the beautiful stained glass windows and standing inside one of the most grand cathedrals in the world was like standing inside a gigantic jewel. I also took advantage of the opportunity to attend a Sunday mass (I'm Protestant) and experience that gorgeous architecture, religious pageantry, and huge pipe organ in a worship service. There were several times I got a little choked up by the beauty of the service in such an amazing setting. To top it off the service was presided over by the popular, and charismatic Cardinal Dolan who's originally from my neck of the woods, St. Louis.
Spectacular on the Inside and Outside. Dropped in early one morning before and during Mass. This is wide angle photography heaven, but remember its a place of worship so be subtle.

Beautiful, Historical Church. This cathedral is nothing shy of stunning. The architecture has been maintained immaculately and the whole building is very well taken care of. It is a warm and inviting place for anyone looking to seek a bit of solitude or just to admire the beauty that will surround you in the cathedral. The ceiling was one of my favorite details, it pays homage to the days that the church was built and has been restored perfectly. This is definitely a must-see church in NYC.
Incredible church. Beautiful church reminds me of those in Europe. Soaring ceilings and gorgeous stain glass. No admission fee unless you want the pricy $40 tour.

MUST SEE!. The photos do not do it justice, of course! The art, the architecture, the stained glass, the history and just the sheer beauty of this place was amazing. Visitors can walk through just to view everything. They can spend some quiet time in a pew or light a candle.There was a gift shop and guided tours available.
Absolutely beautiful!. This is the first I have been there since all the restorations were done. It takes your breath away! There are several daily Masses.
Recently Renovated Iconic Church. St. Patrick's Cathedral has never been more beautiful! Recently removed makes it all the more lovely. Recently visited by Pope Frances - a must see.

Breathtaking. This I must say might be at the top of my list for things to see in NYC. I was in complete awe the entire time I was inside this beautiful exquisite architecturally defined church WOW!!!

I love coming here. Coming here many times in the year is a gift for New Yorkers. My friend and I came here the weekend before Christmas, and it was beautiful. The air smelled of incense, we got to attend the last few minutes of mass, and it was so serene and peaceful. You leave here rejuvenated..
Free!. A stunning cathedral and free to enter. So worth having a look. A service was taking place when we visited. Candles are available to light. Recommend going in.
Love Architecture. Amazing and beautiful. Stop and really look at the beauty. The stain glass is much more appreciated from inside.

Beautiful. I was really looking forward to seeing this cathedral as I love churches, and this one is no exception I just looked everything about it, from the decor to the layout. I was very impressed, only downside is that I couldn't stay longer than I had planned.
Beautiful building. Considering that this building is modern by standards in UK, it did not feel modern and the craftsmanship is exceptional.
A must see. A remarkable building in the hustle and bustle of Manhatten - great to pop in and light a candle in such a serene place. Fantastic ornate carvings and features well worth a visit.

Cathedral in the City. A beautiful cathedral which is undergoing some external renovation (mostly completed). Stunning stained glass windows. Step inside and take a bit of time out to enjoy the quietness and beauty.
AWESOME! . Words are not enough to express the beauty, the solemnity of this place. Open to visitors and for mass...an awesome time in an awesome place. .
A quiet place. Come in from the crowds and fine some spiritual peace. This beautiful place is such a respit from the noise.
Stunning Building. What an amazing building this is, beautiful huge interior and stunning architecture. Well worth going in even if you are just passing by while shopping on 5th Avenue.

Beautiful NYC Landmark should be on your list to visit. St Patrick's Cathedral is a NY landmark that should be on your list of places to visit. It is located in midtown Manhattan on 5th Avenue very close to the Rockefeller Centre. It's Neo-Gothic Roman architecture is stunning. It has recently had major restoration work done. I last visited before the exterior marble was cleaned and the difference is dramatic - it looks fabulous today. The twin spires, extensive use of marble, beautiful stained glass, the immense organ, the alter - truly a joy to behold. Recommended.

Tranquility and Reflection. Regardless of your religion, this is a must on 5th ave. It was so lovely and calming away from the noise of the city, we sat for at least an hour reflecting and walking around. I believe there are tours held here which I would imagine would be excellent especially as I heard they have spent 175million restoring it. There are a few homeless people sleeping to get out of the cold but no bother.The architecture really is breathtaking and it was free entry, great for a rainy day, we did light candles for 2 dollars each.

Even if ya aren't Catholic this place is a peaceful spiritual oais in the midst of a city that never sleeps!!. I hadn't been here in years and on Saturday evening my sister and my niece, and I attended the 5:30 pm Mass. The place looks really cleaned up since the last time I was here. The ceiling, the side altars, and shrines to various saints were gleaming. After the Mass, (which was the first Sunday of Lent 2016), we walked around, lit candles, and took photos while offering prayers for our family and friends. The place stays open until 9:30 pm and its a nice place to duck into for a peaceful respite no matter what your beliefs. It's also across from Rockefeller Center so we went to watch the ice skaters afterwards.

Beautiful Chapel. It's a really nice chapel, but coming from Ireland I'm used to huge impressive cathedrals so there was no wow from me when we entered. It's nice to walk around and pray or light a candle for your loved ones, but obviously not as calm or quiet an environment as a regular chapel.
Stunning!. Well worth a visit. Beautiful place to see! The structure inside and out is amazing. You can light a candle for $1 or $2 (cannot remember exactl)
Beautiful!. We were able to stop into this beautiful church. There was a service going on, so we didn't stay long or take many photos inside. The architecture was amazing!

Beautiful Cathedral. The architecture was wonderful. We visited when an all Spanish mass was going on, so it was needless to say, not understandable, but the music and the pageantry was amazing. Be sure to look at the vestabul and the ceiling.

St Patrick's. If your visiting The Rockafella Centre this cathedral is just around the corner and a must see,it's such a beautiful building and even more beautiful inside, just walk in and wander around a lot of homeless people will be in there just sitting on the seats they go there to get out of the cold they don't bother you most of them are asleep, sometimes there's a service taking place but you can still go in and have a walk around.

Stopped in along the way.... We stopped in between services on a Sunday, just missed the Bishop's service but still was lovely....a lovely church and we have been to many in Europe.....it is great to have this in NYC.....a very nice respite from the hustle and bustle. Very peaceful and calming.

Shrine of Our Lady of Czestochowa. Beautiful St. Patrick's cathedral is hidden between tall NY buildings but you can not miss it. Inside 30 different altars. Cathedral and altars were built through the commitment and generosity of grateful immigrants. Don't get surprise if some of the security will ask you to open your backpack, there is a lot of them there. When we came lady showed us guide book in a lot of languages and she ask of course where are we come from. When she heard POLAND she showed us Lady of Czestochowa.Piękna kapliczka z obrazem Matki Boskiej Częstochowskiej ufundowana przez zarówno osoby prywatne jak i związki kombatantów, weteranów etc.

History Abounds. This is a beautiful Cathedral. So much history. Cannot believe that RFK's funeral was held there and Jackie and JFK were married there. A wonderful collection to your pictures of New York.
Always amazing!. Walking through there is so serene and a blessing to see! Architecture and detail to it is amazing. History is unbelievable.
Under Construction. Work was going on, but it still was an unbelievable place to see. I think it will look totally beautiful when the restoration is complete.

I Visit Everytime I Am In NYC. I love this cathedral and always have. My first visit was over 50 yrs ago for my cousin's wedding. It is spectacular. I just can't believe you have to have your bag inspected when you enter but this is the world we live in. Very sad

Renovations Done!. Beautiful church. We visited last year while renovations were still ongoing. Simply stunning this year. So glad it is being preserved. Very quiet, holy place. Beautiful side altars to light a candle for a special intention. Small gift shop in the back.
Love this place. I visited St Patrick's while on a trip to NYC, really enjoyed it and found it very beautiful. I'm looking forward to going back someday as it was a lot to take in!

Restored and Glorious. I remember the Cathedral as dark and after years of great hard labor, the Cathedral is now majestic once again and it is now fully restored to its glory. I always pay homage to GOD and thank him for allowing me to visit HIS HOME each time I visit.

Lovely Cathedral. I really enjoyed this visit. The cathedral has a traditional feel but at a little more than a 100 years old it is very light and airy. Everybody connected with it was really helpful and made the visit memorable.

A superb monument to religion. What a superb church. The outside of the building is being cleaned and is a lovely white stone after the grime has gone. Inside as everywhere else we had our bags etc. searches.The interior of the Church and the various alcoves and alters of saints were breathtaking. Well worth a visit to this famous place whatever your beliefs.

Wow. We came across the cathedral by accident, but I'm glad we did!
An absolutely stunning building inside and out. We walked in and felt quite emotional. Quiet and serene, wonderful!
Beautiful. Stunning from the outside. Did not get a chance to go in but wish we had - a must do for next time. Beautiful church.
Beautiful building. We didn't go in but looked around the outside and what a place. It is definitely worth walking by to view the architecture.
Breathtaking. . A must see in new York. So much history. I was there a year ago. It's completely renovated now. And stay for the church service too.

Discovering NYC. I had to go and see st.pats again , I was in it when I was 17yrs old and this trip was for my 50th , so times certainly had changed and I felt it , security men in the cathedral was now a normal thing , understandable so after 2011, but still I managed a quiet prayer , it had just recently been sand blasted and done up, certainly an amazing feat of construction... well worth seeing .

Solemn. We attended an easter mass and it was very solemn. The structure of the church is outstanding. They have religious small items for sale also. Bring cash, they sell rosaries and stuff. I suggest every Catholic who comes to the city to visit this place.

Beautiful Church. Whether you are catholic or not - it's well worth the visit to St. Patrick's on 5th Avenue - across from the Rockefeller Center. There's no charge to enter and you can walk along the sides of the entire perimeter of the cathedral or you can sit at a pew and enjoy the serenity. Throughout the cathedral there's memorial candles if you wanted to light them for a stated fee.

Very beautiful. My wife and I went on Ash Wednesday and the cathedral was very busy with people waiting to have the sign of the cross on their foreheads. Choir was singing and the whole scene was so calming. The building inside reminds me of some of the great european cathedrals we have visited. The last time we came 5 years ago the cathedral was being renovated they have done a fabulous job. If you want to see beauty and feel a calming atmosphere please visit.
Shhh! You're in church. Beautiful place of worship with a touch of technology. Sat in the back one Sunday for service. Not huge.
Amazing. So beautiful and big inside. The architecture of the building is amazing and the upkeep is gorgeous.

Great Place to Worship. I had the pleasure to be in mass at the Cathedral while in NY. It is a great experience and if you are catholic you should reserve your Sunday morning to go there. My advise is that you go in the 10:15 mass because I went in the 9:00 mass and it is quick and less impressive.We stayed and took pictures inside the church and saw the preparation for the next mass and it seems grandiose.A must to see and be!

Beautiful architecture and stain glass. When you walk into the cathedral, you feel like you're in Europe. The architecture is reminiscent of Westminster Abby in London. The stain glass is also worth the trip. Check it out and light a candle before you go. It can't hurt.

The architecture and organs are one of a kind. Sunday mass with the full choir was truly moving. The music was beautiful and the altars are unbelievably ornate. Amazing stained glass and arches make this a stunning work of art.
Just restored!. Beautiful location, a landmark in New York City, with countless sculptures and art all around, security was tight but friendly.Please take off your hats when entering the church!
