Beautiful for your heart and on the eyes. There is only one St. Patrick's. Walk in and you will be amazed by its size, its beauty and its reverence. Whenever I'm in the neighborhood, I stop sit in a pew near the back and just soak it in.

Stunning Cathedral in heart of New York. We were lucky enough to visit St Patricks in March last year when refurbishment works were going on, these have now finished and the Cathedral is restored to its former glory and some glory it is! The huge stained glass ceilings/glass work is truly something along with the stunning gold altar at the front of the church. All of the priests who perform Mass in this Cathedral must truly experience something when they say Mass here. The marble floors to the lovely stands for lighting candles for those who are no longer with us, is something special. But even though this Cathedral has been restored to its former glory it has touches of every day life now with a machine that mints St Patrick Cathdral coins, yes coins! Whilst there towards the rear of the church a small service/wedding was taking place, which was lovely on Valentine's weekend. Definitely you must visit this Cathedral in the heart of New York but it is so serene and peaceful and gives a calming effect on one when you enter. All patrons adopt the quiet and although busy with patrons, it doesn't lose its charm as a lovely Cathedral.
Impressive. Family enjoyed the visit to this impressive cathedral, recently refurbished for the Pope's visit to the US

Closer to heaven. While I am divorced mostly lapsed catholic going to St Patricks seems to lift the spirits towards heaven. A lovely recently redone cathedral that rivals most of europes best. Though not up to the heights of St Peters

Tremendous all around. A tremendous experience all around. This church is amazing from both a spiritual and architectural point of view. Even with the construction phase, the building in itself is amazing and to this day I cannot pass without going in and lighting a candle in memory of a loved one.

A classic. I always enjoy a stop in St. Patrick's when I am in the area. It is an impressive cathedral on par with many of the classics in Europe. There is always lots of foot traffic but it is nice retreat from midtown even if just to stop in for a few minutes between meetings or between point A and B.

A Beautiful Cathedral Where Catholics and Non-Catholics Can Appreciate. The Cathedral is just breathtaking. You would be awed regardless of your religious affiliation. If you are not Catholic, you can still appreciate the architecture. I think the restoration is done for now. But don't be surprised if there is one by the time you visit.
Spirit is alive on 5th Avenue. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a go to anytime we are in Manhattan. Besides being a gorgeous church it is a place of reflection like no other in the states.
It's very pretty. If you are into churches. There is always a mass going on and yet people are walking around the aisles. Very weird combo.

Beautiful church. The church is almost finished with renovations and is beautiful once again. Great place to stop, light a candle and say a prayer. Be respectful of those attending mass. There is a gift shop across the street that is easier to shop in when the church is crowded.

Beautiful and Amazing Architecture. One of my favorite places I've visited in NYC. Amazing architecture and beautiful artistry! There was a line to get in when I was there, but the wait wasn't bad and well worth it.

Hallowed place. Now that the scaffolding is down the elegance and beauty of this edifice is clearly visible. Regardless of your religious inclinations visit this architectural marvel and spend some quiet time considering what its construction must have involved. Walk its interior perimeter and enjoy the statuary and other artistic offerings -- stained glass windows, etc. With just a short visit to St. Patrick's Cathedral you will be moved emotionally and refreshed for the activities awaiting you beyond the church's walls. A unique, world-class experience.
beautiful church. it is a beautiful church. they open for public for mass. you need check their schedule. but dont worry the tourist still can go inside as long as you obey the rule.

Thought I was in Rome. Just a very holy and peaceful place in a very busy city!!! Mass going on many times during the day and so very many beautiful
relics to view.

Stunningly beautiful. This cathedral, which originally opened in 1879, was just renovated as of the end of 2015. It is more beautiful now than ever. The interior and exterior look fresh and new now. You could spend hours in here if you were so inclined. There are numerous side altars to see. There is a small gift shop all the way in the back.

Incredible Landmark. We attended Christmas Eve mass at St. Patrick's Cathedral and it was the most incredible experience! Everywhere you look there is history and beauty! We shopped in the little gift shop inside the cathedral and lighted candles for our deceased family members and friends.

Beautiful. We enjoyed a brief stop at St. Patrick's Cathedral during a frigid afternoon walk on Friday. The church is absolutely beautiful and so well maintained. We were delighted that it actually seemed like a place of worship instead of a tourist attraction - much different than visiting churches in many European cities.

BEAUTIFUL. THis cathedral was right across from our hotel and it was very lovely. I did have a gentleman approach me and ask for money while inside the cathedral. Once my husband came back from taking photos on the other side of the cathedral he gave him $20. He left us alone after that. Don't travel alone and stay in groups.

Beautiful!!. Went to 530 pm mass on Sunday Feb 14th. We just love going to mass here. The Church is gorgeous and has so much History. We love that there are so many places in the church to light candles for special intentions.

Gorgeous church, excellent Mass. Visited for Sunday Mass and were delighted to see Cardinal Dolan as the officiant. The church itself is amazingly beautiful and the Mass was very good, too. Whether you are Catholic or not, it's worth a visit..but try to go to Mass there if you are Catholic! It was a special moment in our NYC visit!
beautiful church. This church is beautiful, inside and out. The stained glass windows are works of art; very meaningful.

Beautiful building, inside and out.. We went inside the Cathedral for just a few moments on the way back from Rockefeller Plaza. We were running late for a dinner reservation so we could only look inside for a little bit. Quite impressive.

Very inspiring!!. We went to 10:15 mass on Sunday, when it was 2 degrees outside and didn't think anyone would be there. Hah!. The place was packed. The capacity is 2,200 and I don't think there was an empty seat. Quite an edifice. Beautiful!!

Centre of devotion for New York's Catholics. Saint Patrick is the patron saint of Ireland. This is not the only Cathedral named for him, but it is certainly one of the most magnificent. Saint Patrick's Cathedral was raised to the Glory of God and it has served the Catholic faithful or New York for over a century. Certainly, it is marvellous to look at, especially after its recent renovations. People of any faith, or none, are welcome to visit, as long as they respect the fact that St Patrick's is a church with a duty to minister to the faithful.

Beautiful Cathedral. we were actual here for a fallen police officer that was killed in Afghanistan. they had the NYC police an all the area fire there must of been a 1000 officers there, it made me cry and then the church itself is just beautiful

Stunning Architecture & Beautiful Church. No visit to New York would be complete without visiting this gorgeous Cathedral. The architecture alone is breathtaking and you can feel a sense of calm and serenity when you walk through the doors, even though there are many people wondering around, there is ample quiet space for prayer and reflection. The nativity display at Christmas time is amazing. There is construction work going on inside the chapel but it is interesting to see the artisans at work doing restoration. Great for architecture buffs and all who believe.
Must see in NYC. Don't miss a visit to this Cathedral! All people are welcome and it's an awe inspiring experience with amazing structure, statues, stained glass, just beautiful.
Beautiful. Can visit almost anytime for a self-guided tour. It is awe-inspiring. Across the street from Rockefeller Center, so that is also convenient to see.

Stunning. We visited the Cathedral on Ash Wednesday so it was very busy preparing for Mass and putting Ash crosses on peoples' foreheads.It is situated right next to Saks on 5th Avenue and is dwarfed by another building on the other side, but still maintains a dignified presence. It is worth visiting just to view the beautiful stained glass windows and gloriuos arched ceilings. We didn't stay long but will certainly visit for longer when it is not so busy.

Sunday Morning Mass.. What a tremendous Cathedral. Beautiful and worth the visit. You could feel the Holy Spirit present. Even though there was still construction going on, we thoroughly enjoyed beauty of it all.

Beautiful Building. We just stumbled across this beautiful Cathedral while walking around on our first day . It was spectacular , they were preparing for Ash Wednesday . It took your breath away when you entered it and very humbling . We lit a candle in the memory of my mum , father in law and my mum in law , sadly passed away few months ago . If you get the chance visit it , you will be glad that you did .

St. Patrick's. This cathedral is a place I have heard about my whole life growing up Catholic. It was magnificent !!! Statues, stain glass, stations of the cross so real. The organist plays on Mondays and Thursday; try to visit here on these days as pipe organ takes your breath away.

Beautiful Christmas Service. Hands down the most beautiful cathedral I've ever been in! Compounded by the talented Christmas choirs singing in that magnificent place! It was a beautiful moment in time I'm glad I was able to experience!

Sunday Service. I am a Protestant Christian and came here both for the service and visit. The Cathedral itself is very beautiful and I heard it has just been refurbished so it looks like it is in a perfect condition. The organist and the choir were mind healing too.

Beautiful cathedral . Have been here before but last time they had scaffolding up due to restoration work but now it has been completed its stunning.
Such an imposing building and the architecture is beautiful , such a treat to have a bit of quiet contemplation after the hubbub of Manhattan.
Beautiful building. Stop by this beautiful building. It was a nice break away from all the noise and bustle of the city. Worth a visit.
Beautiful!!. Beautiful building inside and out!!! This is definitely a can't-miss destination. The architecture is beautiful, both inside and out...and the inside is simply massive, yet breathtaking.
First Trip to New York. Gorgeous. Very moving. We did not take a tour, but wish we did. You could still spend hours here just looking and reading.
Amazingly big!. Amazingly big cathedral right in the middle of the shopping around 5th Ave and Madison, that is a whole block!

Awe Inspiring..... When you enter the cathedral, you are awed by the expanse and depth of the cathedral. All the altars, art and statues are alone worth the visit. It shows the richness of the Catholic Church.
St. Patricks. Beautiful cathedral to see even if you are not Catholic. Exquisite architecture and stained glass windows.

Beautiful church!. We have visited St Patrick's many times. Every time we go to NYC we visit. It is just a lovely, spiritual place. The church has been spruced up for the Popes visit and looked majestic.
Beautiful. I loved going here and looking around. My grand parents and parents all went here when they were adults. Very lovely!
MUST SEE. if you come to visit this great city you can not leave with out stopping here. this is a stop that no matter your back round is a must see

Just beautiful. Visited St Patrick's to view it in all its renovated glory, and it was breathtaking. Even a non believer couldn't fail to be impressed by its beauty and tranquil appearance. Very moved by the number of homeless folk just sitting in to take some time out from the biting weather and busy streets.
Simply beautiful and breathtaking!. Free to the public. A wonderful treat we happened upon just walking the streets of New York City. Take a few minutes to go inside...you won't be sorry!
So beautiful. I became Catholic just a short time ago and was so glad I had the chance to see this beautiful Church. I recommend to anyone who visits New York.
Midnight Mass - buy tickets in July. We had hoped to spend Midnight Mass here, but we discovered you need to buy them in July. Still we enjoyed the mass we did attend in a soaring cathedral.

Restoration extraordinaire. St. Patrick's defines the soul of mid-town New York City, and the financial and time commitment to its beautiful restoration is fabulous. The quality of the cathedral and the side chapels offer a universal religious experience. Try to attend Mass, and if not go mid afternoon as not to disturb services. This is a world class church.
Most amazing spiritual place. If you had a hectic day in Newyork traffic. you can go to church and relax with pin drop silence and great spirits

Just beautiful. This is the first time I have visited in a long time where there was no scaffolding! Was greeted by a very friendly man. Would have liked to have timed my visit with a mass, but that wasn't possible. Loved walking around- lovely.

The Old Girl Has Had A Makeover. I was baptized at St. Patrick's Cathedral, and my parents were married there. I sang there as a boy soprano, and have been a constant visitor for more years than I want to think about. It is always a fascinating place, with much to see, and even with the crowds of tourists passing through, there is a sense of peace that slows you down and helps if you want to pray. Several years ago Cardinal Dolan was told that the Cathedral needed work. Not just cleaning and refurbishing, but there were structural concerns that needed to be addressed. So the plans were drawn, the fund-raising started and the scaffolding went up.When the Pope's visit to the US was announced, the work was accelerated, the scaffolding came down, and this focal church on 5th Avenue emerged resplendent. The stained glass windows have not only been cleaned but focused so they look as brilliant outside as they do inside. The stonework is brighter than I have ever seen it, and the whole church has a vibrancy that is exciting. The many side altars are with spending time with. The crypt contains the remains of all the Cardinals of New York. The Lady Chapel is a quiet place to pray. The whole Church is definitely worth a visit, and should be on the list of anyone coming to be a tourist in NY. And if you live here, you definitely should drop in.
Completely overhauled and gorgeous!. THE Cathedral in the US... such history, and completely renovated... quite stunning.. and in the perfect area to sightsee in NYC. Stop in.. it's free!
Quiet contemplation in a hectic city. Always have ten minutes out to savour the tranquillity and solace afforded by this spiritual structure.
distinguished presence. We enjoyed both a visit and a service at St Patrick's..complete with multimedia presentation of the service. Wonderful music and a real atmosphere..well worth the visit

Beautiful Cathedral, recent restorations. Incredible beauty in this grand Cathedral on 5th Avenue. Stop in and enjoy the peace and beauty. Many chapels line the walls. Amazing the workmanship in this beauty.

Rivals the great gothic cathedrals of Europe. I've lived in the New York metropolitan area all my life, and have walked passed St. Patrick's cathedral numerous times, but rarely have entered the church. I told my wife that St. Patrick's had just completed a major renovation, and on a whim we decided to see the results. I was in awe of the soaring heights of the interior, the stain glass windows, stone detailing and the magnificent booming sound of the organ. It may well be the most imposing space in New York and it is not to be missed.
Holy Night! What a Place!. The work is done! What a beautiful house of worship (with and without scaffolding!). Very safe. Wonderful priest hearing confessions! The shrines are inspiring.

Nice and peaceful . Basically popped into just have a quick look when on 5th Avenue. Very tranquil. Only walked around the entrance as had to pay to go any further, perhaps a donation instead of fixed fee might entice more people although I understand how much it takes to run places like these. Worth a visit though

Sanctuary in the heart of one of the worlds busiest cities!. Total contrast to the majority of the rest of the hustle and bustle of NYC. Free admission and offers peace from the noise and energy of the city.

Recent Restoration. The Cathedral has undergone a total restoration and the interior scaffolding was taken down in time for Pope Francis' visit in September. It is very beautiful and looks totally different because now it's so bright inside. Both the interior and exterior were gray because of pollution on the outside and years of candles and incense on the inside. There are volunteers who answer questions for you can time your visit to attend mass if you want to. This is a good place for anyone to visit. There were tourists from all over the world including many non Catholics.
Stunning. As a NYC iconic landmark pictures will never do the cathedral justice. A must see. Every year at Christmas we do the windows and visit the cathedral and I'm always in awe.

Stunning beauty and architect!. I've been to NYC several times for day trips and make a point to stop to see St. Patricks Cathedral every time. And every time, I'm in complete aw of the magnitude and beauty of this magnificent structure. I've never seen anything like it. St. Patrick's Cathedral is an absolute must see for anyone who appreciates architecture, beauty, stained glass and history. As I type this, St. Patrick's Cathedral is 137 years old.
A beautiful Gothic Structure. The cathedral is just as nice as the old cathedrals in Europe. All are welcome to visit this Catholic church.
Breathtaking!. A beautiful sight to see. Very busy place.... people in and out constantly. Glad we stopped to see it!

St. Patrick's cathedral was one of my favorite places to visit.. This is a wonderful place to visit and is the most beautiful church. Words cannot explain the experience. It also had a gift shop. I would recommend to visit even if you not catholic.

Beautiful place. We took a double decker bus tour of the area and we were warned that when we got off the bus that we would probably be accosted by beggars. And we were. But they were not intrusive and did not cause harm. We enjoyed this majestic cathedral. It was very beautiful. A must see!

Beautiful Gothic Style - Now Restored. It stands in the street like nothing else, all white and ornate, the doors alone are a sight to see, majestic carved wood and then you enter, please put some change in the donation box, it costs a lot to keep these old churches and cathedrals in good order and they can then be enjoyed by future generations. Inside there is stained glass and architectural ceilings everywhere.
Restoration makes outside more magnificent. The recently completed cleaning of the exterior has made the church much better looking. The interior altars are worth a closer look.

Beautiful Cathedral. Just walking up inside and being met by a very kind and friendly greeter immediately gave me a zen experience. I was able to pray in peace even for just a moment before proceeding to take photos of the beauty that surrounds you in this cathedral. Excellent gift shop, too!
Time well spent. Take your time and be amazed at the beauty of the Cathedral, so many things to see and take in. we spent many hours in the Cathedral and were able to learn so much of the history.

Always impressive. This is both a house of worship (Roman Catholic) and a tourist attraction. It has been recently refurbished and is beautiful. If you are looking for a prayerful experience go to one of the side chapels.

Beautifully kept. The church is an oasis in mid-town New York. It's also a beautiful church and wonderfully well kept and maintained. Go there. Buy a candle to help the keep of the church, light it up, sit down and spend a few moments there in peace.

St Patrick's Cathedral - Beautiful!. Beautiful masterpiece. Worth taking the time to visit and experience the sense of spirituality that fills the cathedral. The architecture, interior artwork is magnificent.

Great Renovation!!!. Visited on Sunday Jan 31st to see the renovation of the church.Great job...all was clean, all lights lit and new flat screen TV's on the columns to see the service from your seat and participate more intimately.The stained glass windows are fantastic and shine the light through with new force.If you have a half hour to 1 hour to spare.....don't miss a visit to this iconic NY church.

Gorgeous!!. Regardless of your religion, this is a must stop on 5th avenue. The architecture is breathtaking. I do have to say that I lit a candle in the hopes of getting pregnant and did not that long after, so maybe prayers there do work!

You must visit!. Our group came to St. Patricks yesterday for a tour and the whole experience was wonderful! First off the Cathedral literally glows and shines since all the work has been done to it. It actually takes your breath away if the last time you were there was before the work....It has to be seen to be believed...this must be what it was like when it was first built.We had a tour with a great guide - John - who made the Cathedral come alive simply because it was so obvious he has been part of it all his life and truly loved and appreciated it! yes, he told us all the details but made them so interesting because of his personality......I have never been on a tour like that at St. Patricks and definitely recommend it.,..you appreciate it all the more.....
Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful Cathedral beside the Rockefeller Center , quite area upfront followed by the main hall and then a gift shop which i found a little strange to be inside the Catherdral

CHRISTMAS CAROLS, WONDERFUL CATHEDRAL. Went there December 17th for Christmas carols, without tickets got there an hour early, still got seated , right in the middle of down town NY, this is a stunning place , i am not really a religious person, but the architecture,is wonderful, great music and fabulous choirs, two hours of pure pleasure
Astounding!. Loved this cathedral! One of my favorites in NYC! Amazing architecture, rich history, and easy to find locale made St. Patrick's awe-inspiring.
Beautiful!. Beautiful architecture! They have a wonderful tribute to the 911 workers and those lost in the tragedy.
Beautiful Must See in NY!. The Cathedral is a magnificent beautiful masterpiece of architecture. Very awestruck when I first walked in. The stained Glass windows are magnificent.

Not the Duormo in Milan but a beautiful cathedral on 5th Ave.. I recommend a visit to St Patricks. We went to mass here with Fr. Conor and it was a nice way to spend an hour. Even if you are not religious, worth stopping by for a look at the beautifully renovated cathedral.

So Beautiful. The architecture of St. Patricks Cathedral is amazing. It was so beautiful especially when they have it decorated at Christmas time. It is worth it to stop in and walk around just to admire the beauty of it all right in the middle of Manhattan. Unexpectedly great
A must see. A place you cannot miss! Plan to stop in during mass to hear the great organ! Such a great place to take a break from all that is going on around you in New York City!

Anniversary NYC Trip. Wonderful old world architecture in the heart of Manhattan. This is quite a beautiful and awe inspiring historic cathedral. Most impressive are the stained glass windows and stone creche's. There is gorgeous wood throughout, including the sanctuary seating. At the time of our visit there was fairly obvious full security in place, probably due to the well attended late afternoon mass that was about to start. Security ushered us politely through a swift and efficient "bag check" as we walked in. We will look forward to a return visit to NYC when we can take the time for a guided tour.
Beautiful Cathedral - worth a visit. Spent 30 mins walking around but could have spent more. A place of peace and reflection even with plenty of visitors. A place of quiet in a bustling city.

Beautiful, small Catholic cathedral in the heart of Manhattan. While you are shopping on Fifth Avenue walk up the steps to this beautiful cathedral nestled in the middle of Manhattan surrounded by skyscrapers. Take a respite from the congested streets, the heat of the summer or the chill of the winter - go on in and admire the towering stainless windows and the craftsmanship all but lost and take a few moments to meditate and relax.
Cathedral. We didn't go inside here but it is a beautiful building outside. We passed this while walking down 5th ave.

What a Beautiful building.. Stopped by on Sunday after services for a visit.Was glad to see all the scaffolding gone from the exterior as it had been up on our last couple of visits to the city.What a beautiful building this is.It reminded me of my families visit to Notre Dame in Paris.You could just feel the peace and calm come over you as you walk through this masterpiece.
Beautiful Cathedral. Take time to go inside. Beautiful stained glass. Light a candle, say a prayer. Small gift shop where I bought 'Holy Cards' Love the old Cathedrals in the City.

police with machine guns outside. We visited here the week before Christmas. I guess there were all sorts of terrorist warnings that week and we encountered a number of police officers with machine guns at various tourist areas in the City. It was rather unfortunate to see them outside a church but I guess those are the times we live in. The Cathedral has been renovated. When we visited a couple of years ago, everything was covered in scaffolds. It was nice to be able to see the church done. They do search bags here upon entry so expect that. .

Stunning. What a stunning Cathedral. Its in the middle of a city. in between skyscrapers. The architecture is lovely and the inside doesnt dissapoint either. A lot to see and take photos of and luckily, not many tourists to New York are visiting it... they prefer to see tacky stuff which means less crowded in the Cathedral (A proper place to see)

Magnificent and Grand Church. Overtime we go to NYC we stop by St Pat's to take in the feeling and beauty of this great church and light a candle. The church has been totally cleaned inside and out which was badly needed and is now more beautiful then ever. Visited early January, and the church was still decorated for Christmas-magnificent!!
Gorgeous cathedral in excellent condition. It's always worth peeking into St. Patrick's. If there's a nicer church in the US I haven't seen it.

Such incredible achitecture and history. It is difficult not to become awestruck when you step inside the church. Such high arching ceilings and incredible detail everywhere you look. I am not Catholic, but that's not required to recognize that you are inside an amazing, spiritual space. Go, and visit. You won't be disappointed.

Well lit and inspiring. The cathedral's highlights are accentuated by the ample lighting. We were lucky to visit during the quiet times right after the snowstorm - few tourists meant a quieter space and the homeless people resting on the pews were able to have some peace.

Peaceful, stunningly beautiful Cathedral. we called into St Patricks the day after the snow storm last week to leave a photograph and light a candle.such a beautiful cathedral , the windows are stunning , the alter is stunning , breathtaking and peaceful . photography allowed in most areas , be mindful of worshippers , made to feel very welcome , so quiet , you forget you are on Madison ave
Beautiful. If you haven't seen St. Patrick's Cathedral in person, I definitely recommend checking it out. It's beautiful.
Beautiful building. Visited near Xmas time and had the Nativity crib, a very beautiful church and free entry well worth a visit

Breathtaking. This has always been a beautiful church. With the recent renovation it is even more amazing. If you want unobstructed photos suggest getting there off hours, otherwise you will have several people in your photos floor level.

St Patric's Sparkles. My first visit to this venerable cathedral since it's renovation. Wow! Everything is bright and beautiful. This is a must for any visitor to Mid-town Manhattan. Light a candle, say a prayer, it will make you feel good.
Special. It is something very special to find a church in the middle of so many skylines. New York is meant to be special!

A Great Cathedral and a sanctuary during 2016 Snow Storm. This is one of the best cathedrals i have seen in North America and a must see if you are in NYC. We got there during the snow storm and with the streets so quiet it was a welcoming place for all. It is truly spectacular from both inside and out.
Beautiful church!. Fantastic architecture and beautiful stained glass windows. If you want to attend mass on Sunday there are several to choose from.

Breathtaking!. My son and I visited the cathedral right after New Year's and there were a lot of tourists there. The crowd did not take away from the beauty of the place. We thoroughly enjoyed our walk through the cathedral and would love to visit it again.

Enchanting & Peaceful. Although busy the day I visited, people were quite respectful. There are plenty of opportunities to photograph statues, stained glass and intricate ceiling work. Sit for a bit and just take in the energy. Worth seeing! Note** You cannot wear a hat inside.
Very Good!. Very nice interior, excellent location and peaceful atmosphere. Even if you are not into religion, you will be thrilled.

Amazing architecture inside & out. This church is huge and the architecture is stunning both inside and outside. As others have noted, it is right in the middle of many modern retail/business/commercial buildings so it certainly stands out - right across the street from Saks Fifth Avenue and Rockefeller Centre. I was a bit surprised to see that it is open to the public as a tourist attraction and is also a working church (there was a small service going on in a separate area) although I'm glad it is open because the building, the stained glass windows and the ceilings are amazing to see. Although it was very crowded and busy throughout the church, I was impressed that for the most part, people do move around relatively quietly and behave respectfully. It doesn't matter if you're Catholic or not (we're not), this is a must see in NYC.

Amazing architecture. They have done a fabulous job of the cleaning renovations. It has always been one of my favorite places to go for viewing amazing architecture. It takes you back to European style. Always moving and beautiful.
Peace and quiet. if the hustle and bustle of the streets get to you - go and take a moment to reflect . It is beautiful building but also very calm and peaceful. To just sit and be quiet was great.
stands out. Nice cathedral in the heart of loads of modern buildings on 5th Avenue. worth a visit as the inside has beautiful windowns

Lovely. Lovely and impressive cathedral. Was a bit disappointing that there was building work going on but it's understandable to help keep the building in shape. Lots of mass's taking place throughout the day so it's pretty hard to miss going to one. Gift shop a bit disappointing but there you go.

Stunning architecture . This is one stunning Cathedral. Apparently, it's just been cleaned on the outside. Whilst we were there, there was a service going on in Latin. There are tv screens positioned throughout the cathedral. So even if you sit at the back you can still see clearly what us going on the front.The stain glass is beautiful and I think it would look very different during different times of the day. There is still a bit of work going on outside. It's well worth wondering in, sitting for a few mins and taking in the atmosphere, then lighting a candle for two dollars.Bag are security checked inside the cathedral It was extremely busy when we were there which was about 3.30pm
Nice Sprucing Up. The church was cleaned up for the Pope's visit and it is beautiful. The good part is the beauty , the bad part not being able to experience quiet.

One of the most beautiful church in the US . We went for a Sunday mass, was so full was difficult to hear the priest, but the architecture it self was worthy. The ceiling was breathtaking all the details. Catholic or not you should go visit this amazing place.
A must see for everyone. This landmark is for all to visit. Just the structure and artwork alone makes it all worthwhile especially if you are across the street at Rock Center.

Nice renewal. I did not have much time but I went into the just renewal St. Patrick's, it was a cold rainy morning and was full of people.The vitriols are so beautiful and colourful , the general ambience is so peaceful and relaxing.

St. Patrick's Cathedral. I went to church at St. Patrick's Cathedral a week before Christmas. We had been here before, and during the construction for Thanksgiving. The construction has been completed and is exceptionally beautiful place for prayer. Part of the sermon was on reflection to take time to notice the beauty where you are.
A pretty site. Just saw from the outside as I went round NYC but it is a lovely piece of architecture if nothing else!
Beautiful. Such a gorgeous church. They also offer those headphones w guided tour. Reminds me of churches in Europe.Really peaceful place in the middle of buzzing Manhattan!

Absolutely Stunning. St. Patricks is one of the most beautiful Cathedrals that I have ever seen. I was overwhelmed by the magnitude of the space. The architecture is absolutely stunning. After the hustle of the city the peace within the Cathedral is welcome.

Beautiful, Inspiring, and FREE. We got to St. Pat's early enough to walk around to appreciate the beautiful architecture, stain glass windows, and organ. Then we attended Mass and it was such a blessing. The people around us (especially one special lady) were locals and welcoming.

Relaxing . I went in here after mass and looked about and looked at the beautiful architecture there was so much to look atIt was lovely as I was leaving l shook hands with the father which humbled meI went up the steps to this cathedral I did not see any access for wheelchair or buggy access as there was so many people but I'm sure there must be
So grand and beautiful!. A Beautiful well kept cathedral. We go every year around Christmas. If I am in the area, I stop by to light candles ...
Beautiful.. Rich in history, amazing architecture, sacred place. St, Patrick's Cathedral is a must see, regardless of your beliefs.
Beautiful Church. Definitely worth going to if you are at all religious. The church is beautiful and enormous! If you are walking by, definitely stop in!
Jubilee year of Mercy Door. Enjoyed this beautiful Cathedral and mass! So much character and architecture. Blessed to have walked through the Door of Mercy this Jubilee year~!
So magnicifant. Walked in on a cold December evening.So many others were visiting. Beautiful architecture.Sit down and enjoy the grandeur.

A beautiful cathedral well worth visiting. We went to mass on Saturday night, the architecture is magnificent, and the singing is so beautiful. It is always led by a well known artist. Even if you are not catholic it is well worth visiting

Awsome structure. There was a small orchestra practicing for some event in the Cathedral which made the visit special - they were very good. But the structure is second to none in NY in my humble opinion. If you want to see a European cathedral, but don't want spend the time and money to travel there, this is a good surrogate. This is a MUST see. And while you are at it, drop into the Trinity Church; another awesome structure.

Wonderful renovation!. All the millions spent on the Cathedral were well worth it.Try to go during the week when the Church is not so busy, it is worth taking the time to look all over the church and look at the outside too.
Fab architecture a place for reflection. You need to see this regardless of religion etc, a stunning church that allows peaceful time to reflect.

Updated and Breathtaking. After the recent renovation, the cathedral is gorgeous. Certainly stop in, if you are walking by. They do search your bags now upon entry but it is free to go inside and look around. I usually light a candle or two for loved ones while I am in there. It just seems a little special to be able to do that.

Go if you're in the area. As cathedrals go, I found this pretty meh. It's more impressive from the outside than in. It's close to a multitude of other NYC attractions so it's worth a walk-by, but I wouldn't recommend more than that.
Newly restored and utterly magnificient!. If you are in New York, even for just a few hours, make sure you make a quick (or, long) stop here! The restoration is very impressive!

beautiful Church. Commonly seen on movies, great place to commune with God too. Inside the place you will find solitude and give you a chance to listen and be with yourself after the hectic buzz that is NY.
Beautiful . We try and go every time we are in the city-and we are not even Catholic. A must see at some point. Very impressive and beautiful.
Historic. Beautiful old cathedral in the the heart of NYC, tucked between large skyscrapers. Beautiful stained glass windows, tons of history.

peaceful and beautiful. Have to visit St. Patrick's when ever I visit NYC. The artwork is so gorgeous, the peacefulness is unsurpassed in the City and you can feel the antiquity in every step.. The people working their should also be commended.

Gorgeous Architecture-Instilled a sense of Reverence. An unscheduled stop as we were walking along in Midtown. This structure is truly impressive and restoration is priority. It draws a constant small, subdued crowd. Definitely recommend.

Spectacular and beautiful. St Patrick's is a landmark worth visiting. Recently cleaned and restored it is on par with the great religious buildings of Western Europe. We went for Sunday mass- music fills the space with spirituality and awe
Get some minutes of reflection and worship. It is always worth going there , leave the busy and hectic Manhattan to have some minutes of worship, reflection and also Meditation....

Wonderful to see the renovation is almost complete. The cathedral is easier to enjoy now that most of the scaffolding has been removed. Security has been increased but it is handled with grace. The sound system let down the Sunday afternoon service.

Stunning.... I've been going to NYC for years…and it seemed as though this cathedral has been under construction for years too…but, it was all worthwhile. Even though a lot of tourist milling about…still reverent, quiet….just amazing to sit in a pew and look up at the architecture. Nice quiet place to sit and rest and reflect. They will check your bags before entry…no fee..just a donation if you wish…donation to light a candle in memory of someone.
Great Atmosphere. Fantastic architecture and beautiful stained glass windows. Unfortunately due to restorations the place was full of scaffolding but great to see anyway.

Absolutely beautiful. A favourite place to share with new visitors to NYC, the Cathedral is gorgeous, welcoming, and peaceful...you can even take pictures while you visit except in very clearly marked areas. You will be asked to remove your hat. Light a candle, say a prayer, or just people watch and take it in.
Wonderful, go in and see.. This is a beautiful Cathedral, dedicated to St. Patrick. It has its own amazing atmosphere which has to be experienced in person.

Serenity in the center of New York. St. Patrick's Cathedral is one of the most beautifully ornate buildings I've seen outside of Europe. Take a step inside and let your soul become quieted in this grand, space where hundreds have meditated and worshipped before you. A few minutes seated for meditation or prayer can be a calming respite in your busy NYC itinerary. If you are not into any of that, the building's architecture alone provides reason enough to make it a stop near the top of your must-see list.

Stunning! . St. Patrick's Cathedral is absolutely awe-inspiring. The architecture and detail is superb. It should definitely be on your list of places to see in New York. Make sure to leave a donation as well as be respectful of the religious importance of the site.
Beautiful detai,. Absolutely beautiful inside & out. Great stained glass windows, only downfall was having to share the experience with many other visitors.
:). Beautiful Church, must visit if you are in the vicinity. This place is one of the most beautiful churches in the US. Very old but well maintain is worth going for a visit.
We arrived during church service. They checked my husband backpack before letting us in. Services were going on, which we stayed for. We also lit candles for our loved ones at home. Beautiful church.
Breathtaking!. Had a chance to visit St. Patrick's Cathedral in NYC Dec. 2015. After all the renovations done it is superb, a wonderful place to visit, so Beautiful and Spiritual!

The renovation is done!. ...And the Church is spectacular. What they have accomplished is unbelievable, the Church looks new. It has always been a magnet for tourists and it should be but go back and see it now. It is still a church and people pray there so attend a Mass and you will find it better as people will not be milling around at the altar. Anyway that you can go...go!
Very Moving. Beautiful church with outstanding devotional areas to so many saints. The stained glass windows are amazing and the priests are very welcoming

More beautiful than ever! Don't miss a chance to visit.. I have been to St. Patrick's on 5th Avenue many times, but it has never been as beautiful as it is right now. Don't miss the chance to see it while all the renovations are fresh. We saw it on Jan. 3rd. The creche was beautiful as were the stained glass windows and the representation of the town of Bethlehem. I had never seen that before and it was impressive.

Archways to Heaven.. Its big, its beautiful and its smack in the middle of fifth avenue - it is bound to be busy. But still go see what the fuss is about - sit a while and reflex for a moment about what ever is on your mind. You can light a candle - you dont have to be catholic, it can be as a prayer, as an act of remembrance or as wish for the future. Donations of no less than $2 are required for the candles.

What A Treat for Christmas. We came to visit in the evening and mass was taking place. Security was checking bags for everyone. A stroll around this historic church is a must do while in NYC. The statues ,windows, and all around architecture will leave you inspired.
beautiful. We were passing by and desided to step inside. it is lovely and worth spending a few minutes in. There was a mas on so we had to be quiet, but the music is amazing.
Truly breathtaking. It's a wonderful masterpiece and an oasis of quiet in the the hustle and bustle of 5th Avenue. Worth a visit!

St Patrick's Church in December 2015.. I was determined to attend the 10.30 mass at this beautiful Gothis church. The Cardinal himself was celebrating the mas, and he gave the sermon. I was captivated and inspired by what he expressed, also it opened my eyes to what he mentioned. Apart from his excellent sermon, he did not distance himself from the congregation, and showered his love on the children. This was a few days before Christmas.The church itself is beautiful, especially after having had a good clean. Magnificent indeed.The negative side of my visit, was that the security was somewhat overdone. It spoilt things a little, after all it is a church, not a museum. The Cardinal expressed his sense of humour, unlike the stiff upper lip of Cardinals past and present in England.The choir is good, and how I wished I was there for the midnight mass.A highly recommended visit to this awesome church.

Beautiful Architecture. Lovely building to be enjoyed. Very quiet and reverent. Wander at leisure but try and avoid service times unless you wish to participate and poor form to attempt sightseeing here on a Sunday Morning.

Attend Mass. I have walked past St. Patrick's in the past but my traveling companion wanted to attend mass. I am so glad we did. I was amazed at the hugeness of the Cathedral. Mass was beautiful with a great sermon for the Christmas season.

Amazing!. This majesitc architecutral wonder will take you breath away! I love going there when I'm in NYC. I went for Christmas and it just lovely. There were lots of people there and even though there was a service going on, people were still allowed to walk around. I would think this would be distracting for a worship service but eveyone was respectful and whispered and walked softly. Christmas is my favorite time to go but it is beautiful any time.

Majestic Splendor!. The Gothic architecture is stunning! Inside is very beautiful and still you know you are in a holy place.There were many people there but I felt very serene as I took time to light a candle and pray and I am not Catholic, just a Christian. The cathedral was still decorated for Christmas and it was breathtaking!
Too many tourists. Beautiful, but it is overcrowded. It is not a place for meditation anymore. And there are very unpolite people that don´t respect the temple.

Exceptional architecture . Just based on history you should make this a stop while in New York. The architecture is amazing, inside and out, from the Stained glass, to the carvings, high ceilings. I know nothing about architecture, but this church blew me away. It literally takes your breath away. Now I will say we were very quite and stayed toward the front as they were having a service they day we visited. Personally I felt like we were interrupting so we were in and out in like 5 minutes out of respect. Trust me it is worth it, TV does not do it justice.

Amazing place . We came here last Sunday on its last Christmas mass and it was very nice experience for our entire family! We put out some candles and said our prayers. Architecture of this cathedral is amazing and very beautiful! Definitely must visit place for anyone in this area.
Gorgeous. This well-known cathedral is gorgeous both inside and out. Take time to study the detail in both the architecture and stained glass in this this church.
Stunning!. I love St. Patrick's, and I love it even more now that the renovations are completed. It is crowded, but it's well worth the time to take a walk through. The stained glass is amazing!
Renovations are beautiful. Looks like they just built the church. Great job with the renovations. Beautifully decorated for Christmas. Always feel at home here.

As close to Notre Dame as NYC will ever get. A great experience, uplifting and provides a sense of holiness once inside. In the very far back is an altar of Mary, where ardent prayers can be said; a small shop near the Madison Street side offers items including holy water bottles, rosaries.

Took the tour using their ear phones n machine. we came for the tour but the volunteer was out that day. We decided to still use their headsets n machine n glad we did. Got a lot of information then trying to read the signs. We just missed the Christmas decorations.

Renovation is breathtaking!. Having gone to St. Pats dozens of times since I was a child, I was blown away by the recent renovations - the scope and brightness. The work took years and was finished just in time for Pope Francis's visit in 2015.Every single room, alter and chapel has been restored. Areas that haven't been open for decades have been repaired and reopened to the public. Sculptures into the walls that never showed before have been revealed. The stained windows (thousands) now shine clearly since dirt and chemicals have been cleaned off.Do make the time to visit the Cathedral. It's right in the center of the City on 5th avenue and couldn't be more convenient. It's the best free exhibit ever!
A must visit in NY. Great atmosphere in a fantastic building.A lot of people there but still not to crowded, was there 21. December right after the ceremony so it was not to many people there.

Renovation Finally Completed. One of the most famous churches in the world. St. Patrick's just completed a very long renovation and the church looks brand new in and out. This church is beautiful and the architecture is obsolete. A must see while in NYC.

Step back in time. I visit St. Patrick's every time I'm in the city because it never ceases to amaze me when I walk in the door. It is stunning and awe-inspiring at the same time. It's like stepping back in history and so unlike the hustle and bustle of the rest of the city.
A Must. This is a special church. It is beautiful and has a magnificent pipe organ in the back. You'll recognize it from several movies and some funerals that have been aired from there.

Beautiful and historic. I'm not Catholic but, attended saturday night services. The building is simply spectacular and of course, it is a house of worship, so, it had a reverence and peacefulness to me that transended the religion. It also is the place of many a famous person's funeral service so, worth seeing for past and future perspectives.
An uplifting experience. I slipped in here to escape the hustle and bustle of New York City. What a unique experience. Just a beautiful building and atmosphere. I'm speechless....

Beautiful. We just popped in as we were passing and were blown away by this piece of lovely architecture in what is a fairly sterile street. It's full of all sorts of interesting things, so take a bit of time to visit if you can.
An awe inspiring visit. St Patrick's Cathedral is one of my most favorite places to visit in New York. It is religious, humble, and worthy of a spiritual moment.I always come here when I am in NYC.
Stunning!. The most beautiful church that I have ever seen. A Service was going on and the music echoed through out the church.

Quiet break from the city. Giving yourself a few minutes of rest between hopping around tourist attractions is always a good idea. This was one of the most relaxing and amazingly beautiful breaks we took over our weekend visit.
Wow wow wow wow. I am blown away by this cathedral. The experience was breath taking. The history and the beauty has to be experienced yourself. There is no way to describe that would do it justice.

Wonderful architecture inside and out. Huge cathedral with wonderful stained glass windows and imposing columns. The altar area is stunning. Always busy it is open for prayer as well as welcoming to tourists.

Nice to just visit when you can tour the whole building.. I have been to St. Patrick's Cathedral a number of times for Mass, but I have not toured the Church for many years and just did so the week after New Years. The Christmas decorations and elaborate Nativity scenes were beautiful and all of the various altars are nice to see as well as the grandeur of the main hall.

Glorious restorations. I visit St. Pats often, and have recently been impatient with the scaffolding. Well, on the last visit, post Pope Prancis' visit, the work Hal's been completed. The sanctuary, nave and apse are magnificent. We happened to be their on the feast day of our Lady of Guadalaupe. The presentation was inspiring. N addition a miniature Itallian nativity new to me was a wonderful addition

Breathtaking but.... ...sad that this has become such a tourist attraction that ill behaved visitors feel it appropriate to snap selfies and carry on conversations. Folks, it's a church: have some respect.

A Must-See New York Landmark. It may seem tacky to rate a church, however, St Patricks Cathedral is more than a church, it is part of the very fabric of New York City. During the 1980s through 2000 I visited here on a regular basis although I am not Catholic, just to appreciate the serenity in a bustling town. The church has undergone an extensive multi-million dollar renovation and is stunning. There is a documentary on PBS about the restoration that is very informative as well. On my most recent visit during the early winter of 2015, I strolled the perimeter past the shrines and sat amongst hundreds of worshippers, and it was a truly unifying experience.

What a Holy Place. We were there on New Year's day just in time for Mass. My friend was raised Catholic and it was so great to see how he was during the service I think he was moved. This is one of the most beautiful places to visit in New York. You could spend hours just walking around. The stain glass is amazing and changes with the light. You could spend hours just looking at the windows

Must See!. Every time I visit NY, I make a point to stop in the Cathedral. I love to take a few moments to simply admire the architecture, say a prayer, and sit in silence (well it might not be completely silent but it is calming from the busy street outside. I always feel like I'm in Europe when I stop in the Cathedral. Love it!

St Patricks Cathedral. Whenever we go to New York We always visit St Patricks Cathedral! The beauty and architecture of this building is amazing. Mass is going on at various times of the day but it is still open to visitors. This is a very special and beautiful building, there are items to buy from little stalls in the cathedral and drinks to buy. You can light a candle (for a small charge) in remembrance of a loved one. No visit to NY would be complete without seeing St. Patrick's Cathedral.
Awesome!!!. Just beautiful! This church is gorgeous inside and out. Our whole group enjoyed visiting. It is a must see while in New York!

Breathtaking cathedral. A must visit. Crowded but lovely, light a candle lovely at Christmas time reminded me of the Home Alone-lost in New York movie when Kevin visits the church, that was the reason for the visit, didn't disappoint.

Recently Renovated!. If you have been before, you need to go again! After millions in renovations updates over the last few years, this church has been restored to its former glory and is bright and the details much easier to view than before. They will let you come in, take pictures, light a candle when there are not services going on. Just look up the times online and go in between!

Spectacular Renovation. Aah. Finally the scaffolding is down and the beauty abounds. My nephew was baptized there (during the scaffolding) and it was so amazing to be so close to this beautiful architecture. It is so wonderful now to walk towards the Cathedral and be in awe from the second you see this palatial Cathedral before your eyes. I never cease to be amazed when I am there. So blessed to be able to step in this Beautiful place.

Magnificent cathedral, plain outside but lovely inside. This is a classic place to visit, the Catholic Cathedral looks smaller from outside than from within, and if you want to go to mass while in NYC this is the place you are looking for

Tourist must. After a walk to Central Park, i accidentally stumbled on the name of the church on the tourist map so i decided to find it and wow - we spent more than an hour there and would have probably spent more time if i did not have anything else to do. It is a Catholic Cathedral. The church was opened in 1879 and revamped in Sep 2015 before the Pope's visit. It is all Neo-Gothic style and so intrinsic with its detail - you will not know what to concentrate on at first until you take in all of the beauty and then move on to all the little alcoves. Really full of splendor that i had to "google" it after my visit for more detail. Wish i could have afforded the $40 USD coffee table book :) Anyway - i got a coin from a vending machine commemorating the Popes visit with a lovely inscription "Saint Patrick - Pray for us". Will remain in my purse always. And oh - i am Hindu - and it was clear that many people visiting were of different faiths but everyone was in awe and oh so solemn. What a lovely Godly experience. There is an exhibition which unfortunately ends today - It is a nativity scene with a difference - called the Basilicata Treasures - The Secret Garden of Southern Italy - The traditional Italian "Presepe" - a gift from the Italians to New Yorkers - look it up. A must visit for all tourists and people living in the area.

Beauty among the High Rises. Anywhere else St. Patrick's Cathedral would seem massive. Among all the more modern high rises it sadly seems dwarfed and out of place. Yet once you get close enough to really look at the architecture, and marvel at the fine details you forget everything else, and realize it stands alone. Truly an architectural gem, it is well worth the few minutes to view, or more if the circumstances and crowds allow. I believe it recently had a facelift, as the facade is very clean and bright looking. The Christmas decorations were still up and it was so lovely both inside and out. If you are walking up 5th Avenue to Central Park you can't miss it - across from Rockefeller Center.

Amazing building right by Rockefeller Center. This is a must see if you have a few minutes and you're in the area. Open to public. I'm not sure if they do tours, it would be neat to learn more about the building.

Beautiful. Must see thus building its beautiful and currently undergoing restoration. Roof art is unbelievable and the navity displays were wonderfulThe only issue for ne is that due its busyness people forget it's a functioning cathedral where people prayer and go for quiet time which must be protected
crowded during churchtime. we went there on new years day and it was quite crowded, the ceremony lasted for 40 minutes and it was nice to had that done.

Nice way to spend Sunday Morning. Went to Mass in St Patrick's Cathedral last Sunday the 3rd of January 2016. The Cathedral looks spectacular with all the Christmas decorations in place. Both Cribs in place also. One was the standard crib and a second was a present from Italy which was on display.The Cathedral is magnificent and was in its full spledour. It is well worth a visit even if you are not attending Mass. The Mass was officiated by Cardinal Timothy Dolan and the choir was also there for the Mass. The mass was packed with people of all faiths and nationalities. Well worth the visit and its just off 5th Avenue
Beautiful. Great importance placed on size very evident in the building of this church.Does not take long to see and I have not been left with an impression of anything of particular grace or beauty.

My favorite NYC church. If you are in New York, and happen to be on 5th Avenue (which probably covers 99.9% of tourists coming to the City), make it your business to stop by at this magnificent Cathedral. Located in the center of hustle and bustle of NYC, it is a refuge of beautiful sculpture, magnificent architecture and wonderful organ music, if you happen to come during mass. This is the main cathedral of NYC. From here, Archbishop Timothy Dolan left New York to become one of the Cardinals in Rome. You don't have to be a devout Catholic to enjoy this beautiful church and sit in quiet admiration to catch a breath from all the joys of visiting this busy city. Admission is free and open to public. Donations are not required, but welcome.

The Christmas Crib. We visited St Patrick's to see the refurbishment & it didn't disappoint. Most of the scaffolding has been removed & only a little at street level remains at the rear & part of the side. It now looks even more magnificent than before & the floral arrangements in & around the altar are truly magnificent. I would recommend it to people of any belief & not just Roman Catholics.

Christmas in New York City 2015. The Cathedral was decorated for Christmas with the Nativity display and Christmas tree. You are welcomed in by security staff.Take the time to walk around inside as there is so much of interest to see and read. There is a small shop inside.
Grand. This is one huge and symbolic building. It is one of the tallest cathedral's in the world and has marvelous architecture inside.

Breathtaking!. I've seen many cathedrals in my life, but this one was so intriguing to me, especially from the outside. It seemed to grow as I stood and looked up. Really beautiful gothic architecture and the inside is elaborately designed.

Beautiful church, and terrific Christmas services. We have gone there several years now for Christmas Mass. It's very crowded, but they have a Mass just about every hour and a half. Worth the wait for that, but definitely worth a visit when in NYC.

Stunning church. This is probably the most stunning church I have ever been in. The detail of everything in st Patrick's is amazing! There is so much to look at and take in. I wish I could attend mass here every week. What a true blessing this church is.

Nice church with great architecture. Stopped in here to go to Mass during our Sunday visit to NYC. The church itself is amazing. The details in the architecture alone are breathtaking. They also had a nice nativity set on display while we were there. The church is HUGE. They have a chapel within the church, the Lady Chapel. That was interesting to see! Plenty of seating in this church and it was great to see that Mass started on time. Priest was hard to hear even with the auditory system they had in place. I found it more difficult to listen to Mass here than smaller churches. Nothing flashy, just a simple mass with one priest and one singer/reader. Communion surprisingly went really fast even with ALL of the visiting parishioners. Overall, a nice church with great architecture, but to be honest Mass is more enjoyable in my small hometown church. It is worth a peek if you are going to be in the area.

Very beautiful. After experiencing old churches in Europe, you can be surprised that something so 'old" can be find in Manhattan. The virtual windows are really beautiful and the architecture is impressive.
Fabulous!. Regretfully extremely crowded because it was Christmas but oh such a sight to see! Absolutely breathtaking!!!!!

Not Catholic but still enjoyed it. As we live in Asia I am almost forced to see Buddhist Temples if I want to see any famous sites in cities and my wife enjoys visiting them as she is Buddhist. I love just to see the cities top sites and as we were walking around Rockefeller Center we stumbled upon a beautiful and stunning cathedral and I made my wife go inside. We took many pics from the outside at different times of the day. We did go inside but I felt a little awkward snapping photos because mass was being held it seemed like at night and at all times of the day. It makes sense since it was Christmas season. A beautiful place to behold even while mass is in session. Check it out when visiting Rockefeller Center.
Just beautiful :). A must see in this city. Breathtakingly beautiful both inside and out. Lovely little gift shop also.

Attended Holy Mass. A must visit in NYC although it's a bitova zoo! Went to Mass on a couple of times. The liturgy is minimal, and not very reverential. A nice enough priest seem to wander-in from beside the altar. He preached the same homily each day and wasn't very deep. I guess there were staff doing 'jobs' like singing, reading, and extraordinary ministry of HC. If they were more reverential, it might make it more like a Cathedral and less of a tourist attraction. The cathedral itself is beautiful esp after the recent restoration.Go!
Beautiful Cathedral!. Attended mass the Sunday after Christmas on a trip to NYC. Beautiful Cathedral. Service was led by the Archbishop.Would love to go back.

Pure beauty. I am by no means religious, but have to say this was one of the best locations visited. The workmanship is unbelievable, full of detail and Colour. Recently renovated to its former glory defiantly worth a look.

Incredible Windows. Stopped here to see the church while in NY. Worth the time just to see the awesome stained glass windows! Beautiful and an incredible work of craftsmanship from so long ago! They love put into this incredible building built to worship our Lord is humbling.

A great place to reflect and take in the majesty. Visited during New Years 2016. Nice spot to sit and reflect away from the crowds outside. Majestic cathedral. Pristine inside and out. Don't have to be Catholic to be amazed. Mass was in session, however hundreds of tourists were walking around taking it all in.

Beautiful cathedral-see even if not religious!. This is certainly a must see for anyone in New York City. Easy walking distance from Rockefeller Center. Would not take young children if there is a service in progress during visit.

Must see while in New York. Even if you aren't religious, you must step inside the cathedral. Just the stained glass alone is mesmerizing. The architecture with all the columns, and the statues are gorgeous

Amazing building!. One of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen! Lucky enough to stumble in during a mass, vastly over-crowded, but what would you expect at 11am on a Sunday in NY over the Christmas period! Would love to visit again at a quieter time.

Huge. Nice cathedral , especially over the X-Mas time it was decorated nice.
The entrance has a security control .

A Spiritual Moment in a Busy Day. Words cannot do justice to the beauty of this church. We had a beautiful view of it from our hotel room across the street (Lottes New York Palace). We were inspired each time we saw it. On our last day in NYC we got time to go inside and the people assisting were so wonderful telling us all about the details. Go in for a quiet moment in the big busy city.
A Haven in a busy City. Newly refurbished ,it retains that feeling of an Oasis ,a place of calm ,peace in beautiful surroundings

Beautiful cathedral. Lovely cathedral, opposite the Rockefeller centre. I would recommend going in even if its not something your interested in or if your not religious etc the building is lovely and stands out surrounded by sky scrapers
Everyone has to visit. This place is magical to me. The architechture of the building alone is amazing, then add the meaning of the Cathedral. Just something to take in!
beautiful. Worth visiting whether or not you are Catholic or religious. The architecture and windows are beautiful.
Beautiful!. St. Patick's Cathedral is beautiful. The church was open so one could just walk in and look around or sit on one of the benches.
Breathtaking. Yet another reason NYC gives travelers to look up. The ceiling carvings and stained glass are to be missed.

Escape NYC, say a prayer. Great place to get away from the NYC crowds and say a prayer to thank the lord for our blessings. The last several years I've come here, St Paddy's has always been under construction. This is the first time in many years I'm seeing it without the scaffolding. Really nice job refurbishing the cathedral!

Amazing place . Visiting St. Patrick's Cathedral was a very comforting activitie in the middle of the big crowd and noise that normally you get in NY during New Years festivities.
Excellent place for reflection and peaceful
Definitely a must go!!

My first visit was remarkable. This was not on my to do list the previous visits to NY. My husband wanted to visit it . I cannot believe I never went earlier. The architecture is amazing. There were many services when we were there, but open to the public for sightseeing in between times. It will be a recommended Must See from now on.
Great spiritual place. Have to go and see the cathedral if you are in New York. Only church where you get searched before you go in.

Beautiful outside/inside. Can stop by here and spend some time at the back of the sanctuary. This church is beautiful on the outside and the inside. Very close to Rockefeller Center. Well worth stopping by on the way to or from.

Heavenly Beautiful!. The Cathedral looks all glory! no pun intended. The restoration and cleanlines is really a masterpiece. Absolutely gorgeous! especially during the holidays with all the poinsettas. So welcoming even with all the tourist.
Beautiful. Simply amazing, especially at Christmas. It's a must see when in Manhattan. Close to Rockefeller Center.
Stunning. A simply stunning building- have walked past many times but this time decided to go in, so glad I did!
Beautiful at Christmas time. Very beautiful church with the wreaths on the columns inside. The renovations are beautiful. This is a must see anytime.
AMAZING!. Just walk in and look around! Take a seat and observe all there is to see! One of the most amazing places I have ever been in!
nice good place. nice cathedral. peace architecture and build up ... must visit if you pass by Rockefeller centre... its open to public and can click pictures

For a escape from the noise and crowds a place to reflect. St Patrick's was stunning at this time of year (xmas ) the two cribs were the best i have seen anywhere and worth a visit for them alone just been renovated and all alters are amazing

Awesome place. Awesome specially after the restoration. I was there for a Christmas mass. The neighborhood has also attractions like Rockefeller Center. Wort the visit. It's free.
Don't miss !

DON'T MISS THIS!. GORGEOUS!! Breathtaking! We were there just a couple days before Christmas, so it was decorated and simply beautiful. My husband and I aren't Catholic, but we spent time just sitting and taking in the calming spirit the building created. It was a busy place...lots of people walking around and taking pictures. Wish we could have gone to Christmas Eve service, but that is the only service all year that requires tickets.
Packed with tourist still worth a visit. WE visited the day before the huge funeral and it was packed, it is beautiful inside and well worth a visit
An amazing renovation. When in New York City be sure to take the time to walk through this Cathedral which has just been beautifully renovated. The entire building is a work of art.
Beautiful.. Always nice to sit and admire the beauty. (also to say a prayer) Sometimes gets very loud from people forgetting it is a church. Many shrines and statues.

Spiritual beauty. One of the most beautiful buildings in the world. Whenever I enter St. Patrick's cathedral I feel calm, relaxed and peaceful. If you love architecture you'll love St. Patrick's and if you are a spirutual person, you'll love it even more.

A very beautiful church. The style of the cathedral is Georgian revival architecture. The church is beautiful. We had to go through a security check to get in. We got there around 8 pm and there were still a lot of tourist there. The carvings and statues were so ornate you couldn't help but take a picture of them. Of course, it's free to get in.
Heavenely. New renovated...got there just in time for mid day Mass...great experience..even though it was a rainy day..the cathedral was jammed..it was a very spiritual visit...

A memorable Christmas mass at this famous Cathedral. What a blessing to attend Christmas Mass At St. Pat's with my family! This is how our day began...the Cathedral was all decked out in Christmas glory. People from many different nations shared God's message to us on this beautiful day. I come here whenever I am in New York. My only regret is that I did not get to see Cardinal Dolan, who is from my home town.
Spiritual Facelift. After its recent facelift the cathedral look beautiful. Maybe, it washed off some of the history a little.....patina removed a bit.

Simply Amazing!. Being Catholic, this was a must for us! We were able to attend mass and I will say...God's spirit runs deep there. The homily was amazing and the Priest was witty and powerful. This is a must see..especially if you are Catholic!!

Restoration is a triumph!. I stopped by at Christmas time while taking in the nearby Rockefeller Center and the windows at Saks. I had not seen St. Pat's since they finished the restoration and it is not absolutely beautiful. It is well worth a special visit now that it has been restored to its past glory. Make sure to walk all the way around to see all of it.

Majestic and Gorgeous. We have visited this Cathedral several times in the last few years, and finally got to see it without the scaffolding.It was magnificent and ostentatious, yet a peaceful haven amidst all the hustle and bustle of the surroundings. There is so much to look at all around. The details in the ceilings, the carvings on the doors, the Marble Columns and the Statues are all superb.The stunning building itself has a lot of history, so we will certainly take the guided tour on our next visit to this impressive landmark.

A moment to reflect. Although this is open as a tourist attraction, people use the visit to sit and pray or just reflect on life. Shut out the bustle of the crowds and just take a seat in the pews and look around at the magnificent architecture.
Beautiful Architecture. They certainly don't build things like this anymore. A trip to NYC requires at the very minimum, a walk by this old church.

Beautiful restoration, even if your not religious go for the architecture.. I was in NY and was able to view the church after the Pope visit. Beautiful and skillful restoration project. All New Yorkers should be proud.
One of the top Churches in the world. It took a few years to renovate this beautiful church and it shows. During our visit the choir was performing and it was moving.

Beautifully Restored!. I remember the last time I was in the cathedral 20 some years ago and while beautiful then, there were signs of age and grime. Today, the cathedral looks just amazing and I am so happy I walked in. Mass was finishing when I walked in so got to hear the pipe organ and it was just breathtaking!

Breathtaking. We visited NYC last winter and went to St. Patrick's Cathedral. The church was being renevated, unbeknownst to us that the Pope would be visiting soon thereafter. So it took away from the beauty inside. We visited NYC again this year, and went back to the church, and what a difference a year makes. The inside was spectacular and it really took your breathe away. You have to go at least once in your lifetime and light a candle for whoever you love.

Beautiful cathedral.. Love love love this cathedral. Went in to light a candle for departed loved ones. Open all day to public. Tradition for me to go in at least for a few to admire the beauty of the architecture.

Beautiful Cathedral. The Cathedral is beautiful and clean, a must see during a visit. We went when there was a Mass so should be considerate to be respectful, a lot of people going in and out taking pictures, a little distracting.
Beautiful architectural building!. The cathedral is beautiful. It is near Rockefeller center and you can walk to the cathedral while visiting the tree. The cathedral is beautiful and huge!

A Must See Sight in NYC!. This incredible cathedral is well worth your time if you are visiting NYC. Even if you are not a religious person, you'll be amazed by the beauty, magnitude, and history of this place. Light a candle and enjoy a few quiet moments of reflection. This cathedral looks and feels like many of the great cathedrals in Europe.

Grand Cathedral. St. Patrick's Cathedral is an awesome place to visit. The most recent restoration has returned St. Patrick's to what it must have looked like on the day it opened. I have been to St. Patrick's multiple times for services and I am always awed by its beauty.

Con traversing !. After a few hours shopping or walking and spending time in crowd fifth Avenue you could go inside and make yourself calm ,in a spritual state after that totally materialistic world in outside ,even if you are not Christian . It,s a historic place that pops have visited there. It's beautiful glass windows and arcs are really awesome .

Nice Place to Visit, but Way too Noisy.. This is like show case. It is not the Cathedral in the way to Worship. Personally I cannot worship there. There is Organ Concerts before mass. I tried very hard to be good listener, and still, people walk around, talking, taking pictures, care nothing about. Personally, I am not going back. I think it is good to visit once, to take pictures and to have own memories. It is good for one time. To worship, or to listen organ or choir, it is better to go to another places.

Spectacular at Christmas in the evening. Always an impressive building, the lights at the Christmas holidays are spectacular to see in person. Stand across the street at the Atlas sculpture for a great picture. Unfortunately, it wasn't open in the evening to go inside; but crowds gathered, nonetheless, for the outside view.

Amazing. I took my 5 year old Granddaughter into the church on our visit to see the Rockettes. She goes to church with me here in upstate NY and I wanted her to see this church. She was respectful and full of questions about the size of it, the statutes and all the glitter, paintings, little 'nooks". We paid to light a candle, something she does up here each week. We knelt and prayed, and we got to listen to a choir singing the front of the church. It made our day, and we went on to see the Christmas Show.
Beautiful landmark in NYC!. Gorgeous church and a very moving experience! This is an active church with ongoing services - a beautiful place to visit regardless of your religious affiliation.

Beautiful Sunday Mass - Spectacular Church. A friend and I were in NYC the week before Christmas to enjoy the Christmas lights. We wandered by St. Patrick's the first night we were there (so beautiful lit up at night) and were surprised to find it open in the evening and actually very crowded. So wonderfully decorated for Christmas! Gorgeous both inside and out - the architecture and stained glass is awe inspiring. I have seen some amazing churches in Paris, Italy and London and St. Patrick's rivals them all! We returned for Sunday Mass which was also a wonderful experience. Was so nice to see so many people in Sunday Mass right in the center of NYC! The experience was truly special. Would definitely go again when back in the city. (My only one disappointment is that people not attending Mass are allowed to wander in and walk around during the Mass celebration. I found this a bit distracting with people taking photos during Mass.) Other than that, an exceptional experience! Was able to light a candle and thank the Lord for the beauty of NYC at Christmas and the resilience of the American people to bounce back after the terror shed upon us in the same city.
Magnificent cathedral in the center of Manhattan. This is beautiful place to attend Mass or just to visit. It is calming to be inside despite the throngs of tourists.
Wow!. What a place. Stunning interior and a massive part of NYC. Great location, and certainly worth walking into, even if only to see the place. Lovely
Midnight Mass. Beautiful cathedral. I'm thrilled that was able to receive a ticket for Midnight Mass. Peaceful. Hearing the choir sing was uplifting.
