Soulful Experience. I have visited the cathedral many times. This time was truly special, I was able to celebrate an early morning mass. Most of the renovations are comptete inside of the Cathedral and it is truly spectacular. A must see for anyone interested in religion or architecture.
Beautiful!. Beautiful outside and even more so inside. Be sure and walk through if you can. Decorated for Christmas even more beautiful.
Incredible architecture by the man above. What an incredible cathedral smack dab in the middle of New York City. Can only imagine Him being large enough to design such a fabulous worship location.
Restorations complete. No where in the world is Mass more beautifully celebrated than at St. Patricks Cathedral.... especially during the Christmas Season.
Beatiful. This cathedral is breath taking. You do not have to be Catholic to appreciate. Mass is usually going on when I have been there. Tourists are respectful.

Stunning!. They did a renovation and it's still has a little to go but this place just is stunning from outside to the inside. I feel overcome with the most spiritual feelings when I enter St. Patrick Cathedral. You can't help but be in awe at it's beauty and it's long history in the middle of Manhattan. I had the honor of being there while a service was taking place for memory of those lives lost in France. You could purchase a candle and put it on the alter's steps. It looked amazingly beautiful and there was a group of young people singing whose voices were like angels singing. You many not find that when you visit but you will enjoy the grander and beauty always!

Incredible! A must see!. This is the most spectacular Cathedral I have ever been in by far! The stained glass windows and architecture are amazing. The large pipe organ is spectacular and will leave you in awe. We took a moment to pray and light candles for our family and friends. Truly a beautiful Cathedral inside and out!
Beautiful visit to a historic site. We spent nearly an hour walking, admiring and taking photos. Well worth a visit to such a historic site.
Amazing. This place just underwent a 3 year cleaning. It looks brand new, The detail is unbelievable. Look up, across, side to side. Unbelievable architecture. Go light a candle.

What a nice surprise. We went there during the holidays and it was all about Christmas. The church itself is magnificent, high ceilings, the blue stain glass and the cute clover details on top of the columns. There was a group of nuns and priests singing while we were there. It made the whole experience so magical. Absolutely worth the time to visit.

Stunning restoration. The cleaning of the exterior of the Cathedral has returned it to its original light gray color. The interior cleaning has made the stained glass window dazzling. On a bright sunny day, the are almost too much to look at, as they are that brilliant. You can now appreciated all the subtle architectural detail that was obscured by decades of grime. As it is a sacred space, certain areas might be closed off during masses, weddings, etc. Well worth a look at for any lover of architecture.
Beautiful Christmas crèche. The Cathedral is looking wonderful after recent renovations, the Christmas Crèche an Italian Crèche are truly beautiful.
Beautiful from the outside. Didn't go into this cathedral, but from the outside it looked amazing, beautiful architecture very clean and standing very proud.

A breathtaking site!. I've lived in the metro area my entire life and this was my first visit to the church. It was Christmas time so the church was decorate with poinsettias and mangers. I was awestruck with its architecture and easily compared it with the churches visited in Italy.

An Experience. We were lucky enough to be able to celebrate Christmas Eve (5:30 mass) there this year. It was one of my best memories of our Christmas in NYC. The church is beautiful. Go early though. It is very popular.

Beautiful. Such a beautiful cathedral, with a breathtaking view as you walk out of the main doors. Staff are very helpful and knowledgeable, and there is no issue with taking photos.
Be aware - there are no restrooms.
Spectacular. Architecturally beautiful. The restoration has returned this historic site to it's original splendor. We highly recommend a visit.

Beautiful architecture. Attended 8am Mass on Christmas Day as visitors to New York. Beautiful experience.
The cathedral is every bit as beautiful as the best European cathedrals.
Police presence everywhere with security evidenced within the cathedral

Amazing, almost like European cathedrals. Incredible building, gorgeous stained glass, just all around amazing. Got to go to morning mass here with a lot of other people but it was not too crowded or even loud as I could still hear the sermon. Always a great experience.
Beautiful church. This church is very pretty! The renovation is done and it is one of the most beautiful places to visit in NYC. I highly recommend.

Right across from Rockefeller center . A magnificent church on fifth avenue where some of the most respected archbishops have been known to lead. The interior design is breathtaking. Stained glass windows, neo-gothic architectural elements, and a large pipe organ immediately capture your attention. If in the Rockefeller center area, make sure to go inside!
Lovely. This is a beautiful church. I had been before but when we last went, there was construction and we could not enjoy the beauty.
Breathtaking. St Patrick 's Cathedral was very breathtaking!!! We enjoyed walking through the church. It was a little crowded but worth it.

Beautiful Structure and setting.. It is fun, free and very moving. It was decorated for Christmas when we were there. I expected it to be a bit more quiet than it was but with that many people I'm sure it was noisy because of that.

Prayers. A visit to NY is not complete without a prayer in St Patricks cathedral. Escape the mania of shopping for a time of prayer. In a church where many many have prayed before. Sitting in te pew I thought of the Kennedys, of the people who came here in the aftermath of 9-11. Of all the candles which were lit and ceremonies undertaken. It is a holy and pious place
a stunning cathedral. Probably at its best during December, the cathedral is a beautiful place to visit in splendid condition, it stands out on Madison and a very busy visitor attraction

Austere beauty. An oasis of peace and silence in the midst of the tumult New York on 5th Avenue. Cathedral is huge . Now I saw it after renovation and worth a short visit to rest and admire the inside with white tall columns.

Mesmerizing!. To walk through such massive doors out of the cold at Christmas into this etherial place was an emotional experience. The restorations are just magnificent! The music, lights, - everything were so inspiring! I would love to have seen more respect showed to this church by some members of the public who should have removed hats in reverence to this spectacular place. It is a church after all. I think it is reasonable for attendants to ask the public to remove hats inside the church out of respect, regardless of one's religious beliefs.Saint Patrick's Cathedral is a must-see in NYC!JG

Beautiful Church, Newly Restored. It is next to Sakes 5th department store and close to Rockefeller Center. Great place to visit during holiday season and attend mass. It is tourist attraction place so for those who plan to attend mass, it is better to move to front in the church. The architecture and stained glass are beautiful. The cathedral ceiling is so beautiful.

Absolutely Gorgeous!. The doors are open to visitors. Like everything else in New York City, the cathedral is even better in December. There were 2 nativity scenes inside. The stained glass windows and the gothic architecture are wonderful to see.

very nice restored. We went to mass on Christmas day. Never experienced such an efficient mass in my life. Afterwards we felt as if we went through a Christmas-mass-factory. The cathedra itself is restaured and worthwhile to see. The only church in NYC where you can actually see this kind of architecture and church-art we have been told (since we definitely didn't see all churches in NYC!).
A Touristic Church. Beautiful in the inside but for being a attraction point I would not imagine attending a Holy Ceremony. There were a bunch of people coming through...
Very nice, larger than you imagine.. We went in during a service, it's very nice, stained glass is spectacular! Standing outside listening to the bells chimes is fun too.
Lovely cathedral. Escaped the huge crowds of Rock. Center here for a few moments. Similar to so many cathedrals seen worldwide, it still feels good for some quiet reflection.
Stunning!. We rounded a corner by sacs (amazing light display) and found this little gem. So pretty, large but dwarfed by its neighbours. Immaculately presented and so welcoming. Oasis in a busy city

Amazing place. Whenever we come into the city, we always make a stop at St. Patrick's.They have masses throughout the day, so it makes it easy to catch one. The building is impressive with its sheer size and gothic architecture.We like to walk along the side aisles to see the various small chapels on the sides.It is located across the street a block from Rockefeller center.
A must-see in my opinion.. I always want to go here when I am in NYC. It is very interesting and historic and a good place to light a candle and pray, or just walk around and admire.
Don't miss this. Beautiful architecture. Crowded on the weekend. Great location easy to visit right in the middle of the city. Highly recommend visiting

Simply stunning.. Regardless of religion, it is so worth to take in the beauty that is St. Patrick's Cathedral. It is centrally located on Madison Avenue and it is such an incredibly beautiful building. The exterior architecture is Gothic and magnificent, while the interior is majestic and stunning. I don't think words can ever fully do this amazing structure any justice, it truly is worth it to see for yourself.
beautiful but busy. This cathedral is beautiful, but it was so busy the weekend before Christmas that we couldn't even stand for a millisecond to admire the beauty without someone elbowing us.

Visited for Holy Day. Visited historical Cathedral and attended Holy Day mass. Renovation going on inside and outside of church. Noisy during mass. Mass offered many times during the day. Very convenient.

Beautiful Tribute to Christianity. The newly renovated Cathedral is awesome. Very Holy place to us Christians and it is however a tourist attraction. For the most part people were respectful but of course some people have no respect for a religious site. They were just about to start a mass and the ushers were trying their best to keep it Holy. I really felt Gods presence and felt HE was smiling at all the nationalities living in peace. This area like all the areas during our visit had massive police presence and I thanked them for being there and wished them and their families a Merry Christmas, and I was not the only one. NYPD the best.

Very Well Designed Church. The church is really well-built with all those fine details and lighting inside it. You can't miss it. Expect some security check before entering though. It is within walking distance from Radio City Music Hall and Top of the Rock.
very nice cathedral!. very nice cathedral!near the top of the rock.pay a visit to get some pictures.after the rebuilting look awesome!

Beautiful Gothic Architecture. Stop in and look.. It's really beautiful example of Gothic architecture inside and out. The stained windows have been cleaned as has the exterior. It's just beautiful and I was lucky enough to hear a choir sing during daytime practicing.
Lovely.. I loved this cathedral. Even though it was Christmas and crowded, the cathedral is still beautiful, peaceful, and a definite must-do when in NYC.

A Little bit of serenity in NCY. This church was recently renovated and is just beautiful. They did a great job. The week before Christmas brought a lot of people to visit and they were all respectful. With all the hustle and bustle on 5th Avenue, it was really nice to be inside such a beautiful and quiet place.

Christmas visit to St. Pat's. So glad to see the scaffolding down and the repairs finished. It looks beautiful. I did not really understand why the golden lab was in the manger. I liked it though. Pretty interesting.

Magnificent . There's lots of reasons to be awed when walking through the Cathedral. The architecture, the statues, the size of it all is just magnificent. We went during Christmas week and got to see the nativity scene. It filled me with joy and wonder. It was perfect.
Wow! Great restoration work. Beautiful cathedral which after the recent restoration looks fabulous. It should be on everyones must see list in NYC.
Beautiful....just beautiful. This is a fabulous cathedral with so much history. Everyone should visit it when in NYC. It was ok to take pictures too.

Beautiful amazing cathedral!!. Definitely a must see if you're visiting New York City! It was under major renovation when I was last there. But the beauty of this grand cathedral is not hidden by the scaffolds. If you're lucky you can actually see a wedding. I have seen a few before actually getting married there myself 19 years ago. They usually take place every hour on a Saturday.
Cathedral. Last time we visited full of scaffolding All removed now and is absolutely an amazing place, beautiful

Sacred tourism. Have been here each time I visit NYC. It has been renovated in honor of the Pope's recent visit. It is like a mini St. Peter's. So many beautiful small altars dedicated to saints representative of different eras and countries. Literally someone for everyone. This year the highlight is located in the far right area and is a fabulous, and very European extensive Italian nativity town scene from the Basilicata area. Loved this. So detailed, and illuminated. Not sure how long this is there, so hurry !
Beautiful. Nice to look in and see the beauty of the work. Worth a look if you are in area. It is a good example of how catherdals were built and their lasting beauty.

Oh My Goodness. This church is just amazing. I felt so at peace for the first time since being in NYC. Besides all the selfie sticks, the church is just breathtaking. We took time to go around and really look at the carvings, architecture, and structures. We took time to pray and light candles for our friends and family and just enjoyed some time in a very peaceful environment.

Beautiful Cathedral. Saint Patrick's is one of the most beautiful churches in NYC. It's even more beautiful since the restorative work was finished. The inside of the cathedral is sacred. Sometimes you forget it's a church that does have mass going on. The crowds do forget that. I try to go in during a time when mass isn't going on. Worth the visit.
Holiday Trip. The building brought tears to my eyes. The size of the structure is tremendous. The windows and stations of the Cross. The Church is stunning. It's a must see.

Gorgeous Cathedral, organized for tourist and those praying. Very inspiring cathedral, heard it was recently renovated. Went on Sunday and there were tons of visitors, a little loud in my opinion. However, the security/organizers did well in keeping the crowd controlled and to the outskirts of the inner benches thus allowing mass to continue.My brother went during the weekday and it was much less hectic.

A NeoGothic Classic on 5th. Avenue. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a neo Gothic work of art located on 5th. Avenue in midtown. The architecture is impressive and has been recently restored. The stained glass windows complement the soaring ceiling. The church is the de facto heart of Roman Catholicism in America. It attracts many thousands. While crowded on the weekends, it is more peaceful on the weekdays.

Worth Taking the Time to Stop In. Amid the hustle and bustle of the surroundings in NYC, St. Patrick's Cathedral is a mini oasis of beauty, a beacon of light. We walked around looking at the various dedications to the saints and our young boys were very excited to light a candle at their selected one. The architecture and stained glass were absolutely amazing! In December, a beautiful nativity scene is set up.
Fantastic architecture. St. Patrick's Cathedral is certainly a spectacle. The architecture is incredible to see from both the inside and out. Worth a visit even if just for a quick passing by photo.

A Place of Solitude. Definitely one of the top dozen things to see in NYC. Near Bloomingdales, and Central Park (walking distance of 10 minutes to both). Within 5 min of the subway. Wonderful place to pause in the middle of a hectic week in NYC and do some quiet reflection for half-an-hour.

A crown jewel outside of Rome!. You don't have to be a Catholic to enjoy this beautiful place, all the marble and the Stainglass it is absolutely gorgeous I feel like it was a privilege just to be there!
Worthwhile Visit. Take a 20 minute break from all of the buzz of the city to walk into the quietness of this iconic cathedral. It is peaceful and beautiful.

Christmas Concert. We went for the annual Christmas concert with the church choir along with other local choirs. This is a must see during Christmas in New York. I must say I think the church's own choir was the best
Breathtaking old Cathedral. Beautiful and breathtaking old Cathedral. It's been recently cleaned so looks wonderful. A real feeling of tradition in New York. Always busy
Breathtaking. This place is breathtakingly beautiful. It is such a peaceful place to walk around in to escape the hustle and bustle of the city.
St. Patrick's Cathedral. A must see while in New York! Breathtaking at every look!!!!! The architecture is a masterpiece. From the entrance doors to the ceilings, a work of intense labor and love.

Finally Done. The exterior work is finally done and the cathedral is beautiful. I've been coming to this place on and off for almost 70 years and it now looks better on the outside than it has in all that time. They have successfully removed all the grit and grim of the city from years. The interior has also been spoused up and it appears once again to be a church rather than a construction site. Nice to see the old girl back.
Wonderful. What an amazing place, the Stain Glass windows are fabulous, it truly is a lovely building, and most of all it was draught free and warm, we could have spent hours in their,

a 5th Avenue Staple. Stopped by since they have finished the renovations. As always a very beautiful church. Watching the tourists pan for the camera on the 5th Avenue steps is certainly entertaining! Very busy during Christmas season
beautiful since renovatation. scaffolding down it's stunning inside especially with all the christmas decor, stop in while visiting the tree at Rock Center

One of the Most Amazing Church Buildings in the United States. You will be overwhelmed by the beauty of this church. While few churches in the United States compares to the beautiful cathedrals and churches in Europe, St. Patrick's is a definite must see for those who enjoy old world church architecture.

Absolutely Breath Taking. I thought the outside was beautiful but the inside was nothing like I had seen before. It was the most beautiful church I had ever seen. They do let you take pictures on the inside. Try to be quiet and respectful.

Beautiful art and architecture. This Cathedral is a must visit. The sheer size is magnificent then you add the artistic touches throughout. A place of solace and awe that anyone visiting can stop at and feel the rush and pressure just melt away.

Milan-ish Cathedral in the middle of New York. I was quite surprised to see this very beautiful Cathedral in the middle of skyscraper city of New York. If you are going to climb the Empire State/Top of the Rock, you could spend a few mins before/after to explore this cathedral. It wouldn't take long and really worth the visit.(about 5-7 mins walk from Rockefeller center). Huge, beautiful and lovely! I am glad I visited this place in the midst of my tightly packed New York trip!
Awe inspiring!. We went mid-day and there were more people there than we thought would be. It was interesting to go to each prayer station, as we are not Catholic, and view the inscriptions.

The Most Beautiful Church I Have Ever Seen!. I was casually strolling along the streets of New York City during my latest trip, when I accidentally stumbled upon St. Patrick's Cathedral. I must say, it is the most beautiful church I have ever seen! I particularly liked the beautiful stained glass windows, and how guests could light a candle off to the side of the main sanctuary to add to its beauty! My accidental visit was well worth it!

At Christmas Time. A magnificent work of art. When you look around and see all the beauty, love, detail and manpower that went into erecting this grand Cathedral you realize that this type of craftsmanship barely exists anymore. God Bless when people took pride in their work and not just the almighty dollar or the Kardashians.

Amazing cleaned up cathedral. This is a fantastic structure that is so rare in the US. In Europe, huge cathedrals can be found in many places, but in the US, this kind of building is far rarer.Definitely worth a visit.

Wonderful Church and Landmark. We are not catholic but we visit St. Patrick's each time we go to NYC. The church is an amazing piece of architecture and history. It is so beautiful inside and very peaceful. A must visit place to go.

Christmas at St Patrick's. So disappointed. This is a beautiful cathedral which is spoilt by letting too many people in at the same time. Lost count of the people taking photos and talking on their mobiles!! Couldn't believe that the stewards weren't stopping this. They seemed to be occupied by checking inside bags as you enter. Necessary I know in today's world, but surely it's not too much to ask for some peace and quiet and respect in such a beautiful place. Maybe charging to enter would help overcome this. Just a thought!

Everytime we go to NYC, my husband wants to vist St. Pat's.. Visited major basilicas in Italy and St. Peter's thrice; and my husband LOVES St. Patrick's. What can I say? As a native New Yorker, yes, I am partial. It is a beautiful holy place to worship. Ofcourse, I would recommend it highly, it is God's dwelling place; holy ground.

Sunday mass. A beautiful cathedral inside and out. A definite must whether Catholic or not. Manages to retain a special holy feel.
Nice little repository excellent for a gift.

This is a Can't Miss. Most of the remodeling is completed on the inside now and this place is amazing to see. Unbelievable that this could have been built so long ago. No matter what religion you are you have to experience this place.

Wonderful for Holy Door, Year of Mercy visit. Like a million other people, we visited St. Patrick's Cathedral at Xmas. The capital renovation project is going well. The exterior facade has been cleaned and look wonderful. The "Holy Door" is open and available now for the Year of Mercy activities. The Christmas decorations are beautiful. Mass is offered 7 or 8 times a day. A peaceful place in the midst of a hectic city!!
Incredible:). One of the most beautiful churches EVER! A must see if you are in the Rockefeller Center area. Very spiritual!!!!
St Patrick's Cathedral. What a beautiful church, such fantastic architecture and beautiful paintings and sculptures, Peaceful space for reflection in the heart of New York City

Beautiful. I visited in February, when it was still covered in scaffolding, however this trip it is in full view and beautifully restored. It's free to go inside and really is a beautiful place with masses of history. If it's your first trip to New York this must be on your list.

always a beautiful place, especially at christmas. I always try to stop in St Pats when visiting New York. A beautify cathedral. Always stop and light a candle for loved ones. Amazingly beautify and breathtaking. A must see.

Beautiful Cathedral. So close to Rockefeller center, a must see. This is a beautiful Cathedral, mini chapels along both sides. the Nativity scene was lovely. Busy with tourists, but you can still Find some solace by the main alter for prayer, or in one of the small chapels.

Beautiful. I know there are so many places to go and see in New York but please add this to your list. It is simply beautiful! I'm not sure if the life size Nativity scene is up all the time, but it simply beautiful. It is an architectural beauty inside and out.
Beautiful cathedral. I have only been in a couple of cathedrals, but this one is amazing. Almost like artwork. I would recommend anyone going to see the beauty if you have time.

Restored to it's former glory.. Renovation was completed just in the nick of time coincided with the pope's visit to NYC. Some of the smaller detail still under work like the Lady of Guadalupe chapel. You can actually see the the interior and the exterior gleam from the clean up. Was fortunate to visit during the midday mass. Very solemn and dignified.The organ sound was glorious. Even if you're not Catholic, you still appreciate the beauty of the architecture.
Gorgeous church. Historical church with massive celings, wood carvings, beautiful arches. Impressive regardless of your Religion. You can feel and see the history
Got to See. We are not Catholic, but when we are in NYC we always make a trip to visit, light a candle, and just take in this wonderful landmark.
Beautiful cathedral. The cathedral is so breath-taking. It is a sight to see, whether you are Catholic or not. If you are Catholic it is a sacred place to attend mass.

Awesome! Historic! Beautiful!. Visiting St. Patrick's at this time of year is not only awesome but it is also a religious experience. As one fellow pointed out, this isn't just a tourist attraction. It is an active place of worship and if one looks around in that cavernous Cathedral, those who are praying can be seen. Maybe it is only a visit for some of those who are praying. It might be the place of worship, attended every time possible, for others. The Nativity is awesome. We serve an AWESOME God and here is a wonderful place to thank Him!

Unbelievable Cathedral.. Even though this Cathedral is undergoing renovation, it is open to the public. The building itself is something to behold, but the addition of the Christmas Manger Scenes, etc. takes my breath away.
The Most Elegant Building Ever!. If you want to see wonderful architecture then you must stop and see the Cathedral. It is by far the most elegant building I have ever seen.

Magnificent Cathedral. St.Patrick Cathedral is a stoning Catholic church....not to be missed when visiting NYC. Located on Fifth Ave. @ 50th street..almost opposite Rockefeller Center. You don't need to be Catholic to enjoy and appreciate how magnificent this structure is . A big renovation has taken placed at the end of 2015...and this really makes you admire this piece of art in terms of building designed. If you wish to participate in a mass they have quite a few masses in a daily basis, on Sundays they also have 1 mass at 4pm in Spanish..plus the many others in English all Sunday long. We encourage to give a little freely donation to help the expenses to keep this extraordinary Cathedral. If you want to have a quite moment of player stop by the beautiful little chapel behind the main altar, it's just unique!! Lastly, some times they have free concerts, so when you arrive check the schedules of events ...you might be able to enjoy one.

Thought I might be in Europe.. It's a nice cathedral. One of the nicer ones in this country. Looks like it was moved here from Europe. Not as big as its European counterparts, but very nice and clean. Maybe because it's not as old.
A beautiful church. Visitors can stand in the back of the church to observe, but if you want to actually walk around the church you will need to go through a security check.
Beautiful . Beautiful church recently renovated. Stopped in to light a candle and say a prayer... Simply breathtaking! A must see in NYC!

SERENITY. On a recent trip to NYC, I went inside the St. Patrick's Cathedral for the fist time, to rest my tired feet. There was a free Christmas concert. We walked around and admired the beautiful architecture, and lit some candles. It was very calming to be in the church and escape the crowed streets, be it for a short time.

incredible carvings and stained glass windows. We came across this church by accident and I am glad we did. Inside has the most amazing carvings in the high ceiling and walls. The stained glass windows are also incredible.

Beautiful cathedral. Went at night. The lighting on the white marble was perfect and the walls seemed to glow. Beautiful carvings in both wood and marble. Statues were lovely. Wish I could have gotten back to the cathedral in the day time to see the stained glass windows.
Mass at St Patricks. Of course St. Patricks is an awesome visit, but we were there for Mass on Black Friday, so calming experience, with the world outside going crazy with shopping.

what NY fantastic Icon of the city. just steps in front of Rockefeller center, you can plan an afternoon with a walking starting in Times Square go on 7th ave, right on 50th street (Radio City theater at corner), go to Rockefeller center, get the "Top of the Rock" ticket to the observatory and end with the views of St. Patrick's Cathedral fantastic tour of modern, art and cosmopolitan sense of the city.

Wonderful church in the middle of all of the action. We went to a Sunday Mass in St. Patrick's. I had read about its history beforehand, and because of that, I had a real appreciation for its beauty. We absolutely loved the music and the mass--it was a quiet time in the middle of a hectic holiday.
Amazing renovation. St. Patrick's is so exquisite since it's been renovated. The cathedral looks amazing and beautiful..always love stopping by for a quiet moment.
Just beautiful!. Even if you are not Catholic, St. Patrick's is still a place to see. It is just simply beautiful. If you are Catholic, attending mass is an extra benefit.
Gorgeous architecture!. You will be awed by the façade of this cathedral. Few in North America are as splendid. Inside is also very special.

Quiet Dignity. What a spectacular piece of architecture. Even if you're not religious St. Patrick's is definitely worth a visit when you visit NYC. Every time I go I have to stop in say a prayer and light a candle.

A beautiful place of worship !!. We attended Mass there and were moved by all the beauty and
reverence shown by all the folks visiting while we were at Mass.
A nice place to visit on your New York Trip and take time to pray for peace in the world.
BEAUTIFUL. The interior is so breathtakingly beautiful. To see all the old stone work and old wood is just unbelievable. Must see!

It's about time! . After so many years of renovation, we finally saw the Cathedral in all its splendor. No more scaffolding, no more paint buckets. The place looks great inside and outside. A must do while in the Big Apple and right across Rockefeller Center.

As beautiful as I remembered. I was in St Patrick's on a school trip in 2000, and when I returned this December, I was not disappointed! The architecture, the carvings, the stained glass... Just beautiful!!!

NEW YORK CITY IN THE CHRISTMAS SEASON. If you have not yet been to the Cathedral, it is an amazing sight. Have been many time. Recently because of the Pope's visit they have shined it all up. The votive candles and the stain glass windows, the pipe organ playing Christmas Music. Go to the Cathedral and see this amazing sight.
Beautiful for Holiday Season. Attended mass here, beautiful for the christmas season. Manger was gorgeous. Such a beautiful church
This is a church afterall.. Magnificent structure in the heart of midtown. Mobs of people walking through. Bag searches in effect. Bring loose dollars if you want to light a candle.

Wonderful architecture and a beautiful Church. The Church was gorgeous and I was very glad we stopped in to see it. Beautiful all the way around and the Christmas music playing only added to the wonder.
Great Nativity Scene at Christmas. We always visit this church when visiting NYC. At Christmas time there is a great nativity scene. Light a candle in memory of someone.
Beautiful old church. Enjoyed my visit to St Pats. Beautiful architecture and peaceful presence. A quiet respite from the busy Rockafella center across the street.

bIg spaces. A very interesting cathedral , one if not the biggest in New York, p,aged a big part in helping injured people after 9/11 and the service men and women who worked tirelessly then. Very important to the Irish community in N Y. Certainly well worth a visit.

Renovation Complete, Magnificence at its Best. Last summer, I reviewed the outside renovation once it was completed, but the inside was still all scaffolding. Now complete, there isn't a house of worship in this world that is more magnificent than this. Beauty everywhere, architectural nuggets everywhere you look. Once you see the main altar and observe its beauty. Sit down and look up at the ceiling. The detail is beautiful. Even if you are not Catholic, this is a must stop while you are in NYC!
Monumental place. one of New York symbols.. That is a great catholic cathedral right in the city center. Entrance is free. Don't forget to act properly. Coz it is about religion, you know)
Quick look. Beautiful looking place inside, if Cathedrals are your thing it is well worth a look. Had a quick look inside as we were pressed for time but could of stayed here longer for sure.
Great. Glad we stopped off on our way back from Central Park en route to Rockerfella Plaza, didn't realise it was that close!! Which we could have stayed for a service
Impressed with the renovations. Have attended the cathedral on many occasions. So impressed with the renovations badly needed. Highly recommend.

Worth seeing. St. Patricks's Cathedral is absolutely beautiful. If you are anywhere close to the cathedral, you must walk through it just to see the beauty. There are masses on Saturday and Sunday. A tourist can still view the cathedral while mass is in session. There is an active presence of security, too. Be patient while waiting to enter.

Calming. This is place of worship. It hold so much history. We came in after a day of walking- tired. We sat in a pew and let the calm settle over us. The design of the building is beautiful and we wondered what the workers felt and thought as the built the building, as they placed the stones? The building is amazing and has so much history.

BEAUTIFUL!!. We went to the morning service with the live choir. The entirety of it was beautiful.....very crowded though. I have been there in the summer and it was not this crowded so I am assuming it was because of the Christmas Season. A must while in New York!!

Oh! How beautiful!. I saw the cathedral on television when the Pope visited and heard the discussion about the renovations. It is beautiful and a MUST see. It is downtown and in walking distance. We had beautiful spring weather and just enjoyed sitting outside and admiring the beautiful renovations.
Always interesting!. It is a NY institution so a visit is necessary... and for Catholics it is very meaningful... Thanks god Cardinal Spellman is gone!!! Terrible man...

Small cathedral but carry much history. Although it is not as grand as some of the other European cathedrals, it does have some interesting history such as President George Washington attended service there. It is located right next to 9/11 Memorial site.

Beautiful. Currently being cleaned up.. Amazing building. Has been cleaned and is undergoing works. Large nativity scene inside and a scene of Bethlehem based on a village in Italy by an artist whose name I forget. Very serene considering the crowds outside on 5th Ave.
Nice to see minus scaffolding. Attended Mass here. What a wonderful experience that was to be together with so many races sharing an act of Faith

Restoration is absolutely beautiful. I live and work in NYC and I have seem scaffolding around the cathedral for so long - I forgot what it looked like. A friend came to visit, and I decided to take us on a quick side trip to see it. It is stunning inside and out - a must see in the heart of the big apple.

Love going into this Cathedral everytime I go to this area.. I don't care how many time I go to Manhattan (Theater District), I enjoy the sites and sounds of Radio City Music area. Just walking around, enjoying the smells of the street venders food stands and people watching. This Cathedral is must place to visit especially during the Christmas Holidays. They don't make churches like this anymore.
A must come in NYC. This is a beautiful place I always try to visit in NYC... now the restoration works are over and you will enjoy the place completely; its a majestic church with a wonderful vibe;

Beautiful.... Everytime I go to NYC, I visit St. Patrick's. It's just a special place. It's usually crowded but I always love to light a candle for different people in my life. A wonderful site to see while visiting.

Worth the stop if going to rockafeller center. It is a very beautiful cathedral right on fifth avenue across from Rockafeller center. It is worth seeing and in between sacks fifth Ave. And the center you can spend half a day here.
After, Central Park is about 5 blocks north on fifth.

beautiful Catheral. I spent a couple of hours in this beautiful Catheral this past August 2015 . It was being renovated for the Popes visit. It is now finished. It was still beautiful inside. The altars are so beautiful.When you go in ,it totally makesa you feel peaceful and calm. Christmas time is wonderful there. It is decorated really nice.The stain glass windows are gorgeous. It has a gift shop with some nice selections. You can also go to mass there. They have a schedule printed for the times of masses. You can light a candle at each altar if you wish. I will go back each time I am in New York City. It is close to Rockerfeller Center,Radio City, and is easy to get to on the bus.
Stunning. Didn't go inside, but you can't miss this beautiful building if you go to Sacks, radio city or the Rockefeller centre. An architectural beauty amongst quite ugly skyscrapers

Iconic building worth seeing. I have been here numerous times. It's worth seeing if you are in NYC as there aren't many cathedrals to see here in the US. Besides, it's such an iconic building and you can go whenever you want and spend as much or as little time as you want. It's also close to other places a visitor would want to go such as Rockefeller Center, Saks 5th Ave store, (and American Girl store for those with young girls) and close to Central Park as well--so you do not have to go out of your way to make a special trip there. The only problem is that, like many famous cathedrals around the world, it feels a little touristy and they sell souvenirs. That does not seem quite right, but I guess it is a source of revenue for them.The church has gone though a restoration and is currently sparkling clean.
Absolutely beautiful.. A little gem amongst sky scrapers and department stores. A place to get away from the hustle and bustle, relax and take in the religious architecture.
Simply Beautiful!. We were out shopping and stopped by to view this beautiful cathedral. Simply breathtaking inside and out. Worth a stop if you are in the area.
brief walk through. It is really beautiful after the years of renovations are now concluded. This is a must do destination when you are in Midtown NYC

Moving experience . We go here every time we are in New York. The beauty is breath taking! There is such a holy hush in this place. It is so easy to pray here. Christmas time I love the giant nativity they have. This time we went they were having a young adult mass. I wish we could have stayed for the entire mass. Very moving...

Doesn't matter what religion. Impressive. I am not Catholic but visiting this location was worth it. I have been to the Vatican and this place compares to the majesty and significance to history. They don't build things like this anymore. If you are in town, take a look, it's free.

Out of the blue. This stunning Cathedral is sat bang in the centre of the Rockefeller centre & looks so out of place yet so at home. It is a treat on the eyes & neck!! Inside it was so beautiful & mass was being given so it was very busy. A very welcome change of scenery

peaceful. St. Patricks is a peaceful haven in a large city. there was a choir singing when we visited which added to it's beautiful atmosphere. the crib is a must see and is gorgeous. Would like to have got mass there, but the teenage folk were not to be tempted. the only negative thing i would say about St. Patricks is the amount of collection boxes all ove the cathedral. o.k. it costs a lot to maintain, but it doesn't cost to pray. but put that aside and it is beautiful

Looks brand new. They spent the summer cleaner up the outside. It looks in a way to new. I spent my whole life visiting the cathedral with the old historical look on the outside, but I can get use to it. Nicely decorated both in and out. VERY VERY impressive place
A look into European cathedrals of Old. Magnificent, just magnificent!! Where does one begin to describe this?! Just go! Give yourself some time to explore.

A Must See in New York City!!. A piece of European architecture you would be hard-pressed to see this side of Europe. What a beautiful building and what a terrific place to worship the Judeo-Christian God who loves us all!!!!

Beautiful Cathedral. I have visited St. Patrick's Cathedral several times and was a treat to see it post renovation. Its a spectacular cathedral and suprisingly able to visit, look around and listen during mass.

Impressive!. Beautiful cathedral in midtown, with it's excellent vitrals, chorus & organ.
Being newer than european catholic cathedrals, it's also a very impressive one!

The exterior now is gleaming white. It's been a long process, but the exterior is almost completely restored and makes the cathedral gleam in the sunlight. Who'd have thought there was a white building under decades and decades of city pollution? The church is a true landmark and an important piece of architecture as well as the home church of thousands.

Absolutely Breathtaking Beauty!. This place is beautiful, the outside as well as the inside. The sound of the pipe organ is amazing. People are welcome to come inside and pray and visit. I think attending a mass here would be great. If you are close, you should stop by and see it.
Breathtaking. Absolutely amazing architecture. Sitting inside and looking up and around at all it took to build this beautiful church is just memorizing. Inside and out just beautiful.
such a peaceful place in a big city. beautiful church to visit. we lit candles for my parents in law who had recently passed. it was a very peaceful feeling.
Aweinspiring. Our granddaughter loved entering and looking around the cathedral with us. The doorkeepers were very welcoming. It's a lovely restful place in the middle of NYC.
Really impressive. This was on my wife's list rather than mine, but I tagged along and was glad I did. It's a wonderful place, even for non-believers.
A must-see. Beautiful place with amazing details! Loved the nativity scene and the organ music. Lots of people, but still a wonderful experience

RENOVATION MAKES THIS CATHEDRAL SHINE. Recently renovated, the cathedral looked wonderful. Even with the throngs of visitors, it is a place of quiet in the midst of NYC. Check out the schedule on line, as there are often times free musical concerts.
Beautiful!. We couldn't go in that late at night but the architecture is stunning, all lit up and majestic next to Saks

Must See. I lived in NYC for a long time and always thought that St Patrick's was a dark gray cathedral. I was wrong. The recent clean up makes it more spectacular than ever. The public is allowed to walk through most of the church and take photographs even while a Mass is underway. Donate $2 to light a candle and say a prayer for your parents. (My apologies if that is politically incorrect).
Beautiful . This place was very beautiful and must see if you are near the area ... Bag checks required for entry.... an amazing place to visit especially for all architecture lovers out there
St. Patrick's Cathedral. Beautiful space and still humbling to walk in and know the history. The Nativity scene is beautiful and plenty of places to worship and just take it all in.

St. Patrick's Church near Madisson Avenue. I am a nonbeliever but very moving to be inside this beautiful cathedral. The stained glass windows capture your eye the moment you enter the sanctuary.Majestic, ornate architecture. Such a beautiful building in centre of the city calls for a visit.

Highlight of our trip. We attended mass at St. Patrick's on Saturday evening. Arrived 1 hour early to get a seat up close. We have been to a lot of churches in our travels and St. Patrick's was beautiful. We did have trouble hearing as the sound system needed updating.

Lovely. The renovations were just completed and were able to go to mass. So peaceful and beautiful inside. The church is so much brighter than lets say the Notre Dame. My hotel was very close so we were able to easily attend mass.

Serenity in the heart of the hussle and bustle.. This architecturally stunning cathedral is so peaceful and serine in the heart of one of the world busiest cities! From the moment you walk in the door you will be inspired by the outstanding architecture but also the quiet dignity of the century plus structure. Visiting a church is not like visiting any other building and the devine presence can be felt in the respectful quiet of the visitors. Several masses are held daily and on the weekend the music ministry is truly exceptional if you are able to attend. I highly recommend it!
Majestic. I am not a Catholic although I am of the Christian faith. It is not often I am awed by such structures but St. Patrick's is truly majestic ... definitely worth the visit.

A tribute to man's interaction with his Maker. If you have ever visited Italy and the many churches there you realize they were constructed so that 'man' would feel the immenseness of his 'creator' and how 'small' he is compared to this notion. You will get that same 'fee' at St. Patrick's. The majesty and the magnificence of that 'something bigger' than us if felt everywhere in this wonderful place of worship.

Looks beautiful!!. Last year when we were in NYC, the church was covered, as they were into a project to clean the exterior of the church. It is beautiful today!!! It was crowded, but you could go inside, even though there was a service being given.
Breath taking. Visited in the evening. Beautiful singing. Such a beautiful church. You much stop by this church if you are in the area.

A beautiful place to see and pray. We wet on a Saturday, and were able to go back for the Saturday evening Mass. The building is being restored, and almost finished, and looks great.Beautiful stained glass windows, large pipe organ and a lovely altar.

Grils' weekend in NYC. Very moving to be inside this beautiful cathedral. The stained glass windows capture your eye the moment you enter the sanctuary.Beautiful, ornate architecture. Love to visit different cathedrals.

Stunning . Worth the visit! If you can make it to mass while you're in NYC; St.Patricks Cathedral is absolutely incredible. They recently restored the outside and it's amazing. Take photos and take the tour!

Check out the refurbishing. So light and bright now as they refurbish this historic church. The main altar gleams against the white stone. Well set-up for tourists and a full schedule for parish member and visitors.

Restoration is gorgeous!. As a Catholic, we have been going to St Patrick's for years every time we visit NYC. We have watched the 2 year renovation and this visit most all of the scaffolding is down and the true beauty of the Cathedral is showcased. They did a beautiful job and any religion would appreciate the beauty of this Cathedral! Definitely worth a visit with some quiet time and a visit to thank the one above for all He has given to us!

Absolutely Beautiful Landmark. Its a treat to see something so epically beautiful - the stonework, the stained glass, the history, etc. Stopped in and lit a candle at the section dedicated to St Brigid. Worth a look at this architectural masterpiece.
Beautiful. Since the renovation, the church is quite beautiful. During December it is decorated for the holidays. Expect large crowds during the holidays

One the the greatest Building in the World. A must see when in New York
The architecture is breathtaking both inside and out
its conveniently located across the street from the Rockefeller Center
Wonderful Place to walk around. Just across from Rockefeller Square is the Cathedral. Many people go in just to wander around and others go to worship. Everyone is welcome.

Detailed architecture. Such a beautiful Cathedral!! There was a Mass while we were there, felt really peaceful.
Lots of tourist was wondering around, but seen locals as well.
Just take a moment to sit down and take your time.
Beautiful Cathedral. Wow! It is beautiful from outside and inside too. It´s free and it worth the visit. Just enjoy the Cathedral!
Beautiful. The remodeling is finished.The scaffolding is down.Beautiful Church.I have been in before remodeling and after.It is gorgeous.
Great choir. Went for one of the sung masses and was not disappointed. Although full to capacity it was a lovely experience
Bella!!! . Stunningly beautiful since the renovation, it was truly a test to go in. The life size nativity was so gorgeous. Bravo to the years worth of love needed to clean the cathedral!

Stunning!. You are allowed to go through the Cathedral and take pictures. It took over 20 years to build, and the detailing is beautiful. Walk through slowly, take your time to appreciate the architecture.
Peaceful, beautiful. I was blessed to be able to attend Mass last Sunday. Go early to get a seat when the choir sings. The Cathedral is worth a visit whether or not you are Catholic. A must see.

A Respite in a Busy Day. This was a lovely, peaceful few moments during our Christmas shopping trip to the city. Beautifully restored, enjoy a rest in a pew, be sure to notice the organ behind you. Light a candle and/or say a prayer for someone in need. Remember the real meaning of the holiday season.

Gorgeous Cathedral !!!. I have been here many, many times in the past 50 years, but I have never seen this church as clean and vibrant as it is now after five long years of renovation. If you come to New York City don't miss coming to St. Patrick's regardless of your religious beliefs. It's a not to be missed place in midtown Manhattan.
Breathtaking. A must see. Light a candle and say a prayer. The church is tremendous in size and feel. Take your time. Pictures are allowed. As busy as it is, the line in is fast.

Advent Mass first sunday. Attended mass on first advent of Sunday this year,spectacular cathedral.i would definitely consider getting married here if I was to get married abroad... Fabulous atmosphere,well worth a visit.
Breathtaking. Such a beautifully designed cathedral. Huge. Open to all and wonderful sculpturing throughout. Stain glass work is awesome. Just totally breath taking.

So beautiful. First time my bag has been searched going into church. I know the presence of guards is an unfortunate necessity in this day and age but feel the loud voices and general chitchat are quite irreverent, especially when Holy Mass is in progress.

GREAT New Year's Eve Concerts / Choirs. Besides being one of the most beautiful, historic, and iconic churches in the city of New York (which is a MUST see / must visit).... it's also a great venue to attend their choir concerts, concerts, and other musical things on their schedule.Just a divine place !! Fun and magnificent!
beatiful building. even if you are not religious this building is beautiful, its so serene the architecture is amazing and so peaceful

Impressive cathedral. Having recently been cleaned, this cathedral is now very impressive with beautiful stained glass windows, marble carvings and elaborate altar.Also look at the side altars and pulpit.There are huge organ pipes above bronze entrance doors.The sound from the organ is impressive.Don't forget to look up at the intricate painted ceiling.This cathedral is well worth a visit.
Renovated and beautiful. This is the first time that I have seen the front of the cathedral without scaffolding and it is beautiful.

St. Patrick's Looks Like New. St. Patrick's has been recently cleaned and it looks magnificent--nice to see the dark grey (pollution and years of NYC dirt) gone and replaced with pristine white. The architectural features are clearly seen. Inside the cathedral is beautiful, though crowded. It is certainly worth a visit!
Bachelorette Trip. breathtaking! the last time I was here it was full of scaffolds for refurbishing...now it was just beautiful!!!
Mesmerizing!. The architectural detail is amazing!! This is one of the most beautiful church buildings I've ever seen.
Beautiful Architecture. The high and beautiful arhces of this cathedral are noteworthy and you should definitely pay it a visit, while visiting NY.
Amazing Cathedral. Have always wanted to go to a mass here and finally did. It is close to Rockefeller center and a must see while in NYC.
Beautiful and historic. We went to the early mass on Sunday and walked around after, you can come in anytime to look around, definitely worth a visit.
beautiful. Busy but beautiful. Such a lovely restoration of this architrctural gem in a bustling city. Pay $3 and get a "gold" coin from the vending machine as a rememberance of your visit.
Art on the rock. Where did they get all that money from to build this magnificent church. It kept crossing my mind as I was walking inside this unbelievable church.
Amazing. Beautiful Cathedral, it is huge and there is a lot to see. They even let you in during mass, which is not possible at other Cathedrals neither churches.

An escape of calm. I just love this place, step inside from the madness of NYC , the people, shoppers and traffic and the noise and find some peace and calm in St Pats. Take 15 minutes to yourself and enjoy this place

Restoration Looks Beautiful. St. Patrick's has been undergoing a restoration, if you have not seen it for a while go back, the outside has been cleaned and scrubbed and looks wonderful. It looks like some work has been done inside also but not sure on that.

Finding time to pray in the city that never sleeps. Saturday 8am mass came complete with organist and soloist leading the mass songs. Great opportunity to find some quiet time in a small chapel within the cathedral.
A beautiful building - even for the non-religious. The beauty of the architecture, stained glass, organ pipes, and impressive tall ceilings make this worthy of seeing.

Awe inspiring. As a Catholic, I have always wanted to visit this cathedral. I found myself speechless by its beauty and even cried. The statues, the organ and altar are beyond description. I only wish my visit would have been during a mass.
Majestic. Recently renovated. You can go inside and walk around the beautiful church. Famous for funerals of celebrities.

Its a beautiful church!. If you have ever been to Europe and visited all the beautiful churches there, then you will appreciate this as a peer on par with other magnificent churches and it deserves a walk through and appreciation for what it is. That said, this was about a 15 min. visit for me as there was much, much more to see it NYC. It is magnificent and great but like all churches I have seen, if you are not "making a pilgrimage" and architect buff, or churchaficionado then it is nice and all but more than 20 min and your done.

Tourist Attraction as well as Holy Prayer Space. Even though the church was filled with tourists looking at the building I was able to find a place to pray in peace. In fact they had a prayer chapel, behind the main altar, in which the Exposition of the Blessed Sacrament, was on-going. What could have been better?
Very spriritual place. A nice place to visit and hear mass if you are Catholic. Easy to get to and so many regular visitors visit the place

Inspiring, humbling. We visit every time in NYC...although we are not Catholic. The space is spiritual no matter what your religion. We witnessed a special service for lay people committed to ministering to the ill. The a cappella rendition of 'Amazing Grace' led me to tears. Praying for all...
Gorgeous. Stunning architecture. Beautiful stained glass. Peaceful. Make sure to walk around the entire church.

A Catholic must-see... but attend a service as well. Yes, it is a beautiful, awe-inspiring building, but it's too bad that so many see it as just another NYC photo op. We were lucky enough to sit in the middle section for one of Cardinal Dolan's 10:15 Masses, and it was truly inspiring. Attend, listen, and be inspired.

Breathtaking architecture . Went here on the day after the events in Paris and the security was high, not sure if it's generally as high, but took a while to get in as everything was being checked. On entrance though it was well worth the weight, such amazing architecture and Windows. Surprised to find such an old building in such a modern part of New York which made it all the more interesting.

Take a Moment to Reflect. St. Patrick's Cathedral is an amazing structure. Open to the public at no cost. Take a moment to go inside ... to the center of the cathedral .. to quietly reflect. Look, listen and pause.

Simply beautiful. We needed a break from the hustle and bustle. Absolutely stunning architecture. Amazing that the hands of man built this holy place. The stained glass windows are gorgeous. You can't help feeling closer to God in this cathedral. What an oasis in the heart of NYC.

I stained glass windows are beautiful.. St. Patrick's is worth a few minutes to stop in and see the beautiful stained glass windows. The cathedral itself is In great shape. Just take a few moments to stop I if your are I the area.
Relisious place. I went there once when I was in vacation in new York last year. I felt like a safe place, close to Jesus. There are so many every day doing their prayers and worshiping god.
A lovely oasis. Warm and welcoming in the bustle of the city. A pity that bags have to be searched but that's a sign of the times. Simpler than I'd expected and more atmospheric as a result.
It looks GREAT all clean. So white now, it shines. A beautiful way to start our yearly trip to the city. Always the same in many ways but the renovation really makes it sparkle.
Beautiful church. A beautiful church, they search your bag as you go in but that is not a problem, the guys are very polite, lists of people in the church but still very peaceful, glad I went in

Breathtaking detail. When you walk in, just look up! It's a beautiful church with some history in the middle of the bustling shopping district. We did not know about this and stumbled upon it while out for a walk! You can sit and be at peace for a while, or light a candle!

Spiritual. Although it was crowded with tourists - the Parish priest was in the lobby greeting everyone and available for a special prayer. Was able to lite a few prayer candles for family at this special time of the year. Gift shop is very small but the ladies were very polite.

American Gothic. What trip to New York City or any of the big cities is complete without a visit to a historic house of worship. St Patrick's Cathedral is just beautiful, the high ceiling, attention to detail, and ornaments all add to this great church. The cathedral gets crowded between tourists and worshippers, so when you go remember to enjoy the beauty and respect those whom are seeking a spiritual escape from the city. Look your going to be shopping or sightseeing on Madison Ave, so stop by St Patrick for a few minutes you'll be in awe.

Stunning, stunning, stunning!. My husband and I had seen the Cathedral on television and in print many times; however, experiencing the Cathedral in person was a moving experience. Magnificent columns; the most beautiful stained glass imaginable; and creative woodwork absolutely took our breaths away! Please, please, please do not visit New York without stopping by for a few moments.
Beautiful building. It always amazes me how people built such beautiful buildings without the modern day equipment. Fantastic workmanship and a lovely working church.
Beautiful and historic. Beautiful NYC cathedral. Be sure to go inside to see close up the interior architecture. A spot of serenity in the craziness of NY.

Most Spectacular Cathedral in U.S.. Visitors of all faiths will Enjoy a visit to St. Patrick's Cathedral. Set of 5th Ave, the Gothic revival building is awe-inspiring. The stained glass windows are gorgeous.

Absolutely beautiful!. This cathedral is one of the largest in the country and a must see even if you aren't Catholic. It's definitely worth a visit inside and it's right across the street from Rochefeller center which is a pretty common tourist destination =)
Dad wanted us to see this and Wow, Beautiful. This church is amazing, meaning Beautiful, Wow. The structure has so much detail it's unbelievable. Seriously and must see if your here.
Took My Breath Away!. This cathedral is absolutely stunning and took my breath away! It's stunning inside and out. The architecture of building is incredible.

A Spiritual Landmark. We definitely needed more time to view all that is St. Patrick's Cathedral, but there was a mass in progress, and we didn't feel it was appropriate to "tour" the place.This beautiful gothic landmark is built of marble on brick with a gorgeous entrance below a stunning rose window. Construction was started in 1858 with a pause during the Civil War, and it was opened 20 years later. St. Patrick's is easy to find on 5th Avenue right across from Rockefeller Center. If you look down from the Top of the Rock, you will get a good view. The cathedral is designated a National Historic Landmark for good reason. The inside is massive, and will sit 3000 people. From the outside, it looks very much like some centuries old churches in Europe, but is pristine in its cleanliness, inside and out.

Beautiful church. When entering this church, you can see the majesty of its structure and the beauty as it has been cleaned. The stain glass windows are extremely beautiful and it is truly a wonderful place go view, but even more so if you kneel down and pray a while.
Beautiful cathedral. If you're walking down 5th Avenue, be sure to stop in and take a look at this beautiful piece of architecture.

Nothing short of breathtaking!. A beautiful cathedral. So welcoming to everyone! The pastor had just finished morning mass and was out on the steps welcoming visitors. The stained glass, marble, statues, pews, monuments and candles are simply breathtaking. Be sure to look up over the entrance to see the amazing organ pipes. I will visit this amazing cathedral on any visit back to NYC.
Wow!. Love this church! It is so lovely inside and out. I love were it sits, in the middle of shopping etc. If you love architecture this is a must see.

Historic beautiful Cathedral. The Cathedral is located next to the Top of the Rock square and is easy to get to. It is very large and beautiful inside and it is a nice place to take a seat and relax and take time to think things over on a busy day.

Well worth a visit. Went there early in the day before the tourist crowds arrived. Very impressive building both inside and out with very informative notes at each of the chapels. No pressure to use guides etc.

Don't call it St. Patrick's. That's what a nun told me. St. Patrick doesn't own it. The proper name is The Cathedral of St. Patrick. It's a cathedral dedicated to St. Patrick. And it cleans up very nicely, following a renovation program, which I understand cost around $17 million. I make a stop there almost every time I visit the city. The facade is beautiful, and the interior architecture is exceptionally impressive. However, compared to many European cathedrals, it's a bit short on works of art. If you can think of the art in cathedrals in, for instance, Florence, Rome or Paris, they've got it all over the subject of this review, but then the Europeans have been at it for many centuries, while the Cathedral of St. Patrick was built as recently as the 1800's. And I really enjoy the sound of the organ.

grandiose. The church is beautiful filled with art and accessibility to the public is good. I had the good experience of being on the Ukraine celebration mass which was conducted in a ceremonial emotive fashion. You should visit it if you go to NY

Easy to walk to. Beautiful massive church. Has been undergoing restoration so there is scaffolding etc. Enjoyed watching the video regarding donations and the project. Worth taking the time to check out if in the area.

Classically built city cathedral. Beautifully designed architecturally both internal and external. Captures a calming and tranquil feeling in the mist of city life. The Pope was due to visit the week after we went there so there was lots of pictures and souvenirs available. Also had the Papal flying along side US flag. Worth a visit.
It was always worth your time but now more so...... The church is about three quarters way through a cleaning and refurbishing of this wonderful Catederal. It sparkles like never in recent memory.

Great cathedral - so much detail on every part of it!. We visited here during the day. The detail inside and outside is amazing. Well worth a visit - as with many cathedrals, there is the option to light a candle for a lost loved one.
Beautiful!!!. It is a beautiful church in New York City and a must to see!!! I had the chance in Dec 2014 and there was just a worship and really wonderul to see

Place of reflection. I visited this church for Mass at noon on a rainy April day. The whole space was immense. I spent a while walking about the outer aisles just taking in the statues and stained glass. There were areas to light a candle and say a prayer. While there were many tourists at that time of day, it was possible to sit and reflect on the history of the cathedral. There was security present. At noon, the mass was said on the main altar and included a soloist which was so beautiful.
Beautiful -- even more after the renovation. Many visitors; able to walk around the entire church to visit its many shrines. Also quiet places for prayer. Inspection of bags at entry.

Shining Splendor. I had never seen the cathedral so beautiful. It has be cleaned and polished for everyone to enjoy. A grand place among the richest area to contemplate the ethereal. A quite space to find the true you.

Outstanding . This cathedral has got to be one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever been said is that my fiance and I are both catholic and choose to visit the cathedral. They're outside of the building is breathtakingly beautiful but once you go inside it is stunning everything from their statues to the decor is outstanding. Regardless of your religion I would still make it a point of being one of the top things to do when visiting New York City

Very touching. We went to mass on the Sunday after the Paris bombing. Prayers were said in French as well as there national anthem. Very moving experience. The organ, choir and music were very impressive. Loved it

Beautiful Place of Worship. The cathedral architecture is breathtaking. Beautiful stained glass windows. Gorgeous glass Chandeliers. Magnificent altar and statues. Welcoming to visitors of all faiths.

Must see!. What a joy this cathedral is - thought I was in Europe for a moment! Take the time to just "be" in the space and experience the architecture and the windows. And then take some time to walk around to visit all the side chapels - most of which are identified for the particular saint that is "featured". Wasn't there at a time for Mass but would have loved to attend one with music - hopefully that would be as uplifting as the architecture. And there was a person near the entrance who was very helpful in answering some questions about the space.

Beautiful Renovation. I Remember visiting St. Patrick's in the early 2000s. The dark cavernous inside was uncomfortable and brought thoughts of what could be lurking in the great dark depths.WOW, what a change!! I had no idea what a difference sandblasting could do to reveal the light underneath the darkness! Someone once told me when you walk into a church your spirit should be lifted up-Mine certainly was! Great work to all those who helped with the renovation! Beautiful!

A beautiful architectural attraction.. St. Patrick's was an attraction that I had missed in previous visits to NYC. I am so glad that I had the chance to experience the Cathedral on this trip. It is so beautiful inside and out. There are so many locations within the Cathedral for capturing beautiful photos. I love that the opportunity is there to light a candle and say a prayer for someone I miss in my life. No one should miss visiting St. Patrick's!
Spiritual experience. It was nice to experience Mass in St Patricks Cathedral while in New York. Very different to home. There were very many denominations attending, all made very welcome

Inspirational. Ended up here the week after the pope's visit. Catholic so went to services. Thought staff did a nice job balancing tourists and worshipers. Beautiful architecture. Displayed in such a way as to maintain its spiritual character. Hopefully we can all be inspired, whether Catholic or not, to do just a little more to take care of each other and resist the pull to do otherwise.
Peaceful. I walked by this cathedral and stopped in randomly. It was gorgeous and I am so glad that I stopped in.
Beautiful Cathedral. Open to the public, and mass schedule available. Simply beautiful and peaceful. Stop in if walking by.
Beautiful Cathedral. This church is beautiful, historic and very accessible. Even if you are not a catholic, this is a must see NY attraction.

Beautiful church. We werent planning on visiting the church,but walked by at the conclusion of a major event. It is free to the public and is worth a short visit. It is a beautiful piece of architecture
Sublime. Beautiful church. Every nook had something different and beautiful. I love the Gothic look of the outside. Inside they were finishing up a mass and we got to join in a little.

Wow!. Went in to light a candle for my mum at St Anthony's alter - a tradition passed on through the family. Mass taking place so did not want to intrude on people's prayers so did not stay for long once I had completed my quest - but so nice to be allowed in during a service as a lot of churches visitors are turned away unless attending the mass.
WOW. Amazing church, beautiful to visit and experience. Mass open to public. No fee, but donation requested.
beautiful architecture. Wow. The architecture is beautiful. .The front altar, is so detailed, picture worthy. A place to sit and reflect.
Charming Church on 5t AVE. I really love this church. Beautiful gothic style. I Felt calm and peace when I stepped in.Easy to go coz it located on 5th ave,
Calm and serene. It is so peaceful to be at this Cathedral. Such a calm, quiet and peaceful place despite being on the 5th avenue. The interiors are beautiful and the glass paintings are so gorgeous.
Incredible. Definitely a building to add to your fifth avenue itinerary. The size, scale, and detail of the architecture is not to be missed.

Incredibly Beautiful!. The mass was wonderful, but had a hard time not letting my eyes wander around this magnificent place of worship! This cathedral is absolutely amazing! Every time I visit NYC I try to attend mass here!
Simply Beautiful. A very idyllic and beautiful cathedral in the middle of a busy busy city. Take 5 minutes out to sit and observe, light a candle and reflect, The glass worki s stunning.
Really impressive cathedral. Nice to see the cathedral after all the renovations. Lovely building and worth a visit even if it is just to escape from the hustle of Fifth Avenue
A spectacular Catheral in the centre of NYC. Passing by St Patricks is almost impossible without dropping in to see the wonderful interior of this Cathedral. Go see it for yourselves.
Beautiful and peaceful must see in NY. A busy destination crowded with people around the world especially during the time we were there. But such peace in this gorgeous space.
New York History. Sparkling white and gold - the New World trying to outdo the Old. The building reeks of Irish Catholic immigrants and Celtic Cardinals - look on the floor to see their memorials.

Beautiful architecture. Whether you're Catholic or not, you should check out this beautiful landmark. The architecture is absolutely magnificent. No one will interfere with your picture taking. Just remember to be respectful of those praying!

Breathtaking Cathedral and Landmark!. My wife and I stop in to St. Pats very time we are in NYC. It has just gone under a $177 million renovation and it is gleaming like never before! We were actually able to attend a a Sunday morning mass with Fr. Cardinal Dolan. Magic!

Beautiful place, beautiful Mass. Got up early and went to 8:00 am Mass. So worth it!!! The church is beautiful, the priest was kind. Afterwards, we walked around the church, and looked at the amazing details of the church. So wonderful to start your day in such a peaceful place.

Beautiful. Our first time into the Cathedral and it is just as beautiful inside as outside now the renovations have all completed at the front it is much more welcoming. We were visiting while a service started Nd were still able to walk through and take pictures
Beautiful. This is one of the most beautiful cathedrals I've ever seen. Definetly worth the time for the visit.

Impressive landmark!. Everyone should go inside this gorgeous building! A service was taking place when we went in, but everyone was respectful and we were welcome to stand in the back (or enter and sit). We did not have to wait to take our photos. Really nice experience!

The most beautiful place Ive ever visited. This cathedral is the most beautiful chapel I have ever been in. We went to mass and the service was great. There is lots to see and a small gift shop too. This is a hidden gem in the middle of a busy street you must visit if you are in New York
Majestic. This is a truly majestic building in the heart of the city. It offers an opportunity for a moment of quiet reflection in the bustling world of Manhattan.

Impressive renovations. Saw it completely renovated on Columbus Day. Its lights and charm are truly beautiful. The location makes it easy to visit it and still have time to show tourist friends all the nearby attractions.

If you have never seen a European Cathedral or Basilica.... All of the old Roman Catholic churches back East are marvels of architecture as they are made of real materials such as stone, marble, real wood, and have towering steeples. When one steps into an old Catholic Church in New England or the Northeast, one feels that one is in Europe in comparison to the "barns" that they call "churches" in CA (Yes, there are some exceptions, but overall, CA churches do not have the grandeur one would expect). That said, St. Patrick's Cathedral is larger than your typical, huge New England church, so the immensity is what is jaw-dropping about it. If you have never seen a New England or European church, cathedral, or basilica, by all means check out St. Patrick's Cathedral while in NYC.

A Stunning Cathedral. I expected this cathedral to be quite large but it was even bigger than anticipated. The stained glass windows are fantastic as are most of the side chapels - really worth a visit.

Heavenly. Another one to add to your list when visiting or frankly, living in NYC. Most tourists will traverse down 5th avenue at some point and while you are at Rockefeller center gawking at things, head across the street and add some substance to your trip.Another great story to tell your friends for years.

Beautiful but crowded. If you are a very centered person, able to worship and pray regardless of distraction, consider St. Patrick's a cathedral in every sense of the word. Otherwise, come and bring your camera, iphone, whatever, and take photos with everyone else! St. Patrick's is to us New Yorkers, what Notre Dame is to Parisians, a beautiful church of grandiose architecture. Worth a visit, but you wouldn't want to pray there...or you might, but may not.

Elegant church, really characteristic. An impressive church, even if when I travel usually I don'l like going into churches.I've seen it so many times on tv shows, it was a pleasure seeing it for real

Beautiful. We stopped to view and rest after a busy day. We were stunned by the gorgeous architecture! Once inside we were pleasantly surprised to have a choir performance. In the midst of the chaos of outside, it was a wonderful place to visit to rest, pause and reflect.

Beautiful.. We love visiting churches and cathedral while traveling. They are truly works of art. St. Patrick's is no exception. Sited between the skyscrapers, outside of Rome St. Patrick's equals any of the great cathedrals of Europe. An interesting fact, the stained glassed Windows originally purchased for the cathedral were deemed too small and unimpressive when they arrived in NYC. Not being able to return them, Fordham University took possession of them and built the University's church around the Windows.

A historic icon.... Whether you are religious, catholic or not, this attraction is quite soothing. The outdoor architecture is pretty amazing. The indoor experience is really immense. The usual is going on, praying and reflecting, unless of course there is a service going on.They also have candles that you can buy to make donations. If you are in the area, I have to say, quickly peek in at the minimum. I think you'll be pleased...

Nicely refurbished. St Patrick's is always a beautiful stop and the recent renovations and cleaning of the limestone turned out beautifully. It is a lovely church, you can wander in and light a candle or take a guided tour. A NYC must see.

Awesome and inspiring. Pope Franics was just here and the cathedral is gorgeous! I guess that it was cleaned inside and out and it was very beautiful. Having just been in Italy and seeing all of the famous cathedrals in that country, I was startled by how beautiful this church is. I have been to NYC many times and I have been into the church before, but this time it was quite extraordinary. It is a must-see landmark.
Love this place!!. We missed the 5:30 mass on Saturday, but the priest there gave my husband and I a special blessing for our 10th anniversary. We lit some candles as we'll.

Architecture that inspires contemplation. I love St. Patrick's. I visit it every time that I come to NYC. This inspiring building with altars devoted to the many saints in the Catholic Church reminds me of what is truly important in life.

Quiet spot in the midst of chaos. The Cathedral is well worth a visit, especially now that repairs and restoration has been done.
