Centrally located, it is just across the street from the Rockefeller Centre. After a busy day of shopping or visiting attractions or walking on noisy bustling streets, it is the perfect place to come to experience the quiet and spiritual side of things.

Beautiful church...acoustics left a lot to be desired. We attended the Cardinal's mass on All Saints Day (1 Nov.) The mass was a High mass with no fewer than 6 priests...no Cardinal despite the title designated. The cathedral is magnificent but, typical of many Gothic styled places of worship, the visual is much netter than the spoken word...sounds as if one is in an echo chamber. I could make out most of the homily and we did have communion. All in all, a memorable experience, if not the most spiritual.

Stop in but be Respectful. Very beautiful inside and out. You can spend as much or as little time as you want but it would be hard to do it justice in less than 45 min. Just an observation. It is fine to walk and look around but remember this is a Church! Be respectful to those that are there to worship.
Awesome and Beautiful. Even before went inside, we were in awe. After gong in, the church was overwhelming. The beauty of the architecture was amazing.

Great architecture, and a true landmark in New York City!. Attended Sunday mass for our 2nd wedding anniversary. Loved the various shrines within the church, and really enjoyed the experience, as tourists and as members of the Catholic faith. Having chosen seats up front, unbeknownst to us, I was honored by being asked to help during the mass as an usher during the offering and collection part. What a blessing on my anniversary! We live across the river in Jersey City, NJ, and will definitely go there to attend mass again!
Beautiful. If you have a half hour to spare it's well worth visiting St Patrick's .Its a beautiful building ,we went on a Sunday and we stayed for mass which was lovely.

But It is Made with Structural Steel. Just cleaned up to host the Pope so now is prime for a vist. Walk around the building from the outside to see the great masonary works. Enjoy religious art inside as well as decorative religious objects, Interesting side chapels. Ceiling soars.

Nothing Like It. Every tourist visiting the city must stop here. Was beautiful in all it's glory on our recent NYC trip... amazing setting, this amazing structure smack in the middle of NYC. Amazing to visit.

Stunning. Stumbled in here to get out of the rain. Well the Lord did guide us into a stunning place of worship. I am not Catholic but I did find the Cathedral to be nothing short of stunning. If you are not interested in religion I advise you to go to appreciate the architecture. A highlight to my rainy Friday.
Gorgeous!. This is a must see. So incredibly beautiful and rich with history. They did an amazing job with the restoration.

Beautiful. Being raised Catholic St Pat's has special meaning. Just wondered in one evening and was awed. A beautiful church. Surprised at the number of chapels. If you can, go to 10:30 Mass with organ and choir.

An oasis of calm. Right in the middle of the sky scrapers of Madison Ave is this fabulous church. So clean inside and out, great things to see inside and other than a discretionary donation its FREE. Don't need long to look around but well worth half an hour away from the shops and sights. Good for your soul.
Beautiful Interior. The newly completed refurbishing of St Patrick's is worth spending a little to checkout. They have done a wonderful job.

In All It's Glory. We visited St Patrick's a year ago when part of the Exterior and large sections of the Interior were scaffolded. We were keen to revisit and our expectations were not disappointed. What a transformation, now you can truly appreciate the beauty of the architecture and setting. An inspiring visit that should not be missed.

Very nicely restored. As many others have said its well worth the visit. The restoration is excellent bringing the Cathedral back to its old splendour. Wonderful to know its still a fully functioning church. When we were there we saw a baptism and a mass all in the side chapels.

Beautiful cathedral. If you're in the area, pop in to see this wonderful church. Beautiful stained glass, amazing architecture. You can attend mass, light candles or just sit and quietly observe. Centrally located on 5th Avenue.

Beautiful - Very Welcoming. Even if you only spend a few minutes in this Cathedral you'll be glad you did. We sat down in here for a short time and it was just lovely watching around us. It's a very welcoming place in such a busy busy city.

Collision of Art and Religion. Definitely an iconic site to visit, whether you are Catholic/Christian or not. The architecture, stained glass, and the individual niches make this a "have to visit" site in NYC.
Beautiful stain glass!. I highly suggest a visit to St. Patrick's Cathedral - walk in the doors and look up as the ceilings and stain glass are exquisite!
Glorious. Newly cleaned and simply breath taking. Exquisite arches and solemn silences. Just sit and breathe it in.

Worth a look indeed. You'll most probably be walking around NY anyway, so put this on the list of things to see. It's not that far from the city centre so take the time to visit it. It really is an amazing building.

A very nice place for sunday mass.... I recommend attending an early Sunday morning mass. It's so quiet and peaceful in the usual busy are of NYC.
...just be aware that they collect money twice during the mass...

Gothic extreme!. This is the best example of Gothic church architecture in the U.S. It is enormous and the light thru the windows stunning. So many historic funerals have been here, and I have seen the outside on TV but being inside is wonderful. Don't miss it if you are near here.
Worth a visit. The renovations and the removal of the scaffolding means that the cathedral is once again a stunning example of church architecture.
Beautiful house of God.... This is a beautiful church and excellent example of Neo-Gothic architecture (if you've been to Notre Dame in Paris this will look very familiar).
Excellent. Truly magnificent cathedral, such a relief that this visit all the scaffolding was removed which obscured our view last time we were here.

A Must See. Recently totally renovated and brought to its ultimate splendor.
No trip is complete without a visit to St. Patrick's Cathedral.
The craftsmanship is outstanding.
Magnificent. I am not Catholic or even a practicing Christian but I went with a Catholic friend. What a fantastic experience

gorgeous church. I visit this church nearly every time I visit NYC. It is beautiful and peaceful. It is situated right near central park so offers a lovely walk through NYC. Everyone should see this church at least once.

Indredibly Beautiful, Make time to walk through and stay for Mass. I never get tired of visiting St. Patrick's Cathedral. Even if you're not Catholic, you'll enjoy the beauty and architecture of this building. For Catholics, it's a rich collection of every chapel imaginable and a wide range of places to spend quite time in prayer and meditation. I highly recommend making time to walk through the Cathedral, then make time to come back for a Mass.

Beautiful but sad. It is a beautiful cathedral but it is sad to see so many lost people walking through it. Jesus has come to save us, we can Pray to Him. We don"t need Mary or the other saints. They can"t forgive us our sins and save us only Jesus can
Wow wow wow . This is beautiful inside and out. We stayed for full mass. What a extraordinary experience. The architecture is amazing !

St Patrick's Cathedral. If you walk along 5th Avenue, you just must pop in.I went for a mass and really enjoyed it. It may not be everybody's cup of tea but I liked the architecture of the building and the service was friendly and enjoyable.
Breathtaking. This is a beautiful piece of architecture - takes your breath away to see the stained glass windows, the arches, the altar...absolutely everything. Shouldn't be missed!

Beautiful Cathedral!. A busy church. A lot of believers and non believers inside and out of the stunning church even in the mid afternoon. Would be nice to visit to see the structure even if you are a non believer.
Stunning. Beautiful Cathedral well worth a visit. Not particularly quiet due to renovation work on the streets outside but you could still lose yourself in thought/prayer. Stunning glass windows.
Spectacular. A truly spectacular house of worship. After the restoration and cleaning, it's really even more impressive, just stunning!
Beautiful!. A stunning building - everyone should visit here and appreciate it, religious or not..... The stained glass windows are like jewels and the colours they cast in the sunlight is exquisite.

Beautiful building, but incredibly noisy. I visit a lot of cathedrals when I'm on my travels, and was very much looking forward to this iconic example. There's no doubting it's incredibly beautiful and impressive, but it was somewhat ruined by the noise. Most places you go, even when there are lots of people around, they seem to respect the sanctity of these places and keep the noise to a minimum. Not here - there was restoration work going on which made noise, and so did the tourists. There was also someone playing on the organ... and I don't think it was a professional. It sounded more like someone messing around!Could be me being picky, but the racket ruined the experience for me. Cathedrals should be places of peace and quiet - I can't think how the people feel that actually worship there. I should think they need earplugs.
Beautiful. St Patrick's is such a beautiful Church to see. Just seeing the old building, so much history. There renovations and cleaning, it just sparkles. Love seeing it, and there is always a mass.

Impressive American Cathedral. Visiting St. Patrick's is a must if you are in NYC. This is by far the largest Catholic Church I've ever been in and it is beautiful. It is like something taken out of the middle ages and dropped in NYC. No matter what your religion might be, this structure is a must see.

Beautiful. Visiting St. Patricks Cathedral in the middle of a busy city is a must do. We stopped in to light a candle and say prayers for a football player in critical condition, Baylor Bramble of Seigel High School in TN.
Amazing Cathedral!. I visit this beautiful Cathedral in New York City. Its Beautiful from the outside and inside . The Pope was here days after I visit. You can not miss this .
A beautiful church in the middle of the city. Open 24 hours.. this place should really be checked out. it is huge and beautiful and architecturally significant.
Visiting. The architecture of this Cathedral is absolutely beautiful. A must see while visiting New York City. Cathedral has been completely refurbished inside and out. A photo opt.
St. Patrick's Cathedral!. This is a very moving church and the care that has been taken to keep it a beautiful place to worship and visit. A must see in NYC!
Great building. This great iconic New York building has been cleaned up spectacularly since my last visit. Great architecture. A must see. It is a haven of peace in the heart of the City

Must See!. The catherdral is absolutely gorgeous...we were able to walk in during Friday mid-day mass -- the music as beautiful. It was so wonderful to see so many people paying their respects as well as worshiping during the middle of the day when busy life continues outside the doors!

St Patrick's Cathedral restored for Pope Francis' Visit. Went to to see St Patrick's Cathedral, 5th Avenue, Manhattan, NYC once again, but this time was fortunate to see it in its fully restored glory, ready for Pope Francis' visit three days later. The cathedral was fully illuminated and the marble at its whitest and brightest! When I saw it earlier, it was not so bright and dazzling. The reliefs on the walls stood out so well. The choir was rehearsing for the Popes visit and the sound of its great gallery organ & the singing voices was ethereal! The glass windows were fresh & glowing with brilliance & the colours were almost startling. The stone on the exterior was cleaned to perfection and the great bronze door on the west at 5th Avenue shone like gold!The Cathedral was superb and in all its glory to welcome the Pope. A colossal amount however, was to be spent for its restoration 177 million USD!

A must see. Whether you are catholic, religious or not, when visiting the big apple, be sure to stop by the cathedral, such history and beauty, don't be surprised if it is still under construction, it is worth the stop.

Recently renovated and reopened cathedral near the Rockerfeller Centre. This cathedral was closed for renovation when we were last in New York, but has reopened since the Pope's visit earlier this year. It is a really spectacular building, very traditional and very different to all other buildings nearby. The stained glass is gorgeous, and very impressive. It's not as old as it looks though!

Stunning. Stopped here while visiting the area. This is a beautiful cathedral we were told about the recent cleaning and restoration done here and the high price tag to clean it up. It is diffently worth the effort. A building of this beauty needs to be seen and admired

A beautiful place of worship. Once the tallest building in New York City. Amazing architecture - don't leave New York without seing St Patrick's or without attending a service, whatever your religion.

Restorations are finished, St. Patrick's is all spruced up and lovely to see now. St. Patrick (free entry) is a Neo-gothic style building in the heart of NYC. Built between 1858-1879, it is considered one of the most beautiful cathedrals in the United States. Until recently St. Patrick's has been under restorations preventing ideal viewing its interior. We were pleased to discover that these works were finished prior to our recent visit, allowing us full and unobscured sightseeing inside St. Patricks. Within you find lovely side aisle chapels with attractive altars which are very attractive to see. Particularly nice things to see inside include a Pieta sculpture by William O. Partidige (1906), the Stations of the Cross carving (1893), Other nice things to see include the Rose Window above the Great Bronze Door, which is better viewed from the outside of the cathedral, where you can see the Saints which are inset into the door. We also enjoy the two exterior spires and the classic Gothic aspects of both the inside and outside of St. Patrick's. In the end, St. Patrick's makes for a nice cathedral visit for anyone who enjoys Gothic or Neo-Gothic architecture and it can be conveniently added to your sightseeing due to its good location in Upper Midtown. Note: Mass is held quite a few times through the day for anyone interested in attending a service. You can find the schedule on the St. Patrick website. Note: If you enjoy church visits, you can also visit the nearby St. Thomas Church just two blocks away, up 5th Avenue. There is an incredible carved screen behind the main alter that is worth making time to see here.

So good I went back twice. If you like religious buildings then this will not disappoint. It is beautiful both inside and out. On our first visit there was a service taking place but visitors were still welcomed in to be a part or to simply observe. I would say this was 1 of my favourite places to visit in New York.

St Patrick's Cathedral. Beautiful Gothic style church. We went to mass at 8am (no music) and we were out in about 45 minutes. If you're not attending mass, it's worth the peek in the door and look around at the marvelous site.
excellent. great place to visit soak up the atmosphere , very historical a must visit for all - easy to get to - something different
Nice restoration. We stopped by to check out the refebushed St. Patrick's Cathedral that was completed before the Pope's recent visit. The stained glass windows were cleaned up and beautiful.

Gorgeous place to visit. The way this place sticks out architecturally on 5th avenue is beautiful and so unusual. If you are all shopped out and in the area, I would definitely recommend taking a look. Even if you aren't religious it's remarkable to look at the detail and beauty in such a place. As a bonus, the Pope recently visited so the whole place has been cleaned!It's a great place to clear your head and simply admire. A perfect sight to see if you're in the area. And if you're in a group and splitting up, make it a meeting point as you literally can't miss it. Our teacher on our school trip told us to meet there without even showing us where it was and we found it with no issues.As a tip- you have your bag searched and I don't think you can take food or any drink but water in.

Iconic Cathedral. Please visit this perfect place. Its an Iconic Landmark you'll recognise from many films. Against the back drop of 5th avenue shops and sky scraper s its look tiny but once inside the vaulted ceilings really are a stairway to heaven.
Incredible. This is such a cool building, and you just have to go in and see it. It is huge and stately. A must see.

Amazing architecture. I didn't think much of it before, but now that I have been...I'm so glad I did so! It was a lot better than I thought it would be. I was bored and was just passing by so I made a impulsive decision to just go in. It's stunning on the inside and outside. Too bad I can't say the same about my ex....
Beautiful Chapel. We went in to get a Stamp for our National Parks Passport book but they don't do that however if was very cool to see the spiral pedestal and the architecture of the building!

Beautiful catholic cathedral. We stoppped at this cathedral once shopping on Fifth avenue and we did not regret it at all. The building is beautiful and recently renewed so clean and white. The interior is gorgeous with a few decorated altars and marvellous blue stained glass. Do not miss this huge cathedral if you pass by and its main shop in the street.
Breathtaking. The pure beauty and detailed architecture of this Cathedral is humbling. This is a must see! I found myself awe looking around.
Breathtaking . Beautiful and stunning on both the inside and out. The largest cathedral in the United States. Definitely stop by and soak in the beauty and serenity.

Visiting the OZ of Churches. Unbelievably beautiful. The new restoration has made this jewel of Manhattan glimmer again. The years of dirt have all been wiped away, thank to the visiting POPE. A Must see!!!

Beautiful Cathedral. My husband is Catholic, so I thought it would be nice to show him St. Patricks, and that all wonderful cathedrals are not always located in Europe. We spent about an hour walking around, just looking at the impressive architecture, the stained glass, etc. It's a beautiful cathedral. We lite a candle for a recently deceased relative, and spent some time in quiet contemplation in the pews. A lovely spot, just steps from Rockefeller Center.
Wrong time to visit. Arrived just in time for mass to begin .vast space but did not like to look around when people worshipping

Beautiful. One of the finest cathedrals in the world. The renovation is complete and is awesome. You do not need to be a member of the faithful to enjoy the architecture. Light a candle , say a prayer and enjoy the beauty.

Beautiful. The cathedral is beautiful, i was there when they were still doing some renovations, so I didn't get to appreciate the whole thing at it's best, but overall if you are a fan of Gothic architecture, i am sure you will like St. Patrick's.
Gorgeous architecture. This is a phenomenal ornate piece of architecture with it's tall spires and, arches and vaulted ceilings. A must see if on a walking tour of 5th Ave.

Beautiful Cathedral. I am Christian by faith and this is a beautiful monument to our God whether you are Catholic or not (I'm not). The windows are gorgeous and the stonework is grand. I loved having the opportunity to pray here. It is distracting to have so many people walking around taking flash photos. It would be nice to go for a worship service without that distraction...no photos allowed then.
A beautiful Cathedral and it is NOT in Europe !!. St. Patrick's Cathedral is the center of the Catholic community in NYC. Whatever your religion, you will enjoy the splendor of this house of worship.

Inspiring. I attended Mass at St. Patrick's. Beautiful church. 9 am Mass was well attended. If one wants to avoid crowds, 8 am Mass would be better. Organ was awesome. The sound system was not great from the lectern used to preach. It was better at the lectern used to pray. I recommend sitting near the front. At the mass I attended, the responses were in Latin.
Beautiful building outside and inside. This is well worth a visit. The sanctuary is stunning and there are several side altars - all of them beautiful.There is also a little shop.
Beautiful. Beautiful,stunning, amazing,peaceful too many word to describe this cathedral. The stained glass windows were breathtaking. Really worth a visit.

Feel at Peace. When you are too busy or too stress, don t seat along 51-52nd on 6th avenue , just spend a few minutes in St Patrick, you will feel very light and relax, you dont have to pray or anything, just enter and feel the 'Great Chi inside

Beautiful. It was so nice to see the Cathedral finally free from all the scaffolding. Absolutely beautiful and very peaceful to Wal around and admire the alters to the various saints. An added bonus was the number of masses said through the day, with music for the midday mass

Stunning after the remodeling and cleaning. No matter what faith you are, this cathedral should be seen. The outside and inside have been completely cleaned and restored and the effect is outstanding. One is allowed to tour the church unless there are services there. Make sure to see the small alcoves with statues of the saints; all are beautiful. Give yourself time to sit quietly and absorb the atmosphere.
A place of calm on 5th Avenue. St Patrick's has recently been refurbished and it is well worth a visit to this beautiful Cathedral. An oasis of calm in the midst of the busy shops on 5th Avenue.

will and janice new york jube 2015. beautiful cathedral although some renovation work going on.a bit too commercialinside for our liking souvenirs,coin machines etc ,quite overcrowded as well seemed quite disorganised people everywhere going in different directions.certainly worth a visit.
Gorgeous Cathedral. The cathedral is beautiful and awe-inspiring. It was thrilling to walk where two Popes have walked. The statues are unique.

Sunday Mass. We came early for 9 a. m. Mass and were able to walk around the perimeter to see all the small chapels designated to individual saints... the new lighting is bright and enables one to see the expansive space. the Piate copy is inspiring and following the path that the Pope walked is invigorating. all of The artwork is inspiring and beautiful. hearing the organ play during Mass was uplifting and the whole experience is very spiritual.
Incredible. Was blown away by this beautiful place. It is absolutely massive. Would have loved to have come for mass on Sunday. Just amazing architecture.

Amazing Bigg Church. We were inside the Church for a little time.It was great to See the beautiful ceiling above youre head.There are old pews where You can have a seat for as long as You like.And You can burn a candle for 2 dollar.
Beautiful cathedral in NYC. Everyone has heard of St. Patrick's Cathedral, but take time to stop and go inside and have a few quiet moments in your busy day.

St Patrick's Cathedral. My Bride to be and I visited here the day before our wedding. lovely Cathedral left us feeling tranquil. Was in the middle of the renovations for the Popes Visit , wonderful place to visit.

Rest for the weary ....... The entry was crowded, the guards were busy and the candles were burning. The Mass was about to begin as I slid into a pew by myself and focused on the altar. The music was soothing and I instantly felt relief from my morning travels on a busy train. I was here to catch my breath with a sign of relief and to rest my weary suitcase laden body and I did. If nothing else, St. Patrick's Cathedral is a much needed oasis in this city. I am so glad I took a few moments to experience this quiet and peace. My tired body and my thirsty soul says thank you.

Stunning!. Do not ever remember seeing St. Patrick"s without the huge scaffolding. it was gorgeous then- and even better now. Thrilled that the Pope came to NY- sure that trip hastened the work being finished. This is a must visit in NYC.

Amazing church. It was wonderful to see the church without all of the scoffolding inside! I had visited two years ago and was not able to appreciate the true brilliance of the building. It is a beautiful building inside. Amazing stain glass windows, magnificent Mabel columns, floors etc. It is a peaceful, restful place in the middle of a huge city. So glad I was able to see all of its beauty.
A little gem. Tranquility in the middle of a busy city, we lit a candle for my partners dead mother : ) not very religious so don't know what else to say.
Amazing---Must see!!!. Our first time back for Sunday Mass after the restoration. Beautiful!!! Reminds me alot of Notre Dame in Paris. The side altars are works of art. #1 to do in NYC!!!
St. Patrick's Cathedral outstanding. St. Patrick's Cathedral very beautiful place to pray this is another must place to visit on your list
Stunning cathedral. Fantastic building in Fith avenue which must be visited it is stunning inside and is a reminder of all the movies you will ha e seen.

Stunning building amongst the skyscrapers. This is a must see. After the brash and sleek of most of Manhattan, this is, despite being a popular destination, an oasis of peace. Yes it does get crowded, and while we were there, there was a huge renovation project ongoing, but this could not detract from the amazing architecture. Plus there was a sermon taking place which added to the whole experience.

Great!. We visited while Pope Francis was in town although we did not get to see him. The place is beautiful and newly refurbished. The staff was very helpful and informative. A definite must see when in NYC

Beauty Beyond Compare!. We visited the cathedral and were so impressed with its beauty. There was a service in process so we were able to hear the organ which was magnificent. This cathedral is as fabulous as the ones in Europe, and we were thrilled to visit. You can walk there from theTimes Square area. It is very close to Rockefeller Center.

Quiet and Peaceful spiritual retreat from busy city outside. St Patricks cathedral is one of the most beautiful places in the city. It is a peaceful and spiritual retreat from the busy city outside. Its lovely to see the respect that people have for the cathedral as they are quiet when inside its door. We went to visit one morning and entered through the side door, we immediately saw a mass going on and after a second realised it was a funeral mass. Tourists were still going into the side and were being respectful, lighting candles etc. but we decided to turn around and revisit later in the day, as I believe that as funeral should have some dignity. When we returned later we lit our candles for our departed relatives who we remember when we are away from home $2 donation each candle. And we looked at the splendour of the cathedrals stained glass windows etc. The outside of the cathedral is also stunning and has just finished being cleaned from top to bottom, so the stonework is now and pale shade of grey, not the dark dirty shade we had seen a few years previously. Even if you are not catholic, St Patricks is a stunning place to visit.
you must see it. You must to see it. It is really heart of N Y, or soul. Close to 5 avenue ,Rockefeller center, Public library.

An awe-inspiring structure. St. Patrick's Cathedral has all of the elements of any classical cathedral in Europe, but is so much newer and brighter that you get a sense of what those European cathedrals must have looked like in their prime.If you are an architecture aficionado, you will love the elements of this structure; if you are a person of faith, you will be inspired by beauty of sanctuary; if you are a history buff, you will see the location of Robert F. Kennedy's funeral in 1968. There are many reasons to visit St. Patrick's Cathedral, so make sure you add this to your list for New York City.
Spirit needs also its location. Visiting the cathedral is kind of diruption as it takes you in a different world where peace is all , nothing else. Beautifull monument as well.

Beautiful. We stumbled along St Pat's and decided to check it out. It's so enormous that tourists at the back are moving around taking it all in that you don't notice that at the altar the priest is presiding over Mass. So beautiful and solemn and it was lovely to be able to stay for the remainder of the mass. I was overwhelmed remembering watching the RFK funeral coverage as a child and mentioned it to my husband. He chuckled and said he was remembering that Vince Lombardi was buried out of there !
Mass. We attended the 5:30 Sat. evening Mass there, and thought it was beautiful. I have been in 1996 also

A lovely cathedral. St Patricks is a lovely cathedral and a peaceful place to visit and instantly get away from the hustle and bustle of Fifth avenue. Although thousands of people are always going in and out, they retain a respectful quietness which is nice in this day and age. During our visit a mass was about to start so we attended this and very much appreciated the visiting publics respect. The mass carried on just like any other one I've attended and we left feeling very relaxed and uplifted. Just what we needed after all the stress of the city. Very much recommended.

Iconic cathedral. Lucky enought to be in NYC just weeks after the Pope had visited so St Patricks was still pristine after being scrubbed from top to bottom. Was amazed to find we were allowed entrance on a sunday morning whilst there was a service on which made the visit even more memorable

Stunningly Beautiful. One of the most beautiful Cathedrals I have seen. The cornerstone laid in 1858 and doors opened in 1879. Spectacular architecture and design. Check out their concert series and gift shop while you are there.

Stunningly Beautiful. One of the most beautiful Cathedrals I have seen. The cornerstone laid in 1858 and doors opened in 1879. Spectacular architecture and design. Check out their concert series and gift shop while you are there.

Amazing site. The 23 years I lived in NYC I never went inside the building. We were getting ready to view the Columbus day parade and decided to go in. It is a colossal church. There is so much to see here. Fortunately for us there was a nun giving a tour to what I assumed were catholic school children. She pointed out the different saint areas behind where the priest gives the mass. and some interesting carvings on the ceiling. The stained glass tiffany windows are incredible.

Amazing!. We happened to hear the pipe organ as we walked down Madison Ave and went inside to find a Latin mass happening. We were blessed with beautiful music and breath taking moments of wonder at the sanctuary.

Must see . This church is gorgeous! The architecture is simply the best. You will want to take your time walking through and enjoying the stained glass and statues. A calm sense overtakes the busy NYC atmosphere in this church.

Mass on St Patrick's day. Was in NYC from Ireland with a group from work for St Patrick's day so decided to go to mass on the morning of St Patrick's day. Beautiful cathedral and what an amazing experience, tarnished only by my buddy beside me who was a little bit under the weather from the brandy the night before, very gaseous! Would recommend a visit here.

Lovely place to visit. There's areas for all denominations, so worth a visit. It was being cleaned during my visit (in time for the Pope's arrival) but some screens explained the cleaning effort made, including before/after shots of some work being performed.
Trip 46. Must visit regardless of religion or faith. Very pretty and peaceful church. It is worth checking out.

Always Amazing No Matter What Religion You Are. The exterior renovations were completed just in time for the Pope's visit and this majestic cathedral once again shines in it's glory. Once inside, it's very welcoming and comforting. As this is a working Church there are regularly scheduled services and many time you might see some celebrities that live in the area attend mass. The elaborate architecture makes you wonder how this could have been built so long ago but, then again if you've seen some of the churches in Italy or England, you just take it for granted. A must see if you are visiting NYC.

A Work of Art!. I was absolutely blown away by the size and architectural beauty of this church. A definite must for any visitor - you will be amazed at the many statues, stained glass windows, and breathtaking beauty of this masterpiece!

Sunday mass. Sunday English was nice, given by a Bishop. About an hour long, watch out for communion as everyone rushes to the front as if they are going to run out of hosts. Other than that the service is very nice and recommend.
Historic NYC Cathedral. This is a must see stop for anyone visiting from out of town and also for someone who lives in the city.
Stunning. One of the most beautiful places I've ever visited. A very peaceful place to take a moment for yourself. The stained glass and architecture are magnificent.
a place to reflect. when you enter this holy place, you feel the serenity and the peace that overwhelms you sit down and just let the sounds and sights give you an inner peace
beautiful. The church was absolutely gorgeous inside and out. I could not stop taking pictures. You can really appreciate the beauty once inside.

Beautiful and moving experience!. My 12 year old daughter and I went to mass at St. Patricks just weeks after the Pope was there! such a wonderful experience. The church is so beautiful inside and out.

Beautiful church. I wandered in while a mass was taking place and they even encouraged you to take a photo! It was packed. Nice to light a candle and say a little prayer, taking time out to do it, in this busy city!

A must see in NYC. I am not catholic, nor necessarily religious, but the architecture for St Peter's, the statues, and the stain glass windows are beautiful. It gets very crowded and it is free to walk through.

Beautiful Church....Make Sure You Stop. If visiting the city, you should stop and see this beautiful historic church. It will be worth at least 30 minutes of your time. Located on 5th Avenue, it's in the middle of everything midtown.

Stunning cathedral - a mindful moment in the hectic city. Just across from the Rockefeller Centre, this stunning cathedral is a giant piece of quiet and full of statues, prayers and moments. Certainly worth the visit if your in the area.

Peaceful. There are many tourists but they stay respectful and make it easy to actually say a prayer. Afterwards, I can spend an hour just taking in the architecture. And now that the scaffolding is off and the outdoor has been cleaned its even more beautiful.

Breath taking!!!. I had heard so much about this place before I went there but it just can't be described in words. It actually took my breath away when I walked in there!! I am not an overly religious person ( I believe in God just don't go to church a lot) but this place just makes you feel amazing. It is so hard to put in words how beautiful and amazing this place is!! If you go to New York you have to go to St. Pats and just see for yourself how beautiful it is!!
Sunday mass. Beautiful Sunday mass experience. They try to accommodate a full church with screens everywhere. It was a wonderful mass and homily.

A Magnificent Cathedral. Set right near Rockefeller Centre - this is a beautiful, reflective place and even more exciting since the Pope's recent visit. Well worth a look if you love the history and splendour of New York City
A Treasure!. There's not much else to add other than to say, this church is a national treasure with incredible architecture and history. When your visiting NYC this is a must visit.
Renovation is complete. An iconic church that every visitor to New York should see.If you are Christian, that is an added bonus.We attended Sunday Mass, a very nice end to a beautiful weekend
A Must See.. This is a chapel which is a must see for any religion,The architecture is amazing inside and outside.Great visit.

Massive. It's massive, there videoscreens everywhere so everyone can follow the sermon. The whole sides are little altars for different saints. It has had a big renovation which shows. some thing are renovated in something new which takes away some of the authenticity feelings. Still it is free entry. So if you like churches and cathedrals you can't skip this one.
Absolutely Gorgeous. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a must see if you are visiting NYC. It is the most beautiful church in the US that I have ever been too. It is breathtaking!!!!

A New York must see. Pop in at any time of day and just sit back and rest your bones. It does not matter if you are religious or not, it is simply a stunning place to sit and watch the world go by, and have a moment to yourself.

Must see in NYC. How can you beat seeing one of the most beautiful Cathedrals in the country in NYC, and its free to see. Just got done with a multiyear renovation and it is spectacular. A must see when in NYC

Wow. If you like architecture, you need to visit. The stained glass and stone work are impressive. Last year, we wandered into Riverside Methodist church and were blown away. St Patrick's out distance Riverside

St. Patrick's cathedral. St. Patrick's cathedral is absolutely beautiful in Manhattan New York. 100 of people were visiting on a late Saturday evening. Most were in aw and enjoying the beauty of the numerous alters.

Dazzling Renovations!. This magnificent church has been cleaned; but that word does not do justice to the fact that it now bursts into brilliant prominence on Fifth Avenue like a jewel, The sprucing up has thrust into prominence many formerly hidden features and works of art that it as if a whole new edifice had been built, Amen!

Stunning Cathedral. We were in the city while the Pope was there and attended noon Mass at St. Patrick's the day after he had held Mass - it is huge and gorgeous. It's a must see whether you are or are not a religious person. Super easy to find!

History in the making. So many historic movies filed here, so many dignitaries visited here
so much emotion and beautiful architecture. A must see.
Stunning. a beautiful building, complete with stain glass windows and rose window. Having seen this church often on television, it was fulfilling to be in it in person.

Beautiful Cathedral. Myself & some friends from Hawaii had the chance to see the newly restored St. Patrick's Cathedral. I had been there many years ago and it was pretty much the same, just cleaner. I lit a candle in memory of my father; he was catholic. It was a nice experience if you are religious and even if you are not. the grand organ and beautiful stained glass windows are worth a look.
Breathtaking!!!!!. The newly renovated cathedral is a must see in NYC. It is stunningly beautiful! Don't miss the side alters and the beautiful artwork.

A haven amidst the bustle of NYC. On our recent visit to the city we chose to attend midday Mass At the Cathedral. The construction work around the site made it difficult to hear everything being said by the celebrant & the readers. Half an hour well spent!
Stunning Church. This is a stunning church ..... Absolutely beautiful and huge too. Was super busy when I visited . Right on the main road and easy to find too.
Magical. St Patrick's is an icon of the Big Apple! IT's impressive from the outside, but the space once you step through the doors is mind blowing. It's huge, beautiful and inspiring. Must visit!

Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful stained glass. The architecture is beautiful. Fairly good chance there will be some sort of service going on when you are there. A don't miss place for a quick stop. Across the street from Saks Fifth Ave. and close to Rockefeller center.

Beautiful Calm Worth a stop. beautiful church worth a stop,lite candle for my fatherwho passed awat in april 2015 he lived in New York a few years when he left Italybefore coming to Montreal, had many stories about this city,I would try to assist a mass next time I an in NYC.

It was lovely!. We saw a wedding, in progress while we were visiting the cathedral. The cathedral
Itself was huge and lovely. Glad we stopped in, for a quick visit.

See the stunning ST Patricks cathedral across from Atlas at Rockefeller square. St Patricks ... they dont build churches like this anymore! a grand cathedral of the scale you rarely see. Well worth a drop by and feel the presence.
2015. A beautiful cathedral with fantastic stained glass windows, a must in NYC and if you are at mass, the choir is like hearing angels, even if you are not Catholic.

sightseeing. this church was so amazing, a must see...and the Pope was going there a few days after we were there how funny is that...we went to NY too see all the sites, we enjoyed each and everyone of them, there are lots of restaurants everywhere we went , however hard for my daughter to really fine Vegetarian... lots of shops to go to , something on every corner

Awesome. I have visited the church many times and every time I am in awed of the architectural details. The stain glass windows are superb. Don't forget to look up. The arches in the ceiling are a wonders
A must see. One of the biggest churches in the city, it's worth visiting if you are in the 5th avenue. Not much to see inside.

Breathtaking. The outside and inside are breathtakingly beautiful. I'm not sure I like the "touristy" nature of it..when you went in the church there were people all around taking pictures and buying candles. I guess that's going to happen at an "attraction " but it seemed a little odd.

Just beautiful...... St. Patrick's Cathedral is absolutely, breathtakingly beautiful! It will take your breath away. If you have a chance to stop in and are lucky enough to attend a mass there, you will be in awe of the church's beauty. The history behind the cathedral is interesting. Google it before you go and don't forget to bring your camera so that you can photograph it's beauty and remember it forever. During his recent visit, Pope Francis visited the cathedral.

Beautiful Building!!. After seeing the Pope's visit to this Cathedral, I wanted to see it. It just under went a massive remodel. Absolutely beautiful building with amazing stained glass windows. And I am not at all religious, but I could appreciate the building.

Beautiful and Serene... No more words needed even if one is not a Catholic...It is not only impressive and beautiful inside, but since its outer walls had been cleaned one can appreciate the great architectural design from the outside as well.
Just Beautiful. This was one of my highlights of NY. It was breath taking. A must when visiting. So much to see and read

Wonderful, bright a peaceful place. Wonderful cathedral, bright, warm, spacious. A must see. While bags are not allowed and must be locked, the opportunity to find peace, privacy and still take pictures when strolling around is given.

another great attraction. Passed this Cathedral not knowing it was there and just had to go in. What a magnificent piece of architecture with wonderful stained glass work. You cant help but to be impressed by this incredible building.

Beautiful place. Not having been in very many cathedrals, this one is stunning in size and detail, both outside and inside. We went in during mass and walked all the way around inside while the organ played and people sang. It is a very beautiful place to visit.

Beautiful Cathedral. The Cathedral looks spectacular since the restoration. Television views while the Pope held Vespers there did not do it justice. Everyone should visit this Cathedral and sit and enjoy the feelings of peace and serenity despite the crowds.

Looks brand new. Amazing restoration, almost finished except for one section mid ways down on the right. If you are going there for a mass, seat near the front. They let tourists move around sides of church and at the back and it can be distracting.

Wonderful Cathedral. Each time we are in the city a must to go to St Patrick's, a wonderful place to sit and be still , great gift shop and also on the right side of the cathedral when you come out the front is a great cathedral gift shop across the street, a must stop and see,St Patrick's has wonderful prayer stations with saints, wonderful Blessed Mother Prayer area, so much to see, lovely place to give thanks and walk around in peace!!!!!

Beautiful!. St. Patrick's Cathedral is simply beautiful with all the stonework and woodwork. You are allowed to take pictures and I highly recommend that you do. It is certainly a place you want to visit on your trip to New York!

Historic & Heartwarming. It is hard not to pop in here even when you are in a hurry if your Catholic! The architecture attracts others, but the holiness and serenity you feel upon entering makes it worth it even if you only have a few minutes.
Beautiful building. Beautiful cathedral tucked away in amongst the skyscrapers. Well worth a visit. Can attend a service as well at certain times of the day.
Amazing!. It was simply amazing been able to visit this Cathedral on my way to the hotel from the city. It's a place of peace in the middle of the Big Apple!

St. Patrick's Cathedral... Breathtaking Beauty. Welcoming all who want to enter. A magnificent cathedral just recently renovated. A must see when you are walking Fifth Ave. Take some time to go in and contemplate.

Stunning. This was one of my favorite parts of our trip to NYC. This church is absolutely gorgeous! They had a service going on while we were walking through and it was very pleasant. There are donations areas around the church as well and candle lighting donations.

Quite Lovely Post Facelift. Construction was begun before the Civil War when the location was probably never dreamed to one day be in the city center. If you count Irish New Yorkers among your ancestors, they may well have put pennies (or more if they were among the few rich Irish) in the collection for this church.Donation envelopes on hand, not required. Quiet required.

Beautiful and Holy. What a beautiful Cathedral located on the East side of New York. You feel a holiness when you enter. The structure itself is fascinating with the statues and stain glass windows. Do yourself a favor and visit the magnificent Cathedral when in New York

Never ceases to amaze me.... I have been coming here since the 1960's and its splendor never ceases to amaze me. The last few times I have been here it's been under construction but even that didn't take away from the beauty, stillness, peace and grandeur. Please do not miss this magnificent cathedral when you visit.

A must see in NY. There first time I went into St. Patrick's was at a friend's wedding 20+ years ago and I remember it as if it was yesterday. The shear beauty of the architecture is unmatched, yet it does not compare to the feeling you get when you walk inside. I am not Catholic, but I felt this incredible "presence" in the church that was both welcoming and awe-inspiring.If you are in New York and miss this milestone, you have missed New York.
NYC's go to tourist church. Iconic catholic cathedral on NYC. One of the best looking cathedrals of the city as well. The sight is free to enter, just we mindful of religious services being held.

Our National Treasure. I had forgotten how beautiful this cathedral was, (it's been 30 years since I have been back). This time I was able to enjoy this moment with my husband. The Cathedral opened in 1879 and is Gothic Revival in style. The rose stain glass reminds me of Notre Dame de Paris. There are two spires that reach 330 feet form street level and is the US's largest Cathedral.It takes up a whole block and you can view it from the top of the rock, since it is right across the street for Rockefeller Center, on 5th avenue. I have no word's to describe the awe inspiring beauty of this cathedral, you just have to see it.
Mass at the Cathedral. We went for Mass while we were there. The cathedral is beautiful and can get crowded, so plan accordingly.
stunning. beautiful cathedral in heart of the city even managed to catch a mass, worth a moment of contemplation at the shop and earn at any price culture of city life

Beautiful and historic. Toured the cathedral and went to Sat. evening mass. Beautifully restored building. A must on anyone's list. Also went to St. John the Divine which is being restored. It's bigger, historic and will be more beautiful when restored although still not finished.

Fabulous Cathedral. On previous visits St Patricks was surrounded by scaffolding but this year all works are complete and you can see the overall beauty of this place.Quiet respite from madness of NYC.
Majestic. It is a must to see while in New York. Recently renovated - the Cathedral is a structure of beauty. It is absolutely breathtaking to see

Great property!. The scaffolding which has been a feature of this great building for a number of years finally appears to be gone. It is a magnificent architectural structure but more importantly is an oasis of calm in the centre of busy Manhattan. Always worth a visit.

Worth a quick look. It's free to enter which is a plus in NY. If you are from Europe and like cathedrals you might be a little disappointed. It's not so great in comparison with European cathedrals. It is interesting in its own right but there's not much information on site to inform visitors. Maybe tours are available, if so that would be good.
Unbelievable Architecture. Just happened to be walking by St. Patricks and had to go in and see. Boy was I glad I did. Very impressive and inspiring Cathedral.
Bucket List. The Architecture outside and inside are a must see if you go to New York City. Such a Historic sight to see.
Close your eyes for a few minutes!!!. We popped in to have a look at the stained glass and ended up sitting there for about 20minutes. Great place to visit...packed with people.
Outstanding!. The work inside and outside are finally done! It's really worth the go inside to see the beautiful architecture!

When in New York, definitely see St Patricks Cathedral.. Beautifully redone. The inside reminded me of the Sagrada Familia in Barcelona. The way the archways and the lights come through the stained glass and the skylights. They did a marvelous refurbishing of the Cathedral. The floors, the ceilings the altars all so beautiful.

Beautiful cathedral!. I have been to this cathedral several times...on my visit a few years ago it was being renovated & I visited this past September...it is absolutely beautiful, I visited the day after the Pope said mass...I felt like you could still feel his presence

Incredible sight. Sadly, the cathedral was undergoing some inside structural work during my last visit, but despite this there was no way you couldn't not be in awe. This building is an architectural masterpiece, and if for nothing else, make sure you stop in to admire its beauty. Plan to spend as much or as little time as you want inside. If I remember correctly, a donation is suggested but not required.

So much more than what you see in films. Yes we've all seen the cathedral in films but once inside you only really see the beauty and scale of the building. What really changes as you enter though is that you forget the films and feel the serenity and calmness of a holy place. Take the time to remember loved ones who have passed and light a candle at one of the side altars - quite a moving experience.

Inspirational. Visited church during mass while we were in town. Wonderful place, so spiritual, so inspiring. The architecture inside and out is amazing. Listening to the music of the organ echoing through the cathedral gives you goosebumps. A must see!
Awe-inspiring religious art and architecture.. A religious sanctuary in the midst of the hustle and bustle of 5th Avenue. Amazing art and architecture.

Complete awe .... We were in total awe when we walked into the Cathedral. It was so calming, even with the many visitors. Still said a silent prayer and had a wonderful time touring this beautiful church.
Amazing. Beautiful church. Extremely welcoming of all religions. It felt sacred and magical. Wonderful gift shop around side of church.

St. Patrick's Cathedral....not to be missed.. We had the good fortune to attend morning mass at this wonderful Cathedral. The building has been beautifully restored both inside and out. An essential visit if on holiday in New York

Absolutely Beautiful!!. I love beautiful churches. I tend to find the churches in the U.S. to be huge disappointments compared to European churches. This one was not a disappointment. So much architectural beauty.
Make sure this is on your list to visit when in NYC!

Don't miss even if you're not religious. Stating the obvious, perhaps: entrance is on Fifth Ave (at 50th St), not Madison as the street address would tell you. Very inspiring place to visit, admire, and pray, regardless of faith.

Magnificent!. We have attended mass at St. Pats many times during our visits to New York, and on our most recent trip were less than a block away when Pope Francis arrived at the Cathedral. The restoration and cleaning that have been ongoing for quite some time were completed very recently and the result is magnificent! A visit to the cathedral is a "must" not only for Catholics, but for anyone who enjoys amazing architecture and awe-inspiring atmosphere!

A piece of rome in nyc. I've been to Rome and the Vatican city as well. This cathedral is fantastic. No cost involve. Spend the time to look around . I spend half an hour looking and the sculptures and the gorgeous windows

Gorgeous Cathedral, Stunning Architecture, Recently Refurbished. Major renovations have been completed to this 1879 Cathedral and staple of NYC. As a result, her stone is bright and gorgeous instead of black and dreary. Inside you will find stunning artwork and stained glass, statues and beautiful statues and altars, any ONE of which would be worth a visit in most major cities but several dozen reside in this singular location. Free tours are available, call in advance for tours for groups of ten or more. Seven masses are celebrated on weekdays.
Wonderful. This cathedral is just breath taking in its size and design. Very beautiful building. We didnt attend a mass but well worth a visit
Impressive church. We came on purpose and were deeply impressed about this large church in the heart of Manhatten. Everything was very clean and wellmaintained.

It's the people that make the difference!. This is a massive, historic and beautiful cathedral to visit. We visited several cathedrals while in New York, but this was our favorite by far because of the people. We visited in the evening when they have congregational members welcoming guests and offering information. I was in a wheelchair and they went out of their way to make everything accessible. Most of all, we loved that this is a real Christian congregation which was obvious to us, although we are not Catholic. When we visited another cathedral-type church in New York, it obviously had abandoned its Christian roots and was more a monument to the achievements of man, which really left us cold. Their treatment of guests was pretty cold as well. Our visit to St. Patrick's, however, was warm and wonderful and memorable.

Worth to drop in. Love the beautiful stained glass windows and general architecture of the church. There's usually an organ being played hauntingly, all the time. People sit on the steps outside the church to watch people on the streets. It's open to anyone.

Very solemn. Had the chance to visit, and there were a lot of tourists. We attended the first mass the following day, not a lot of people, thats why it was very solemn. Though the mass finished early, the priests did all the readings, I'm not used to it.
Art and free. This is a very special place. Sooo awesome! Art lovers should not miss this wonderful place. It is free.

Renovation Ready for the Pope. I had the opportunity to visit this beautiful 136 year old Cathedral undergoing about $175 million dollars in renovation prior to the Pope's visit. People can take a tour with their smart phones and attend Mass during the week and weekend. There is a large gift shop across the street from the Cathedral and a smaller one inside the Cathedral.

Beautiful cathedral. We watched the broadcast from the Cathedral during Pope Francis' visit to New York so had to go and have a look inside. It is beautiful inside. Apparently a lot of renovation work has been done and has been worthwhile.
St. Pat's Cathedral. When I walked into St. Patrick's Cathedral I was in awe of the amazing windows and the overall craftsmanship of the building.

Inspiring. No matter what your beliefs are this is a "not to be missed" destination. It is open to everyone. Among all there is to see in NYC this is a stand out. It took 25 years to construct (completed in 1888) and it just came through a 3 year renovation. The Neo Gothic design is stunning.
St. Patrick's Cathedral. Love historical place like this, Cathedral is great inside and definitely worth to visit sit down and take a time to think :)
Majestic. Beautiful old cathedral and an icon of NYC. The Pope's recent visit involved an address at this cathedral. Well worth the visit.
Beautiful from the Inside and Outside. What a magnificent Cathedral and a little oasis far away from the busy street outside. Come for a little prayer before being on your way again :)

A wonderful spot to visit. Amazing historical church with incredible stained glass & statues. It is an incredible site. Try to include a Mass when you visit ~ quite the experience. Also do not forget to visit the gift shop across the street....great mementos available for everyone !

St Pats. We visited in early September - they were almost done with the big renovation prior to the Pope's visit. I lived in NYC in 1985-86 and St Pat's was one of my very favorite places. A beautiful peaceful gem of a place in the heart of the bustling city.It's still JUST as beautiful. From the soaring ceilings to the massive organ pipes, to the intricate woodwork and the incredibly beautiful stained glass.... take it all in. Spend some time, light a candle, visit the replica of The Pieta, and sit down and enjoy the peace. Really a lovely place, no matter your spiritual leaning.

Beautiful spot to come in and reflect. I try to stop in here every time I come into the city. I came in today the day after Pope Francis' visit. Beautiful beautiful place. I come in to rest and reflect in a pew. lots of great history here.

Beautiful. Renovated in the last few years, St Patrick's white stone gleams inside and out. Wonderful classic architecture with double steeples. We were fortunate to arrive just prior to mass and were treated to fabulous music from the organ and choir. The stain glass windows are massive and beautiful.
Looks like new. IF you ahve been there before, you need to return to see the wonderful transformation. The cathedral looks like it was just built. A great restoration job done inside and out.
Even for non-catholics: Fabulous. If you love art, great architecture, sociology or just a beautiful site then St. Patricks is a must see. A gothic style cathedral in the midst of enormous steel

Beautifull Cathedral. This cathedral has just been renovated and is located at 5th Avenue. It's often very crowded and there's a security check when you enter. If you are into churches, this is a must visit. If you're not, i would visit it too.
Beautiful. A beautiful cathedral was just getting ready for the popes visit. Great architecture fantastic windows

Holiday. Beautiful. Well worth a visit. I'm not really one for churches and cathedrals but wow. I lit a candle for my pops to say happy new year. Didn't feel I could take photos so not sure if you were allowed.
Stunning renovation! Must see. The just being completed renovation is incredible. Hopefully, this will secure the structure for another century!
If you're into churches. This one is pretty nice. They've almost finished renovations, just in time for the Popes visit. It's often crowded, even for it's services.

Beautifully restored. We were here a year ago and there was scaffolding everywhere. Now it is beautifully restored and the stone inside and out is gleaming white. Lovely stained glass windows and carved stations of the Cross. It is quiet inside despite the tourists. Photos are allowed. pope Francis will be giving mass here in a couple of days, so everything is being polished!

Beautiful renovation. St. Patrick's has undergone an cleaning! Beautifully sandblasted interior and exterior that shows off all the grain in the marble columns and the sharpness of the ceiling. Worth the visit to see the 'new' St. Patrick's!
Historically amazing. It's simply breath taking! The architecture is breath taking. You step inside as the hectic world stays at the door.

Beautiful building - worth taking time out and saying a wee prayer.. Quiet and peaceful in this fast moving City. Nice to take time out and enjoy the beauty of the building and it is so hard to believe it is in the middle of the City. Worth visiting and reflecting.
Love the architecture.. This place is currently under renovation. However, it is still worth the visit. The beautiful architecture and stained glass are amazing to look at.

Always Great To Attend Mass Here. I went to mass at St. Patrick's Cathedral in August 2015. It was magnificent and moving. The organ and music for the mass were very good and the priest gave a very good homily. Afterward I walked around went behind the altar to look at the various prayer places. Then I bumped into my brother-in-law and sister-in-law. What a coincidence. I have been to St. Pats many times including attending mass. It is always a very good experience. For out-of-town visitors it is a must see as well as a stroll up or down Fifth Avenue.
Awe-inspiring. St. Patrick's Cathedral is beautiful and inspiring in spite of the large crowds gaping at the beautiful architecture and stained glass.

A beautiful building.. Being cleaned-uprenovated and nearly finished. Much better for photos. One should visit this Cathedral to pay homage to all the men and women of the emergency services who lost their lives in the 9/11 tragedy. It is one of the most historical and iconic buildings in NY. Pop in even if a service is on. Then go across the road to The Rockerfeller Centre for the Observatory or lunch in The Summer Garden.
Awe-inspiring. A most beautiful cathedral smack in the middle of New York. A must visit even for the non religious one. Simply amazing architecture.

Most surprisingly beautiful attraction in NYC!. St. Patrick's Cathedral is breath-takingly beautiful. Not possible to visit without saying, "Wow!" One of those places that everyone finds to be better than they expected! Don't miss it!

Beautiful church!. Stopped by St. Patrick's in NYC and lit a candle for my deceased ex-husband. Beautiful church that you can sit in, pray or just quietly reflect. Very peaceful. Plenty of candle stands.
Beautiful Cathedral . Only saw it from the outside but it was beautiful. Worth taking the time to walk by. Very short walk from Rockefeller Center.
Stunning!. Just beautiful! Breathtaking. A must see in NYC! Take time to sit and reflect on things while there and enjoy the solitude and beauty.

Worthy for the Pope. We stopped by St. Patrick's to see how the renovation went and were we impressed. The place has every square inch fixed and cleaned and is about ready for the Pope's visit. We were also able to see the Pieta for the first time and it was impressive. There are 15 side alters and of course the main alter. It took three years and $177 million to get the church back in shape and what a wonderful job.A true gem for all people of New York City.

Love the Renovation!!. Went to Sunday Mass. I visit St Patrick's every trip to NYC. The last 3 years the church has been undergoing an extensive renovation and cleaning. I was so excited to see the majority of the renovation completed and all the scaffolding removed on the inside and outside. Wow! Looks fabulous! The stained glass is truly beautiful!! St Pats is anticipating Pope Francis' visit to NYC.
Sunday mass . Was passing so had to call in and mass was just starting so stayed for it all. What a building worth the visit and say a few prayers.

Add it to your list. The Church is absolutely stunning. You absolutely should stop in, to say a prayer, to marvel at the architecture, or just to say you did. Right across the street from Rockefeller Center and a truly peaceful place to take a break from the chaos of NYC.
Mass in St. Patricks. Went with my husband to mass early on a Sunday. Beautiful architecture. Building work on going but did not detract from the atmosphere .

Very Pretty and Very Busy. I try to visit every major Cathedral in the places I visit. St. Patrick's is quite stunning. Unfortunately, there was a mass happening when I arrived, so didn't have the opportunity to explore. I know I could have sat down on a pew and taken a good look, but chose to walk through and take a quick peek at the architecture and stained glass windows.

Beautifully restored magnificent cathedral. The last few times I have been to st. Patrick's were quite disappointing as scaffolding covered major parts which were being cleaned or restored. This time I was delighted to see that the restoration and cleaning process is virtually complete. The building gleams white on the outside and is truly amazing...very few examples of cathedrals of this sort in the U.S....mostly you think you have to go to Europe to see examples of this type of architecture. The stained glass windows are gorgeous..must have been cleaned and every side chapel down both sides of the church are gleaming marble and the gold and statues look beautifully restored. Truly a beautiful place.
Magnificent Structure. We went to visit right after visiting Rockefeller Center. AMAZING architecture and so beautiful inside. Very relaxing and peaceful.

Good organist. We popped in here whilst walking up 5th avenue and took a seat to absorb the atmosphere. The place is having some refurbishment so was a bit noisy from the as well as being very busy with tourists too. However, despite all that it was still a lovely oasis from the busy street outside.

St Patrick Cathedral, no other one !. We cannot be in New York without visiting St Patrick Cathedral, pray and offer some candles to Virgin Maria for our loved ones ! This belongs now to our "tradition" and St Patrick became over the years a kind of "second home" where we like to seat down, relax and pray. It is perhaps crowded sometimes, but you can still feel safe and alone with your prayers and God.

Still a work in progress. I know its been under mainteinance for a couple years now, when I visited it the exterior was finished but the interior was undergoing a lot of work, it will end up looking beautiful, but until then ill give it 4 points. Definitely a must

Perfect place for a prayer to above.. Lovely church in the middle of the skyscrapers. A piece of the past in the modernity of downtown New York City. The shrines are amazing and the state of the church is perfectly well maintained. Beautiful architecture.
Magnificent and uplifting. Strikingly beautiful interior with beautiful stained glass windows and distinctive sculpture. Grand cathedral, contrasting and yet fitting with the surroundings.
So clean and white. We went in the evening after visiting Rockefeller Centre. Doors were open and people were sitting on the steps. So clean and white, with the restoration. Beautiful and peaceful.
Just refinished. Got here just before the Pope's arrival in a few weeks , so the church is all finished with updating. It is stunning and jaw dropping. What a beautiful place of worship!

Covered in scaffolding but interior beautiful. The outside is still being restored and so the exterior is mostly covered but what we could see was intricately carved. The inside is a working cathedral but there was no problem with tourists having a look inside.

Incredible Structure.... I visited St. Patrick's severe times & every time I do I'm in AWE of this place.This is truly one amazing structure inside & out. Especially now with the scaffolding off the facing it looks amazing. Almost angelic. The gothic style building & the expanse of it truly WOWS you. It is a place of beauty & peace. There's always a ton of people going in & out. It's truly unfortunate in this day & time we live in that even a place of worship requires security people & cameras as well as bag screenings. All I all it's a wonderful visit indeed.

blisss. one of my favorite places on my trip in the middle of busy city so peaceful and relaxing. I cant recommend this enough you can light a candle pray or just sit there and relax in the peace.you can buy beads candles etc if you wish or a coin for $2 as a remembrance. They don't charge you but you can leave a donation if you want , i personally did as i really felt it was worth it
Beautiful. Walked in this beautiful church right off Madison avenue. Lit a candle for my brother. A very beautiful interior with the stained glass windows and amazing architecture.

Peace and tranquility in the middle of Manhattan.. St Patrick's is the most amazing cathedral I have ever been in. The building is stunning with the most beautiful architecture. You can light a candle for $2 which we did then spent 5 minutes just soaking up the atmosphere. The tranquility is astounding considering the construction and New York madness just outside. I would definitely recommend a visit.

Sacred Cathedral Surrounded by Skyscrapers. St Patrick's is the seat of the Archbishop of New York and one of the most scared and honored Roman Catholic churches in the USA. It is built like a Gothic Cathedral. High vaulting nave, enormous transept, and, outside, flying buttresses to support the beautiful walls of stained glass. Creates a sense of holy and sacred despite the throngs of tourists. The radiating chapels the surround the altar are my favorite parts of this church. In particular, St Anne's Chapel at the back is a moving and special place. Very humble and tranquil. It is somewhat bittersweet that the church is now dwarfed by the skyscrapers of business, but the scene represents New York so well.

Stunning inside and out.... One of my favourite places I've visited so far, the architecture and the interior craftwork is absolutely beautiful. It's a first and foremost a church so a place of peace so of course be respectful when wondering round but it's definitely worth popping in if your in the area!

I thought there was a fee. In some mayor churches in Europe, as a tourist, you have to pay a fee in to in, besides they ask you to have a respectful attitude once inside. Here the attitude of the public is all but respectful, so careless. The place is imposing, beautiful and in process of restoring. I only imagine when the work is finished.

Beautiful Inside and Out. We were delighted to be able to get inside and see this magnificent structure since there was a mass being conducted. Being able to take pictures of the interior stained glass windows, carved wooden doors, ornate ceiling was a plus. Met my "to do " list. We didn't do the tour due to a time constraint but the proximity to Rockefeller Center made it easy to get to.

You can fill something special. Finally they completed the work inside this beauttiful bulding. I´m Catolich and love to visit churches, this is one of my favorites. If you visit NYC, no matter whar your faith is, this is a place you must visit, is amaizing.
Nice church on Fifth Avenue. A good place to take a short silent break on your shopping tour on Fifth avenue. The church itself is nice but without being over the top.

Gothic style and peaceful. Beautiful church to visit even if you are not catholic. It offers Neo-Gothic style with lots of details to take in. A peaceful place amid a crazy New York! I was there end of August 2015 and a lot of renovations going on - I believe that the Pope is schedule to visit the church in September!
Place to visit. Just incredible to visit! One of the most precious and architecture can I visit of monuments religious, don't forget to visit.

Words cannot express . Renovations on outside were done but still doing some inside. The place is indescribable. You can walk right in and look around. Very peaceful and a feeling of calm comes over you after stepping off the busy street and into this majestic building. You can visit as long as like. Some places are roped off, but you get to see it all.

Celebrate Any Religion. I would be a regular visitor to St. Pat's if I lived in NYC. What a magnificent structure and visited by people with a vast variety of religious backgrounds or none at all. Take your time, soak in the emotion, sit in a pew and say a prayer.

Magnificent Gothic Cathedral. St Patrick's Cathedral has it all: Two 300 foot bell towers, an elaborate facade, a long nave, a grand golden baldachin, shrine upon shrines, a Pieta, a beautiful lady chapel, a masterful organ, a beautiful rose window, amazing stained glass windows, and the Lady of Guadalupe. However, it's always crowded.

Getting Ready for the Pope's Visit. What a timely visit to St. Patrick's Cathedral in New York City, where preparations are being made for the upcoming visit of Pope Francis. The Cathedral has beautiful stained glass windows and ornately decorated alcoves and altars. There was a lot of activity inside, sprucing things up for the Pope's visit.
Busy place. Walked by on a week night and the cathedral was lit up and the organist was practicing. Quite a site. Walk in and check it out.
Wonderful details. beautiful, must see... I stop here every time I bring someone to New York City! The detail in this place is amazing
Amazing inside. Worth a pop in if you are in New York. Typically oversized but lots going on. Pay extra for taking pictures inside.

Quiet time. No matter what your religion, St. Pat's is such an icon and is in so much literature; so many movies, that you've got to see it. It inspires reverence and is a place I like to go and sit for a few minutes - half an hour in the midst of a busy day.

NYC Treasure. St Patrick's is a beautiful neo-Gothic cathedral looming overhead when you exit Rockefeller Center. This is the largest Roman Catholic cathedral in the U.S. The architecture, the amazing organ, the artwork, the sculptures and the stained glass should not be missed. I have visited many cathedrals in Canada, the US and Europe and some of my favorite stained glass was right here. Construction is still ongoing but that didn't stop the multitudes from going inside although it is so large (a whole city block!) that it was not crowded. As a bonus, it was nice and cool inside on a hot day along 5th Avenue!
Wow. Wow everyone must visit. Be you religious or not you can't miss this beautiful building, it's tranquil but busy, the silence is golden among 100s of people. Put it on the don't miss list.

Beautiful and timeless. I have seen more people taking pictures of this gorgeous cathedral than all of New York! It has such an imposing character yet walking in to stare at the stained glass, well you would need more time here than at the MoMA. Take the time to visit, and this is the time to take a slow breath and marvel at the architecture and engineering of this wonderful place.

Uplifting. This beautiful cathedral was so white in the brilliant sunshine it stopped us in our tracks. My husband was a catholic in his childhood and was so struck with the cathedral we came back for Sunday mass which despite scaffolding was lovely and well worth it if on a visit to New York. Really peaceful and uplifting.

one word for this cathedral...amazing!!!. As I walked through this beautiful church, there was so much peace, beauty and color.I sat for a long time, thinking about those who had spent so much time making such a place of quiet elegance.People are allowed to see the inner workings as well as items from it's past. It is a must see for anyone who has never been to New York. It is somewhere that I will see if I'm in New York again.

Absolute Oasis of Tranquility among the daily hum drum.. Came across this beautiful Cathedral whilst touring NYC. The Architecture is absolutely amazing and a must see if you are in the city. Renovations are ongoing but this does not detract from the buildings utter splendor.
pretty . it looks almost out of place beside all the sky scrapers but you should definitely go inside the stained glass windows are very beautiful and it has great architecture.

The most beautiful church I have seen in the USA. I saw this church at night and it was lit with lights and stood out like a beacon so graceful white and beautiful I had to goback during the day. I was not disappointed. This is a beautiful church without being to gaudish. A real must see and to top it off unlike many other church's you felt a sense of welcome and warmth. Stunning !,,,
Stunning!. A friend of mine told me to check this place out while NYC. This church is simply amazing! Everything about it was stunning! Still under construction but still worth the walk through.
Beautiful. Pay a visit to this lovely Cathedral,Looks as good inside as it does from the outside.Nice and peaceful inside,It is been restored but still beautiful inside.

Beautiful church in the middle of the city. It's a beautiful church in the middle of all the buildings and the chaos of the city, you walk in and immediately feel at ease. It is currently under renovations so expect some noise! It's right next to Rockefeller Center, you can't miss it!
Nice. I never liked going to churches, then I went to St. Patrick's cathedral. If you're catholic you have to go on a mass here, there's no other such place on the east coast.

Spiritual Haven in New York. Beautiful haven from the hustle and bustle of New York...spiritual lift after walking the streets and a respite from the sightseeing.Lots of renovation work going on and quite noisy and of course crowded with tourists but the architecture and stained glass windows are all a marvel to behold n this House of God. Cannot understand some of the other reviews mentioning a charge to get in..? Donations should always be forthcoming for help in the upkeep of such a wonderful building particularly when you have had the privilege of sharing it for however a brief moment...
Beautiful. Although currently under construction St. Patrick's Cathedral is still breathtakingly beautiful. Do not miss this if you come to NYC.

Absolutely Beautiful!. When we visited the cathedral was undergoing renovation. It was still open to the public for viewing. We met with the pastor in the rectory to add a family member to the prayer list. The staff was wonderful. As a devote catholic, this church is a national treasure. The detail is absolutely beautiful!
