Disappointing compared to most European cathedrals. We have been to most of the first class Catholic cathedrals in Europe and elsewhere, but we had not been to St. Patrick's in many years. Perhaps because it is so much newer and therefore less historic than those other cathedrals we were a bit disappointed.

Must see, Bucket list stop. St. Pat's is a wonderful example of gothic architecture in the US. It is simply grand. Currently there is a lot of renovation and cleaning activity. So, it just adds to the congestion. Best times are early Sunday mass or during the weekday to avoid peak crowds.

A sea of calm in New York. Stumbled across this cathedral as we were wandering past on 5th Avenue.The building is magnificent inside and out, the architecture and stained glass is stunning, but perhaps just as good a reason to visit is just to take a bit of time to relax, sit down in relative peace and quiet and (especially handy in the summer) the air conditioning.A sea of calm in the middle of New York, worth visiting if you are nearby to take a break.

Breath taking.. One of the most breathtaking Cathedral's I have ever been too. The stained glass windows are incredible. I went to Sunday morning mass and is was just wonderful and I am not even Catholic.

If you like architecture, then don't miss this!. A five year, 50+ million renovation has revived this old landmark of the city, look up and you will see the newly cleaned up ceiling and those wonderful stain glass windows.Just don't use flash, when you take photos, that is a no no ! I love this old church!

A restful place. Visited several times during our stay in New York. A beautiful building that is still undergoing restoration but still allowing visitors to access the building. We went first during mass and I felt a little awakward taking photographs then but that is probably my Catholic upbringing, not that anyone said anything. I think the Cathedral is so used to visitors. Such a friendly welcome when we entered although sadly they still have to look through bags on the way in. We returned another time and this time I felt more able to wander around. Beautiful and a place to which I would love to return.

Iconic!. You don't have to be a catholic to appreciate this awesome cathedral, which in my opinion, is the best in the nation. Unfortunately, it is undergoing a massive restoration and several areas of the church are closed off to visitors, but just standing and looking up at the massive ceiling is awe inspiring. A must-see when in midtown.

Beautiful Cathedral in NY. A welcome break in the bustle of NY. This is a beautiful Cathedral with some amazing stained glass work. It was undergoing some major restoration so it had a ton of scaffolding up but still beautiful. Its just down the street from MOMA.

Beautiful church I traveled so many years ago!! !984. Beautiful architeture, it is definitely worth a visit, but it was a little embarassing to see a temple of God asking for money at the entrance! In my opinion it is awkward

Still a progress in work. I went inside because I have a real admiration for Cathedral's even though I'm not Catholic, or even Christian. The Cathedral is was going through major renovations and had scaffolding all over the place. I saw some people lighting candles and praying. For a rainy day, the place was pretty full. Once the scaffolding comes down maybe then I will be able to see the inside better.There are several unique things about the Cathedral, however neither the height or width are one of them. I think the stained glass work is well done, but no where near the quality of that in Europe's cathedrals.
A must see. What can I say? This iconic cathedral is a must visit for anyone-Catholic or otherwise. Beautiful...

Fabulous. What a lovely cathedral sitting in the heart of 5th Avenue amongst the sky scrapers and the shops. Take time out to visit this lovely serene church. Entry is free and it is well worth stopping to look during your busy schedule.

Renovation is nearing an end and it's looking great!. I stop in nearly every time I'm in New York. It is coming out of a multi-year refurbishing project. The outside is clean, gone are all the stains and filth of the City. Inside, the scaffolding is coming down gradually, in time for the Pope's visit this Fall. It's looking great inside. Upgraded electric, sound, and the works. Can't wait to return in a few months to see it complete.
Beautiful place. special place holy and pure a place filled with God 's wonder beautiful workings in and near downtown,

Heavenly and majestic cathedral takes your breath away!. New York City's 5th Avenue boasts some incredible and famous addresses, shops and hotels... But the most divinely beautiful architecture is captured in the St. Patricks cathedral. An entire city block is devoted to this breathtaking Cathedral. Take a few moments to go inside and feel the presence of something bigger than you. It's moving and overwhelmingly awe inspiring!! One of the greatest cathedrals in the world.
Nice chill experience. Beautiful grounds, amazing cathedral. Hard to explain but it was a very "chill" experience as my 15 year old daughter said afterwards. Worth a stop.

Beautiful Cathedral. The nice thing about St. Patrick's Cathedral is that it is open to the public. Nowadays, many churches are locked unless a service is in progress. If you are in Manhattan, this is worth a visit. My last visit was on Ash Wednesday.
Beautiful . The restoration seems mostly completed at least for viewing and it fills uou with awe and peace. We stayed for the mass and then enjoyed its beauty on a self guided tour.

Once in a lifetime renovation, you don't wanna miss it!. A 80 million dollar, 5 + year renovation. Look into those pearly white ceiling and this cleaned up stained glasses, every where you look, they will just take your breath away....

Beautiful church!!!. We visit St. Patrick's everytime we come to NYC. This church is absolutely beautiful. They were doing improvements on the interior and exterior of the church but it is still beautiful. I love coming here!!!
Beautiful . One word..beautiful. Even though it was under construction when we were there you can still see the beauty. Not just for Catholics.

Must see. Wow- even though renovations are happening all around this cathedral, do whatever it takes to get there go inside and have a look. Absolutely breathtaking. There were no line ups no huge crowds. My partner and I were left reeling in the beauty of this place

A place to behold. We stopped by here while on a hop off portion of our hop on and off big bus tour. (I've reviewed the tour separately if you were interested to hear about that).The church is the middle of some serious renovations, lots of scaffolding and work men. That doesn't however detract from the beauty of this cathedral. If you're babble to visit after the renovations are done, I'd recommend that. Otherwise don't be put off, it still amazing inside.My kids never believe people read my reviews. So if this was helpful to you on your travels, please give me a helpful vote. It's always nice to point out that people rely on others reviews when making choices in unfamiliar locations.

Stunning Neo-Gothic Architecture!. I enjoyed going to St. Patrick's cathedral! It's a 135-year-old Roman Catholic church, located in the midtown Manhattan. I loved its Neo-Gothic-style architecture, as well as its interior - stained glass windows, the altar, the entrance, and pipe organs. One of the most beautiful churches in NYC!

Never miss mass. I make a point to make sure I attend mass here at least once every tin I get to the city. The beauty is indescribable. I really look forward to seeing the finished product after they have completed renovations that seem to have been going on forever. Would not miss this great landmark if you are coming to NY.

Lovely Cathedral But.... It's under heavy construction now in preparation for the Pope's Visit. Go after the Pope has come and gone. If you've been to some of the grand churches in Europe, you'll be disappointed but if you're comparing it to your local Catholic Church, you'll be impressed by the size and majesty of the place. It was busy but not overly crowded and no wait to get in.

Beautiful and Serene. I've been here a few times and always liked it very much. It's an incredible building to be in and view, and it always seems less crowded than other NYC attractions. As a Catholic, I could appreciate it all the more.
A Must See!. An oasis in the middle of the city! Beautiful stained glass and architecture. There is a great little gift shop, too!

Beautiful even under construction . Great place to visit when in NYC. The church always seems illuminated by light even thought all the skyscrapers around the church are in darkness. When visiting stop to take in the amazing details of stain glass icons on the ceiling and wall details. There is heavy construction inside the church but still a must when visiting NYC!
Beautiful historical structure. A beautiful historical church. Even though it is in the middle of being renovated it was so gorgeous.

Renovations are almost done. 3 years ago the place was completely covered on the outside and inside for renovations. Now at least is completed from the outside and on the inside is half way trough.The place is beautiful and well worth a visit.
Too beautiful for words. This is one of the most gorgeous places I've ever had the pleasure of seeing first hand. There are no words to describe the beauty, peace, and comfort you feel while there.

a little peace in the midst of the bustling city. St Patricks cathedral is a place where people go to worship every week but also a place where thousands of tourists flock to for a bit of a respite during their vacations. A trip to New York is not a relaxing event but making a stop at the St Patricks Cathedral is almost a requirement. It is right across the street from Rockefeller Center which makes it a convenient location. The architecture is beautiful and they have a nice gift shop. I am not catholic but I love to stop in here when I am in the city and just sit for a bit and meditate. As of July 2015 they are doing some construction so there is scaffolding up in the sanctuary but it is still a must see.

St. Pats is a beautiful site for those of all faiths.. Stunning, awe inspiring and just gorgeous. Recent renovations have restored some features that were difficult to appreciate before. A must visit in NY.

history. I love the history and memories of this beautiful church but I wish the construction would end. I love the fact that you see people of all religions and from all over walking in this church and reading the history of it. But the construction takes so much away from the religious experience.

A Gem - With Scaffolding. New York City is full of places of worship - you can see them as you move about and they dot many streets and corners and cover many religions and denominations. But how often do you find a wonderful building and hope to enter and investigate and can't? But not so with St. Patrick's Cathedral. Open to all this cathedral draws tourists, visitors and the devout and gives them welcome. A functioning place of worship (with an awe inspiring amount of renovation) this is a church that welcomes all and provides full Catholic services, music and devotion with much architectural beauty and history. What You Need To Know*The Cathedral is undergoing extensive work at present in preparation for the visit of the Pope. Consequently, several areas, alters, etc. are not available. However, the Cathedral has provided as much as possible to compensate. Altars, prayer cards, statues have been moved and hopefully you can find what you want.*There is no entrance fee - don't be timid. You can enter, pray, visit, photograph. They are happy to have you there.*Services are held at times throughout the day and you must be respectful of them. The staff will not throw you out but move you away to avoid distracting the faithful. If you wish to attend you are welcome to.*The staff of St Patrick's must be the most courteous and welcoming ever encountered. They truly are happy you are there.
Impressive. St.Patricks was under construction when we went but still very beautiful. Very impressive when you consider when it was built and all the history that surrounds this awesome church.

Awe inspiring. People of all religions can appreciate the beauty and inspiration provided here. The cathedral is massive but yet serene. Words cant properly describe it. One must see it to appreciate it.

Beautiful If You Just Want To Take A Peak. Absolutely impossible to not be moved when you walk in and see the stunning views and realize that this is not a monument. Its a place that you can still go to worship in the heart of Manhattan.
Uplifting. We attended mass on a Saturday, it was beautiful - so uplifting. Right now there is a lot of construction inside but you can still see the beauty of the church.

Under Restoration. It was under major restoration when I visited in March but still a stunning site. I recommend going to the Top of the Rock and seeing the cathedral from on high as well. There are two gift shops - on inside and one around the block if you are looking for a gift or personal memento.

Is the scaffolding to hold up the faith?. Throngs of people, strolling through a beautiful church, snapping photos, of statues and saints, lighting candles and ticking it off their to see list. Under renovation at present. Churches should be treated as places of prayer, not photo opportunity moments and money garnering enterprise. By the way, the church is beautiful.

st Patricks walk-by. this is just a beautiful building- we were unable to enter but even the view from outside was lovely. its a great stop when down near Rockefeller Center and an easy stroll. We stayed at affinia 50 - 3rd and 50th...nice walk.
One of the prettiest in the US. It's currently being renovated, so some of the windows are not visible. But, you can still feel the grandeur and serenity, so it's worth a visit.
Weekend Getaway . When we were there it was under construction. But it was still such a beautiful church. You don't need to be a Catholic to appreciate the beauty of the place.

Magical Must Do. On my visit to NYC two years ago I was incredibley disapointed at missing this. It had quite a lot of work being done to the outside and we ended up skipping it. I made a promise to myself I would NOT miss it this time.AWE INSPIRING. Dramatic. IMPACTFUL. Reverent. Its a must do, must feel. Sitting in the wood pews just being. Incredible.

Beautiful church.. A piece of gothic architecture tucked away beneath the shards of glass and concrete. A most inspiring sight. It looks quite out of place and once inside you struggle to remember that you're in the middle of this vast city. Amazing spot.

St. Patrick's Cathedral. Very beautiful cathedral! The outside is breathtaking and the inside is even more beautiful. It gets crowded with people walking around or on the outside. There was a teen choir that performed while we were in there. Not sure if they were starting a evening mass or it was just for a rehearsal but it sounded beautiful.

Glorious.. A beautiful place to appreciate the extraordinary talent and skill with which it was all built. It is a fully operational church which makes wandering through sections where people are on their knees praying, a slight bit awkward - especially when you are an avid photographer.It is a serene, peaceful and voluminous space filled with beautiful objects and architecture. Worth the visit, even now while construction is going on to get it shiny and spit spot for the papal visit.
Breathtaking. Staff was friendly and I could have stayed all afternoon taking pics in this gorgeous, peacful cathedral!

Stunning. Stunning and breathtaking old Church. What a great piece of History that's going through some renovations but it still doesn't take away from the beauty and peacefulness of the Cathedral. It's well worth a trip inside and just a short walk from Rockefeller if you are in the area.
So beautiful. They are currently undergoing a 5 year renovation project to prepare for the pope visiting, but despite the construction you can still go in and enjoy and it is still so so beautiful

Amazing. Amazing architecture. Breathtakingly beautiful. I can't even begin to articulate how awesome this landmark is. They were actually having a service during my visit so I didn't get to see the front alter area up close but the organ was one of the largest that I have ever seen. Very detailed architecture. Wort a visit.
Really beautiful old church. I only saw this church in passing, but it was incredible. There was some construction going on, so it was covered in scaffolding, but still a beautiful church.

Beautiful church. We visited this beautiful church while visiting New York. It's gothic style spires and architecture are tucked next to skyscrapers. The inside is quiet, peaceful and adorned with stained glass windows. Facing the entrance is the sculpture of Atlas holding the World. This church is impressive inside and out. Visitors are welcomed, photos are allowed, there is a tiny gift store for postcards inside.
Great to visit but is undergoing renovations inside. You will still enjoy the architecture and the peaceful feeling of the Cathedral. The work is done inside toward the main altar.
A must See!. The architecture and the magnitude of the building is impressive and a must see if you are in NY. Quite impressive.

Beautiful Mass. We went to mass today at 10:15 am and were very lucky to have Cardinal Dolan serve the mass with reverence and humor.
The music was terrific and we left with a wonderful feeling for having been a part of the service.

St. Patrick's Cathedral. There are many nice curcles in New York, but the St. Patrick's Cathedral is one of the finest. Not quite as the catcholic churches you might find in Rome, but very close. Absolutely worht a visit if you are in the big apple.
Impressive. An Impressively majestic Church that is surely an experience to achieve. Great architectural details.

Stunning Cathedral. The cathedral is under construction at the moment, but did not expect to find a beautiful cathedral in New York like St. Patrick's! Amazing stained glass windows and one of the biggest Cathedrals I have ever seen.

Old World beauty in the New World. Gorgeous church with Old World appeal and interesting history.
If you squint, you almost feel,as though your in Europe. Convenient location makes it easy to breeze through. However, as other reviewers have mentioned, major renno's are underway, so be prepared for lots of scaffolding inside and out.

Don't miss it. A grand landmark in NYC. Don't miss it if you live here or happen to be a visitor. This majestic church is located on 5th Avenue goes fits in with iit's upscale surroundings. The church just went through and extensive renovation. Catholics can attend Holy Mass which is repeated throughout the day, every day. The exterior is a mix of Victorian beauty. The interior has sculptures with religious figures as well as many beautiful statues. Plenty of room for those that want to share their prayers,The ceiling stands out with pillars, decorations and religious artifacts.It seems to be endless with beauty. Don't forget to stop by. Candles can be lit. See the organ and pope/cardinal chair.
Very welcoming. Visited for Sunday Mass and felt very welcomed by the Monsignor who lead the service. A beautiful homily, wonderful music ministry and a lovely experience when visiting NYC.
SIMPLY BREATHTAKING!. Even though it is under construction, the church is a one of a kind structure. The attention to detail and the windows are spectacular. don't miss it!

Beautiful but under construction . Be prepared. Like most cathedrals of its age, St. Patrick's is under massive renovation. That doesn't mean that it still does not have beauty to offer. Rather, that you should be prepared for scaffolding.

Nice to see if you are close by. We didn't get to go in because it was closed when we went by, but it is still looking from the outside. If you are close by it is a great stop. The history alone makes it worth the stop.

Special Day. I called the Parish office a couple or so weeks before our planned trip to New York and talked to Fr. Ravi and asked if we could have a special blessing for our 25th wedding anniversary. He scheduled us for the day. We went to the Parish office the day before to make sure it was scheduled and it was. On the day after mass we went to the chapel behind the small altar had a special blessing and renewal of our vows for our 25th wedding anniversary officiated by Fr. O'Connor who was nice and accommodating and gave a short special sermon.Thanks for making the day special for us.

A Place of Prayer. How does one rate a Cathedral? Actually, go inside and feel the spirituality of this magnificent place of worship with its bright colored walls and beautiful stained glass windows. A place for the weary soul as much as a place to rest weary travellers

Very, very cool. I hope that other travelers get to see the finished product. When we visited they were doing a major renovation so not a lot was visible. None-the-less, it was a great stop and glad we took the time to walk through this incredible structure.

St Patrick's Shines!. Our first day in NYC and we wanted to light a candle for a sick family member so we called into St Patrick's -what a beautiful cathedral it is. The restoration work undertaken during the past three years has brought the features of the cathedral back to life. Well worth a visit for some quiet reflection.

Renovations looking good. This is a must see for visitors to NYC. The renovations on the outside appear to be complete. The scaffolding has been removed. The interior still has major work being done. The areas that have been done look great. This is an attraction that deserves respect when it is visited.

Stunning Cathedral. This place is a great cathedral and a must visit if you happen to be walking down 5th avenue or visiting Rockefeller Center. The windows are gorgeous as is the stonework. It is often under restoration, so there are frequently scaffolds someplace on the interior or exterior, but it's still a lovely place to see. Highly recommended.

A work of art. The architecture of this place is amazing. The high ceilings and overall size is awe inspiring. The stained glass is also a site. You are allowed to tour the majority of the cathedral but stay quiet. It's an active place of worship so respect of that is expected. There is no need to be religious to visit this marvel. Good location so it's easy to stop by.

size but no feeling or atmosphere. stunning building and typically as it has American it has to be the biggest, yet there is a significant lack of feeling here compared to the Notre Damme, The Vatican or even our local LLandaff Cathedral..... I guess size doesn't matter when it comes to your Cathedrals, just more about the feeling it gives you when you are inside and sorry to say but this one left us feeling a bit sterile!!

just a stunning peice of aechitecture. you don't have to be religious to go and take in the beauty of this Cathedral. The stained glass windows, the alter and all around works of art. Simply beautiful and not to be missed.
Beautiful. The cathedral was beautiful although there was construction going on during my visit. It's a great place to stop and see if you are in New York.

Gorgeous architecture, but under construction. Definitely stop in and check this place out - it's gorgeous and worth the stop for the stained glass alone! You can go in to the cathedral, but please be courteous with your conversations, cell phones, and picture taking - this is an active place of worship! Currently this cathedral is under construction, so prepare for your picture taking to be interrupted anyway with yellow caution tape and scaffolding. Still worth the visit. :)

An spiritual oasis in the midst of Midtown. In the middle of renovations, but still do not miss it. Beautiful inside and out. The architecture, ceilings, stained glass, pipe organ, altar, etc are spectacular. A great respite in the middle of the City. There is a gift shop inside and another across the street. Loved it.

WELL WORTH A VISIT. This beautiful cathedral is well worth a visit ,it is under renovation at the moment and is still spectacular to view even if your not religious, the stain glass windows are amazing and the altar is beautiful, it is a wonderful place to just rest and take in the the size of the cathedral, there is a little gift shop at the entrance which have lovely little souvenirs that are very reasonably priced.If your touring Manhattan don't forget to go.

Wonderful! Don't forget to see the Ambulatory. Under construction, but well worth a visit. Take a tour if you have time. Cleaned/restored stained glass windows in main part of church simply stunning.Call the church ahead of visit to find music schedule. Great pipe organ.Even though under construction, don't miss the Ambulatory section. This is the curved hallway to the sides and behind the altar area. There are multiple beautiful chapels along the walkway which must not be missed. Check out the floorplan (image uploaded) for details.This is a good time to visit, many tourists seem put off by the construction and crowds are much smaller (nonexistent when we visited July 2015) than in previous visits.

The Classic Church for Manhattan. This is the place for all of the big catholic funerals, pope's visit and visiting dignateries to come. It is immense and takes a square block and is the home to the New York Cardinal of record. Many important events have taken place here and visitors always take pictures. It is located across the street from Rockefeller Center which is convenient to take it all in at once.

A quiet haven amongst busy Manhatten. No preconceived plan to stop here but glad we did. While walking up the other side of the road we noticed the striking building and thought we'd pop across to go in. A beautiful church inside and out. The chapels inside are beautiful. Scaffolding in parts inside blocking done areas. It offered a nice break from busy Manhattan. Would stop by again on next visit. We spent about 20 minutes inside looking at the chapels and stained glass. A visit could be shorter or longer if you take a tour or attend mass.

Stunning Cathedral. Church is big and gorgeous. Beautiful architecture that coexists surprisingly well with its 5th Avenue shopping mecca surroundings. The Gothic architecture is offset by a broad stairway that lines 5th Avenue. St. Patricks truly is a work of art and worth seeing. The stained glass is breathtaking and it is amazing to just sit in the pew and stare at the unbelievably high ceiling.Worth a visit in NYC

Calm and Serene With Beautiful Stained Glass. A great place to go when wanting to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the streets. You can spend hours there and not feel as though you have seen everything.Sitting on the steps and people watching is fun.

St. Patrick's. What a beautiful church and a great gathering of people for a Sunday morning mass even if most were tourists like us. It was refreshing to see and the building itself is just breathtaking!
Beautiful. The church was going through some restoration, but we could see the beauty of it anyway. You don't have to be religious, it's a piece of art.
the one and only. this is by far the best Church to visit in New York, it is beautiful and you will never forget it. Enjoy
Beautiful Setting. We marveled at the beauty and inspiring architecture of this magnificent cathedral. Our tour guide told us of the history and other information on the church.
Great Architecture. this is a beautiful cathedral. When I visited, there was construction going on inside and outside. There were several street/ homeless people sleeping inside

Gorgeous Cathedral in the City. We didn't stay too long because there was an actual mass (service) being conducted when we wandered in St. Patrick's Cathedral. From our short stay inside, we marveled at the colorful stained glass, majestic arches and nave, and took in the calm that comes from being inside of a house of worship. This is a terrific way to find a 10-minute break from hustle and bustle of New York City. Come inside for the beauty, history, and moment of serenity.
An Architectural Delight. From the outside it was stunning & the inside would equally have been so had it not had scaffolding up as they were doing repairs.A place to re-visit in the future.

Love seeing results of renovations. Was here in January while there were tons of scaffolds up. Love seeing the improvements that have been made. This is a gorgeous Cathedral, we stop every time that we are in the city.

Once of my favorites!. I just love going to St Patrick's Cathedral, it is so beautiful! I try to go every time I visit NYC. Is been remodel right now so there is a lot going on but you can still appreciate the beauty of it.

Small amongst the big. Okay. So it's famous because it is a fairly large church which is still dwarfed by the surrounding giants of Manhattan.However, it may be small in comparison, but it's not just the size contrast which is striking. It genuinely is a beautiful building. Well worth spending a small portion of you Fifth Avenue time taking this place in.

Under Construction, but still breathtaking.. My daughter, niece and I went here on our New York City trip. There were hundreds of people in the Church and it was still so very quiet. Peaceful. The exterior is just as beautiful. A must see.
Beauty and grandure. A must stop if you like visiting churches and since its still a very active church find time to attend a service. you don't have to be Catholic to enjoy the beauty of it all.
Spectacular!. From the architecture to the stained glass windows, it is just a beautiful place to visit. It is a very peaceful place.

Beautiful Inside and Out. I took my mum here when she visited NYC as she is Catholic and I knew she would appreciate it. She was very impressed, as was I. Although under pretty much constant restoration, the architecture is magnificent. The stained glass windows are huge and all around the cathedral. We made a donation and lit some candles and walked around to see the statues of the various saints. There was a choir playing while we were looking around, which we sat and listened to for a while before continuing our walk around the cathedral. There is also a gift shop, which had some really nice pieces. I would like to visit again and take the guided tour, but you have to check the calendar as they are not daily.

A 3, Believe It or Not. There are a number of reasons I detracted a higher rating. First, large portions of the interior are under construction. Not what you should expect of a major NYC landmark. Second, photos are allowed, but not everywhere. Huh? I guess however, this is still a must see.

classic cathedral - and a great place to visit in NYC.. classic cathedral - and a great place to visit in NYC. Charming and historical. a must visit fro anyone coming to NYC, especially for the first time.

Unaware of this Building. We came across St Patrick's purely by accident whilst wandering around New York, what a beautiful, picturesque building. We wandered in and it is undergoing some restoration work and a lot was hidden by the scaffolding,. However, it is still worth a visit and some beautiful architecture to see. Well worth taking some time to see.

An Impressive Cathedral. St. Patrick's Cathedral in NYC and the Duomo in Milan, Italy, not forgetting Notre Dame in Paris, are the three most impressive Cathedrals I have visited, The architecture of each is special, as is the feeling of peace, in all of them,. especially at times when they are not crowded, A Must visit for visitors, more than once, better. Don't miss it!
beatiful cathedral. we are not catholic, but we try to visit st patrick's every time we are in nyc. it is so pretty and there are many things to see inside. very similar to the cathedrals in europe
Magnificent. We enjoyed XMASS ceremony, although the cathedral was under renovations, the charm remained untouched.
St Patrick's. A beautiful cathedral. The statues and altars were stunning. Such a feeling of awe as we walked through the church. Peopled moved about quietly and at a timed pace. Will go again.

Ethereal. This Cathedral is an absolutely divine experience. The intricate facade welcomes you into a lovely, serene church, with a massive organ and well-made alcoves celebrating various saints. The stained glass panels and sculptures can't be missed.

Family Vacation. Very awesome in daylight as well as night. It is huge and historical. Was holding the Spanish mass when we toured it. Doing remodeling, so that is why not excellent as alter area was being redone.
Beauty in the inner city. Even visiting while the cathedral is being worked on, didn't diminish the beauty of this beautiful place of worship. The workmanship of this place is way beyond words.
A must see. This is definitely the most beautiful cathedral I've ever seen. Its definitely a must see if you haven't yet

You never think this was in the middle of New York City. For such a beautiful and HUGE church, it is nestled in the centre of a major city. A welcome calm in the storm of traffic that is New York, and somewhere you can take a second to appreciate the older side of the city.

History Architecture Art = Awesome & Free!!. This place has been here forever and it is a free haven to rest, to see incredible art and amazing architecture. Quietly and respectfully walk around the entire structure when ever you want - you can even take photos - but not when there is a service in progress - that would be rude! It is usually pretty cool inside even in the heat of the summer days. There is so much to see - I stop in whenever I am nearby.
Am I in Europe. I was surprised when I walked into St Patrick's, this looks like Cathedral I have seen in Europe. Nice piece of history.

Smack dab in the middle . This is literally in the middle of loads of shops and a wicked popular area with high foot traffic. Breathtaking architecture and I love the St. Therese relic in the mini side chapel in the cathedral. I always stop here every time I visit the city.

Iconic Church. St. Patrick's Cathedral was one of the places I had to visit when I first went to NYC in 2002. It didn't look like much on the outside, but it's very big on the inside and very nice. I tell all my friends to go see the famous church. You can get there by subway and it's not far from Rockefeller Center.

Prominent Landmark still Undergoing Renovations. Even though it is undergoing renovations, you can still admire this cathedral. The NYTs reported it would take around five years to finish so it will be another couple of years before it is restored.
in construction. Even when it is a beautiful church, we couldnt appreciate it very well because it is undergoing some construction/repairs
Special place to visit. One the real good cathedrals to visit whilst in New York, great place to visit and buy a candle for a loved one, topical wonderful architecture and well worth going to
NYC At Easter. Beautiful! just to walk in and breath.....take it in slowly. They don't mind you taking pictures, either.

It's a Peaceful, Easy Feeling..... Just a very Holy place, notwithstanding many, many tourists who may not have the same religious knowledge and understand the proper behavior inside such a place, it is an amazing place to share with EVERYONE.... Embodies the solemnity and history of the Catholic Church, I felt at home and in the presence of the Father
Welcome!

Precious jewel in the middle of the city. Amazing!!! Beautiful!! They are making a lot of restoration so part of the Cathedral can't be seeing but it's a must see place located on the east side of 5th Avenue between 50st and 51st
Impressive.... Impressive. A true landmark. However, the perennially ongoing construction is quite perplexing. Combine it with a tour of Rockefeller Center.

Must see . Incredible church to see right on 5th Ave with a ton of history to take in. Beautiful stained glass and wood work, and no one will rush you through. One of my favorite parts of visiting the city.

Beautiful even when shrouded in scaffolding. Storied cathedral in Midtown Manhattan is beautiful, even when the interior is masked by a repair scaffolding. The carving, stained glass, and deeply religious calm deserve to be experienced firsthand
Beautiful inside and out. So gorgeous. Under renovations and cleaning at the time :( The stained glass and the walls are just elaborate and something to see in person.

Beautiful haven. It's in one of the busiest areas of NY, of course, and we stay in the area often. St Patrick's is such a beautiful haven... a place of prayer, first. But a place where you can meditate, take in the beautiful architecture, just be a human. And think about the inside of your life. Not the outside glitz that is so apparent on the street. It's in the perfect place in New York. A treasure.

Undergoing Renovations 7/15. Beautiful. Spiritual. Amazing craftsmanship. A Holy Place. Under construction, but doing a great job. The woodwork and marble/stone work is breathtaking. As well as the stained glass windows.....

A contrast to the glitz of the Rockefell Plaza. In 1853 Architect James Renwick was engaged to design the current Cathedral, and it was opened formally on May 25, 1879. The spires were added between 1885 and 1888. The Lady Chapel was completed in 1908. In 1927 the sanctuary was enlarged, the choir gallery was rebuilt, new chancel and gallery organs were built, a new baptistery was added and new nave flooring and pews were put in place. Also worth visiting is the Cathedral of St. John the Divine in Morningside Heights.

America's Parish -the New St. Pat's. Renovations should be completed by the end of 2015. This cathedral is actually NOT the first cathedral in NYC to bear the name St. Patrick's. The old, original St. Pat's still exists in lower Manhattan near the Bowery and is worth a visit, just for historical reasons. The other 5000+ reviews have said everything that needs to be said about the 'new' St. Pat's and how much it means to both New Yorkers and the nation. I would only add a very few minor points. First. This is a church, and a parish church at that. For this reason tourists are going to find a lot of locals actually using this place as a church. Please respect their peace, prayer and privacy when moving about, talking, taking photos, etc. Second. If you ever get 'overtaxed' by the hustle and bustle of Manhattan, come in here for a real break. Religious or not, it will 'recharge' your batteries and you will leave refreshed and reinvigorated. Third. You can go next door to The Rock (Rockefeller Center) for two things: a snack/meal, and a great birds-eye photo 'top-down' of St. Pat's from the observation decks. Fourth. If you want a fuller experience, check the cathedral website for times of services, music rehearsal sessions and tour dates/times. 60-90 minute tours are free, but donations are gratefully accepted. Finally, don't forget or ignore the gift shops, I say shops because not only is there one inside, but there is one outside as well. Enjoy!

Largest Catholic Cathedral in US and soon will be as good as when new. Once the external and internal work has been finished by Christmas 2015 (or even for the pope's visit in Sep 2015) this cathedral - the largest Catholic one in US will be as new. It is a spectacular building with wonderful carvings and a mix of religious shrines/ altars reflecting the US's mixed catholic heritage. Still has real candles - stop and light one and remember to light one say a prayer to save the soul of someone who has no one to remember them.

Under Renovation but worth a visit.. Beautiful old church in the middle of the city. Currently under restoration but still a beautiful historic building. Not Catholic go to a mass anyway the organ and stained glass is stunning. 136 year old chuch with great character.

Alleluia. I had walked by it a couple of times whilst walking of 5th Avenue but went to Sunday Mass at 10.30am. I managed to find a seat as I arrived 10 minutes before the start of Mass but after than the Cathedral was full with standing room only. Some of the Cathedral is being renovated (near the altar and towards the back of the Church) but you can still walk around and look at the beautiful stained glass windows. Even if you are not Catholic it is worth attending one of their services just to experience the Cathedral in all its glory
A sight to behold. Absolutely stunning stained glass, architecture, the atmosphere is so incredibly peaceful. It is definitely a must see in NYC!

Gorgeous, a must visit, heart of NYC. Stunning and Beautiful. Closest thing to Europe/England we have! Stumbled on a wedding taking place and just gorgeous. How lucky is a bride to be married here? Very large

Attractive cathedral. Visited this attractive cathedral whilst walking around mid-town on a recent visit to New York (May 2015). At the time there was some renovation work going on, but it was still possible to go inside and enjoy most of the
Prayers to give thanks. Always a favorite place to visit. Meditating in the pew and looking in awe at the architecture and stain glass images is inspirational.
breathtaking. amazing detail in this catholic church - It is like something out of a movie. Rich with color and details, any religion can appreciate all aspects of this beautiful cathedral.

St. Patrick's Cathedral is one of the greatest in the US. St. Patrick's Cathedral is one of the greatest buildings one can visit in NY. If you enjoy seeing great Cathedrals, St. Patrick's is one of the finest in the US. The stain glass windows are also stunning. Of course it's not as old as the great European cathedrals but it's every bit as magnificent.
Construction. The construction and restoration going on will be worth it in the end, but really put a damper on things this time around.
St. Patrick's is a cool place. :). A nice place to sit and think and pray. It was cool and inviting. I am not Catholic, but I did feel welcome. Beautiful place.
Beautiful Cathedral. This is a beautiful cathedral. Scaffolding was inside, but didn't deter from admiring the building. It was a wonderful resting place to get away from the crowds.

Grand dame of the catholic church in NYC - even if it is named after a welshman.. Definitely worth a visit - one of the many fine churches in Manhattan but probably the biggest. The high quality stonework and glazing are testament to the artisans who have worked on the building and who are now restoring it. Very much part and parcel of the Catholic church's life in NYC.

Lovely Church!. I visited the St. Patrick's Cathedral recently while on a trip to New York. A beautiful building, it looks particularly spectacular at night. Easy to locate in Manhattan, a visit is highly recommended!

Beautiful Church in the Big City. St. Patrick's is a beautiful church. It is being restored, so there are a lot of "restoration" items in the church. There were a lot of visitors the day we went, and we took a lot of beautiful pictures of the inside and outside of the church. Great pictures of a beautiful place to visit.

New Cathedral in Manhattan. The inside of the cathedral was in refurbishment as of middle of June. The cathedral was quite new and it may not be so impressive for Europeans or those who have had lots of travels to Europe to see the churches. The stained glasses were vivid and beautiful though.

Under Remodel. if you're planning on visiting this summer be advised it is under a remodeling project. You will not get to see the true beauty of this marvelous place. I will be back next year to see the finished product
Gorgeous!!!!. Hands down, the most beautiful thing I have ever seen. The stained glass is amazing. We lit a candle for my father. The architecture will leave you speechless.
Beautiful. The cathedral has beautiful sites, statues, and stained glass windows, but currently under construction. There is no cost for entry.

Beautiful Catholic Church. St. Patrick's has finished the restoration of the outside of this magnificent church. It is a historic landmark of New York. The restoration work inside is supposed to be finished in December, 2015. There is a gift shop inside the church. Visitors are always welcome. In the past, I have been able to attend Mass when the Archbishop of New York is presiding. The church is beautiful on both the outside and inside.

Lovely. Right in the middle of the city, falls midway between Times square and Central park. Huge church, spectacular glass paintings and sculptures make it a must see in NYC. Currently, a renovation is hampering the beauty but it is still worth the visit. Got to see it to experience it.
Worth your time. It's an incredible structure. Worth taking the time to see. I've never attended church with so many people and video/camera. Worth taking the time to attend mass. (I'm not catholic)
Just beaaaautiful renovated!. After many years of passing by St. Patricks in renovation it is finally finished and it looks incredible!
Beautiful church.. Such amazing architecture a must see even if you don't go to church. During the day there are times you can go through minus the service.

Solemn pilgrimage. After a long day of discovering Manhattan, it was great to find solace inside this great cathedral. It is under renovation but we could still walk around the side altars and soak in its beauty and stunning architecture.
Keep the faith. Went to Mass in St Patricks Cathedral on our visit it is a very beautiful church- but lots of scaffolding in the inside.

One of the Best in the World. I have been to Cathedrals and Basilicas all over the world and I still love going to this cathedral just for the beauty, size and reflective spirit you experience while in the church. Try to experience one of the "high masses" with the choir and extra religious pomp and circumstance.

Renovations at the front. The windows are very beautiful and large. There is renovation work with scaffolding covering the front alter area of the cathedral. The cathedral is dwarfed by the surrounding buildings.

Similar to English Churches. Situated on posh Fifth Avenue near the Rockefeller Center. However, the original one was in Lower Manhattan. Based on the Cathedral in Cologne, Germany. No doubt, the most spectacular ecclesiastical building in New York. Full of Gothic details (spires), with a Latin cross floor plan, its facade with three porches and bronze doors, its marble recalling Classical antiquity. Make sure to visit the Lady Chapel and enjoy its magnificent stained glass windows.La Piedad – similar to the one in St. Peter's Basilica in Rome is, however, much larger than Michelangelo's pietà.People from Eastern Europe: pay attention to the chapel recently added in homage to the Polish saint, Our Lady of Czestochowa.Currently under renovation.
Beautiful Architecture. Currently being "renovated" so there is scaffolding everywhere! Still a worthwhile place to visit if you are in NYC
Home. Love this place. Can't walk in w/o crying. Native New Yorker, many hours here, some repairs in place

majestic cathedral with cryptic artwork. This was a great, free excursion in between other stops in NYC. Hopefully will be even better once the scaffolding is removed from the front of the interior space soon. Wish there was some handout guiding interpretation of the beautiful stained glass and statuary scenes.

Beautiful Cathedral. Went here for a Sunday service while visiting New York. The Cardinal gave the service and the choir sang at the 10:15 AM service. Got here twenty minutes early and already, the place was packed. The Cathedral is beautiful. It is in the process of being redone and the scaffolding goes to the ceiling, which is at least 15 stories high. The service was wonderful. After the service we walked around to see all the side chapels. A must see even if you are not a Roman Catholic, such as us.

St. Patrick's Cathedral. Beautiful Cathedral with lots of history. So much to see in a church ... on left and right sides the beautifully made sections for saints with their idols and candles for lighting and praying. The Cathedral seemed be under renovations .. there were scaffolds set up in the front area. Security searches bags before entering there areas where the pews are. It is one of historical landmark of NYC ... a must See.
Magnificent building. Sadly, major construction work was ongoing at the time of our visit and this detracted from the majesty of the building. Nevertheless, it is worth a visit.

St Patrick's Cathedral. We went here in february and was mesmerised by the tranquility and amount of candles lit, let alone the aesthetics of the inside of the church just incredible. I remember watching on the news after 9/11 and all the families of missing people congregated here.

Very Affecting.... So,I'm Irish..like real Irish, not Irish-American. So, I see this church is special. It has been cleaned after 100 years and inside you could be in ROME, except the windows are all sponsored by Irish Families (O'Neills, Walshes) and various Dioceses (Newark, NJ). For me, I found this very emotional, generations of emigrants (successful and less so) giving what they could to build this stunning edifice. I cried. Light a candle.

Beautiful church. Even though there was construction ongoing, it is a beautiful church. Especially outside and the neighboring gardens are spectacular.For a donation you can go in to see the church otherwise there is guided tours.

Stunning . Came from top of the rocks and had this on "things to see" if we could list, we were not disappointed, straight across from Rockefeller centre you will find a stunning architectural cathedral in the midst of a makeover but don't let that put you off.

St. Patrick's - A Midtown Manhattan Treasure. St. Patrick's Cathedral is stunning with its Gothic Revival/English Gothic style architecture. For approximately 3 years scaffolding has surrounded the church as it is being cleaned and restored. Expected completion is the end of 2015. The good news is the church's main entrance on 5th Avenue is mostly complete and you don't have to walk under the scaffolding to enter. The difference after the cleaning is quite noticeable. But, enter you must for a view of this magnificent church on 50th and 5th Avenue. Some of the best views and photos of St. Patrick's can be found from The Palace Hotel on the Madison Avenue and 50th. Tranquil, serene and a great place to visit.Just a very short walk from Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral is worth the visit. Tours are available and everyone is welcomed. Great stop as you explore NYC. After you visit, you can continue walking east on 50th Street to Park Avenue for stunning views of St. Bartholomew Church, the Met Life Building, both on Park Avenue (and the Met Life beautifully colorfully lit at night) and then eastward to Lexington and 50th for a great photo of the Chrysler Building. After I stopped to photograph these sites, others stopped to take selfies especially at 50th and Lexington for photos of the Chrysler Building. From St. Patrick's Cathedral on 5th Avenue take the walk on 50th through midtown for terrific architecture and photos.

Beautiful Building. Another must see for anyone in New York for the first time. This building just stands out from everything around it. Magnificent architecture. Never ceases to amaze me how this sort of building was made in their time. We would struggle to do this today.

Beautiful gothic church. This church / cathedral is an icon of NYC. It's a catholic one. It's beautiful both outside and inside. Inside you can find an altar to the Virgen the Guadalupe, which impressed me as Mexican.

Beauty and rest on 5th Avenue. Even if you are not a church goer or a Christian this is a lovely place to enter for some peace and rest in the midst of the turmoil on 5th Avenue. I have been a number of times and heard choirs, seen bewildered people and watched priests practice their ceremonies.At present there is a lot of scaffolding that spoils the view of the altar area - but still well worth a visit.
Breath-Taking. The building structure and architect was stunning. Absolutely beautiful!!! A must see if you visit NYC. Not far from Empire building.
St.Patrick's Cathedral NYC. Remember coming here when I was a Little girl. Enjoy having Family Adventure in the city. We visit the church it's still beautiful to see.

Largest Cathedral in the USA.. By no means the best example I've seen in New York, but it is vast and has beautiful stained glass windows and architecture. Unfortunately it was being restored when I was there so I wasn't able to see all of it - maybe my view would've been different. Get in early if you're planning to go to Mass - especially at Christmas.

Beautiful!!. This is a must stop!! Very beautiful and stunning. Even with the renovations going on; still a must stop! They are supposed to be done with those this September. We took the free tour and the guide was informative and wonderful. He gave us a 90 minute tour. Really glad we went to the free tour. Check the website for dates. They are only like 2x a week at 10am. I bought a few gifts at the gift shop both in the cathedral and the one they own next door. Beautiful items for sale. I stopped by the St. Jude chapel and lit a candle, too. Don't let the renovations keep you from visiting. Stunning cathedral!!
Gorgeous . I've been here for two weddings. It's beautiful. The architecture is amazing. If you have never been there it is worth a visit. You won't be disappointed.

Amazing. Beautiful Cathedral architectural E outstanding unfortunately under renovations right now. You can still see a lot of the Cathedral with the altar under construction the full beauty of this cathedral is left to be desired. I would love to visit again when it is finished.

Save your visit inside until construction is over. The front of the cathedral is gorgeous and with the sun shining on it in the afternoon, it looks almost like it is lit up! Beautiful, but as others have said, the inside and the altar area are undergoing extreme renovation so don't plan your trip or your day around a visit to this historically (usually) beautiful Catholic Church. Unless of course, you think a bunch of very tall scaffolding could be a religious experience! Even with these negatives, the crowds there this afternoon were large.

Beautiful but under renovations.... This is a beautiful cathedral. I've been there before in 2006 and now I came back to find it under renovations. I think it's great NYC is recovering this amazing cathedral because it really is worth it. If you are catholic, it will have a special meaning to you, because it's an amazing place to pray. People are usually respectful!

Renovations...... The church is undergoing lots of renovations so there is lots scaffolding. The Tiffany altar is mostly covered. The stainglass windows are beautiful. Be sure to look at bronze front doors. They are beautifully embossed.
A must Visit place. this place is great for prayers and for picture taking at the same time. The architecture was so nice and the people visiting are very encouraging.

Beautiful Gothic architecture, but construction is in progress. If you are religious, you may find extra value in a visit to this cathedral. But even if you are not, you are likely to be impressed with the amazing architecture and beautiful stained glass windows.St. Patrick's is across the street from Rockefeller Center, and if you are going there you shouldn't miss the cathedral. There's no fee (though donations are appreciated) and you can just walk in and walk around.The cathedral is of a classic Gothic design, and attempt to replicate the amazing structures of Europe in New York. I'd say that it might not quite compete with some of the great ones I've seen in Europe, but still is impressive and beautiful enough to be worth a visit.Unfortunately, at the time of our visit in May, 2015, the central area of the cathedral was occupied by massive scaffolding and construction equipment, which made it hard to truly appreciate the cathedral. But even so, we didn't regret stopping in to see it.Note: If the front doors are open, which they often are in warm weather, on your way out look down the main aisle toward the big pipe organ at the back and the doors. The doors frame the statue of Atlas across the street, an interesting (but very difficult to photograph) effect.

A must see!. There are no words to describe this beautiful church. I was lucky enough to have walked in just as mass was starting so I stayed. What an experience to hear the organ play and participate in the service.
Amazing exterior. Truly amazing to look at especially in amongst all the skyscrapers dissapointing that it was full of scaffolding when we went but that can't be helped.

Peaceful & Magnificent. The St. Patricks Cathedral really is a show stopper! Walking along 5th avenue whether you are doing some shopping or just generally going for a walk is something that I guarantee everyone will have a look at.The gothic architecture is like something of Gaudi's in Barcelona, almost like a mini La Sagrada Familia in the middle of midtown Manhattan. With its stain glassed windows and chapels on both sides it really is an eye catcher.

Gorgeous Example of Gothic Architecture. Breathtaking experience!!! Everyone should visit while in New York irrespective of your religion. Incredible example of gothic architecture, with beautiful diminutive chapels off to the sides. The statues of the saints and with their historical descriptions are very moving.
Spiritual and peaceful. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a "must" visit on every trip to NYC. It is beautiful and exquisitely built. I love the scents, stained glass, statues and welcoming atmosphere.

Beautiful and historic . Must see if you are a catholic visiting downtown manhattan. It's undergoing a full restoration which will be most impressive when its done. Take the audio tour. 7 am mass on sunday is 30 minutes.

Beautiful. It's an extremely beautiful and ornate place. Unfortunately when we went it was mostly covered in scaffolding.But really, don't let that deter you - it's really quite something to see, inside and out.

One of my favorite places. The cathedral is being renovated right now so a lot of it is covered by scaffolding.St. Patrick's is one of my very favorite places to visit. The stained glass windows, wood carvings and architectural details are so beautiful. The grandeur and scale is just remarkable, not to mention the huge pipe organ. Amazing, amazing...don't pass this one up on your tour!

so beautiful and trankuilo. went a few years back and was totally amaze at how beautiful and peaceful it was...the mass was done in a fashion that people from all religions could appreciate.a must for all visitors

Under renovation don't go at the moment. I am sure it is a beautiful place to visit, but all you see at the moment is towers of scaffolding. Save yourself time and go when it is finished, I am sure it will be a shining and wonderful jewel in New York

Pax amid the bustle of NYC. Been here a few times before but always worth a visit for Mass, or if not that way inclined to appreciate the building. The scaffolding ( restoration work ) is an obvious distraction but nevertheless there is plenty to view.... Beautiful stained glass window.... Lovely small side chapels .... And the peace .... even though there is usually a surplus of tourists around. Sadly there are the necessary security checks on entry but carried out with courtesy.
Cathedral. This is a lovely Gothic cathedral built for the Irish immigrants in New York City. It is now undergoing renovations so unfortunately you won't be able to see it in all its glory.

Exterior looking pristine, however.... The cathedral is stunning where the exterior has been cleaned, however muc cleaning and restoration is going on inside. You cannot at all appreciate what lies beneath the extensive scaffolding. I have seen it in tact and await the completion of this renovation project. If you plan to come to NY in the future find out completion date or status. It will be worth the visit- can still go to services and visit! Now!
Well worth a visit. some restoration work ongoing but this did not spoil the visit or the atmosphere, a quiet little sanctuary in the heart of a busy city, wonderful.

Sanctuary. We went to 10:15 Mass and so it was not exactly a site seeing venture. However, the building is absolutely breathtaking. We had both been there before, but it is indeed an overpowering presence inside and out, even during the present stage of renovation. Only recommendation is that when you go, be respectful. As much as it is an attraction, it is more importantly a church.

WAIT TO VISIT...................... Building is magnificent! Stone work, art work, workmanship, beauty and size are overpowering.BUT, THE INTERIOR AND EXTERIOR ARE UNDER MAJOR RENOVATION!While it is still worth seeing, it would be a better place to visit on your next rip to NYC.

Beautiful building.. St. Patrick's church is such a stunning looking building from the outside, we decided to see if it was as good inside and we weren't disappointed despite the scaffolding and renovation work that was going on. The stained glass is absolutely beautiful as are the small chapels which people use for prayer. I'd definitely recommend a visit and can't wait to see it again when the work is finished

Amazing!!!. St Patrick's Cathedral is a "Must See" when visiting NYC! Right now there is tons of scaffolding as they do some restoration, but it is still worth going in! And did I mention it's FREE!! The only thing I didn't like was that it is very "touristy" now. When I visited 15 years ago there wasn't security and audio tours it was just a simple beautiful church that you could sit quietly in and have time with God!

Under renovation in April. This is a beautiful church but couldn't see much in April as the church is undergoing a massive renovation. But if you are in 5th Ave take a walk along to the church, you won't be disappointed.
Awesome. An iconic building in Manhattan, beautiful architecture outside and an equally awesome interior. A visit to their souvenir shop is a must.
Beautiful oasis. A sanctuary in the city. Specular building with a peaceful interior, despite the crowds. Defiantly worth taking an hour of your day to recharge your soul here.
Renovation complete- and worth it. This is a beautiful cathedral. Actually went to mass there as well. The bishop was a wonderful speaker, inspirational. Choir is amazing and the acoustics amazing.

Not much like it in US. USA have a lot of stuff, great "older" buildings is not one of them (if you are from Europe and compare) but this is a very pretty building and i would say definitely worth passing by for a visit.
Beautiful old church. Absolutely beautiful, but something I liked was looking at it from the outside and seeing this old church sitting next to modern buildings. quite a sight.
OMG!. This is so beautiful! If you have the opportunity to visit, DO IT! was amazing and the kids loved it. Very nice and peaceful. I could spend hours here.

Go to one of the tours for the full experience. We toured St. Patrick's Cathedral - they only offer the tours a few times a month and you have to check the website to find out the dates. I recommend doing the tour because we learned SO MUCH MORE about the cathedral than we would have without the tour. I loved our tour guide - she was so knowledgeable. We did not get the chance to go to mass there, which I would have loved to do. The cathedral is currently undergoing a $170 Million restoration. It is going to be absolutely beautiful when it is finished. Even with the scaffolding, I am so glad that we went and I would not snob it off because of the construction. Go on the tour to see the most and learn the details of what you can see.

So much beauty. This church for many years has been under refurbishment, BUT great things come to those who wait. You definitely can see the progress from the last three years, you can also still see the beauty. I get goosebumps now just thinking about it. This is forever a tradition to go to St. Patrick's whenever I'm in town

Too Much Scaffolding ThisTrip. Unfortunately for tourists this beautiful cathedral was undergoing renovations and/or cleanup, so a lot of the wonders inside were obscured. Nevertheless, the outside is beautiful and what you could see inside, was worth a quick trot around. So many angles from which to see this church, especially from around the Fifth Avenue and 51st Street aspect. Don't be put off by the construction, especially if you're not sure you're coming back!

Unfortunate scaffolding. This is a truly breathtaking building....HOWEVER at the moment the interior is adorned with a rather large amount of scaffolding. If you can out off your visit for a couple of months then do so.

Wonderful American Cathedral. I really need to get back after renovation, but what I was able to check out from mass was impressive. I had to search internet for some history. I believe they do offer some tours, that did not work with our schedule, would check into that in the future.
So Beautiful!. The work to restore the stone to original beauty is amazing. This building alone testifies to the glory of God! Thank you!

Beautiful church even during construction. We recently visited St. Patrick's Church in New York City and I would definitely recommend a visit if you're in the area. The architecture is beautiful even if it under reconstruction. Worth the visit.

Marble and stone . Great for architects especially if you have visited an European cathedral before because you'll get better the feeling of this building and its roots. Honestly it's a humble building compare to the British cathedrals but still a magnificent masterpiece in the middle of NYC! Go ahead an visit it!

Church. St. Pat's is a beautiful church but there was remodeling going on in the inside so the scaffolding was throughout the entire church. Took away from the view - we have visited here before. We lit a candle for my brother who has lung cancer and said a few prayers.

So glad we went. We are practicing Catholics so when we realized we would be in NY for Easter, we wanted to make sure to attend Mass here. The 1015 Mass with the Cardinal requires (free, but preordered) tickets and that wasn't necessary for us - so we went to the 0800 Mass (without music) just to be sure there wouldn't be a problem. What a lovely cathedral. The scaffolding is up for the construction but despite it, I was so honored to be able to attend Mass there. Can't believe how fast they get everyone through for Communion :) Will definitely be back to see the finishing touches one day.

Its will be beautiful after restauration is completed. It is a big church, beautiful inside and with beautiful stained glass. But it is not as authentic as the impressive churches found in Europe (Italy, Spain, France, Czeck Republic).Still worth a stop while walking along the Fifth avenue.

Always learn something different!. while much of it was being restored, loved walking in the back of the altar, seeing the small chapels and the crypts underneath the altar. Always reminds me of the cathedrals in Europe and S.A. What was amazing was how quiet the workers were in restoration while we were in there....even power equip had noise abatement. was pretty incredible.

Great potential after restoration is complete. Most of the interior is behind tarps and scaffolding right now. I'm sure it will be lovely once completed, but right now it was a disappointing visit. If you are walking by, its worth a quick stop inside since there is no charge, but I wouldn't go out of my way right now.

Beautiful Church. Visited St. Patrick's for a second time just to look around. I would love to go to mass here but have not made it yet. The church is so lovely and a work of art. The detail, the statues, the stained glass is all very beautiful. You do not need to be a Catholic to appreciate the detail and beauty of this church. Worth a walk around!

Under construction. Beautiful architecture and stainglass windows with incredible marble but difficult to truly appreciate it whilst it was under construction. Very easy to just pop in, say a prayer or have a look at the great design and building as it is so centrally located. I am not sure I would go out of my way for it until construction is complete later in the year.
Nothing special. It's just BIG. Other than that, there's really nothing much to recommend this cathedral - certainly in comparison with European ones. Free to get in.

A Beautiful Cathedral Even With All the Construction Going On.. We visited on Easter Sunday and we got there after the mass. We went inside to pray and light a candle. It has been 41 years I last heard mass here.. The beautiful architecture still impressed me. It is worth your time and effort to see this cathedral if you are in New York City.

Must visit in nyc. As part of American history this church has held funeral mass for babe Ruth, joe DiMaggio, Robert Kennedy and even Celia Cruz. Beautiful building is getting a restoration but is still amazing
Weekend visit. Absolutely amazing to see. Must go . Just massive , beautiful place. It's under construction but still worth the tour.

A Must See. We visit every single trip we take, always light a candle or two, you don't have to be a Christian to get a feeling of inspiration from the time you walk in to the time you leave. It is really something to see if you have never been. This magnificent structure will give you a sense of awe when you walk in.
Peaceful moment. Love going into St Patricks for a few moments of peace. Currently undergoing a lot of renovation so can't get full effect of how beautiful it is. Still worth the effort

Beauty hidden under construction scaffolding. Attended Mass recently at St. Patrick's Cathedral, and a little research would have served us well! We noticed that the sides of the building were covered in construction scaffolding ~ of course maintenance of a structure such as this is important and must be on-going. That is why the front, facing 5th Ave., is spectacularly white and clean. Was a bit disappointed when we arrived for Mass to see that the altar area and transept are also covered by scaffolding for the interior renovations. Upon inquiring, I was told the work should be done by December 2015. St. Patrick's is still stunning and worth a visit, despite not being able to see it in all its glory ~ just don't be surprised.

Worth the visit. I came here with my brother, parents, and husband. We ALL enjoyed it. The detail is just so magnificent and there is so much to see. I enjoyed reading about all the saints that are in the nooks around the cathedral. Even if you just have a minute, it's worth stepping into this building.

St. Patrick. Stepping up to the amazing bronze relief front doors, felt like being in Florence. To create such beauty, for common men and women to see and to touch, is a sobering calm. True there is so much interior scaffolding, and detours around to distract anyone from the true purpose of this cathedral. Yet Palm Sunday was as truly wonderful experience.Our tour guide, though understated, relayed the fact that this was the cleanest and whitest he has ever seen this church. You could hear the pride and wonderment that in the half a century of his remembrances, this mighty building was never as amazing. Do also take note of the cleaned stained glass, and the vibrancy of the renewed colors. See the dingy before pictures, and the after glorious colors.

Breathtaking....even with the renovations. I attended the Easter Vigil service here. There are extensive renovations taking place at the Cathedral currently, so there is lots of scaffolding to the front of the church that doesn't let you take in the full grandeur. From the back half (the un-scaffolded half), you can tell what the front should look like.If you plan on attending a service, check the schedule and try to attend when Cardinal Dolan is saying mass.One disappointment is people seem to forget that this is a place of worship. There were people using their iPads and phones to record the service and take pictures. There were also people wandering up and down the side aisles to sightsee during the service.

Fantastic stained glass. Although they were renovating the church when we visited, it was still a stunning place to visit. A very large cathedral, with excellent stained glass and wonderful intricate stone work. It was a slow lovely to sit inside away from the hustle and bustle of NYC and the rain at times too. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful cathedral worth a visit. This beautiful cathedral, near Rockefeller Center (beautiful view on the cathedral from Top of the Rock) is really worth a visit. It is now being renovated, but still open to public.

Construction Continues. If you're Catholic, this is the place. Check out the mass schedule and join for mass. Cardinal Dolan frequents (of course.) The construction continues which is really distracting; arrive early enough to get a seat. Warning: the non-Catholics tend to wander about and take photos during the service. (What can you do?) Take some $1's so you can light a few candles.

Beautiful Sanctuary In A Sometimes Hectic City. Just across the street from Rockerfeller Centre, St. Patrick's Cathedral offers a chance to find some calm and tranquility from the business of life and the city. Although somewhat overshadowed by massive skycrapers, St. Patrick's still stands out as an integral part of "The Big Apple".The architecture is refined and stunning both outside and inside. With daily free guided tours St Patrick's is definitely worth a visit regardless of your faith.

Symbol of Christ. This place is firstly beautiful. It is a very nice place to visit and if you have the time; worship and have mass at. I recommend you bring a camera, as this is a kodak photo opportunity. I also recommend you bring comfortable shoes as the place is actually pretty good in size.

Palm Sunday ~ a day in the life of a catholic in NYc. Love that in the busy life visiting NYC we were able to attend mass today. The message was beautiful and I felt all who were there felt the same way. Whether you are catholic or not, the clergy welcomes all to his cathedral with open arms. Today is a good day.

An enduring symbol of New York history and culture. What a beautiful spot in New York. Being a tourist in this city can be overwhelming. This cathedral offers a (relatively) quiet point of reflection in the chaos of NYC. Currently, the church is undergoing a renovation, so portions may be covered in scaffolding. Whether you are particularly religious or not, folks can appreciate St. Patrick's Cathedral for the history, beauty, and architecture. It's like a classical hold-out form the neighbors. You should absolutely visit.
Restoration. Was being restored when we visited so the scaffolding took away from the beauty somewhat. Still it is a stunning building and is worth a visit.

I became so overwhelmed and cried. The cathedral was astonishing and felt so Cal. There were lots of repairs and a service taking place. I was so overwhelmed and was there for what seemed like hours. U even went to confession. Beautiful and balancing experience in the middle of.nyc.

And it's a very big "YES" from me!!. Infact, "Yes, Yes and Yes.". I love the front, a series of 5 spires streaming upwards, in a clean line. And those bronze doors, just beautiful. And here right in the middle of 5th Ave - on Main Street, where a church is supposed to be - so they tell me.I love the interior too. The whole building focuses in on the altar, and the steps leading up to it.At night, the hanging lamps, and the lighting generally - just great. In the day light the lower line of stain glass you can actually make sense of. And the above stain glass above the apts - the first time I have seen this, is very good.Commenced in 1858 and fully completed in 1976 - already in 2012 it was in need of a major clean - at a then estimated cost of $177 million. And today they are approaching the completion.Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.

Family Vacation. Lot's of harsh reviews out there due to renovations...ignore them. Yes, there's lots of scaffolding. Yes, you can't see the ceiling or the south exterior of the Cathedral. But you can still visit all of the individual chapels and shrines inside the Cathedral and the Adoration Chapel. It is a must see with or without renovations!

A hidden beauty. Completed in 1878, the Neo-Gothic Roman Catholic cathedral is a landmark in New York City. Enjoy the silence and beautiful decoration of the church, and escape for a few minutes from the hustle and bustle of the big city. Unfortunately the renovation is hiding its beautiful facade.

Beautiful Architecture-- Gothic Style. Watching the St. Patrick's Day Parade from this venue is inspiring. This cathedral is overwhelmingly beautiful. You can go inside and light votive candles if you choose.

Magnificent . I've been to many cathedrals in the New World and this is the most impressive so far. The organ is pretty impressive. It has a beautiful "capilla" of the Virgin Mary that is more comfortable than the church I belong to. Basically it's an exaggeration of art. A true beauty of love, religion, dedication and art

Impressive but under construction. An impressive Cathedral. We popped in after going to the Top of the Rock and there was a sermon in progress. The back for full of tourists and as you walk through you will notice a lot of building work going on. However, don't let that put you off.
Renovations in Progress. It's a beautiful cathedral. The front half of the facility is undergoing some pretty serious renovations, so it doesn't look nearly as grand as it actually is.

Wish I'd checked here first. I do wish I had checked here first. Plenty of reviews recently state very clearly that the cathedral is under construction, but I didn't look. So I was very disappointed when I arrived and the place, inside and out, is covered with so much scaffolding that it's almost impossible to see it. You can see a bit of the side chapels and the alter, but the overall effect is really ruined. I happened to be there on one of the viewing days for Cardinal Eagen, which added police presence and a line of mourners to the equation, and it felt wrong and intrusive to be sightseeing at someone's viewing. Again, all my fault for just deciding to hit it spur of the moment while in town for business without doing a bit of research. Still, I'd say for right now, if you have limited sightseeing time in NYC, focus on other things until the renovations are further along.

A must see . Beautiful cathedral in da middle of 5th ave. well worth goin in to say a prayer and light a candle. There's a small shop inside where you can buy holy medals, rosary beads etc. you can also leave a donation and leave a note on books provide to say where your visiting from and and date it.

A Must See for Anyone Who Believes in Faith. Massive church. Never been to a mass but have been there many times. It is a serene place to pray. You need tickets for some masses. The architecture is beautiful.
