Cathedral under construction but the Cardinal was wonderful. Sunday morning at the Cathedral. I was fortunate as mass was said by the Cardinal . He delivers the prayers in a simple kind heartfelt way. Another amazing experience in this great city.
Amazing. This is my favourite cathedral in NYC. So gorgeous inside and out. I swear they have been doing renovations for months and months. I can't wait until it is all finished.

Beautiful Church to Visit. While we were in NYC for my daughter's run in the 2014 NYC Marathon, my wife and I had time to visit St. Patrick's Cathedral. It is a beautiful church. The only problem we encountered was that they were renovating the church outside and inside so we were not able to really enjoyed the beauty of the church. It is a must visit if you are in NYC. We were glad we went to see this beautiful church. We have always heard about it so we wanted to see it. I would recommend going there.

Unbelievable experience. Attended mass at St. Patrick's and to our fortune Timothy Cardinal Dolan was the celebrant and gave the homily. Unbelievable experience and reverent service at St. Patrick's with Cardinal Dolan.

Catholicism at its Finest. I have been to St. Pat's a variety of times over the years and each time I am more moved than the last time. Cardinal Dolan is an amazing speaker who provides visitors with a heart-felt message that directly relates to scripture and all can relate to. NY is blessed to have him. Just make sure you get to mass a bit early as the seats fill up. Although the cathedral is under construction, you can still see the fine attention to detail in the creation of this cathedral. I am so amazed at the love of Christ demonstrated in the artistic expression throughout this cathedral.

A must see for Catholics. I try to hit a mass there every visit and since they have many daily masses, it is almost always possible. It is large and impersonal compared to your local community church but the stained glass windows and architecture is breathtaking. I like the feeling of being in a church alone with my thoughts and prayers while so much is going on a round me. You can get lost in your own spiritual world despite being in a huge cathedral with many visits there to look around. Light a candle and say a prayer for a lost loved one if you can't stay for mass.

Astonishing. The largest Gothic-style church in NYC with its sand-coloured limestone and the rich Gothic decorations out- and inside left us breath- and speechless. The acoustics inside and the very truthful to its medieval prototypes aspect of the church leaves the visitor with the secure feeling that there is a higher power watching over us and guarding us against all evil. A Christmas or Easter mass in this church must be a lifetime-experience of religious ceremony!Don't miss it!

Absolutely Gorgeous. We wandered in not knowing what to expect. What a glorious building. We were able to wander at our pace so that we could look at all the windows and altars. We were even able to go behind the altar to see some of the small chapels. We were there during Lent so there were services during the lunch hour. We were able to hear the magnificient organ. Surely that is what heaven will be like.

Gorgeous church right in mid-town Manhattan A Must-Do for the NY visit!. This is a must-do stop when in NYC. The outside has been completely sandblasted and it looks gorgeous. The inside is one big scaffold but despite the renovations it is still gorgeous inside and out. People working inside they had originally been scheduled for December, but with the Pope arriving in September, they might be stepping it up. Best view now is to walk up to the altar and look toward the back of the church to see the windows, organ, and vaulting. Visitors welcome but you may have to have your back pack searched. No bathroom facilities, but Saks 5th Avenue is on the next corner....Take a walk around the perimeter of the church and see all the little niches and altars. Then walk back behind the altar to find some small chapels, etc. Don't let the renovations hinder your visit. Check for mass schedules because it is a working church and sometimes they do not allow visitors.

lovely. They recently finished their outdoor renovation and it appears beautiful outside. The church welcomes everyone and it's great to visit after services are over so you can pray or quietly contemplate. The stained glass windows are gorgeous and the tabernacle in the back conveys a powerful aura and mystique about the worship of God. Unforgettable

Gorgeous Gothic Icon Being Renovated Inside. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a magnificent Roman Catholic cathedral in the heart of mid-town Manhattan. This is simply a beautiful, iconic structure.The exterior is very Gothic and newly renovated. If you can see it on a nice day it is magnificent.ALERT: With the outside finished, renovation has now turned to the interior, much of which is now completely covered in scaffolding. What you can see is very nice, but, for example, the altar area is completely boxed in with metal supports. If you really want to see the interior in its full glory, you might want to check their website to see if the renovation is still ongoing.The Cathedral does a good job of catering to tourists who want to see the structure (including an audio tour and descriptive materials) and to churchgoers. I attended mass on a Thursday evening and felt no intrusion from onlookers (they cordoned off the area, but were very easy-going about it). Similarly, I had no trouble going around the building afterwards to look at the many lovely chapels. Admission is free, but they do ask for a donation for the upkeep, which is reasonable.St. Patrick's calls itself America's parish. Regardless of whether you agree, it is a holy and awe-inspiring place. Even if you are not Catholic, or even religious, it's worth a visit for its magnificent architecture.

Well worth the visit. As previously mentioned the building is undergoing some major renovations, but none the less my visit was still a highlight. I walked from my time square hotel, just slowly, was about 20min or so, flat walk. Still a busy place, and I enjoyed the archeticture, there was a service in one of the smaller chapels, so I stayed to listen to the organ music, was magical. I ambled around, admiring the beauty and the peace, I was there probably 30mins. Yes there is scaffolding inside to manoeuvre around, but I didn't find it any difficulty and I still enjoyed my visit here.

Always Amazing. This is always a must when visiting New York.City. The current renovations make it hard to fully appreciate right now, but it is still worth a visit. If you really want the full experience, attend a service.

What a lovely church. I have always admired this church. It is beautiful inside and out. Do take note that it is in renovations, at it may look unfinished for now but the work that they are putting into the church is worth the wait. So many followers and worshipers come to the masses and gets pretty full. Although it's a place for prayers and other religious stuff, tourists are always welcomed to take part of this magnificent relic. To do absolutely!

Inspiring. We appreciated the breathtaking architecture and attention to detail. Too bad the construction got in the way in some areas but overall you still got the sense of awe that you are meant to feel in these buildings. Keep going around the back of the construction area to get a more intimate feel and see the crypt entrance.

Breathtaking. Although it being under construction when we recently visited NYC, it was absolutely breathtaking to visit. Standing outdoors looking up at the gorgeous architecture of the building was incredible. Everywhere you look there are more intricate details that pop out, making the cathedral even more interesting to view. I cannot wait to revisit after the construction to see it again!

Great facade. One of europian-like structure in NYC surrounded by modern manhattan sky scrapers is this cathedral, i wasnt able to go in as there was construction going on that time so i just admired the beauty of it from outside. Very near rockefeller center and other tourist sights.

Truly Gorgeous-but under renovation. I've passed by this beauty so many times, and finally got to see the inside. The cathedral is truly beautiful, although right now there is a ton of scaffolding inside, as well as some outside. Still, this is a very worthwhile visit if you love cathedrals-

So goth. While visiting Rockefeller Plaza, walk over to St. Patrick's. Great church with amazing stone architecture. Alot of it was under rehab when we went thru, but the stonework and stain glass is amazing.

Most Beautiful Building on Madison Avenue. Near the Rolex, Cartier and Tiffany stores stands St Patricks Cathedral with its deeply impressive architecture inside and out. An oasis of calm contemplation and inspiration, the cathedral is an essential stop on Madison avenue for a quick break from the (what some might call) nauseating rampant consumerism, just around the corner.

A peaceful experience. The best thing that can happen for us, catholics, is to join a mass in other countries, different from our mother language.You feel as at home; it's very cherishing.The priest was inspired; the choir, delightful.It was not the perfect experience, only because its refurbishing.

work being done. was disappointed. went Feb 2014. Was work being done to the outside of the building, which was disappointing as didnt get to see the outside as work being done - lots of scaffolding, although inside was stunning! defo a must see!

Gorgeous. the outside scaffolding along 5th Ave is down (finally) and seeing the façade for the first time in years reminds me how beautiful this church is. The restoration work inside is amazing as well. Who knew the stone was so many shades of cream. Even if you have been in the past, it's worthwhile for another visit, it's more beautiful than ever. (Restoration continues on the sides of the church but compared to the past, it's barely noticeable.
Stunning. Beautiful church just a shame lots of building work going on but still worth a visit beautiful music at the services
Awe-inspiring.. The architecture alone is just so amazing. I always make it a point to stop in when I am in NYC. It provides a quiet respite in a busy city.
Awe inspiring. The architechture is beautiful and magnificent. It's a quiet, inspirational place to just be in the midst of a bustling metropolis.

Amazing craftsmanship. Though it is undergoing restoration so there is lots of scaffolding on the inside, it is obvious why they want to make sure it keeps its charm. The stained glass windows were beautiful and the woodwork was very detailed. You can spend as little or as much time as you want taking it all in.

Impressive from inside. Although from outside is a beautiful construction, from inside it is a cozy and at the same time impressive construction, in a cross format that, remembers St Peter in Rome, keeping the right proportion. The organ is very impressive by its opulence. The penalty is that you cannot visit the organ, for security reasons. But, for sure worth it a visit.
Uplifting. Overwhelming beauty among the greatest in this country you can spend 30 minutes or an hour or two taking in the details

Amazing Craftsmanship. I am not a very religious person, but this church is very impressive. When we showed up 1/3 of the interior of the church was under construction due repairs inside. This cathedral looks huge from the outside but seesm twice as big from the inside, it is quite remarkable the attention to detail. This building reminds me of extremly old churches in London & Italy. Free to enter and well worth seeing if you are in the area.

Incredible workmanship. It was a very moving experience. It reminds me of the European Cathedrals. This is a must visit , so please put it on your list.Presently, there are renovations and cleaning taking place however, it is still worth the visit. A representative informed us that the renovations should be complete by September 2015.

Definatly visit. Went to cathedral last year but inside and out was covered in scaffolding due to renovation but on returning this year front of cathedral has been brought back to its glory. The inside is still being refurbished but don't let that stop you from looking around as it is so peaceful and its beauty is being restored
Timeless. Has a special place in my heart... high school graduation ceremony took place there back in the day as well as our monthly friday masses.

Under renovation. This is still a beautiful and peaceful place to visit. You can still see many statues and beautiful parts of the cathedral but a lot of it is covered up for repair. Still worth the visit.

Just a little disapponited. Being from upstate NY and then going to the NYC and wanting to see this beautiful church was a little disappointing. The church is in on a major repair. You can't see the a lot of the alter as it has lots of plastics all around. It looks like it is going to be a while of repairs. But still very spiritual and comforting,
Beautiful and historical site. St. Patrick's Cathedral is nice and a very importante site for Catholics. many importante events had occured there.

Although under Renovation Still Worth a Visit. I've visited St Patrick's Cathedral many times, but this visit was really awe-inspiring. The exterior has been cleaned so thoroughly that I actually did not believe it was St Patrick's until I got close enough to realize it could be no other church located right across from Rockefeller Center. Although the interior renovation is not finished (they are up to the altar area now), what has been done is breathtaking, especially the vaulted ceiling and the massive pillars. If you are lucky, you can watch craftsmen working on one of the side chapels as they clean and even apply plaster. I will certainly return once the renovation is complete, and Catholic or not (I'm not) a donation towards the cost of the renovation is money well spent.
Beautiful but under construction. Loved it. Would like to go back once construction is completed. Very comforting and spiritual experience.

extremely beautiful. We visited the cathedral the day after Christmas. It was absolutely beautiful and not nearly as crowded as I had expected. I don't know the exact details, but they are definitely doing some renovating or probably cleaning and repairs inside the cathedral. There is a small gift store just inside the front doors. You can still go into the pews to say a prayer or meditate.

Peaceful and Incredibly Beautiful.. Very beautiful building inside and out, and worth a look inside whatever your faith. A peaceful , tranquil haven that greatly contrasts the streets outside!I love how the doors are usually just open for anyone to take a look inside. It's well worth a walk around.

Majestic. They have been renovating the cathedral for several years now inside and out. Hard to see all its majesty with scaffolding everywhere but you can still see lots of beautiful stained glass, statues, columns and wood work.

Need to revisit when the construction is done!. Great stop as it was bitterly cold outside and this is a beautiful place. Unfortunately, much of the beauty is hidden under the scaffolding as they do needed repairs. Will need to come back when it is done!

Great spiritual Manhattan landmark.. Currently the cathedral is covered with scaffolding which may be disappointing to some visitors but it is still a beautiful place to stop in, explore and pray. The renovations started circa 2012 and may need three to five years to complete. The Cathedral is very interesting. It has beautiful stained glass windows, two pipe organs, many chapels and works of art. I like the Chapel of Our lady of Czestochowa on the right. It is a landmark which should not be omitted in your Manhattan explorations - even it you stop just for five minutes.

Beautiful Cathedral. The largest Roman Catholic cathedral in the US when built. Funerals of Robert Kennedy and Babe Ruth were here. It was undergoing some renovations and doesn't compare to some European cathedrals, but still worth stopping in for a few minutes as you stroll down Fifth Avenue

Imponent...but under repairs!. The church is beautiful, with its own style, and all the altars and statues and saints, and the ambient of meditation and "prayment". Though I'm not a catholic, it does make you look inside.
Hope to be back when it's finished.

Beautiful but covered in scaffolding when we visited. Lovely cathedral that we popped into while it was raining one afternoon. The stained glass and mosaics were beautiful although much of the cathedral was covered in scaffolding when we visited due to restoration work.

Presently under major interior restorations. St. Patrick's is an important historic Cathedral that makes a nice church visit, particularly for those who fancy seeing Gothic style architecture in the Big Apple. Unfortunately, during our recent visit to NYC we discovered a rather massive interior restoration project underway, resulting in much of its beautiful interior being covered or highly obscured by drapes and scaffolding. Sadly, this means that visits to see the beautiful church are greatly hindered at this point in time. With renovations taking place at present, you may want to pass on visiting St. Patrick at this time. It seems works are scheduled to be completed at the end of December 2015. Hopefully this project will remain on schedule so that visitors in 2016 can enjoy more optimal visits to St. Patrick's Cathedral.
Under Construction. During a visit to NY in Dec 2013 I was disappointed that there was major repairs going on at St. Patrick's which detracted from its allure.

Beautiful, but inside is covered in scaffolding. The is a beautiful cathedral, but much of the inside is covered by scaffolding right now. It's still worth a visit to see the outside and the stained glass inside. Make sure you turn around and look up at the rose window.

As beautiful as you would expect. We have seen cathedrals all over the world. THis is not as spectacular as the catherdrals in Rome, but this is probably the best in NYC. It is so bigand beautifuyl when you go inside. There is some much to see that you should take at least an hour or so if you really want ot take it all in,From the stained glass windows to the mosaics, it is all so beautiful

Unbelievable. I have been to NYC many times , always stop in a St. Patrick's. A perfect place to get away from the hustle and bustle of NYC. Not only a beautiful cathedral, but a full of so much history. Nice gift shop as well. A definite must see in NYC.

Beautiful place. I am always interested in knowing new churches, as some of the old ones are neat constructions with a lot of history. This cathedral was not the exception at all. The place looks amazing, it's being cleaned up and the sculpting on the roof is beautiful, you can look all over the place and be amazed. Also, if you're lucky (like me) you can get some people from the congregation to explain you a little about it's history, which makes it even better.

Under construction but still beautiful. Hard to beat visiting this beautiful church during Christmas. They are in the midst of renovation but it still is a must see for pure beauty and history. They do offer trinket type gift items as well for souvenirs.

Loved This Place !!!!. Even shrouded in scaffolding this place is amazing. Very well placed, looks great, open masses if your interested. Restoration coming along well, and this place just oozes Gothic style and grace. Peaceful place to take 5 and reflect !

Breathtaking place of worship . You don't have to believe in any specific religious doctrine to appreciate the beauty of this cathedral. It truly is a magnificent work of art.Even while under construction so many sites to see, the art work, the architecture is inspiring. We also appreciate despite the countless amount of visitors the building does not lose it's sense of sacred.Our only hope is that part of the renovation will include an expansion of the gift shop. They offer some lovely items but because it is in a small space it makes it difficult to move around.

Beautiful. We went into the church, as the doors were opened and tourists were coming in and out. A mass was going on! I find it disrespectful to be a spectator of something sacred... so we stayed for mass. It's was a wonderful experience.

Work in Progress. This is a lovely cathedral. However at the moment it is in the middle of a big refurbishment and there is extensive scaffolding outside and inside, so it is difficult to have a complete picture of it hence the mark down. However the staff inside are very friendly and took their time to explain what was going on.

Wonderful Cathedral to Celebrate Mass. We were here for the 10:15 A.M. Sunday Mass. Cardinal Dolan was the celebrant and homilist. The choir was superb.Celebrating Mass here was a special occasion for us. Highly recommend it for all Catholics.God Bless.

Beautiful cathedral--very impressive!. The cathedral is under renovations, but was still beautiful! There are many opportunities to light a votive candle, which is always a prayerful moment for me. Make sure you take time to do the walk behind the main altar, as there are several other altars there, and a couple of small chapels--there was adoration going on in one of them, which was an awesome opportunity for Roman Catholics to participate in this Catholic tradition. We were there during the Christmas season, so they also had a Nativity scene set up to the left of the main altar--beautiful with life-size statues and a real manger. Although anyone would appreciate the art and the beauty of the cathedral, it should definitely be on any Roman Catholic's list of things to do while in New York City!

You are walking past! Why not peek in?. I love this church and visit every time that I am in town. Just take a moment to reflect on the beautiful detail and peaceful atmosphere. Feel the faith of the thousands that have worshipped here and light a candle for those who have left this world or are still here but suffering. A calm within the storm of busy 5th Ave.

Breathtaking even under Remodeling. They were doing remodeling when we went on December 27th so the outside was pretty much shielded from view with scaffolding, and the inside had a lot of scaffolding and sheets inhibiting the view, BUT it was still quite breathtaking and beautiful to walk around and admire. I imagine when it's clean and not packed with tourists, it's quite peaceful and yet overwhelming with its majesty. The architecture is absolutely stunning.
Beautiful church and service. We wandered in on Christmas and enjoyed singing carols with the mass in progress. The church is under major renovations but it is still a sight to behold.

Always stunningly inspirational. Passing through St Patrick's has been a family tradition since Best & Co was on the other side of the Cathedral from Saks. Each time I go there, I am in awe of the magnificent gothic architecture. Yes, there are often renovations in progress, and yes, the scaffolding sometimes blocks the view of the main altar. A person can get easily visit the many side chapels and get as much or more of the religious and aesthetic experience as if the scaffolding were absent. Hint: Come back in 2 years. St Pat's will not disappoint.

Amazingly beautiful!. This cathedral is so beautiful and amazing! All of the art everywhere is so stunning. You don't have to be religious at all, to enjoy this beautiful temple! Too bad it was under construction while I was there.
Too many renovations!. Too many renovations going on to truly enjoy the beauty. Scaffolding is everywhere, getting in the way of any chance at good pictures.

Beautiful church. Mass was inspiring. Perhaps the most famous church in NYC. The church is under cleaning/renovations but it still looks beautiful. Mass was well attended NAND there was still time afterwards koto tour the church. Very friendly priests. A must go for catholics

Oasis of Calm. St. Patrick's on 5th Av., offers so much to the New Yorker and visitor at any time of the year but around Christmas, it is special. The outside scaffold is now removed and the facade is beautiful. I visited on a Sunday afternoon and there was quite a line up. Even though the inside renovations are still underway, there was a real sense of peace. It was packed, there was a Mass being conducted but the flow of visitors never stopped. Once back on to 5th Avenue and into the Christmas crowds there was a sense of rejuvenation and an ability to face the chaos. The visit also made for some reflection on the season. Regardless of faith, a visit is well worth while.

A big cleaned up catherdral. Beautiful architecture especially as it is set among other incongruous buildings. Worth a quick visit and a candle if the mood takes you. Quite a lot of work was being done around the church thus it is difficult to have a quite space in a busy city.

Major renovations.. My wife and I just visited NYC, if you're planning on going to St Patricks cathedral be aware of a major renovation project underway. A good portion of the cathedral inside and out is covered in staging and black fabric. So far the restored areas are beautiful, but there is quite a bit left to restore. It had to be done to bring back the cathedrals beauty. I just wanted to let my fellow travelers know what to expect if you plan on visiting.

Beautiful. We visit St Pat's every year. They have been cleaning & restoring for 3 years now. The outside looks beautiful. The inside is being worked on. Very interesting to see the restoration work going on. Scaffolding everywhere. What a beautiful building.
beautiful. The most beautiful church. Very inspiring and the architecture is magnificent. A must to see whgern you are in NYC!

Beautiful architecture. Even with the renovations going on you can still visit St. Patrick's Cathedral. This place is beautiful and the best thing is... its free! We went on a Sunday evening and were able to just walk in and enjoy this beautiful church. This is a church and there are people praying so please keep that in mind.

Masterpiece Being Restored. Saint Patrick’s Cathedral is an architectural masterpiece being restored to its original beauty. Even with all the scaffolding and covers the newly cleaned areas bring forth a brighter light within these Holy Walls. Remember this is a house of worship, so please be respectful of those who are attending services or praying.

A Beautiful Place to visit at Christmas.. The Cathedral in midtown is a beautiful place to visit for the atmosphere: as a place to pray and meditate, or to walk and see the history. Presently the cathedral is being restored, and there is scaffolding blocking some of the view.

under renovations. If you are looking to see St. Pat's in all its glory you may want to postpone the trip. The renovations has scaffolding inside and out. The sections that are done are fantastic but they have covered a lot of the church inside. The manger is up and beautiful.

Beautifully Restored Gem in Heart of Manhattan. The gorgeous Saint Patrick's Cathedral in midtown Manhattan is being beautifully restored. The front is finished, the scaffolding has come off (the front), and it's sparkling clean. It looks gorgeous. It's definitely worth taking the time to see. It's beautiful inside, and while it is not the most historic church in the world, it is an iconic New York City landmark. It's lovely.
One of the best in the world.... Mass at this church is simply very special! The church is still in the midst of a $175 million dollar renovation so there is scaffolding throughout the interior.

Peaceful, Serene, Beautiful. Absolutely love stopping here each time we're in the City. The renovations that were last going on outside the Cathedral have moved inside and while the scaffolding is the first thing you notice, the views are still amazing. I love how welcoming a Church this is whatever time of year and visiting at Christmas makes it that much more special because of the decorations and the Nativity. Loved the addition of a virtual guestbook and a coin-operated machine where you can purchase a medallion from the Cathedral. We always light a candle, as well. Love this place. Every. Single. Time.

A beautiful basilica. The scaffolding has finally come down on the outside and I'm amazed at the beauty of the white stone. My entire life this was a dark gray building and now the beauty of the white stone has returned. The interior is still scaffolded over the alter but the back of the church has been restored.

A Must Visit in NY!!. The renovation on this beautiful cathedral looks like it is on schedule and it is something very special! After visiting this beautiful church over the last 30 years it's really amazing the difference in this cathedral in the areas where the renovation has been completed. It looks so fresh and alive! When we come back next year it should be completed and we can't wait!

Beautiful!. As others have mentioned, the cathedral is under renovation. Please don't let that stop you from visiting. The size and beauty of the cathedral are still worth a look. The architecture is amazing and the entire place is peaceful and serene.

Magnificent Church in NYC. They are in the middle of renovations, but this Catholic Church is magnificent. I'm glad we stepped in and I said a pray. If you do go, please remember it's a Church/Holly place. God bless, and can't wait to see this church when they finish renovations. Still a must see even now.

Peaceful and beautiful. The cathedral is being renovated at the moment so there is lots of scaffolding around it. This does not however take away it's beauty. I would love to see it without the scaffolding if it looks this good with it! You can light candles for loved ones inside for a recommended 2 dollar donation. A great little place of calm in a busy city.

Just beautiful!! Don't miss it even if not religious.. This church was being renovated the last couple of times I visited. I've also seen it before the renos started.
Super beautiful church. The architecture, attention to detail, and pure grandeur of the place makes it a must see.
Easily accessible. Free to visit. Donations appreciated.

NY's most beautiful Cathedral. Visited St. Patrick's during a holiday visit. The Church has been under renovation for years. The main altar is now covered in scaffolding. There were hundreds of visitors walking around the perimeter of the large building. We went counterclockwise at our own pace. There are numerous small altars on the perimeter, all with votive candles with real flames. Our children were happy to light candles of remembrance for a small donation. Handicapped access is limited. There's a small gift shop open near the main entrance.St. Patrick's is modeled after the grand European cathedrals. It's magnificent and well kept. It's a landmark on Fifth Avenue and a sacred space for all New Yorkers and NYC visitors.

Beautiful (even under renovation). A beautiful structure among the concrete jungle that is New York City. I loved being able to walk through and take in the majesty of this cathedral. I felt like I was back in Europe!

So beautiful, so crowded. I love St. Patrick's Cathedral. It is so beautiful and magnificent. There was a lot of scaffolding up, so you couldn't see a lot. Plus, because it was Christmas time, it was packed.
beautiful. Beautiful cathedral in the middle of the city.Nice to light a candle for family and friends and a special one for Maddy too.Stain glass stunning.

Renovations do not impact on visual beauty of this stunning Cathedral. Although most of the outside of this stunning building is shrouded in scaffolding it did not put us off venturing inside and seeing the many features and different areas of the CathedralSome scaffolding is also erected in the middle and towards the rear end of the Cathedral interior but still warrants visiting even if it just to sit in silence for a short period of time and remember loved ones by placing a lit candle in one of the dedication areas provided within the building. Spent about an hour at St Patrick's and there is no charge to enter

Amazing Even Under Construction . A stroll in downtown Manhattan is simply not complete without a visit to St. Patrick's Cathedral.As mentioned here on Trip Advisor by others, the cathedral is under massive renovation so much of the building is off limits and services are limited. It's still worth a visit to admire the architecture and appreciate this historic landmark.
So Beautiful and heartwarming. The church is under renovation, so many areas are blocked off. That said, it is still very beautiful architecture and I find the reverence heartwarming and moving.

Beautiful architecture. The cathedral is being restored. There are lots of scaffolds and restoration processes going on. We dropped in while window shopping on 5th Avenue. It was warm and inviting. Although it is a solemn place and for us very calming. Such beauty should be fully respected and it is. It is a place for everyone to reflect and enjoy. It is free but it is you that will be compensated by this visit.

Manhattan landmark. No visit to New York City is complete without a visit to The Cathedral of Saint Patrick on 5th Avenue. It's location on 5th Avenue implies of course that it figures in all of New York's famous parades. But the cathedral is truly a gem in it self.St. Patrick’s Cathedral was opened formally on May 25, 1879. The newspapers hailed the new Cathedral as “the noblest temple ever raised in any land to the memory of Saint Patrick, and as the glory of Catholic America.” When we lived in New York in the 1970's the cathedral was undergoing extensive restoration (in preparation for the 100th anniversary). The cathedral is currently undergoing an extensive new restoration. It is planned to be finished by the end of 2015. We will come back for the celebration of St. Patrick's Day in 2016. The cathedral can be visited during the restoration period.

Beautiful Building but under construction. When in NYC visit theCathedral to see the wonderful beauty of the building, however be aware there is a major renovation happening currently and best to visit during daylight hours.

Renovations? Go anyway !. This cathedral is a great example of Gothic architecture. Even though it is in the middle of renovations, go and make a donation, light a candle, admire the difficult work that went into this building, and perhaps offer up a prayer. Good security is all around, & bags are checked. All this helped to make me feel safe. I wish I had the time to visit for a Mass. Not a bad walk from my Sheraton location & Rockefeller Center is just across the street. Which you can see as you exit this beautiful cathedral.

Under renovations.. Gorgeous huge church that has to be seen for it's beauty. They just don't make churches like this anymore or ever will. Renovations are father along then last year so there is less scaffolding. Will be beautiful once completed and at that time will deserve a five star rating.

Can't wait to visit when renovation completes! . A massive church near Rockefeller Center. The areas which completed renovation are magnificent. They still hold masses (we attended a weekday mass at 5:30PM).

Under Construction. Gorgeous, iconic Church located on 5th avenue in Manhattan. It is in the middle of a massive restoration so there is scaffolding everywhere. Still worth visiting and lighting a candle for a loved one.

Under Renovation. By all means be sure to stop in to give a quiet moment of reflection. But be warned the cathedral is undergoing extensive renovation that will continue for another year. When it is completed, it will be magnificent!

A beautiful house of worship. St. Patrick's Cathedral is the largest Roman Catholic Cathedral in North America. Construction began in 1859 and was completed in 1906. At the time of our visit it was impossible to appreciated the complete beauty as there was scaffolding around much of the area. The already cleaned areas give an idea of the hidden beauty.

Wonderful place...hope the repairs are done soon and scaffolding comes down. This is a beautiful place, but right now it is hard to see the beauty through the scaffolding. Regardless of the construction, it is still a special place to visit. Take time to walk around. Be generous and leave a donation. The service we attended was quite nice. We were glad that we went. If I go back, I hope the construction is done and the scaffolding is down. Then my pictures will capture the true beauty of this magnificent church.

Beautiful building and a must see if you're downtown. I didn't realize this isn't the original St. Patrick's until I was taking a tour of Manhattan but this one is still amazing inside. The outside and inside are still under construction but we were able to walk around and admire the craftsmanship.

Are they ever going to take the scaffolding down?. I have visited St Patrick's Cathedral for 3 years now and still I cannot get a descent picture from the outside since it is surrounded by scaffolding. The cathedral itself is awesome and definitely worth a visit. Keep in mind it is an active Catholic church so regular masses are being held daily.On this particular visit I was delighted to find that on 51st St right across the street from it they have their own gift shop so you do not have to go into the cathedral if you want to make a purchase for someone back home. Regrettably, that store is in a block also under scaffolding but it is not hard to find and it will save you the trouble of a security check if you just want to purchase a gift.It is one of the few attractions that is free and well worth the visit.

Not the best time to visit. One of the key New York attractions is unfortunately currently covered in scaffolding inside and out. It it not the best time to visit at present as you will feel a bit frustrated and disappointed.

Scaffolding and Construction. Unfortunately the building is being renovated and is covered in scaffolding and wooden barriers but it is still lovely and it is a church so I still lit a candle and offered a prayer. Will look forward to renovation end date for a revisit.

Beautiful!!. I stopped here before hopping in a cab to time square. This church is beautiful both inside and out but it is under renovation and has been for some time now. The renovation does take away from the overall experience but I think it’s still worth taking a peek inside though. The high ceilings will leave you in awe, the sculptures and statues might bring you to tears and the alter will humble your soul. If you’re nearby just take a quick walk in side. Hopefully I can make a trip back once the renovation is complete

Major refurbishment ongoing. The cathedral is currently undergoing massive refurbishment and as such it is difficult to assess. From the areas that can be seen it would seem as though it will be a very impressive building when renovations are complete. Some beautiful stained glass windows.

Beautiful church (under construction). From the outside to everything inside it's just beautiful, the only sad part is that it was under construction so I wasn't able to fully enjoy the place, but I went to mass twice there during my visit and the Sunday 10:15 am mass was beautiful and the choir amazing!

Under Construction. Beautiful church, however, travelers beware. this place is HIGHLY under construction. there is so much equipment and scaffelting inside that it truly takes away from the church's inner beauty. you can still appreciate it for what it is, but there are many remodeling/repairs being done inside. but still worth the visit.
God's House. I loved being there. It was being renovated but it was still wonderful. After all it is God's House.
gorgeous church. attended mass on sunday during my stay. music was lovely. undergoing renovations indoors and out. beautiful church

Beauty on the inside. Currently undergoing a large scale cleaning and restoration program, the outside is currently surrounded by masses of scaffold. expect the usual bag searches on the inside, but it's a lovely place to visit.Pop across the road and stand between the pillars behind the atlas statue and see what happens.
Worth the stop. Peace and serenity in a bustling city! Take a moment to light a candle and see the history. The architecture is breathtaking. The peacefulness is worth it. The little store is quaint.

Top of the list of things to see. This has to be on the top of your list ,the cathedral was being renovated when we where here but still breathtaking. ..inside the high ceilings and the workmanship of this place is exquisite ...... you don't have to be religious to enjoy beauty .... and this a a master piece ...This place gives you a sense of peace and you can gather your thoughts .....truely AWESOM I would highly recommend

Fantastic snapshot into history. This building opened in 1879 and was a Gothic architecture building. It is stunning; however it is going under major restoration so you can’t see a lot of the beauty because of the scaffolding so not great for photographers. Having said that its really worth the visit and if you get a chance go during the Sunday Mass because you see it in its real environment as an active catholic church. We went to the 10.15 am mass because that one has the church choir which were breathtakingly good especially with the autistics of the church . There is also a really good gift shop across the road on the side street run by the church. A great attraction for the religious and the architect buffs
So beautiful. Even though they are undergoing restorations, the cathedral is still worthy of a visit. It is beautiful either way. Definitely stop in for a few minutes.

Save your visit till after the construction work is finished. A must see in NYC - but not at present as the cathedral is overewhelmed with scaffolding and under whelming a s a visit as a result. Come back in 2015 (I'm assuming it's not a Sagrada timeline.....)

A peaceful place. St. Patrick's is a monument built by the formerly destitute Irish immigrants who found a new home in America. James Renwick's neo-gothic architecture is one of the topmost achievements of its kind. The church is the chair to the archbishop of New York. Well worth visiting together with the Top of the Rock, just across 5th. Ave. Visitors should be aware that there may be some renovation going on in this second half of 2014.

Under Restoration. This Cathedral is under restoration but its worth a visit to just knock it off your bucket list. There is not entry fee and you can always spare a moment from the hustle bustle of the city and pray.

Beautiful and historic. I went to a Saturday evening mass here in late October while on a trip to NYC and enjoyed it thoroughly. Although under construction, a number of its features ( the huge brass doors, various altars and stained glass windows) are still visible and they are impressive. For a tour, with images of the church without the scaffolding, I downloaded the app. I think the charge goes to the restoration and it will do until I can return to see the church when the restoration is done. The cathedral has a gift shop where I picked up a few souvenirs and the staff were so friendly and helpful. I'll definitely return next time I'm in NYC.
Undergoing major renovations. Visited the Cathedral today and it is undergoing major renovation outside and Inside, so at the moment you cannot appreciate its beauty.

Cathedral amongst tall buildings/boutiques . Yes this is a wonderful architectural building that has so much character but it is currently undergoing some major renovation work, with scaffolding both inside and out.All buildings of this age need sone work like this from time to time so to give harsh reviews and scores is quite unfair in my personal opinion.One can still see the splendour of the stained glass windows - see photos and the beautiful ceiling.The full splendour will be restored in the fullness of time to bring this lovely historic building back to lifeThis work will return thus

Under Wraps. We were looking forward to visiting the cathedral but were unaware it was under a major renovation. The rating is harsh but that is how we experienced it.Hopefully, next time we visit NYC the work will be finished and we can see and experience all it's glory.Kayjohn

Wonderful architecture but under major renovation. A wonderful Gothic edifice located in the middle of modern, high rise central just off 5th Ave. Currently surrounded and filled with lots of scaffolding for the renovations, so the acoustics are temporarily very subdued.

A Work In Progress. At last you can see this great Cathedral beginning to emerge from it's scaffolding wrapping and we wait to finally see it renewed, hopefully on our next visit in a years time. Meanwhile the sheer scale and complexity of the work taking place is awe inspiring. However, beneath all the steel the building still retains and impresses with it's pastoral meaning. Very friendly and helpful staff added the personal touch, and were much appreciated
Wonderful Gothic Architecture. Went as a tourist and then back on Sunday for mass. It was quite the place with tourism happening continuously even during the mass and a wedding.

Home of JFK!. Whenever I visit New York City, I stop here and take a rest. It is very fortunate to find a place you can take a rest especially in busy downtown like New York. Before you visit Rockefeller Center, you can stop here and relax. JFK's requiem took place here. Near the cathedral, there are many famous shops around as well.

Lovely cathedral unfortunate for all the construction!. St Patrick's cathedral is a lovely cathedral set in the city however there is a lot of construction going on just now, due to run until May 2015 apparently!!it does take something away from the place but you can tell it would be a very nice place without all the scaffholding around.

A cathedral among the skyscrappers. St. Patrick's is a beautiful cathedral undergoing major renovations. Yet, I was still very much able to enjoy my experience of the church. There are many altars where you can kneel and say a prayer.

It's a big Cathedral. Similar to any major Cathedral in Europe this is a big one with all the usual Cathedral features. It's been under renovation for years and I would like to see it without all that scaffolding.
great church. great historical church during the times of new york, good architecture lots of people around the church be quiet while visitng.

Under Construction, But Lovely. Awe-inspiring catholic church - incredibly beautiful inside, but not very peaceful since the church is heavily under construction. You cannot really see the exterior facade at all - it is covered in scaffolding - and the inside has certain areas that are gorgeous, but then most areas inside area also covered in scaffolding.
Beautiful. St Patricks is under a major refurbishment, but you can still go in and see this amazing "place of worship". Its magnificent. Another must see!!

A beautiful Cathedral. Step inside and see the 7000 pipes of the Organ which is situated right under the Rose Window. The Stations of the Cross were carved out of Caen stone in Holland. The Great Bronze Doors at the main entrance are just massive. Each door weights 9,000 kg. The inside is breath taking.
beauuiful but under construction. was told to come back in 2015 when the construction work will be finished. beautiful church though would love to see it when its restored
Gorgeous!. We visited St. Patrick's Cathedral in 2013. Stunning building, wonderful history and friendly guides. I highly recommend you visit while in NYC.

Always a pleasure. I always stop in a pray while in NY. St. Pat's is a landmark and anchor for me. This visit was disappointing as the scaffolding covered 90 percent of the beauty of this grand Cathedral. Still a reverent place but suggest checking to see the state of the refurbishing before booking your trip.

Now is not a good time. We stopped by here on foot after walking around the blocks most of the day. The only relief was the airconditioning was working well. It's difficult to see the beauty of the place in its entirety 'cause like the previous reviewer said the place was covered with scaffolding and a lot of renovations.

A horrible mess due to the renovations. We knew there were works going on but decided to go in as we were passing. However, the sheer scale of the renovations was staggering - scaffolding everywhere and most things covered up! It's really a mess inside and it is impossible to get any appreciation of the beauty of it. Obviously the work needs to take place to preserve a great building but I wouldn't recommend going to visit in it's current state.

Impressive but covered in scaffolding. I am sure that this is a beautiful cathedral but as at October 2014 it is swathed in scaffolding inside and out. No criticism, renovation is required but don't expect to see it at its best until the scaffolding comes down.
Beautiful!!. It was under construction when we were there, but still what a beautiful place!! I was blown away at the architecture and the size!! A must see!!
simply amazing. whether or not you are a believer or not, this architectural gem needs viewing....simply stunning...excellent place to reflect quietly

Beautiful church. Beautiful Church!! Despite the renovations going on, you can still visit this grand Cathedral can still see its stain glass windows and massive spaces. A real experience to see this Cathedral
Beautiful. Even under construction it is an impressive place! Never get tired Of walking around in here.. A little bit noisy at The moment with all The construction going on.

Looking forward to the post-restoration look. This soaring cathedral now seems a little dwarved by the many skyscrapers but as a religious building, retains a timeless elegance that modern buildings don't always project. It might have needed a pain job on the outside at least but I have to admit that the need for major restoration wasn't very obvious when I visited. But it's needed, it's needed, and I'm sure it'll be look fabulous when all the restoration is done.
Being Restored. Being Restored when we went to visit but very lovely churchIn the middle of a busy area but great to see

Under renovation. My husband had never been to St Patrick's, so on our walk down Fifth Avenue we stopped in. The interior in undergoing a complete renovation with scaffolding everywhere. We did take a walk around the cathedral liking the many chapels and occasionally visible stained glass windows. If you have never been, it is worth visiting as there is no charge, but for the full effect, return in 2 years when it's complete. Rockerfeller Center is right across the street. And is worth a visit.

FIFTY MILS TO REPAIR. I haven't been to St. Pat's in years. When we got there, we were a little stunned to see the scaffolding EVERYWHERE inside and out. You can't even see the outside of the church! The brochure we read said it will cost $50,000,000 to repair all that's falling apart. We could still see the main altar and most of the side altars. Beautiful church.
It's ok. It is not an impressing cathedral and it is too modern for my taste. However, it is good to have a look if you pass nearby.

Beautiful Church!. My husband and I made plans to visit St. Patrick's Cathedral 2 months prior to our trip. Somehow, the fact that the entire cathedral was under renovation was not adequately relayed to us on their website. What we were able to see was beautiful, but sight lines were limited due to scaffolding both inside and outside of the church. I certainly want to make the trip again once renovations are complete.

awesome. we stumbled upon this fine place after going to the top of the rock, the church is at the moment full of scaffolding but it doesnt matter, its very scerene inside, the organ was going full tilt , there were loads of worshippers inside, i very corner there is somewhere peaceful defiately have a look
lovely. Really to see one of new York icon in very good condition such as Patrick cathedral, we visited last winter and we planing to take the kids this year too to Visit .

Soaring beauty. This is my home church and I've always loved it. Stop by if you're in Manhattan, it's a must-see for any Catholic and really anyone with any eye for beauty. Lovely soaring ceilings with astonishing stained glass, everything is just detailed exquisitely. The lovely Chapel in back of the main church is a little gem all of it's own. A small gift shop in the side of the entrance has very thrifty souvenirs of this beautiful and working church. True, it's being refurbished but that's no reason to not stop in and visit if you are able. You'll be happy you did.

Disheartening...but still beautiful. Was looking forward to mass on Sunday morning at St. Patrick's while on a weekend getaway to NYC. The entire cathedral, both inside and outside are going through renovations to clean and preserve the beautiful church. So it was a little disheartening to not to see it in it's full beautiful state, but I look forward to going back when it is all finished.

Being Refurbished. Sadly this spectacular cathedral was totally encased by scaffolding and sadly did not present its best face. The Sunday Mass was excellent despite the extensive refurbishment underway internally as well.Should be back to full splendor when the refurbishment is completed.

A beautiful and humbling experience. Even if you aren't a "church goer" there is ample reason to visit the St. Patrick's Cathedral. The beautiful bastille is nestled right in the middle of downtown Manhattan and offers a peaceful respite from the constant blaring and honking and human-oriented words. If you're really lucky and there when any service is being conducted, you get to hear the amazing pipe organs. The statuary and stained glass windows are awe inspiring, as is the ceiling. In 2014 it is undergoing restoration in many areas so it does limit the visuals.

Under construction but nice to look around. If you have some spare time, just take a peek.Don't just sit around go in the back of the church where no photo allowed. It is very spiritual and clam it bring me to peace and forgot about all the construction that was going on. I wasn't christian but still get a very spiritual feeling in there which is pretty awesome.
The biggest church. The saint Patricks cathedral is one big church the way I was looking at it. The inside is beautiful. Candles, saint stations and more.

Under refurbishment. This cathedral is currently having substantial renovations carried out so there is scaffolding everywhere so you are not seeing it at it's best at the moment. However it is a beautiful Catholic Cathedral in the busy Madison Avenue.Pop in and embrace the peaceful atmosphere while in bustling New York. We attended the Sunday morning mass during our visit and found it a lovely experience and were made very welcome. The sound of the organ is wonderful and the cathedral choir excel themselves .

Disappointing in its present state. St. Patrick's Cathedral was one of the things to see on our list when in New York. However, whilst it is a Gothic Cathedral which makes it dark inside anyway, it was made worse by scaffolding. From outside, you can only see the top of the towers, the rest covered by scaffolding and inside it is dark and gloomy with much covered up, ladders / poles etc. There were quite a few visitors wandering around but with banging from the workmen, it was not peaceful. We went to the small shop near the entrance but was told that they had sold out of guide books and we could only get a postcard. I suppose it might be better when finished but I have seen better cathedrals elsewhere.
Beautiful church. I visited the St. Patrick's Cathedral and I stayed few hours enjoying from inside. It's well located in New York. Worth a visit it.
Visited May 2013. To see such a massive structure in the heart of Manhattan and then to enter into a place of calm/coolness is wonderful no matter what religion one follows. Beautiful inside.
Beautiful and large. Beautiful cathedral, it's under restoration though, but you can still visit it and stay to listen the mass.

under restoration. I've been there before, and all I can tell is it's worth visiting it, even though these days it's being restored so the building cannot be fully appreciated. I attended the holy mass and could enjoy the fabulous organ playing and a lady singing so beautifully. I would come back to this place!

Renovations. Visited the Cathedral this month...it will be stunning when it is completed. The difference in the outside colour is incredible. Lots of people visiting, whether to light candles, say a prayer, or just take in the interior...and hopefully, to make donations to the cost of renovating.

If you like scaffolding............... Very disappointed with the state of the cathedral, obviously significant repairs and renovations are required, but why keep it open to the public during the week? At the moment there is virtually nothing to see other than the main altar, everything else either removed, covered up or hidden by scaffolding. I have been very lucky to visit a large number of cathedrals and churches around the world, many undergoing repair, but never have I seen so much scaffolding within a religious building. Seems to me it is being kept open so people may be tempted to donate to repairs.Close it during the week, get repairs completed more speedily.Basically don't bother visiting at this time, unless of course you are a scaffolding fan!

Church. The cathedral has been under renovation for awhile now, so you are limited to all. But you do get to visit some of the side alters, light candles, visit gift shop, and go to a daily mass. There is scaffolding outside as well as inside, but you can picture the beauty and history of this enormous place once your in. I loved it!

Covered up. I'm sure this is a lovely cathedral, but, right now it is covered up so much as to make it impossible to rate. The columns are wrapped and there is scaffolding everywhere.Still a peaceful ambience somehow, despite the chaos.

St. Pat's in the City. A must-see if you are in New York City. A cultural and spiritual landmark in Manhattan. You've seen it on TV and in numerous movies. See it in person. It's gothic, quiet, and majestic. Check out the alcoves and confessionals. Attend mass there. It's an experience not to be missed.

Place of peace. In the hustle of 5th Avenue and Manhattan, this is a good place to relax, find peace...I was impressed by its size and its gothic style, but overall, compared to Europe's great cathedrals (i.e. Italy, France, Spain), it is dull, dark and lacks splendor.
Stunning. This is an absolutely fantastic sight. The stained glass is gorgeous as is the marble... It really is difficult to describe how amazing it looks!

Best stop for me in NYC. Such a great place to visit!!!! Very historical. I enjoy walking three every time I visit NYC,My kids enjoy the visit. Meaning full stop for me.Want to attend Christmas Eve midnight mass one year

Worth the visit!. Currently under construction, so that took a little of the beauty away, but it was still worth the visit. I am not Catholic, but can appreciate the beauty and history. It is truly a remarkable cathedral.

True momument to our Catholic faith. I just went to St . Patrick's on friday because i work in the area and have been there many many times. It is my go to place for peace and prayer. I like to take time out from the hustle and bustle of NYC. i find great comfort in The Our Lady of NY Chapel at the back of the Cathedral behind the main altar. It is absolutely beautiful. A must see for everyone God Bless.

Beautiful and a place for reflection. It is beautiful and it´s my second time in NY and I stopped by again since the first time I was in a hurry. As a warning, the cathedral is undergoing a major restoration so it´s full of scaffolds outside and inside, so you cannot contemplate the fullest of its design and I guess it´s gonna take a while. Anyway, you can see some details of the external architecture and it´s amazing,Why not donating something?

Beauty in the bustling city. At my time of visit (8/14/14), St. Patrick's Cathedral was undergoing a major renovation so there were scaffolds inside and outside the building. Nonetheless, the majority of the building was still accessible and the scaffolds could not conceal the true beauty that this Cathedral has to offer! Visit this remarkable and beautiful church that is located in the middle of bustling city right beside the festive Rockefeller Center!Built as the seat of the Archbishop of New York, St. Patrick's Cathedral was one of the earlier Catholic churches in America and played a significant role in Catholicism in the United States. In this church, you will find not only the marvelous architectural elements but also beautifully sculptures of Christian figures. Look for the Our Lady of Guadalupe painting given by the pope and the Pieta sculpture that was intended to imitate the one in Vatican but was revised to an unique take because of mechanical balance issues!Take an audio tour to make the most out of your visit! St. Patrick's Cathedral is an excellent stop for any NYC tourists. You can also look up the mass schedule online to participate in one that involves their world-renowned organ music!

Vacation. Timed it so we could do the actual free tour. Look at church on line schedule. Small group was great. Information on history, construction and how the church came about was a vision come true. Very informative. Church is under massive reconstruction but you can see the much needed difference. So we weren't able to see all statutes....Suppose to be completed in mid 2015.

Peace in a big city!. Have been to the cathedral a couple of times and I'm still amaze day the quietness and peace there is even though outside there is the hustle and bustle of New York going on!Unfortunately your bags are scanned or searched even when you are going in for Mass but that's a sign of the times!klThe cathedral is beautiful although it is undergoing extensive renovation work- a must see!

Gorgeous, but a bit of a hassle due to construction. Really a stunning interior, though with so much scaffolding and plastic sheets it was tough to really take it in. But just wonderful alcoves and worth a visit.

It will be awesome when the renovations are complete. It is a stunning New York landmark. Beautiful art and statues and a calm quiet peaceful place to relax and pray. There are frequent Masses before 1 pm every day. Christianity is live and well at Saint Patrick's Cathedral.

Must see and check out the pig. The Cathedral is quite magnificent in its own right and well worth a visit. It's a real church with masses in progress and, on a different level, is often seen on the TV when the news requires it and in films etc. The 'hidden' NY books notes a stone pig climbing up the masonry. It's not easy to find but it is there - towards the back side...

Always a stopover. Whenever in NYC, I visit St.Patrick's catedral. Sometimes I spend little time there, sometimes more time, I don't count the time, it just happens how I feel....it always brings me such inner peace and I've been there through very though times and happy times and I shall never ever forget and cherish all those moments.I shall return.

Currently under renovation, but still open. This church is beautiful, whether it's covered in scaffolding or not! Both the outside and inside are currently being renovated (as of Summer '14), but we still found the inside of the church breathtaking.
Beautiful church. I went there for a mass and the sound effects are really good. The church is absolutely beautiful and should not be missed.
More money grabbing!. Very saddened abt how commercial the cathedral has become. Sell sell sell.. Just across the street is a store dedicated to selling souvenirs of the church also..

Simply Amazing!. What an amazing place! It is an architectural masterpiece, and even though all the visitors and hundreds of people that go in and out, you can feel the peace inside. Definitely a must when you go to NY.
Stunning. A very beautiful church, in the middle of the urban jungle. Sadly the second time I went it was being restored, but it still was quite impressive.

Worth a visit, under renovation. Beautiful gothic church that became NYC's Cathedral in 1879. Currently under renovation, and the extensive scaffolding prevents seeing the church and experiencing the prayerful atmosphere. Security team does its best to maintain the sacred space. We attended Sunday 9am Mass, which was a good decision as the church got crowded afterwards. Make sure to walk all the way around the back of the altar and visit the pretty chapels and see the entrance to the crypt. Tiny gift shop. Worth a visit.

Worth Seeing . . . When Scaffolding Is Gone. July 2014 was my second visit to St. Pat's. I took the family, hoping to show them the breathtaking architecture. Oops, everything inside (and much of the outside) is covered in scaffolding (see photo). I would advise travelers to wait to visit until the interior renovations are finished (when?), if your reason for visiting is to see the interior and exterior architecture.I guess I should have checked TripAdvisor before going!
Magnificent church despite the scaffolds. This is an iconic NYC church and it was beautiful. The scaffolding did detract from it, but if you look beyond it, you'll see a magnificent church.
Gorgeous!. What a beautiful place! It is under heavy construction at the moment, but still breath taking! Would have loved to taken the tour, but we visited during mass.

Stunning architecture and serene experience. Came later in the evening around 4pm and was amazed at how beautiful and serene it was inside. Great opportunities to pray in private and observe the stations of the dross and other saints. Just stunning and great experience.

Under Heavy Construction at the Moment. We went out of our way to catch 10:00 mass at St. Patrick's, only to find that it's being renovated. Many of the seats were unavailable due to scaffolding structures, leaving a few hundred people cramped for even standing space along the outside corridors. You couldn't even see the altar. They had setup TV screens to aid with the visuals, but the camera wasn't aimed well, and only caught the left ear of the priest, so we could barely see him either. The cathedral is impressive, but now is not the best time to visit.....

Under MAJOR construction. It is difficult to rate a church, particularly one that you can't really see since it is under major construction both inside and out. I am not exaggerating when I say that as of the end of June 2014, when my family and I went out of our way to take a trip here, we couldn't see it. The scaffolding is everywhere. I was sad since this would have been our teens' first visit to a cathedral, and I wanted to show them that even Americans can build cathedrals. I wanted to be with them when they experienced that sense of AWE seeing their first cathedral. Alas, it was not to be. I definitely would NOT have come here had I known. Certainly, there is still beauty to be seen here, and of course, there is more to a church than just SEEING the place - but due to the construction, the sense of spirituality or connection to God was, for me, completely ruined. If I had it to do over again, I would checked this out online to make sure the construction is done.

Still great despite being under construction. St. Patrick's is a must see for everyone while in NYC. The cathedral is still under construction making some parts inaccessible or difficult to appreciate, but once the renovations/restorations are done you will have to go back. Once inside you'll forget you're on busy 5th Avenue. It's a great place to collect your thoughts and have a look around. Also don't be shy about taking pictures, they're welcomed in all parts of the cathedral except the very back.

Very uplifting experience. St Patrick's Church is absolutely beautiful!! I have been in many churches but this one really left a presence for me!!! We were able to light a candle for a loved one for $2 Both my friend and I felt something very moving come over us!!! It was extremely uplifting and we both cried at the same moment!!! It was right after we lit the candle!!! Again, I recommend a visit here The architecture and stunning beauty will not disappoint!! I will cherish what I experienced here forever!!

Worth a visit. Worth a visit if you need a break from the consumer extravaganza that is Rockefeller Center. Pop in and take a walk around, look at the shrines and admire the architecture. You might not even realize you are on Manhattan for a few minutes.

Under rennovation unfortunately. Amazing to see a Cathedral in the middle of a busy street especially one as iconic as 5th Avenue!Was very excited about seeing St Patrick's but unfortunately it was under heavy rennovation and refurbishment when I was there. Could barely see anything outside and when I got inside it was even worse... would have been good to have been forewarned about this (maybe outside - if you are on a bus then you would know not to get off for example).I did sit on the steps for a bit and watch the world go by and sat inside to get the feel but was quite disappointed overall.Will be lovely to see when rennovations have finished though!

A place to contemplate. This cathedral is beautiful both inside and out. Yes, as the other reviewers state it is under refurbishment and there is a lot of scaffolding around, in and outside. Yet, it still remains a place to have a few quiet thoughts and a prayer. If you sit in the right place you can see how the reconstruction work is progressing as you can see the old and the new cleaner stone. The organ and the window above it were a talking point for our family. If in NYC and in the vicinity it is definitely worth a visit. There isn't any requirement to pay an entrance fee they just ask for donations. You can also light a candle for two dollars.

The extraordinary cathedral in the middle of Manhattan. Then back in 2005 my wife and I finally had a chance to be overwhelmed by the beauty of the gothic elements outside and inside of one cathedral, but that time, on the american ground. So between the Fifth Avenue and Madison Avenue and East 50th street and East 51th street, the whole complex of this decorated Neo-Gothic-style Roman Catholic cathedral church occupies the space amid the high rise buildings as are the Rockefeller Center, Saks Fifth Avenue Building,and others. That was really unusual situation to see one wonderful cathedral with all these gothic decorations on the front and sideways facades, that splendid tower with the spire at its end, these stained windows made by artists from Boston and from European artists from Chartres, France and Birmingham, England, among the steel, concrete and glass of the skyscrapers of one awesome megalopolis. What we now gladly recall of, is one wedding, we've seen from across the street, I think that it was in Madison Avenue from what sidewalk we looked at the Cathedral little stairs beneath the arched stoned vault.Really nice memories.
Beautiful cathedral!. Although there are renovations going on it was still well worth the visit. They ask for $10 donations to visit but any donation amount was appreciated.
Impressive but currently a construction site. Beautiful building - but not worth a detour this summer due to renovation. But I would want to visit when work is done.
Spectacular. Unfortunately the inside and outside of the cathedral are under construction, but you can still see how spectacular the art work and windows are.

Majestic but undergoing huge renovation. This wonderful Cathedral is undergoing a complete renovation. But it's still the wonderful refuge for prayer and inner thought that a vacation in the hustle and bustle of New York needs. Thanks to the construction crew for their patience while working under very stressful conditions. They were so respectful of us visiting last week!

Open, but Still Under Construction. This beautiful cathedral is a must stop for tourists to NYC. Unfortunately, the cathedral is currently filled with scafolding that is being used for a remodeling project that has been underway for years. The beauty and majesty of the cathedral can still be appreciated. There is a gift shop in the cathedral to purchase souvenirs.
Spectacular!. The church is undergoing restoration. However, it remains open to the public and is well worth a visit. It's breathtaking in it's size and grandeur.
Beautiful building. Very worth going to see the building, even if not religious, and worth going to mass if you are, they had the relics of Pope John Paul II there when we went.

beauticul icon. While I haven’t had the opportunity to attend a mass at St Patrick’s, I walk through here every time I’m in NYC. It is a grand, majestic cathedral that is simply breath-taking. It amazes me that this structure is over 130-years old. Currently it is under renovation, but it is still open to the public. While there is no fee to enter, they do ask that you leave a small donation.
Wonderful. Even through the renovations this is a truly amazing church. We even went to mass on Sunday morning at 10:15. Very relaxing with the very nice choir and music. A must see.

Beautiful Church. It's been under renovation and I will be back to see it fully and beautifully restored. The location is amazing and very convenient. Mass still ongoing despite the renovations. All the transportation all around manhattan either via bus or subway are minutes away from the church.

Having a renovation.. A lovely, big cathedral, this does get quite a few visitors. It is currently going through some construction work, so scaffolding up inside and out. Still a nice place to pop in and have a look.
Good experience, had fun. One of the most interesting cathedrals in the city. Very good art amd impressive design. Go St. Patrick!
Wait til renovations are complete. . A beautiful place I couldn't wait to show my daughter but unfortunately the renovations made for a very disappointing visit

americas parrish. currently under renivation but open. scaffolding everywhere. this should not deter your visit. sunday mass was special- the sermon was worth the trip to nyc itself. good old school catholic mass with choir and incense.

Under renovation 7/2014. Beautiful from what we could see of the outside and inside. We didn't go inside because of all the renovation inside and out. Scaffolding everywhere. But we will check it out again on our next visit.
Amen!. Under extensive renovation at the time of our visit, but still very awesome. We were able to see and hear Cardinal Dolan preach during our visit, which was great.

Under Renovation = Nothing to See!. I'm sure this is a marvellous site when not under renovation. I visited in July 2014 and more than half the church is covered or obtructed due to renovation. I'm sure this may take a couple of years, so I would not waste making plans to visit it. If you happen to be walking by and feel like 10 min of quiet time, perhaps walk in and take a break, but other than that, I would wait until finished.

Disappointing Discovery. So much wanted our visit to St Patrick's to be the highlight of our trip to New York, however, not knowing about the extensive construction work being carried out in advance we were bitterly disappointed when we arrived at the Cathedral. Little of the wonderful architecture can be seen inside, although we did manage a time for quiet prayer at the altar towards the rear of the Cathedral. Hope this building work can be expedited and St Patricks returned to its usual magnificence a.s.a.p.
Under Construction. It maybe getting a facelift, but it still a good place to visit while in New York. The stained glass and gothic architecture are not to be missed.

Still beautiful even under construction. Most of St. Patrick's Cathedral is currently covered by scaffolding (both inside and out) but it is still a beautiful church. You can walk around a lot of the inside of the church so I would still recommend a visit now to enjoy the details of the side altars. Then, once the renovations are complete, it would be great to go back to take in the grandeur of this impressive cathedral.
Beautiful Church. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a beautiful church! It was under construction while we visited, but still enjoyed our visit. Would love to see it when the renovations are complete!

Awesome architecture. Even with all the scaffolding both inside and outside, you can already see that much progress have been made in the restoration. Some of the stained glass windows have been finished and are absolutely gorgeous. The restoration should be complete by December, 2015 but it is still well worth entering this awesome structure.

Beautiful historic Church. I would have given it 5 stars, but they are currently renovating just about ALL of Saint Patricks and it is covered in scaffolding now. It's a beautiful, historic church that holds a lot of great art and history. There is a gift shop around the corner that is more spacious than the little one in the back of the church, so if you're looking for a souvenir to take home, take the short walk for a better selection and more room to move around.

Mass at St Patricks Cathedral NYC. The mass times at St Patricks are wonderful there is no excuse for not being able to attend mass on Sundays in NYC. The cathedral is just amazing and if you don't feel God's presence there you'll never feel him anywhere. My only concern is with the security there, at the front door no trouble with showing your bags or back packs, it's the security with seating an fat communion times. I understand it's hard to organise thousands of people at one time but there is no faith or compassion shown by those mean men, I felt bullied because I refused to jump in front of a man on a wheelchair where I come from you help those less fortunate. Today a family was belittled for climbing UNDER a barrier to find a seat in church, this is not mass!! We should be helping one another on faith. Just remember it's God we came to visit not the bullies

Aptly named for my husband Patrick. Big and strong,beautiful chiseled features. Gentle ans peaceful on the inside...unintentionally imposing on the outside.Wonderful place to find peace in a chaotic city.Paula@paulamarks.com

Not much to see due to restoration work. There is virtually nothing to see inside due to the very extensive renovation work inside. If you like building sites this is the one for youBest viewed from outside

St Patricks looks like an embarrassment. I understand they are undergoing maintenance although this has been 3 years and is a disappointment to look at. The scaffolding and ruined chairs takes away from this magnificent cathedral. Hopefully it will be done next time I visit as it is upsetting.

Light your candle.... It's an Impressive place...Surrounded by giant buildings and insane loud people & crazy traffic, there it is: Saint Patrick Church!Do not miss the opportunity to light a candle... does not matter which religion you like the most, simply step in and do it!
