Undergoing maintenance. Beautiful cathedral which is currently undergoing massive maintenance so scaffolding everywhere but you still get a sense of the place and you can light a candle and prosy still. It will be beautiful and would love to see once work completed

Poor Patrick. Architecture of building is outstanding.Undergoing maintenance at the moment so covered in scaffolding.What I didn't like was the fact that this is one of the 'richest' well known churches in NYC frequented by many famous, well heeled families and donations from the public were being solicited.

under reconstruction. I have been to St. Patrick's many times over the years, so I was truly disappointed to come this time and see almost nothing because of the massive reconstruction project that blocks almost everything. Be forewarned: if you just want to come by, fine; but if you want to see the glories of this wonderful cathedral, you will have to wait a few more years.

Beautiful!!!!!. Stunning building, amazing atmosphere, a must see if you are in New York. I love the quiet that everyone obeys when in a Church, you know that everyone is thinking and reflecting on something or so some. It is simply stunning!!!!!

UNDER CONSTRUCTION. It is a beautiful cathedral, but be forewarned, it is completely covered inside and out with scaffolding. It is undergoing a $175 M restoration and will not be completed until 2015. Look at the white spires that are already sparkling, and the brass doors that have been redone. It will be beautiful when done.

Beautiful. I really wanted to visit St. Patrick's Cathedral, since one of my favorite book of Tom Robbins takes place inside the Cathedral and in its neighborhood. It is a beautiful church and totally worth a visit.

Summer of 2014 Not a Great Time to visit. Although we've peeked in at St. Patrick's during prior trips, especially when it's decorated for Christmas, this summer is not a good time to plan a visit. Both the exterior and interior are shrouded with painting cloths and obscured by scaffolding. Unfortunately, the Church did nothing to offer an alternative of even looking at photographs. You can still imagine up to 5,000 people crowding inside for a service, but it's harder to imagine the grand cupola and stained glass windows without a guide! Pass on by this summer.

Facelift. About 2 years into a 4 year renovation (so we were told) so scaffolding, etc. obstruct alot but nevertheless, it is stunningly beautiful and must see if you've never been there. I've never grown tired of seeing the craftsmanship and the feeling of awe its sheer size and presence inspires. I was disappointed for the hubs since it was his first visit but it oddly motivated me to want to go back when the work is completed. How lucky the citizens of NYC are to have this jewel!

Restoration going on. Both inside and outside. I have never been inside a cathedral that was being restored on the inside...LOTS of scaffolding! It made seeing the inside a bit hard! Fortunately I had visited it several years ago. Wish I could mentioned when it would be over but I didn't check.

June 2014 - under drastic renovation!. We stopped here after an incredible walk through Central Park. The friend that we met hadn’t eaten, so we grabbed drinks and noshed some nachos. The nachos were pretty good (being from TX, I’ve had some knockout nachos, and these held their ground). The beer selection was just “ok” - but, I’m pretty picky and really like to have a nice selection of local beers. They had a few and it was just perfect for the evening.The waitstaff was nice - but our waitress left before we did and it would have been nice to know that we had been given to someone else for the rest of the evening.I’d probably drop back by here, but it wasn’t a place to “seek out”. So, if you’re looking for that perfect bar to grab some grub and drinks while you’re in the City, this place may or may not knock your socks off. It just needs a few things to really stand out above the rest of what the city offers.
Peaceful. The cathedral was shrouded with peace. We loved the inside of the church (the structure and all). It's a great place to do some reflections. What a marvelous place of worship in NYC!
Major Construction. Currently under construction not much to see. However its quite a site. St Tomas is down the street, I recommend seeing it.
Most Beautiful Church in NYC. Most Beautiful Church in NYC. Unbelievable. Breath taking views and statues. Gift shop too.A must see in New York City. I love this site

A haven of peace. A beautiful spot for a moment of peace away from the sidewalks of New York. Interesting building and whilst not old by European standards is still a good place to visist. When I was there the front was undeer scaffolding so I couldn't see much outside, but do step inside.

Currently has building works ongoing. The cathedral currently has building works ongoing so covered in scaffolding inside and out. Worth checking ?online before making a journey here if it is the structure of the building you wish to see. Inside all going on as usual.

simply amazing!!!. St. Patrick's Cathedral is definitely a MUST SEE!!!!! A place of history and spirituality all rolled up in one! The first thing that comes out of people's mouths when entering is "WOAW!!!!" The grandeur of the Cathedral is truly awesome and amazing!!!! If you want to see a piece of New York City's history, get away from all the hustle and bustle of the city and have a few quiet moments with God!

Will Check Out Again Post-Reno. Took a peek inside years ago prior to the renovation. This past weekend, walked around all over the inside. It is strange to see it under construction with all the barricades and scaffolding. I look forward to going back once the renovations are complete to see it again.Truly massive and grand.Be prepared to open your bags for inspection upon entering.

Under construction, yet simply beautiful. The construction at St Patrick's might extend into the next mellinium! But even with scaffolding that stretches the entire cathedral both inside and out, this religious icon rivals the most beautiful in Europe. It is definitely one of America's national treasures.

Architecturally stunning! . This gem in the city is one of the most visited places in New York.Which is why it was in need of a make over.Despite that fact it is still an awe inspiring no matter what your religious beliefs are.My favorite times are when I am lucky enough to be there when the organist is practicing. Brings tears to your eyes.

From a Non-Religious Perspective. Regardless of your religion you should check out St. Patrick's Cathedral - the age and the architecture is pretty amazing. It is under a major restoration right now - but still worth checking out.

Encased in Scaffolding so not as pretty as she once looked!. I'm sure that before the scaffolding went up, inside and out, she was a fine example of ecclesiastical architecture, but at the moment, there is no direction you can face without the tangled web of ironwork marring your view. Still. A lovely building but currently a hidden beauty.

Probably will be cool when they are done remodeling. My mother is Catholic so she wanted me to visit the church while in NYC. I'd seen pictures online and I was interested in the architecture, so I agreed. The ENTIRE place is surrounded by scaffolding. Inside too. They are still having church service and the shrines are mostly accessible inside. I didn't see a project completion date, but I would wait until they finish it before going to see.

Breath-taking. If walking through New York City, tourist or not, Catholic or atheist, walk in. The overwhelming designs are absolutely beautiful and breathtaking. It is amazing and I don't know who would not return to this fabulous place. Very inspiring and magnificent. I will definitely stop by again!

Prepare to have your breath taken away.. An Absolutely awe inspiring space. Regardless of your religious orientation, you can't help but admire the architecture of the interior & the beauty of the stained glass. It's a very spiritual feeling and sense of serenity, especially with the craziness of the city just outside the door. Go, even if all you want is a few minutes to sit in a cool, quiet place and relax. All are welcome, although I always make a small donation to say thank you for keeping the doors open for free.
Exquisite!!!. Simple Exquisite..Admired the achitecture of the church.. Paking might be a challenge. Walking around is fun..

Pales in comparison. We saw many cathedrals in London, Paris and Rome so St. pat's pales in comparison. St Patrick's is nice from what we could see through all the scaffolding. Its currently under restoration so you may want to wait until the project is complete before making a visit.
Beautiful. Fabulous ! well worth a visit if you like churches, some beautiful statues, very serene you wouldn't think all the hustle and bustle that was outside, very quiet.

On Renovation. Walked passed the cathedral while shopping along 5th avenue. Nothing much to see inside as the building is practically on renovation. The steps on the external foreground is a good place to sit & rest before continuing the walk to finish the shopping marathon along 4th & 5th Avenue. Beware of pigeon droppings before you find a place to sit.

Beautiful, excessive, lavish for a church. This place is gorgeous. Right now (and for quite a while, I would imagine) the inside and outside are largely covered in scaffolding for renovations. The stained glass, architecture, sculptures, etc are all incredible, gorgeous and over the top. It's very beautiful but it feels nothing like a House of God or place of worship (in my opinion). I think Jesus might have flipped the tables at a place like this. There was security everywhere (understandable) and lots of donation boxes. If you're looking for a gorgeous tourist attraction, this is it. But, if you are looking for a sanctuary (a place to connect with God, a spiritual advisor, etc.) I think you will be disappointed here.
Love this church. Even though it is being restored lots of scaffolding it still show this church beautiful structure . Worth a visit.

Covered in scaffolding (inside and outside). Fortunately, you can still see the 2 spires reaching to the sky. They are still the most visible part of the cathedral and are newly restored to their original luster. It's true that it's still a beautiful church under it all. It just makes it difficult to take good pictures. I tried to take the iconic picture of St. Patrick's Cathedral through the globe of Atlas. It's just not the same with all the reconstruction work. It's nice to see some of the progress as you make your way through the cathedral. The narthex ceiling looks so much brighter and cleaner than before. The stained glass windows are still visible, as well as the altars of the saints. There was a service in progress at the Lady Chapel. That chapel and organ are concealed in the back of the cathedral because of all the reconstruction work. We lit a couple of candles for loved ones. It's still worth a visit even with all the scaffolding. It was all very beautiful.

A Place Catholics Love to Visit. We were in New York City in December 2013 for 3 nights and the day before our final night one of my sister’s friends visited us who lives not too far from the city. She was most excited about coming here to visit St. Patrick’s Cathedral. No one else in our party is practicing Catholic. My daughter who was with me she has been exposed to it though as her Mom’s side of the family are originally from Colombia and are devout Catholics, and my Mother that was with me too and her family has a very light Catholic background.Despite the construction the other members of my party enjoyed walking through this area, lighting some candles and saying a prayer. My sister really liked looking at the architecture. To me it was one of those, you probably need to be Catholic or a fan of buildings to like this. I decided to politely opt out, and sat on the chairs waiting for them to finish, in order to rest my feet. I had travelled 8,500 miles to get to NYC and was on the go all the time since so no one minded or felt I was being rude.Having seen how much others enjoyed this leads me to give it a very good rating. For Non-Catholics this is free to enter and still easy to pop your head in and take a glace if already walking by it. If in the area might as well give at least that a go.

Amazing. The scaffolding is up everywhere but we thought that was really cool too. It gives you an idea of how much work is involved in the restoration process. We really loved stopping in here and looking around.

Must See. Despite the restoration work, this is a wonderful sanctuary to enter and pause from the madness of shopping and eating. They have posters around of notable Catholics which were interesting and inspiring. I thoroughly enjoyed my brief visit to the cathedral and would recommend it to anyone!

The cathedral itself is wonderful.... As the title suggests, definitely go here! The building is beautiful and you will be in awe of the architecture. Be advised, however, It always seems to be under construction and is overly crowded with no room to turn around, and there isn't a lot to "see" beyond what you would expect to find in a cathedral... well, except the gift shop...
NO GIFT SHOP...PLEASE. I had not been to the cathedral in a number of years. I was so disappointed that it has become a tourist attraction WITH a gift shop. Just let it be.

Restoration work being carried out. Went with a tour, had twenty minutes to look round, the restoration work is being carried out both inside and out, but the inside is a beautiful site if you try and ignore the work ongoing overhead and the sides, when finished it will be worth another visit

beautiful cathedral. I always visit St Patricks when I go to NYC. It is a beautiful cathedral and worth going in every time - even when it is under construction. It is always extremely busy during the Easter weekend, but still worth the time to visit!

under construction. even thou the cathedral is under construcción on all of 5th avenue side, it is still amazing to see it from outside. We tried to visit st Patrick during easter, but resurreccion sunday mass was impossible to attend. The parades on fifth ave and people trying to attend service made the lines very long. so we had to walt to 43rd and 2nd ave to St Agnes church to attend the dominical service. Try to visit during the weekdays

Extensive restoration at the moment. We visited St Patrick's Cathedral for Sunday mass. As we approached, we could see scaffolding over the exterior of the building so it is hard to see what the Cathedral looks like. Inside, same story - most of the cathedral interior is covered with scaffolding. You do get some views of the beautiful stained glass windows and towering pillars towards the rear of the church. It is being cleaned also so when finished, I'm sure it will be magnificent again.

If you like a giant erector set inside and out, head on over.. As a movie dork (could care less about religion), I wanted to see the cathedral that has been in many movies I have seen. Of course at this time the place is absolutely blanketed in scaffolding inside and out so you really can't catch a glimpse of much of anything other than a statue or two and some stained glass.I could imagine when its not being renovated that it would probably be quite a sight. My girlfriend lit some candles for $2 a piece. We peaked in the closet they call a gift shop where a line of people were jockeying for position to buy something so we just left. I'm sure the renovations will take years so it'll be one of those places where we'll just have to happen to walk by it if we ever see it again. That seems to be the thing in New York, especially the city. Everything is always under construction or being renovated in some way shape or form. There seemed to be potential, and it least it didnt cost anything to walk in. You would think the city would do more to warn you of wasting your time like this...Unless you're into seeing a giant erector set. If so, run on over and feast your eyes

A Beautiful Cathedral. I hadn't been inside St Patrick's since I was a child. Imagine my surprise when I saw that it was covered in scaffolding both inside and out. The impression I left with was that there is beauty in almost everything.

The Scaffolding Cannot Hide It's Beauty. My husband and I were on a week tour of New York City with a group. They took us to this elegant cathedral on the way to Rockefeller Center. The building is being renovated. At first glance all you see is scaffolding (actually a testament to the renovators as this is rather intricate and spectacular in itself). Then you start to walk around and try to find what you CAN see... and it is beautiful! My husband and I lit a candle for our daughter who has been going through some rough times health-wise - felt so at peace after doing so and got good news about her condition later on in our trip. I hope to return to the cathedral when it has been fully restored and see the final product. "The idea is to bring the building back to what it was in the 1880s," said Jeffrey Murphy of Murphy Burnham & Buttrick Architects, which is leading the design team overseeing the restoration work. "When it's all done, it will be cleaner and lighter. ... It will be like when the building was when it was built."
Covered with scaffolding. Pretty much unavailable for tourists now due to rehab scaffolds inside and out. I'm sure it will be beautiful when it's done.

Hard to appreciate it's grandeur during renovations. You can catch a glimpse here and there. With or without scaffolding, it is a beautiful building. It meant a great deal to me on this occasion, as I stopped to light a candle in memory of my father. They ask for a $2 donation, which I was more than happy to give.

Beautiful although the restorations.... It's a beautiful cathedral, in spite the restorations going on. You can't really enjoy the outside shape, but if you come inside you can enjoy some of the marble work, alters and painted glass windows. Try to come on weekdays for it's less crowded, but hearing a part of Sunday mass is also a unique experience. Seeing such an old building in the middle of the 5th Ave with all the shopping and towers around was something special. The restorations are supposed to last until the end of 2015 so I wouldn't wait for them to be over...

A beautiful building no matter your beliefs. Even with all the scaffolding around it, St Patrick's is a beautiful building. Whether you are visiting because you have an interest in architecture or because you want to attend a service, this church is worth a visit to admire its grandeur.Although the scaffolding does detract a little, you should not let that stop you from attending and admiring.
Ignore rennovations. I thought that this was a very beautiful place, but the rennovations made it look sort of bad. Once they are completed it will be very nice again.

Look past the renovations. They will finish it sooner or later but in the meantime, look past the ongoing work. We were able to watch a baptism going on from just a few pews away - the family had the front roped off for privacy but it was very sweet to watch. Don't miss the gift store accross the street. Was a very meaningful experience.
Couldn't see any of it inside or out.. Under restoration, give it a miss at the moment because it is completely covered by scaffolding inside and out.

Scaffolding. Visited this cathedral for mass but didn't do a tour as the building is being renovated and the interior is full of scaffolding. I'm sure when the work is completed it will be stunning. I'll have to return to NY to see it :)
Gorgeous. I'm not Catholic, but this place was amazing. When you go, be sure to take some time to admire the details and not get caught up in the overall grandeur.
under renovation. unfortunately nothing to see so presently not worthwhile the visit -neighter for the spirit nor fo the architecture- wait until the construction sites are cleared

Stunning. Although everything was covered in scaffolding, it was still beautiful. Just knowing that the first stone was put in place in the Mid 1800's, and what it took to build this magnificent structure.

Beautiful even during refurbishment work. Have been to St.Patricks Cathedral every time im in NY and always amazes me the this is perched between sky scrapers and mad traffic!!.. Have seen it prior to and whilst refurbishment work is on going.. and in my opinion still dosent take away from it, make it your buisness to see it!!

Beware of Renovations. I know that it will be worth the wait but it was a huge disappointment to see the whole church inside and out covered in scaffolding. I look forward to seeing the result hopefully in the not too distant future.

Beautiful Cathedral despite Extensive On-going Renovation. While the scaffolding clearly detracts from the experience, this is a beautiful church. We enjoyed the noon mass. The Irish tenor server provided the most moving singing I've ever heard inside a church. Quick, efficient mass that still provided a meaningful message. No restrooms... Plan accordingly.

Refurbishment. I could not see very well because many things were covered/protected due to refurbishment or restoration. Anyway, it seems be OK to visit but you do not have time do not hesitate to exclude it from your planning for NYC...
Ongoing renovation!. Wasn't able to appreciate the beauty of the church inside because there's an ongoing renovation...hope it's done when I come back
Beautiful. This is the first place I visit in Midtown. It is under construction/renovation right now, which may ruin your experience. I cannot wait to see it when the renovation is finished!
Go visit!. Beautiful historical landmark in NYC. There is no cost for admission, but you can donate. Currently under renovations, but still very spectacular to see. It's huge.

Visit after construction is completed. Unless you are a devout Catholic (does not apply to me or my guest) or this specific cathedral would hold special meaning to you, visit another cathedral during your NYC trip. This cathedral is under construction both outside (which almost completely covers the entire building outside) and inside (which obstructs the majority of the interior), making viewing impossible. Unless you are attending mass here or have a special reason for going to this particular place, while under massive construction, go elsewhere for a cathedral experience.

Worth the visit but currently under construction. Unfortunately the cathedral was under renovations and the scaffolding was everywhere. It was difficult to see the beauty of the building. As devout Catholics we felt fortunate to be there on a Sunday and attended Mass, Timothy Cardinal Dolan was the celebrant. I found his homily to be moving, encouraging and made sense for our daily living. It was a bonus to have him as the celebrant as I had only seen him on TV or listened to him on the radio.
Magnificent church. Unfortunately it was covered in scaffolding but still quite impressive. Very easy to visit and tour with helpful facts and history available at the door.

Magnificent despite the scaffolding. At first glance, you struggle to see the cathedral through the considerable scaffolding that is currently in place. However, once you see beyond it, the incredible architecture and religious artefacts are stunning. Definitely worth visiting. I'd certainly like to visit again when the renovations are complete.

Beautiful. Although I missed mass the atmosphere in this magnificent cathedral was awe inspiring. it is hard to believe that this gem is in the heart of such a busy city. Anyone travelling to New York should make time to visit this iconic monument.
Awe inspiring. A beautiful piece of history. Don't have to be Catholic to feel the majesty of it. Definitely worth viewing.

Inspiring Sunday Mass. On our visit yesterday there was now scaffoldiing everywhere inside the Cathedral....BUT in spite of those small "obstacles" the faithful streamed in for a standing room only Mass. God bless Cardinal Dolan for also visiting the Ukrainian Catholic church Sunday morning too. Can't wait to see the Cathedral when the work is done!

Stunning!. Beautiful architecture, whether you are Catholic or not this church is a must see when traveling to NYC, my wife and I make it a point to attend mass when are in town and I always marvel at it's beauty. One thing to be aware of is all Masses don't have music so if you want to hear the sound of the massive pipe organ go to Cathedrals web site and the mass schedule, the mass times with music are in bold print.

Under renovation at the moment. Visited the Cathedral but we were disappointed to see it covered inside and out in scaffolding.This construction will go on until the end of 2015 so it may be worthwhile waiting until then to visit

Will be great -. Have always wanted to visit St Patricks but unfortunately it was all under scaffolding or wraps for renovations when I was there. I can imagine it will be wonderful when it is finally unveiled. Still don't let this put you off a visit. There are still some great things inside - -

Gothic architecture in the heart of Manhattan. It's a gorgeous Cathedral right in the heart of NYC. Currently under renovation but still amazing! Definitely a must see even for non Catholic/religious visitors.

A bit of God in your trip can't hurt. My girlfriend and I take an annual New York shopping trip. We spend 4 days of spending way too much money on food, an amazing hotel, drinks, shows, clothes, etc. And within that crazy binging spending spree, we have ALWAYS made time for Sunday morning Mass. Typically the 10:15 Mass is the Cardinal's Mass if you feel strongly about attending his. After 3 days of shopping and spending WAY TOO MUCH on food and drinks, we relish the Sunday morning Mass to get our heads back on straight before we fly home in the evening. Whether you're Catholic or not, the message is worth the trip and hey, the stores don't open until noon on Sunday anyway so take a moment to give back.

Will be beautiful soon. St Patricks is currently under renovation and it's hard to see much at all but you can still tell what a stunning building it is and I'm sure it will be beautiful once the renovations are complete . Centrally located you are likely to walk past so pop your head in and take a look.

A must go place, currently under renovation. It is my most favorite in NYC. A must visit place for me when I am in NY. It is currently under renovation so one may not be able to see the total beauty of the place. There is also a baggage check before entering the main area of the cathedral.Being seated there for sometime is a must to appreciate the architecture and gain some inner peace. Do not forget to light a candle and make your prayers.

Wait until 2015. We were so sad to go in and not be able to see ANYTHING because the interior is completely covered for renovations. Not sure when it will be done, but there is no reason (except for a service) to go here - absolutely nothing to see right now.

Beautiful landmark. Even if you are not a believer, it is well worth the visit, which can be guided or not. It is a beautiful Neo-gothic building, decorated with stunning stained glass windows and a magnificent organ which is played in some services.

Good, but under construction. We went between Christmas and New Years. VERY crowded. There was a service going on, but we were there to sight-see, as we are not Catholics. Between the crowds of congregants and tourists plus all the construction obstacles, it was very difficult to maneuver. I felt I was intruding. What was there was beautiful. Several of the side chapels/altars were moving. Frustrated that the "shop" was down the street in another location, as it had been on site last time I had visited (decades ago). Not as convenient to purchase items. But, it IS beautiful, magnificent, impressive, gorgeous, a real tribute to our magnificent God.

Magnificent Cathedral. Made a brief visit to St Patricks Cathedral while visiting NYC.It is very impressive and well worth going inside to see the interior.Beautiful stained glass and organ. This cathedral easily matches many I have seen in Europe.Only the east side was free of scaffolding when I visited and this gave an idea of the magnifience of the building. Disappointing that so much was covered up, but gives me an excuse to visit New York again.

Impressive Cathedral for the people. The first thing that will strike you when you cross 5th Avenue between 50th and 51st Street and you look at the amazing St. Patrick's Cathedral is the contrast between all the modern office buildings and the 135 years old Cathedral. It looks if time stood still when you are in front of the church. This Roman Catholic Cathedral, built in Neo-Gothic style, is one of the biggest in the world. It measures 110 meters long and 58 meters wide. The two towers at the front are 100 meters high and the ship inside is 36 meters high and 16 meters wide. The original site was bought in 1810 for $.11.000 where a Jesuit school and a chapel were built, which served later as an orphanage by Trappists. After the Trappists left, the chapel was reopened in 1840 by Bishop Dubois and a small church was built. It was only in 1853 that Archbishop John Joseph Hughes announced that a new Cathedral was going to replace the small church and was to be named Saint Patricks Cathedral. The building stared in 1858. The Cathedral was completed in 1878 and dedicated in 1879. A few years later an adjacent school was opened. In 1888 the spires were added and in 1900 they started building an addition on the east, including the beautiful Lady Chapel. The Cathedral was renovated between 1927 and 1931. The cathedral and associated buildings were declared a National Historic Landmark in 1976. In 2012 an extensive restoration of the cathedral was begun and is planned to last 3 years at a cost of $.177 million.St. Patricks Cathedral is the seat of the Archbishop of New York, Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan. Every year more than 5 million people enter the Cathedral and more then 1 million prayer candles are lit. There are seats for more than 2.400 people and mass is celebrated more than 2.400 times a year. The great stained glass windows and the bronze doors are impressive. The Lady Chapel, behind the main sanctuary, is a place for prayer, where picture taking is not allowed. The painting of The Lady Guadalupe at the Altar of the Sacred Heart at the right of the main sanctuary is the most visited place of the Cathedral. A basement crypt behind the altar is the burial place of every New York Archbishop and the remains of Pierre Touissant, who was an Haitian Catholic slave.Masses were held here for New York Yankees Babe Ruth and Billy Martin, football legend Vince Lombardi, singer Celia Cruz, Senator Robert F. Kennedy, and for many of 9/11's fallen police and firefighters. A visit to St. Patrick's Cathedral is highly recommended.TIPS-> There are several masses each day, some of them with music. Sometimes they are broadcasted on local channels;-> There are free public tours of the Cathedral on select days beginning at 10 a.m. and daily services are free and open to the public;-> On the right side after the entrance there is a small gift shop (The Annex), selling a small selection of medals, rosary beads and post cards. The main gift shop is located across the street from the Cathedral on 51st Street-> You can still visit the old St. Patricks Old Cathedral, located at 260–264 Mulberry Street between Prince and Houston Streets in the Nolita neighborhood;

Escape the rat race.... Even with the scaffolding, this is a magnificent church! It doesn't get in the way of what the church is really for: worship, peace and serenity! I lit a candle in reverence of loved ones who have departed this earth. The pipe organ is a work of art and the stained glass is lovely. Services for many famous people have been held here. Come in, take a load off your feet and enjoy!

Too much scaffolding. The church itself is beautiful and the history is great. However, the renovation has taken over the outside and inside of the church. The is scaffolding everywhere in side and out. If you want to see the actual church you should come when the reno is finished.

Must see Cathedral. Very quiet and calm place. One has to visit this place and go round the this cathedral and pray. Lot of construction is going on. But still lot of place for people to go in and see the place. take time to see the beautiful sculptures and praying places.The architecture is fntastic and interiors are great. See the altar and pray.

Beautiful cathedral. Unfortunately, right now there is a lot of construction going on outside and inside St. Pat's, but you can still walk around and visit the different chapels, which are beautiful. Once the construction is finished the cathedral will be even more beautiful.

lovely place. There is much construction going on in St. Patrick's but you can still enjoy the beauty of the church and the different chapels around the main altar. Prior to entering you must have your bags and packages inspected, but it was not a problem. I think the fact that there is so much construction many people do not want to visit the church, but it is still worth visiting.

Pretty Cathedral. I'm not religious but I do love architecture and St. Patrick's does not disappoint with its beautiful interior ribbing for the vaults and lovely ceiling medallions of flowers and vines. It's size compares to Westminster Abbey, so it is quite grand. The altar was beautiful and ornate, as one would expect, and the side chapels were just as interesting as the main cathedral. Warning: The cathedral is undergoing major renovation right now so any shots of the main area are going to include scaffolding. It's still worth the visit.

Beautiful cathedral like an oasis in Manhattan. If you feel tired walking all the around New York City, you will feel this cathedral like an oasis in Manhattan. Enlightening, beautiful and calm cathedral will refresh you up while traveling the world's most crowded city. Not the must-go place, but worth-visiting. :-)

Serenity abounds. We have visited St Patricks a few time and it still takes my breathe away. It is currently undergoing renovation on a huge scale, but this does not distract you in any way. You can't even hear the noise from the workers. I'm not Catholic but my husband is and I find myself drawn to the faith when I start going up the stairs to the entrance. Take time to visit this wonderful place. The outside noise of Taxis' are plentiful honking horns together with the noise from the hustle and bustle of 5th Avenue just disappear as if my magic with every step you take from the sidewalk. Go on make that visit you will not be disappointed.

Enlightening : ). When visiting NY on Sundays we like to start our day at St. Pat's. Even if you are not Catholic; if you love music, and who doesn't?, I recommend the 10:00 am Mass which includes the full choir. In one word: inspiring. Get there early if you want a seat.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful that every Catholic should have on their bucket list. Non-Catholics will enjoy the beauty of the church as well but for Catholics it is really something special.

Beautiful Stained Glass. I'm a sucker for stained glass. I love visiting old cathedrals like this one. The quality of the light as it shines through the colorful glass is stunning. Beautiful architecture too!

Wonderful and Moving Mass. The cathedral is under construction, so you can't see much. Sunday mass with the choir at 1015 was absolutely wonderful. It was one of the best things I did while in NYC. Attendees were from many different denominations and seemed to be enjoying the service. Highly recommend.

Beautiful Cathedral. This is a must see when in NYC even if you aren't Catholic. We took our son for the first time this past holiday season and I was disappointed because the place is covered inside and out with scaffolding, hence the 4 star rating. This is a beautiful cathedral when not under construction, though the price to light a candle has gone up since I was last in. Can't wait to see it after the renovations.

Awe Inspiring Church. The church is currently under construciton, but you can still go inside and walk around. It is stunning and even with all the scaffolding you can see the history and the grandeur of this fine old church. Stain glass windows are beautiful as well as the gold chalis and the manger they had set up for Christmas. All the candles were lit and it was surreal. You get a sense of peace and calm when you enter that church and if your a believer, then I think you can feel the heavenly spirit inside this church.

Connect with Angels!. We walked into a BEAUTIFUL church with a beautiful ceiling, floors and a last minute MASS prayer that felt like a sign from heaven above. They have these mass prayers spontaneously, so make sure you go in even for a few minutes.

Wonderful, peaceful moment in the city. We stopped in here to get out of the blustery cold wind. I wasn't sure what my daughter would say. She was enthralled by the saints and said several prayers of thanks and wellness for my grandparents. It was a precious moment. We will go back next time we're in NYC and look forward to seeing the renovations complete.

Truly a spiritual experience.. We make the pilgrimage every Christmas and spend several days in NYC to soak up the festivities. We attend the Christmas Eve 5:30 service geared to children. Other than the current construction and scaffolding that is all over the interior for a few years, the service was wonderful. You walk out uplifted, and full of hope for humanity.

Beautiful cathedral. The archetecture is fantastic. It is crowded and there is not much room to move around the scaffolds. The cathedral is still under renovation after 10+ years. It is well worth your time as you walk around the city. It is located South of Central Park and a block off 5th Avenue. Please be respectful as this is an active church and people are praying.

A must stop in NYC. This is such a beautiful building. The carvings are exquisite and many of the alters were done with such high artistic skill, it was breathtaking. This is a must stop when vising in NYC if you're never been there. It reminded me of the beautiful churches in Europe, just with a lot less gold decorations.

Beautiful Architecture. It was a nice break from all the other New york modern buildings. Undergoing renovation at the moment so we weren't able to enjoy the beauty of it fully. Still, well worth a visit!

Beautiful Catholic Church under repair. If you are Catholic, this is a must see stop. If not, you may still be interested in visiting beautiful St. Patrick's Cathedral. If you planning on going to mass here, I recommend getting there at least 15 minutes before the service starts particularly around heavy crowd times like the Christmas Holidays. It is located on 5th avenue very close to Rockefeller center and many other sights to see.

Beautiful even under renovation!. We were in the area to see the tree at Rockefeller Center when I remembered we were close to St. Patrick's. I didn't realize it was under renovation, so I wasn't even sure it was open until I saw the signs. So glad we went inside! In spite of renovations, this is one of the most beautiful buildings you will ever see. You can appreciate what it will look like where you see some areas that have been cleaned and renovated already. Special note - if you look up at the ceiling near the alter, you'll see the Cardinal hats hanging from the ceiling. You cannot help but feel moved by being there. A must see if you are in the area!

Well worth a visit!. St. Patrick's is one of those places we always visit in the city. It is a gorgeous cathedral, though the scaffolding for the current renovations does mask some of its features. We attended an early morning week day Mass on a recent visit. The service was being taped for television so the Cardinal performed the service and there was a wonderful cantor. The nativity scene is beautiful.

Despite scaffolding inside, worth a detour. Went with friends unplanned on sunday, joined a full cathedral of people theer for service led by the Cardinal. Many different nations in one place among the building work, calm and respectful, actually more stimulating than many NYC "attractions" . Great counter to relentless commerciality of 5th avenue
Architectural Beauty. The reverence of this holy cathedral sinks deeply into you as soon as you step through the magnificent doors! Truly an experience of divine pleasure.

Beautiful!. Major renovation going on inside and out so you couldn't get the full effect but it really is beautiful! You can still walk through the church. Can't wait to go back one day and really get another good look!

Construction!. When I walked in there was mass going on and I felt uncomfortable touring a church during a ceremony like this. You could tell the church is beautiful but with all the construction going on you can't see much at all. It was a nice place to look just to say you did and warm up for a second.

Renovation in full swing. While we were there in december, the renevation was in full swing. You can only see a little of the church, most of the building is covered in pastic and is rebuild. But the small things you can see are just besutifull.
Beautiful very time.. The cathedral is being restored, but due to the extreme attention to detail you can appreciate. There was a baptism going on, just an extraordinary place.

Beautiful Cathedral. I was disappointed that this Cathedral is under construction, but it's a 3-year project. It's still beautiful inside even with scaffolding. Take a walk around. I'm looking forward to returning when construction is complete.

Scaffolding everywhere. Very disappointed as have never seen scaffolding inside as well as outside a church but should be grateful it is being restored. just not able to appreciate its glory at the moment

Place of worship not just a place to visit.. Fantastic building and worth the visit but please remember that this is also a place of worship. Fortunately the apparators try to stop people walking in with drinks and food but it can be disconcerting are just there to visit when a service is taking place. I look upon it as at east of the virtue of patience

Even under construction it's beautiful. We visited St. Patrick's Cathedral and noticed that it was the perfect place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. There is so much to take in and appreciate as you walk through the cathedral.
Under construction... worth the trip. The ENTIRE building is covered in tarps and scaffolding. Completely under construction. Worth the walk through. You can still see all the alters.

Lovely building. I visited when the facade was being renovated so I didn't get my postcard photo however it is still worth visiting. On the inside they displayed the ethnic diversity of Catholics by showing saints and icons relating to different cultures and countries. It is an amazing building and worth a visit

beautiful. I'm not Catholic but found this cathedral to be very beautiful. It was lined with scaffolding inside and out so I didn't get the full effect of the architecture, but still found it worth the visit.
Visited during renovations. This place is beautiful. The architecture is incredible, and you can't help but feel the reverence when you walk in the doors.

More scaffolding inside, then out. Incredible. One of my 'must stops' on ever trip to NYC. It is always something to beholden and they are working so hard on the renovations. We were able to attend mass in the back and confession before Christmas. If you've never been, Catholic or not, it is such a magical place.

Under Construction!. While this is obviously a beautiful structure, the current renovation process obscures the viewing of most of it both inside and out. The scaffolding totally covers the walls top to bottom. We will return another time when work is complete.

Under construction. I love to come to St Pats anytime I am in NY as I love the feeling of shutting out the city in this oasis. While it is certainly still special, the significant amount of construction going on inside and out certainly takes away from the experience. There is scaffolding up everywhere so you really cant see much of the interior of the church. I can't wait to see it finished as I am sure it will look even more beautiful.

Beautiful... must visit!. This is a must visit for Catholics and really, people of any faith. It is a beautiful church! It is currently under construction/renovation, so we didn't get to see all of the beauty it holds... but it is still a worthwhile stop in NYC!

A real wonder in the material world. The church is on 50th Street and 5th Avenue in Manhattan, next to Saks fifth avenue, close to the Top of the rock Rockefeller building. This wonderful gothic cathedral has a strong contrast and mirror to the material world and consumer society. A wonderful island in the shopping area, where you can have a rest and you can think of your lost loved ones. Light a candle, sit down and just have a prayer. Incredible place in the concret jungle. Actually an important renovation is undertaken, only a part can be visited, but it's worth. Try to get there when there is a Mass. You have Masses from Monday – Friday:7:00, 7:30, 8:00 am, 12 Noon, 12:30, 1:00, 5:30 pm (Music at 5:30 on Mondays and Fridays only). Saturday:8:00 am (in Lady Chapel)12 Noon, Vigil Mass at 5:30 pm (Fulfills Sunday obligation) Confessions: 12 Noon to 12:45 pm and 3:30 to 5:30 pmSunday: 7:00, 8:00, 9:00, 10:15 am (Choir), 12 Noon, 1:00, 4:00 (Spanish), and 5:30 pmNo Confessions heard on Sundays.For more info check out: http://m.ny.com/cgibin/frame.cgi?url=http://www.archny.org/about-us/st-patricks-cathedral/&frame=/frame/holiday.html

Beautiful cathedral!. I love this cathedral--especially from the outside at the top of the cathedral--like the views from the New York Palace. It's peaceful if you can find it on the right time of day. But, I like that so many people flock to this cathedral and its usually a place of activity. It's not as historical as many in Europe but it holds its own.

An amazing site but currently under massize renovations. Have been here before and it is stunning but it is really a construction site at present. If you can't come back then definately go in to see what you can but if you can make it back to see it in it's whole then do it for the history and the beauty.

Worth a visit any time. If you travel or live in Europe, St Pat's is perhaps no big deal because compared to "normal" cathedrals in Europe, this one is modest. But for NYC, it is pretty spectacular if you can get through the morons camped on the steps.

Always Beautiful and Peaceful. This is one of the most beautiful churches I've been in both artistically and architechturally. The stsined glass will take your breath away and if you look closely they tell a story. The alcoves with the saints and intention candles are always pretty. My favorite area is the chapel behind the altar. I fibd despite all the bustling and hundreds of people filing through the cathedral it is always peaceful and prayerful. If you've studied the Saints go to the back chapel and look at the windows above. There are nine windows that go around the chapel ceiling. They have several stained glass scenes and each scene features a saint. There must be hundreds of them. I also like the replica of the Pieta. It is beautiful. Every time I'm in the city I stop here. It is a true jewel. As mentioned in other reviews they are undergoing huge renovations. There is a lot of scaffolding throughout the church and somexareas are blocked off. I am looking forward to seeing it after it is finished.
Peace & Solace. I am not Catholic, but I found great peace and solace within the Cathedral. It was undergoing great renovations both inside and out, but it was still very much worth it.

Beautiful, undergoing repair. Amidst a $175 million repair and refurbishment when we visited in Dec 2013 .. still a wondrous place to worship, just be ready for scaffolding and workers as necessary work is done.

Great for Mass - But Be Aware of Renovations. This was one of the few things that my partner specifically cited as wanting to see while in NYC, so we ended up going to the Mass at 9AM to check it out. The Mass was surprisingly good for a cathedral that doubles as a tourist attraction: on the website it noted that the 9AM service had "music" (the one at 10AM has a choir), and we weren't really sure what that meant, but it turned out that they had a solo singer for the hymns/songs. She was quite good and made the service much more enjoyable. The Mass was great and I don't have any complaints about it.The cathedral in general, however, is currently under some pretty substantial renovations. My partner was really disappointed since it was something he had been looking forward to for a while, and while I knew that the cathedral was undergoing renovations I was still surprised at the extent of the construction. If you're in the area there is absolutely no reason to stop in and take a look around, but at this point it is still pretty much impossible to get a good view of the overall architecture of the building from the outside or the inside. Until renovations are complete or at least scaled back, I would put this under as a "low-priority" attraction.

Being renovated.. It's a fabulous place to see, but you really can't see it right now because of renovations. You can see the side altars and get behind the nave, but can't take pictures back there. Don't get it's true magnificent effect.

Worth taking a look.. St. Patrick's Cathedral is worth a short visit if you are at Rockefeller Center or otherwise walking around Mid-town Manhattan. It is not a particularly important historical site, although it enjoys some interesting history, and it is not the equal architecturally or aura-wise of scores of European cathedrals, but it is impressive for its size, location, and decor. Interesting as a landmark of NYC and its history of Irish immigration.

Worth a visit but scaffolding up just now.. A fantastic example of gothic architecture if you like that kind of thing. A wonderful exterior but under refurbishment at present with scaffolding up. Inside still operational with sevices etc and plenty of visitors. The individual chapels were really beautiful and welcoming....no admission charge or pressure for donations. The view from the Top of the Rock is also worth seeing as it's very close and when you look down onto the roof there is a perfectly structured cross.

Really beautiful- just a shame it is covered up. Currently lots of scaffolding inside and out, but still a beautiful place. It felt very open and friendly and I liked it that there was neither a charge nor a hard sell for a donation.

Wait until renovations are completed. We could sense that there must be a beautiful church under there somewhere - but with scaffolding covering the exterior and most of the interior as well, it is not worth the stop right now. The few side chapels and interesting bits are crowded with people trying to find something of interest to look at. Even the front steps were flooded with water, hoses, and workers, and people were jostling to get around the water and each other - we will try St. Patrick's again next trip.

Beautiful cathedral -- feels like you're in Europe. This is a lovely cathedral, and we were surprised to see that t is currently covered with scaffolding. See, that alone reminds me of European cathedrals! It is a lovely haven in the middle on Manhattan. The cathedral is huge and we enjoyed the large number of beautiful artworks. Well worth a visit when in Manhattan. Afterwards, walk down Madison Avenue for some serious shopping.

Take a breath, take it all in.. Every Christmas I rebel from Las Vegas to NYC to visit my brother. Every Christmas I make the time to visit this beautiful and reverent monument; regardless of the renovations, the experience is what I leave with.

Much Improved. While I was still disappointed that the exterior is completely covered in scaffolding and panhandlers frequent the front stairs, I was happy that early on a Saturday morning this beautiful place was practically empty. This allowed me to take in the atmosphere and enjoy the experience. I lucked out that they were just finishing morning Mass and got to hear lovely music echo through the apse and nave. I would love to go for Mass one time, but I fear it will be too chaotic....

So Beautiful, But Mostly Under Tarps. We just happened to visit while the beautiful cathedral was under major restoration. I understand it is necessary, it was just a shame because you really could not see much of the stonework outside and much of the inside was behind tarps or blocked with scaffolding. Despite, you could still feel peaceful and tranquil atmosphere and we are glad we got to see it.

Amazing even under renovations. As of November 2013, it's almost impossible to get a good picture of the exterior due to the extensive renovations. There are also significant renovations inside, with scaffolding through the interior of the church. However, it still easy to see the grandeur of this phenomenal building. Additionally, going up and down the sides, you can see the small niches for Saints and all of the ornamentation that has made this monument justifiably famous. Even with the renovations, still very worth visiting; hopefully, will have a chance to visit after the renovations are done as well.

St. Patrick's. This is a beautiful church, that would have received a much higher rating from me if it wasn't full of scaffolding. This church is taking on major renovations at this time and takes away from the scene of it, however still a very beautiful church.

Under remodeling / Fall, 2013. Exterior is virtually disguised as scaffolding, as is the interior. The altar is not compromised by the remodeling work. Ushers and staff were disinterested in tourists and beyond unfriendly.

Beautiful Building. We visited this iconic New York building at the end of October and were disappointed, as it is undergoing a makeover which could take up to 8 months to complete.So we did not get to see the full glory of the building either inside or out.But what we did see was quite beautiful and was very busy with workmen, tourists and mass goers, but it also took away from the traditional sense of peace that is associated with religious institutions. It was good to see it anyway.

Disappointed due to renovations . My husband and I went to St. Patrick's Cathedral with our friends. It was disappointing to see that there were massive renovations taking place. It was clear to see that the cathedral is an absolutely beautiful building, however I would not visit again until the renovations are complete.

Mass at noon on Fifth Ave. Yes, Saint Patrick's Cathedral is undergoing major restoration, both inside and out. It is rather interesting to go inside during this renovation and find Mass being said at Noon on a workday and a number of the faithful attending. Those attending Mass included neighbors, business people, high school tourists and adult tourists. We wandered around, sat for a bit of Mass, lit a candle and stood in awe that such a Cathedral is right there in the middle of NYC, across the street from Rock Center and just around the corner from Central Park. Beautiful and Amazing!! I can't wait to go back in a couple of years and see it after the restoration.

Under major renovations. I have visited the cathedral on various visits in NYC and this was the first time I've seen a majority of the church under renovation & closed off for viewing at its normal splendor. The major renovation project is expected for another 2yrs. Wait to visit until completed

An Inspiring Sight. St. Patrick's Cathedral is a beautiful piece of architecture both inside and out. Beautiful stained-glass windows pour a lovely palette of shades through the sunlit windows. Along the sides are small "chapels" to saints. A small shop tucked in a back corner allows the faithful to purchase holy cards, rosaries, and medals. If you are lucky, as I was, you will be there on a late Saturday afternoon and witness a lovely wedding. One note: the Cathedral is currently being refurbished and repaired and is covered both inside and out with scaffolding. This does diminish the experience.

A Truly beautiful place.. This amazing building in the middle of high rises is just beautiful.Even if you are not religious you cannot fail to be moved by its inner beauty. The restoration is ongoing and you can see them working all around you but it is still quiet and serene. If you do nothing else in New York visit this wonderful place and sit for just a moment ;you will forget you are in the middle of the hustle and bustle ..Light a candle for a loved one before you go..On the way out you can get a keep sake medallion from a machine .Well worth a visit..

You could be in Europe. This church, although undergoing restoration, is definitely worth a stop while walking along Madison Ave. The interior is impressive and the history of RFK's funeral resonates.
Beautiful. This cathedral just took my breath away! Even with all the scaffolding and repair work, the beauty of this cathedral is still evident! Fabulous cathedral that is well worth a visit.
Under repair. This is an outstanding piece of history and art. Currently under repair so much scaffolding interfering with the true majesty.

Gorgeous architecture, Catholics pay your tithes for tourists to enjoy. Still under construction but open for walk-through and services. Built 1858-1879, this neo-Gothic cathedral was in the middle of a $175 million restoration. Some construction debris, scaffolding, plastic sheeting, but beautiful architecture, reliquaries, stained glass, and sculpture to enjoy. Free but donations accepted.

MUST SEE IN NYC!. Wonderful cathedral in New York City that is a must see for every visitor. If you are Catholic this is a must for Mass as many are offered throughout each day. If you are not catholic this is also a great stop for cultural history. Easy to get to, near times square and Rockefeller center this is a must see in NYC!

Under construction. We didn’t see much of it, just passed by and poked our head inside. There is a lot of scaffolding inside and outside the cathedral. It’s a 2 years $177 million renovation.Built between 1859-79, the cathedral seats 2400 people. Funerals for police officers and firefighters were held here after 9/11.I hope to get back to New York City when it’s done to see more of it.There is no fee but contributions are accepted.
Breath Taking. Beyond Words. I had a chance encounter with the Cathedral and wad able to take the tour around with singing going on in the church. ..a spiritual journey must have
Beautiful. Everyone should see this cathedral at least once in their lifetime. I try to go at leat once a year as I live in the state of New York.
Under Renovation. In spite of the scaffolding it is a must see, worth going in just to see all the stained glass and the beautiful architecture.

Good. This was good. The staff were friendly and the self guided tour was good. Though only down side but understandable was that there was building work going on. There seemed be a lot of history there. Also take note is that when you do the. Self guided tour you have to leave something of value. The. Cathedral is free itself being a church I suppose that it has to be. Though there is a charge for the tour guide

A little piece of tranquility. I decided to visit St. Patrick's Cathedral, it's located on 5th Ave & 50th St. The building undergoing some restoration work maintains its elegant exterior, upon entering the Cathedral, I was immediately struck by the feeling of calm and tranquility, as the noise of the busy weekday traffic seem to disappear behind me. You are able to spend as much or as little time here as you like, light a candle and enjoy the serenity. Such a welcome relief from the hectic lifestyle that is today's NY.

Beautiful. Anyone who visits New York should stop in to explore this cathedral. It is very beautiful inside. You can walk around to view the different saints and read a bit about them or maybe even say a pray by each if you wish. You can also light candles in different areas of the church for a small donation. They have a small gift shop inside of religious items and souvenirs.

Worth seeing. Even with construction going on, I highly recommend taking a look inside St. Patrick's Cathedral on Fifth Avenue at 50th St. It's a beautiful gothic style building, complete with rose window, which you may or may not be able to see depending on how much scaffolding still is there. If you plan to return to New York in the future, you may want to save this site for another time, but if you don't plan to return, definitely go see it while you're here. If there is no mass service in progress, you can walk all around, even behind the main altar. While it may not rival European cathedrals like Notre Dame de Paris, or even our own St. John the Divine, it's still quite impressive, and it's right in midtown, near Rockefeller Center and Saks Fifth Avenue. I have visited on a number of occasions and always enjoy it.
Views. Free to see and I would recommend. There are some works going on at the moment, but there are still some fantastic sights inside this cathedral. Just sit down and look up and be amazed.
Construction but still walk in. Lots of construction but still rather impressive inside. Made me think I was inside a cathedral in Europe. Seemed odd to be in downtown NYC.

Hidden from view right now. Major construction works hide this cathedral totally right now. Scaffoldings everywhere. The Rose window is totally covered and so on. I can't honestly recommend anyone to visit this place now unless they are passing by and have spare time. The scaffolding is bad enough, but from what I can judge, this cathedral is not much to see even without.Compared to cathedrals in Europe, this one is much less decorated. The cathedral of St John the Divine on upper west side/Harlem is much more impressive so better visit that place if you want to see a big cathedral.

Amazing Cathedral. This is a MUST place to stop at! Although at the moment they are restoring this amazing place it's still stunning ! Beautiful art and altars and stained glass. A wonderful religious experience too.
So Peaceful. I always stop in here for a moment of silence when I am in the city. It is absolutely gorgeous and I always leave with a feeling of serenity.

Beautiful but it was also a big construction site. I visited the Cathedral a few years ago and it was such a beautiful place!I wanted to bring my mother in law since I knew she would really appreciate this cathedral but I was dissapointed by the amount of construction there was.You could barely see the cathedrale from outside because of the construction and then inside there were large areas blocked off.It was still nice but it did not give her the chance to see the true beauty of this place.
A must for a Catholic. This cathedral has free admission like a Catholic Church is supposed to be. It is currently in the process of being renovated. It is truly impressive.
Scaffolding everywhere. I preferred visiting St Vincent's and St Thomas's. St Patrick's was crowded and covered in scaffolding. Couldn't see any of the beauty others talk about. May be next time

SAD,BUT WITH A REASON. Always wanted to see what is described as a magnificent cathedral set in the heart of New York City.Alas, the day we went, not only were we saturated but the only 1/2 day rain of our entire holiday, but we found the exterior of the cathedral covered in scaffolding due to maintenance work, but this also applied to the interior which was also covered in scaffolding and cloth protected area.I understand that maintenance is necessary to maintain magnificent buildings such as this, I just wish it had not been on the one day I happened to be there as it's unlikely I will ever return to this country.
Excellent and beautiful. Beautiful cathedral that I have walked past numerous times. Incredible architecture and very calming.Highly reccomended.

Superb. I have been here several times and the best time to go is during the Christmas season. The Creche is simply amazing. On this trip we took our 8 year old granddaughter, and unfortunately since the Cathedral is undergoing renovation, inside and out. you were not able to appreciate the beauty and splendor of it.

Just Beautiful . My parents and I went in late August and it was under renovation.I would have given 5stars but alot of the beautiful artwork and stain glass was hard too see with all the work going on. Still its a must see when in nyc.

Breathtaking. This is an amazing site to visit. Pity there was construction occurring inside the building, but the spirit and essence of the cathedral was well captured. The design of the building is very nice and reflects the expert craftmanship of the builders. Despite the large masses of people, the flow of human traffic was quite organised.
Beautiful!!!. The outside of the cathedral was under construction, but the inside was just as amazing as it always was. A must see when in the city!

Majestic building in the city. Although scaffolding inside and out, this is some cathedral. We visited twice - second time for mass which was very memorable. Lot of staff to help the flow of traffic,yet it is still possible to maintain an atmosphere of serenity and holiness. Looking forward to returning some day to the finished job:)

Catholic Church. This is truly an awesome place of worship. The fine work in the shrines, the stained glass and the baptismal are worth the time it takes to see it all. One can't help but admire the painstaking detail in all the craftsmanship. Even our non-catholic friends were awed by the reverence of the place. Can't wait to go back and see it after the renovation is completed. Planning on it already.
Beautiful Church. Go for a service, go to just see an exquisite church built long ago that has been well maintained. We stayed across the street and got to look out on this every day.

Wow - up there with the best on my Cathedrals list. Been to Cathedrals in The Vatican, Malta, St Petersburg in Russia London and Liverpool and this one was a mustServices on going when you visit so it's difficult to take in the architecure

Beautiful Catholic jewel in the heart of Manhattan. St. Patrick's is an amazing monument on 5th avenue just across from Rockefeller Center. It is a huge church embodying the beautiful meaning, architecture and religious connotations of Catholicism. It.s beauty does not only span from its external monumental architecture, but goes deep inside into the details of every tile, every stone and every religious icon.You need to enjoy what this cathedral symbolizes by checking all its sections. Start by the entrance on 5th avenue and walk your way towards the main hall and then behind the altars towards the chapel in the back. On your way out walk closer to the sides of the church and check all the scriptures, statues, icons....it is breathtaking. I can only imagine how beautiful mass is on Christmas at St. Patrick.sI know that most people associate New York wit the statue of liberty, central park and other tourist attractions, but trust me St. Patrick's deserves its own share and is definitely a site to visit while you are in NYC. You can't miss it as you will be passing in front of it anyway you would be going on 5th avenue.I have visited on many instances, it is currently being renovated on the outside and parts on the inside, so not all parts might be clearly visible but it is definitely highly recommended
A must see!. St. Patrick's Cathedral is under construction but it's still breath-taking beautiful. The altar is incredibly beautiful! We went to a Sunday Mass and it was still packed with people.

Beautiful. Our sons were able to serve at mass and the church is beautiful. The architecture is stunning and while it was under construction when we were there this visit it is still a historic place to visit.
Amazing church in the middle of Manhattan. Beautiful art work, stained glass. They are currently during construction but inside is a must see during your visit to NYC.

Beautiful Church. A truly beautiful Church which was being restored during my visit. When I first walked in it reminded me of a mini-Vatican. The tributes to a number of Saints are beautiful. The main altar is quite handsome while the small sanctuary behind it, which was being used for a baptism when I visited, is welcoming. The Church bring bring mixed emotions for me. On the one hand it brought to mind parts of Catholicism that brought me comfort as a child. On the flip side, it reminded me of so much of the wealth behind the Church. Nonetheless, it is a MUST visit for anyone visiting NY.

Splendor and awe. What a magnificent building of worship. A must see for anyone of faith. We arrived just before mass, but toured the church. The art work, stained glass and the old gothic styles of the cathedral .If you have 30 minutes to spare, and you are near by, check out this landmark. Well worth the time.

Impressive Cathedral; great souvenirs.. This was one of my favorite attractions in NYC. I was raised Catholic, but I think anyone who likes religious buildings, stained glass, statues, shrines, architecture, candles, etc. would find it worth visiting. They don't build churches like this anymore in the USA. Mass was in session Saturday evening when I wandered in, but the ushers didn't mind funneling the visitors around the edges of the church to look at the numerous shrines. Donate a couple dollars and light a small candle at your favorite shrine (I chose the Polish saints). There is a lot of scaffolding around the edges because of the refurbishing that is going on, but you can walk under it. When mass is not in progress, you can walk up to the altar and look at the detail of the art work. People around the edges were quietly chatting and taking pictures. Sit in on the mass. If you're Catholic, maybe you can even take the gifts up, if you talk to the right person. There is a small gift shop in the corner of the interior, but about a block away is their larger gift shop. They have the most affordable and meaningful souvenirs I was able to find in NYC. Many were less than $10, and most were labeled with the name of the cathedral. I got some Christmas shopping done (in July). There were bracelets, rosaries, items to use when praying for those with cancer, addictions, and other troubles; nativity sets from around the world, small stained glass reproductions of the windows in the cathedral, and many unique items that you won't see elsewhere in the city. My 20-year-old daughter, who is not very religious, made this one of the first places we visited when I arrived in NYC. It doesn't cost a thing, and there is a lot to look at. There are tours that you can go on if you arrive at the right time.

St. Patrick´s. In the center of New York, it is a building with a completely different architecture from those that surround it, so it is easy to find. The interior is very beautiful, although there are works going on inside as well as outside it that don´t allow to see clearly some parts but the altar can be clearly seen and it's very beautiful. You can lit a candle inside if you wish. It is worth a visit.

Beautiful Cathedral. St. Patrick's Cathedral was a quick stop as part of our tour, but we really enjoyed seeing this 1879 Cathedral. The detail of the architecture is amazing and makes it a beautiful building.

Beautiful Cathedral. Although an amazing place to check out and I would't go out of my way I was passing in on a journey shoppingHowever a very peaceful place away from the hustle and bustle of the city
For any catholic world wide a must see in manhattan. Beautiful church, right in the heart of manhattan, although I would recommend a visit to old St Patricks in lower manhattan near little Italy

Beautiful. Unfortunately renovations were going on during my visit so much of it was covered in scaffolding. However at the back are a number of small altars dedicated to various saints which were stunning. I don't believe in treating a place of worship like a tourist attraction so was a bit annoyed with ones talking loudly and posing for pictures even when the sign said no photographs at Our Ladys chapel. And I thought the machine dispensing medals was a bit too much! I would love to go back once all the work is completed.
Beautiful. This was a highlight of New York for me. The church is so so beautiful and definitely worth visiting.

Breathtaking Church. I'm not much one to tour churches, but as I was working right across the street, I decided to walk through on a whim. I am so glad I did. I have never seen a church so tall and beautiful in my life. This church rivals the one I saw in Paris some years ago. It contains beautiful architecture and high ornate ceilings and columns. Beware that it is very much being renovated and scaffolding is all over, but still the beauty of this church shines through. If you are catholic and are in NY, I highly recommend a pilgrimage to this place.
Wait till reconstruction is done. It is a beutiful church but it cannot be seen due construction it us loud too inside. Wait for building to complete and then come.

Beautiful even though it's currently under construction. I had been looking forward to seeing St. Patrick's for a long time, as I've heard many wonderful things about it over the last ten years or so. When we went, it was being renovated unfortunately, but the parts we could see were still beautiful. It's in a great part of town and was still very busy inside the church even with all the construction.

Lovely Cathedral!. I stopped by St. Patrick's Cathedral, a couple of weeks ago to revisit this place. The last time I went was about 15 years ago. Even though the restoration process is going on, it is still a beautiful place to go.
Fail and Rain. This church is very beautiful. But I'm fail Beacause The church under construction and at that time rain but have many people come here and Take aPhoto.

Beautiful. I visited as a child, and after 30 years it hasn't changed much, so sad it was now under construction. But I did enjoy 2 beautiful Masses here, one of which was celebrated by the Archbishop.

Cardinals' Mitres. As a non-Catholic and generally irreverent college student, I went NYC over Thanksgiving with the friend I was visiting. We spent a long, energetic day traipsing over Manhattan and passed St. Pat's just after puchasing pizza slices for lunch. Someone suggested we go in and we did. My irreverence subdued almost instantaneously; the hallowed places always have that effect on me. Then when I saw the mitres sespended from the ceiling it enhanced that feeling. Thus, a place for anyone's quiet contemplation.
Sadly.... We would have like to visit the cathedral but it was in restauration outside like inside so we decided not to go...

Under Renovation, But Still Beautiful. Every time I go to NY, I try to make time to visit this iconic Cathedral. I was a bit disappointed when I approached the church and saw layer upon layer of scaffolding surrounding the cathedral from the ground up. I learned that the cathedral is undergoing intensive preservation efforts and that although certain parts of the cathedral may be closed to visitors, visitors are still welcome to enjoy the beauty and splendor that the open areas of the cathedral can provide. Nonetheless, this is still a beautiful church and not to be missed (even with renovations going on).

St Patrick's Cathedral is breathtaking!. St Patrick's is undergoing renovations both outside and in, but is still open to visitors. Visiting this beautiful cathedral was a highlight of our day in NYC. It is absolutely beautiful! Do not miss a chance to visit this historic landmark.

Faith Wins Again. Visited this Cathedral both as a child and now as an adult. A must see, even in it's current renovations just ti possibly understand the beliefs that made this all possible. You will possibly walk away with the understandings of the POWER OF BELIEFS. A must see just for the understanding. So huge.

Big Restoration Underway. The exterior may look like an erector set for the time being with all the scaffolding now in place to renew the strength and beauty of St. Patrick's; but the interior space of this fabled cathedral is not to be missed.

Open during renovations. Absolutely awe-inspiring experience to visit this incredibly beautiful cathedral. Gorgeous gothic architecture and stained glass windows. A lot of security guarding the artifacts.

Not worth the visit. Aside from the bigness there really is nothing remarkable here. Why visit an inflated parish church, when there is a genuine Gothic cathedral under construction in New York City, the Cathedral of St John the Divine, a much more exciting and interesting place to visit that won't be overwhelmed with tourists flashing photographs of the mostly mediocre architecture of St Patrick Cathedral. I'd say under 5 minutes is plenty of time to poke your head in, realize what a disappointment this place is, and leave.

Magnificent, if you can ignore the scaffolding. Beautiful architecture and ornate decorations. It didn't seem that the construction or the thousands of visitors stopped the church from operating. We watched the Saturday evening blessings, and visited some the chapels behind the main altar / sanctuary part of the church.
under repair but still neat to see. Even though you can not see much of outside and in due to repairs you should still see it. Very pretty and amazing place.

Imposing landmark. A New York City icon. This is a most impressive cathedral, the likes of which are generally found only in Europe. It is massive and awe inspiring. Wen we visited it was undergoing restoration so a lot of construction and cleaning was underway which spoiled the experience somewhat.

Wonderful but under construction. This is worth seeing even with all the scaffolding inside and out. The beautiful architecture that was visible was amazing. It is a true work of art. It's a peaceful spot to come from the noise of the city. During mass people are still allowed to walk around and admire the church.

beautiful. Very impressed from what we saw. Didn't realize it was under renovation. Was looking forward to seeing it in all its' glory but that did not work out. It seems it will be under renovation for the next couple years.

Truely inspiring. The church is under construction at this time but it is still well worth visiting the inside. It is beautiful and full of amazing chapels. There is an area at the front of the church that no photos are allowed that is moving and breath-taking. I felt true peace in in this area.

Like going to Rome, but friendly and in English. One of the most beautiful cathedrals in the world. There was lots of scaffolding because the church is undergoing renovation, but it is still absolutely beautiful. The church rivals any big cathedral in Europe, but going to mass was very personal, just like going to mass in our parish church. A must if you are in NYC on Sunday.
