Still impressive even with the scaffolding. Trapped inbetween skyscrapers the cathedral is still impressive. On Madison Ave. opposite the stutue of Atlas. Even though it is covered in scaffolding and much of the inside has scoffolding you can still get a feel for how impressive the building is. The external size does not give a feel for how big the inside is. It is free and well worth a visit. For all those structural nerds the scaffolding is also impressive.

Under renovation. A Neo Gothic Catholic cathedral, a prominent landmark of New York. Its slap bang on the east side of Fifth Avenue directly across the street from Rockefeller Center and specifically facing the Atlas statue. Therefore it attracts tourists and even though its under renovation its still a buzz of activity around there.
Mass was Special. We went to Mass while on vacation in NYC. The place was all torn up but I appreciated getting to be there with Cardinal Dolan. The choir was excellent. Highly recommend.
Glorious. Even though the Cathedral is under renovation, it still is a wonderful place to visit. It is a peaceful Holy place that when you walk in you feel at peace. It is beautiful.

Very little to see with major construction inside and out. Huge construction underway inside and out. Scaffolding everywhere, so not much to see for a while. This includes inside the cathedral, which is under significant construction.

Can't describe how beautiful it is.. I went there in 2009 and at that time there was no construction going on. It was remarkable and so beautiful and peacefully that I can't describe. It was very nice and I definitely suggest and recommend to visit it if you are visiting NYC.

A first! Going to attend mass and being turned away!!. Difficult to write this review as the cathedral is undergoing major renovations and we were trying to get into the sung mass on a Sunday. However......the organisation of the renovations is very poor so you are unsure where to sit or walk and get spoken to in a very rude manner (more than once) by attendants who look frustrated and angry. certainly not fitting for the house of God. We did go back for a later mass and it was lovely. Great sermon too.

Very Disappointing. We went to St Patrick's and found that they are doing very extensive renovations at the Church inside and on the outside. It is not worth going there now as you don't get to see the real place in all it's glory. We were really disappointed as we will only be in the USA for 14 days.

God's House Is Under Renovations. I'm sure St. Patrick's is a lovely place, but it's covered in scaffolding, so I didn't get a really good look at much of it. The parts I could see are impressive, and I'm sure the religious services are meaningful, but if you're going there to admire the architecture and the stained glass, you can probably find a better example elsewhere.

Hugely disappointing due to renovations.. Best keep away if you want to see the full splendour of this Cathedral. When I arrived it was pouring with rain and access to the Cathedral was restricted. Once inside space was limited and with all the builders noise and commotion I was glad to get out. If you're going for a religious service then you wont mind, but for those who have an interest in architecture then a huge disappointment. It seems unlikey that I will come this way again so an opportunity missed.

Renovations. Always wonderful to go to St. Pats but right now under serious renovations. The entire outside is covered with scaffolding and much of the interior. Once you get toward the front things open up, but the construction is very distracting.Still a wonderful place to stop and pray and most of the other visitors were very respectful of the place. Might be better to wait until the construction is over, but if this is your only visit to the city it would be wise to stop in.

Beautiful and Grand Old Cathedral. We attended a service here at noon one Sunday. The building is going through a remodeling so there is scaffolding up on the inside and outside. It is a beautiful church and we would love to see it after the restoration is complete. Well worth a stop.

Beautiful. Catholic or not, this is a work of art; there was alot of scaffolding outside last time I was there which detracted from the windows when you were inside (the sun didnt shine through as beautifully as when theres no scaffolfing) but still breathtaking
magnificent for one and all. although in renovation it is St Patricks cathedral and awesome we were there during a service which made it very special

to much for a tourist attraction. No respect was shown by visitors more like a social meeting area than a church.
Beautiful church at that though.
Beautiful and humbling. Much needed renovations. Beautiful and inspiring. Renovations in progress so currently much to be desired. I recommend this if you are visiting New York for the first time.
Even under construction, still fabulous. Have visited this Catholic cathedral every time I'm in NYC. Still awe-inspiring even under the scaffolding.

Good. It is under huge renovation work at the moment so it's covered in scaffolding inside and out. There is a walkway around the inside but it quite dark and you can only see sections at a time. Once you get to the middle it's a bit more open so you can see the ornate ceiling and stain glass windows. We went mid morning on a Monday and it wasn't busy at all.
St. Patrick's. As long as you don't go when it's too crowded, St. Patrick's is astonishing. Beautiful architecture, worth seeing no matter what your religious beliefs are.

Under Renovation But Still Awe Inspiring. The church is being massively renovated and is no longer holding service, but is still open to the public. It is a beautiful piece of architecture and the product of old-time workmanship.

A Quiet Place. NOTE: the cathedral is undergoing a 5 year restoration, so the exterior and a large portion of the interior are covered with scaffolding.Located right in the centre of midtown, across from Rockefeller Centre stands St. Patrick's Cathedral - spiritual centre of the New York Catholic Archdiocese.The cathedral building is in the Gothic Revival style and took some 21 years to erect, finished in 1878.The building is 332' by 174', at the transepts. The spires rise some 330' from street level. Definitely walk around the altar with its bronze baldachin and walk around to the Lady's Chapel with beautiful stained glass windows.
Churches in NYC. Beautiful. If your into seeing the inside of churches, make sure you also visit Trinity church on wallstreet and the on near city hall! Don't forget multitudes of others
Beautiful. One of the most beautiful churches I have ever visited an iconic building whose interior takes your breath away again an amazing building with a wonderful history

Christmas at Saint Pat's. The most beautiful church in the world, next to the churches in Europe. Christmas is the most spectacular time to visit - you actually feel the magic & warmth of such a fast pace city.

Far from amazing. The cathedral is currently full od scaffolding so I didn't see it at its best. Having visited many cathedrals in Europe I'm sorry to say that ,even without the work going on, this Cathedral is nothing to write home about. Poke your head in if you're in the area but don't bother going out of your way to go and visit it unless you're going to a service.

Beautiful cathedral with scaffolding all over. The cathedral is beautiful but currently under major remodeling work so there is scaffolding all over the place, both outside and inside. Part of the interior is not accessible due to this. Right before the 10:15 Mass there was a man outside playing the bagpipes which was nice to hear.

THIS JUST IN.... If you are going to visit NYC and do not visit the St. Patrick's Cathedral, you are going to hell. I'm obviously just kidding but seriously you have to experience this place. It is unbelievably gorgeous. The architecture is amazing. The feeling you get while inside is indescribable. ***We just went on 5/3/2013 and it is under a major renovation. There is construction everywhere. However, it is still open. You absolutely have to put this on your list of must dos on your NYC trip. There is nothing else like it. And there is no cost.

Reverence and Beauty. Feel the need to get out of the hustle and bustle for even just a few minutes - step inside - it's reverence, beauty and peace are worth the visit! What a beautiful cathedral! My husband and I were happy to attend Mass while visiting the city. Even with the current construction due to renovation, it was breathtaking.

Class Trip to NYC. Unfortunately the Cathedral is under renovation so the students were not able to admire it in its full beauty, but the stained glass was simply gorgeous as the afternoon sun shone through! They could truly feel the greatness of this Cathedral despite the construction and scaffolding all around!

First Visit to NYC. I stopped here on my very first visit to NYC and was able to be present for part of Mass...It was Christmas time and while the exterior and part of the interior was covered in scaffolding, it didn't diminish the beauty and awe of this Cathedral...I can't wait to see the renovations completed in 2 years
Always stop in when we visit the Rockefeller tree. This is a beautiful church, a must see on your visit to NYC. Can be crowded but great for picture taking

A must see.. Would you go to Rome without visiting the Vatican or Paris without Notre Dame? You do not need to be catholic to enjoy this wonder. Just the architecture is amazing. And it is a stone throw from Rockefeller Center.

What a beautiful building. I wanted to visit St Patricks as it is the Cathedral shown on Miracle on 34th Street. Unfortunately there was a lot of building & structual work so outside wasn't a pretty site. However inside is stunning. A must see when visiting New York. Also went to Mass on Sunday.
New York Landmark. worth the visit, make sure you walk around the entire interior and see the naves and altars at the front of the cathedral
True beauty. absolutely stunning......brought me to tears it was so beautiful!!! its a must see in NYC!! I stood outside the Cathedral and just stood in amazement!!!!

Sunday Mass. Went to the 9 am Sunday Mass. It had music. The whole cathedral is under renovation. The mass was held in one of the smaller chapels. You need to get there close to the time it starts since it filled up quickly.
Pretty Amazing!. I love the outside of this cathedral. It's so huge, the pictures I took really did not give it justice! You should check it out.

A beautiful building worth a visit. I first spied St. Patrick's Cathderal from the lofty heights of the top of the Rockerfeller Centre. Looking down, the cathedral looking fairly unremarkable and not even terribly large. However, at street level, there is no denying the scale and beauty of this majestic building. Exploring the inside is a great experience whether you are religious or not. The atmosphere is quite amazing, a quiet and thought provoking place to contemplate whilst the craziness of Manhattan carries on relentlessly outside!
Scaffolding and candles. Surpisingly peaceful, even when the builders were working on the renovation. Spectacular in its scale.

Still Gorgeous. This is a no brainer stop for any traveler to New York. Unfortunately it is currently in year two of a five year renovation, so there is scaffolding here and there throughout the inside. But you can still see and feel the majesty of this wonderful church.

Skip the construction site!. I'm sure that St. Patricks is a fascinating cathedral usually, but for now, there is almost nothing to see as the exterior and interior are shrouded with scaffolding! You can still light a candle or sit in on a mass, but until the construction is finished, you can't see much else.
Being renovated.Not much to see.. Covered in plastic on the outside and inside because of renovations. Not much to see. Stay away untill the renovations are finished.
Beautiful Church. Beautiful church. A lot of things to see for the family. One of the biggest church I have ever seen. It is nice in the inside and outside.

All are welcome. As a Catholic, I have often sought solace here. But as a 'tour guide' with out of town guests of all denomenations, everyone has always truly enjoyed the experience of a visit to St Patrick's when they're in the Midtown area. Historical, religious, architecture, photography... they're all found their niche here in this solomn experience.
Beautiful. renovating, however it was beautiful. was able to attend mass earlier in the yr. I took my son, It really it something to see.
Under Rennovation. Whilst we were here it was under rennovation but still well worth seeing. Amazing building and hope some day to get back to see it finished

Beautiful, but surrounded by scaffolding in April'13. The Cathedral is beautiful, but if you're planning to appreciate and/or take pictures of its architecture, check if it's still under renovation. At least in April 2013 it had scaffolding all around, inside and outside hiding most of the walls from the entrance almost to the altar.

Beautiful & inspirational. Whenever we are in NYC we stop by St. P's to light a candle. It is such a wonderful contrast to walk in from the fast paced noisy streets of NYC and find such a peaceful place to reflect.
peaceful places. beautiful, intricate artwork,stain glass windows were awesome, the price is right. easy to reach by public transportation, nice location
beautiful. you don't even have to like church to appreciate the architecture and beauty of this building. if you are in NYC it's worth a peek inside to see the beautiful sructure of this church.

beautiful building but better when construction done. As everyone has said, the building is great but lots and lots of scaffolding sohard to appreciate it all. You still get a view of what must be a very large undertaking when it was build and a big load of cash to renovate. Its beautful inside and likely outside but cant see it well. If i go back ever I would go again since didnt get the full view that day. You can see some stained glass the the big ceilings of a large church and some of the history even if its in state of renovations.
A great piece of history. A quick walk in/out and you'll see how splendid this is! Loved the architecture and the carvings, it is majestic, and this doesnt mean I'm of this faith to enjoy it.
Beautiful!. Make this one of your stops on your trip! Beautiful church! Lots of history to know about it and great to look at it!! A must stop when you visit New York City!!
so beautiful. a little hard to appreciate now that is under repair on the outside but just stunning, a lovely beautiful visit

Ecumental Service in a Cathedral. Attended Psalm Sunday amidst construction of the interior of the Cathedral, yet the sermon and music was superb and moving. Due to the construction the organ did not vibrate the room, yet the message is usually always encouraging and ecumenical except for the eucharist. A must see and experience to see such beauty and history, wonderful architecture and stain glass, very gothic.
Under scaffold but beautiful. Currently undergoing repairs and is all boarded pn all sides - but inside it is a fabulous cathedral
A Beauty on Fifth Avenue. A lovely Catholic cathedral in the middle of Fifth avenue's shopping mecca. Stop in to rest between stores.

Easter Sunday Mass in the Cathedral. Even with the scaffolding in place for its major refurbishing, this is the most perfect place to enjoy Easter (check their website because some masses are by Ticket-Only, and you will have to order yours early to attend the Cardinal's Mass). It's such a grand church and everyone felt welcome. After mass, the Annual Easter Parade was just starting on Fifth Avenue, and there were thousands of people who created the most fantastic and unusual Easter bonnets - men, women and children, and lots of dogs, too, and we all strolled down Fifth Avenue, wearing Easter Bonnets! Someone had crafted several hundred wild and beautiful hats, which he/she gave away to anyone who wasn't wearing a hat. Imagine - walking down Fifth Avenue, wearing a bonnet, just like a New Yorker. What a great time.
Beautiful. Even thought it is under construction, the cathedral remains as beautiful as ever. A must do destination for a trip to NYC.

Find somewhere else for mass. We went to mass on Easter Sunday especially as it is such an iconic church in New York. It was a conveyor belt of masses - one set of worshippers out another in. We had arrived in plenty of time but could not get a seat. Watched the service on tv screen. Would go back to see the cathedral when the restoration work is complete.

no access..no organisation...one big crowd pushing to get in. Buy a ticket before you try to access the Cathedral. We naively thought we would get into the Easter service - we knew the 10.15am service was ticket only so we arrived at 8.15 for the 8.45am service - we queued where advised ( yes there was queue even the) but didn't get in. The queuing system wasn't recognised by other visitors who jogged on to the front and got in..the door closed at 9am ad the venue was full.Our friends ( pretty laid back people who stayed in bed on hearing the time we intended to leave ) didn't have tickets for the 10.15am service but got in....

Impressive. I took my two kids to St. Patrick's Cathedral, arguably the most famous house of worship in America, to light a candle in memory of my dearly departed beloved wife and children's mom who lost her battle with cancer last year. The Cathedral is undergoing major renovations with scaffolding both outside and inside the structure. It was not crowded when we went and we were able to walk all the way around the back of the altar area. The architecture is stunning and it is worth taking a look around this historic masterpiece.

Wonderful. This is a beautiful Cathedral right in the heart of 5th Avenue in New York.Like other reviews, we felt that it doesn't seem as large as it actually is as it is dwarfed by the larger buildings in the vicinity. However it is a totally beautiful building both inside and out, very atmospheric and well worth a visit

Covered in scaffolding. Origianally i walked straight passed it without realising. It was a shame that it was closed and being refurbished. But still the tallest church in all of AMERICA. what does not do it any justice is that its surrounded by so many large buildings therefore its doesn't not feel as big as it actually is. But being on 5th avenue, 2 minutes away from the rockerfellar centre you can't not pop into this church
Beautiful building well wirth a look. Lovely building in the heart of 5th avenue, well worth 5 mins as walking past as beautiful and so strange in amongst all the skyscrapers

Don't expect to see St. Patrick's Cathedral at its best. St. Patrick's is under major renovation. We tried 3 times to see the main altar and either could not get in because of crowds (so much is impassable). When we did finally get it, all the seats were reserved and we had to beg an usher to let us just see the main altar.

Very Impressive. We strolled through this well known NYC cathedral during our recent visit. Unfortunately it was being renovated so we didn't get to appreciate the beauty of it. The part we did see which was the main sanctuary left no doubt in my mind that once the renovation is complete it will rival the many beautiful cathedrals I have seen in Europe. I hope to see it again when the renovations are done.
WOW. The stained glass was beautiful. Very peaceful on the inside (pictures just don't to it justice). Being inside you realize how grand it is.

Old and beautiful but breathtaking.. I try going a lot because of how beautiful and big it is. My cousin was visiting from oversees for the first time so I decided to take her and se loved it! We took pictures and it was around Christmas so we stayed for a little prayer and lit a candle. It was breathtaking. It's free so definitely swing by for a memorable experience.
Classic New York Site. The cavernous cathedral makes one feel very small in the house of the Lord. Cardinal Timothy Dolan officiates at services.
old cathedral like those in europe. if you are in the neighbourhood it's a good break from the noise outside. it's calm atmoshpere is always welcoming

Peaceful. Visited January 2005. Simply beautiful inside. Bought a few reasonably priced souvenirs in the little shop ran by local parishioners, which I still have. Spend a moment in there, no matter what your faith ( or non-faith) and let your spirit rest.
A Blessing. A Blessing. This is the first church that I visited when I arrived to the country from London. I went there to pray and I got the job I prayed for. Amen
Having work done at the moment. there was quite a bit of noise going on, and red tape around certain areas, but on the whole worth a visit.

A beautiful Sunday mass. It took until my fourth visit to NYC to actually attend a Sunday church service at St Patrick's Cathedral. Upon entering, I had no idea just how beautiful and large it was. The statues and marble and the underground tombs make this place truly spectacular. You just feel at peace when you are inside here.

Lovely place to be. I visited St.Patricks Cathederal to see a famous attraction and light a candle for my lost loved ones who would very much appreciate a candle being lit for them in a beautiful church.When I visited there were some construction works, which meant there was scaffolding outside but this is such a beautiful church. The statues of saints inside are wonderful, each one having a place to light candles.There is also a small souvenir shop inside with beautiful pieces to purchase as keepsakes or as gifts for your loved ones.The location is on 5th Avenue, nearer the Central Park end of the town. This is a must see for anyone visiting New York.

Stunning!. We stayed in the Hotel across the street and were lucky enough to have a room with a view of the Cathedral...It's stunning! Even though it's full of scaffolding due to the huge renovation project that is underway the inside is still spectacular!

Pop in for the architecture. I'm not remotely catholic but we came across the cathedral and decided to pop in to have a look. The buildling is stunning and the windows are absolutely beautiful. If you are with or without faith but appreciate stunning architecure, then it is well worth taking a quick look.
Sunday Mass. St. Patricks Cathedral is wonderful and when in NYC, Ialways stop in for mass, It is beautiful inside and out.

What is with the scaffolding???. I've lived here for 3 years and I never see the outside of this place because its always got scaffolding on it! It doesn't compare to some of the other ones I've seen in Europe, but it's great for NYC.

Beautiful old church. It was a magnificent place. Currently it is under construction and all of its splendor is masked. Any time of day, there will always be parishioner praying, so please be respectful!.

Hope it will be better when the scaffolding comes down.. I visited this Cathedral as a child and remembered it being bigger as you do. I was disappointed with the building work and found the experience quite disappointing. Perhaps I am jaded by living in England. St Patrick's has nothing on Durham Cathedral.

Awesome.....even under renovation. Even under renovation this is a must see for Catholics and non Catholics alike on a NYC trip. The shear grandeur of the architecture and detail and ornateness of the interior is spectacular. The altars/shrines surrounding the interior perimeter demand time to study each detail. Visit the interior gift shop and the gift shop located across the street for some novelties. A truly religous experience and if can attend a mass or roseary even the better and it's free.

A Blessing.... You feel electric when you enter this Cathedral. Spend the time to go around the interior, one by one the Saints will amaze you!
The over all structure is a sight to behold alone. Just wonderful inside and out!

Daily visit at the cathedral. Beautiful church. I got married at the church 49 yrs ago 4/4/64. Daily walk to central park I make a pint to stop by the cathedral and meditate. The Lady chapel is renovated and is much quieter at the back of the main altar. Very few tourist and you can really pray. One of the best churches in NYC.Renovation is on going but do not affect the church serenity.

Stunning architecture - the US version of what you see in Europe (though not as old). A truly beautiful church. Stunning stain glass and architecture. Visit, but respect that people do come here to pray. It is an amazing building and worth spending some time here - regardless of your religion.
A must to visit in NYC. You cannot leave NYC without a visit to the St Patrick's cathedral. For a couple of minutes, you must go and pay a visit.
beautiful cathedral. Well worth a visit, even more so to 10.15 mass on a sunday morning to really experience it. Tip. make sure to arrive early to guarantee a seat!

Newish cathedral with promises. The 150 years old Roman-Catholic cathedral is presently under renovation and major parts of the church is therefore covered in plastic and scaffolding. Side altars, choir and apsis are however accessible for visitors and masses are still celebrated in the Virgin chapel.St Patricks is modelled over the great European cathedrals from the Middle ages. They are the same as far as religious devotion is concerned and that is of course the primary purpose. But for original religious art and a numinous experience of the Transcendent you have to go to Europe.

Even under restoration, well worth the visit!. The front of the cathedral is still covered in scaffolding, and some work is being done inside. From the bronze doors to the stained glass windows, the arches, the statues, the grandeur of it all is breathtaking. Take a quick stroll around the interior, or linger a while.
Great feeling for our son's confirmation. Our son decided to join the Cathloic Church. He was confirmed here- by Cardinal Dolan no less !! Most impressive house of worship I have seen in the USA.
Beautiful!. I always stop in when I', in the area. Every visit you will discover a new area you hadn't seen previously, whether it is a statue, archway, woodwork, or stain glass.
Beautiful Cathedral. Very impressive Cathedral- currently under extensive renovations but still able to get around. The stain glass, marble, archways, woodwork, etc. Everything is very beautiful.

A behemoth of a church on Fifth Avenue. When I first started coming to New York City with regularity, we would always make a point to visit St. Patrick's. And at that time, it was the most monumental sacred space I had visited. But over time, I got to see many of the beautiful churches in NYC, other cities, and then eventually Europe as well. And I have to say, St. Patrick strikes me as excessive, as in just full of stuff, but not nearly as impressive as, say, St. John the Divine, and lacking in a sense of quiet and peace that most great churches have. Maybe it's the setting, and the fact that it's so popular that it is always full of huge crowds of tourists. But I would much rather visit other churches in New York City at this point.

Beautiful Church. Although the outside of the church is under construction, you must go inside and see the lovely alters, light a candle, say a prayer and just reflect upon your life and feel the presence of God.
Somewhere you just have to go to!. Beautiful Cathedral in the middle of it all! Being refurbished at the moment but you can still go in for a look around. Worth a visit.

Definitely a must-see. A beautiful piece of architecture! If you are an architectural buff you will love it. You will feel like you are in Europe. If you are Catholic you will find an expansive choice of Masses to attend.

Sheer awe. This is a classic cathedral and it's right here in rock center. I believe everyone should walk through the doors of this place once to experience the religious art and beauty of this place. It takes all of 20 minutes...tops...and should be a part of everyone's visit to the worlds greatest city.

Construction Outside, Spectacular Inside. We arrived in NYC in the afternoon and decided to visit the St. Patrick's Cathedral close to our hotel. After we checked into the hotel and spent some time trying to figure out directions, we started our first sightseeing. We have never been to this church in our past visits to the city. It was a busy Sunday afternoon, and we were surprised to find the 135-year-old church under substantial three-year, $175 million dollar renovation. The exterior spires were covered by unsightly scaffold.The construction of a new St. Patrick's Cathedral between Madison Ave. and Fifth Ave., and 50th and 51st Streets started in 1958 and completed in 1878. The delay was due to the Civil War. The Neo-Gothic-style Roman Catholic cathedral church was designed by architect James Renwick. More structures were added in later years such as the spires were added in 1888, and the construction of Lady Chapel begun in 1900 with its famous stained-glass created between 1912 and 1930.We went in the church through two huge bronze doors while they were having a Sunday Mass. The cathedral can hold more than 2,000 people. The beautiful Lady Chapel is behind the Crypt. However, no photography is allowed. There are many altars along the sides of the walls. The Gallery Organ has 5,918 pipes, and the Chancel Organ has 3,920 pipes. Currently, the Gallery Organ was temporarily relocated since June 2012 due to the renovation, so we have to wait until the renovation is completed in late 2014 or 2015 to enjoy the Kilgen Organ Recital Series.
like rome. it is really nice Cathedral, you should see it regardless of faith, it is one big and powerful building similar to churches in Rome

Currently under renovation. Usually i wouldn't score this at average as it is a very impressive building, but at the moment its under renovations so the entire building is class with scaffolding, but if its finished when you get there, visit it during the day and evening. I've been here for christmas and surrounded by the fifth avenue decorations and christmas snow, it is an iconic picture to behold.
Very Grand. Very Grand and awe inspiring, it is undergoing some reconstruction at the moment so some areas look a little worse for wear. The windows are beautiful from the in side and out.

Impressive space. Even though they were doing some construction/renovations to the front tower, the space is magnificent and admirable. Take note however that parishioners are praying and using the space for their own personal religious experiences. Be respectful, but make sure you make a slow loop of the Cathedral. It's a grand building.

Small by european standards but a sweet spot in NY. It's great to get off the hustle of 5th ave and duck into the cathedral. For NY it is grand, but after seeing older cathedrals in Europe it is small, but quaint: an odd thing t0 say about something in NY

a super WoW. now I am Jewish and my wife is not but I never visit the City without going to St.PatsI have my wife light a candle for her folks and just sit and look at what a fantastic building this is.I see something new every time I see it. A true home of every type of people who visit and pray and makes you thank your own God that there are so many good people left in this world no matter what or who they believe in. Go to this great building and you will walk away a different person no matter what your faith.

Inspiring!. Can't say enough. So moving. It is the history, the art, the holiness of the Adoration chapel, the shrines. You'll be lucky if you get there when Mass is being said. Sit up front so you won't be disturbed with the tourism

Should see the inside. We were a little disappointed to see that the exterior of the cathedral was covered in scaffolding. Fortunately the interior was not. It is a beautiful cathedral with an interesting history.

A spectacular site. Even with the renovation works underway, this really is a superb building. We went on Ash Wednesday (not for any religious reasons, but it was the last thing on our 'to do' list for the week) which gave the Cathedral something of a special atmosphere.Intend to return once the renovations are complete, but it's still an amazing place with the scaffold in situ

The Notre Dame of New York. St. Patrics is a medeval stone cathedral in the center of NYC. Stop in sit down and feel the anxiety and craziness of midtown drain from you as the tranquility of this place settles in. Nothing like it
St. Pat's. Went to Mass Sunday. Huge Cathedral. There was a lot of people. Standing room only. Good to see a church in the city that's not closed.
Beautiful. Under restoration but very nice to visit. I wish people would be more respectful of the church than they are,and if you can give something for the restoration costs.

A quiet refuge in a busy day. Even under restoration, the cathedral is beautiful and it is a respected oasis in the middle of the bustle of the city. It is well attended by informed staff who are happy to answer questions. It was good to take a quiet half hour to admire and reflect.

St. Patrick's Cathedral. This realy old church is under construction but on saturday's catch a glimpse of brides to be wed. You'll see statutes of saints. I always stop by St. Jude located in the back of the church to the left.The very far front of the church has the lady chapel where you can see blue pues and beautiful italian tile on the floor.To the right front of church you'll see the Virgin Guadalupe every year the mexican community is seen in profession of their faith walking in front of the Cathedral with the picture of the Guadalupe then it is placed back in the church. St Michael is placed in the back St. Anthony to the middle right of the church. And our holy sacrament in the chapel of our lady. Since Easter is coming call the Cathedral so that you can get a seat for Easter sunday. God Bless you.

It's a Beautiful Cathedral. I don't know what to say, it's a beautiful cathedral. Maybe I'm spoiled by the Cathedral Basilica in St. Louis, MO, but they look a bit similar to me. Cathedrals are far more lavish than regular churches, and St. Patrick's is beautifully lavish. It met my expectations.

A magnificent holy place!. It is breathtaking! The architecture is wonderful and the size is quite impressive. The location on 5th Avenue attracts all types, but everyone was very respectful while we were there for Mass. When in NY, make it a point to stop in for a visit or hopefully to catch a Mass.
Beautiful church. A NYC landmark!. A very beautiful cathedral with amazing architecture. Worth it to go check it out. Do take your camera as you'll want to take pictures inside.

Incredibly beautiful!. Each time I am in the area I visit St. Patrick's Cathedral. It is just an amazing experience and I am always taken by the fact that this gothic cathedral is located right next door to Saks Fifth Avenue and accross from Rockerfeller Center! It is currently undergoing renovations so you will not be able to appreciate its exterior beauty at this time but you can still go inside and see the interior beaity. There are lots of tourists and they check all bags. Be sure to visit the little gift shop and light a candle!

A must while in NYC. As usual, it is a great place to visit. The restoration of the facade is being done, and don’t know when it ends, but you can see the interior. If you are catholic, great place to take mass.

Beautiful building. Beautiful building inside but scaffolding galore outside due to renovation work. Bag searches in operation but worth it to see the splendou inside. Can light a candle without going right in. Central location but silent place of reflection inside.
God Lives Here. What an inspiring place to visit with God. Located near so many other tourist sites, SPC is awesome tribute to the Owner.

Catholic Must-see. Went to Mass during my recent stay in NYC. Cardinal Dolan said the Mass--aided my many priests and one bishop along with a top quality cantor and choir. Not sure if this is business as usual at the 10:15 but I felt lucky to take in all the pomp in this amazing setting.

Covered in scaffolding. A little bummed it was covered in scaffolding for Ash Wednesday. Still open and beautiful inside. Just disappointing. I guess we should have checked it before we took off on foot from the hotel. Cant wait to see what it looks like once done.

St Patrick's. If you wanted to get Ashes on Ash Wednesday and you were not at the Vatican, what is the next most known place to get them?We were in NYC on ash Wednesday and went there. It is very impressive to visit and think of all the ceremonies that have taken place there.

Amazing. St. Patrick's Cathedral is truly an amazing place to see in NYC. It's grand and highly embellished, with so much history and architecture to admire. It is active, so be respectful of worshippers when you go in.
Right by Rockefeller Plaza, definitely worth a stop.
Impressive. One of the largest church I have been in. Beautiful stained glass, huge rose window, and a huge pipe organ. The two spires out front are terrific on this gothic style church

Beautiful - must see. It's a beautiful 19th century Irish cathedral with some of the best stained glassed I've seen. It's a great escape from busy 5th avenue and the nearby Rockefeller Center. Regardless of religious affiliation, or lack thereof, I highly recommend paying a visit to this cathedral steeped in architectural and societal history

If you are a Catholic you have attend mass here at least once. Whenever we are in New York we always attend Sunday Mass at St. Patrick's. Great church, great ambience, usually a very good homily. Afterwards it is always worthwhile to look at the shrines/mini chapels. Definite must if you are Catholic.
Must see. Unbelievable church that you must visit to see the spectacular interior and exterior. Currently covered in sacffolding for a major clean up.

Beautiful. Where do I start, The Cathederal is absolutely Beautiful beyond words. It is my Sanctuary so Peaceful. It is Huge with so many Beautiful Saints in Statues just stunning. Now they are remodeling it cleaning it up all the stained glasses and you could see how beautiful is going to look when is fully cleaned up. WOW.. Must go see if you are in NYC... One of my favorite places.

Beautiful stained glass windows. In the heart of Manhattan, across from Rockfeller Center. A precious goth church with beautiful glass stained windows. It pays a visit, photos and a prayer if you are catholic

Sunday Church. While visiting NYC we had to go to Sunday Mass at this famous Cathedral. We visited during MLK Weekend and although almost the entire exterior of the Cathedral is covered with scafolding for repairs, you could still take in its beauty. The inside is a sight to see and the mass was rather quick, only lasting 45 minutes.

Beautiful and Inspirational!. During our past NYC visits, the cathedral was under renovation, so we didn't get a to go inside. However, when we went after Christmas, it was open to the public, and we went inside. All I could say is "Wow!" If you're in the area, this is worth a visit. The Christmas decorations were still up, and that really added something to the already beautiful place. There were various alcoves where you could light a candle for someone, and I did just that. There was a beautiful manger, and one of the church volunteers gave a nice talk about St. Patrick's. One of the things he said that stuck with me was that when you enter the cathedral, and look up, it feels like you're looking up to heaven (with the vastness of the ceilings). Very true! When you enter, realize that you're in a church, and keep the noise level down. Also, follow the church rules. A great visit!

Beautiful sanctuary. Such a pleasant place to stop and rest after touring the City, especially on a cold day. If it's sunny the stained glass windows are amazing. I'd recommend a stop here even if you are not religious. The architecture is stunning and after the cleaning and restoration it will be even more so. Make sure you walk all the way to the front of the church to a very intimate chapel like area.

WONDERFUL CATHEDRAL. Loved St. Patrick's Cathedral - it is so warm and you get a great feeling of peace when you enter. Sometimes I get Mass there when I am in the city and it is just so beautiful - especially the choir - it makes me feel good for weeks afterwards.

So Grandeur Inside!. This cathedral amazed me with the sheer amount of size that it has! So stunning! Even if you don't have a lot of time to check this place out at least spend 10 minutes to walk through it. A lot of detail was put into it and it's great to see such a wonderful building be maintained in the midst of the hustle and bustle of NYC.
Beautiful - Worth a visit!. Even under construction, this place is worth a visit and a short prayer. So large and beautiful. Many visitors, but plenty of room.

A Beauty To Behold. Although it is presently undergoing facade restoration, it is still it's beautiful self inside. The architecture is breathtaking and truly must be experienced. I do ask, however, that people give the cathedral and those inside a little more respect. Please use your indoor voice and be mindful of the people who are there to worship.
No place like it. Moving, spiritual and peaceful. Highly recommend staying for a mass for any Catholic. And they still have real candles!

Too Many People. I had been so looking forward to seeing the famous St. Patrick's Cathedral and even planned on going to the Saturday Vigil Mass, but upon arriving to a building covered in scaffolding, I was completely overwhelmed by the sheer number of people that had crammed into this holy place. I was so smushed and pressed that I didn't even have a chance to enjoy the beauty of the carvings and the stained glass. Maybe it was the time I went or just the season. I hope to try going back in the near future.

Boom, it's there. You're walking on Fifth and suddenly "BOOM" the St. Patrick's Cathedral is there. A huge and wonderfull building who have nothing in common with is neighboors. In the inside, you'll discover a fascinating architecture. It's also really quiet and calm in the church.

If you've never been to Europe.... This is what I imagine the cathedrals in Europe to look like. I have never been in a church so classically Gothic, vaulted ceilings probably several stories high. Beautiful. And you can still light candles there, which a lot of churches you can't anymore. Thankful I went, even though I only stayed about 10 minutes. Don't miss this, very close to Time Square.

So much history and very nice inside.. Amidst the chaos of 5th Avenue, it's always so calming to step inside St Patty's. The building is peaceful and so beautiful inside and there's a lot of history. They also have a tour which I did many many years ago that was interesting.
Charming St. Patricks. Love this New York landmark so beautiful and peaceful.So glad it is still kept up perfectly.A great traditional NY church an asset to the city.

A 'must' visit for any 5th Avenue explorer. Such a peaceful diversion from the material attractions of 5th Avenue. Our high marking makes due allowance for the restoration work and scaffolding which inevitably detracted from the full beauty of the stained glass windows and the organ but all this should be finished by 2014. Although not enjoying the antiquity and history of older European Cathedrals, St Patrick's is spectacular in its own way, and the quiet and individuality of its many chapels renders it ideal either for those seeking quiet prayer or for the casual and passing observer.
Gorgeous. Beautiful cathedral. Rich in history. The scaffolding outside hinders the view, but inside makes up for what we missed outside.

Best to book ahead for a free guided tour, but walk-in's are allowed on some tours. There is sightseeing daily 6:30 a.m. to 8:45 p.m. They give free guided tours Monday through Friday. 212-355-2749 ext. 829. I would think it’s best to book ahead, but walk-ins are allowed on certain dates and times: http://www.saintpatrickscathedral.org/visit_tours.php. We didn’t take the tour, but we did go to the Noon Mass on New Year's Day and it was lovely.

You'll need tickets for some Easter and Christmas Eve masses but not New Year's Day. We wanted to attend Noon Mass on New Year’s Day 2013, so while planning our trip I called St. Patrick’s and asked how to do that. I was told no reservations or tickets were necessary for that particular service -- just walk in as you would to your own church. However, some Easter and Christmas Eve services do require pre-ordered tickets, but they’re free. Those tickets supposedly go fast, often months ahead of the date. Check the website for Mass times and be aware that the times often change during holidays and holy days. http://www.saintpatrickscathedral.org/masses.php.
Beautiful. Amazingly peaceful in the middle of NYC. Please remember when visiting that this is a place of worship and people are taking mass.
Magical Place. At. Patrick's Cathedral, in the heart of Rock Center is magnificent. There's a small gift shop in the front to the right for religious articles and inexpensive souveniers.

Very impressive. Even if you're not in any way religious it's some where that shouldn't be passed up on your tour of NYC. I happened to go (I'm a lapsed Roman Catholic) for my mother as she wanted a mass card (which by the way you get from the "parochial house" around the side of the Cathedral - not the shop) and I was really taken in by how beautiful the building is and just how impressive.

Excellent Mass. This place is breathtaking. I lit a candle for Sandy Hook with my 7 year old daughter. Ever since that experience I have felt more at peace.Mass is not that long and very inspiring. There is something to be said for traditional church experience. The church we attended in Salinas had so become modernized that it felt more like entertainment than church. This really made a difference.The only unfortunate thing was it was under construction and we couldn't see some of the beautiful stained glass.

Beautiful.breathtaking.. So beautiful. Take your time and really see what is there. Gorgeous statues, gold Leif . There are plenty of places for prayers. Candles cost $2. This church is massive, and every part is beautiful.

Tickets for Midnight Mass at St Patrick's. I was lucky enough to attend Midnight Mass 2012 at St Patrick's Cathedral. I was visiting New York from Australia and had read that tickets were needed to attend this mass. While the tickets are free, you need to apply for them in August/September. They are then posted to you in late November. While I did apply for these tickets in September and I sent a self addressed envelope, the tickets did not arrive in Australia before I left for my holiday. I went to the Parish office and explained the situation. Fortunately, they were able to provide me with 2 tickets. A hint for travellers when applying for tickets in September, ask that the tickets be posted to the hotel where you will be staying and then ask the hotel to hold the tickets until you arrive. It will save a lot of bother. The mass was beautiful and will hold special memories for me for a long time. I can thoroughly recommend this experience.

Continues to be impressive. This was not our first exposure to St. Patrick's, but it was our first visit when it was decorated for the Christmas Season. It's an impressive facility - no matter the Season!

Always A Memorable Experience. Love going to Mass here whenever I am in NYC. The church has such a calming effect, and is beautiful in the evenings when all the candles are lit and the windows seem to glow. Great place for some quiet reflection, but take the time to tour the church and all that is there as well as look in the gift shop. It has a lot of great small items for gifts.

Awesome. This is my second time viewing St Patrick's and it's just amazing. What a great piece of history to see. The only bad thing was that they were doing work on the outside, so you really couldn't take pictures. There were also a ton of people inside, which is usual...but it really is amazing.
Inspirational. The graceful arches and the high ceiling gave the Cathedral such a flow. Almost hard to believe made of stone. A very beautiful structure. stood in awe.

January 2013 may not be the best time. I love stopping in at St Patrick's Cathedral after Christmas while the poinsettias decorate the cathedral. I pick up items in the gift shop that I can use as small gifts throughout the year.But inside and out, the building is currently lined with scaffolding. I don't know how long the project is supposed to last, but If you're coming to see the architecture, you might want to wait until the scaffolding comes down.

Beautiful. We arrived just in time for Mass on a Saturday (just as all the non-Catholic visitors were exiting the church). Even though the outside of the church was surrounded by scaffolding, the inside was majestic. The music sung was heavenly ... enhanced by the acoustics of the church. There was a true sense of holiness within those walls. Mass at St. Patrick's was a highlight of this Catholics visit to NYC.

Magnificent Cathedral. Its hard to describe St. Patrick's. Its definitely a must see if your visiting NYC. It takes up one square block which is huge. Most church's can fit inside St. Patrick's. It has beautiful stained glass windows and the pipe's for the organ are magnificent and the sound is amazing. The past Cardinal's of NY are buried beneath the main alter. You can walk down one side and around the main alter and up the other side. There are smaller alters lining the sidewalls dedicated to different saints. It IS a NYC landamrk and a must see.
An unbelievably beautiful cathedral.. You have to see it to believe it. So beautiful. It's a real challenge to get good pictures inside, but once you've been you'll most likely remember it anyway.

A must see in NYC. Went today for Sunday Mass and had the luck of Cardinal Dolan saying the Mass on the Epiphany. Even though renovations are under way the beauty, majesty AND holiness of the Cathedral is breathtaking. Go even if not Catholic......you might then convert.

Nothing to see, here, folks, nothing to see.... Currently, St. Patrick's has scaffolding around the entire cathedral,, as nearly as I could tell (it was a rainy day; I did not walk around the back), so none of the architecture is visible in any way, shape or form. Perhaps because it was the Christmas season, or just the wrong time of day, but this was described by previous reviewers as "an oasis" from the bustle of New York. While there was some quieter tones, the place was mobbed when we went through, so it was hardly an oasis. Go at a non-busy time (not mid-afternoon, in my experience), and wait until the scaffolding is down.
Historically Enchanting. The cathedral never ceases to amaze me. It's awesome. Our visit at Christmas time was very heartwarming.

Beautiful. I took my mom to NYC for her birthday and this is always a must see for her. It is simply beautiful. While it is very "touristy", we were there during mass and I personally felt that the church was big enough that the tourist were not interfering with our religious experience. I would definitely recommend visiting while in the city.

Gorgeous. A must when visiting NYC. Right on 5th Ave so very easy to get in. Currently has a lot of renovation so not much photo ops but the sanctuary is so moving. Go in, light a candle and take in this glorious place.

Beautiful... but not tranquil. St Patrick's is a stunning church and an oasis in the heart of the busiest city in the world. The history is evident and so is the interest, however it is more of a tourist site than a church. There is no one there to remind people to keep their voices down, to be respectful of the statues, People were taking picutes and videos like it was Santa and not our savior. I am sure the church thrives on donations to keep it running, especially the heating bill since the doors of the church are left open on 35degree days, however there are donation collection boxes every 5 feet. I felt I was in the wrong place to sit and have a minute of prayer. I feel they have lost the intergity of the church in lieu of the option for hundreds of visitors and their donations. Still a must see even if you are not Catholic, although it is being renovated the beauty is still evident.

Rich in history. Im not catholic but I feel Gods presence there. It's a beautiful cathedral worth walking through. There are several saints on display on both sides of the church. The place is usually packed with visitors from all over the world. It's a nice place to get out of the cold and warm up in if your walking 5th ave. I really like having the opportunity to light a prayer candle.

Had to convince the kids to come here, but glad I did!. My teenagers were not particularly excited to go and see a church, but I remembered seeing it as a child and convinced them to humor me after a stop at Rockefeller Center. Yes, the outside is under construction, which made them even more underwhelmed as we approached. But once inside, St. Patrick's does not disappoint. The Gothic style is inspiring and awesome, the stained glass is magnificent, and the sheer enormity of the building is worth seeing alone. It was packed the day we were there (shortly after Christmas 2012), so there was not much chance for peace or quiet. The Nativity scene had a long line of viewers. But I was pleased to see how long my kids chose to stay and explore and sit and appreciate. My son even listed it as among his favorite things we saw on our trip by the time we got home!

Beautiful.. I won't lie, I felt a bit of Catholic guilt taking pictures inside a church like it was a tourist attraction, but the inside really is breathtaking, and worthy of a few photos. (Guilt was lessened when I noticed the gift shop in the back corner. A gift shop in a church! ...it was closed by the time we got there at 8pm, by the way, else we probably would've worsened aforementioned guilt by purchasing a magnet.)The outside is under restoration/renovation. There are long, covered walkways on either side that open at the entrance points and doors. The back (on Madison) still has a bit of a view, but the front (on 5th) was completely covered in plastic and scaffolding. We were there a few days before NYE.Seriously, though: Beautiful. Love the architecture, and the Christmas decorations were still up, which was quite pretty.

beautiful. Sadly the outside of the Cathedral was under construction during our visit but the inside was breath-taking, gorgeous stained glass & architecture. Definitely worth stopping by. We had this on our places to visit and it did not disappoint.
Under construction. Hoping to be helpful- I wanted to make Tripadvisor's readers aware that the entire outside is under construction as I type. The inside, however, is beyond words.

Beautiful, Peaceful Oasis in Midtown NYC. I used to attend Mass every day at St Patrick's cathedral when I worked in Manhattan. The Lady Chapel all the way behind the main altar is especially peaceful and prayerful. If you want a break from all of the hustle and bustle of Rockefeller Center and Fifth Avenue, make a stop at Saint Patrick's.

Good For The Soul. We are not Catholic nor religious, more spiritual,we felt like we needed to connect being way from family and friends at Xmas. Passing St Partricks we went in and felt refreshed by the wonderful experience of a Xmas Mass and the atmosphere that makes the hairs on the back of your neck stand up. We lit candles for friends and family and prayed for peace in the World.I should also mention that this Cathedral is beautiful and well worth a visit for it's beauty alone.

Take the Tour!. We enjoyed the tour of this beautiful cathedral - so interesting. They are working to reinforce and repair problems so the church exterior in completely shrouded with scaffolding and the windows covered outside for protection from the work, but it was still worth the time for the tour. Check their website for the tours - they are scheduled at different times, not on a regular schedule. The tour we took worked out well for our itinerary. We always feel welcomed in this church, even though we are not Catholic. The docent was very interesting and showed her love for the congregation and the wonderful history of this cathedral. Very good!

A Beautiful Church. I used to work accross the street from St. Patricks but rarley visitied it. I went to see the Christmas tree in Rockerfeller Center this season and stopped by to view the church. They were under construction but the inside is magnificent.

Our father who art in heaven. We were fortunate enough to be in the church and light a candle just before Christmas. There was a Singing in NYC event and we were blessed to hear the lovely carols and psalms

Awe-Inspiring. We visited during the Christmas holiday; it was my first time in the cathedral. I can't begin to explain the experience that stirred something inside- from the grand architecture, nativity scene, incents burning to lighting candles, prayers, and the beautiful singing of Silent Night it was all so special and absolute breathtaking. A must see especially during Christmas time.

Beautifully decorated for the holidays despite scaffolding. On a snowy/rainy Saturday we stopped in to light candles for our families. Despite the scaffolding inside as well as outside, the cathedral was beautifully adorned with lots of poinsettias.As indicated in other reviews, it is a short walk from Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall. Definitely worth a stop while in the area.

From A Top Contributor, This Is A Must-See!. Having visited here previously, we stopped in again, to see the breathtaking architecture. Though covered with scaffolding, we enjoyed the experience just as much as times previously. It just so happened that Christmas mass was just about to begin as we walked down the center aisle of this majestic cathedral. What a great place to spend Christmas day! We sang Christmas carols, lit a candle for those in need, offered a few prayers, took communion, and most importantly, worshipped our Lord Jesus Christ in this glorious cathedral, as thousands have done before us. Located just a short walk from busy Rockefeller Center with all the ice-skaters, this respite was a meaningful and welcomed stop, particularly on Christmas day, 2012.

Beautiful Cathedral. We come to NYC every Christmas and we always try to stop in and see St. Patrick's Cathedral. We enjoy the amazing architecture, the statues and the Christmas activity. Well worth the stop. Would recommend it.

Papist pomposity in its worst form. A very ugly clone of the real things in Europe. Ostentations and grandiose, just like its parent institution. Save yourself the time and visit the Cathedral of St. John the Divine uptown if you are into this kind of thing.

Under restoration. Went in September & outside was being covered in scaffolding etc.However went in side - and that is some place.Not particularly a church goer - but i can appreciate places like this [ same as the Basillica in Rome]The skills involved perphaps are now lost in our present world. a must see if in New York

Breathtaking. St Patrick's Cathedral is one of the most beautiful cathedrals I have seen anywhere in the world. It is also in pristine condition, with polished stone and marble and stunning stained glass and shrines. Work is in progress on the exterior and it is shrouded in scaffolding in places but this does not affect the interior. Situated on Madison Avenue, opposite Rockefeller Plaza, it is easy to step inside this beautiful church for a few minutes and admire the magnificent architecture. Highly recommended.

A place to pray!. We were exhausted when we got to the Cathedral, we quickly found a bench and just sat in awe of the environment and the architecture. A must stop while in NYC. I felt so peaceful after leaving it was amazing.

World Class Neo-Gothic Cathedral in the Heart of NYC. There is a reason 5.5 million people visit this cathedral each year. Many (obviously) come to worship, but regardless of your religious views, this is an amazing, beautiful, peaceful place to visit. Like most world-class cathedrals, there are beautiful stained glass windows, a vast, tall beautiful interior, and a great many side chapels with excellent paintings and sculptures on and around their alters. It is well worth a visit.
beautiful. it is under construction so it is hard to see the details outside. the towers are huge and the architecture is amazing!
Beautiful. I attended mass at St. Patrick's. It's a beautiful cathedral and a must-see even if you aren't Catholic. The architecture and artwork are beautiful.

Beautiful Cathedral. St. Patrick's is a beautiful Cathedral opposite Rockefella plaza and is a must see. It is undergoing renovation on the outside at the moment, which I'm sure will restore it to its wonderous beauty.Inside is a haven of tranquility with beautiful architechture and windows.When we visited there were Carols being sung which added to the atmosphere. Absolutely breathtaking.

A Place of Peace. The building is undergoing a makeover and has been that way since we were her in May.However it is an island of tranquility in a mad City. Time to stop reflect and realise the madness of life particularly in times of real distress like the Newtown Massacre.

NYC _ Brooklyn December 2012. The Cathedral was under renovations to the outside, at this time, once completed, will restore the amazing architecture. It was very croweded, on Saturday, Dec 15th, due to the Newton, Connecticut tradgedy.We lit candles for the victims and thier families, walked through and admired the Christmas Decorations, Manger setting, Christmas Tree, etc..

Glorious by any comparison. Tourists, particularly Christian tourists to New York should include St. Pats as a must visit on their itinerary. Beyond the vaulted architecture and sculptures, a number of exhibits await visitors. The only significant downside to visiting the cathedral results from its popularity - aisles are very crowded and moving about takes some negotiation with the masses.

Under renovation outside; still breathtaking inside. Just an overwhelming experience when you are standing in the back of such a massive cathedral. And such a solemn place when you walk to the back of the cathedral to the Women's area.
Haven of Tranquility. Thoroughly enjoyed the visit to St. Patrick's. The scale of the cathedral is quite daunting but you quickly adapt. Felt very welcome. Spent a very enjoyable hour.
America's Largest Catholic Catedral. Opened in 1879, its in French Gotich style. The interior has altars dedicated to saints and holy figures, chapels. Beautiful windows.

Get There Early If You Want To Sit During The Mass. We planned our schedule so we would be able to take in Saturday evening Mass. It was soooo crowded (which is a good thing) that we almost had to stand but some seats opened up. It was a lovely service and we're glad we made time for this retreat from the hustle and bustle.
Restoring a beauty. Right now the scaffolding is obstructing the exterior but inside this is a beautiful piece of architecture. The statue of the Pieta is a must see.

A gothic style Church amid skyscrapers. I suppose the saddest thing was that there were' security people' searching bags as people entered the service in the church. St Patricks is now surrounded by scaffolding which is not very appealing but its another 'site' to visit when in New York

Beautiful building. What a magnificent space, inside and out. Such a huge departure from its surrounding buildings. Really nice to see a historic building like this. The cathedral was under construction but people were able to walk in, pray and explore the interior. Very peaceful and spiritual presence.

If at Christmas make sure to see the Nativity. On my visit they happen to have the Nativity displayed - beautiful! Plus the choir was giving a Christmas concert on a Sunday afternoon which was spectular to hear!
The church is undergoing renovations so a lot of the church is covered in construction but still plenty to see.
Awe inspiring.. Even though it is currently undergoing renovations this is still at must see in midtown. It is such an amazing place and so beautiful.

wonderfull church. What a wonderfull church. And its free. At Christmas you can see the crib and light a candle for lost loves. Biggest Cathedral in America. Just think of those old films featuring this place of worship. Try to be their for a mass.

Must see. Under renovation. But it is possible to be visited. Historic and beautiful interior. Truly a place that should be on every list of things to do in New York. It is even more beautiful in Christmas season.

Just Awesome. A must when in NYC. Having some construction and renovation but still open to the public. So much history here , has a well stocked gift shop, and a great place to rest and collect your thoughts and special intentions. I vist every time I'm in area
Christmas tradition. Every year we go and see the tree and of course have to visit the Cathedral. It would not be Christmas without it. Such a spiritual place.

Part of my life. I can't remember a time when I didn't know St Pat's - my parents came here when they were courting, counseled with the then Rector, the incredible Msgr Dalla Villa, brought me to Christmas Midnight Mass when I was still in my mother's womb to pray for the viabilty of the pregnancy, that I would come to full-term, have a safe and healthy birth, for the health and safety of my life. My mother often took me to St Pat's for "visits." I love the grandness, the scale, the structures, the beauty, the majesty, and the history, not just our family's personal history, but the Cathedral's history in NYC, and the part it plays in furthering the history of Christianity in New York
Historical.. Jackie O was in interim here and many other famous people so it puts the occasion of their pasing into perspective.

Lifts your soul!. St Patrick's is a special place. Though thousands go through its doors daily, one can still find peace there, and can find a quiet place to pray. It is also beautiful! Don't miss the special chapel behind the main altar!
Wonderful mass!. Do check it out, despite the renovations going on...love the celebration of Mass at this historical Cathedral!

One of the prettiest churches in the USA. I have been to chruches around the world and in this country. There was an element of Westminster Abbey with this church. Currently, the church is under restoration so much of its inherent charm is lost amongst the scaffolding and other construction material. But once you get past that, it is a beautiful church and certainly worth a visit for all people and all faiths. If you want, go to mass too. Check out their scheduled and the languages that are being offered. Also, make sure that you really look at the schedule. If you have a hectic day planned, you don't want to go to mass when the Archbishop is there. We went to church at noon and it was normal. Sit in the front - which means you should get there early. Sitting in the front gives you a bird's eye view of the altar and all the happenings during mass. I love sitting in the front in any church. Even if you don't there are monitors that maybe on throughout the mass and certainly speakers strategically placed so you can hear.Before mass (or after), tour the church. It is likely that there will be another mass happening when you are touring but if you have been to the Vatican, you know what it is like to be at mass with hundreds of people walking and taking pictures. If you go while the church is getting its facelift, look past the work to see the gothic beauty. You do not find many churches like this in the States. Soak it in. If you have never been to Europe, this is a good idea of what you would see in some of the truly 13th century gothic churches you would find there.PSA - If you are inclined, donate to the church itself. The costs to maintain the building, I imagine, are enormous. Every little bit helps. Regardless of whether you are Catholic or not, this is a landmark that should be preserved and kept for all New Yorkers and all visitors of New York.
Worth a stop. It is worth a moment to step in and take in the architecture. Simply stunning. They have some construction at the moment but it was easy to navigate.

Lovely Sunday morning in NYC. We decided to attend mass here, even though we are not Catholic. If you go, make sure to get good seats up towards the front so that you can see - it's huge. Also, people towards the back and sides can be disturbed by chatty tourists. Would definitely do this again.
splendor. informative spiritual and awe-inspiring. What's more to say. Masses are regular and you can see the cardinal
a must see in NYC. I've been here many times over the years, grand in the style of European cathedrals. a lot of NYC history here

Classic Historical Site. St Patrick's is easy to get to, located in Midtown on Madison Avenue close to the Rockefeller centre. The cathedral is undergoing extensive exterior renovations at present. This did not detract from the view internally which was impressive.As I am originally from the UK we are fortunate in having many grand cathedrals to visit, so seeing something this grand and old is not new to me. If you are in midtown and have time on your hand St Patrick's is worth a visit.

GOD BLESS NYC.. A truly amazing building.Outdoor photos not too clever with the Cathedral being surrounded by scaffolding but inside was as you Americans say awesome !Ian Stapleton,Manchester,England.
Beautiful. The church is goreous. The interior is definitely a sight to see. The exterior was undergoing renovations, so couldn't really see that at all:( However, mass is pretty quick.

A Cathedral that Endures. This is a stunner, but there are less famous and just as beautiful Catholic places of worship throughout the whole town. Some of my favorites are: St. Ignatius Loyol (83 & Park) -- their concerts are well worth it, and highlight the musical scene of NY. St. Vincent de Paul - another stunner. Do not hesitate to walk into the churches. They are architectural and spiritual gems.
peace. it is really peace what you fell once inside the cathedral. Attending service during working days is really a moment of intimacy with God. Not so much on a sunday

Beautiful and Inspiring. This is probably the most famous of all of the US Catholic cathedrals. It is having some upgrade work done on it now; but I thought having boxes outside for contributions was very gauche and tacky - almost as if one had to pay an admission ot go in and say a prayer. I could have done without the political literature in this place of worship also. BTW, what office is Dolan running for?

Absolutely loved it.. The Cathedral was on my "to see" list when I finally came to New York. It is an exquisite building, even with the renovations going on. There is an area for quiet contemplative prayer, which everyone seemed to respect. You can't take pictures at this area, but you can in all other areas that aren't cordoned off. I've visited a lot of churches, and 4 here in New York alone, it is an awesome sight, and if you like architecture, then don't miss this one out. Life is too short for regrets

Amazing architecture. If you are a fan of architecture you have to see this place. You don't have to be Catholic (or any religion) to appreciate the magnificence of this place. It was awe-inspiring even aside form all the religious icons. They only ask for donations and you are welcome to sit down and pray or light a candle if you so choose. I would definitely recommend not going on a Sunday unless you are going for the service as it is full of worshippers and you are not able to look around freely.
Beautiful place. If you can get into the New York Palace hotel to see the Cathedral from above it's pretty cool and shaped like a cross
Must see. Spectacular sight a must see. It is a great sight to see all the work and care and the sheer size. Highly recommend at least a quick walk through.
Amazing. I was taken aback by the beauty. It was hugh and the attention to detail was amazing. Whether your Catholic or not, you will be in awe.

Take time to visit. In the mayhem that is New York this place of tranquility exists. This place is a haven for those who seek spiritual reflection, for others its about the architecture and sensational stained windows. Take time to walk around and find the creative jewels. Show your appreciation by making a small contribution to their current renovations

Worth visiting. Saint Patrick's is architecturally one the nicest building in NY. Its one of the iconic places you must visit when in NY.
I don't think you have to be religious to enjoy visiting St Pats

Simply beautiful and peaceful. Imagine the silence of the cathedral and the calm of the building after a night of storm (Hurricane SAndy) I cannot say more than the title. Let us pray for the ones suffering
My Wife Attend Service Here!. They are doing restoration outside this fabulous building; however, to walk inside is still something all people should experience.
OK for Christians. Great architecture and artwork, a little on the stuffy side with the religion stuff. But, since it is a church, I guess you can understand the pushy end.

Definitely make arrangements for a tour. Having grown up in NYC I have been to the Cathedral several times but never before did I get a chance to see it like I did with the tour group I was leading. Our docent was very knowledgeable and interesting. You get so much more detail with a guide. The structure itself could take you days to see all the intricate artwork and designs. Knowledge of Catholicism is not a requirement to enjoy every aspect of this sanctuary.I only wish that they had a system just like that used across the street at the Rockefeller Center tour. There the docent had a headset and each of us had earphone receivers so that you could hear every word. I am sure the church could not go to the expense (the church tour was free) Of course donations were more than acceptable.

Uplifting Spiritual Renewal, Open to All. Took our visiting teenage grandson for an evening outing; he'd never been to NYC or to a cathedral and was visibly moved by this architectural and spiritual treasure in the heart of the city. Ongoing exterior restoration doesn't diminish the majestic beauty inside; and way cheaper than a trip to Europe!
Very Beautiful.... We were able to to in and enjoy part of a Mass Sunday evening... Was nice. Portions are under renovation

Skippable. With all the great things in NYC to see, St Pat's may not be one you want to go out of your way to visit. If you're in the area, no reason not to poke your head in. If not, it's not a tragedy to skip it.

Marvelous Cathedral!. The exterior of the cathedral was under renovation during our visit, but that didn't detract too much from its overall beauty. What I loved most about this site was the interior walls of the cathedral, which were lined with patron saints. Each section has designated areas where guests can light a candle and sit/kneel and pray before their patron saint, such as St. Therese. In summary, visit St. Patrick's Cathedral if you want a nice quiet moment away from the hustle and bustle of NYC.
Amazing. To hear about this church on TV and See it on TV gives it no justice while experience it in person. This church is a landmark and just pure serenity.

Grandiose. This gothic church is a masterpieceA must see,the profusion of details, ornements,the vault, stained-glass windowsThe contrast between the hustle from outside and the peace inside is to experiment
As beautiful as expected. The outside is under renovation so you couldn't see much of the exterior, but the inside is beautiful and moving.

God is Alive. Walk around the altar. Look up at the ceiling and see the red hats of all the Cardinals who were Archbishops of New York. The red hat is what the Pope gave to the Archbishops when they were appointed Cardinals. Behind the altar and down the steps are the tombs of the former Cardinals. Attend Mass at the main altar or if you are lucky, you may see a priest saying Mass at one off the side altars. Stop at the church store. Visit the Blessed Mother's altar behind the main altar. Say a prayer for me.
A beautiful city centre cathedral. Although the outside is swathed in scaffolding and dwarfed by modern buildings the interior is peaceful and very beautiful.

Renovations being done but still breathtaking. Beautiful, awe inspiring even with renovations being done inside and out. Mass is open to public so if you want to catch a mass, make sure to check times. Gift shop also had great selection of items with various price points.

under construction but don't let that stop you. Even if you have no desire to see a Cathedral talk yourself into stopping. St. Patricks is beautiful and full on history. Take 20 to 30 minutes of your time to explore. You can choose to take the tour or not. We didn't and still seen alot by just walking it our self.

Simply Stunning!. Oh my goodness! This is one of the most amazing buildings I've ever been in. It's just breathtaking. I was so surprised that tourists could just walk through while they were having Mass. But... I'm glad we could. It's worth going in.

it's like crossing a church with Grand Central station. Saint Patrick's is architecturally beautiful - inside and out. But they do nothing to contain tourists or insure this remains a place of worship. We visited recently, and there was a wedding taking place, while hundreds of tourists walked around, chatting and taking pictures. What a mess! They also have hung television monitors eveywhere, which ruins the sacred-ness of this place. It's truly awful.

Beatiful Gothic Cathedral at NY's most posh address. St. Patrick's is a landmark and a must visit for all, no matter what your spiritual believe. The architecture is amazing. There are many smaller altars and chapels around the perimeter. Attending a Mass or service here is spectacular, particularly if the Choir sings. I was blessed to attend a wedding. It was spectacular!

Contemporary message in a Gothic catherdral. the message was so contemporary and so meaningful to this protestant, it is such an international audience and the message was so on target, I have visit St. Pat's on most trips to NY when I am there on Sunday. They have scaffels on the outside and inside so the pipe organ did not show off it loudness, however they have wonderful inspiring music. The architecture is most moving, I sat near the front this time so I was able to see the true wonders of the columns near the alter and the stain glass is so moving. A must to visit on Sunday.

Overwhelming !!!!!. St.Patrick's Cathedral is breathtakingly beautiful. The stations of the cross are so detailed you actually become entranced looking at them. I was fortunate enough to hear a Mass being said. It's amazing how you just get lost looking at the details in all the stained glass windows and sculptures. A must see if you go to NY.
NY Gothic. See a great Cathedral in the heart of Midtown Manhattan. Take a break from shopping, rest a spell, light a candle, meditate.
