Beautiful on the inside. When we went, the exterior of the building was under renovation, but the inside was a lovely escape from the hustle and the bustle of the city outside. The interior was true to Gothic architecture and was immaculately detailed. I loved the high ceilings and attention to detail.
Beautiful Church. This is a beautiful church. Mass here is special but it is also a peaceful place to say a prayer or two.

A must see. Don't miss stopping in at St. Patrick's Cathedral. It is amazingly beautiful and serene. You don't have to be of the Catholic faith, or any faith at all for that matter, to enjoy visiting this cathedral. The architecture, and details of the cathedral are fantastic. It was easy to view, and you can walk in just about any time. I highly recommend taking a few minutes, and checking out St. Patrick's Cathedral on 5th Ave.

Impressive. You don't expect such an impressive interior, because when we visited the exterior was encased in scaffolding. The interior is dominated by a soaring gothic roof that is reminiscent of medieval cathedrals we saw in Europe. Ornate chapels dedicated to particular saints and angels line the walls. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful architecture and totally open to the public. I've visited many churches and cathedrals in other countries, but none have been as accessible as St. Peter's. We walked throughout the main building and around the alter. It's a striking building. The fact that no-one was struck by lightening and the building didn't fall around us because I was there indicates that anyone can visit it!

Go to hear Christmas Midnight Mass here.. Majestic Cathedral surprisingly squashed in a narrow area almost across the road from the Rockerfeller Centre. Go early for a seat, very full, go up to the front to enjoy and to be a real part of the Service. Also visit the old Cathedral in East side where the early immigrants worshipped and see some famous names remembered.

Great Gem ~ Piece & Quiet on 5th Ave. Famous Gothic Cathedral under going renovations. Scaffolding covers the external facade and a few places inside cathedral.Great spot to sit and view your surroundings.Usually a lunchtime a religious service (catholic mass) is held.Walk all around the inside and observe all the side altars.Many stained glass windows. Review the Cathedral website and Wiki for more infoFree tours on a Thursday at about 13:00 ?Please check the website.

Impressed me!. Im going to start off by saying that i'm not a religious type person but this cathedral is one of the most spectacular buildings i've ever seen.I happened to go in when there was hardly anyone else in there and the feelings i got were just overwhelming. It is so beautiful. You can't help but feel blessed to be in there.The stained glass windows, the architecture and all the stone carvings were just beyond belief. Don't miss this!
very interesting. Impressive architecture and art. A learning experience. Nice atmosphere, seeing the prayers and tourists

St. Patrick's. We visited St. Patrick's while in NYC to see a play and have dinner. The Cathedral is magnificent and beautiful. It has a long and storied history. Even though the Cathedral is large, you can still sit in silence and feel very comforted, especially at the front of the Church were the Blessed Sacrament is adored.

Must see in NY. St Patrick's is being renovated on the outside but remains open to the public. It is a beautiful Gothic Cathedral well worth visiting to see the wonderful architecture and stained glass windows.

Scaffolding detracted . It's a lovely church inside and sits proudly on 5th avenue but the outside being entirely covered with scaffolding detracted from its overall beauty . A visit in the past without the construction has been a better experience for me than this time around. Seems like scaffolding may be there for a while too

magnificent. have been there before but my husband hadn't unfortunately, it was being worked on so that there was scaffolding all around the structure inside was wonderful, so grand & large a must see

Breath taking. Just a wonderful place to visit, a must see. Wandered in there by mistake when walking around. The stained glass, wood work, and stone work were great. A nice quiet place in the middle of the busy city.
History and architecture in middle if city. While on fifth avenue stumbled upon this location. Go in for the views and history. Busy with worshipers and visitors.

Peace and quiet just when you need it!. Step inside for a real tranquil setting where you can bearly hear the madness and chaos outside. A stunning building which is bigger inside than it looks. Wonderful huge stain glass windows and marble make this opulent working church a little bit of heaven.

A Beautiful Church. We visited on a Saturday afternoon and happened upon a wedding! We stayed and joined in the prayers and applause for the bridal couple. It was so emotional for us as we only celebrated our wedding last year. The Cathedral itself is stunning and we were sad not to be able to attend Mass there the following day due to our travelling arrangements

Pity about the Scaffolding. The outside of the cathedral is covered in scaffolding because of the renovation, but once inside it is a beautiful cathedral. When we visited midweek there was a mass at the same time and quite a few people in attendance. Lots of lovely stained windows and decorated altars along both sides. Should be magnificent from the outside when renovations completed. Glad we visited.

Exquisite architecture. They are currently doing a huge renovation but we got into the cathedral and it was truly breathtaking, ornate in every respect and very, very beautiful...A real work of art that if you enjoy churches and cathedrals? You would NOT want to miss this one in New York City...It's as beautiful as I have seen ANYWHERE in the world, but if you don't like churches or cathedrals? DON'T BOTHER...NOT for you...

A Nice Cathedral. I've travelled all over Europe, so compared to the cathedrals there, this was nothing special (especially compared to Spain), but it is compared to other US Cathedrals. I'm not a Catholic, but, it was beautiful inside, and had lots of people visiting. I can't say there is anything special to be sure to see here, but its a nice stop along the way. The only con, there are no bathrooms, so be prepared!

Splendid Architecture. St. Patrick's Cathedral is an architectural gem just opposite Rockefeller Center. The central stained glass window above the main doors are incredible, as are the many other stained glass windows that abound. The statuary is beautifully lighted and the entire cathedral's interior is a photographer's dream, but you do need a long lens because of the size.The main drawback that I know about is Christmas time is very busy in the area, especially with Rockefeller Center across the street. On the upside though, you have the beautiful landscaping and decorations as well as the huge, lighted tree and the ice skating rink and a variety of restaurants, in a wide price range. It's well worth the trip to see St. Patrick's Cathedral.

An unexpected gem. This is a beautiful cathedral that took us by surprise. We were fortunate enough to be there just on the noon mass and when the pipe organ began to play - it was just magnificent. Remember it is a church so be reverent and respectful of worshipers - really not to be missed
Magnificent. Always a quiet retreat from the maddening world outside, St. Pat's is a beautiful oasis to stop and rest and say a prayer for someone you love.
Beautiful old church. Simply amazing. To see the church in person was a gift. The architecture was incredible. Would recommend for anyone!

Save the airfare to Europe!. I went to Mass in St. Patrick's Cathedral in NYC last Sunday and it was quite a treat. Traditional Catholic service in a georgeous cathedral. The stained glass, architectural details and palatial ceilings all combine to give you a true feeling that you are somewhere special. I have traveled to many cathedrals in Europe and none have impressed me any more that this one here in the good ol' USA. A truly spiritual place to worship.

BEAUTIFUL CATHEDRAL. While in New York be sure to visit this church. We went to Christmas mass and as you can imagine it was very crowded. Many poeple were standing. It is quite large but will only take a half hour to take it all in. There is no charge to enter the church. it is an experience.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful church. The stained glass windows are amazing. Well worth a visit, just a couple of blocks down from Central Park.

One of the most amazing buildings in the world. Of course anyone who comes to new york must stop in to see st. Patrick's cathedral. It is like notre dame in paris, the duomo in florence, or westminster in london. History, grandeur, glamour - its all there. You can stop in for 15 minutes, or spend an hour or more going slowly through the many parts.

Restoration. Even though there's a huge restoration in progress there were people outside about to start a wedding so it was kind of difficult to get in, but we already have been inside so it wasn't a big deal.

Thank you!. I really appreciate the fact that this holy church is well cared for by the people of NYC.
The place is so holy even if it receives thousands of visitors everyday. Thank you for having a space for all the saints and archpishops. Thank you!!!!

Majestic Place. St. Patrick's Cathedral can be entered from 5th avenue 51st street, Manhattan, NY. The exterior is under renovation, but full services were going on inside the cathedral. The very entry into it gives you a divine pleasure. There is an information desk and many helpers are there to guide you. Details about the church are : Height of the spires is about 330 feet; Number of pipes is over 9000; Seating capacity is around 2400; 19 bells; Rose window of 26 feet diameter (located above Main Organ); and Main Organ and Choir Gallery located above Narthex. It is about 400 feet long church. When you enter through the Bronze Doors, Statues of St. Paul and of St. Peter will be seen. Just next is Bas relief of St. John Bosco and of St Frances Cabrini. Before Stations of the cross, Alters of saints are located. Around the Sanctuary gives a majestic view. The Ambulatory is equally worth seeing where you can see Lady Chapel. Photography is not permitted in this area.

Very special Cathedral. We are not Catholic, but if you get there at the time of the Mass, you will feel a special spirit of worship if you sit quietly. The building is remarkable, and the Ladies Chapel is especially sweet., We heard Gregorian Chants there after the 1:00 Mass. Very lovely.

Calm in al the chaos. We just happened past the cathedral and decided to look inside. Mass was going on which was really cool. Mid-week at noon and there were a lot of people there. It is well worth checking out.
Came across this by accident. We were walking along 5th Avenue and noticed the doors were open, wow what a place. Absolutely stunning, we are not religious but were so glad we went in.
Qiet contemplation amid the bustle of 5th Ave. Enjoyed a quiet hour of contemplation in this iconic cathedral. The architecture and stained glass windows are magnificent.

The best Gothic art outside Europe!!!. This is a must while in NY. Right in the 5th avenue. Even if you are not Catholic, you will discover this gem of the architecture is a very interesting visit.Althoug is not as big as Wien or Cologne's this Cathedral has its own unique charm. One of the best examples of gothic art outside Europe.Please remind that is not a museum, some respect is requested for the tourists toward the people attending a religious service.

A place of peace. This is the only place I have entered in years that makes me feel like I am close to whatever God is. There is a serenity here that reaches in and touches my soul. I want to sit and mediate to really meld with whatever it is here that makes peace seem so possible. I wish I cold bottle this feeling.

Beautiful. Although it is being restored it is a fantastic building. We went to mass there and the service was great and everyone was so welcoming. Would have loved to see the outside but there was scaffolding everywhere. The inside is just as impressive though.

A Magnificent Church Always Open. You will be amazed at the mix of people that visit for the archetectural glory, take a break to sit and relax, or just offer up a prayer that they are able to travel!! You will forget you are in New York City. Just enter from the front and take your own tour.

Truly Angelic. In the heart of 5th ave, St Patrick Cathedral is in a league of its own. The architecture, the windows makes it breathtaking. High ceiling and a rather spectacular Lady Guadalupe, which is one of the main attraction for most people. It's the most quiet serene place you can actually sit and pray. You can light a candle for prayers or fill your bottle with holy water. There are free scheduled guides and walk in guided tours. There's a small chapel inside the church, no cameras allowed, if you don't want to be disturbed in your prayers. I've had a wnderful experience and it's a shame that I'm from the city and never even bother to visit more often.
Special Place. Although we are not Catholic, it was hard not to feel your faith when visiting such a majestic building.

a gothic monument amist other creative nyc architural edifices. catholics, protestants, jews, muslims, name the religion....it doesn't matter! st pat's is a destination for sightseers from all over. its vastness is almost overwhelming, but the numerous altars and smaller "nooks and crannies" personalizes it. christian holiday times make it extra special as decorative embellishments make it wondrous for people of all religions and all parts of the world. the stained glass windows and vast main altar make it especially appealing for those art lovers who enjoy architectural and creative beauty. my last visit was in august, '12, but have been there many times before, and will visit in many future times. there seems to be something new to discover in st. pat's each time one visits.

Incredible Architecture. St. Patrick's Cathedral offers incredible Gothic architecture, amazing stained glass and art in the midst of midtown Manhattan. It is undergoing a major renovation right now, but that doesn't detract from its grandeur or minimize the incredible photo opportunities. Of course, it's an amazing church first, so if you're Catholic I'm sure it offers incredible spiritual meaning, as well.Definitely include this on your must-see list!
A must see!. You can't go to NYC without stopping to see this beautiful church. I wouldn't recommend around the holidays though, as long lines definitely form.
Wedding site. We attended the perfect wedding here. It was amazing from start to finish and the cathedral is breathtaking.

Magnificent, even with outdoor renovations underway. The beauty of the Architecture in St Patrick's Cathedral is magnificent. We spent about an hour just taking in all of the Stained Glass, statues, ceilings, the Altar, floors & so much more. St Patrick's is a treasure & should not be missed. People of every culture & faith appreciate beauty. You will enjoy visiting St Patrick's! By the way, I had a 10year-old boy & 12 year-old girl with me & they commented that they had never seen anything like St Patrick's!

Beautiful Cathedral. A beautiful Catholic cathedral in the heart of midtown. A must stop if you are in midtown. The only negative are the tourists taking pictures everywhere and talking out loud (very few whispers here). I know it's a tourist destination but I Parisian standards for churches-proper attire, no photographs (use your memory), whispers only and a general sense of respect for the institution. Call me old fashion. By the way, you may be lucky enough to see a mass or a wedding.
Another Church. Nice church in a great city, it is impressive but I still like the small churches which are more personal better.

One of my favorites!!. This is a truly beautiful cathedral and very big. Sometimes in the afternoon you can catch the choir rehearsing. At Christmas time (usually around Dec. 15th) the choir has a free Christmas program as well. A real treat!

Amazing. Amazing part of Church history. A free attraction, showing the beautiy of the church. It was open to the public. If you were there to medate, pray or even nap in the pew (all I seen)--all were welcomed, including noisy guests like me. Thanks,
Didn't go inside but the architecture itself is lovely. There was construction on the outside and we didn't have time to go inside but it was still amazing and a marvel to look at.

Attend mass. Mass is held frequently throughout the day so be sure to visit during mass. So much to see inside, there are several chapels and areas for meditation, prayer or lighting a candle. Be sure to make a wish if it's your first time there.

A Beauty.Magnifcent.But Exterior Renovation.. This is a really beautiful church (grand architecture at it`s best), a must see, but the exterior is pretty well coveredbecause of renovations so one can not expect to view it in all it`s glory.Still, experience the power and elegance of the interior. And enjoy thequiet and peace far removed from the busy world outside on 5th Avenue.

Amazing!. Words cannot describe the complexity in the architecture of this church. WOW!!! I'm not a Catholic, but was amazed at the love that was felt while visiting the church. The history of the church is impressive. I visited during mass, which I didn't realize visitors were allowed during that time. Listening to the organ play was soothing and peaceful. Inside this church is a world away from what is just outside the doors. Regardless of religion, you must visit St. Patrick's Cathedral while in Manhattan.

What a church. Although its being renovated it was a sight to behold on the outside and in. While passing and stopping in weddings were going on, so lovely.And the visitors just never stop, busy but not packed. Go see this historic place.

The most magnificent of all Roman Catholic Churches in NY. If you happen to be a Catholic, the "presence" of the religion is felt as you approach the structure itself. It seems like it was dropped down into NYC from Rome. If you are not a Catholic, the architecture will impress you, The crowds are allowed in almost always, so masses can be noisy...
Awe and reverance. See this magniicant church whether you are christian or not. If you are in town on a Sunday try catching mass there as it is not only a city attraction but at its heart a church.

Spanish Mass. We arrived right in time for mass. Yes it was in Spanish but any good catholic knows you can pick up the misslette and follow along by reading it in English. I would not dear take photos during mass. I was really just honored to be here for mass after living in NYC over 30 years and walking by this functioning landmark.One note there is a lot of construction going on and the church is barrier-ed by scaffolding. What an eye saw. I am sure this is only to restore the building to its original grandeur.
trully beauty. allthough was remodeling, this church is a gem in the middle of manhathan. Very nice visit. A must see !!!!!!!

Intricate detail inside this gorgeous cathedral.. The cathedral is much larger than it appears outside (which was covered in scaffolding). Make sure to go to the alter at the front of the church where it is gorgeous. Photography is permitted everywhere except up front, where a security guard ensures people comply with the written rule banning the taking of pictures.
A must for visiting NYC. St Patrick's Church one of the main churches of NYC. It is nice to go during a service or during the holidays.

Gorgeous!. This cathedral is Gorgeous!! There is some construction and renovations being made outside, but there wasnt any additional noise or interuptions should one want to attend mass here. The security team is in the church making sure that everything is respected fully, which it should be. There is also a gift shop in the cathedral that is convenient for those who can not travel and would like a souvenier from this cathedral.

Gorgeous. I recommend taking a few minutes and just at the very least popping you head in to take a look at this magnificent cathedral. I stop everytime I am in NYC - which I always find myself right by it anyways so why not?? It's is just stunningly beautiful........its under restoration so the exterior always seems to have portions covered up by scaffolding which is a shame because its so gorgeous but understandably so.

Truely a Holy Place. Every place inside you look proves that this a holy, special place. My wife and I went for Mass and were in awe when we walked around inside after Mass. Dedicated altars were everywhere you looked and the Chapel to Our Lady of Guadelupe was spectacular.

One of the most beautiful places in Ny. The outside is so majestic, it made us wanna go and look what else is hiding inside - and we discovered beautiful interior with stained glass windows, glamorous altar... be sure to visit!

Wonderful, but crowded. Being a native New Yorker, I've been coming here since I was a child, and sometimes take it for granted. It is amazing. One of Renwick's best. Try to visit on a weekday morning, before the stores are open and tourists are out and about.
World Class. this place is absolutely stunning situated in the heart of the busiest city in the world it is the most stunning place definetly worth a visit

Awesome. The outside is completely covered in scaffolding but it didn't take away from the experience inside the church. Even though there were quite a lot of visitors walking the inside perimeter of the church it was very quiet and peaceful and so beautiful. The history and awesome architecture is breathtaking.
Probably one of the best churches in the city. This is one of the best churches in the city and close to everything so a great place to visit. Easy to get into and a great sight inside.
always a part of our annual Christmas visit to nyc. you mingle with hundreds of other visitors to light candles and spend some reflective time in one of the worlds most beautiful cathedrals

Peaceful atmosphere, stunning architecture. The cathedral is beautiful, with a blue stained glass in the upper windows that I hadn't seen in many cathedrals before. The exterior is currently (summer 2012) undergoing restoration work, but access is still maintained to the interior. As a tourist in New York it was fantastic to find a place so peaceful in the middle of such a busy city, also to shelter from the heat! Definitely worth a look, a wonderful place for anyone to pray and take some time out.
Ornate and gorgeous. Loved all the carving detail, the stained glass was beyond amazing and the general feel of the cathedral was quite uplifting. Well worth the walk.
Classic NY. There are bigger, more beatiful cathedrals but not may as famous as this one in the heart of midtown. Its worth a visit. Stop off and then go th Saks!

Under renovation. Though the exterior is under renovation the interior is open to the public. When Bishop John Hughes inaugurated the construction of the cathedral, he wanted an edifice that could show the people of America the power and glory of the Catholic Church. Though he didn't live to see its completion, it certainly fulfills his purpose. It is a classic gothic construction with all of the grace and formality that entails.
Amazing Cathedral. The architecture of this grand cathedral is a once in a lifetime view. Sit down and just relax in the middle of a busy day. One of the few quiet places in midtown.

Beautiful!!. This Cathedral is huge,beautiful and free. Great location in the middle of manhattan and of course accross the street has rockerfeller center. Inside is serene with daily visitor and mass. the window are colorful and beautiful...

Take a moment to renew yourself at St. Patrick's. An oasis in the middle of New York City. Currently under major renovation but services and self-guided tours continue nonetheless. The architecture and history, along with a sense of serenity, make it a must see in midtown Manhattan.

Magnificent Cathedral and a Glimpse into the American Soul. We visited on a Saturday afternoon when a wedding took place. St. Patrick's is such a beautiful Cathedral that when the organ began with wonderful music filling the air, I was so moved that it surprised me. As a Catholic of Irish extraction, I could not visit New York without visiting here. This is a place of worship and pilgrimage for me, not a tourist destination, so I am surprised at the tone of some of the reviews in here. The vast majority of visitors treated their time here with reverence, although I was disappointed at the number of men who did not remove their headgear. The artifacts adorning the cathedral were works of art in themselves, whilst all being holy items.We also went to mass on the Sunday. Being Memorial Weekend, mass was said by the Cardinal and 5 priests with at least two from the visiting Fleet. Readings were by a Naval Officer and a Marine Officer and the enlisted men attending filled several rows. We sang "America the Beautiful" as the recessional hymn. This rounded off our visit to this magnificent country, with its friendly, beautifully mannered people. This moving service gave us a glimpse into the American soul and we gained some understanding of why they are the leading nation in the world. (And I am not particularly a fan of the USA, at least prior to this visit!)

So Beautiful. The Cathedral is currently undergoing interior and exterior renovations, but its opulence and beauty continues to inspire. The architecture is so awe inspiring. The mere size of this building takes an entire block. Just beautiful.
Absolutely Stunning!. This cathedral was breathtaking! You can see the enormity of it as you walk in. Definitely visit this place if you can. It's just beautiful.

St. Patrick's Cathederal. St. Patrick's Cathedral is an incredible church that everyone should visit just to see....no matter what your religion.I took my 8 year old and he really enjoyed it. We lit candles ($2.00 fee per candle), and said some prayers.

Nothing to write home about. For many believers this is clearly an important building. However, simply as a place to see it has little to recommend itself. Big, traditional style, nothing inspirational. Nearby St Bartholomew's is another story altogether and well worth seeing. But that's another story...

Magnificent, but please be respectful.. The magnificence of this Cathedral and its history within it is marred by the rudeness of people not observing the respect of this religion by men wearing hats, kids running onto the alters, people who are apparently not Catholic awkwardly trying to receive Communion, but if you look past all of that, it is DEFINITELY one of the most beautiful Cathedrals in NY.
It's a church!. throngs fill this sacred hall, flashes illuminate the art, and the constant hum of tour guides makes you wishthere were limited hours. Then again, how about food carts?
Wonderful. Couldn't go to New York and not visit St. Patrick's Cathedral. Such a lovely Church, the stained glass is fantastic! Really worth visiting.

Thank you for sharing your church with us. What a beautiful church! It must be difficult for regular attenders to go spontaneously and have quiet time with God and pray with a constant flow of people coming through the doors. So please know that we appreciate you sharing it with us. Blessings!
ethereal. ethereal, architectural masterpiece, still a spiritual place despite the tourist attraction elemant. no restrooms available
enjoyed noon Mass. I wanted to look inside and walked into the noon Mass just beginning. What a special place to be a Catholic. It's majestic, serene, beautiful and spiritual.
beautiful. so beautiful and peaceful,its magical you can't belive your in the middle of manhattan, bring your camera
for catholics or not. I love gothic architecture. Statues are beautifulll, the sun coming like drops of rainbow through the windows an if you are lucky you may heat the choir and the organ

Nice break from the city. It's a beautiful cathedral. A quite place to take a break in the middle of all the rush in NYC. Take a few minutes while you walk on 5th Ave and give yourself a moment of peace by going to St. Patrick's.
Go in the morning. Come here early in the morning, enjoy the silence... admire the architecture... They walk around the are... You can also come during the afternoon mass...

A Haven of Peace & Quiet. We are Catholic so it felt like home but you do not have to be Catholic to feel the peace. The side altars are interesting and engage one's interest like Our Lady of Czestachowa: it's survival story as an icon is amazing and this image of Mary bespeaks many emotions. A must see in NY.
The BEST!!!. When ever I'm in New York City, I always stop here and say a few prayers. You don't even have to spend a while here to appreciate how beautiful it is!! The stained glass is the best!!!
St. Patrick's. My first visit to this church. The architecture is impressive, the side altars are something to behold, as are the stained glass windows.
Always an awesome place. Whether you are Catholic or not, this is well worth a visit. Hopefully, the renovations will be finished the next time we visit.
Beautiful.................. Was under construction while we were there, but still a beautiful place to visit. A must whilst in New York.
Peaceful and beautiful. A calm and quiet spot in a busy, bustling city. Beautiful architecture, statues and stained glass. Massive in size and scale, worth stopping by to see.

A must see!. Went to mass on Sunday morning at 10:15. We got there early which was a good choice because the church fills up very quickly. Cardinal Dolan was present at the mass and it was great mass, and the Our father was said in Latin. It was a distraction from the blessed sacrament because the dumb tourists would not put their cameras away and focus on what really matter in life, Our Salvation! Will be back next visit to the Big Apple!

Weekend Getaway. Prayer is always needed and I was able to visit a wonderous church such as St. Patrick's Cathedral. Even with the construction going on, there were a lot of prayers going up to be granted. What an experience.
Still a must see. However it is covered in scaffolding. Really cannot see the beauty outside. Inside is still beautiful.

Absolutely Beautiful. It is one of the most beautiful churches around. You can enter through the side doors to avoid some of the crowds. It is a unique place, as it a house of worship, with people praying and an occasional wedding, but it is also a busy tourist spot (free to enter). Currently under construction, it is still worth seeing the architecture and stained glass. Whenever I am in the area, I make it a point to stop by to light a candle and have a moment to contemplate.

An architectural must see. In spite of the construction that is going on, you have to look in awe at the grandeur and design of this beautiful cathedral. We were limited in our tour due to a lovely wedding taking place. If we had more time we would have returned later.
Beautiful!. Stunning cathedral! Felt very spiritual as I said my prayers

Majestic, Historic, Sacred, and... so New York!. This view (thumbnail I'm seeing as I write this; front of the Cathedral) , and where you're looking at the front, is from 5th Avenue. Just being here is a tourist destination in itself. Opposite the cathedral is Rockefeller Center, with its mall, statue of Atlas, skating pond, and NBC studios. Not to mention miles of elegant (and not inexpensive) shoppes and impressive store windows. And mobs of people, especially at Holiday/tourism times.The inside is amazingly beautiful, as is/would be the outside too. I mention this because at present (July 2012) the front is being repaired and is covered by scaffolding. Just saying, in case getting a photo of the front is a major goal. (On the steps in front of the door is a lovely photo).Inside - and I'm sure you can find photos - it's very much like some other elegant traditional churches of Europe - and it is open to the public most of the time. When I walked in with a friend (out for a walk-about Manhattan) we found ourselves observing an actual wedding. Awesome.Candles, incense, etc., all behind the back of the pews (front of the church) with various educational pamphlets and signs, plus (of course) a collection place. No entry fee to just poke your head in and see it. And as I've said, it's right in the midst of 5th Avenue/Midtown Manhattan, close to "everything", from music halls (e.g., Carnegie Hall) to designer clothing/jewelry (e.g.,Tiffany's) to a flagship Apple Store, to the Plaza Hotel, Central Park, etc., etc. Depending on your love of walking....

The most beautiful church I have ever seen. What else can I say? This is a must see for anyone visiting New York City, religious or not. A piece of trivia, this church is featured in Godfather when Corleone performs the baptism and literally becomes a Godfather.
Stunning!. Easy Access. Enjoyed architecture, serenity. Nice artwork.

A must see in Manhattan!. This is a beautiful cathedral, not large, across from Rockefeller Center, set among huge buildings and the busyness of NYC. It is an important Catholic Center, where the Archbishop is pastor, and it is very beautiful. The stained glass windows, the many altars with statues, and the main altar are all wonderful. There is also a gift shop in the church. An important landmark in NYC!
Irish Pride. This is a must visit on any trip to midtown for out of town guests. You dont need to be Irish or Catholic to appreciate....lol

The Grandeur of St Patricks. Interior is amazing in its detail. Went for mass and was more than impressed by the end of it. TVs all around the chapel and the place was packed with parishioners. Had a video going the whole time, got some great footage. Not far from 30 Rock

STUNNING. I've visited St. Patrick's Cathedral many times. Always a great place to go for a quiet moment in the busy city. If you are lucky, like I was last time, you may catch a couple getting married while you are there. Beautiful stained glass, and carvings throughout the church - and can be appreciated by both religious and non-religious people.

This place is huge!. Extremely busy esp.surprised cause it was a weekday. I assume that it is in the Gothic architecture. I forgot where I was and kept my camcorder on inside! Sorry about that! I didn' t mean any disrespect just being a tourist and taking pictures of everything!
Beautiful Place. It's old but beautiful. It's peaceful you can go there and meditate Often you can people watch you'll be surprise who goes there - many celebrities

Breathtaking. From the architecture with soaring arched ceilings and delicate frescoes, to the stunning stained glass and carvings, this was a beautiful but quick stop for our group. It would be a lovely place to take a bit more time, sit down and just breathe. After the hustle and bustle of the streets outside, the cathedral provides a beautiful respite for the soul.

much is under cover for several years now for rennovations, but.... it is such a gorgeous facility; nothing of reconstruction can take away the thrill of this awesome cathedral! Music concerts often; a nice gift shop. Right on Fifth Avenue. Don't miss it

Spiritual experience. I go there when I am in NYC. It's a great place to pray but can be overcrowded and noisy.
I do love an organ music so it is great to attend a Holy Mass on Sunday.
the best church around. this must be one of the best churches in the area once you visit it you will never forget
Sunday Mass. went to mass there on Sunday morning - packed with respectful worshippers - a moving spiritual experience

Absolutely Beautiful!. Words cannot describe the beauty and majesty of this church. It's absolutely breathtaking and the thought of what went into the construction and design is mind-boggling. Plan to spend extra time here to really examine the architecture and religious sculptures. I'm going back again on this trip - I just have to.
Really only average. The interior of St. Pat's is very plain.It is huge, but there are many more beautiful cathedrals in the world.
Magnificent!. I never get tired of going past or inside St. Patrick's. I only wish I lived nearby just so I could attend Sunday service there! All NY tourists must see this beautiful cathedral!
Beautiful!. We didn't get to see much of the outside because they were doing work to it, but the inside is amazing. A must see. Free to the public.

AWESOME. Very special place in the middle of all the highrises in Manhattan.
A must see for anyone. Went to 5:30 Saturday nite mass.
Spectacular. This is not the Empire State Building or Met. Yes, it has some stunning architecture and art work, but most of all it is an historic place of worship. If you visit, go with that in mind.

Reverent views. This magnificent cathedral takes your breath away when you walk inside. At the altar, go right to see the Pieta and around to find the communion chapel at the rear. Whether you are Christian or not, the giant stained glass windows and sweeping architecture are worth the visit.
Incredible Bulding!. The Church is spectacular, they are working on restauration, but still you can see the beatiful and the art of this incredible Church.
It's free... and it's gorgeous!. After walking around Rockefeller Center or window shopping at Sacs, this is a great place to sit down for a while. And it's free!
beautiful. even with parts of the cathedral under construction, it is still beautiful
Beautiful architecture. This is an extremely beautiful church inside and out.

So Beautiful. Very beautiful cathedral, with stained glass and outstanding architectural detail. It was near Christmas when we were there and they had a huge nativity scene up front. It was awesome to be there.
Humbling. The cathedral is amazing. The outside is going under a 177 million dollar renovation. So it is covered with scaffolding. But the inside is breath taking.
Amazing. Historic - beautiful and certainly a must see. Yes it is free.

Absolutely Gorgeous!. This cathedral is amazingly beautiful! I was overwhelmed walking into it and I am not that religious. It is just gorgeous and you can feel the spirituality of this cathedral even though it is busy and there are many people. There is a lot of construction in the area but I do not think this deters from the beauty of this church. I wish I could pray here every week!

Very Beautiful!. This church is very nice and beautiful. This is one of the best chruches I ever went too. When my family and I go we always put a candle for our loves and you can feel emotions and also spirts there. The store in the church is very nice and its reasonable the prices and they have neckleces and rosary beads and have crossess I love God

For those who are religious it is the place to go. It is right on Fifth Ave. and it is where all the big religious events take place so many times. It is a beautiful building and for Christians it is a must see place.

Magnificent!. One of the most beautiful and incredible Catholic Churches in the U.S. Went for Sunday Mass and got the added bonus of having Cardinal Dolan as our celebrant. What a great Sunday!
Admittedly there's a lot of construction going on...but easy to ignore it.
on any visit a great treat. beautiful, solemn, spiritual....an amazing experience

St. Paddy's. The edifice is magnificent, walking through the various chapels is
so inviting, and the history of the place cannot be ignored.
moving. we came upon st. pauls by accident and have to say we were so glad we did. very emotional place and u get the feel of the sadness of 9/11
Just as I remembered. Went as a young child and felt that I was speaking to God. Felt the same awe many years later. It is crowded but still a beautiful and holy place
Photos don't do it justice!. Simply amazing. To sit in those pews and take in the humbling surroundings of St. Pat's...there just aren't words.

A welcome break from shopping. When I visit New York with my grandchildren, a prayerful stop in St. Patrick's is a must. We light a candle and give thanks for being able to visit this exciting city; and we remember our family at home.
One of the great cathedrals. Beautiful interior, windows and the exterior is also beautiful. A very important religious house of God for worship.
Divine. I went there around the holiday season with my wife for the first time and I was in awe I could not believe the surroundings.
Beautiful Architecture!. This was the most beautiful and awe inspiring display of architecture we saw during our trip. Please take time to visit the Cathedral. You will not be disappointed!
Beautiful church. So much history and the stained glass windows are great for photo taking!
Attended Mass. Amazing detail everywhere you look. We could have spent hours walking through it.

A Beautiful and Busy Place. This is a LIVING--busy cathedral, full of those "just looking" and those worshipping. It is NOT a quiet spot! :-) Currently with construction/repair noises too, but it is still worth seeing for the architecture and stained glass. Tours available, but I didn't not have time, so can't comment on them.

Visiting St Patricks Cathedral. It was a Sunday. A service was going on but they allowed tourists in to walk around the back of the church in a roped off area. Seemed a little strang but I guess they're used to it. Believe it or not there is a gift shop in the back of the church! Regardless,it's beautiful and worth a stop if you are out on a walking tour of the sites.

Beautiful Church. This beautiful church is located among some of the biggest named fashion on 5th Ave. We always step away from the hustle and bustle for a few moments to bask in the serenity and scenery of this gorgeous sanctuary. Great photo op.

Another Must Do!. Visit this special place and you will feel the love. I do every time I go. Don't miss it during the Christmas holidays. Amazing Cathedral but it's always under construction but don't let that stop you.
I love St. Patrick. We visited the cathedral and marveled at the beautiful design while honoring the house of the Lord. Such a serene place in the midst of NYC.

Remarkable. This was an incredible cathedral... I have seen the churches in Rome, Venice, and Florence, and this one had the power to take my breath away. It could be that the churches of Italy are so heavily traveled and toured that they cannot retain their holiness despite their grandeur and hundreds of years of history. When we walked up the aisle underneath the center dome it was almost as if you could hear the angels singing.... the architecture and height are breathtaking, and the staff and security very strictly enforce the quiet policy. Not that it seemed to be an issue, because almost every soul that walked through the doors was silenced and awestruck by the majesty of St. Patrick's. It would be a dream to get married within the walls of this epic cathedral. Don't miss it on your walk up 5th Avenue.

Beautiful St Pat's. Had the opportunity to go to Mass on Palm Sunday at St Patrick's. Everything about it is beautiful - and it's at the very heart of New York City. I was also amazed by the diversity of Mass goes, coming from Indiana - it opened my eyes. Can't wait to visit again one day!

Beautiful Cathedral. This is stunning on the outside but truly amazing inside. It's hard to believe you are in the heart of New York, on Fifth Avenue, as it's so quiet, calm and peaceful inside. Twice I have been inside and twice Mass has been in progress so didn't feel able to take photos. A must see for anyone, religious or not. Absolutely beautiful building.

Stunning!. Unbelievably beautiful. I am not a Catholic but loved the time I spent in St Patrick's. Sit in the pews for awhile and just take it all in: the stained glass, the stone and wood, the architecture, the people around you. I enjoyed sitting in quiet meditation and even lit a candle (for a donation of a few dollars) and said a prayer for someone special. Spend 1/2 hour or so unless you want to take in a mass. I went alone; families would be okay too but just ensure your children remain with you, quiet, and respectful. Don't forget to walk back around the altar for a pieta and more.
Beautiful. A beautiful old church. I can't imagine what it costs to keep that church in that fine of shape. Absolutely stunning.
Beautiful Cathedral. I stop in everytime we are in the area. It is a very special place. Time to say a prayer at the many statues is a must.

Outstanding. It is hard to comprehend how this building was built to a fine intricate detail when the workers would have had limited resources. An amazing testament to the hardworking people of new york.

LA Gem in Midtown. EVen a quick visit to this cathedral while it is being spruced up a bit on the outside is a grand experience. My son and I popped in for a quick visit and we were not disappointed. The cathedral is replete with great works of art and religious iconography. The pieta (located beyond the altar) is truly worth a visit.

God Is Love. Loved this place, actually came across it by accident and inside is amazing, the best cathedral I have seen. When I had just about finished they were actually darting a mass and I wish I had of been able to go back to take part in a mass before leaving.
Gorgeous!!!. Every single time I go to New York, I want to walk into St. Patrick's Cathedral. The architecture is absolutely stunning. It's worth walking through, even if you aren't Catholic.
Also give it a look from above!. Take a trip up to the Top of the Rock and you'll get an interesting architectural surprise when you look down on St. Pat's.
Gorgeous!. St. Patrick's Cathedral is gorgeous and well worth a visit. It is a nice place to go and reflect and to take a minute away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Huge. This cathedral is huge. It is currently having exterior work done but it is still a comfortating place to come and say a prayer.
glad i saw it. It is beautiful. I hope to attend a mass there on my next trip to New York. Check it out even if you're not Catholic.
St. Patrick's Cathedral. There's a lot of people entering and its like bumper to bumper people. The inside was beautiful but just went to the door to many people.
Beautiful and Timeless. The service was beautiful and the architecture was amazing. A must-see in NYC.
A landmark. We were lucky to see a graduation. A must see landmark. I was so glad I went on the Grayline Comphrensive tour to go back to the spots we found interesting.
Beautiful Cathedral. We had a quick look round while walking down 5th Ave. Beautiful architecture.

A calm island. A calm island in the super-busy and crowded streets of NY with really beautiful statues and glasses, and its not like a museum: the artefacts have not been removed or displaced for the sake of visitors, everything is in its original place/environment and together form a magnificent atmosphere, definitly recommended

Stately and Serene. We took 15 minutes early one morning to rush through this Cathedral before catching up with our tour group. I wanted to visit this church because I had heard Regis Philbin refer to it quite often when he hosted his talk show. The church is undergoing cleaning. However, I still got a good picture of its twin towers soaring into the sky. The quiet interior of this church gave me a comforting feeling with its dark woods, many beautifully stained glass windows and floral arrangements at the entrance and the altar. As I passed by the Stations of the Cross and the many niches with carved statuary devoted to the saints, I did not have time on this short visit to read the information about each saint. Flash photography is allowed inside. The church, opening early and closing late, has a helpful website for planning a visit and to be a part of the services.

Beautiful Respite During NYC Visit. As you go from attraction to attraction in New York City, slip into St. Patrick's Cathedral. It is near Rockefeller Center, so it's an doable walk from Times Square and the Broadway Theatre. The cathedral is beautiful. Pause a moment, pray for a friend, or a loved one, for peace, or for what have you. A moment of reflection will boost your spirit and recharge your batteries for more NYC fun. Worth a moment.
Beautiful Cathedral. Well worth a visit if you are in the neighborhood! Truely beautiful!

Interesting and relevant sermon, grand organ!. The leaders of this internationally respected church knows its audience and the speaker respects it, attended on Memorial day, a wonderful acknowledgment and participation in the service by our military personnel. I have attended when in NY, and always a child when the organ plays the notes that vibrate the building. A religious experience of trandition.
Magnificent. Very beautiful Cathedral, I was very impressed the homeless where not turned away, we saw one poor soul sleeping on a pew.

Gorgeous!. Only got to see the outside as we were in a hurry, but it is beautiful. I can only imagine the inside. Will catch it on the next trip. It's right by Rockafeller, so it's an easy stop if you're in the neighborhood.
St Patrick's cathedral. Stained glass windows,side alters, main alter, try and arrive at Mass Time . All welcome

Beautiful!. The cathedral is beautiful on the outside and on the inside. What is so nice is that while it is big, it is not as distracting as other cathedrals where you forget that you are in a house of God. A nice, decent place to worship.
Beautiful church. There are 30-minute Masses and the architecture is beautiful.

Awe Inspiring. Gothic and lovely. The facade is truly gorgeous and inside is beautiful. I never miss a visit when I'm in NYC. Be sure to go to Our Lady's Chapel in the rear to have a few minutes of peaceful solitude. All the previous NY Cardinals along with Archbishop Fulton Sheen, Cardianl Cooke and Pierre Troissante (sp?) ( all being reviewed for sainthood) are buried in the crypt behind the altar. Lovely!

Beautiful - right by Rockefeller Center. When you visit Rockefeller center make sure to stop by here. It is the largest cathedral in America and admission is FREE. It would be a great place to sit for a bit and get out of the heat. If you are able to attend mass, try to go at a time when music is part of the service.

Must go.. . Another that we spent too much time at. Our trip was a 3 night trip. This is one of MANY churches in Manhattan.. It's gorgeous and huge. We spent over 2 hours here. This is one that you get in, bless yourself look at the majestic columns and art work and move on. You should be be to admire in about 45mins if you're on a time budget..

Take some time out in St. Patricks. Got Sunday morning mass in St Patricks. Great experience, very interesting sermon which appealed to the packed cathedral, locals and visitors catholic an dnon catholic alike. worth a visit.

glorious and beautiful. a large and beautiful cathedral that was a delight to visit and observe all the history and religious traiditional activity. we even participated in a strangers wedding that occured while there. this is one of the most beautiful cathedrals in America.

BREATHTAKING. Absolutely worth the trip to see. It is evident why so many choose to marry in the Cathedral and why so many thousands attend to see each year. Signed the register, made my $2 contribution, lit a candle and thanked God for health and family.
The lucky church. It's a nice church you can enter admire and pray a little. No flash inside. It's also really easy to access since it's in the middle of a main street.
Stunningly beautiful. One of the most beautiful Cathedral's I have ever visited. Amazing history to the site.
Landmark on Fifth Avenue. Ever beautiful. Still standing proud and strong. The faithful praying and tourists admiring the architecture.

Stunning Cathedral. I am not a church go-er, I am a young guy who likes colours and patterns - this building was stunning.
Right opposite the Rockafella Centre - why not pop in and take a look...

Truly Amazing. This is the most beautiful cathedral I have ever seen. If you get a chance to walk around the outside after dark it is eerily beautiful. The inside just goes on and on. The details left me awestruck. A must see.
Stopped in during Christmas.. Very crowded & not very clean. Acoustics & architecture was beautiful. A must for out of town visitors, convenient to 5th Ave. area.

Gorgeous Cathedral-Something To See. While vacationing in New York we had the opportunity to visit the cathedral and we were so glad we did. One of the girls in our group is catholic so a couple of us attended mass with her on Sunday morning. This is such a beautiful cathedral and I recommend anyone in the area to visit it.
Wow!. It was on my list of places to visit but found it by accident on our first day. There are no words to describe this beautiful church. Take a few minutes from the craziness outside.

Breathtaking!. If you are Catholic, you must attend a mass at St. Patrick's Cathedral. If not, visit anyway and admire the beautiful architecture, statues and decorations. It will take your breath away.
Lovely Church. St. Patrick's Church is a must see when you visit NYC. It can be very crowded at times. They have been doing renovations so expect scaffolding.
Lovely place. What a beautiful place the only problem I really had was they don't stop people entering when funerals are taking place.
A must see in NY. Beautiful place and while not necessarily completely unique when compared to other similar cathedrals around the word, one cannot visit NY and not see St. Patrick's.
Amazing!. Beautiful church near Rockefeller Center. Even if your not a follower, I recommend to visit this place. The architecture both from the outside to the inside is something to admire and love.

Peace and Quiet in the midst of the city. Duck into this classically beautiful sanctuary for a bit of peace and tranquility. I have been here over and over and always find another little niche, beautiful statue or amazing view in this lovely cathedral.

Peaceful setting in middle of hectic city. The detail on the doors, windows and everything else in St. Patrick's Cathedral is amazing. It's such a different sight in between all of the office high-rises on the surrounding blocks. There was a daily noon Mass going on while I was there and you could still walk around the entire inside of the church. There's a Holy Water dispenser if you want to bring a container to get some. At the very front of the Cathedral past the altar there's an area where no photos are supposed to be taken but plenty of other areas inside where you can take photos. It's a great place to relax and sit down for awhile during a busy day in NYC. Would like to attend a full Mass in there, the size of the cathedral is unbelieveable until you walk in the front doors.
Capacity of 2000 ppl. ENORMOUS cathedral in the middle of huge city. Worth visiting in Sunday at 8/9/10
Easter Vigil. Beautiful candlelight service with Cardinal Dolan.

Amazing and Beautiful. This is a must see on any NYC itinerary. It is simply beautifyul inside and a work of art. No matter what religion you may or may not belong to the church is a magnificent sight to see.
Sunday Service. If you have a chance, go to a Sunday service when there is a Choir - the organ, the choir, the service, the beauty of the Church is awesome....must do if you have the time.

Easter Mass this year was SO Beautiful. We wrote away for tickets to the Easter morning mass with Cardinal Dolan and I must say, compared to years past, this was the most spectacular. I hate to use such a secular term but the music, the service, the choir, the organization everything was so well done. A real BLESSING.
Beautiful. Pop in to admire this church or enjoy a service. The staff were extremely friendly and inviting. Both the interior and exterior of this cathedral are gorgeous. Take the time to stop by!

America's greatest chirch. If you have not visited this Cathedral on a visit to NYC, just do it! It is a magnificent edifice and its history is quite storied. Every person of faith should view the ornate pulpit, the incredible woodwork as well as the gorgeous stained glass panels.
Beautiful. Amzing. Must see. Huge! Don't miss the opportunity to see it.

Must Visit. The Cathedral is huge and it is centrally located. It truly feels holy, they allow you to light candles before different saints and the holy sacrament is exposed in the chapel. I went to mass there and the church changes when the lighting is on, otherwise it looks like the many cathedrals in Europe that are dark.The cathedral is near Rockefeller Center and 5th av.
Very interesting!. Really. A little unexpected in Midtown, across the Fifth Avenue from Rockefeller Center. Enjoy the interior, see it from above, at the Top of the Rock.
Must attend Mass!. Moving experience The cathedral is magnificent and the choir is wonderful.

Nice, but didn't impress like the cathedrals of Europe. I enjoyed my visit here. Was actually able to attend a memorial mass which included some beautiful bagpipe playing. However, in comparison to the cathedrals I have visited throughout Europe, this one left me a little blah and modernized compared to the others.
A great church. This church is situated right in the middle of bustling New york, it is majestic and well worth the stop

I felt like old-time Irish AND catholic.. The history drips off the place. I bought a bookmark in the gift shop to help me remember. There are some renovations going on the past few months, so the facade is obscured a little with scaffolding. But I love walking around and looking at the statutes, etc.

Simply beautiful. We loved it! It was magnificent. Just go see for yourself and you will be touched by its grandeur and beauty.
A small area is restricted to cameras but it didn't make the experience less enjoyable.
Beautiful!. A quiet peaceful place in the middle of the big city. A must-see.

Majestic!. Majestic is my word for St. Patrick's Cathedral! Located right on Madison Avenue in a busy section of town, this gem is worth a stop. The architecture is outstanding...breath-taking, actually, and you'll be in awe of the magnitude of each detail. There are candles to light for a loved one, and an echo-like quietness from the moment this place captures your attention. What a great place to worship our Lord! For His majesty is overwhelming, so is this place. Offer a prayer as you find your place in a pew. This cathedral is a must-see while you are in New York City. A memorable experience to say the least.

One of the most beautiful cathedrals in the world!. Located on the 5th Avenue, surrounded by shops & opposite another tourist attraction - Rockefeller Centre there isn't a better place to come for a quiet prayer or just walk around & admire its architecture. People of all religions visit this breathtaking cathedral as it appeals to everyone.Note for Polish people - there's an icon of Our Lady of Czestochowa there.
Spectacular by US Standards. It is truly gorgeous. But, by Vatican and European standards it is actually small
Beautiful. What a beautiful church inside out!! A most visit if coming to nyc.

Beautiful Church, Beautiful Easter Service. I decided to visit St. Patricks for Easter sunday service along with my family. We attended the 8:00AM service and it was full, but it was still very easy to find a seat and enjoy the service from one of the many television monitors mounted in the church. I was actually surprised at how quickly communion was dispersed given how many people were in the actual service. I'm not sure if this is a norm for service, but they were randomly checking bags in the lobby as you came in, and I did not find any problem with that at all. I thought it was a beautiful chuch and service and I would definitely return.
Breathtaking. Regardless of your religion, St. Patrick's Cathedral is a place of beauty and history. You must walk around the church and view all statues of Saints.

once in a life time experience. i was in New York in 2005 with the Physically Challenged Irish American Youth Team. this was a 2 week once in a life time experience, one of these days we were taking to mass in Saint Patrick's Cathedral. it is such a stunning building,, unfortuently some of the memories are fading.however i will never ever forget been given the opportunity to take up the gifts for communion. this was truly an honor. i have Mr Bill Brodwhick The Jordan Family and the members of the Physically Challenged Irish American Youth Team to thank for this.

A must when in New York. Unfortunately the outside is covered in Scaffolding at present and the inside is not too lavish, but we liked the quietness of the building. The flowers left over from Easter were absolutely stunning. Banks and banks close to the alter.

Beautiful Cathedral. I love showing my daughter the different saints and reading the stories and we always like to light a candle for our loved ones who are already gone. It is just a beautiful church.

Beautiful and worth seeing. I'm not Catholic, but I did want to see the inside of this beautiful church. Wow!! The architecture is just amazing, the stained glass, everything about it is unbelievable. Worth a visit -- even if you aren't there to pray! I loved it.
Beautiful cathedral. Elegant and beautiful. Undergoing renovation right now, wish I could see it without all the scaffolding
Awesome. As city centre cathedrals go this is up th with best architecture.

Breathtaking. This amazing Church is in the middle of Manhattan, and on Sunday, every service is just about packed out. The architecture is phenominal when you look down at it from Top of the Rock, it is even more amazing, A must see.

Attended Easter mass and other services. Magnificent building.. Magnicent Cathedral, great Easter Vigil service with beautiful music and a fantastic sermon from Cardinal Timothy Dolan. Also went for a couple of the daily services and looked around at the many chapels. Clear explanations of the saintslovely place to visit.

The best cathedral in the world vist!. I love this place of worship and it's so big and it's free to enter if you go to NYC see this place frist you will love it.you can light a candle for 2 dollers each and they also have shops and differet things to see and much much more!
lovely church. This is a lovely church, but after seeing so many over the top churches in Europe this one is average
Landmark so have to see. Just like other many Cathedrals. Great Carving and good place. I really like the inside out of the hustle it is so quite. Got to spend some time here
Hat Parade. Every Easter morning you have a great ingenius and comic hat parade starting on 5Th Avenue between 10 am to 2 pm

Just beautiful. I have been to cathedrals all over Europe, and I have to say St. Patrick's Cathedral is totally unexpected. It is every bit as beautiful as its European cousins, with vaulted windows and stained glass and all sorts of other decadence. You would expect it to be in an old area of Spain somewhere, but there it is, right on the corner of 51st and Madison! It's also nice to grab lunch at one of the many sandwich-salad type places around there and eat lunch outside on the steps.
Wonderful place to visit and seek guidance. Fantastic building among a metropolis of concrete. Light a candle for a lost loved one and be thankful for all that is good.
Beautiful. We stopped in the church during Easter Week. Jammed packed with tourist; me included. Found a quiet spot to pray. Beautiful artwork, sculptures, stained glass windows.
beauty. at 5th avenue, so it is a nice way to walk. When you are inside you feel the peace and the silence. IMPERDIBLE
characteristic landmark. u cant miss it...u have seen it in movies,post cards that is worth visiting!
America's finest cathedral. London may have Westminster Abbey, Paris may have Notre Dame and Rome may have St. Peter's . . . But only NY has St. Patricks!
Breathtaking. A must see. The stained glass is amazing, the architecture is amazing, the atmosphere is amazing. I am not Catholic and enjoyed this immensely.

Magnificent. Sit there when walking down Fifth Avenue and just take in the beautiful space.. Or go for a service. The stained glass is big, old, dramatic. The space is special. Its the grand cathedral of New York City in my view.
Wonderful. One of the best things to do in Manhattan is to visti St. Patrick's. I'm Jewish, but I love this place. It's beautiful, gigantic, and peaceful. A special place to visit and contemplate.

Amazing Cathedral on 5th Avenue. Nestled between the high class stores on 5th Avenue lies St Patrick's Cathedral. It's a beautiful building and despite the fcat that it was filled with tourists, it feels very calm and peaceful.

Fifth Avenue's Gem. Beautiful, serene and donut miss The Lady's Chapel in the back.
And if you're in town, don't miss the Easter Parade in front!
A Religious Experience, Christian or not.. One of THE most spectacular cathedrals in NYC, do not miss it, religious or not, the architecture is amazing!

just lovely. Beautiful old cathedral across form 30 Rock. Great Gothic architecture, lots of little alcoves with spectacular art. Going through a restoration, but so far that only impacts the outside.

Always Calming. Whenever I am near St.Patrick's I must go in for a few minutes to admire its beauty and enjoy the calming effect it has upon me. The stained glass windows are some of the most outstandiing to be see locally. I have lighted candles in this cathedral all my life and will continue to do so as long as I am able. There is something so very special about sitting in this holy place and praying. The hustle and bustle of Fifth Avenue is left outside the doors.
Just Beautiful. We hadn't planned on visiting the cathedral but stumbled across it on a walk , so went in.. so glad we did its stunning.

Beautiful Experience. We tried to make St. Patrick's 5:30 pm mass on Palm Sunday but couldn't get there until 8:30 pm. They were just closing up the church when we asked if we can go inside. There were 3 men standing there, ready to lock the doors and we told them we wanted to get our palms. One gentleman handed me his own palms made into a cross - which was so kind of him. One of the other men told us to wait a minute and ran back into the cathedral. He returned with a huge bundle of palms and gave them to us. He said they had an oversupply of them. We were overwhelmed! What a beautiful souvenir for our friends and family!! We found New Yorkers to be very friendly, kind and helpful. This was a perfect example of the hospitality we were shown in NYC. Will never forget that experience.
Beautiful Cathedral. 2nd visit and always light a candle for my Mum, lovely quiet place for reflection
A big church. Ornate.. Beautiful church. On the other hand, it looks like all the other old churches you might go visit. You might be disappointed if you've gone to a lot in Europe.
Beautiful Cathedral. Worth seeing, walk inside sit on a bench and retreat to a quiet place in the middle of the day. Enjoy the stained glass and high ceilings...
Beautiful. great place, worth a visit. beautiful interior. worth a visit if you are passing on 5th avenue.
so beautiful. This beautiful cathedral is in the heart of nyc, a few blocks from central park. It is often criwded but a must see if in nyc.
Respite in the City. The stained glass can rival European houses of worship. It is a lovely, quiet respite on busy Fifth Avenue

A Must-See!. It's architecture is unparalleled, it's free, & you can trade the hustle & bustle of NYC for the tranquility inside. Light a candle and say a prayer for a lived one & explore all there is to see & hear here.
Amazin' grace on Fifth. This cathedral will bring out the spiritual in anyone.
Beautiful!. An absolute must for any NYC visit. The beauty of the church and the peace you feel walking inside cannot be described in words.

Go.... even if it's not Sunday... :-). When we stayed at the Waldorf-Astoria not too long ago, one of my personal goals was to attend Mass at St Patrick's Cathedral. I did. The architecture is phenomenal, atmosphere is memorable, and you know you are in a wonderful building with an amazing history.
It's a tourist destination, of course, but much more as well. Very beautiful.
Beautiful. Religious experience for sure. Beautiful church inside&out close to Rockefeller Plaza. Was a pleasant surprise.
wonderful. i love old buildings and this was a great place to see within walking distance handicapp accesible

Amazing architecture!. We were on our first trip to NY about 2 weeks ago and stumbled upon St. Patrick's Cathedral whilst walking along 5th Ave, its huge! The architecture is very impressive, you can go inside and take photos of the architecture, which we did. Your bag will get checked but this isn't a problem and is the case with most attractions in NY.A must see if you haven't before and it's free. Take your camera.

Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful catholic church, well preserved.It is a gothical style building from the 1800's. It is an american cathedral, very different from the european and mexican cathedrals. It has many altars for catholic saints.

So beautiful. This is such a great historic place in NYC. I love the outside and the inside is breathtaking. I have walked by this place several times, but went in the first time this past Saint Patrick's day. Such history!

A New York must see no matter your religion. I live in New York and only come here when I have visitors. I forget what a lovely building it is and it's amazing to walk in there and actually see a service in progress. You will enjoy this as much as the other sites of Fifth Avenue like Saks and Henri Bendels.

A wonder of NYC. Take a few minutes from shopping to relax and take in this wonderful building.
The beauty of St Pat's is breathtaking!

Took my breathe away!. I have been in many churches but this one is special. As a side note, our house sitter "lost" our 11 year old springer spaniel. He had been missing for 2 days. We walked in St.Patrick's, our house sitter called and said he had been located. How crazy is that?

A beautiful church in the middle of the city. The stained glass windows are just magnificent. The church looks huge from the outside but inside it appears even bigger. Its really nice to see how well it has been looked after.Beautiful example of its time still in use today.
Beautiful. Beautiful inside and out. It's nice that they allow photos in most areas.
Gorgeous church!. Definitely take the time to walk through this beautiful church. The architecture and the stained glass are absolutely beautiful.
St. Patrick's Cathedral. It is just beautiful and mesmerizing. It is such classic beauty and art.
Nice. Quiet, beautiful architecture. Has a small gift shop.
Wonderful architecture. We loved the stonework and the stained glass windows.
An amazing spiritual journey!. This building, the spiritual community, and the history and location are all worth experiencing! What a wonderful, awe-inspiring cathedral!
Peaceful. Beautiful Cathedral, alot bigger on the inside, very interesting.
The queen of American Gothic Cathedrals.. Who could give this church a rating? Its reputation speaks for itself.

Wow. What a Cathedral. It was soo pretty. We stood at the back for awhile while mass was going on. It's so huge, and so gorgeous. There is just so much detail. The outside is great, but you really need to go inside to see how cool it is.

Breathe Taking. Amazing archetecture and almost feels like a time warp as you leave the busy streets of manhattan and enter this place. they silence speaks volumes in such a city. we also went when there was a service on and found it a nice experience.
Magnificent. Great snapshot opportunity! Amazing building within close proximity of Central Park!

So Much Going On In One Place. My Mum and I decided to go in and have a look and was amazed at how calming St Patrick's was and that there was a wedding, a christening and some other celebration going on all at the one time in various parts of the cathedral. A few years prior to that my hubby and I went in and there was a late mass for hispanic people and it was beautiful to listen to them singing. Always visit St Patrick's when I hit NYS even though I'm not religous
heartstopping. magnificent cathedral that now is home to a Cardinal...even though the crappy Empire State Building refused to honor him with lights
indescribable. This is a must see. The cathedral is so beautiful and you feel such peace in there. It's just beautiful. I believe it's the biggest cathedral in the country.
Great to see if one isn't religious.. Love to take visitors here as it is such a beautiful space and filled with majesty
Amazing!. We saw this on ash Wednesday so it was very very busy but an amazing experience! The inside is beautiful and the architecture is amazing
It's magnificent. Everything you want in a big cathedral and right next to Saks Fifth Avenue!

Beautiful, moving, and free. This is a great stop when in the Rockefeller Center area. Entrance to the Cathedral is free, and the organ is often being played during the day. There are occasionally concerts by visiting choirs, and they are listed on the church's website.Visitors can walk all the way around from the back of the nave to the smaller chapels behind the choir and altar area. Our student group sat in the pews during a long rain storm and drew pictures of the stained glass windows. A wonderful oasis in the sometimes deafening center of Midtown Manhattan!

Wow!. We happened to be walking up to Central Park when we came across this amazing church! Very reminiscent of old European churches. This church is huge and very ornately decorated inside and out! A great place to go in and have a look around, and its free to do so! Although they do ask for a $3.00 donation, still cheap!

"Spires of Inspiration". Regardless of one's religious preference--or none--, stepping inside this Fifth Avenue landmark--particularly on a sunny day--is sure to stop a visitor in his/her tracks. Altar flowers at Christmas and Easter are magnificent. Looking at the magnificent organ in the loft over the great west doors is a must before leaving--something that some visitors have forgotten to do, so enrapt were they by what they saw on the main floor.

scaffolding currently around it, but the inside will keep you in awe. Beautiful inside and out. Currently outside renovations have scaffolding around the outside. A great cathedral to visit to learn about your faith.

Peace and Beauty resides here !. This is a beautiful cathedral that takes you to a different day and age. The minute you step into this church, you are transformed to a world so much quieter, sane and peacuful from the super busy 5th avenue. The design and architecture is commendable. It may not be Roman, but no less either. It is beautiful in its own right. It is huge, yet never noisy. People/tourists are always walking inside, taking pictures and admiring the sculptures and the statues. There is a statue of Mary and Christ behind the main altar(in the center) which is larger than life and my favorite. Everyone finds something here and leaves with an unexplained sense of peace. You don't even have to be religious, you just have to be here. If you are in Newyork city visiting, this is definitely a must see. This is also a popular background spot on tv series and movies. Visit during Chritsmas, even better. You can add the icing of the famous NY christmas tree just across the street at yet another famous NY site - The Rockefeller center. Hope you enjoy your visit.
Lovely. I visit St Pat's everytime we are in Manhattan. It's just so lovely. If you can attend mass, do so.. it's a true experience.
Breathtaking.. This is one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever been in. Even if you are not the worshipping type, it is worth stopping in.
an oasis of calm. although when we visited st. patricks cathedral it was very busy,somehow i felt as though i was the only one there..Beautiful building where you can sit and be at one with yourself
beautiful church. I am not a church type, but this is one is beautiful. There's a gift shop on the corner and a place to light a candle
amazing catholic church. beautiful church with a lot of history. a must stop for those who will appreicate the experience. if you can take in a mass - it is even better
Beautiful church. Just like a lot of European churches. A nice haven on a busy street

A gem. I probably spent more time outside the Cathedral than inside as I took photographs from every side. The architecture was what I loved the most but no disappointment when you go inside - it's beautiful. St Pat's is a gem.
Majestic!. My favorite church in the United States. On 5th Ave & 50th St.
Must See. beautiful chuch - so much history. would love to attend Christmas Mass there some day.

A must stop on 5th Avenue - beautiful. Whilst shopping on 5th Avenue we went to St Patrick's, its beautiful inside, there was a mass taking place whilst we visited but you could still look round, take photos and light a candle.
Spectacular. Big, old, beautiful. This is still a house of worship and if you want you can show up not as a tourist, but as a participant.
Beautiful. So peaceful. It is easy to forget you are in the middle of the city.

AWE INSPIRING. HUMBLING... a Majestic blend of Prayers, Praise, and the Personification of the Almighty. The Perfect Place to get in touch with your INNER YOU, with a delightful history all wrap in One.
My favorite church in NYC. We always stop in at this church. A lovely way to rest and reflect. Great architecture, cool, calm, and I never miss a chance to go in for a visit.
Beautiful. Although it was undergoing renovations, St. Pat's was just beautiful. The architecture, the stained glass work was just gorgeous. A definite must-see if in NYC
beautiful, must see. beautiful cathedral, a must-see. while you're there, stop by st. paul's on the next street

Stunning Beauty. The church is beautiful beyond words. I felt it was too much of a tourist attraction to be really peaceful and the fact that they had requested donation amounts on absolutely everything in there was a turnoff for me. Folks tend to give more when you allow them to, rather than force them to. I felt like I was paying for a blessing.

It's a cathedral...seen one, seen 'em all.. Disclaimer: I'm not a fan of cathedrals, churches, etc.I suppose if you're Catholic, it would mean something, but to me it's just another cathedral: big, high ceilings, fancy, etc. nothing to write home about.

A special place but enough with the scaffolding already!. Always hard to get a great photo of St Patrick's because it seems to have endless scaffolding around it. It is very nice inside and quite inviting for a large space. Doesn't have that cold feel that many cathedrals have. Each time we have gone in for either a mass or to just have a look (with visitors coming to town) it's always been a lovely respite and calming place amidst the chaos of the City.
Beautiful. This is such a beautiful building, the history, the architechure ... a must see
Love this beautiful church in the heart of Rock Center. A nice quiet place to go .. just watch your purse!
