Sunday Mass. During a recent trip to NYC my husband and I attended 9am Sunday Mass at St. Patrick's Cathedral. The inside of the cathedral was breathtaking. Visiting this place was truly a blessing.
Many more beautiful churches to see.. Cold and noisy . Very '"unmoving" despite the historical provenance of the church.Too many people standing around outside smoking.
An oasis in the bustle and glitz. Leave bethe city behind the doors and find peace and spirituality in this beautiful and vast place of worship

Overwhelming ...... There is so much wonderful architecture in NY....Chrysler Building, The Flat Iron and Woolworth to mention only a few. But, in my humble opinion, you must add to that list St Patrick's. The vastness of the interior is overwhelming. And inspiring....no matter your religious preference, you knew you were in a Holy place.

God's Manhattan Showroom. Lovely Catholic cathedral, a "must" on any midtown Manhattan tour (it's across the street from Rockefeller Center). But for an even better experience, visit the equally impressive Cathedral of St. John the Divine (110th Street near Columbia University) and compare the two. Both are majestic to behold. St. Patrick's is finished. St. John's is not, but even in its incomplete condition it's still the 4th largest cathedral in the world. I call the two churches God's Manhattan showrooms -- big time religion on display.
Simply Beautiful!!. I never got a chance to attend a service but the outside alone is just one of those things you have to see before you die!
Beautiful. The Cathedral is just peaceful and beautiful, but if you are from Europe and have a short time in NY skip it, you have better cathedrals at home.

Breathtaking. a magnificent Gothic structure in the middle of modern skyscrapers the Cathedral if a beautiful edifice which is definitely on the "to do" list of any visitor to NYC. The architecture is magnificent and in stark contrast to the sleek and spartan buildings surrounding it on all sides. Inside is beautiful and worth a leisurely walk around to get a true appreciation of this piece of Neo-Gothic design...Just remember it is a place of worship and services continue to take place. There is also a mandatory bag search on entrace.

cinderblock monstrosity. I don't want to dis anyone's religion, but St. Pat's is one of the ugliest cathedrals in the world. The Lady Chapel is the only part that is pleasing aesthetically. Also, the ushers here are overbearing and obnoxious. Between services, they race around shushing folks who are talking about the architecture and art.Speaking of services, listening to the current Archbishop (soon to be Cardinal) preach is not as excruciating as listening to the oratorially challenged Cardinal Egan, but inspiring it isn't. If this Cathedral were not so centrally located. I doubt many people would knock themselves out to visit.

Grand and gentle. A beautiful cathedral in the centre of all the bustle of a city high street. Great for a few moments of calm. Sit on a chair and just take a moment as you look up at the amazing architecture.

A slice of history among the stores. Whilst shopping on 5th Avenue make sure you pop in St Patrick's, its beautiful inside, there was a wedding taking place whilst we visited but you could still look round
Beautiful, especially at Christmas. Worth a visit - even if you are not Catholic. Architecture is lovely and it is so close to the Christmas Tree at the skating rink in the Plaza.
Lovely church!. This is a marvelous, historic church that never loses it's impressive awe, no matter how many times you see it.

Take a 'spritual' break on your NYC visit. A simply beautiful cathedral, with handsome stonework and fine art inside. If you attend Mass on Sunday, go to the 10:15 am service, which is usually has the Archbishop as the celebrant and is televised - great choral music is assured!

A must see in NYC. If you have a few extra minutes just to walk in and see the inside of the Cathedral please do so..You will be glad you did. Oh yea and it's free so how in the world could you go wrong.

Just exquisite. Across the street frm Saks and Rockerfeller Center.
It is a must see.
Go in and light a candle.

Big surprise!. On a busiest avenue, squized between fancy boutiques of D&G, Bulgari and others there is a place somehow out of place. Beautiful interior, lots od gold and blue, you might feel already half in heaven. The magic thing is that the door closes behind you and you are surrounded by silence. Hard to believe you are still on the 5th Ave. Unfirgotten time ven if you pop in.
Refuge. Saint Patrick's Cathedral was open and beautiful. It is an active church community and so there are religious services going on there as well as a work of art.

In the city that never sleeps, everyone needs a place to pray.. Their motto: In the City that never sleeps, everyone needs a place to pray. I’ve visited St Patrick’s several times while in Manhattan, but never had the chance to attend mass until Sunday, January 15th. There are several masses on Sunday morning, so you have plenty of opportunities to work it into your schedule. The 7:00 am mass was not very crowded and there wasn’t any music, but it was a very nice service. I just think it’s simply amazing that, every year, more than five million people of every different nationality and faith enter this Cathedral. Even if you don’t have time to attend mass, just visit the church – the architectural work alone is amazing. Also, there’s a small gift shop in the church, and another larger gift shop about a block away. I purchased a beautiful pink rosary for a coworker of mine for $25. She loved it! There are altars/shrines that line both sides of the church, where you can pray and light candles. Most of the shrines contain information about the saint it honors. Very interesting, even if you are not Catholic or Christian. If you are there during the Christmas/Advent season, the Nativity scene is very beautiful, and can be found to the left of the sanctuary.Don’t miss this beautiful cathedral! Be sure to stop in and look around, say a prayer, light a candle, and be amazed and spiritually moved...bb
Lovely church. Beautiful stained glass windows and architecture. It was a little weird looking around while people were praying but hey
Beautiful and comforting. Beautiful architecture, magnificient place to be in no matter your religion. Very comforting amid the chaos of the city.

The most spectacular Monument in New York!. Simply a Majestic structure in the center of Manhattan right on 5th Avenue across from Rockefeller Center. It is of an inmense beauty and rich history, a must when in New York City!
A Quiet, Sacred Place. A feel for the Old Country in New York. When I'm in the area I usually stop in to quiet my mind and give praise for God's gift of self in the Christ.
A NY Treasure. Nothing like entering this cathedral and feeling very humble; even if not a Catholic/Christian visit this cathedral to pray or just reflect on your life.
Beautiful Church. from a non religious person it was very interesting to look around at the religious artwork and the wonderful and ornate ceiling and windows
Light a candle for a dearly departed. It's a very beautiful place. But its most important function is an oasis of prayer in mid-town.

Christmas Mass. we were there for the christmas mass in spanish at 4pm , I fell lucky to be able to be there on that day at that time. The Church is beautiful inside and out.
Thank you !

Very Nice. The most beautiful churches I have ever seen were in Italy. That being said, this is one of the most beautiful churches I have been to in the United States. If you are in New York City and have extra time on your hands it’s a great place to visit.
Wow-a must see!!. You will be so amazed with the character and inside of this church is beautiful! Must See!!

Good to see if it is in your way. I don't think it is worth a special trip but drop by if it is in your way. The church is big and has lots of stained glass. No question it is a part of New York. However, it is not much different than or more spectacular, say, similar sized churches in England.

Church. We walked in and went through a baggage check to enter the
Church. Building is being renovated and has scaffolding up around the outside.

One of the most beautiful Cathedrals in North America. A lovely interlude from the Midtown madness. We attended mass on a Saturday morning at 8AM - the service was held in the Lady Chapel, which is behind the main altar. The organ music is magnificent.

Beautiful cathedral!. Every time we visit new York we visit this cathedral.. It is beautiful, truly a must-see! Great location. If you're visiting NY you will most likely visit the rockefeller area, and the cathedral is right around the corner, there is no charge for visiting :)
Magnificent!. I love this church. I love that they have multiple daily masses you can go to. It's sooo beautiful, breath-taking and the little shrines to the saints on the sides are just superb!

Even bigger than it appears on TV and spectacular inside.. A magnificnet church that defies description. Wonderful side chapels and fantastic architecture. They do check your belongings when you first go in, so be prepared to have packbacks, etc. searched. Also check for Mass schedule so as not to arrive when you can't get in. But Catholic or not, you should try to attend the Mass if you can to feel its magnificence, hear the organ, etc.

Crowded and poor sound system. Keeping in mind it was Christmas night, the church was crowded, people were rude and we couldn't hear the priest. The church is beautiful and impressive. They should not allow people to take pictures during mass.

Takes your breath away!. All I can say about St Patrick's Cathedral is WOW! From the moment you walk in, you feel it is a very special place. The building is incredible with it towering wood ceiling to the many stained glass windows. I have been in many churches in my lifetime, but this one tops them all. We were there at Christmas time and they had a lifesize nativity scene set up in the front left corner that took our breath away. If you are ever in New York, this needs to be on your bucket list. You will never forget it!

Beautiful Nativity. St. Patrick's Cathedral is worth visiting at any time of the year, but we were lucky enough to see all the beautiful Christmas decorations and the huge Nativity scene. The only problem was that the church was so crowded that it was difficult to move around. The crowd kept moving and you just got swept along.

Just beautiful. This is religious history here. The inside is beautiful with sculptures, stained glass windows. and other artifacts. Visit and say a prayer, no matter what religion you are. God bless.

Historic Cathedral and grounds. Located on 5th Ave, visiting the cathedral is a memorable experience and usually free! It's huge inside and beautifully sculputured and emotionally moving. Another plus is that after visiting here you are on 5th Ave and in short walking distance of Rockefeller Center, and Radio City Music Hall as well as some of the best know retail stores making this a combination visit.

Beautiful Church. We stayed at the NY Palace hotel next door so visitng the Cathedral was super convenient. The church is stunningly beautiful inside and out. The nativity set up indoors for the Christmas season was also very nice.

Absolutely stunning. It almost feels sacrilegious to write a review about a church, but I was so impressed with this Cathedral. It's HUGE, and so beautiful, and having been raised Catholic I can't imagine how cool it would be to attend Mass here. I'm hoping we'll have time since we'll be in NYC for a few days. Even if you aren't Catholic, come for the beauty and the history. It's worth it.
Fine. I love cathedral architecture, but St. Pat's is a little bland. Go to Newark and check out Sacred Heart.

Replica. An exact replica of the cathederal in IReland and so lovely to be able to go in and visit. it was amazing on the inside and being able to light a candle for my Mother was certainly special. I found it strange how they "charge" for the candles rather then a donation, but i suppose some people maybe took advantage or didnt realise it was a donation required. I was being decorated on the outside but you could still see its beauty

Stunning. simply gorgeous. Just walking past this massive building I was drawn in by it's beauty. Although I had no plans to go inside, I found myself climbing the steps and slipping in the doors. Once inside I'm sure I gasped audibly at the stunning beauty. I was only inside for a moment but it was a highlight of the day as it was someplace unexpected.

Gothic European style Cathedral in the heart of NYC. A large and impressive, gothic style cathedral, more suitable for mainland Europe than the United States, St. Patrick's made a nice stop for us during our recent trip to NYC. We were impressed with the scale of the church, now squeezed between blocks of tall NYC buildings, finding the interior to be nice but not particularly amazing. We were half expecting to find gargoyles on the outside but we couldn't spot any, perhaps due to not looking hard enough (or maybe they don't have them) and we would have liked to have seen a bit more stained glass in St. Patrick's, just another personal preference we have with the gothic style churches. As we have nothing like this in Hong Kong, St. Patrick's was definitely enjoyable for us for a quick stop and was our second favorite church visit only behind Trinity Church and its wonderful historic graveyard, near Wall Street and the financial district in lower Manhattan. Overall, St. Patrick's is a pretty good attraction if you enjoy visiting churches and colossal old buildings. It will remind you of gothic cathedrals you may have seen in Italy or other places in Europe which makes it quite unique for NYC and much of the United States for that matter. Thus, its worth a few moments of your time to stop and see St. Patrick's while visiting the Midtown area of NYC.
Spectacular. What's not to like. The Cathedral is magnificent.

Awe-inspiring cathedral with amazing stained glass windows. The Nativity scene and poinsettias for Christmas made the Cathedral even more spectacular than usual. Every time I visit I notice details I've previously not seen. I could spend hours just studying the stained glass and the carvings. To help continue to preserve the Cathedral and keep it open, please consider making a donation during your visit. There is no admission but if everyone gives just a few dollars it will really make a difference!

A Beautiful Church That is a Must See. This is such a beautiful church. St. Patrick's Cathedral is so antique looking and there is so much to look at. The church is huge and there are many places to observe and reflect. Everything is very detailed all the way up to the ceiling and the windows. They have candles you can light and you can pretty much spend a long time in there just looking at everything. I've been there quite a few times and just this past recent time I noticed the gift shop on the right side when you first walk in. It is kind of small so if it is busy in there it gets crowded but the items they have are also beautiful! I definitely recommend taking a trip to St. Patrick's Cathedral!

Beautiful! You'll get the chills. The church is amazing, as soon as you walk in you'll feel like your in Europe. The architecture is beautiful & one of a kind! Pictures are allowed until a certain point so take a camera. Overall gorgeous place...
Always beautiful. Architecture is magnificent. Walked in and experienced a Catholic Mass at Christmas time. That experience outweighed the hugh crowds.

A bit of Heaven in Manhatten. This is a lovely Cathedral that I always stop at while visiting New York. The statue of St. Brigid is my favorite. Please remember it is a place of worship so enter and exit quietly.

Beautifl, Solemn, Serene. Take the time to step out of the hustle and bustle of touring and shopping. I felt a sense of peace and calm; the building is beautiful inside. Visitors are very respecful as to the fact that this is a Church as evidenced by hussed voices and polite walking. Always a Must on my visits to New York City.
Incredible building, remove your hats. Worth a stop in to see such a historic building and NYC center of such a historic religion. Remove your hats and maintain silence to soak it all in effectively.
Amazing..... This church is amazing....sooo beautiful! The detail is phenomenal!

Architectural Jaw Dropper. Doesn't matter what faith you are, if you like Paris, architecture, gothic or if you aren't blind, you should just take a step inside. Stands along with the European greats.
Beautiful. This church is just fantastic. The building is a must see. We went to mass there and it was full.

Our Nation's Parish Church. What an experience!! I've seen St. Patrick's on TV over the years many times, mostly for televised funerals when someone famous died. But to experience it in person is wondrous, amazing, and even overwhelming!!Our hotel was literally four blocks away, so we'd walk over every morning for mass. We even got to attend a high mass on the last Sunday of Advent. Archbishop Dolan was the celebrant, and the full choir sang also. What a treat!The church is breathtakingly beautiful. If you can't go back several times to see different parts on different days, please do yourself a favor and devote at least an hour or two to touring the church and seeing all the different stations dedicated to various saints.You REALLY feel a sense of history and a deep spirituality after going to St. Patrick's.
St Patrick's is so moving. The cathedral brings tears to your eyes. You have to attend mass there to truly appreciate the culture and history of the beautiful surroundings and warmth.
Awestruck. Even if you aren't Catholic the Cathedral is worth seeing. The drama and architecture of the Catholic church at it's finest.
Stunning !!. You have to see this place, its situated right opposite the Rockerfella Centre and is just so quaint, but the stain glass windows inside are fab

What A Beautiful Cathedral. Saint Patrick's Cathedral is amazing. The architecture is incredible. It is a moving experience to visit this Church. This year the Nativity setting includes a dog. The Priest who was responsible for the Nativity has a 15 year old retriever who he loves and he felt should be included. It is quite lovely to see. If you are in New York City, you will most certainly be happy that you took the time to visit Saint Patrick's.

Lovely Music. I just love listening to good music at mass. Even though there are a lot of people, they are very good at moving things along. NYC trips are full of busy stuff, so it is nice to take an hour to reflect and pray.
Huge. Very beautiful location that is worth a visit. I wish I had come during the day time to see the stained glass windows.
Iconic for a reason. This incredibly beautiful cathedral is well known world wide for a reason....it's splendid!

Beautiful, heavenly structure. I'm Catholic. I love all Catholic Churches because it's the only place you can get the Eucharist! :) Besides that, this is an enormous, beautiful cathedral. But I live in St. Louis and we have the Cathedral Basilica and it is the most awesome place. They call it the "Rome of the West", and it truly is magnificent. If you're ever in St. Louis, tour it. You'll be awestruck :)

You'll Feel Like You are in Europe. We were window shopping on 5th Avenue, came upon St. Patrick's and decided to stop in. Like everything else in NY, there was some scaffolding outside so you couldn't get a good view of the building. Unlike everything else in NY, there was no admission fee, just a request for donations if you cared to make one. Once inside, you are in another world. The Cathedral is magnificent. Marble, large stained glass windows, statuary- we felt like we could have been in St. Paul's in London or Notre Dame in Paris. It is that spectacular. Definitely a respite from Midtown Manhattan and well worth the time to see if you are in the area. And you'll save the airfare to Europe.

Mass on Sunday. We visited the Cathedral on Sunday and heard mass there. I was not sure what to find. Have been to the Vatican and other churches and cathedrals in Europe and therefore was not that much impressed. But if you have the time do give it a visit.

No matter the faith, go see this place. I am Catholic, but regardless of your faith, you should go see this beautiful place. Very inspiring and grand. They don't build them like this anymore! They were playing the organ when I was there and it was great.
Peace and quiet if you need a break. What a beautiful building. So peaceful you cant even hear the traffic of new york inside.
Welcoming and Beautiful. I happened upon a wedding which didn't stop the church from being open and beautiful. It is a must see in New York reguardless of your religion.

Very Impressive. St. Patrick's rivals many of the great cathedrals of Europe. The artwork inside is really quite impressive and the space inside has the feeling that it is well used. It is easy to find your way around the interior of this fine cathedral. I suggest that you grab a good guide book and use it to assist you in understanding what you are seeing. The visit is well worth an hour of your time. As you exit the cathedral look across 5th Avenue and you'll see Atlas directly across from the cathedral's main doors. Apparently his eyes are about level with the statue of Jesus on the cross inside the cathedral - a fact that was of great concern to the church.

Beautiful Cathedral in NYC!. I have been several times in NYC and have always passed by the St Patrick's Cathedral.On one of my visitis, I was going to Macy's and as always found mysel been half an hour before the store opening houses. And then I said what can I do with this extra time, turn left and saw St Patrick's Cathedral.Went inside the cathedral, light a candle and admired the vitraux and the atmosphere, knowing also that the Kennedy's always visited it, so I felt part of the history of NYCThe little shop at the right hand of the entrance is fully stocked with souvenirs and for every budget. A beautiful rosary, a keychain that would make anybody happy! And sure it did!I would recommend visiting this Cathedral while walking 5th Avenue just to go into and admire it and have a respite from this great city!

Beautiful church. I want to start of by stating that I am not a catholic so I went there strictly to sight see an old church with beautiful stain glass windows------> which is exactly what it was. People were praying so I tries my best to be respectful (no flash). It took me an hour to read about the saints along the sides, disect how beautifully detailed each one was, and admire the gorgeous wall coverings. I took the time to sit at the Lady's chapel ( only section where there are no pictures allowed) and I found myself praying to Jesus. Truly a solemn place in an otherwise not so quiet church. There was no service at the time. My favorite statue was of Jesus in the arms of his mother, which is on the right side of the chapel.As a native New Yorker, I am surprised that it took me this long to visit this church but it was worth my time.
Beautiful gothic. This is probably one of the most beautiful churches I have seen in the US. I look forward to seeing ones in Italy and other parts of Europe but this one is breathtaking.

Active church ~ remember, people are praying. Beautiful cathedral in the Gothic style. St Pat's is styled after the most impressive churches in Europe, it's a wonderful amalgam of English, French & German styles. The side altars are lovely, each with prie-dieux should you wish to stop and say a prayer. Make sure to stop at the Lady Chapel, it's lovely enough to merit a visit by itself. The baptistry is huge, the confessional truly intimidating. The stained glass is awesome ~ in the true, old sense of the word. The main altar and baldachin are humbling. Give yourself an hour to wander. Also, the gift shop at the rear has nifty souvenirs and the profits help maintain the building, feed the hungry, shelter the homeless and so forth. Or, at least make a donation. Please remember : this is an active church. Be respectful, turn off your cell phone, speak quietly, walk solemnly and turn off your flash ~ you won't need it anyway (see my pics). Even if there is not a Mass being said at that moment, someone is nonetheless praying. That being said, to really get the feel of the Church, sit or kneel and say a prayer. No one will mind.
We love St Patrick's ... we were married there in 1967. One of the most beautiful churches in NYC, St Patrick's Cathedral is a good place to relax and count your blessings.

BEAUTIFUL, PEACEFUL CHURCH IN THE MIDST OF THE BUSTLING CITY. This Church was absolutely BREATHTAKING!!!!And its location- right in the middle of the Big City... Absolutely incredible!!!!You have this Peaceful, Antique, Gothic Church surrounded by the skyscrapers,... it's a pretty magnificent sight to behold :)I've been to the Famous cathedrals in England, and this was just as impressive!!!We didn't even make it inside and I was still just so blown away.Next visit, I'm making it a point to come back to St. Patrick's and check out the inside- If it is even HALF as incredible as the outside, It will be WELL WORTH a stop.

Inspirational and Beautiful. A "must-see" on my list was definitely St. Patrick Cathedral. As soon as I walked in, I was inspired by the beautiful gothic design and lit a candle for continued blessings. I love architecture and NYC has amazing architecture throughout the city. I was most impressed with St. Patrick Cathedral from the inside and outside. Although, there was construction work on the outside, it did not take away from the beauty. I highly recommend the St. Patrick Cathedral to anyone visiting NYC.
Superb church !. You have to see this ! Centraly located and it takes your breath away !

Breathtaking. This is a beautiful church and it is well worth spending some time inside and marveling at the stained glass and the ornate marble throughout. It reminded me of some of the majestic churches that you visit in Europe. This is an immense church. Don't miss the pipe organ at the rear of the church.
Magnificent. This church is unbelievable, just beautiful and breathtaking. You just sit there in amazement of your surroundings. Great for a stop in your day to visit.

A beautiful Cathedral with fallen heroes. A beautiful Cathedral with huge high ceiling and get monuments to all the fallen heroes. They were doing construction while we were there but it was still nice.

Beautiful Gothic Cathedral. My wife and I attended Saturday Mass and then came back another day to walk around the Cathedral. The Gothic architecture and stained glass are amazing. There is so much detail work throughout the church! It is also interesting to walk around to all the altars to various saints. The only thing that was a little odd was seeing tourists during Mass, but it's New York. It is very close to 30 Rockefeller Plaza, so if you're in the area it is definitely worth a visit.
Must see when in NYC. This is a beautiful and majestic old church. No charge to visit, but worthy of a tip as you leave.
Wonderful history. Enjoyed our visit to St. Patrick's Cathedral on Palm Sunday. It was crowded but we were still able to appreciate its history, architeture and energy. Worth the time to visit.

No religion required to enjoy. Seeing St. Patrick's Cathedral was a highlight of our trip. We did not have it on our list of things to do (not being aware of it) but when we came down from the Top of the Rock it was right across the street. We are not Catholic but I don't know if we could have enjoyed it anymore if we were. The building itself from the outside was beautiful, then to go inside was even more stunning. The sculptures were impressive, the stained glass windows were breath taking, and the atmosphere was peaceful. Would for sure go back given the opportunity, I would love to spend even more time there.
A treat to behold. This cathedral is breath-taking; it seems that should be standing in Europe but it is right here in NYC. You can't miss this gem, treat your eyes to its beauty.

As Awe-inspiring as architecture can get. St. Pat's is a must see when in NYC and in the Rockefeller area. A few things to remember: 1) You can only take photos inside when no mass is being performed. 2) There's a great gift shop inside at the front so buy your souvenier here and not at one of the millions of shops in the city-it will seem more special! 3) Take plenty of film or an SD card with alot of space because there's so much to photograph especially the sculptures. 4) It is always crowded so be prepared to maybe wait in line to get in (not always but it does happen) 5) Try to give yourself at least an hour to take it all in.

Serene and very beautiful. You can't really miss the imposing cathedral, situated on 5th avenue. As you approach it is well worth taking some pictures from the opposite side of the street, as this gives you the best view.Entrance is free but it is recommended that you contribute something towards the upkeep of the building, either through donations, collection boxes or in the gift shop. The inside of the cathedral is extremely calming and very beautiful. You can explore practically all of the building and there are plenty of seats to admire the architecture, ceilings and windows.It's well worth popping in, even if you only have a few minutes

Stunning. It is absolutely beautiful. Just gorgeous. I highly reccomend stopping in, you won't regret it. You can't put into words the beauty of it, just go see for yourself, and light a candle for someone you've lost, or for any reason. Just go.

Beautiful!. A Beautiful Cathedral! A must see. Once you walk in, you will immediatly feel the sence of greatness. The Cathedral is hugh and awe inspiring! You will notice the quietness of the place, enev in the middle of NYC. The light of the stained-glass windows cast a somber light of the holieness of the place. The prayer stations are beatuiful, and inspires one to inflect within regardless of your faith. I am always amazed at, when leaving, the hustle and bustle of NYC hits you straight on... Bringing you back to everyday life.
Absolutely Beautiful!!. This was a highlight of the trip. Just gorgeous. Gorgeous and Moving. Please do not miss this if you are in the city.

WOW! This is a must see!. Definitely bring your camera along for this attraction! This church is gorgeous! We were taken back by how beautiful both the inside & the outside of the church is! There were many tourists inside while there was service going on. (There is church service all day) You can walk around the entire lower level of the church and take pictures. It's a breath-taking and serene place! Leave at least an hour for this!

Beautiful. This building is beautiful to look at both inside and out. Keep an eye out for it is you are walking on 5th Avenue and make sure you make the effort to have a look inside if you can. There are impressive vaulted ceilings, nice decorative columns and interesting pictures on the walls. There are also candles that you can light for loved ones who have died.

Beauty and Calm in the middle of it all. St Patrick's is a fabulous place - free, but please make a donation - to gather your wits and sit for a few minutes in peace and contemplation. The art in the side chapels is worth a walk about. I got some of my best pictures during my NYC stay here.Do your absolute best to not disturb the worshippers, since this is an active Church. Silence your phones, and keep the talk to low whispers.

Absolutely Amazing!. The Cathedral was amazing! Walking through the cathedral gave you a sense of peace...The architecture was unbelievable, it was definitely a change of pace from visiting the other fast paced sights in NY. All I could think of was it must be amazing to be able to have your wedding here. We were very happy that we made this one of our stops.

A nice rest from the city.. I have been to many old churches in Europe, and St. Patrick's offers much of the same feeling. The arched ceiling seems impossibly high, and a bevy of small altars in front of statues of saints and the Virgin Mary provide places for visitors to make donations, light candles, and offer prayers. There is some beautiful statuary in here.Visiting is free, and you can take a break from the noise and rush of the city. Combine this with a visit to Rockefeller Center, which is just across the street.

Beautiful LARGE Church with lots of attention to detail. My husband and I have visited St. Patrick's Cathedral multiple times over the past few years. It is just around the corner from Rockefeller Center & is a nice place to step in off the streets on a cold winter night. We often stop in here after viewing the Rockefeller Center Tree. Our last visit to St. Patrick's was on Sunday December 6th 2009. We happened to visit the church while a mass was going on. They hold 8 masses on Sunday alone. Sometimes we have seen several people doing the mass, but this time there was only one person giving the mass. Some of the masses have music, while others do not. You can check the bulletin or web site for this information & schedule.The inside of the church is massive, so you will see TV's placed throughout so everyone can see the mass speaker. Also it sounded like the had an overhead speaker system to amplify the voice of the speakers. There are tall pillars, lots of detailed wood work, stained glass windows, beautiful statues, marvelous arches and sometimes we have seen a nativity scene displayed near the front of the church. The outside of the church is just as stunning as the inside. They really paid great attention to detail when this church was built in the mid to late 1800's.Anyone can visit this church, regardless of their religion. St. Patrick's welcomes Catholics, fellow Christians and non-Christians to their celebrations. However, if you are not catholic, you will not be admitted to Holy Communion. But, anyone can visit, view a mass, offer their prayers, and revel in the wonder of this great architecture. It is completely FREE to visit the church, unless you wish to give a donation or light a candle. The cathedral is open form 6:30am to 8:45pm daily if you wish to visit in person. It looks like their 8 o'clock mass is recorded and telecast on local TV stations too.Overall, St. Patrick's is a nice place to stop and rest. We have visited here many times. It is nice to visit the shops and stores during the busy winter holiday season. But it is nice to stop and take in the beauty of this church too. It is a nice place to rest on a pew and take in the solitude of this magnificent building. It is a nice quiet place to warm up & relax in peace before heading back into the hustle & bustle of the Manhattan crowds. Note: This is still a cathedral, so it is important to be respectful of the church. We have witnessed guards asking people to remove their hats as a common courtesy. Also, they may ask to search your bag or back pack & to leave any open drinks outside.

Good for quick, free visit. Most attractions in NYC are expensive, this one is free, unless you choose to make a donation. This is a beautiful building, inside and out. We were awed by the numerous stained glass windows. It is a wonderful, historic, place to visit for people of all faiths. Non-flash photos only. May not be suitable for young children because it should be kept quiet with no running around. People are worshipping at all hours.

We Can All Appreciate Beauty and Inspiration. Nestled in the heart of Manhattan is an oasis of tranquility known as St. Patrick's Cathedral. You do not need to be Catholic to appreciate the beauty of this place. Its grandeur and history is evident everywhere you look from the exquisite stained glass windows to the spiralling cement columns which looks like they could touch the sky. . What is truly amazing are the many altars built around the cathedral in honor of various saints: they are simply stunning. One can only imagine the sweat, commitment and love that went into building this placeWith all the hustle and bustle in NYC this is a place where you can catch your breath and appreciate the inmeasurable riches of a moment of solitude. Before leaving why not light a candle in rememberance of a family member or friend.

A Slice of Heaven!. St. Patricks is a slice of heaven in heart of Manhattan. St. Patricks is a gorgeous cathedral and definitely one of the best attractions in NYC. It simply cannot be missed especially since it is free to visit! Hours can be spent staring in profound wonder at all of the minuet architectural details. It's also a cool retreat in hot summer months and a great way to spend a moment in silence for Catholics or atheists alike! Don't miss it!

God is certainly here. We had been rushing around NY trying to see everything in just 5 short days. But our stop at St. Patrick brought us to a sudden stop. Here we found the time to thank God for all we are and all we have. Here we could light a candle for our family and friends. The beauty is simply breathtaking. Certainly God is present in this place, looking over us, worried about us, open to hear from us. St. Patrick can change your direction in life. Stop in, sit down and give it some thought.

Beautiful. An absolutely breath-taking church, heavily influenced by the designs of medieval European cathedrals. The ambulatory is especially reminiscent of the pilgrimmage churches. If you enjoy great architecture, I highly recommend visiting this unique NYC landmark. Also be sure to note the exquisite bronze relief doors.

Beautiful and regal church. Definitely a very ornate and regal church compared to other churches. The arches are so high, and the altars are exquisite. Along the walls are several patron saints. I didn't go in while there was service going on, so there was a lot of picture-taking.

Beautiful... The church was magnificent and welcoming, the only tip I have is to see it during the day, we saw it in the evening and you really couldn't see the stained glass very well. Other than that we were not disappointed.

A beautiful building not to be missed. Built in 1853, this largest Catholic cathedral in the United States is a gorgeous building, both inside and out. Situated in the heart of Manhattan on 5th Avenue and 50th Street, it is worth stopping by if merely to admire the spectacularly ornate Gothic Revival structure that seems oddly out of place amongst the skyscrapers of the modern city. The exterior facade is made of carved white marble, the great doors are bronze, and the grand interior includes an amazing bronze canopy ceiling, stunning stained glass, and impressive sculptures. Truly a lovely place to stop and marvel at the opulence of days gone by.

A Sight to Behold. We went inside the cathedral and looked around a little before one of the services was about to begin. It was very beautiful. It's a little scary to think you need security to walk through before entering a church but it happens. That's what you will see here as you enter, but after all - it's New York! Just enjoy all that you can in this wonderful city and be thankful that many are out there trying to continue to keep you safe in public and private dwellings.

Special. St. Patrick's Cathedral is beautiful and peaceful. After the excitement of being in NYC, it is just nice to come to the cathedral to admire and provide inspiration. I too have been to churches all over Europe, including Italy, France, England, Austria, Czech Republic and Hungary, and although the churches and cathedrals in these countries are very beautiful, St. Patrick's is still on my list as one that is unique and as beautiful.

It's Beatiful, but no more special than those in Europe. It's a really lovely church, but, I couldn't help compare it to the churches I saw on my trip to France and Spain and England earlier this year. It is great by typical American standards, but no comparison to St. Pauls or La Sagrada Familia.

Exclusive for a church. Somewhat unfriendly; the church wouldn't let us in because they had some graduation about to take place --even though this was over 3 hours beforehand. Not even a glimpse was allowed, and the ushers and other people in charge were terribly rude about the whole affair. Not one of the sights of NYC I'd care to try visiting again; come to the "other" City instead--San Francisco!!

Amazing. We visited St Patrick's Cathedral on June 26. It was awesome. Even our pre-teen and teenage sons were inspired by the beauty of the cathedral, so much so that they chose on their own to buy a few gifts at the gift shop. All people (religious or not) will appreciate the sheer magnitude of this magnificent place.
A Must See. This agnostic was amazed by the beuaty and grace. You have to hand it to the Catholics, they sure know how to inspire beauty.

the greatiest thing i could have ever done. st. patrick's was the greatest. it is a must see it was the best thing i did the way i felt when i walked in i was like wow. i got very emotional inside. you could feel the presents of god. so peaceful.and im not really a church going person but maybe i will be now

A Modern Marvel. St. Patrick's Cathedral is definitely a must-see. A place of history and spirituality all rolled up in one. The first thing that comes out of people's mouths when entering is "Wow!" The grandeur of the cathedral is truly awesome. Tourists are welcome to take pictures. The only exceptions are the Blessed Sacrament in the Lady Chapel at the rear of the main altar and during Mass. Feel free to join other Catholics when Mass is celebrated. However, only Catholics and those of the Eastern Rites in union with Rome are allowed to receive Holy Communion. If you want to see a piece of New York City history, get away from the hustle and bustle, and have a few quiet moments with God, see St. Patrick's Cathedral.
